A wide, dense palate matches the nose, while this tastes of ripe berry, cassis and fig along with spice and chocolate. Dry tannins and a hint of desiccation define the finish on this tasty Rioja reserva that will be at its best now through 2021.

title: Emilio Moro 2016  Ribera del Duero
description: Mildly gritty blackberry and cassis aromas are lightly charred and a touch fiery. A fully saturated palate is at max weight, while this tastes primarily of blackberry and chocolaty oak. Considering that this is Moro's basic RDD, with some 70,000 cases bottled, it's exemplary. Drink through 2025.

title: Quinta da Muradella 2012 Muradella Treixadura (Monterrei)
description: A shiny gold luster introduces an oxidized but still vital Treixadura. Aromas of peach pit, baked pastry and resiny oak are integrated and lead to a full palate that's still freshly acidic and showing fruit. Flavors of oxidized apricot and peach are woody on a long complex finish. Drink this unique wine from mostly unknown Monterrei through 2026.

title: Marqués de Cáceres 2014 Gaudium Grand Vino  (Rioja)
description: Meaty berry and plum aromas are dark and solid. A saturated palate shows full extraction of ripe Tempranillo fruit; but in the end, this feels a bit blocky and stumpy. Blackberry, vanilla and savory spice notes finish mostly with creamy oak and latent vanilla. This is ripe, intense, oaky and powerful. Drink through 2030.

title: Marqués de Murrieta 2014 Dalmau  (Rioja)
description: Sweet, cheeky aromas of vanilla, cappuccino and coconut are derived from the barrel, while this modern-style Rioja is flush and tannic, meaning it's a mouthful. Oak-driven flavors of coffee, mocha and cream are a big part of a black fruit flavor profile. On the finish, this remains weighty and oaky. Drink through 2029.

title: Muruve 2013 Reserva  (Toro)
description: Despite hailing from a cool year, this wine smells a bit cooked and stewed, with surrounding smoke and charred notes helping out. A saturated palate is dense and blocky, and it tastes of baked berry fruits, fig and chocolate. A peppery-tasting finish and smooth tannins offer a nice close; drink through 2022.

title: Larchago 2008 Pagos de Tahola Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: At first, this wine smells a bit burnt. But airing allows this gran reserva to show mature aromas of grilled beef, dry leaves and spice. Hard tannins make for a rubbery mouthfeel, but savory flavors of leafy plum and berry fruits bring it around. A finish with baked fruit and chocolate flavors concludes this classical Rioja. Drink through 2025.

title: Los Frailes 2014 Sinergia Cabernet Sauvignon (Valencia)
description: Blackberry aromas are deep and ripe, with woodsy side notes. A powerful palate is sinewy but not overly rugged or tannic. Blackberry and toasty flavors of chocolate and brown sugar smolder across a strident finish; drink through 2022.

title: Marqués de Cáceres 2011 Gaudium Gran Vino  (Rioja)
description: Oaky aromas suggest sandalwood along with plum and blackberry. This feels lively but also tight and gripping, something that a few years on its side should tame. Ripe black-fruit flavors are savory on the backside. It is firmly structured, with a meaty flavor on the finish. Drink through 2026.

title: Matarromera 2014 Prestigio  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Max ripe aromas of prune and raisin are baked and sweet. On the palate, this is huge and rugged, with massive tannins. Chocolate, raisin and cassis flavors are similar on a finish that adds fig and coffee to the picture. While this may be a touch overripe, it will stay drinkable up to about 2030.

title: Numanthia 2013 Numanthia  (Toro)
description: Despite 2013 being a tough year for reds throughout northern Spain, this is a good effort within the Numanthia framework. Compact dark fruit aromas hint at prune and chocolate. A raw palate with hard tannins and lemony acidity reflects the vintage, while flavors of black plum, currant, vanilla and maple land on buttery oak on a rough, hard finish. Best from 2021 to 2028.

title: Bodegas Martinez Lacuesta 2010 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Fine aromas of brandied cherry, spiced plum and earth get this reserva from a great vintage off to an impressive start. The layered palate is lively but showing maturity, while it tastes of black currant, brown sugar and myriad spices. A peppery, chocolaty, dry finish is beyond nice. Drink this well-priced overachiever through 2025.

title: Pago Casa Gran 2015 Casa Benasal Crux Red (Valencia)
description: Blackberry and prune aromas are smoky and suggest hoisin or barbecue sauce. This Monastrell-Garnacha blend is a bit drawing and wiry on the palate, while flavors of toasty oak, blueberry and savory plum are bold. Oak character dominates a clampy, grating finish. Drink through 2023.

title: Portal del Montsant 2012 Brunus Red (Montsant)
description: Earthy plum and leather aromas fold in notes of prune, rubber and oak. This shows a firm grip, tomato-like acidity and a layer or two of complexity. Peppery, toasty plum, oak and spice flavors are integrated into a quality whole, while this Carignan-Garnacha blend finishes long, dry, peppery and elegant. Drink through 2020.

title: Regina Viarum 2012 Regina Expresion Mencía (Ribeira Sacra)
description: Mossy earthy black-fruit aromas open this powerful laser-focused Mencía. Eschewing the ligh floral style that's common in Ribeira Sacra, this is ripped and intense. Toasty spicy blackberry and plum flavors show a note of lemony oak. The finish is like a spice cabinet of clove, mint, pepper, etc. Drink through 2025.

title: Scala Dei 2012 Cartoixa Red (Priorat)
description: Ripe heady aromas of black cherry, licorice and fir tree are lightly herbal, foresty and on the money. This feels tight as a box of nails, with firm tannins. Black plum, black cherry, blackberry and peppery flavors finish toasty and dark. This has a lot of life left in it. Drink through 2024.

title: Raventós I Blanc 2012 Textures de Pedra Sparkling (Penedès)
description: This tan-colored bubbly from stony soils smells complex, bready, yeasty and a lot like baked apple. A round, yeasty palate is cushioned like fine bedding, while yeasty flavors of bread and apple finish long. Drink through 2020.

title: Dominio de Tares 2015 Baltos Mencía (Bierzo)
description: The 2015 harvest produced a bumper crop of excellent Bierzo wines, Baltos included. Aromas of black fruits and violets are full and floral, with a hint of nicely scented candle. There's balance to the palate along with toasty, blackened flavors of blackberry and spice. Toasty notes persist on a well-balanced finish. Drink this fairly dense and wholly delicious Mencía trough 2020.

title: San Vicente 2014  Rioja
description: A blocked nose is toasty and charred, with requisite black-fruit aromas; but it's slightly herbal and stalky as well. A tight stern palate is rubbing and tannic, while this tastes of blackberry, mocha and savory spices. Tobacco and mocha are the main flavors on a controlled finish. For a marginal vintage like 2014, this is a winner; drink through 2028.

title: Peñalba Herraiz 2014 Carravid  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Ripe, meaty aromas of black fruit and oak announce a well-made wine with nice balance between ripeness and structure. Its creamy and a bit thick on the palate, offset by hard tannins. It finishes with chocolaty oak and savory berry flavors. Drink this serious red through 2026.

title: Bodegas Riojanas 2010 Viña Albina Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: A ripe, earthy nose shows touches of raisin, peanut and dried cheese along with tobacco, all of which are textbook gran reserve traits. A deep, lush, integrated palate delivers chocolaty flavors of berry fruits, cassis and tobacco. On the finish, oaky notes of vanilla and chocolate blend seamlessly into berry and prune flavors. Drink through 2030.

title: Celler Burgos-Porta 2011 Petit Mas Sinén Red (Priorat)
description: The mix of red- and black-fruit aromas is schisty, with minerality bursting at the seams. This blend of Garnacha, Carignan, Syrah, Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon is full in body, with cheek-grabbing tannins. Saturated black-cherry and blackberry flavors include herbal hints and integrated chocolaty oak. A musclebound finish displays power and heat. Drink through 2022.

title: Señorío de la Antigua 2015 Señorío de la Antigua Finca Cabanela Mencía (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
designation: Señorío de la Antigua Finca Cabanela
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León
description: Medium-deep black fruit aromas are ripe, earthy and smooth though not overly complex. On the palate, this single-vineyard Mencía is pure and ripe, with bracing acidity. Blackberry, plum and cassis flavors cover the full black fruit spectrum, while this balanced red blends weight and power with freshness and finesse on the finish. Drink through 2025.

title: Cepa 21 2014 Malabrigo  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Cepa 21's top wine smells of savory oak, bacon fat, hickory wood and Bourbon barrel, meaning it's oaky. A fully packed palate is intense, with rough, drying tannins suggestive of sandpaper. Char and smoke flavors are at the top level, barely allowing for berry fruit to poke through. No surprise that coffee and toast flavors dominate the finish. Drink through 2030.

title: CVNE 2011 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Aromas of olive, root beer, rubber and spicy berry fruit are a bit closed, damp and earthy. A solid palate with good acidity hosts flavors of spiced plum, currant, vanilla and raw oak. On the finish, plum and fresh herb flavors drift off under the guidance of subtle oak. Drink now through 2025.

title: Casa Primicia 2015 Julian Madrid Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Creamy lactic oak aromas settle on vanilla, toast and berry fruits. On the palate, this feels full, grabby, dry and intense. Oaky flavors of baking spices, blackberry and prune turn raisiny on a dry finish that hollows out faster than you might like. Drink through 2024.

title: Viña Olabarri 2011 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: A full, ripe nose include aromas of vanilla, spiced plum and raisin, while this gran reserva from a hot year feels tight as nails on the palate. Spicy plum, currant, leather and earth notes capture the essence of a warm vintage, while this exerts a firm tannic grip on the finish. Drink through 2032.

title: Vega Sicilia 2015 Alion  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Aromas of violet, blackberry and plum toggle between fruity and floral, while this ripe-year Tempranillo feels a touch heavy, with hard tannins. Baked blackberry and black-tea flavors culminate on a short finish, with minty oak notes and scrubbing tannins. Drink through 2026.

title: Vizcarra 2014 Celia  (Ribera del Duero)
description: A ripe and saturated nose includes aromas of blackberry, prune and mocha. This is big on the palate, but the acidity is primed and thus it doesn't seem overly heavy. Blackberry, tobacco and vanilla flavors wrap up on a finish with heat. Drink through 2025.

title: Mas d'en Gil 2014 Clos Fontà Vinyes Velles Bellmunt Red (Priorat)
description: Berry, cherry and cola aromas exhibit an iron component on what amounts to a fresh minerally nose. Iron also describes the grip on this Garnacha-led wine from the village of Bellmunt. Dark-berry, black-currant and raisin flavors finish with dry rough tannins. Drink through 2034.

title: Valduero 2015 I Unacepa  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Toasty oak and mint aromas infuse a sense of darkness to the nose of this full-bodied wine. Bold acidity cuts through the woody weight to give balance on the palate, with flavors of berry and cassis. This is dry and substantive on the finish, which tastes of salt, baking spices and more berry fruits. Drink through 2028.

title: Maetierra Dominum 2008 QP Reserva  (Rioja)
description: An attractive mix of spiced plum, fresh tomato, herb, tobacco and vanilla aromas are the intro to this excellent wine from a not-good vintage. The palate is creamy but vital, with roasted plum, integrated oak and savory flavors. A smooth but intense finish brings this home. Drink through 2019.

title: Bodegas Valdemar 2012 Selección  (Rioja)
description: Open-grained oak aromas lend molasses and vanilla to the nose of this well-built Rioja. It's lively and choppy on the palate, with roasted plum and berry flavors, finishing dark and toasty with oak and graphite notes. Drink through 2026.

title: Consejo de la Alta 2011 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Rooty aromas of licorice and sarsparilla are oaky and toasty, like burnt bread crust. This reserva feels weighty, but well balanced. Spicy currant and plum flavors are racy and improve on an elegant finish that doesn't overreach. Drink through 2026.

title: García Figuero 2013 Milagros  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Milagros means “miracles,” and the marvel is how good this wine is considering how rough in general 2013 was in the Ribera del Duero region. Oaky aromas of root beer and blackberry are smooth and heady. This wine is intense, with big tannins and firm acidity. Faith will be rewarded down the line with potent berry and chocolaty oak flavors. Bottle age should help this soften up; drink from 2020–2030.

title: Vega Sauco 2011 Adoremus  (Toro)
description: Full-force aromas of plum, vanilla and herbal tomato leaf are convincing, as is a charged-up palate that doesn't grate or grind. Plum, wild berry and creamy oak flavors finish with a mocha hint. This plays well from start to end. Drink through 2028.

title: Marqués del Puerto 2010 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: This wine's ripe berry, vanilla, toast, raisin and cedar aromas set the stage for an intense palate with choppy tannins. Its blackberry, caramel and vanilla flavors are rich and ripe, tasting pure on the finish, with a strong punch of chocolaty oak. Drink through 2024.

title: Bodegas Corral 2011 Altos de Corral Barrel Fermented  (Rioja)
description: A good deal of oak is notable on a nose with savory aromas of beef soup along with berry-fruit scents and a hint of prune. A full chunky palate shows rubbery tannins, while this tastes of plum, savory berry, prune, salt and spice. A steady finish doesn't deviate from this Tempranillo's core flavors. Drink through 2035.

title: Bodegas Leda 2014 Viñas Viejas Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León
description: Ripe aromas of blackberry, prune, raisin and oak spice come together with aplomb. A full-bodied palate with controlled weight is the vessel for toasty flavors of oak, vanilla, mocha and baked black fruits. A solid finish with latent acidity is a worthy conclusion to this fully oaked Tempranillo. Drink through 2027.

title: La Gitana 2014 Gold Label  (Rioja)
description: Vanilla, oak spice, tea, berry, olive and herb aromas signal a classic Rioja. Its crisp palate and choppy tannins form the canvas for spicy berry and cassis flavors. More spice powers the finish, which has the fruit to absorb and support the high level of oak. Drink through 2025.

title: Matsu 2014 EL Viejo  (Toro)
description: Toro is known for its massive wines, and this fits the bill. Oak, tobacco and mocha aromas share space on the nose with cassis and berry scents. Fully extracted tannins and resiny oak create a sizable palate of plum, cassis and vanilla flavors. Oak-derived spice notes inflect the intense black fruit flavors on the finish. Drink through 2026.

title: Elias Mora 2012 Reserva  (Toro)
description: A bold, smoky nose of black fruits and toasty oak is aggressive and unsettled. This is deep, chewy and severely tannic, with a sandpaper sensation to the mouthfeel. Spiced-up cassis and berry flavors come with earth and tobacco notes. On the finish, this is powerful and hard, with a note of fine cigar. Drink through 2028.

title: Valduero 2012 I Unacepa  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Ripe, baked black-fruit aromas go heavy on the raisin and prune, with a hint of spice cake thrown in. On the palate, this is saturated and a bit thick. Baked berry, cassis and creamy oak flavors finish lush and chewy, with flavors of oak grain and chocolate. Drink now through 2020.

title: Pago de Carraovejas 2015  Ribera del Duero
description: An opaque color and max-ripe aromas of raisin, prune, cassis, vanilla and raw cream open this heavyweight red that's holding nothing back. A thick, extracted palate is syrupy in consistency. Flavors of chocolate, maple and slightly overripe blackberry finish warm but shallow. Drink this modern high-octane wine through 2030.

title: Portal del Montsant 2015 Brunus Red (Montsant)
description: From the start, this is a powerful but comported and comfortable blend of Carignan and Garnacha. Consistent with prior good vintages, this all about blending deep, delicious berry fruit flavors with the framework of firm tannins and fine oak. Flavors of black cherry, baked plum and chocolate hold their quality across a long finish. Drink through 2025.

title: Neo 2014 Punta Esencia  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Smoky oak aromas sit atop berry and cassis scents on what amounts to a classic RDD nose. A clampy palate is tannic and tough, while this tastes of oak-driven chocolate, baked black fruits and raisin. A strong oak element persists on a ripe finish with vanilla and prune notes. Drink through 2025.

title: Livius 2015 Fermentado en Barrica Rosado (Rioja)
description: A rusty-rose-meets-ochre color and mature aromas of earth, wood spice and dried red fruits introduce this classic-style, barrel-fermented Garnacha rosé from Rioja. A healthy palate is deep and properly acidic, while salty peach, dried plum and barrel-spice flavors finish tight and clean. Don't be put off by the age or color of this wine: it's as it should be and highly rewarding. Drink through 2021.

title: Ramirez de la Piscina 2014 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Ripe berry aromas are dark and oaky, with a welcome hint of black pepper. This Reserva from a marginal vintage impresses via a lush palate that's generous and fruity. Spicy blackberry, graphite and toasty oak flavors finish with cassis and spicy oak notes. As ripe Rioja goes, this is performing; drink through 2025.

title: Bodegas Roda 2016 Sela  (Rioja)
description: Full berry and plum aromas are ripe, lightly spiced and inviting. A fleshy, full-bodied palate features bold tannins, while this delivers sizable black-plum, blackberry and savory oak flavors. Rubbing tannins create texture on a deep finish. Drink through 2022.

title: Peñalba Herraiz 2015 Carravid  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Ripe modern aromas of black fruits and fine oak set up a flush palate with density and smooth tannins. Chocolaty oak flavors are wrapped around blackberry and plum notes, while this is savory tasting and doesn't hammer away on the finish. Drink this excellent Tempranillo through 2025.

title: Proelio 2015 Cepa a Cepa  (Rioja)
description: This wine's richly oaked blackberry and cassis aromas include hints of tobacco and sawdust. Its saturated palate is hard with rubbery tannins, suggesting it needs time to age. Its oaky, inky black fruit flavors finish toasty and dark, with tobacco and cigar box notes. Drink 2021–2038.

title: Albet I Noya 2009 Reserva Martí Red (Penedès)
description: Dry, subtle aromas of tobacco, cherry and red currant are spicy, with hints of road tar and forest floor. This is a blend of Tempranillo, Syrah, Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. It's full in body but mild in terms of tannic bite. Flavors of lightly herbal berries and chocolaty oak finish dry and spicy, with a lingering note of tobacco. Drink through 2023.

title: Bodegas Faustino 2005 I Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: This wine offers a mix of floral, berry and earthy aromas on the nose. It reflects its fine vintage, displaying firm tannins on a tight palate. Dried plum, cherry, tomato and herbal flavors finish with tension and wiry freshness. Drink through 2027.

title: Casa Primicia 2014 Carravalseca Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Ripe, stocky berry aromas come with grainy oak notes that try to take over the nose. A firm, clampy palate is tannic and pulling, while this tastes of cassis and raw oak stemming from 20 months in barrel. On the finish, a woody character dominates, although bold latent fruit has its say. Drink through 2026.

title: Bodegas Tobía 2016 Óscar Tobía Blanco Reserva White (Rioja)
description: Ripe fruit, heavy oak and related spice and wood-grain aromas create a full nose that's classic for white Rioja. Based on Tempranillo Blanco, Viura and Maturana, this feels racy with a resiny offset. Spiced apple and pear aromas are lightly baked, while this age-worthy blend tastes of farm-fresh butter on the finish. For fans of barrel-aged whites, especially Chardonnay, this is very much worth trying; drink through 2030.

title: Luna Beberide 2015 Art Mencía (Bierzo)
description: Foxy blackberry and cassis aromas are young and untamed, with a note of wet animal fur. This Mencía is grapy and rich, with a dense, saturated palate. Chocolaty black-fruit flavors finish with hard tannins, lots of residual fruit and a structure that suggests that this wine is here to stay for a while. Drink 2019–2025.

title: Alidis 2010 VS  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Strong classy oak aromas lead blackberry and baking-spice scents on a potent but textbook RDD nose. This old-vines wine from a benchmark year is tight-fisted and linear in feel, with lemony acidity. Fully oaked flavors of blackberry and cassis sit comfortably on a bed of herb and spice notes, while this is oaky, spicy, steady and integrated on the finish. Drink through 2027.

title: Lleiroso 2011 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Toasty, oaky aromas of graphite, pepper, barrel char and black fruits properly announce a palate of chewy tannins and several layers of blackberry, cassis, barrel-spice, toast and chocolate flavors. Chocolaty depth on the finish only adds to the package. Drink through 2030.

title: Bodega Carmen Rodríguez 2014 Carodorum Selección Especial Reserva  (Toro)
description: Jammy berry aromas smell like fig paste, and overall the nose on this Toro is thick and potent. Following the nose, this feels massive and deep, with hard tannins creating roughness and dryness. An explosion of black fruit flavors includes cassis and blackberry, while a big finish is sturdy, with toasty chocolaty flavors. Drink through 2030.

title: Tionio 2014  Ribera del Duero
description: Intense, rubbery aromas of blackberry, cassis and raisin lead off. This Tinto Fino is full bodied, saturated and ripe in feel. Blackberry, cassis, toast and chocolate flavors finish with a covering of burnt oak and spice. Drink through 2026.

title: Dominio Dostares 2015 Cumal Prieto Picudo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León
description: Gamy berry, herb, mint and oaky aromas open this high-end Prieto Picudo. A firm grinding palate is anchored by muscular tannins and bold acidity. Savory oaky berry and plum flavors are saucy and complex, while this finishes long and choppy, with chocolaty oak flavors and lasting savory notes. Drink through 2025.

title: Bodega Virgen de la Asunción 2015 El Secreto de María  (Ribera del Duero)
description: A ripe, concentrated nose is front-loaded with black fruit scents, toasty oak and cool earth aromas. This winner is medium to full by Ribera del Duero standards, and well balanced. Flavors of black cherry and blackberry only get stronger the longer this sits. On the finish, this dries out while feeling chalky and minerally. Drink through 2030.

title: Olivier Rivière 2014 Las Viñas de Eusebio  (Rioja)
description: This single-vineyard Tempranillo opens with smooth, straightforward dark-fruit aromas that are calm and collected. A deeply stacked palate is a touch fierce but well structured. Toasty blackberry and cherry flavors linger on a toast-etched finish. Drink through 2032.

title: Parés Baltà 2010 Blanca Cusiné Sparkling (Cava)
description: There's hardly a top-shelf 2010 Spanish wine that didn't excel, and this blend of Xarello, Chardonnay and Pinot Noir is no exception. Aged, mature aromas of briny fruits and yeast are integrated and smooth. A citrusy palate is vibrant, while this tastes of grapefruit and tangerine. Lightly buttered toast and white pepper notes appear on a long-lasting finish.

title: Bodegas Muriel 2015 Conde de los Andes  (Rioja)
description: Earthy berry, plum and spice aromas are smoky, toasty and integrated on the nose. This feels full and saturated on the palate, with smooth but present tannins. A jammy flavor profile includes blackberry and other black fruits, while a vanilla note accents the concentrated berry flavors on the finish. This has the stuffing and structure to age a long time; best 2024–2035.

title: Valdelacierva 2015 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Classic Rioja aromas of plum fruit, olive, pipe tobacco, vanilla and dry earth are a fine opening and lead to a tight sinewy palate, with a firm structure. Currant, plum, cocoa and vanilla flavors finish with tannic bite and length along with a hint of oxidation in the backdrop. Drink through 2025.

title: Bodegas Olarra 2016 Clásico Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Olarra calls this Clásico, and if you're talking Rioja Crianza this is classic and traditional all the way. Berry, plum, vanilla and dried earth aromas announce a charged-up wine to drink now or hold. Generous plum, berry and cocoa flavors rumble across a fresh and sinewy finish that folds in notes of tomato, herbs and pepper. Best through 2028.

title: CVNE 2015 Cune Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Dry, leathery berry and currant aromas include a note of cheesy oak. On the palate, this Reserva from a ripe vintage feels flush, firmly tannic and well built. Black-plum and dark-cherry flavors finish full and with just a hint of oak character. Drink through 2030.

title: Bodegas Olarra 2015 Cerro Añon Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Ripe berry and cherry aromas meld with earth, chocolate and leather on the nose. The full-bodied palate is energized by lemon and supportive acidity, with flavors of toast, wood grain and tobacco in addition to plum and berry fruit. The finish is long in spice and cocoa flavors.

title: Bodegas Olarra 2015 Laztana Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Earthy berry-fruit aromas with classic Rioja touches of vanilla, coconut and leather lead to a full palate that doesn't grind despite showing power. Plum, berry and prune flavors turn more savory and towards blueberry, while toast and dry spice elements accent black-fruit flavors on the finish. Drink through 2026.

title: Bodegas Fariña 2011 Gran Colegiata Campus  (Toro)
description: Char and wood grain are prominent on a smoky nose with blackberry and black-currant aromas. Intense tannins and layered depth make for a full palate, while this tastes ripe and toasty, with blackberry and chocolate flavors. On the finish, mild herbal complexity mixed with latent oak are stirring. Drink through 2026.

title: De Bardos 2012 Suprema 30 Meses  (Ribera del Duero)
description: A smoky, heady nose is defined mostly by char, coffee and black-fruit aromas. In the mouth, this wine is solidly built but not too heavy. Toasty, chocolaty blackberry and cassis flavors don't change much on a bold, blocky finish that stays the course. Drink through 2027.

title: Marco Abella 2016 Mas Mallola Red (Priorat)
description: Up front, blackberry, prune and vanilla aromas are smooth and not loud. Freshness and mild acidity push the palate, which combines smoky oak with baked berry flavors. The finish is brusque and bumpy but also long. This is Priorat in fine light. Drink through 2026.

title: Latitud 42 2010 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Ripe berry aromas are oaky and include a note of woody vanilla. On the palate, this is tight and has a resiny texture from extended barrel aging. Oak-heavy flavors of vanilla and berries finish with chocolate and a medicinal hint. Drink through 2032.

title: Casa Primicia 2014 Julian Madrid Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Lightly charred and smoky aromas sit on top of earthy berry fruit, all touched up by lemony oak and minerality. A wiry palate is pulsing with acidity, while this tastes of blackberry and boysenberry along with vanilla and cured beef. A secure and steady finish features just enough brightness to suggest further aging. Drink through 2029.

title: Dominio de Tares 2015 Bembibre Mencía (Bierzo)
description: A black color and deep aromas of berry fruits, vanilla, wood spice and pine set up a full, jammy palate with padding and lushness. Blackberry, dark plum, berry pastry and chocolate flavors finish round, beefy and chewy. This is a loaded Bierzo to drink through 2026.

title: Viña Mayor 2013 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Attractive aromas of sandalwood, blackberry pastry and root beer signal a ripe wine from a notoriously cold vintage. A firm but impressive structure supports leathery berry, spice and tobacco flavors backed by a wall of oak. A finish with controlled heat tastes spicy and feels eminently dry. Drink through 2028.

title: Casa Primicia 2012 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Ripe, malty aromas of chocolate and maple blend with cherry and cassis scents to form a red carpet kind of nose. Flush, deep and solid on the palate, this lively gran reserva goes for fruit over classic Rioja nuances; expect spiced berry, currant and plum flavors accented by tobacco and chocolate. A muscular finish is the close. Drink through 2032.

title: Alta Alella 2015 Mirgin Opus Paratge Qualificat Vallcirere Brut Nature Sparkling (Cava)
designation: Mirgin Opus Paratge Qualificat Vallcirere Brut Nature
description: Dry apple and mineral aromas are slightly bready but show zero aromatic sweetness, which makes this more “nature” than many brut natures. A round and full palate tastes of orange, peach and papaya, while the finish is tightly wound, focused and true to the crisp and clean brut nature style.

title: Marqués de Murrieta 2011 Capellanía Viura (Rioja)
description: Waxy aromas of dried stone fruits and potent oak open this classy barrel-fermented Viura. A refined palate with cutting acidity energizes woody pear and apple flavors. On the finish, resiny oak and a wave of oxidized Sherry notes are highly complex but maybe not for everyone.

title: Rejadorada 2012 Sango Reserva  (Toro)
description: A barnyard aroma is tempered by notes of coffee and baked berries. This is a rugged, old-school Toro, with scraping tannins and lemony acidity. Flavors of plum, lemon peel, tobacco and vanilla are deep and thorough. A burly finish with live-wire tannins and acidity keep this jacked-up Tempranillo on edge. Drink through 2026.

title: Marqués de Cáceres 2012 Gaudium Gran Vino  (Rioja)
description: Saturated berry, cassis and black-plum aromas are densely packed onto the nose of this tightly built iron-fisted Rioja. Berry, plum and cassis flavors are lightly toasted and spicy, while this is juicy and bold on the finish. Best from 2020–2024.

title: Maetierra Dominum 2012 QP  (Rioja)
description: Root beer, sandalwood, cassis, berry and tobacco aromas are rich and heady. While this Rioja from a warm vintage is deep and intense, it's lifted by lemony acidity and a bold oak character. Brandied cherry flavors are spicy and helped along by creamy vanilla and chocolate notes, while an easygoing finish suggests near-term drinking through 2020.

title: Agustí Torelló Mata 2012 Gran Reserva Brut Nature Sparkling (Cava)
description: Rich, mature aromas of brioche reflect autolysis. A full palate with just enough acidic freshness is layered and complex, while spiced apple flavors are yeasty. A mild note of toast melds with a hint of butter and brioche on the lingering finish. As gran reserva Cava goes, this is a winner.

title: Pago Casa Gran 2015 Falcata Arenal Red (Valencia)
description: Ripe berry and black-plum aromas come with a hint of bacon. This blend of Garnacha Tintorera and Monastrell is dense, ripe and layered on the palate. Black fruit flavors are well toasted, while this shows notes of chocolate and black olive in addition to residual fruit on an exceedingly long finish. Drink through 2024.

title: Vall Llach 2013 Porrera Vi de Vila Carignan-Grenache (Priorat)
description: This aromatic Priorat is 72% Carignan and the rest Garnacha. Aromas of floral bath soap, cinnamon and cedar accent plum and berry scents. In the mouth, this is built like a tank. Spicy chocolaty black-plum and cassis flavors finish chewy and thick, with notes of mint and licorice. Drink through 2021.

title: Eguren Ugarte 2012 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Blackberry, vanilla, sandalwood and oud wood aromas are a touch cheesy and warm but mostly alluring and of high quality. Intense and pulling on the palate, this warm-year Reserva tastes of blackberry, coffee and vanilla. Coconut, vanilla and unresolved oak flavors dominate a ripe finish. Drink through 2023.

title: Marqués de la Concordia 2011 Hacienda Zorita Natural Reserve Syrah (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León
description: Ripe berry, raisin and Maduro cigar aromas are hefty and convincing for Spanish Syrah. This feels full, with bracing acidity. Flavors of cassis, plum, chocolate and tobacco are steady as a barge on calm water. This is impressive for varietal Syrah from Spain. Drink through 2021.

title: Señorío de Sotillo 2012 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Smooth, heady aromas of blackberry, cassis, tobacco, marzipan and vanilla are clicking on all cylinders while leading to a dense, saturated palate that only gets more dense and hard with airing. Blackberry, black cherry, coffee, mocha and caramel flavors conclude with notes of marshmallow and chocolate on a tannic finish with sharp teeth. Drink through 2025.

title: Granbazán 2017 Etiqueta Ámbar Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Lovely aromas of green melon and apple are on the money, as is all of this top-end Albariño from a highly reliable winery. Tight acidity matched with bold but fresh fruit make for an ideal palate, while this tastes of melon, apple and white pepper. A lively finish is jewel-like in its precision. Drink now.

title: Protos 2011 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Gritty, intense, oaky and powerful from start to finish, this displays black-fruit aromas, hints of asphalt and an intense mouthfeel with a tight grip. A common duo of black-fruit and oaky flavors finishes with vanilla notes and a hint of coconut. Drink this structured, fully tannic RDD through 2028.

title: Viña Vilano 2014 Legón Premium  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Toasty dark-fruit aromas are compact. In the mouth, this wine is more screechy, tannic and taut. Oaky and berry flavors are balanced and integrated on a long finish with driving acidity. Drink this strong-boned Tempranillo from a lesser vintage through 2028.

title: Arrocal 2012 Ángel  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Aromas of tree bark, braised turnip and smoky black plum are rooty. This feels gritty and borderline astringent due to massive drying tannins. Savory earthy tarry blackberry flavors end with a hard tannic clamp. Drink this hefty brute from 2018 through 2035.

title: Burgo Viejo 2016 Selección Especial  (Rioja)
description: Ripe berry aromas are at the precipice of jammy. A saturated palate is not overly deep, so this Garnacha-Graciano exhibits mostly a surface-level character. Blackberry flavors are chocolaty and toasty prior to a drumming finish. For a wine with significant Graciano, a grape prone to showing nothing but high acidity, this is a success and a cool find. Drink from 2019–2035.

title: Marqués de Vargas 2010 Selección Privada  (Rioja)
description: Maple, mocha and raisin aromas announce an oaky, fully ripe wine with roasted tomato notes. The palate is saturated with mixed berry, spice and chocolatey oak flavors, finishing with heavy residual tannins. Drink this oaky powerhouse through 2028.

title: Terroir Al Límit 2015 Torroja Red (Priorat)
description: Rose and violet aromas sit comfortably with tight, gritty cherry and plum scents. A tight medium-to-full palate is the staging ground for fresh plum and berry flavors that are powerful but not heavy. A long, warming finish maintains the wine's core potency. This is not ready to drink; best from 2019–2028.

title: Terroir Al Límit 2016 Roc d' Aubaga Rosé (Priorat)
description: Like an ugly duckling that's a beautiful swan in waiting, this unique rosé, if you can call it that given its rusty, almost brown color, is something only Terroir Al Limít would bottle. Earthy in aromas, this mix of several Grenache strains tastes of apricot and dried red fruits. It's mildly spicy throughout, with actual tannins from skin contact. Drink this quasi rosé as you would a serious white or red, meaning with good food like a Catalan-style rice dish. And drink now.

title: Pinord 2010 +7 Red (Priorat)
description: This ripe, healthy wine offers aromas of baked black fruits, licorice and raisin. In the mouth, it's more vital than on the nose; racy acidity and firm but pure tannins make sure of that. For flavors, look for savory tomato, plum, berry fruits, licorice and schisty minerality. Finishing notes of mocha, plum and coffee are braced by hard-driving tannins. Drink through 2024.

title: García Figuero 2014 Viña Viejas  (Ribera del Duero)
description: A dark color and charred, lemony black-fruit aromas announce a wine that's loaded with hard-pounding oak and tannins. This wine tastes super-toasty, blackened and slightly burnt, with black-fruit flavors at the center. This will work best if quality oak applied in abundance is your thing; drink through 2028.

title: Sangenís I Vaqué 2000 Clos Monlleó Gran Reserva Red (Priorat)
description: If you're curious about how Priorat wines age, this 16-year-old blend of Garnacha and Carignan is a good indicator. Mature aromas of earthy grit, leather and spicy plum rest in front of a flush jammy palate with structure. Peppery berry and plum flavors match the nose, while this folds in sweet syrupy notes of chocolate and berry jam prior to a long spicy complex finish. Drink through 2020.

title: Marques de Griñon 2013 Svmma Varietalis Estate Bottled Red (Dominio de Valdepusa)
description: This is a well-balanced offering from Marqués de Griñon's. Forward but controlled cassis and blackberry aromas are earthy and suggest cocoa. A stout palate shows modest flexibility and elegance, while this blend of Syrah, Cabernet Sauvignon and Petit Verdot tastes of spicy cassis and raisin prior to finishing rock steady. Drink through 2024.

title: Alidis 2012 VS  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Ripe berry aromas are backed by strong oak that yields a touch of clove. A deep and layered palate is balanced and mostly fresh, which aids a full-bodied Tempranillo such as this. Black-plum, cassis and spice flavors finish with savory complexity. This is a big ripe offering to drink through 2028.

title: Ardiles 2015 Red (Priorat)
description: Ripe raisiny berry aromas are cool and schisty in that Priorat way. A bold palate feels extracted and tannic, while this tastes of black fruits and toast. Any raisiny qualities that carry onto the finish are cut by hard tannins, which creates roughness. Drink through 2028.

title: Monteabellón 2012 Finca Matambres  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Ripe berry aromas with a touch of root beer are lush and soft. That is not the case on the palate, which is tight in the middle and scratchy along the edges. Blueberry and black-currant flavors are a touch minty, while this wine displays chocolate and lemon-peel notes on a tough, pulling finish. Drink through 2030.

title: Arrocal 2012 Selección  (Ribera del Duero)
description: This wine's compact, lightly toasted berry aromas are reticent but also slyly complex. The palate is packed with firm, abrasive tannins. Dark berry, spice, toast and chocolate flavors finish long and harmonious, with equal amounts of herbal, exotic, oak and berry flavors. Drink through 2026.

title: Matarromera 2014 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: This wine's blackberry and raisin aromas are accented by cheese and leather notes, suggesting brett. It's at once fully extracted and racy, saturated with blackberry and prune flavors at peak ripeness. Although heavy feeling, it's not cloying. Drink through 2028.

title: Emina 2015 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Welcoming berry and cassis aromas are ripe and smooth, with integrated oak. On the palate, this crianza is honest and not overly demanding yet well structured. Blackberry, coffee and mocha flavors are in command through the finish. Drink through 2026.

title: Rento 2015  Ribera del Duero
description: Ripe berry aromas are slightly reduced and offer hints of animal and leather. Huge tannins make for a rubbing palate, while sunbaked flavors of prune, blackberry and chocolate finish blocky, and with a touch of heat. This seems to have absorbed all the sun and warmth that 2015 delivered; drink through 2027.

title: Finca Albret 2011 La Viña de Mi Madre Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Navarra)
designation: La Viña de Mi Madre Reserva
description: Composed cherry, cassis, tobacco and oak aromas are elegant and on the spot. This is alert on the palate, with bold acidity and moderate tannins. Lightly herbal plum and cherry aromas are earthy and leafy but not green. A rugged-feeling herbal finish suggests Cabernet Franc, but this is 100% Cab Sauvignon.

title: Finca Río Negro 2012 Cogolludo-Guadalajara Red (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: This modern blend of Tempranillo, Syrah, Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot offers spicy, leathery berry aromas and a complex hint of dried cheese. The palate is saturated and lacking finesse, driving spicy brandied berry and chocolate flavors into the finish. Drink through 2026.

title: La Gitana 2012 Viñas Viejas  (Ribera del Duero)
description: The nose of this wine is loaded with mocha, coffee and raisinated fruit notes. The palate offers dark, chocolaty flavors of toasted blackberry and oak, framed by ripe tannins. That oaky chocolate flavor carries over to the ripe, slightly hot finish. Drink through 2028.

title: Pinea 2014  Ribera del Duero
description: Rubbery pencil eraser scents accent this wine's blackberry and menthol aromas. It's a heavyweight, with chunky blackberry and fig flavors swathed in chocolate notes from aging 30 months in French oak. It remains oaky and thick into the finish. Drink through 2032.

title: Casa Castillo 2014 Pie Franco Monastrell (Jumilla)
description: Alluring aromas of cocoa powder, berry fruits, graphite and raw oak lead to a jammy palate with density and weight. This old-vines Monastrell tastes of chocolaty oak and herbal blackberry. On the finish, it's tight and rugged, with mildly scratchy tannins and a saucy aftertaste. Drink through 2022.

title: Torres 2010 Grans Muralles Red (Conca de Barberà)
description: This blend of Carignan, Garnacha, Monastrell and several other local grapes opens with gritty, cheesy aromas of oak, tar and asphalt along with savory berry fruits. A saturated, dense palate weighs in as heavy and thick, tasting of reedy berry fruits, roasted plum, savory spices and grilled steak. A blackened, oaky finish is a touch syrupy in feel but quite deep and long. Drink through 2023.

title: Dominio de Atauta 2015 Parada de Atauta  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Appealing black-fruit aromas include notes of tobacco and chocolate. This is a brooding, deep Tinto Fino with grippy tannins. Ripe berry, plum and cassis flavors are flush, while this wine finishes dark, with a reprise of young, rubbery tannins. Best from 2019–2030.

title: 12 Linajes 2014 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Blackberry, leather and plum aromas are inviting. This wine is full and lush on the palate, with grippy tannins. Oaky berry flavors are accented by spice and chocolate notes, while the finish brings pronounced coffee and mocha flavors. Drink through 2025.

title: Bodegas Olarra 2015 Clasico Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Aromas of dried cherry, cola, cedary oak and tobacco are what you want from a fine Rioja, and this has all of that and more. On the palate, this reserva is fresh and full, with subtlety cut by racy acidity. Spicy flavors of leathery berry fruits are savory and deep, while this tastes lightly herbal and spicy on a steady finish. Say yum and drink at any point through 2023.

title: Larchago 2007 Temperado Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Mature woody aromas of foresty berry, cigar box and vanilla set up a palate that's mature but still fresh. Spicy oaky flavors of cherry and plum come with a hint of chocolate, while this ends with integrated notes of coffee and mocha. Drink through 2025.

title: Sonsierra 2012 Pagos de la Sonsierra Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Concentrated black-fruit aromas are charred and savory, with notes of grilled beef and black olive. A plush plump layered palate offers earthy saucy savory plum fruit, while the finish is round, wholesome and smooth. Drink through 2023.

title: Valdubón 2011 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Fully ripe aromas of blackberry, raisin, vanilla and wood grain set up a fleshy, bold palate that's tannic, but not tough or impermeable. Savory oak and ripe berry fruit flavors finish chewy and dense, with moderate complexity. Drink through 2025.

title: Dominio Basconcillos 2011 Estate Grown 12 Meses en Barrica Made with Organic Grapes  (Ribera del Duero)
designation: Estate Grown 12 Meses en Barrica Made with Organic Grapes
description: This is a concentrated bruiser from a ripe warm vintage. Aromas of cheesy oak, vanilla, maple and blackberry require as much air as possible. Saturated, heavy and jammy on the palate, this pounds the palate with rugged tannins. Flavors of blackberry, prune and chocolate finish thick, chewy and grabby. This is not about elegance—it's all about power and concentration. Drink through 2025.

title: Valenciso 2009 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Spicy earthy briary aromas include a note of cola along with requisite berry and cassis scents. A slightly choppy mouthfeel and flavors of blueberry, cardamom, herbs and oak define the palate, while this finishes fruity and open. Drink through 2024.

title: Vetus 2011  Toro
description: The nose on this ripe Tinta de Toro is dense, bold and brimming with black-fruit aromas. Following the nose, this tastes of blackberry, cassis and various spices, while finishing black-fruit flavors are lightly herbal, spicy and complex. This offers a touch of everything good, and even more when it comes to ripe fruit. Drink through 2024.

title: Arrocal 2014 Ángel  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Smoky oak tops a nose with root beer, chimney draft and heady berry aromas. A thick, creamy palate delivers the heft Ribera is known for, while this tastes of ripe blackberry, cassis, coconut, vanilla and mocha. A lush finish is packed to the brim, but while this is massively fruity and oaky, to call it elegant, sophisticated or refined would be stretching things.

title: Perelada 2012 Finca Malaveïna Red (Empordà)
description: This five-grape blend is muscular and wide on the palate, with oaky berry flavors that are also tarry and toasty. Hard tannins and some chop on the finish suggest further aging would be beneficial. Drink this Cabernet-led blend that also includes Garnacha, Syrah, Merlot and Cab Franc through 2025.

title: Bodegas Muriel 2010 Viñas Viejas Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Ripe berry, prune and raisin aromas are at the core of a nose that's also driven by coconut and vanilla accents. A rustic mouthfeel with grippy tannins frames savory, oaky red berry and plum flavors, while tobacco and vanilla notes are corralled by a drying finish. Drink through 2028.

title: Bodegas Ontañón 2010 Reserva Tempranillo-Graciano  (Rioja)
description: Classic Rioja aromas of cured meat, dried cherry, wood spice, tobacco and vanilla play nicely together. The plush palate is plenty full but not heavy, with flavors of plum, berry fruits, vanilla and oak. It's a balanced wine from a stellar vintage, with a powerful finish that indicates it will continue to mature with grace. Drink through 2028.

title: Bodegas Ondarre 2015 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Aromas of cherry, berry, tomato sauce and vanilla are smoky and slightly tarry. A flush, full mouthfeel is lifted by core acidity, while flavors of blackened spice, tobacco, toast and cassis finish with classic Rioja notes of vanilla, mocha, toast and warmth. Drink this winner through 2024.

title: Casa Primicia 2014 Viña Diezmo RV Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Elegant aromas of forest floor, fine oak, tobacco and spice notes grace core black fruit scents. A powerfully restrained palate is a touch creamy with oak, while this offers deep plum and berry flavors backed by a roasted, meaty finish where spice character is prominent. Drink through 2028.

title: Bodegas Franco-Españolas 2011 Barón D'Anglade Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Welcoming aromas of cola, oak and earthy plum are a touch tarry and fiery. On the palate, this shows moderate to good depth but still seems a bit narrow. Flavors of leafy, earthy berry and plum are lightly oaked and finish with spice notes attached to lingering berry and plum fruit. Drink through 2035.

title: Valduero 2011 6 Años Reserva Premium  (Ribera del Duero)
description: This features top-heavy aromas of cedar and tobacco. It's ribbed with powerful tannins that frame its cassis and baked plum fruit. Those flavors are infused with cedary oak, finishing smooth and chocolaty. Drink through 2030.

title: Marqués de la Concordia 2011 HZ Abascal Vineyard  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Ripe, earthy aromas of baked berry fruits, cassis and licorice lead to a chewy, stout palate. Oaky flavors of ripe blackberry and cassis are rooty and leathery, while this tastes of chocolate and fig on a broad finish. Drink through 2023.

title: Marqués de Murrieta 2012 Finca Ygay Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Murrieta's wines have been on a good run in recent years, as evidenced by this saturated, fleshy Reserva. The nose delivers berry and cherry aromas, with ample oak. The palate is a full-volume bonanza of berry flavors framed by briary spice and toasty oak. A naturally spicy, ripe finish confirms its excellence; drink 2018–2026.

title: 12 Linajes 2011 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)
description: A welcoming opening consists of creamy oak, raspberry and exotic blueberry aromas. In the mouth, this is just right, with a seamless blend of acidity, rich oak, tannins and depth. The big three of Ribera flavors—intense berry fruit, chocolate and pepper—end with notes of toast and coffee along with length. Drink through 2024.

title: Val de Los Frailes 2006 Pago de las Costanas Tempranillo (Cigales)
description: This rust-tinted wine's roasted plum, currant, olive and rubber aromas lead to a mature palate with lasting acidity. Its balsamic berry and plum flavors are a touch oaky yet seem ready to drink. A meaty note accents the finish.

title: Valduero 2014 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Exceedingly ripe aromas of chocolate and raisin hint at a cooked wine, but on the palate this redeems itself. Yes, it's extracted and syrupy, but a bright core of acidity brings it back to earth. Its herbal berry and fudge flavors come with more than enough oak, recalling prune, blackberry and chocolate layer cake on the finish. Drink through 2022.

title: CVNE 2012 Viña Real Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Compact, almost gritty aromas of tree bark and herbal berry fruits require time to breathe. After necessary airing, this is elegant and fresh on the palate, but full in body. Herbal plum and berry flavors are leathery, spicy and suggest tomato as this transitions to a firm, racy finish. Drink through 2020.

title: García Figuero 2013 Tinto Viñas Viejas  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Smoky hickory and meat aromas overshadow this wine's berry scents. On the palate, it rattles about like an untied load. Berry and black plum flavors come with more than enough oak, which is reflected on the toasty, char-laced finish. Drink 2019–2026.

title: Valdelacierva 2011 Alfar Reserva Edición Limitada  (Rioja)
description: Ripe cassis and berry aromas come with common Rioja side notes of vanilla, cedar and tobacco. This wine feels flush, with plenty of weight but also balance. Flavors of raisin, prune, cassis, chocolate and vanilla finish full, toasty and warm. This is a ripe reserva made in the classic Rioja style; drink through 2025.

title: Coto de Imaz 2010 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Interest is stirred right away by tarry aromas of wild berry fruits and rooty spices. The solid palate is creamy while also showing its teeth. Toasty, spicy baked-berry flavors are integrated and finish long and dry, with a touch of latent oak. Drink at any point through 2032.

title: Teso La Monja 2014 Victorino  (Toro)
description: Dense, dark aromas of minty oak, blackberry, pencil lead and chocolate set up a broad, hard-bodied palate with firm, gripping tannins. Toasty blackberry and pronounced oak flavors culminate on a big, lush and grabby finish. This is excellent, though a bit bold and burly; drink through 2022.

title: Bodegas Olarra 2012 Clásico Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Like all of the Olarra 2012 reservas, this shows earthy plum and berry aromas, but in this case there's a hint of fresh mushroom and herbs that are typical of traditional Rioja. A round chewy full palate holds flavors of herbal tea and balsamic plum and berry fruits. A comfortable blend of power and restraint guides the finish. Drink through 2023.

title: Marqués de Murrieta 2010 Finca Ygay Gran Reserva Limited Edition  (Rioja)
designation: Finca Ygay Gran Reserva Limited Edition
description: Slightly overripe aromas of raisin and prune dominate the nose on this jammy, spongy-feeling gran reserva. Soft, ripe cassis and plum flavors come with spice and tobacco accents. On a savory finish, prune comes back into play, thus cementing a ripe, jammy essence. Drink through 2025.

title: Agustí Torelló Mata 2008 Magnum Gran Reserva Brut Nature Sparkling (Cava)
description: Crisp clean white-fruit aromas come with a hint of clover. This is mellow and mature on the palate, with nothing aggressive or edgy. Dry, peppery, yeasty flavors show little overt fruit, while this offers a hint of green melon on a dry complex finish.

title: Marques de Griñon 2011 Emeritus Red (Dominio de Valdepusa)
description: Emeritus is a blend of 83% Cabernet Sauvignon with Petit Verdot and Syrah filling out the form. Dense earthy aromas of blackberry come with a note of graphite, while the oak on this bruiser smells a bit cheesy. Pounding blackberry and chocolate-cake flavors finish oaky, toasty, baked and incredibly ripe. Drink this massive wine through 2023.

title: Marques de Griñon 2011 Single Vineyard Estate Bottled Graciano (Dominio de Valdepusa)
description: Lush ripe aromas of earthy black fruits and graphite open this varietal Graciano from a warm vintage. Hefty and chewy in feel, this tastes of fudge cake, blackberry and cassis. A lasting stout finish offers tobacco and prune flavors. Yes, this is huge. But there are very few Gracianos that offer this kind of power, flavor and intensity. Drink through 2023.

title: Losada 2015 Altos de Losada La Bienquerida Mencía (Bierzo)
description: Concentrated black fruit aromas come with accents of lemony oak, olive and dried spice. A flush, tight, extracted palate features drying tannins along with savory flavors of black fruits and black olive. A muscular, meaty finish with lasting dark-berry flavors ranks as full, dense and delicious. Drink through 2026.

title: Portia 2012 Trienna  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Earth, leather and strong but quality oak notes accent berry-fruit aromas. Cheek-sucking tannins make for a rugged mouthfeel. Spicy, peppery berry flavors are fully oaked and toasty, while this tastes dry and minty on the finish. Grilled meat and/or a few years on its side is what this needs. Drink through 2025.

title: Alidis 2011 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Dark smoky, stout aromas of licorice, molasses and blackberry feed into a jammy palate with rock-hard, clamping tannins. Plum, blackberry and blueberry flavors are loud and intense, while this finishes with density, complexity, chewy tannins and a jammy essence. Drink through 2028.

title: García Figuero 2014 15 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)
description: This wine's toasty oak and inky black fruit aromas suggest pencil lead. The palate is full bodied but controlled, with prominent woody flavors of tobacco and vanilla. Savory black fruit and tobacco notes mark the finish. Drink through 2028.

title: Marques de Griñon 2011 Summa Varietalis Estate Bottled Red (Dominio de Valdepusa)
description: Dense ripe black-fruit aromas are moderately spicy. In the mouth, this blend of Syrah, Petit Verdot and Cabernet Sauvignon is stout and rugged, much like Griñon's other 2011s. Flavors of ripe blackberry and cassis finish with chewy tannins and an overriding sense of ripeness. Drink through 2023.

title: Contino 2010 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Earthy notes of plum and berry include a touch of leafy herbs. This is crisp, elegant and slightly tomatoey in feel, with dry herbal plum and berry flavors that end fresh and savory. There's nothing over the top about this classic Rioja. Drink through 2024.

title: Marco Abella 2011 Mas Mallola Red (Priorat)
description: Ripe black-fruit aromas are schisty and suggestive of burnt toast. An edgy fresh agile palate is a touch choppy, while flavors of peppery black fruits and desert herbs and brush finish crisp, focused and not too heavy. Drink through 2024.

title: Casa Gran del Siurana 2010 Gran Cruor Red (Priorat)
description: Smoky, woody, spicy aromas come with notes of campfire, hickory smoke and rubber band. This contains 70% Syrah and 15% each of Garnacha and Carignan. Dark peppery spicy berry flavors are oaky and a touch burnt, while spicy oak and herbal berry flavors make for a satisfying finish. Drink through 2021.

title: Bodegas Riojanas 2010 Viña Albina Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Dusty aromas of cocoa, herbs and spice grace prune and plum scents. This is firm, layered and healthy in mouthfeel. Flavors of baked plum, blackberry and mocha finish dry and well balanced. This has more than a few years left in it. Drink through 2023.

title: Baron De Ley 2010 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: This is a fine gran reserva from a great vintage. Aromas of vanilla, cedar, earth and spiced black fruits lead to a fresh pure palate with tomato-like snap. Cherry, cassis, tobacco and chocolate flavors finish smooth and clean, with just enough tannic grip. Drink through 2022.

title: Altos De Rioja 2014 Altos R Pigeage  (Rioja)
description: Creamy, heady aromas of vanilla, raisin and prune are at the fully ripe end of the spectrum, while this is chewy and dense on the palate. Similar to the nose, prune and cassis flavors push acceptable ripeness to the brink, while this remains saturated and full on the finish. Drink through 2025.

title: CVNE 2012 Imperial Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Aromas of baked blueberry and prune on the nose reflect the hot, dry vintage. The solid palate brings dense berry and plum flavors that show a touch of raisin prior to a fruit-laden finish. Drink through 2026.

title: Bodegas Ontañón 2010 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Spicy red-berry aromas are a bit reedy and piquant, which makes sense when you arrive at a fresh, vibrant palate, with peppy acidity. Plum, raspberry and strawberry flavors are accented by wild herb notes, and only on the finish does this show a riper note of prune and some oak. Drink through 2032.

title: Campillo 2012 Reserva Selecta Tempranillo  (Rioja)
description: A smooth nose of spicy blackberry melds with accents of dried cheese and vanilla. On the palate, this is muscular and a bit fleshy. Plum, spice and berry flavors finish with power and purpose; drink through 2027.

title: Emilio Moro 2016 Malleolus  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Charred oak speaks loudest on a nose that fluctuates between clean and fruity and pointed and staunch. A choppy palate relaxes with airing, while this tastes of oaky berry fruits. On the finish, this reverts to woody, hard and tannic. Revisit this between 2022 and 2024 and it should be calmer and nicer to drink.

title: Comenge 2011 Don Miguel Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Initially this smells intense and gritty, but with airing you get fresher berry notes accented by dried herbs. A plush mouth-filling palate offers a mix of savory blackberry, oak-based maple and chocolate flavors. On the finish, this is smooth, with notes of coffee, lemon peel and oak grain. Drink through 2022.

title: Celler Piñol 2016 Mather Teresina Red (Terra Alta)
description: Ripe blackberry aromas are nuanced and there's restraint to the nose of this Garnacha-Carignan blend. A layered and intense palate is bulldozing, but that's fine given how strong and pure are the cherry, cassis and chocolaty oak flavors this brings. A warm, spicy finish suggests fall or winter drinking, ideally through 2025.

title: Bodegas Fariña 2010 Dama de Toro Reserva  (Toro)
description: Blackberry, brandied cherry and spice aromas lead to a wide palate with tannins that pierce like nails. This tastes a touch foxy and wild, while the finish feels centered and firm. Despite intense, abrasive tannins, this displays depth and complexity. Drink through 2022.

title: Vatan 2014  Toro
description: This full-size, oak-heavy Toro smells of baked berry, prune and wood grain. Lush and chunky on the palate, with mild acidity and bulky tannins, this tastes mostly of toasty, blackened oak, cassis and blackberry. A choppy but long finish tastes chocolaty and rich. At 15.5%, this is extracted, with fleeting balance. Drink through 2020.

title: Vega Sicilia 2012 Pintia  (Toro)
description: An opaque purple color and charred, smoky aromas render this ripe-vintage Toro dark from the outset. Sandpaper tannins frame its dominant char and burnt toast flavors, while a base of black fruit holds it together. It's all about oak and slamming tannins now, so cellar and drink from 2020–2030.

title: Campillo 2015 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: This crianza offers a flush, full-volume palate, with classic Rioja flavors of plum, raspberry and currant that don't fade or falter on the finish. Drink now–2024.

title: Marques de Griñon 2012 AAA Red (Dominio de Valdepusa)
description: Ripe years like 2012 can produce mammoth wines in places like Dominio de Valdepusa in Central Spain, and this is indeed a huge black seriously ripe blend of Graciano, Petit Verdot and Cabernet Sauvignon. Raisin and prune aromas are in the lead, and there's fiery oak to go with that. Flavors of prune, chocolate and blazing oak match the nose, while this ends with the thud of extremely ripe fruit, tons of oak and soft tannins. Drink through 2021.

title: Marqués de Vargas 2010 Hacienda Pradolagar  (Rioja)
description: This is yet another unconventional, funky Rioja from this producer. Herbal saucy aromas of briar patch and raisin are a challenge to process. On the palate, this is intensely tannic. Herbal, spicy cherry, plum and licorice flavors finish with juicy acidity. Drink through 2028.

title: Aspaldi 2010 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Briary plum and leather aromas are slightly toasty. This feels just chewy and dense enough to rise above lean and dainty. Spicy peppery berry flavors come with a dusting of chocolaty oak, while the finish hums along with a firm but manageable tannic grip. Drink through 2021.

title: Pecunia 2012 12 Meses  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Earthy black-fruit aromas show a side note of rubber. This feels tight, deep and concentrated, with hard tannins. Blackberry, cassis, toast and dark-chocolate flavors finish firm and dry, with a chocolaty aftertaste. Drink this full bold true-to-form Ribera del Duero through 2025.

title: Marqués de Cáceres 2010 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Almost overripe aromas of prune and raisin are at the fore on the nose. A full, chewy palate shows big tannins and roasted, earthy flavors of olive, spice cake and berry fruits. Assertive tannins linger through the finish, with flavors of licorice, herbs and chocolate. Drink through 2022.

title: Rioja Vega 2012 Reserva Estate Bottled  (Rioja)
description: Lightly astringent cherry and berry aromas are intriguing and complex. This eases across the palate with weight and ripeness prior to baked berry, cassis and prune flavors. Earthiness becomes a more dominant characteristic the longer this sits. Drink through 2021.

title: Palacio de Fefiñanes 2017 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Fefiñanes ranks among the best and most consistent makers of Albariño in Rías Baixas, so no surprise that this comes across clean on the nose, with lively notes of white fruits and buttercup. A plump but vibrant palate is still in peak condition, while this tastes of nectarine, apple, honeydew and lime. Drink through 2019.

title: Legaris 2014 Páramos de Legaris  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Prune and dried blackberry aromas start off this wine. The saturated, meaty palate brings blackberry and black plum flavors that move to a dried-fruit finish. Drink through 2023.

title: Crápula 2014 Soul Limited Edition Old Vines Monastrell (Jumilla)
description: This leads with wiry, bouyant black fruit aromas. The palate is jammy and full bodied but also raging with bold acidity. After an initial burst of plum, cassis and subtle herb flavors, darker notes of toast and chocolate settle in on the finish.

title: Protos 2013 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Robust aromas of dark toast, cool mint, cola, blackberry and chocolate are riper than what most 2013 RDDs show. A round, expansive palate gets drier as rough tannins take grip. Roasted, savory flavors are solid, while this simmers with oaky tobacco notes on a long finish. The more time this has in the bottle, the better. Drink through 2028.

title: Covila 2014 II AEX  (Rioja)
description: This wine's blackberry and raisin aromas come with fig, prune and chocolate notes. Scratchy tannins make for a rugged, chewy palate, with ample tobacco and oak flavors and ripe blackberry and cassis notes. Hints of prune and chocolate emerge on the finish. Drink through 2027.

title: Bodegas Riojanas 2009 Viña Albina Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Savory, mature aromas of woodspice and earthy berry fruits form the greeting on this gran reserva that's more lively than subdued or silky. Spicy, oaky berry flavors have a ripe, rooty component, while there's just enough pop to a bold, baked, chocolaty finish. Drink through 2026.

title: Clunia 2014 Syrah (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León
description: Creamy oak and raisiny notes announce ripeness and richness that turn to complexity as this Syrah airs out. In the mouth, this is full-force, with choppy tannins and tomato-like acidity. Spice, herb and plum flavors finish dry, toasty and well balanced. Drink through 2021.

title: Coto de Imaz 2012 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Classic Rioja aromas of earthy berry, cassis and raisin along with cocoa and dry spice notes announce a ripe wine with complexity. A dense palate with good acidity sets the stage for baked berry, cassis and raisin flavors. This Tempranillo is earthy and smooth on the finish. Drink through 2020.

title: Avancia 2015 Old Vines Godello (Valdeorras)
description: Citrus and white-fruit aromas are elegant, smooth and suggestive of Burgundy, which makes sense given that this was aged in oak. The right amount of acidity lends lightness and length to the palate, while ripe lime and honeydew flavors are well oaked. A fresh friendly finish is minerally and crystal clean.

title: Alta Alella 2014 Privat Laietà Gran Reserva Brut Nature Sparkling (Cava)
designation: Privat Laietà Gran Reserva Brut Nature
description: A focused nose with purity, mineral notes and clean white-fruit aromas opens this fine brut nature. The palate is round enough to not be austere, while it carries flavors of white currant, apple and lime. On the finish it maintains its flavors, minerality and clarity.

title: Bodegas Escudero 2010 Solar de Becquer Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Elegant spicy aromas of dried red fruits and plum are fresh and clean. A pure forward medium-bodied palate holds flavors of spiced cherry, plum and vanilla. Those flavors are repeated and unbroken on a clean lithe finish. Drink through 2022.

title: Ferrer Bobet 2013 Red (Priorat)
description: A bright purple tint announces a jumpy youthful-smelling wine with plum, black currant and oak aromas. This is Carignan, Syrah, Garnacha and Cab Sauvignon, and it's full in body but also juicy and lively. Savory, saucy plum and berry flavors ride a wave of crisp acidity, while the finish feels dry and exact, with minty medicinal overtones. Drink this snappy wine through 2021.

title: Celler Bartolomé 2015 Clos Bartolomé Red (Priorat)
description: Earthy berry, licorice root, chocolate and vanilla aromas set up a full palate with chewy tannins. Baked, fully ripe berry flavors are chocolaty and fairly rich, while this holds on to its chocolaty oak character on a finish that's easygoing and more simple than complex. Drink through 2021.

title: De Muller 2013 Les Pusses Merlot-Syrah (Priorat)
description: This wine's ripe black fruit aromas suggest prune and raisin. Rough tannins make for a drying, tough mouthfeel, with desiccated-seeming smoked meat, cassis and raisin flavors. Despite its minor flaws, it shows great quality for a difficult vintage. Drink through 2022.

title: Legaris 2012 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Olive, forest floor and damp earth notes mix with berry and cassis aromas on the nose. It shows powerful tannins on the palate, with ripe black fruit flavors that reflect the warm vintage. Drink through 2024.

title: Anier 2015 Vendimia Seleccionada  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Balsamic aromas of soy sauce, Modena vinegar, black olive and stewed berry fruits form the opening on this clampy Ribera with pinching tannins that narrow the palate. Savory blackberry and boysenberry flavors finish with some heat and hard tannins. Drink through 2035.

title: Huguet de Can Feixes 2009 Gran Reserva Brut Nature Sparkling (Cava)
description: Initial charred gritty aromas become more yeasty, round, complex and friendly with airing. This feels solid and moderately full in body, with dry yeasty neutral flavors that aren't particularly fruity. A dry, subtle finish is classy and long.

title: Viñedos de Alfaro 2012 Conde del Real Agrado Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Top-level berry and plum aromas are backed by classic Rioja notes of spice, herbs and mint. While this is scouring on the palate, there are no complaints about the wine's energy level. Flavors of red plum, cherry and vanilla finish with a reverb of smacking acidity that makes this eligible for additional aging; drink through 2024.

title: Bodegas Ugalde 2012 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: This intense wine has rooty, tarry aromas, dried berry notes and a tinge of raisin. Its spiced berry and plum flavors are dry and persistent. A long, tea-inflected finish suggests it's nowhere close to done. Drink through 2032.

title: Marqués de la Concordia 2013 Hacienda Zorita Magister Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León
description: This wine offers aromas of leather, earth, and berries. The palate is intensely concentrated and jammy, with brambly blackberry and cassis flavors that show a minty herbal side. Roasted, earthy notes rise up on the finish. Drink through 2030.

title: Bodega Carmen Rodríguez 2013 Carodorum Único Crianza  (Toro)
description: Immensely ripe black fruit aromas are accompanied by no shortage of vanilla, chocolate and baked notes on the nose of this Toro heavyweight that spent 30 months in oak. The palate amounts to an avalanche of black fruit and tannins, while this tastes baked and exceedingly ripe. Touches of spice and complexity can be found on a finish saturated with blackberry and cassis flavors.

title: Viejo Mundo 2015 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: A clean nose plays up blackberry and cassis aromas, while a pulling palate offers Ribera del Duero's patented hard-clawing tannins. Roasted berry and plum flavors are lightly oaked and take on a savory character as this sits. Tea, olive and latent black fruit flavors push a rough-textured finish. Drink through 2028.

title: Reserva de la Tierra 2014 Vines of Bonmont Red (Priorat)
description: Charred, lemony aromas of black fruit and shoe polish are dark and chocolaty. A ripe palate is full of energy but wears its size and strength well. Blackberry, mocha, char and spice flavors gradually settle on a full-flavored and long finish.

title: Protos 2012 Gran Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Charred aromas of burnt wood, black coffee and tire rubber give way to smoky fruit. This is a tannic, tough Tempranillo, one that's pinched in feel. Charred blackberry flavors remain dark on a chewy tannic finish. Give this lots of air or more time in bottle; drink through 2027.

title: Terroir Al Límit 2014 Pedra de Guix White (Priorat)
description: Despite a tan-meets-orange color, this Priorat white is fresh on the nose with apricot aromas. A solid texture with grip controls the palate, while dry white-fruit and orange-peel flavors end with slightly rubbery white-grape tannins.

title: Suertes del Marqués 2015 El Ciruelo Viñas Viejas Listán Negro (Valle de la Orotava)
description: This varietal Listán Negro from Tenerife in the Canary Islands opens with minerally cherry aromas offset by notes of earth and leather. A juicy, clamping palate with salty plum and raspberry flavors ends with light spice notes. This is elegant and svelte, but packs punch. Drink through 2021.

title: Alta Alella 2016 Orbus Red (Alella)
description: Black plum and wild berry aromas are solid as a brick house. A flush and fruity palate is braced by sizzling acidity, while this tastes of plum and blackberry along with vanilla and tobacco. Racy acidity propels a fresh finish that offers modest complexity via tomato leaf and herbal notes.

title: Señorío de Cuzcurrita 2010 Cerrado del Castillo  (Rioja)
description: This is a dark saturated fully oaked Rioja with savory briary berry aromas and notes of coffee grounds, fennel and hard spices. A full chunky palate is displaying young rubbery tannins. Flavors of baked plum, grilled meat, raw oak and lemon peel finish with toasty oak that veers towards maple. Drink through 2030.

title: Adegas Gran Vinum 2017 Gran Vinum Selección Especial Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Peach and melon flavors are fresh but also full and slightly leesy. A citrusy palate is tight in structure, with lemony acidity keeping this Albariño crisp and focused. Orange and lime flavors are clean as polished glass, while this is long, pure and minerally on a stylish finish. Drink now.

title: Resalte 2011 Expresion  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Cedar, bold berry and cassis aromas come with an exotic note of sandalwood. In the mouth, this feels alert, bright and grabby, with a full load of muscular tannins and acidity. Flavors of spiced blackberry, coffee and chocolate are toasty and a touch burnt in character on the finish. Drink through 2023.

title: Lealtanza 2010 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Soft, ripe aromas of cassis, raisin and buttery oak are easygoing and not too demanding. An elastic feel is derived from rubbery tannins, while this tastes of saucy plum and berry fruits as well as savory oak. The finish on this gran reserva delivers more of the same flavors, with notes of herbs and spice. Drink through 2025.

title: Valdelacierva 2014 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Berry, cherry, chocolate and brown sugar aromas give way to toast and vanilla as this airs out. A powerful palate is fueled by wiry acidity, while an oak-driven flavor profile features vanilla, coconut, toast and plum. On the finish, this thins out then turns overtly woody. Drink through 2025.

title: Familia Montaña 2016 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Ripe berry and cassis aromas come with a hint of pine or spruce. A fleshy palate shows girth balanced by acidity, while this Crianza tastes of black plum and raspberry. On a texturally nice finish, this tastes mostly of spice and chocolate. Drink through 2024.

title: Baron De Ley 2012 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Classic Rioja aromas of root beer, cedar, cigar box, olive and earthy baked-berry fruits open this gran reserva. A weighty palate is cut by acidity, while this offers flavors of baked cherry, cassis and spice. A rush of acidity lends length to a finish with tobacco, pepper and dried berry flavors. Drink through 2025.

title: Bodegas Caudalía 2015 Xi'ipal Gracia Vid San Martín de Unx Graciano (Navarra)
designation: Xi'ipal Gracia Vid San Martín de Unx
description: Smoky spicy black-fruit aromas are at max ripeness for Graciano. A tight, somewhat narrow palate is typical of this acid-driven variety. Reduced flavors of plum and cherry come with hints of chocolate and cola. Lastly, a loaded finish is racy and fruity, though not that deep. Drink through 2020.

title: Artadi 2014 Viñas de Laguardia  (Rioja)
description: A dense, dark color and ripe and raisinated black fruit aromas welcome one into this multi-vineyard Rioja. On the palate, it's loaded with berry and vanilla flavors, its textured finish showing a hint of toast. Drink through 2021.

title: Consejo de la Alta 2014 Cata de Consejero  (Rioja)
description: Warm, earthy berry aromas are a touch horsey but are aided by chocolate and tobacco notes. A dry, fairly hard palate holds tomato and savory red-berry flavors that are demonstrably not lush or jammy, while a long and meaty finish remains savory and moderately complex. Drink through 2025.

title: Alvarez de Toledo 2015 Colección de Familia Mencía (Bierzo)
description: A dark berry aroma is heady and warm, with a flush, wide palate. A bolt of acidity gives energy to blackberry and spice flavors, while this Mencía doesn't falter on a plush finish.

title: Bodegas Berceo 2016 Más de Berceo Graciano (Navarra)
description: Cassis and lightly stewed plum aromas are fruity to the point of jammy. This Graciano from Navarra is thick and flush, with grabby tannins. Flavors of dark fruits are chocolaty and slightly herbal, while this is toasty, chewy, dense and balanced on the finish. For the price, this is a total steal.

title: Conde de Siruela 2014 Élite  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Cedar and tobacco aromas blend with black-fruit notes and coffee to create a welcoming nose. An expansive palate is full in volume and cut by strong acidity. Lemony oak sits atop flavors of toasty plum and blackberry, while this delivers a lively finish with earth notes. Drink through 2028.

title: Bodega San Pedro Regalado 2012 Canta Perdices  (Ribera del Duero)
description: This wine's blackberry, cassis and plum aromas are plump and fruity, with no garish oak notes. On the palate, it's fleshy, with inky blackberry flavors and tapered tannins. Those tannins persist long into the finish. Drink now–2030.

title: Embocadero 2014  Ribera del Duero
