description: Plum, black cherry and gritty notes of tar, asphalt and chalk dust control the nose on this wiry Tempranillo that's grabby, hard and tannic on the palate. Peppery berry-fruit flavors are steady across a bold finish. This still needs time to settle and soften; drink through 2025.

title: Matsu 2015 El Recio  (Toro)
description: Intense berry aromas are baked, earthy and suggestive of prune. A powerful palate is direct, healthy and tannic. A mix of black-fruit and blueberry flavors concludes with dry, peppery spice notes on a long tight finish that's on target. Drink through 2026.

title: Losada 2015 Godello (Bierzo)
description: Losada is known for its red Mencía, but this Godello debut is well done. A waxy floral nose with apple and stone-fruit aromas sets up a round full balanced palate with bold acidity. Salty notes accent peach and apple flavors, while this displays grip on a lingering finish. Sophisticated is a good way to describe this.

title: Alta Alella 2013 Privat Laietà Rosé Gran Reserva Brut Nature Sparkling (Cava)
designation: Privat Laietà Rosé Gran Reserva Brut Nature
description: Mild comfortable aromas of burnt orange and spiced pumpkin lead to a tight, focused palate of moderate weight. Dry melon and peach aromas are on the money, while this finishes clean as polished glass, with a touch of spice.

title: Bodegas Corral 2010 Don Jacobo Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Despite being a bit murky, leathery and stewy on the nose, this reserva from a classic vintage more than gets by. A full palate with proper balance offers flavors of prune, vanilla and chocolate. Tobacco is the lead flavor on a dense, blocky finish. Drink through 2024.

title: Dominio Basconcillos 2011 Viña Magna Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)
description: This heavily oaked Ribera del Duero features maple, barrel char, dried cheese, licorice and boysenberry jam aromas. The palate is so concentrated it's syrupy, its blackened oak, crème de cassis and chocolate flavors feeling heavy on the finish. Drink this saturated bruiser through 2022.

title: Museum 2011 Reserva Tempranillo (Cigales)
description: This Tempranillo from little-known Cigales opens with potent crushed brick, spice, toasty oak and berry aromas. The palate has a juicy, fresh outlook and no excess weight or overextraction. Its plum, berry, spice and vanilla flavors finish with a note of mature, sweet tobacco. Drink through 2020.

title: Vall Llach 2014 Idus Red (Priorat)
description: This wine's full dark berry and desert herb aromas are typical of Vall Llach. Its full-bodied, chunky palate delivers brandied black currant, black plum and baked berry flavors, with a finish that's strong with peppery, herbal notes. Drink through 2022.

title: Inurrieta 2012 Laderas de Inurrieta Graciano (Navarra)
description: Ripe black-fruit aromas include earthy notes and a hint of roasted meat. This is powerful on the palate, with popping acidity and hard tannins. A flavor profile comprised of cherry, plum and berry fruits finishes with oak-based notes of vanilla, mocha and baking spices. This is nowhere near its peak; drink through 2027.

title: Losada 2015 Mencía (Bierzo)
description: Ripe, fleshy, minerally blackberry and black-cherry aromas are pure, deep and suggest high quality that's confirmed later on. In the mouth, this Mencía from an excellent vintage is racy and pumped up, with acidic energy and tannic grab. Roasted black-fruit flavors come with notes of spice cake and salt. A long, full finish confirms how good this is; drink through 2022.

title: Covila 2010 II Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Earthy berry aromas are sweetened by notes of raisin, creamy oak and root beer. This gran reserva is more easygoing, plump and chunky than what you'd expect from a great vintage like 2010, with flavors of tobacco, woodspice, vanilla, cherry and berry fruit. Cocoa is a prime flavor on the finish. Drink now through 2023.

title: Carlos Moro 2015 Finca Las Marcas Fermentado en Barrica Verdejo (Rueda)
designation: Finca Las Marcas Fermentado en Barrica
description: Dry apple and lemon aromas are clean and one step above neutral. In the mouth, this barrel-fermented Verdejo feels full and flush, with citrusy acidity. Integrated oak notes accent a core orange flavor on the finish of this finely made Spanish white.

title: Bodegas Olarra 2012 Cerro Añon Reserva  (Rioja)
description: This Rioja reserva hits all the standard checkpoints with aplomb. Earthy loamy mossy aromas of plum and berry fruits feature a hint of tobacco and vanilla. In the mouth, this is full, with round but serious tannins. Tea, wild herb, black plum and berry flavors finish with savory soupy notes and prodding tannins. Drink through 2022.

title: Bodegas y Viñedos Tábula 2011 Damana Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Very ripe, almost raisiny black-fruit aromas open this heavyweight. Stout and blocky on the palate, with hard tannins, this tastes of jammy roasted blackberry. A round drying tannic finish is still young and aggressive. Drink through 2026.

title: Alto Moncayo 2014 Aquilon Garnacha (Campo de Borja)
description: Alto Moncayo's mega Garnacha is this smoky, roasted smelling monster. Aromas of plum and currant are straight from the smoker, while this feels full and massive but tempered by acidity. Resiny oak flavors of clove and campfire are stronger than the wine's plum and berry notes, while this tastes savory and extremely woody on the finish. Drink through 2022.

title: Vall Llach 2016 Embruix Red (Priorat)
description: Bold blackberry, black cherry and raisin aromas are balanced by ingrained minerality, always a good sign for Priorat. A saturated palate fits the house style for Embruix, while toast, coffee, blackberry and prune flavors finish chocolaty but not that long or complex. At 15.5% abv, you should tread carefully with this.

title: Marqués de la Concordia 2008 Viña Alarde Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Savory, mossy plum and currant aromas are mature and woodsy. High acidity is the lifeblood of this gran reserva that tastes of reedy, leafy currant and herbs. The finish is dry, with a note of tobacco. Drink through 2026.

title: Martín Berdugo 2014 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Earthy black-fruit aromas open this fully built crianza. A tannic palate with cutting lemony acidity gives this a ton of energy. Berry and cassis flavors are equaled by oaky vanilla and café-mocha notes, while a coconut flavor and heat come up on the finish. Drink through 2026.

title: Covila 2011 II Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Jammy blueberry and cassis aromas set up a fleshy flush palate that qualifies as jammy. This tastes of blackberry, plum, vanilla and coconut. On the finish, ripe fruit flavors are compact, forward and stowing energy to spare. Drink through 2040.

title: Díaz Bayo 2011 Francisco Díaz Bayo Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Raisin and prune aromas are components of the nose on this ripe Ribera del Duero that offers additional notes of fig and chocolate. A fleshy, thick palate deals earthy black-fruit, prune and spicy flavors prior to a chunky, chewy finish. Drink through 2024.

title: Balbas 2014 Ardal Crianza Vendimia Seleccionada  (Ribera del Duero)
description: This black-colored crianza delivers big, toasty aromas of charred oak, setting the stage for a massive palate, the equivalent of an 18-wheeler. Blackened flavors of burnt wood, coffee and berry fruit lead to a smacking tannic finish. Drink 2020–2025.

title: Bodegas Hidalgo La Gitana 2010 Alameda Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: This gran reserva from a lauded vintage opens with prune, roasted berry, tar and leafy notes, making it intriguing and complex but not entirely easy on the nose. An edgy, raw palate is snappy as it offers earthy, leafy berry, tea and spice flavors. Tension, earthy grit and leafy notes rise up on a raw finish. Drink through 2030.

title: Raventós I Blanc 2010 Manuel Raventós Negra Conca del Riu Anoia Sparkling (Penedès)
designation: Manuel Raventós Negra Conca del Riu Anoia
description: A mature, bready nose smells like a bakery. This blanc de noirs-style of sparkling wine is quite rich and yeasty on the palate, with dry, bready flavors of brioche and baked pear. On the finish, it becomes mildly nutty and yeasty, with a lasting sense of richness. Drink now.

title: Raventós I Blanc 2014 De La Finca Conca del Riu Anoia Sparkling (Penedès)
designation: De La Finca Conca del Riu Anoia
description: Raventós I Blanc is one of Spain's best producers of sparkling wines, although theirs are no longer classified as Cava. This has aromas of briny apple and yeasty vanilla setting up a stony palate with narrowing acidity. Flavors of lemon and orange peel are from the brut nature school. It feels chalky and citrusy on a lean, long finish.

title: Rioja Vega 2008 Gran Reserva Edición Limitada  (Rioja)
description: Aromas of cola, raisin and cassis are ripe and chunky. A sinewy palate displays raisiny flatness, while this is oaky tasting on the surface and more spicy, rubbery and fruity underneath. Flavors of tobacco and wood spice finish tight, with bright acidity keeping things lively.

title: Matarromera 2015 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Ripe berry aromas are balsamic and earthy, while this feels sappy, saucy and creamy at the same time. Savory black-fruit flavors are superripe and roasted, while this runs out of steam on the finish due to low acidity. Drink this heavyweight through 2027.

title: Viña Vilano 2014 Terra Incógnita  (Ribera del Duero)
description: A chocolaty, well-oaked nose with minerality and core cassis aromas is contradicted by a juicy palate with bright acidity and tension. Dry, salty flavors of berry and cassis are mildly toasted, while this wine is peppery and snappy on an acid-driven finish. The acid level on this wine suggests more aging; drink through 2032.

title: Bodegas Riojanas 2010 Monte Real Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Aromas of black fruits, integrated spices, licorice and tobacco are sturdy and almost heady. This feels layered, with structurally sound, slightly scraping tannins. Flavors of spicy cherry and cassis finish ripe, loamy and with a note of prune. Drink through 2020.

title: Bodegas y Viñedos Tábula 2013 Clave de Tábula  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Ripe berry aromas combined with oak, vanilla and coconut scents make for a full friendly nose. This feels choppy and abrasive. Woody flavors of coconut and black fruits finish full and tannic, which creates a raw blocky feel that time may tame. Drink through 2023.

title: Avancia 2016 Mencía (Valdeorras)
description: Minerally plum and blueberry aromas create a fine opening to this fleshy Mencía with popping acidity. Bold plum, wild berry and cassis flavors come with a hint of Valdeorras's patented schist, while this is steady, energetic and texturally appealing on a long finish. Drink through 2025.

title: Casa La Rad 2015 White (Rioja)
description: From the start, this oak-aged white blend is smooth and nicely knitted together, with peach, vanilla and tropical fruit aromas sticking out. A full-bodied palate is balanced by citrusy acidity, while this tastes explicitly of green apple and oak, with buttery notes rising up on the finish. Drink this elevated acid-driven mix of Chardonnay, Malvasia and Viura through 2025.

title: Montecillo 2012 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Familiar Rioja aromas of creamy oak, wood smoke, leather and earthy berry fruits are encouraging and lead to a solid palate with forgiving intensity. Blackberry, cassis and vanilla aromas are lasting on a finish that's reaching maturity. Drink through 2023.

title: Bodegas Landaluce 2014 Fincas de Landaluce Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Woodsy oak and olive aromas frame more standard cherry and berry scents. In the mouth, this is rubbery and scratchy due to hard tannins. Black plum and boysenberry flavors suggest coffee, while the finish on this is toasty and darker than what came before. Drink through 2024.

title: Elias Mora 2015  Toro
description: Savory, meaty berry aromas are unconventional and gamy more than bold, oaky and fruity. A plump round palate is full but not fat, while roasted meaty blackberry flavors finish toasty and snappy, with touches of heat and burn that should slip away with more time in bottle; drink through 2025.

title: Aspaldi 2016 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Pure black-fruit aromas include complex hints of lemon peel, graphite and oak spice. A saturated palate is grabby but not heavy, while this tastes of saucy berry and plum. A plump finish is chewy and fortified by rubbing tannins. This Crianza is another indicator of how good the 2016 vintage was in Rioja.

title: García Figuero 2015 Noble Tempranillo  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Ripe black fruit aromas are earthy and accented by cola, prune, licorice and tobacco. It is wiry and tight in feel, with flavors of vanilla and tobacco over a blackberry core. The finish brings a blazing streak of acidity. Drink through 2028.

title: Montecillo 2009 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Baked berry and cherry aromas are ripe and come with accents of mocha, leather and caramel. This feels full but not heavy, with balance and cushion to the palate. Spiced black-fruit flavors show a tea-like note, while this is dry, spicy and a touch chocolaty on the finish. Drink through 2026.

title: Maurodos 2014 San Román  (Toro)
description: This wine shows a heady, toasty nose of black-fruit aromas, along with maple, spice and heat notes. Spiced blackberry and cassis flavors are typical of this Tinta de Toro, however a palate that's rough as sandpaper makes this a tough go. Drink through 2025.

title: Val Sotillo 2011 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Savory black-olive aromas lend some funk to the nose of this tight pointy massively tannic Tempranillo. Flavors of olive, black fruits and chocolate finish with hard drying tannins and flavors of black coffee, additional chocolate and peppery spice. Drink from 2018–2030.

title: Artadi 2013 El Sequé Monastrell (Alicante)
description: Baked plum and blackberry aromas are accented by notes of dry herbs and desert rocks. Typically lush and plush, this Monastrell is also a bit soft. Flavors of blackberry, mixed spices, herbs and chocolate are savory and leathery on the finish, where a spot of mint leaf comes into play. Drink through 2022.

title: Viñas del Cenit 2013 Via Cenit Tempranillo (Tierra del Viños de Zamora)
description: Heavy oak gives this Tempranillo from Zamora an inky, resiny, charred set of aromas. Its muscular palate is softened somewhat by creamy oak. Woody mocha, blackberry, vanilla and spice flavors linger into the finish, feeling rich but also punchy and tannic. Drink through 2024.

title: Sierra Cantabria 2011 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Oak-rich aromas of maple, chocolate and vanilla rest on top of ripe berry scents. This is a medium-deep Rioja with bouncy tannins and lively acidity. Flavors of blackberry and cassis show a flowery hint of violet on a finish with depth and character. Drink through 2026.

title: Pere Ventura 2012 Gran Vintage Gran Reserva Brut Sparkling (Cava)
description: Yeasty, bready aromas of briny nectarine show early onset autolysis. This gran reserva brut is plump and round, but low on energy and bead. Flavors of dried papaya and melon include a note of brioche, while this is steady, bready, mature and ready on the finish. Drink now.

title: Bodegas Bilbainas 2013 Viña Pomal Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Cinnamon, clove and oak-spice aromas frame notes of berries and citrus peels on the nose. A full palate feels a touch oily and creamy, while this tastes of savory, lightly salted plum and berry fruits. The saltiness carries over to a well-formed finish. Drink through 2025.

title: Bodegas Faustino 2006 Faustino I Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Smooth, welcoming aromas of cola, black fruits and integrated oak are soft and indicate that this is ready to drink. A plump, sappy palate delivers ripe berry and chocolate flavors, while this is fleshy on a finish weighted down by berry pulp. Drink through 2021.

title: Covila 2013 II Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Cool earth and horsey aromas are part of a nose that also contains quality berry and plum notes. A healthy palate with form and finesse generates flavors of smoky berry and chocolaty oak. Oak spice and residual acidic energy push this to its finale. Drink through 2023.

title: Montecillo 2011 Edición Limitada  (Rioja)
description: Ripe aromas of cassis, raisin and vanilla lead this reserva toward a full-bodied palate with rubbing tannins. Spiced berry and prune are the lead flavors, while this holds on to its ripe profile on a finish with dried berry flavors suggestive of prune. Drink through 2022.

title: Bodegas Valdemar 2011 Conde Valdemar Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Baked blackberry and cassis aromas are ripe to the max and come with plenty of oak-driven vanilla. On the palate, this is plump but honest, with depth and give. Baked berry flavors are enriched by oaky vanilla and coffee notes, while this is smooth and steady on the finish. Drink through 2024.

title: Resalte 2012 Expresion  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Reflecting a warm, dry vintage, this wine smells ripe and balsamic, with notes of cheese blending with raw wood, cowhide, coconut and cassis aromas. A bipolar palate features creamy oak and lemony acidity. Deep berry-fruit flavors are pushed by perky acidity towards a finish with toast and chocolate notes. Drink from 2019–2030.

title: Sierra Cantabria 2008 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Earthy plum and berry aromas open this firm gran reserva from a cold vintage. This wine is chunky on the palate, with scraping tannins. Rooty, meaty berry and cinnamon flavors are slightly stewed, while this is long but hollow on the finish. Drink through 2026.

title: Viñedos de Paganos 2014 El Puntido  (Rioja)
description: A smooth, rich and malty nose includes notes of cola and blackberry. Initially this feels high in tartaric acidity, but it settles. Blackberry, cassis and coffee flavors are from the modern Rioja recipe book, while this feels a bit rough and tastes toasty on the finish. The 2014 vintage in Rioja was difficult, so credit El Puntido for coming through. Drink through 2024.

title: Muga 2011 Selección Especial  (Rioja)
description: Aromas of toasty oak, vanilla, black cherry, plum and spice hit the right notes. In the mouth, this is chewy, full bodied and loaded with resiny oak and cutting acidity. Baked loamy black-fruit and fig flavors reflect a warm dry vintage, while this tastes chocolaty and is packed to the brim on the finish. Drink from 2018–2028.

title: R. Lopez de Heredia 2004 Viña Tondonia Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Slightly damp, earthy and cool aromas introduce this traditional Rioja. In the mouth, pinchy tannins and tomatoey acidity pave the way for flavors of raisin, peppery spice and leafy herbs. A long steady finish is full of life. Drink now through 2030.

title: Merum Priorati 2013 Inici Red (Priorat)
description: This Garnacha-led blend starts out fiery and pointy, while foresty berry and oak aromas turn more gritty as it breathes. A tannic palate is tight as nails, while plum, currant and herbal flavors finish a bit raspy and tannic. Reflective of a cool vintage, this is just ripe enough. Drink through 2022.

title: Balbas 2014 Ritus  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Ripe berry aromas come with a fitting helping of toasty oak. On the tongue, this is tannic and resiny but not overly so. Flavors of blackberry, raisin, oak grain and vanilla dry up on a desiccated finish with mild oxidized notes. Drink through 2022.

title: Valserrano 2009 Gran Reserva White (Rioja)
description: After 23 months in barrel, this Viura-Malvasia blend shows a yellow color and dry resiny oak-based aromas along with apple in the backdrop. Round and slightly oily in texture, this tastes of salted nuts and baked apple on a woody base. Oaky salty flavors persist on the finish.

title: La Gitana 2014 Tradición H  (Rioja)
description: Leathery berry and animal aromas blend nicely into savory plum and berry scents to form a good nose. A tight, drawn-in palate is a bit hard, although there's no complaints with this Rioja's energy level. Saucy, slightly salty tomato and red plum flavors finish with earthy notes. This is a classic Rioja in every sense; drink through 2025.

title: Llopart 2012 Gran Reserva Panoramic Imperial Sparkling (Cava)
description: Apple and pear aromas are fairly fresh and bright, not bready or rich. A juicy but mature palate has vitality. Dry, lightly yeasty white fruit flavors are more competent than special or spectacular, while this well-made gran reserva is moderately complex on the finish.

title: Sonsierra 2012 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Dry berry, rose petal and leafy notes get this gran reserva going. In this youthful state, pulling acidity is making this raw on the palate. Currant, red plum and cranberry flavors loosen up on a steady finish. This is not a classic Rioja gran reserva; it's fresher and less complex than the classic recipe calls for; drink through 2022.

title: Bodegas Olarra 2011 Cerro Añon Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: This is a fully oaked gran reserva with gritty aromas of lemony wood resin, milk chocolate and tarry grit. A wide palate is more big than precise, while this tastes of gamy berry, oak spice and cardamom. A minty but light oak character on the finish suggests tobacco and complexity. Best from 2022 on.

title: Bodegas Tobía 2011 Óscar Tobía Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Aromas of rubber, pencil eraser, vanilla, wild berry and desert brush are true to Rioja. This gran reserva feels lush and packed, but the acidity seems a bit tartaric. Cassis, blackberry and chocolate flavors don't do much on a full but chunky finish. Drink through 2022.

title: Protos 2014 Selección Finca El Grajo Viejo  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Charred, toasty oak aromas lend a note of maple to the nose of this pulling, tannic, high-acid Tinto Fino. Lemony oak, plum, wild berry and savory, saucy flavors finish with scraping tannins. Drink this single-vineyard ball of power 2019–2030.

title: Heredad Graula 2012 Gran Reserva Tempranillo-Garnacha (Catalunya)
description: Ripe black-fruit aromas come with oak-driven hints of maple and malt, as well as a note of road tar. This blend of Tempranillo and Garnacha feels full, fleshy and pumped to the brim with fruit. Given that, it's not surprising that this tastes of jammy blackberry and black plum. Lastly, a fat finish is chewy and holds onto its balance. Drink now.

title: Uro 2011  Toro
description: Stewy aromas take time to show their best, which includes a floral note of violet to go with earthy baked blackberry. An abrupt palate revolves around choppy tannins. Flavors of soy and hoison sauce accompany stewed berry notes prior to a drying finish. Drink through 2025.

title: Benjamin de Rothschild & Vega Sicilia SA 2013 Macán Clásico  (Rioja)
winery: Benjamin de Rothschild & Vega Sicilia SA
description: Rubbery blackberry and peppery spice aromas lead to a palate with piercing acidity that might be perceived as shrill. Tangy red-plum flavors are so intense and shear that there's a citric element to this cool-vintage Rioja. On the finish, which is racy and choppy in feel, spice notes return. Drink through 2030.

title: Bodegas Olarra 2014 Laztana Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Earthy, savory aromas include notes of cured meat, dried leaves and red berries. A solid palate is grabby but in shape. Leafy, earthy flavors of roasted plum and berry fruits end with peppery spice notes and a lasting sense of dryness. Drink this by-the-book reserva through 2024.

title: Bodega Classica 2009 Hacienda Lopez de Haro Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
designation: Hacienda Lopez de Haro Gran Reserva
description: Earthy plum and cherry aromas are typical of Rioja gran reserva. A full, grabby palate is not silky-smooth, while this wine tastes of fig and chocolaty berry fruits that are on the cusp of cooked. It loses steam on a finish with raisiny notes. Drink through 2022.

title: Emilio Moro 2011 Clon de la Familia  (Ribera del Duero)
description: A concentrated, demanding nose of bacon and black fruits announces a saturated Tinto Fino that's linear in feel but missing layers of complexity and depth. Rich massive flavors of baked black fruits and chocolate finish with coffee, chocolate and blackened spice flavors. This is highly reflective of the hot and dry 2011 vintage; drink through 2024.

title: Ferrer Bobet 2013 Selecció Especial Vinyes Villes Carignan (Priorat)
description: Bright plum and berry aromas are topped with a spicy sauvage note. A tightly wound palate is blaring with acidity, making for an austere mouthfeel. Acid-driven flavors of tomato, red plum, currant and dry herbs finish sharp, with salty notes and acidic boost. Drink through 2030.

title: Baron De Ley 2015 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Earthy, spicy plum and red berry aromas are solid and in harmony. This reserva shows depth and balance along with ripe berry, cassis, chocolate and brown sugar flavors. On the finish, this is more subtle and smooth than loud. Drink through 2023.

title: Vega Clara 2016 Diez Almendros Degusta Secreto  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Broadly ripe blackberry aromas are embedded with smoky oak and dried-fruit notes of raisin and prune. A pulpy and hefty palate is more jammy than tightly focused, while this tastes of blackberry, dark plum and raisin prior to a finish with coffee and cocoa notes. Drink through 2024.

title: Alta Alella 2015 Laietà Gran Reserva Brut Nature Sparkling (Cava)
description: Apple, stony minerals and mild brine are notable components of a nice nose for brut nature. A medium-bodied palate has grip and size to it, while this tastes of orange and melon. White-pepper notes and a hint of spent yeast give the finish a boost—excellent for the Cava brut nature class.

title: Balbas 2009 Alitus Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)
description: A ripe nose is slathered in resiny oak smells, mostly of raisin and aged balsamic vinegar. A huge palate, with pounding tannins, is anything but smooth, while this monster red from a hot vintage tastes of mocha, tobacco, cassis and blackberry. Coffee and smoky notes dominate a long finish; drink through 2027.

title: Bodegas Fuentespina 2014 Selección Old Vines Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Initially this wine is charred and smoky-smelling, with accents of graphite and cola. A tight, juicy palate is bolstered by bold core acidity, while ripe blackberry and currant flavors capture both the black and red sides of the flavor spectrum. A dry, tannic finish with peppery flavors is intense. Drink through 2026.

title: Remelluri 2010 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: A compact bouquet with dense aromas of leafy berry fruits and compost is not entirely fresh and pure. On the palate, this is packed with pulpy fruit, but there's isn't much nuance. Short, stocky berry, plum and spice flavors finish fleshy but a touch leafy and abrasive. Drink through 2028.

title: Muga 2014 Torre Muga  (Rioja)
description: Savory berry aromas include a lot of oak and graphite along with exotic hints. Hailing from a vintage marked by a rainy harvest, this isn't bright or fruity at any check point. Blackberry, cassis and licorice flavors are short on a blocky finish tasting of mint, cardamom and oak. Drink through 2024.

title: Portal del Priorat 2015 Tros de Clos Carignan (Priorat)
description: Earthy blackberry aromas include a gaseous note as well as hints of black olive and spice cake. While big as an ox, this varietal Carignan is also bumpy and incongruous on the palate. Sappy black-plum and berry flavors include vanilla and lemony oak notes in front of a drawing finish with savory tobacco accents. Drink this warm-vintage Priorat red through 2022.

title: El Centimo 2010 Real Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Fresh plum, tomato and spice aromas are integrated. On the palate, this wine is ripe and saturated but not heavy. Generous flavors of caramel, vanilla, plum and berry fruits are smooth and chocolaty across the finish. Drink now through 2020.

title: Sonsierra 2010 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Earthy aromas of olive, tobacco, prune and oak set up a palate with drawing tannins. This tastes of coffee, mocha and earthy mixed berries. The finish is meaty in texture, with compatible oak spice and berry-fruit notes.

title: Cellers Unió 2012 Roureda Llicorella Anyada Clássic Red (Priorat)
description: Schisty aromas of licorice and blackberry are touched up by a shot of cedary oak. This feels juicy and not that heavy or compact on the palate. Reedy, spicy plum and blackberry flavors come with lemony oak notes. This is toasty and spicy on the finish, with a spot of licorice. Drink through 2022.

title: Cepa 21 2014  Ribera del Duero
description: Black-fruit aromas are made more complex by notes of leather and oak. This is full, blocky and tannic on the palate, with dark-fruit flavors of black plum and blackberry touched up by oak. A woody but long finish suggests that this will find its prime in a couple of years; drink through 2024.

title: Maurodos 2015 Prima  (Toro)
description: Ripe black-fruit aromas blend with notes of sandalwood, turned earth and graham cracker to form a complex and inviting nose. A dry tight tannic palate is proper and drumming, while this Toro tastes of blackberry and wood spice prior to a focused but dry and tannic finish. Drink through 2024.

title: Celler Pasanau 2014 Los Torrents Red (Priorat)
description: Ripe, inviting aromas of black cherry and cassis rank as precise. In the mouth, this is racy to the point of being wiry, with abundant intensity. Live-wire plum and berry flavors are the definition of high energy, while spice and complexities are trying to settle on a still-young finish. Drink from 2020–2030.

title: Hidalgo 2016 Generación Ocho  (Ribera del Duero)
description: The first Hidalgo wine from Ribera del Duero that we've come across is concentrated, tannic, grinding and packed with fruit. Aromas of blackberry, maple and cassis are heady, while the palate on this young Tinto Fino is raw and rough. Blackberry, chocolate and woody flavors settle with gusto and some sophistication; best from 2022–2035.

title: Emilio Moro 2015 Malleolus  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Ripe smoky aromas are oaky and full, with rooty sweetness and some heat. High acidity creates core intensity, and overall this feels more punchy and acidic than in prior years. Woody spicy peppery flavors of plum and currant finish fresh and ripped, with residual oak, spice, herb and plum flavors. Drink through 2028.

title: Valdelacierva 2014 Reserva Edición Limitada  (Rioja)
description: An intense mix of graphite, asphalt, tobacco and blackberry aromas is ripe but positive, while this feels more gritty and narrow than elegant. Baked black-fruit flavors are bolstered by chocolate and coconut notes, while this is peppery but also pruney on a bold finish. Drink through 2023.

title: Bodegas Tobía 2015 Óscar Tobía Reserva  (Rioja)
description: A dark, smoky, charred nose is chocolaty and dense, with black-fruit notes but also a hint of chimney. A tight palate is pulling and tannic, while blackberry flavors come with notes of black coffee, chocolate and burnt toast. A narrow tannic finish suggests that this Reserva should improve over time; drink through 2030.

title: Adegas Gran Vinum 2017 Esencia Diviña Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Orange and blanched almond aromas are light and lucid on the nose. This is citrusy and ripe on the palate but not heavy. Citrus and melon flavors are a touch leesy, while this is steady and well-balanced fresh, rounded finish.

title: Familia Chávarri 2009 Izarbe Reserva Vendimia Seleccionada  (Rioja)
description: Blocky prune and blackberry aromas are not exactly lively, while this feels dense and concentrated, a reflection of the hot year that was 2009. Buttery black-fruit and cocoa flavors are rich in tandem, while this is lush, creamy and ripe all the way through the finish.

title: Quinta da Muradella 2012 Gorvia Doña Blanca (Monterrei)
description: This is a mature, oxidized style of wine made from the local Doña Blanca grape; look for a mix of Galician minerality, Jura-like flavors and Sherry complexity. Aromas of resiny oak, roast corn and hay are dry, leading to a grabby palate, with a grape-skin texture. Woody, buttery dried apple flavors finish full and long, with popcorn notes and the essence of controlled oxidation. By no means is this for everyone, but it's well made and has its virtues. Drink now through 2023.

title: San Román Bodegas y Viñedos 2016 Prima  (Toro)
description: Bold black-fruit aromas include a very ripe note of prune. Typical of wines from San Román in Toro, this is a tannic number but within reason. Savory oak pushes a bacony flavor onto blackberry fruit, while this is meaty and spicy on the finish, sort of like beef jerky. Drink this strong boy through 2026.

title: Ankal 2013 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Oaky aromas of maple, blackberry and chimney grit set up a raw tannic palate. This tastes toasty and oaky, but with enough black-fruit flavor to support all that wood. Mild herb and spice flavors mix with tea and berry notes on the finish of this off-vintage Tempranillo. Drink through 2022.

title: Lealtanza 2012 Reserva Selección de Familia  (Rioja)
description: Warm malty aromas of maple and ripe berry fruits turn woody with airing. Reflective of a hot but very good vintage, this settles quickly on the palate and is never overly lively. Spiced plum, berry fruit and chocolate flavors finish with mild oak spice on an easy finish. Drink through 2023.

title: Mas d'en Gil 2010 Coma Vella Red (Priorat)
description: Gritty, spicy, schisty berry aromas are composed, while this Garnacha-led blend feels saturated and layered. Spicy plum, herbal notes and black pepper make up the flavor profile, while this is strapping, peppery tasting and complex on the finish. Drink through 2022.

title: Portal del Montsant 2011 Brunus Red (Montsant)
description: Aromas of wild herbs, dry brush, rubber, oak and berry fruits come prior to a pointed palate with high acidity and choppy tannins. Flavors of creamy oak support racier currant and red-plum notes, while this Carignan-Garnacha-Syrah blend tastes oaky, spicy and thorough on the finish. Drink through 2021.

title: Enate 2011 Merlot (Somontano)
description: Cedary plum and berry aromas are savory and ripe, but not overt. This feels layered and almost lush, with grabby tannins. Flavors of blackberry, baking spices, cocoa and mocha finish chewy, chocolaty and long. This is a serious Merlot to drink through 2019.

title: Elias Mora 2014 Crianza  (Toro)
description: Deep black-fruit aromas are a touch murky and raisiny, with accents of mocha and chocolate. The palate on this Crianza is raw and shocked by tartaric acidity, so this isn't a smooth and easy ride. Blackberry and prune flavors finish hard and lemony, with unabsorbed oak and tannins. Drink through 2025.

title: Viñedos de Paganos 2012 El Puntido  (Rioja)
description: Richly oaked aromas of burnt wood, caramel and sawmill compete with jammy blackberry and cassis notes. A rugged, drawing palate is fiercely tannic and dry. Blackberry, burnt oak and coffee flavors dry out quickly on the finish, leaving simmering toasty mint. Drink through 2025.

title: Finca Río Negro 2014 Cogolludo Guadalajara Red (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Racy red berry aromas bring a welcome herbal note along with kick. Packed with fruit on the palate, this blend of Tempranillo, Syrah, Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon tastes toasty and full, with blackberry and fudge flavors. Things stay dark and toasty on the finish. Drink through 2026.

title: Tionio 2014 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Aromas of ripe berries and smoke meld with a hint of Band-Aid on the nose. The palate of this reserva is narrow, condensed and fairly hard. Typical regional flavors of mixed black fruits are at full ripeness, while this is muscular and concentrated on a finish that hints at syrup. Drink through 2027.

title: Suertes del Marqués 2015 7 Fuentes Red (Valle de la Orotava)
description: This blend of Tintilla and Listán Negro opens with savory aromas of latex, plum and cherry dusted with minerals. The palate is full but racy. Flavors of plum and cranberry show spice and mineral notes before a long, peppery finish. Overall, this is bright, floral and interesting. Drink now.

title: Paixar 2015 Mencía (Bierzo)
description: Grapy aromas of cassis and blackberry are fairly foxy, with a whiff of wet animal fur. An intense palate is held together by firm, rubbery tannins. Black cherry and dark-plum flavors are lasting on a finish that's ripped with intensity. Best from 2019–2024.

title: Valserrano 2011 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Coarse aromas of tree bark and tobacco are smoothed out by vanilla and dried cherry and plum notes. This is structured and firm on the palate, with fairly hard edges. Chocolaty oak flavors lead secondary spiced berry and tobacco notes, while this tastes oaky in a familiar Rioja way on the finish. Drink through 2028.

title: Vega Sicilia 2013 Valbuena 5°  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Exotic aromas of blueberry along with Middle Eastern spice notes set this apart from the Ribera del Duero pack. A wide, pulpy palate is smacking, while short, oaky flavors of stewed plum and beef bouillon are meaty and again, different than most wines from the area. Finally, a finish with oxidized notes suggests that you drink this sooner rather than later.

title: Gramona 2005 Celler Batlle Gran Reserva Brut Sparkling (Cava)
description: Chiseled aromas of mineral, oyster shell, tangerine peel and lemon-lime are a fine lead into a mouthfilling palate with modest textural complexity. Yeasty flavors of white stone fruits are mature and nutty, while this top-end Cava is smooth on the finish. Drink through 2022.

title: Llopart 2011 Leopardi Gran Reserva Brut Nature Sparkling (Cava)
description: Yeasty sourdough aromas are fresh and mature at the same time. A full palate with integrated acidity offers fine balance, while this brut nature mixes a white peach flavor with a mild astringent note prior to a finish that's dry, steady and airy. Drink through 2021.

title: Marqués del Puerto 2014 Bentus  (Rioja)
description: This wine's ripe berry aromas are accompanied by creamy oak, pepper and licorice notes. It feels choppy yet built to last, with spicy, lightly herbal berry and plum flavors and an abrasive but fresh finish, suggesting it will not suffer from further aging. Drink through 2024.

title: Alto Moncayo 2015 Veraton Garnacha (Campo de Borja)
description: Aromas of olive and earthy berry fruits battle for air against heavy oak that smells chocolaty. A thick, blocky palate is tannic and intense, while flavors of brawny black plum and wild berries are backed by oaky chocolate and peppercorn notes. A blackened finish has a grape skins feel and is seared by spice. Drink through 2030.

title: Portal del Priorat 2016 Clos del Portal Negre de Negres Red (Priorat)
designation: Clos del Portal Negre de Negres
description: Cool black fruit aromas include notes of violet and cola on a well-integrated nose. A firm palate is stacked in layers, while this blend of Garnacha, Carignan and Syrah tastes of bold black plum and wild blackberry. A mildly toasty finish is kissed with chocolaty oak, making for a classy finale. Drink through 2024.

title: Val do Sosego 2016 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Tight citrus peel and peach aromas show a leesy side on the nose. This excellent rendition of Albariño feels round and juicy, but not sharp. Pleasing peach and melon flavors dry out and suggest white pepper on the finish.

title: Valenciso 2010 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Notes of earthy, clove and all spice carry the nose. This is full, juicy and popping on the palate. Flavors of raspberry, mixed spices and exotic tea finish with red-berry leftovers and even more spice notes. Drink through 2028.

title: Montebaco 2014 Alma de Vino Old Vine Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
designation: Alma de Vino Old Vine Crianza
description: Nicely spiced dark-fruit aromas of plum and blackberry are steady and stout. On the palate, this is tight and rough, with scratchy tannins that really dig in. Blackberry, spicy oak and prune flavors wrap up on a drying, texturally abrasive finish.

title: Cuerno 2015 Expresion  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Poking, prodding aromas of black plum, cherry and blackberry lead to pumped-up palate with power and hard tannins. Dark, spicy black fruit flavors are aided by peppery oak and a note of clove, while this is firm as a boulder on a spicy finish. Serve with hearty food to tame the tannins, or wait several more years to drink.

title: Raventós I Blanc 2013 Textures de Pedra Conca del Riu Anoia Sparkling (Penedès)
designation: Textures de Pedra Conca del Riu Anoia
description: There's a light pink color to this airy sparkler along with fresh aromas of celery and rose water. A clean, tangy palate is well balanced and fresh, offering flavors of pink grapefruit, nectarine and citrus peel. A steady, long finish closes out this high-quality vintage bubbly.

title: Casado Morales 2011 EME Monovarietal Alavesa  (Rioja)
description: Black-fruit aromas include oaky notes of baking spices and vanilla. This Graciano is full in body, with bounce and depth. Dark-fruit flavors include chocolate and spice notes, while this is toasty and oaky but also racy and juicy on the finish. Drink through 2026.

title: CVNE 2015 Imperial Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Savory oak and spicy foresty berry aromas are a touch gritty. A grabby palate with controlled astringency tastes of salty, lightly stalky plum and raspberry, along with vanilla. Earthy berry and oak flavors dominate a finish with tannic rub. Drink through 2035.

title: Los Frailes 2014 G-11 Cabernet Sauvignon (Valencia)
description: Prune and spice-cake aromas suggest a richly roasted wine. A massive palate with saturated weight and density delivers blackberry, chocolaty oak and pepper flavors in front of a finish that's a bit fiery. Drink this power-packed Valencian Cabernet through 2022.

title: Legón 2014 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Spicy black plum and wild berry aromas are not overly ripe or rich. Following that lead, this feels chippy and tight on the palate, with drying tannins. Flavors of roasted plum, hard spices and toasty oak finish with additional woody notes. Drink through 2027.

title: Numanthia 2014 Termes  (Toro)
description: This wine's black fruit aromas come with road tar, leather and raisin notes. It's intensely tannic, with ripe, savory berry and cassis flavors and integrated oak. Chocolate and baked black fruit notes last on the strong, tannic finish. Drink through 2025.

title: Elias Mora 2015 Descarte  (Toro)
description: An intense nose is blasting with foresty, cool power and depth. On the palate, this is stacked with fruit and backed by seriously fierce and rough tannins. Savory flavors of soy and spice lead meaty berry fruit to a finish that is rock hard and in step for a bruising red such as this. Drink through 2030.

title: Raventós I Blanc 2015 De La Finca Conca del Riu Anoia Sparkling (Penedès)
designation: De La Finca Conca del Riu Anoia
description: Yeasty aromas include fruit-based scents of peach and melon. This has a full and plump mouthfeel with some citrusy acidity to keep things fresh. Mild citrus and papaya flavors are mellow and don't overpower, while this is steady on a dry finish without any additional flavor notes.

title: Venta del Puerto 2011 No. 18 Vendimia Seleccionada Red (Valencia)
description: This blend of Syrah, Tempranillo, Cab Sauvignon and Merlot shows the upside potential of Valencia, one of Spain's low-profile regions. A nice mix of vanilla, root beer, spice, plum and chocolate aromas reflect 18 months in oak. With full stout tannins and deep ripe flavors of plum, cassis, tobacco and chocolate, this barrel-influenced middleweight should age nicely through 2022.

title: Rioja Vega 2014 Edición Limitada  (Rioja)
description: Ripe red-fruit aromas are slightly candied and include notes of brick dust and baking spices. On the palate, this is lively and in good health. Savory, lightly roasted plum and currant flavors finish steady, with freshness, residual red-fruit flavors and finally some noticeable oak. Drink through 2021.

title: La Gitana 2015 Cuerno  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Bulky berry aromas at first smell a bit green and grassy, but then burnt campfire wood takes over the nose. A wide palate feels grabby and strong, while this tastes of charred oak, bacon, plum and brandied cherry. A finish with cinnamon and baking spice flavors is tannic and choppy. Drink through 2026.

title: Morlanda 2010 Vi de Guarda Red (Priorat)
description: Ripe earthy aromas of licorice, vanilla, cola and raisin set up a jammy pulpy palate with plenty of cushion. This is 50% Garnacha and 50% Carignan with flavors of plum, raisin and prune that are fully ripe, while ending notes of licorice and fleshy berry fruits run long and steady. Drink through 2020.

title: Perelada 2012 Finca La Garriga Carignan (Empordà)
description: All of Perelada's wines are made in a flush bullish ripe style, and this varietal Samsó, which is the name for Carignan in Catalan, is particularly intense, smoky and earthy on the nose. On the palate, it's juicy and ripe, with plum, berry and overt oaky flavors. A chunky finish deals cassis and prune flavors. Drink through 2025.

title: Sierra Cantabria 2012 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Earthy plum and berry aromas precede a racy, high-acid palate that's fresh and sharp. Snappy red plum and wild berry flavors finish tannic, with oak spice and mild chocolate notes. This is a power-packed wine that will last a long time; drink through 2028.

title: Muga 2013 Casa Conde de Haro Metodo Tradicional Brut Sparkling (Cava)
designation: Casa Conde de Haro Metodo Tradicional Brut
description: Brioche and buttered bread aromas lead the way on the nose. Malic acidity creates textural freshness, while yeasty flavors of green apple finish on an underripe nectarine note. Drink through 2020.

title: Finca Constancia 2014 Altos de la Finca Red (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Floral-based aromas of violet and blueberry announce this blend of Cabernet Sauvignon and Petit Verdot that also smells of hickory and campfire. A choppy, drawn-in palate is herbal and savory, with blatant oak accenting earthy berry flavors. A roasted finish with hard tannins calls for more aging or decanting. Drink through 2023.

title: Comando-G 2014 Las Umbrías Rozas de Puerto Real Garnacha (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
designation: Las Umbrías Rozas de Puerto Real
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León
description: Dry earthy aromas suggest rubber and sea shells along with mild red-fruit scents. This Garnacha from vineyards planted at 3,300 feet feels tight and rubbery. Savory, meaty plum and berry flavors are complex, finishing long and dry on a strong accent of woodspice. Drink now.

title: Bodegas Tobía 2016 Viñedos de Altura  (Rioja)
description: This is the definition of a young ripe bomber with big berry aromas and floral notes. Hardness on the palate makes this a tough hill to conquer now—fierce tannins are unforgiving. Toasty blackberry and coffee flavors are gritty on a long finish with lasting blackness. Drink from 2019–2030.

title: Bodegas Valdemar 2010 Conde Valdemar Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Soupy raisiny aromas announce a fully ripe, almost overripe gran reserva with a round, dense mouthfeel. Baked flavors of ultraripe berry fruits are matched by savory notes of black olive. On the finish, there's mostly coffee and toast flavors and not much acidity or tannic grip. Drink through 2022.

title: Agustí Torelló Mata 2011 Gran Reserva Brut Sparkling (Cava)
description: Bready apple and spice aromas are layered, mildly complex and appealing. In the mouth, this is dry, leesy and tastes of toasted apple and nectarine. The finish hits the spot with proper weight, balance and lively acidity. Excellence in Cava may be fleeting, but this makes the grade.

title: Marqués de la Concordia 2012 Federico Paternina  (Rioja)
description: Edgy berry aromas include notes of pencil lead and woody oak. The crisp bouncy acidic palate emphasizes freshness over weight. Plum, currant and oak-based flavors are spicy and snappy, while this maintains a spicy character on a dry finish. Drink through 2024.

title: Vivanco 2010 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Spicy saucy red-berry aromas announce a flush palate that's more balanced than outright bullish. Flavors of wild berry, nutmeg, vanilla and chocolate finish lively, with good weight. Drink this delicious Reserva through 2019.

title: Eguren Ugarte 2014 Martin Cendoya Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Vanilla, spice, cherry, plum and lemony oak aromas are lusty and full. In the mouth, this off-vintage wine is raw and clamps down with biting tannins. Baked plum, chocolate and charred flavors finish with an oak character on top of a dried plum and cherry base.

title: Pittacum 2012 La Prohibición Garnacha Tintorera (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León
description: An opaque black color and gritty aromas of toast and tar announce a dense, saturated, warm-vintage Garnacha Tintorera that's pumping with herbal blackberry notes. A pinching, tannic finish is a bit abrasive, while this tastes of peppery black fruits, while the savory, oaky finish with stewed, gamy notes is intense. Drink through 2020.

title: Legaris 2011 Calmo  (Ribera del Duero)
description: A dark, smoky nose with Bourbon barrel richness and concentrated black fruit aromas leads to a strict palate that's tight as nuts and bolts. A dark, smoky flavor profile is driven by toasty oak, while dark chocolate comes in on the finish. Drink through 2027.

title: Bodegas Olarra 2015 Summa Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Black-plum and cassis aromas include an exotic spice note akin to cardamom. In the mouth, this is smacking and dense. Baked black-fruit flavors include notes of black coffee, cocoa and burnt toast. On the finish, this stays chocolaty in flavor and comfortable in feel. Drink through 2026.

title: Bodegas Riojanas 2015 Viña Albina Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Slightly desiccated aromas of prune soften toasty dark-fruit scents. This Reserva from a warm vintage is tight and braced by red-fruit acidity. Plum and raspberry flavors are spicy like a fine Rioja should be, while this finishes with integration and a firm texture. Drink through 2025.

title: Bodegas Tobía 2016 Alma Tobía Blanco Fermentado en Barrica White (Rioja)
designation: Alma Tobía Blanco Fermentado en Barrica
description: Oak and more oak is the greeting on this not so subtle barrel-fermented white Rioja. A full palate is lively under a resiny surface, with kicking acidity. A peppery spice flavor tops apple and stone fruit notes, while this is long, toasty, creamy and intense on the finish. Drink through 2030.

title: Viña Otano 2016 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Nicely presented plum and cherry aromas come with touches of malt, molasses and oak. A fresh and balanced palate is lively and fairly generous, while this tastes of berry, plum, light oak and earth notes. Spice and vanilla flavors carry a steady finish.

title: Vinos de Arganza 2015 Viña Século Mencía (Bierzo)
description: This Mencía smells more ripe than fresh, with aromas of prune, raisin and spice cake. A jammy palate is a touch overweight, while mocha, spice, raisin and cassis flavors finish rich and chocolaty. Drink now for its ripe friendliness.

title: Bodegas Olarra 2016 Cerro Añon Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Blackberry and plum aromas are steady and composed, while this is deep but choppy and a bit tough on the palate. Plum, currant and spice aromas form a serious set of flavors, while this tastes of spiced raspberry and rhubarb on a tight finish. Drink this Tempranillo blend through 2025.

title: Bodegas Olarra 2015 Era Costana Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Aromas of cherry, vanilla, oak grain and spice are straight from the Rioja recipe book. A tight, pulling palate is healthy yet tannic, while this tastes of plum, cherry, vanilla and cocoa prior to finishing with red-plum, mocha and savory notes. Drink through 2026.

title: Bodega Carmen Rodríguez 2015 Carodorum Crianza  (Toro)
description: Blackberry-jam aromas are full, flush and lush, but not what you'd call complex. A choppy lively palate with bruising tannins isn't shocking for Toro, while this tastes of ripe black fruits, mocha and chocolate. Despite having massive tannins, this Crianza finishes just smooth enough. Drink through 2024.

title: Olivier Rivière 2015 Gabaxo  (Rioja)
description: Spiced plum and cherry aromas get this live-wire Rioja going. A clawing palate with rubbery tannins needs time to settle. Toasty flavors of black fruits and oak finish with a rubbery texture due to drying tannins. Give this more time; drink from 2018–2028.

title: Bodega Carmen Rodríguez 2015 Carodorum Issos Crianza  (Toro)
description: Leathery berry aromas include exotic notes that stir interest. This feels choppy but also lively and balanced. Cassis, blackberry and plum flavors finish steady. With plenty of ripeness and depth, this manages to show complexity along with elegance. Drink through 2020.

title: Cellers Baronia del Montsant 2010 Clos d'Englora AV15 Red (Montsant)
description: Rich aromas of coffee, mocha, tobacco and formerly ripe but now dried berry fruits are highly appealing and shout quality. A rushing palate is full of acidity and unresolved tannins, while vanilla notes soften core cherry and plum flavors. A racy, amped finish suggests that this still has some years to go; drink through 2022.

title: CVNE 2015 Real de Asúa  (Rioja)
description: This wine's black fruit aromas are smoky with chocolaty oak and animal notes. On the palate, severe, citrusy acidity narrows down its savory plum, wood and lemon flavors. With so much youthful oak and acidity, it's wiry and angular now. Drink from 2020.

title: Licenciado 2013 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Initial oak-driven aromas of grilled and smoked meats don't allow for much fruit expression on the nose. A jammy, plush palate is solid but not too hard or tannic. Spicy, toasty flavors of plum, raisin and licorice expire with mild heat and burn on the finish. Drink through 2032.

title: Astrales 2015  Ribera del Duero
description: Roasted blackened aromas of berry fruits and black currant are a touch rough and could use more time to settle. A crisp snappy palate is intense, angular and showing grainy hard tannins. Spicy woody flavors of clove and campfire are intermixed with plum and berry fruit, while this feels lively, acidic and a bit fiery on the finish. Drink through 2030.

title: Godelia 2012 Mencía (Bierzo)
description: Potent earthy cherry and animal aromas are neither too pushy nor overbearing. This is quite full and concentrated, with a ripe-fruit mix of black plum, blackberry and chocolate flavors. Chocolaty oak is even more out front on a deep finish. Drink through 2024.

title: Balbas 2009 Ardal Gran Reserva Selección Especial  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Baked raisiny aromas of spice cake are almost overdone. Like many 2009 RDDs, this is huge, tannic and massive as a whole. A woody flavor profile includes earthy jammy berry fruit, while this is heavy with campfire notes on the finish. This is 80% Tempranillo and 20% Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink through 2023.

title: Bodegas Fariña 2011 Gran Dama de Toro  (Toro)
description: This massive heavily oaked blend of 94% Tinta de Toro and 6% Garnacha smells like a cross between café mocha and a sawmill, with baking spices thrown in for good measure. The palate is rough and tannic, while oaky flavors of clove dominate blackberry fruit. On the finish, more clove is apparent, while the tannic clamp is severe. Drink through 2024.

title: Alta Alella 2012 Privat Opus Evolutium Gran Reserva Brut Nature Sparkling (Cava)
designation: Privat Opus Evolutium Gran Reserva Brut Nature
description: Lime and mineral aromas drive the nose on this fairly full-bodied brut nature from a warm vintage. On the palate, this is balanced, with bubbles absorbed into the wine's fabric. Up-front salty notes are backed by briny apple, nectarine and yeasty flavors, while this is sophisticated and fairly complex on the finish.

title: Agustí Torelló Mata 2013 Reserva Brut Rosé Trepat (Cava)
description: Dry yeasty aromas control the nose on this moderately sophisticated rosé that's made entirely from Trepat. In the mouth, this is solid but not thick. Dry peach and nectarine flavors are clean and finish with just enough girth to chew on.

title: Val Sotillo 2014 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Despite the fact that 2014 was a problematic vintage in Ribera del Duero, this crianza is showing the right stuff. Earthy black fruit aromas push up against stewy, while this feels flush, with grabby tannins. Savory black plum and blackberry flavors are mildly oaky, while firm tannins frame finishing baked black fruit and oak spice flavors.

title: CVNE 2015 Viña Real Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Earthy berry and plum aromas come with patented Rioja side notes of vanilla and tobacco, while this reserva from a warm but top-notch vintage feels dry and slightly choppy. Roasted, gamy plum and berry flavors show some buttery oak, peppery notes and a leafy accent in front of a meaty finish touched up by lemony hints. Best from 2020–2024.

title: Marqués de Murrieta 2014 Capellanía Viura (Rioja)
description: A lucid light gold color suggests elegance, as does a pure nose controlled by lemon aromas and oak grain. In the mouth, this Viura is lemony, acidic and elegant. Resiny oak leads tart apple and vanilla flavors to a woody, smoky finish, while integral citric acidity ensures that this will age well through 2028.

title: Vega Clara 2015 Diez Almendros Degusta Secreto  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Warm, slightly cheesy aromas give way to earthy black-fruit notes with baked overtones. This feels tight and firm, with healthy tannins. Black-plum and blackberry flavors are replaced by toasty blackness on the finish. Drink through 2025.

title: Remírez de Ganuza 2008 Reserva Old Vines Unfiltered  (Rioja)
description: A mix of earthy berry, cassis and leather aromas sets up a grabby, rubbery palate that isn't very lush or cushioned. Flavors of roast plum, savory spice, olive and tobacco are more earthy than ripe, staying steady on a savory, roasted-tasting finish. Drink through 2022.

title: Remírez de Ganuza 2008 Viña Coqueta  (Rioja)
description: Richly oaked aromas of maple and mocha accent earthy, rubbery berry scents. This is muscled-up and edgy on the palate, with flavors of tobacco, mocha, plum and berry fruits. A grabby, slightly collapsed finish contains earthy, savory flavor remnants. Drink through 2020.

title: Marqués de Cáceres 2013 Reserva Especial Edición Limitada  (Rioja)
description: Aromas of prune, cassis and marzipan are surprisingly rich for this cold and difficult vintage in Rioja. It's full bodied and tannic, with plum, blackberry and prune flavors. Dark berry and meat notes mark the finish.

title: Marqués de la Concordia 2010 HZ Abascal Vineyard  (Ribera del Duero)
description: This wine's earthy, mature plum, currant and raspberry aromas are spicy and defined. The mouthfeel is marked by drawing tannins and citrusy acidity. Bold flavors of currant, red plum and cherry emerge alongside a cocoa note. Drink now–2032.

title: Bodegas Franco-Españolas 2011 Excelso  (Rioja)
description: Earthy, leafy plum and savory aromas open this vibrant, traditional Rioja with a flush but subtle palate. Its plum, blackberry and tea flavors are steady and spicy. Drink through 2023.

title: Clunia 2014 Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León
description: Baked berry aromas come with notes of dry spices and sandalwood. A chunky palate is a touch flat and overweight, but not outright flabby or fat. Berry, black-plum and savory baked flavors finish flush and long, with chewy tannins. Drink through 2024.

title: Casa Castillo 2013 Las Gravas Red (Jumilla)
description: This Monastrell-led blend smells like a pot of baked beans. A compact body is solid in the center but scratchy on the edges. Toasty, briary black-fruit flavors are herbal, and the wine tastes peppery and like tomato and oregano on the finish. Drink through 2021.

title: Pago de los Abuelos 2018 Viñas Centenarias Godello (Bierzo)
description: Aromas of melon and apple lead to a plump, fleshy feel in this rich Godello. Creamy pear chimes in on the palate alongside schist and honey.

title: Bracamonte 2011 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Gritty aromas of road tar share space on the nose with black cherry and dark plum scents. This feels hard and abrasive, even by Ribera del Duero standards. Plum, berry and integrated oak flavors finish savory and with a lasting note of dry oak. Drink through 2023.

title: Ramirez de la Piscina 2010 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Heavily roasted aromas of gamy berry fruits, herbs and coconutty oak settle on charred. This wine is bulky and a touch stewed and soupy in feel. Oaky flavors of chocolate, baked berry and cassis end with chocolaty oak on a finish that's heavy and lacking in verve. Drink through 2024.

title: Pazo San Mauro 2018 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: A blend of mineral, apple and pear aromas amounts to a clean whole that presents this in a good light. A lemony palate blazes with citric acidity, while flavors of white pineapple and orange don't falter on the finish. If you want a textbook-defined Albariño, this is it.

title: Gratavinum 2010 GV5 Red (Priorat)
description: Schisty berry aromas are very ripe and bit reduced, with a sense of cooked and raisiny fruit. A tannic palate is gritty and powerful. Warm, baked flavors of blackberry and cassis finish with hard tannins and oaky notes of coffee and toast along with Priorat's patented schist.

title: Bodegas Perica 2005 Viña Olagosa Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Leathery oaky berry aromas are a touch gritty. Grabby tannins and blazing acidity make for a dry scratchy mouthfeel. Flavors of red plum, tomato and spiced berry fruits finish with notes of black pepper, cocoa, tree bark and coffee. Drink now through 2026.

title: As Laxas 2016 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Light in color and mellow on the nose, with leesy notes, this always-reliable Albariño is fresh and kicking with acidity. Apple and peach flavors carry over to a plump finish with lasting stone-fruit and melon notes.

title: Val de Los Frailes 2015 Prestigio Tempranillo (Cigales)
description: Aromas of baking spices, vanilla, dill and toast are more out front than fruit, with oaky graphite in the background. A pulling palate is immediately tannic and resiny. Woody barrel-driven black-fruit flavors are savory, while residual oak is the lead ingredient on the finish. Drink through 2025.

title: Muga 2015 Conde de Haro Brut Sparkling (Cava)
description: Lime, melon and brioche aromas send this Cava from Rioja in the right direction. A zesty palate braced by citric acidity is juicy and displays ample energy. Snappy lemon, citrus and green-apple flavors finish crisp, with tension and focus.

title: Marqués de Murrieta 2015 Finca Ygay Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Soft, earthy berry and plum aromas are full and ripe but short on the complexity that this is capable of showing. A medium-full palate is in good shape, while dark plum, berry and raisin flavors are confirmed on a steady, ripe and fruit-driven finish.

title: Pago Casa Gran 2016 Falcata Casa Gran Red (Valencia)
description: A dense purple color and deep black-fruit aromas signal a quality blend of Garnacha Tintorera and Monastrell. A saturated palate shows grip and tannins, while this tastes of blackberry, with a savory backing. Toast and chocolate flavors on the finish avoid tasting fake or candied.

title: Marqués de Cáceres 2014 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Ripe berry aromas are suggestive of raisin, baked plum and pastry. In the mouth, this Crianza is chewy and solid, but not too heavy. Plum, raspberry and wood-spice flavors are lasting and steady across the finish. Drink through 2022.

title: Cuna de Reyes 2009 Edición Limitada  (Rioja)
description: Oak-based milk chocolate is the dominant aroma on this earthy, creamy Tempranillo from a warm vintage. A full-bodied and syrupy mouthfeel has cutting tannins but not a lot of acidity. Flavors of mocha, tobacco and chocolate sit atop black plum and berry fruit, while this is slightly soupy feeling on the finish. Drink through 2025.

title: Mas d'en Gil 2013 Coma Vella Red (Priorat)
description: Aromas of raisiny berry fruits and barnyard lead to a full palate with lushness and grabby tannins. Earthy flavors of black fruits and spice amount to a savory whole, while this tastes meaty and feels chewy and dense on the finish. This is 70% Garnacha, with Carignan and Syrah.

title: Bágoa do Miño 2017 Lágrima Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Bágoa do Miño is one of the more reliably excellent Albariños from Rías Baixas. In this vintage, peach, green banana, talcum powder and bath soap aromas are feminine and elegant. A comfortable palate balances acid and pulp, while tropical fruit flavors benefit from a touch of wet stone. A chiseled finish tastes ever so slightly briny. Drink now.

title: Campo Viejo 2012 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Mature berry, cola and coffee aromas announce a gran reserva that just reaches that level of affordable excellence that everyone is looking for. The palate is a bit raw and bumpy, and the spiced plum flavors are familiar and touched up by buttery oak, but overall this delivers enough classic Rioja tobacco, vanilla and red fruit character to warrant spirited consumption.

title: Finca Constancia 2011 Red (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Aromas of rubber, coffee, lemon peel and cherry are good but lack some cohesion. This Cabernet Franc-Syrah-Garnacha blend feels lively and fresh, but also choppy and tannic. Dark blackened flavors of cassis and black cherry finish toasty and peppery with a gamy accent.

title: Campo Viejo 2011 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: This wine's earthy plum and berry aromas include classic notes of tobacco and vanilla. Its solid, balanced palate delivers ripe berry, prune, cocoa and oak flavors prior to a warm, lightly herbal finish with a hint of raisin. Drink through 2022.

title: Bodegas Olarra 2015 Clásico Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Earthy, nutty berry aromas are leathery and struggle to suggest purity. A saucy palate shows firm tannins, while this tastes of tobacco, earthy plum and mixed spices. A long, savory finish with dried fruit flavors is classic for Rioja.

title: Marqués de Cáceres 2014 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: A deep nose with solid berry aromas, oak and spice is what you'd expect from a reserva from this reliable bodega. Full tannins make for a rubbing mouthfeel, while this tastes of berry fruit and distant chocolate. Savory flavors take over on a heavy, tannic finish. Drink through 2024.

title: Bodegas Riojanas 2011 Viña Albina Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Front-loaded aromas of oak and vanilla lead tobacco, plum and berry scents on this classic-style Rioja reserva that's perky and grabby on the palate. Vanilla, cocoa and woodspice flavors are as prominent as those of cherry and plum, while mocha is the key flavor on a long, oaky finish. Drink this high-energy Rioja through 2025.

title: Montecillo 2016 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Fresh berry and red plum aromas are lifted by complementary notes of oak grain and vanilla. This value-priced crianza from a very good year feels flush but primed by punchy acidity. Red plum, berry and a hint of wood spice make for a classic Rioja flavor profile, while this remains tasty and fresh on the finish.

title: Portal del Priorat 2015 Somni Carignan-Syrah (Priorat)
description: Reduction is at the fore of a nose that's full, baked, rubbery and a touch green. On the palate, this is tannic and hard as rocks. Savory plum and berry flavors are oaky, while this is fiery, grating and relentless on the finish. Expect a power-packed ride from this Carignan-Syrah blend.

title: Bodegas Franco-Españolas 2014 Excelso Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Lightly baked berry aromas come with ample wood-spice accents and a note of rubber band. While this is flush in feel, it's also fresh and punchy. Plum, currant, tomato-sauce and spicy flavors wrap up, with integrated oaky notes that reflect 18 months spent in American oak barrels. Drink through 2022.

title: Bodegas Faustino 2016 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Traditional Rioja aromas of red berry fruits, spice and vanilla fill the nose of this crianza from an excellent vintage. On the palate, it is tight and juicy in spicy plum and currant flavors.

title: Bodegas Faustino 2008 Faustino I Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Brandied berry and raisin aromas lead the nose of this mature Gran Reserva. The texture is austere and grippy, a reflection of a cold vintage. Spice, earth, berry and plum flavors finish with a note of tobacco. Drink through 2024.

title: Edetària 2014 Finca La Pedrissa Old Vines Carignan (Terra Alta)
description: Initial aromas of wet cement, baking spices and creamy oak are as prominent as red-berry scents. This old-vines Carignan from Terra Alta is full to the brim on the palate, with no wiggle room. Saucy, oaky plum flavors come with a full dash of cocoa, while this is warm, oaky and savory tasting on the finish. Drink through 2021.

title: Atalayas de Golbán 2014 Torre d'Golbán Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Spicy berry aromas are ripe and exhibit integrated oak, earth and leather notes. A tight but bold palate with tension delivers bright berry and cherry flavors backed by a hint of chocolate on a balanced finish. Drink through 2022.

title: Cellers Unió 2014 Roureda Llicorella Gran Selecció Vitis 60 Red (Priorat)
description: Earthy berry aromas are dense and hint at prune, with a shortness of freshness. This is 78% Carignan and 22% Garnacha; it's strong boned, while flavors of plum and berry fruits are lightly salty. Similarly, the finish is salty, with lasting herbal plum and berry flavors.

title: Finca Nueva 2015 Crianza.15  (Rioja)
description: Resiny oak aromas meld with rose hip, cherry and spice notes on the nose. This crianza is built by firm tannins on the palate, with cherry and prune flavors that lead to a solid finish.

title: Celler Piñol 2016 L'Avi Arrufi Garnacha Blanca (Terra Alta)
description: A full, oily nose, with hints of melon and tropical fruit, is the greeting on this Garnacha Blanca from Terra Alta. There is pinch and tannic grip to the palate, while slightly bitter terpenes are notable on a flavor profile that includes melon and green banana. While you should drink this sooner than later, it's stout enough to last through 2022.

title: Viña Olabarri 2015 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Cherry and plum aromas are at max ripeness and include a friendly note of vanilla. On the palate, this is choppy but lively. Plum and vanilla flavors are lifted by lemony oak, which offsets a note of raisin brought on by the warm and dry conditions of the 2015 vintage.

title: Bodegas Luzón 2010 Alma de Luzon Red (Jumilla)
description: Earthy berry aromas are gamy while showing a hint of prune. Hard, rubbing tannins make for a rocky mouthfeel, while this blend of 80% Monastrell and 20% Syrah tastes of spiced black plum, toast and chocolate. While this is bullish and fleshy throughout, the finish is helpfully balanced.

title: Vega Sicilia 2013 Pintia  (Toro)
description: Cool, savory blue fruit and herbal aromas are damp and dense. An even-plane palate offers slightly rough tannins, while stewed black plum, barbecue smoke and cardamom flavors are particular to Pintia and not standard for Toro. This feels compact on a finish without much layering or textural complexity.

title: Bodegas Franco-Españolas 1999 Excelso Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Light aromas of citrus and lemon peel suggest a lean aged wine. On the palate, this is linear, without a lot of body or layering. High-toned plum and citrus flavors are mostly monotone on the finish except for a light dusting of spice.

title: Sonsierra 2013 Pagos de la Sonsierra Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Dark smoky charred aromas lend a crusty, slightly burnt topping to the nose. In the mouth, this cool-vintage wine is wiry, with magnetic midpalate acidity. Saucy flavors of plum and berry finish savory and tight. Fitting for a 2013, this is never overly ripe. Drink through 2022.

title: Sonsierra 2014 Crianza Vendimia Seleccionada  (Rioja)
description: Ripe berry aromas suggest raisin and graphite. A flush palate is full in body and displaying good structure. Roasted berry and plum flavors are meaty in front of a savory finish that tastes of soy sauce and grilled beef. Drink through 2020.

title: Bodegas Ondarre 2016 Era Costana Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Concentrated berry and plum aromas retain a sense of purity and freshness in front of a saturated, grapy palate that's raw and sinewy. Oaky notes of coconut and vanilla accent plum and berry flavors, while this young Crianza is solid and tightly built on the finish.

title: Raiza 2015 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: This wine is carried by aromas of earth, spice, cherry and plum. For a crianza, this is a serious medium-bodied wine. Spicy dark-berry flavors come with a touch of cocoa prior to the lasting finish, with leftover spice notes and slow-fading fruit. Drink through 2019.

title: Bodegas Riojanas 2015 Monte Real Reserva  (Rioja)
description: A solid nose common to Rioja smells like earthy berry fruits, dried leaves and olives. A punchy palate with screechy acidity offers flavors of plum and currant touched up by oaky vanilla. More of the same along with a touch of prune carries the finish. Drink through 2022.

title: Finca Allende 2016 Martires Single Vineyard Estate Bottled White (Rioja)
description: Lemony oak is the lead aroma on a round powerful nose with strong barrel influences. Substantive, round and deep, this barrel-fermented Viura is classic in style. Flavors of buttery oak, wood grain, spiced apple and nutmeg finish long, with the lasting impact of nine months spent in French oak. Drink through 2024.

title: Príncipe de Viana 2013 1423 Reserva Red (Navarra)
description: Stout berry and plum aromas are intense and send this wine off towards a palate with energy, acidity, raw tannins and just enough ripeness. Spicy flavors of red plum, currant and tomato are oaked up, while herbal notes of peppery berry fruits go on and on across a long finish. Drink through 2027.

title: Portal del Montsant 2013 Santbru White (Montsant)
description: Fleshy pumpkin and squash aromas are mature and lightly oxidized but in good form. A round, full palate offers vitality and balance. Earthy flavors of acorn squash and baked apple finish long and peppery. Drink through 2019.

title: Casa Castillo 2015 El Molar Garnacha (Jumilla)
description: Early aromas of latex and animal hide yield to earthy berry scents. A lively palate is full of energy, while blackberry, baked plum and chocolate flavors are more dense and generous than streamlined. Flavors of fudge, fig and berry fruits are bold on the finish. Drink through 2021.

title: Comando-G 2014 El Tamboril Navatalgordo White (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León
description: While this high-elevation (4,035 feet) white Garnacha is mostly neutral smelling, it offers stony notes that are direct, minerally and clean. On the palate, it is tightly wound and showing vital malic acid. Salty but fresh persimmon and quince flavors are lasting on the finish. For a 2014, this is in fine shape; drink now.

title: Valmiñor 2016 Edición Especial 10 Años Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Dry aromas of pithy citrus fruits come with a hint of fresh-cut grass. This feels steely and pure, with flavors of citrus fruits, nectarine and green apple. A racy finish offers tropical fruit flavors and a spot of bitterness.

title: Tierra Aranda 2012  Ribera del Duero
description: Savory notes of olive and rubber share space on the nose with dark berry aromas. This wine feels thick and fleshy, and ultimately a touch heavy and collapsed. Dark, spicy, slightly bitter blackberry flavors finish with a reprise of savory accents. Drink through 2022.

title: Viña Mayor 2014 Barrel Aged  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Earthy black cherry and blackberry aromas are moderately spicy and complex. This wine feels plump and round, without the tannic clamp that some RDD wines display. Savory black-fruit flavors reflect the nose. It finishes smooth and with medium length.

title: Berta Franquet 2010 Red (Priorat)
description: Ripe oaky aromas of marzipan, vanilla and baked berry fruits are soft and raisiny. This blend of 40% Carignan and 30% each of Garnacha and Cabernet Sauvignon feels rich, saturated and smooth. Flavors of raisin, prune, spiced cherry and cheesy oak finish with a reprise of raisiny ripeness. Drink through 2018.

title: De Bardos 2012 Mítica Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Earthy aromas hint at stewed fruit, while this wine is beefy and not very bright on the nose. Rubbery tannins and flavors of roasted, meaty berry fruits finish dense, brooding and dark, with residual tannins. This wine reflects the warm, dry conditions of 2012; drink through 2023.

title: Emilio Moro 2014  Ribera del Duero
description: Despite a hint of green to the nose, this comes around. Tight clampy tannins make for a tough, youthful mouthfeel, while this tastes woody, with black-fruit flavors in support. There's a lot of oak on the finish, but airing and/or time in the bottle will help that subside. Drink through 2023.

title: Salcis 2011 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Initial gritty aromas suggestive of coffee grounds give way to richer notes of molasses, leather and bretty berry fruit in this wine. Its full-bodied palate is ruled by choppy tannins and rugged plum and spice flavors. Those flavors lose clarity as oxidized notes settle in.

title: Pago Casa Gran 2015 Falcata Red (Valencia)
description: This blend of Garnacha Tintorera, Syrah and Monastrell features oak-laden berry aromas. It's punchy and lively on the palate, with bold tannins and fine acidity, giving its plum, wild berry and mixed spice flavors plenty of energy. The finish is firm.

title: Contino 2011  Rioja
description: Bold oak on the nose places aromas of hickory and smoke atop sappy berry scents. A clampy tannic, high-energy palate is emboldened by penetrating acidity, while flavors of plum, berry, tomato and spice are lifted by that same acidity. This is still young, jagged and abrasive on the finish. Drink through 2028.

title: Ramón Bilbao 2010 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
