description: A dark, gritty, spicy nose with aromas of black peppercorn, coffee and black fruits sets up a high-acid palate with lemony oak. Flavors of vanilla and creamy oak dominate, while the finish echoes what came before: oak, creamy notes and lemony acid. Drink now through 2027.

title: Taron 2006 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Initial aromas of animal fur and cheesy oak give way to balsamic berry fruit scents. While this is mature on the palate, it's balanced and displaying vital acidic kick. Earthy plum and berry flavors finish with modest oak, spice and cocoa notes. This is ready to drink but not at the end of its road.

title: Valserrano 2013 Gran Reserva White (Rioja)
description: Hard-pounding woody aromas are dominant and border on chemical. This blend of Viura and Malvasia feels racy, with unavoidable oaky richness to the palate. Spicy oak-based flavors include lemon, orange and clove, while a smoky character steers a long-lasting finish. This was aged 28 months in oak, so strong barrel influences are out front. Drink through 2028.

title: Beronia 2014 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Berry and plum aromas come with ample oak and touches of smoke and char. The palate brings flavors of plum, blackberry and vanilla lifted by bright acidity, with an extended mocha finish.

title: CVNE 2013 Viña Real Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Dried plum and cherry aromas include spice and mulchy notes. This is yet another 2013 Rioja that's got issues—which doesn't mean this isn't without its charms. A tannic palate is raw and gritty but built to last. Cherry and red berry flavors finish short. Drink through 2034.

title: Bodegas Palacio 2014 Cosme Palacio 1894  (Rioja)
description: Cheesy oak and raw cherry and plum aromas create a nose that needs time in the glass to show its best. This Rioja feels fresh and tight, with pulling tannins. Zesty plum and cherry flavors carry a peppery side note prior to a snappy finish with similar flavors.

title: Rioja Vega 2018 Colección Fermentado en Barrica Tempranillo Blanco (Rioja)
description: Rioja Vega is on to something with this limited-edition barrel-fermented Tempranillo Blanco. Intense oak aromas transition from harsh and slamming to smooth and spicy, while lemony acidity lends energy to a palate made softer and more oily by notable wood resin. This tastes of citrus, apple and wood spice all the way through a smacking finish. Drink through 2023.

title: Adegas Gran Vinum 2016 Esencia Diviña Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Minerally aromas are balanced by light, elegant fruit scents akin to applesauce and pear. This feels refined on a palate that's only slightly pulpy. A fruit-bowl's worth of stylish citrus and apple flavors are lasting on the finish. Drink now.

title: Finca La Estacada 2011 Secua Cabernet Sauvignon-Syrah (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Earthy aromas of dried plum, baking spices, chocolate and cassis are impressive. A crisp, snappy, almost tomatoey palate with lightly herbal flavors of tomato sauce, vanilla and spicy red plum make sense for a Cabernet Sauvignon-Syrah blend. A steady finish offers no drastic detours. Drink through 2019.

title: Vinessens 2012 El Telar Monastrell (Alicante)
description: Heady raisiny aromas smell sweet, savory and a bit like animal fur. This is pinching and hot on the palate, which shouldn't surprise at 15.5% abv. Savory roasted blackberry and baking-spice flavors end with peppery heat and hard tannins. Drink this sizzling varietal Monastrell through 2023.

title: Maria Casanovas 2014 Brut Nature Gran Reserva Sparkling (Cava)
description: Yeasty, bready aromas reflect time in the bottle, although for a gran reserva this is still young. Depth and cushion are present on a slightly foamy palate, while this wine is less about ripe fruit flavors and more about sourdough and fermented citrus notes prior to a lasting finish.

title: Morgadío 2016 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Peach aromas include a note of stone-fruit pit, while citrus is the other standout scent on an elegant nose. This wine is citrusy in feel, with good body and clarity. Flavors of orange and ripe grapefruit finish in fresh, clean fashion.

title: R+ 2012 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Ripe, earthy berry and cassis aromas smell damp at first but unfold nicely. Bright acidity and abrupt tannins make for a packed palate. Lightly oaky flavors of plum and berry show a note of vanilla. It finishes crisp and choppy due to the aforementioned bold acidity. Drink through 2022.

title: Larchago 2012 Reserva Familia Chavarri  (Rioja)
description: Powerful but composed aromas of blackberry, tar and blackened spice are on the money. A grabby, pulling palate is pushed by hard, drying tannins, while this reserva from a warm vintage tastes of saucy berry fruit and oak prior to a finish that's plump and a touch flat. Drink through 2021.

title: Bodegas Vegalfaro 2014 Pago de los Balagueses Syrah (Spain)
description: Smoky, blackened aromas take their lead from heavy oak, which makes for a resiny, foresty nose with blackberry scents. This Syrah is saturated and full-tilt in feel. Clove, toast and blackberry flavors finish oaky and spicy. This woody monster needs time to settle and absorb more oak; drink through 2023.

title: Alto Moncayo 2016 Veraton Garnacha (Campo de Borja)
description: Concentrated berry fruit aromas are aided by vanilla and grainy oak scents. A tannic palate is no easy ride due to tannins that bite. Blackberry, chocolate, marshmallow and vanilla flavors finish with a final whack of spicy oak cut by leftover berry freshness. If big, ripe Garnacha is your thing, this should do the trick.

title: Losada 2014 Mencía (Bierzo)
description: This wine's ripe berry aromas are tinged with schisty minerality while showing restrained oaky scents of coconut and vanilla. Its saturated, firm palate features big tannins, tomato, plum, baking spice and coffee flavors and a dark, toasty finish.

title: Altanza 2010 Sorolla Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Tar, smoky plum and berry aromas are fine but light on complexity and elegance. This feels tight, with edgy tannins, while roasted plum flavors finish short on depth. For a high-end Reserva from a great vintage, this is just good enough to recommend.

title: Rioja Vega 2016 Edición Limitada Fermentado en Barrica Tempranillo Blanco (Rioja)
description: A blast of controlled oak opens this barrel-fermented white Tempranillo that also shows lemon and white-flower aromas. A tight, lemony palate is enriched by oak but remains fresh. Flavors of orange, lemon, salt and oak finish with youthful energy. Drink now through 2032.

title: Vall Llach 2014 Embruix Red (Priorat)
description: Schist, cola, cassis, berry and tobacco aroma cover all the bases in this wine. It's grippy and chewy but complete. Dark, earthy mulled berry flavors precede a tannic, pulpy finish with lasting plum and cassis notes. Drink through 2021.

title: Gramona 2011 III Lustros Gran Reserva Brut Nature Sparkling (Cava)
designation: III Lustros Gran Reserva Brut Nature
description: Peachy aromas are slightly briny and suggestive of scrambled eggs. This is a touch flat on the palate, without much activity or punch. Minerally apple flavors finish with notes of green herb and stone fruit pit, while this is smooth as well as quiet on the finish. Drink now.

title: Muga 2017 Rosé (Rioja)
description: Bright, peppy aromas of tangerine and nectarine are clean and attractive. A healthy palate braced by proper acidity offers flavors of cantaloupe and peach, while this is steady and fresh on the finish.

title: Mas de Subirà 2012 Red (Priorat)
description: A mix of raisin and forest floor are the lead aromas on this concentrated yet rustic Carignan-led blend. In the mouth, firm tannins frame flavors of roasted plum and peppery spice, leading softly into a surprisingly demure finish. Drink through 2018.

title: Comando-G 2015 La Bruja de Rozas Garnacha (Vinos de Madrid)
description: Spicy plum and raspberry aromas are earthy and dry. This Garnacha smacks the palate with rubbery tannins and measurable acidity. Medicinal cherry, tomato and herbal flavors finish with a light oak note that leads the way.

title: Muruve 2013 Crianza  (Toro)
description: This wine's appealing cherry and plum aromas feature an oaky note suggestive of maple. It's medium in body, its spicy, oak-aided flavors of cherry and currant driven long into the finish by lively acidity. It ends with tobacco and chocolate notes. Drink through 2020.

title: Portal del Montsant 2014 Santbru Vinyes Velles Carignan-Grenache (Montsant)
description: This wine's berry and plum aromas come with a hint of Band-Aid. It's fresh and tight on the palate, with full tannins that don't go overboard. Dry, earthy plum and berry flavors are moderately oaky, finishing with woody and spicy red fruit notes

title: Alta Alella 2016 Xtrem Red (Alella)
description: A dark color and overtly ripe aromas of blackberry, raisin and lemony oak lead to a palate that's full and lusty but also scratchy due to hard tannins and loud tartaric acidity. Toast and lemony oak flavors are attached to core boysenberry fruit, while this Catalonian blend is fueled by acidity on a lightly smoky finish.

title: Alta Alella 2014 Mirgin Opus Brut Nature Sparkling (Cava)
description: A deep color and bready yeasty sourdough aromas are uncommon for brut nature, while overall this follows its own path. On the palate, this is soft and without much bite or bubbles. Butterscotch, dried stone fruit and white-mushroom flavors finish steady, nutty and seemingly mature.

title: Beronia 2009 Gran Reserva Tempranillo-Graciano  (Rioja)
description: Aromas of vanilla, tobacco, plum, currant and tomato leaf carry the nose. This Gran Reserva from a warm vintage feels full and jammy, with plenty of fruit weight. Blackberry, black plum and chocolate flavors give way to an easy fade on a fig-laden finish.

title: Covila 2014 II Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Ripe, chocolaty berry and olive aromas are classic for Rioja reserva. A fully saturated palate is oaky but braced by bold acidity, thus ripe flavors of plum, currant and chocolate seem fresh. Covila usually produces highly drinkable, steady wines; this fills the bill. Enjoy through 2021.

title: Val do Sosego 2017 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Racy orange peel and melon aromas set the stage for a well-formed palate with good acidity, freshness and balance. Lightly briny white fruit flavors are textbook for Albariño, while a note of green herbs rises up on a popping finish. The track record for this label is good to excellent; this adheres to precedent.

title: Genium Celler 2013 Poboleda Vi De Vila Red (Priorat)
description: This village-designated Priorat's ripe black fruit, tobacco, baking spice and raisin aromas are jammy and heady. It's full bodied and grippy, with wiry acidity. Lemony oak and tobacco notes dominate its chocolaty berry fruit, finishing thick and unrefined.

title: Bodegas Riojanas 2013 Monte Real Reserva  (Rioja)
description: The nose of this wine is rich but a bit flat, with plum and raisin notes. It's a full-bodied Rioja with a plodding palate, earthy berry and plum flavors and tea and dark spice accents. It finishes meaty and chocolaty.

title: CVNE 2011 Viña Real Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Spicy plum and berry aromas are slightly earthy and on the money. This feels full and plump, but well balanced. Spicy dry plum and berry flavors are limited but focused, while this offers a vanilla note on a finish that fades out slow and easy. Drink through 2019.

title: Muga 2016 Flor de Muga Rosé (Rioja)
description: If you are of the school that says rosé from Provence is the world's gold standard, then give this excellent newcomer a try. Brief skin contact has created a light color and sense of elegance on the nose and palate. Flavors of cantaloupe and peach are lightly sweet but cut by ample acidity. Drink as soon as possible to capture this wine's fresh essence.

title: García Figuero 2014 Tinto 12 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: The nose on this Crianza is front-loaded with oak and related aromas of spice and vanilla. In the mouth, this is tannic and resiny. Similar to the nose, this tastes woody, with barrel-related side notes of cinnamon and clove. A dry pulling tannic finish suggests that another year or two in bottle is in order. Drink through 2024.

title: Volver 2014 Triga Red (Alicante)
description: A blast of chocolate and mocha rises up on this heavily oaked Monastrell and Cabernet blend before those aromas change to char and toast. A chewy, heavyweight palate deals flavors of licorice, blackened oak and char along with dark fruit that's more canvas than paint. Drink this modern red with steak or roast lamb and it will show best.

title: Larchago 2017 Edición Fábulas  (Rioja)
description: Spiced plum, berry and earth notes are lightly oaked and integrated. Despite catchy, rubbing tannins, this is solid and balanced. Flavors of cola, chocolate and berry fruits form a common but likable Rioja package, while this is steady and remains chocolaty on the finish.

title: CVNE 2016 Viña Real Viura (Rioja)
description: Nectarine and white-flower aromas are young and pulsing. This Viura feels fresh and elegant, with grip and weight. Oak-driven flavors are controlled and sit atop a white-fruit base, while this finishes clean and easy, with finesse.

title: Pazo de Rubianes 2016 1411 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: This Albariño's floral aromas are a bit misleading, because it packs pop. The palate is full and textured, with mature grapefruit and orange flavors that finish in peak condition. It's bold, staunchly acidic and still fresh; drink through 2019.

title: Juvé & Camps 2013 Gran Reserva Brut Sparkling (Cava)
description: Fresh minerally aromas of wet stone and nectarine feed into a mature palate that's not overly active or bubbly. Flavors of apple, celery, white pepper and green herb are classic for brut Cava, while this feels good on a mild finish. Drink now.

title: Maurodos 2014 Prima  (Toro)
description: Black-fruit scents combined with cheesy oak aromas are common for Toro. This wine has a wide, pulpy, grabby palate and flavors of black plum, herbal blackberry and savory meat. There's plenty of weight and substance, but it's also a bit stretched and bumpy along the way.

title: Burgo Viejo 2012 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Dense fairly bold blackberry and dark plum aromas are backed by a plump palate that's braced by a beam of core acidity. Earthy berry flavors come with notes of vanilla, wild herbs and tobacco, while the finish is full and weighty but also juicy. Drink through 2020.

title: Bodegas la Cepa Alta 2014 La Veguilla Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Grainy oak aromas dominate a nose with black-fruit, spice, balsam wood and barrel notes. This crianza is intense, with strong tannins and blazing acidity. Toasted, blackened berry flavors are under control on a bold finish. Drink through 2022.

title: Cellers Unió 2014 Roureda Llicorella Clàssic Red (Priorat)
description: Drilling aromas of graphite and balsamic dark fruits open this intense, pulling blend of 50% Carignan, 25% Garnacha and 15% Merlot. Roaring berry, chocolate and pepper flavors get brushed aside by the tannic roughness of the finish. Give this plenty of air before pouring; drink through 2024.

title: Alvarez de Toledo 2015 Roble Mencía (Bierzo)
description: Welcoming aromas of berry fruit come with a bit of oaky menthol in support. A full palate, bright acidity and slightly edgy tannins make for a healthy ride. Plum, currant and juicy berry flavors are choppy on a fresh, bold finish.

title: Casa Castillo 2015 Monastrell (Jumilla)
description: This Monastrell gets going with roasted plum and berry aromas, with side notes of crushed stones. A full palate with an iron grip shows flavors of black fruits and coffee. A fleshy finish is spicy and dark in flavor. Drink through 2019.

title: Agustí Torelló Mata 2010 Gran Reserva Brut Nature Sparkling (Cava)
description: Lightly pickled apple aromas are dry and direct, like a brut nature should be. Citric and malic in feel, but with enough body to absorb and project the wine's acidity, this tastes briny, salty and like apple and tangerine. This stays the course on the finish, and overall it ranks as a complex Cava.

title: Valdelacierva 2016 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Rooty berry aromas include notes of forest floor and dried leaves. A full yet tight palate displays youthful exuberance and balance, while this Crianza tastes of blackberry accented by savory oak. A full finish isn't too heavy but isn't shy. Drink through 2024.

title: Aldonia 2015 100  (Rioja)
description: Candied berry aromas are fragrant and sweet, like a nicely scented soap. A full palate brings a firm grip, while red-plum, spice and fresh tomato flavors roll out on a big finish that's neither shy nor punishing. Best with grilled meats; drink through 2023.

title: Bodegas Franco-Españolas 2007 Rioja Bordón Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Earthy aromas of cola, coffee and saucy plum lead to a palate that at first seems loud and acidic but which comes around. Plum and berry flavors are accented by oaky vanilla and citrus peel, while this is bright on the finish due to lasting acidity. Drink through 2023.

title: Venta del Puerto 2013 No. 12 Selección Especial Red (Valencia)
description: Ripe berry fruit and gritty oak aromas lead to a full-bodied blocky palate with grating tannins. This is a heavily oaked blend of Syrah, Tempranillo and Merlot. Flavors of blackberry, vanilla and wood spice finish with barrel char and depth. Drink through 2023.

title: Baica 2015 Barricado Organic Monastrell (Jumilla)
description: Intense aromas of inky, leathery black fruits announce a full, saturated palate that's bolstered by tartaric acidity. Plum, blackberry, raw oak and salty flavors are chocolaty on a finish. Drink through 2019.

title: Baica 2015 La Finca Selección Monastrell Monastrell (Jumilla)
description: Oaky, concentrated black-fruit aromas feature notes of graphite and savory earth. This Monastrell is deep, jammy and textured on a full-bodied palate. Spicy oak and black-plum flavors finish toasty, with hints of baking spices and dried herbs. Drink through 2019.

title: Valserrano 2016 Blanco White (Rioja)
description: A nicely oaked bouquet includes aromas of tropical fruits, melon and green banana. This has a full, creamy palate, with oak resin and acidity balancing each other out. Salty melon and banana flavors are oaky, while this is texturally pleasing on the finish.

title: Viña Vilano 2014 Legón Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Spicy berry aromas come with a bell-pepper note. In the mouth, this wine is raw and somewhat abrasive. Plum and raspberry flavors are lightly herbal, while this is distinctly tannic, raw and tough on the finish. This quality wine begs for food.

title: Marqués de Montejos 2015 Marqués de Montejos Mencía (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León
description: A hint of rubbery reduction, which is nothing abnormal for Mencía, blows off quickly and leaves mostly black fruit aromas. A stout palate is on the full and blocky side, while this tastes of blackberry and cassis. Those same dark fruit flavors linger on a thick finish with toast and coffee notes. Drink through 2022.

title: Alta Alella 2013 Dolç Organic Mataro (Spain)
description: Despite opening with reduced raisiny rooty aromas of cough syrup and licorice, this sweet Mataro (Mourvèdre) comes around. Medicinal black cherry, cough drop, maple and chocolate flavors rest easily on a jammy palate. The longer this sits, the more it evolves.

title: Alidis 2011 Gran Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Alidis is not the most consistent winery in Ribera del Duero, but this gran reserva gets it mostly right. Earthy, slightly mulchy and rubbery berry aromas lead to a saturated bulky palate. Saucy earthy flavors of black fruits finish gritty and a bit leathery, with a jammy weight and a lasting note of black coffee.

title: Marqués de Cáceres 2015 Excellens Cuvée Especial  (Rioja)
description: Ripe berry aromas are warm, mossy and earthy, with oaky support. A full, fleshy palate is firmed up by solid tannins, while this tastes of black plum, berry fruits and savory spices. A medium-length finish is chewy and ripe. Drink through 2023.

title: Marqués de la Concordia 2014 Hacienda Zorita Natural Reserve Unamuno Vineyard Syrah (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
designation: Hacienda Zorita Natural Reserve Unamuno Vineyard
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León
description: Dark, heady berry aromas are intense and oaky, with a cured-meat note of beef jerky. A deep, layered palate is savory and meaty in flavors, with light herbal notes embedded into berry and plum fruit. A spicy, peppery, lightly charred finish is the final chapter. Drink through 2019.

title: Agustí Torelló Mata 2008 Kripta Gran Reserva Brut Nature Sparkling (Cava)
description: A bready, yeasty nose announces that this brut nature is more than ready to drink. In the mouth, it's smooth, but light on verve and bubbles. Oxidized flavors of spent yeast, bread dough and sautéed mushroom finish dry and reserved, but somewhat flat. Drink now.

title: Avancia 2014 Mencía (Valdeorras)
description: Aromas of sweet oak and maple announce that this Mencía received generous barrel treatment. Supple in feel, this tastes of oaky plum and raspberry along with a dash of salt. Jammy berry notes and a hint of Graham cracker rise up on the finish. Drink through 2019.

title: 12 Linajes 2015 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Smoky black-fruit aromas meet the basics for a top-notch Ribera wine. While this grinds a bit on the palate, it's not too scouring. Bold berry flavors show a saucy gamy side on a finish with mild heat and scrappy intensity. Drink through 2025.

title: Bosque De Matasnos 2012  Ribera del Duero
description: Jammy blackberry aromas come with strong notes of creosote and asphalt but not much nuance. A saturated beefy mouthfeel and dark toasty black-fruit flavors are intense, while this tastes of chocolate and dark spices on a deep, pounding finish. Drink through 2024.

title: Bodegas Palacio 2009 Glorioso Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Spicy plum aromas are accompanied by appealing oak scents. While this wine doesn't show the greatest of ease and flow on the palate, flavors of plum, cassis, clove and cinnamon are persuasive. A blocky, rubbery, tannic finish with roasted notes is more about power than finesse. Drink through 2023.

title: Bodegas Palacio 2012 Cosme Palacio Viñedos Viejos Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Ripe, spicy berry aromas are a touch reduced. This warm-vintage reserva feels jammy and wide, with rugged, pulling tannins. Peppery dark-fruit flavors turn more savory on a tannic, rocky finish. Drink through 2022.

title: Bodegas Corral 2004 Don Jacobo Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Saucy red-fruit aromas are aided by a subtle scent of old wood and barnyard, all of which are throwback characteristics. A full, grabby palate is rife with grape-skin tannins, while spicy plum and berry flavors are ripe enough to suggest prune. A firm, peppery-tasting finish is right for this quality Gran Reserva; drink through 2026.

title: Bodegas Franco-Españolas 2008 Gran Reserva Excelso  (Rioja)
description: A reserved earthy nose smells a bit leafy and stalky. A wide palate with hard tannins delivers textbook Rioja flavors of dried cherry and spiced berry fruits. An earthy note alongside chocolate on the finish ensures that is very much in the vein of Rioja gran reserva. Drink through 2027.

title: Raventós I Blanc 2016 de Nit Sparkling (Penedès)
description: A light pink color and smoky, lightly woody aromas introduce this racy rosé sparkler that includes a dash of Monastrell for color. Nectarine, red apple skin and citrus flavors are fresh and briny, while this is steady and doesn't break down on the finish; ideal for fried chicken (trust us).

title: CVNE 2016 Cune Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Berry, spice and tobacco aromas work in unison to give this Crianza a nice start. A firm palate avoids jamminess and shows grip. Dark plum, raspberry, spice and pepper flavors hold on through the finish. For everyday Rioja, there isn't much better than this.

title: Bodegas Olarra 2015 Añares Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Classic Rioja aromas of cherry and plum come with tobacco, vanilla and earthy accents. A crisp, tight and grabby palate is acidic but not shearing, while this tastes of plum, red currant and lightly spiced oak prior to a bone-dry finish.

title: Siglo 2014 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Earthy plum and berry aromas are on the soft side, while this feels creamy and slightly raisiny, with grabby tannins. Oaky milk chocolate notes blend with herbal red plum and berry flavors in front of a grabby finish where a chocolate flavor rises to the fore.

title: Beronia 2008 Gran Reserva Tempranillo-Graciano-Mazuelo  (Rioja)
description: Tea and root beer aromas carry a slight rubber slant. A choppy, angular palate is home to savory oak, berry and plum flavors. On the finish, olive and herbal fruit flavors are propped up by live-wire acidity. Drink this long-laster through 2024.

title: Vionta 2016 Limited Release Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Aromas of fresh-cut grass, wet stone and apple are mild on the nose. A round palate with zesty acidity is in full health, while flavors of apple, melon and pineapple last on the finish. Drink now.

title: Quasar 2012 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: A high level of char introduces this saturated, high-energy Rioja, which also shows animal and wild herb aromas. Oak and vanilla flavors share space with plum and blackberry fruit on the palate, a mocha note echoing on the strong, acid-driven finish. Drink through 2027.

title: Finca Albret 2013 La Viña de Mi Madre Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot (Navarra)
designation: La Viña de Mi Madre Reserva
description: Baked blackberry aromas are creamy and saturated. On a full and jammy palate, this Cabernet Sauvignon (with a touch of Merlot) is edgy with tannins. Spicy blackberry, olive, herb and coffee flavors finish with an odd note of chicken fat as well as chocolate and oak-based toast notes.

title: Marqués de Riscal 2013 Baron de Chirel Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Fine oak helps an otherwise ripe and earthy nose. A rich saturated palate ranks as syrupy, while this Tempranillo-led blend tastes of coconut, chocolate mint and blackberry jam. While thick and stout throughout, this off-vintage wine always seems a bit flat. Drink through 2021.

title: Larchago 2015 Crianza Edición Fábulas  (Rioja)
description: Jammy berry aromas come with hints of chocolate cake and mint. A full, dense palate rates as chunky and warming, while this Rioja tastes of blackberry and dark plum. A chewy, solid finish has integrity and properly reflects a warm, dry year. Drink through 2021.

title: Adegas Tollodouro 2017 Blanquito Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: This wine's pineapple and floral aromas are blowsy at first but settle with airing. Its smooth palate has a full texture, bracing acidity and lightly salty apple flavors that finish with a briny note of seashell. Overall, this balances pop with weight, capturing what can be so appealing about Albariño.

title: Viñedos de Paganos 2013 La Nieta  (Rioja)
description: Typically dark in color, with plum, blackberry and a touch of raisin on the nose, this feels a bit jammy, with a shock of acidity and hard tannins. Prune, baked plum and baking-spice flavors finish toasty and charred, with dry rough tannins. Drink through 2025.

title: Ignacio Marín 2015 Old Vines Garnacha (Cariñena)
description: Ripe, dark blackberry aromas border on prune. A fleshy, full palate offers layering and tannic structure, while this old vines Garnacha tastes toasty and heavily oaked, with blackberry flavors resting comfortably under a woody blanket. Coffee, chocolate and tobacco flavors are ramped up on a hot finish.

title: Dios Ares 2012 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Earthy, rubbery berry and plum aromas are spicy and dry. A tight palate with firm tannins and bold acidity offers plenty of grip. Baked plum and currant flavors are dry and spicy on a finish with residual oak character. Drink through 2023.

title: Bodegas Olarra 2014 Añares Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Earthy berry aromas are oaky and smoky, but not overly so. This feels fleshy and grapy, with a pulpy overall mouthfeel. Smoky, blackened berry flavors are chocolaty, while this is toasty and dark on the finish. For the most part, this reserva seems authentic for Rioja and ready to drink.

title: Brega 2015 Garnacha (Calatayud)
description: Ripe, syrupy plum and berry aromas are jammy and dense. This is a full-bodied Garnacha with 16% declared alcohol by volume. Candied black plum, cassis and brown sugar flavors are far from light and feminine, while this is chocolaty, calm and collected on a very ripe finish.

title: Enate 2011 Cabernet Sauvignon (Somontano)
description: Leafy gritty earthy berry aromas are spicy. This feels rugged but fresh, with a tolerable but strong tannic grip. Plum, boysenberry, chocolate, blackened toast and peppercorn flavors finish leafy, with firm tannins.

title: Numanthia 2013 Termes  (Toro)
description: Woody aromas of maple and raw oak shroud core berry aromas. This wine is edgy on the palate, with tomatoey acidity and choppy tannins. Flavors of plum and tomato come with vanilla and oak accents. It hollows out on the finish, leaving rubbery tannins. Drink through 2020.

title: Las Moradas de San Martín 2014 Senda Garnacha (Vinos de Madrid)
description: Fresh berry and plum aromas are lightly spiced. This Garnacha comes from the high-elevation Gredos Mountains, and it's rubbery, powerful and grinding on the palate, so food will be of great help. Slightly medicinal red plum and cherry flavors show modest oak spice prior to an edgy but long finish. This is an intense wine from interior Spain with a lot to offer.

title: Altavins 2013 Domus Pensi Red (Terra Alta)
description: Integrated aromas of black fruits, graphite, cola and vanilla are under control and inviting. In the mouth, this blend of Garnacha, Merlot, Syrah and Carignan is tight, crisp and focused. Wiry plum and currant flavors are balanced by creamy oak, while this is lively on the finish. Drink through 2020.

title: Siglo 2015 Crianza Selección  (Rioja)
description: Earthy berry and plum aromas are full and accented by mocha, oak grain and smoked meat notes. A lush palate is all about fruit and freshness, while this crianza tastes of plum, raspberry and baking spices. A steady finish brings this to shore with no issues. Drink through 2023.

title: Finca Constancia 2011 Parcela 23 Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Mild raisin, black cherry, anise and burnt tire aromas lead to a plump, balanced palate that's full but not overloaded. Earthy baked black-fruit flavors show a hint of oaky coconut, while this Tempranillo finishes with depth and density.

title: Escalada Do Sil 2014 Red (Valdeorras)
description: For a different breed of cat, take a look at this blend of Merenzao (Trousseau), Mencía and Garnacha from Valdeorras in Galicia. An elegant, schisty nose displays gamy, savory plum and currant aromas similar to Pinot Noir. A choppy, astringent palate makes this wine less than smooth. Herbal plum and spicy oak flavors are bolstered by racy acidity and finish long and almost citrusy in flavor. Drink through 2022.

title: Bodegas Lacort 2011 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Dried cherry and currant aromas are subtle as they introduce a palate that's medium in body but grabby. Textbook Rioja plum, raspberry and currant flavors are mellow in front of a finish that shows a hint of oxidation. Drink now.

title: Alta Alella 2015 Mirgin Reserva Brut Nature Sparkling (Cava)
description: Light, fresh and direct describes the white-fruit aromas this brut nature is exuding. In the mouth, this is just round enough but mostly linear in plane. Flavors of dry lime, apple and fresh-baked white bread finish mild yet agile. This is affordable brut nature taken to a high level.

title: Viña Olabarri 2016 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Classic Rioja aromas of mild oak, vanilla and dried berry fruits are slightly earthy as a whole. This crianza is tight due to smacking acidity, but that also creates freshness and overall health. Plum and berry flavors are saucy, while firm tannins and acidity drive the finish.

title: 12 Linajes 2016 Crianza Tempranillo  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Bold berry fruit and oaky vanilla aromas are integrated and inviting. In the mouth, this crianza from a strong vintage feels deep, flush and layered, with firm tannins. Blackberry and black currant flavors don't go much further on a staunch finish. Drink this steady crianza over the next few years.

title: Gotas de Mar 2016 Godello (Ribeiro)
description: A bold gold color and aromas of apple and stone fruits are collected and controlled. This Godello is on the full side, with good texture and enough acidity to ensure balance. Flavors of apple, stone fruits, dry spices and white pepper finish slowly and with style. Drink now.

title: Vins El Cep 2012 Cla Ror Gran Reserva Brut Nature Sparkling (Cava)
designation: Cla Ror Gran Reserva Brut Nature
description: A rich, bready nose smells of fresh-baked croissants. Flavors of tropical fruit and peach are slightly bitter and carry a saline note, while the finish ends taut and dry. Drink through 2020.

title: Protos 2012 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)
description: A smoky, charred nose includes notes of baking spice, chocolate and black-fruit scents. A tight, solid palate of firm tannins and oak tastes charred, spicy and ripe. On the finish, oak is out front but this has the body and depth to handle it. Drink 2018–2023.

title: Finca la Melonera 2014 Payoya Negra Red (Sierras de Málaga)
description: Jammy black-fruit aromas push up against raisiny but stay composed. This blend of Syrah, Garnacha, Tintilla and a grape called Rome feels rubbery and pulling, but solid. Blackberry, cassis and chocolate flavors are chewy but focused. Drink through 2019.

title: Viñas del Cenit 2014 Villano Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León
description: If you like full-flavored, lusty Tempranillos, Viñas del Cenit in western Zamora is a reliable source. This has floral berry aromas, a saturated palate with wall to wall tannins, and baked black-fruit flavors that push up towards maximum ripeness. A staunch, jammy, tannic red made to with meat off the grill.

title: Alberto Orte 2008 La Antigua Clásico Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Rooty aromas of sarsparilla mix with red-fruit tones on the subtle nose. This aged Rioja is showing hard tannins and choppy acidity in support of herbal, leafy plum and red currant flavors. Tomato, herb and plum flavors stick out on a traditional, high-acid finish.

title: Parxet 2012 Titiana Brut Rosé Sparkling (Cava)
description: Yeasty bready aromas are more smooth and leesy than fruity. This has a round palate that's full but not creamy due to firm acidity. Melon, peach and vanilla flavors finish yeasty and dry, with moderate complexity. This is made entirely from Pinot Noir.

title: Blanco Nieva 2016 Pie Franco Verdejo (Rueda)
description: This old-vines Rueda delivers green-leaning aromas of Granny Smith apple, lime and lettuce. A citric, stony palate is linear and direct, with fine-tuned acidity. Citrusy flavors of lime and green apple turn briny on the finish.

title: Pazo de Rubianes 2018 1411 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Apple, pear and melon aromas are clean and clear and show the way to a full palate that's melony and ever so slightly spritzy. Ripe, tasty melon and tropical-fruit flavors hold onto their pulpy generosity through the finish.

title: Viñedos de Paganos 2014 Calados del Puntido Tempranillo  (Rioja)
description: This wine's jammy berry and spice cake aromas give the impression of oak. It's dense and heavy, with ripe tannins, baked black fruit and spice cake flavors and a raisiny finish. Drink through 2024.

title: Cuatro Rayas 2018 Vendimia Nocturna Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Crisp, clean lime and passion fruit aromas are true to Verdejo. Offering a juicy, bright palate, flavors of orange, lime and green herbs finish with citrus and lettuce notes. Drink as soon as possible.

title: Adega Algueira 2015 Brandan Godello (Ribeira Sacra)
description: Peach and nectarine aromas come with a dusty covering. This Godello feels both round and pulpy but also balanced and well cut by acidity. Dry almost briny white-fruit flavors are stony and suggest nectarine on the finish. Drink now.

title: Eduardo Garrido García 2011 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Aromas of tobacco, wood grain, plum and cherry set up a plucky, lively palate with hard tannins. Spicy plum and berry flavors finish steady and drawing. Drunk now through 2023.

title: Matarromera 2014 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Aromas of blackberry, cassis, raisin and vanilla are common for top-level Ribera del Duero. In the mouth, this is rough due to hard tannins, heavy oak extraction and outsize acidity. Cola, blackberry and chocolate flavors are peppery, spicy and heady on a tough-as-nails finish. Drink through 2028.

title: Martín Berdugo 2011 MB  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Textbook Duero Valley aromas of licorice root, cola, peppery spice, blackberry and vanilla are complete and cover all the bases. While this is medium to full in body and weight, it is racy due to pulsing acidity. Flavors of toasty oak and vanilla are compatible with tart berry and plum fruit, while this is lithe and bolstered by acidity on the finish. Drink through 2027.

title: Valdubón 2014 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Alluring spice and berry aromas along with notes of maple, winter-scented candle and vanilla make up a nice nose. While this is dry and scratchy in feel, on the plus side it's focused. Dark berry and cassis flavors yield to oak and wood prior to a toasty, spicy finish with chocolate notes.

title: Legaris 2014 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Aromas of earth, leather and berries carry a slightly gamy undertone on the nose. The stretched, sinewy palate is tannic, while this crianza from an off year tastes of baked black fruits that show a hint raisin. The savory finish offers a steady close.

title: Matarromera 2015 Fermentado en Barrica Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Mellow white-fruit aromas are nonspecific and oaky, but not overly so. This barrel-fermented Verdejo feels plump and chunky, with balancing acidity. Salty melon, apricot and apple flavors end steady and long. For barrel-fermented Verdejo, this is at the top of the pile.

title: Remírez de Ganuza 2010 Fincas de Ganuza Reserva Old Vines Unfilitered  (Rioja)
designation: Fincas de Ganuza Reserva Old Vines Unfilitered
description: This wine's rubbery latex, briary plum and berry aromas are potent. Its plum, berry and vanilla flavors finish with shrill acidity, hard, choppy tannins and long-lasting dark berry notes. Drink through 2028.

title: Alta Alella 2017 Mirgin Reserva Brut Nature Rosé Sparkling (Cava)
description: Fresh, light and clean aromas of citrus, peach and wood smoke lead to a crisp palate. Smoky orange and tangerine flavors finish with latent toast, hard spice and spent yeast notes. This is well done and makes it to the high floors of the Cava hierarchy.

title: Bodega Classica 2010 Lopez de Haro Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Aromas of spiced plum, cherry, mocha and vanilla are common for Rioja Gran Reserva. A choppy but dense mouthfeel lacks elegance but gets the job done. Roasted plum flavors are earthy and hint at bacon, while this thickens up on a jammy finish. Drink through 2025.

title: Gotas de Mar 2015 Godello (Ribeiro)
description: This yellow-tinted Godello smells of stone fruits and lanolin. A tight citric stony-feeling palate delivers lightly salted flavors of lime and stone fruits in front of a healthy plump chiseled finish. Drink now.

title: La Caña 2014 Navia Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: A clear shot of oak hits first on the nose, followed by melon and mild citrus notes. Despite its age, this is still fresh and in balance due to good core acidity. Yeasty, lightly resiny flavors come with notes of briny citrus, while an oaky-tasting finish is steady due to the aforementioned acidity. Drink now.

title: Perelada 2011 Finca Espolla Red (Empordà)
description: Syrah is the lead grape on this blend, which also contains Cabernet Sauvignon and Garnacha. Spicy, gritty aromas are not uncommon for warm-climate Spanish Syrah, while a hard, tannic, dense mouthfeel and spicy, savory, tarry flavors finish peppery, with drying tannins. Drink through 2022.

title: Fernández Gómez 2015 Selección Familia White (Rioja)
description: Peach and apricot aromas give way to vanilla and resiny oak notes. This blend of Viura, Malvasia and Garnacha Blanca is full in body and has taken well to oak. Melon, green banana and wood spice flavors are dry and elegant on the finish. Drink through 2021.

title: Perelada 2012 5 Finques Reserva Red (Empordà)
description: Rich dark-berry aromas combined with toasty oak give this seven-grape blend a modern yet encouraging nose. Saturated but slightly tannic and grating in feel, this tastes of blackened toast, vanilla, blackberry and spices. Toasty black-fruit flavors are largely pure on a tannic finish. Drink through 2022.

title: Olivier Rivière 2016 Rayos Uvas  (Rioja)
description: Blueberry and blackberry aromas are spunky and a little earthy. A juicy, jammy palate is angular and fairly sharp. Wild berry flavors seem right off the bush, while this wine is tight and narrow on an acidic finish. Drink through 2023.

title: Vinessens 2014 La Casica del Abuelo Red (Alicante)
description: Loamy aromas of wet clay and blackberry transition to gamy and animal-like with airing. This blend of Monastrell, Syrah and Cabernet Sauvignon feels full and rough, with hard tannins. Flavors of savory oak and baked berry fruits are spicy, earthy and dry on the finish. Drink through 2021.

title: Valserrano 2015 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Solid berry and cherry aromas include mild but helpful spice notes. This crianza from a good vintage is smacking, fresh and true to the classic Rioja style. Flavors of plum and berry include vanilla, spice and cocoa notes prior to a long finish that's dry, peppery and strapped with acidity.

title: Paixar 2013 Mencía (Bierzo)
description: Woody plum and berry aromas are a bit more raw and angular than in past vintages. This feels abnormally bright and lively for Paixar, which is normally a dark full-bodied type of Mencía. Flavors of baked black plum and oaky coconut finish toasty and long, but low on fruit. Drink through 2023.

title: Altos de Valdoso 2015 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Warm, oaky aromas of maple and cocoa blend with dark-berry-fruit scents. On the palate, this is lively and punchy but nothing special or unusual for a Ribera Crianza. Snappy plum and berry flavors include spice notes, while this tastes of desiccated plum and chocolate on the finish. Drink through 2024.

title: Terras Gauda 2016 O Rosal White (Rías Baixas)
description: Lightly briny citrus aromas are typical of this Albariño-led blend. The chunky palate is acidic and driven, tropical with flavors of passion fruit and kiwi. A plump finish is slightly oily in feel and briny in flavor.

title: Vetus 2014 Flor de Vetus Vino de Finca  (Toro)
designation: Flor de Vetus Vino de Finca
description: This wine's ripe plum and berry aromas feature an oaky note of bacon. On the palate, it's choppy and aggressive with tannic bite. Dark fruit flavors are bolstered by oaky spice, tobacco and chocolate hints that persist long on the finish. A texbook Toro wine.

title: Muga 2018 Rosé (Rioja)
description: A stony, fresh nose is clean as a whistle, while this feels medium to full, with a faint skin-driven texture and citrus-laden acidity. Orange and nectarine flavors are bright and fairly deep, while it remains alert across a snappy finish.

title: Alto Moncayo 2014 Garnacha (Campo de Borja)
description: A heavy application of charred oak might be too much for some, but if that's to your liking then you should enjoy this Garnacha's smoky, spicy nose. A stout, full-bodied palate is full of resiny oak with a balance of acid. Saturated, woody flavors of roasted berry fruits finish toasty and resiny. Drink through 2020.

title: Otazu 2006 Altar Red (Navarra)
description: Cool rooty aromas of cola and tree bark grace the nose on this ripe but still not fully mature Cabernet Sauvignon (with 5% Merlot). In the mouth, this is choppy due to sandpaper tannins. Flavors of sarsaparilla, pepper, and blackberry are dense and chewy, while the finish is bumpy and scraping due to aforementioned hard tannins. Drink or hold through 2022.

title: Príncipe de Viana 2013 Edición Limitada Red (Navarra)
description: Aromas of cherry, plum, forest floor and tobacco feed into a clampy palate with fresh acidity. Lightly spiced currant and red-plum flavors are limited in scope but nice, while this tastes herbal and feels tight and racy on the finish.

title: Avancia 2015 Cuveé de O Godello (Valdeorras)
description: Melony floral aromas are friendly and easygoing. On the palate, this is clean and precise, with moderate weight and a touch of oak. Lime and kiwi flavors are a bit sweet, with a welcome oaky offset. On the finish, this Godello fades nicely, with core acidity extending the ride.

title: Portal del Montsant 2014 Brunus Red (Montsant)
description: A potpourri of floral red-fruit, dried herb and wet cement aromas lead to a racy fresh palate that's mildly complex. Oaky red-berry flavors come with a note of chocolate, while this tastes lightly herbal on a lasting well-formed finish. Drink this Carignan-Garnacha through 2021.

title: Sierra Cantabria 2014 Organza White (Rioja)
description: Mango and melon blend with crushed vitamin on the nose of this Viura-Malvasia-Garnacha Blanca blend. This feels wide and fairly full, with modest acidity. Resiny flavors of sawdust shade apple and vanilla notes, while this is oaky and nonaggressive on the finish.

title: Comenge 2011 Familia Comenge Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Earthy and a touch gritty smelling on first take, this gets riper, cleaner and better the longer it catches air. A full slightly tannic palate is mildly abrasive, while tea, herbal berry and chocolaty oak flavors are appealing. A spicy peppery chocolaty finish is not shedding its drying tannins. Drink through 2022.

title: CVNE 2010 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: For a tight, snappy rendition of Rioja, this answers the call. Herbal plum and tomato aromas are earthy and a touch horsey. Tomato, plum and herbal flavors amount to a saucy whole, while this is fresh, herbal and brothy tasting on a crisp finish.

title: Regina Viarum 2014 Mencía (Ribeira Sacra)
description: Ripe raisin and black-fruit aromas come with a licorice sidenote. This feels tight and pure but not demanding, with proper balance. Plum, blackberry and chocolate flavors give way to a spongy fruit-driven finish.

title: Casal Novo 2015 Godello (Valdeorras)
description: Dusty white-fruit aromas lead to a firm palate with fine acidity, minerality and a sense of completeness. Dry slightly spicy apple and peach flavors finish in elegant form. This is everyday Godello at its best, meaning no bells and whistles, just fruit, slate and acidity.

title: Muga 2012 Reserve Selección Especial  (Rioja)
description: This opens with heavy, earthy blackberry aromas, seeming chunky. The potent palate is saturated with beefy plum and blackberry flavors, which remain at full volume into the finish. Drink through 2022.

title: Pata Negra 2012 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Spicy, mint-laced berry, tobacco and oak aromas introduce this wine. It's solid but ordinary, with good structure. Its intense berry flavors are matched by loud oak notes, yet it remains lively on the finish, with preserving acidity.

title: Bodegas Palacio 2012 Glorioso Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Ripe spicy berry aromas are a touch raisiny and hot, which is a proper reflection on the warm 2012 vintage. A balanced palate is just tight enough, while this tastes savory and spicy, with ample oak and berry fruit flavors. A texturally solid finish benefits from core acidity. Drink through 2022.

title: Bodegas y Viñedos Tábula 2015 Damana Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Jammy currant and plum aromas show notes of latex and sweet pastry. A tight, rubbing palate runs heavy on the tannins, while black-fruit flavors are chocolaty but lacking in nuance and complexity. Same goes for a full-fruited finish. Drink through 2024.

title: Clos de Tafall 2016 Red (Priorat)
description: Dry, schisty aromas are subdued for Priorat, a warm region known for its big-boned reds. A well-balanced palate is clean and uncomplicated, while this blend of Garnacha, Carignan and Cabernet Sauvignon tastes of ripe plum, raisin, spice and herbs. Drink this steady red through 2021.

title: Caracol Serrano 2016 Monastrell-Syrah-Cabernet Sauvignon Red (Jumilla)
description: This wine shows a lot of purity, balance and quality. A ripe, jammy nose is full of blackberry and cassis, while this blend of Monastrell, Syrah and Cabernet Sauvignon is big on the palate but jolted by wiry acidity. Flavors of spicy black fruits offer a touch of chocolate prior to a mild finish. This red from southeast Spain shoots and scores.

title: Aljibes 2016 Enclave De Los Aljibes Red (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Dark, charred oak aromas dominate a black fruit nose, while this Monastrell is medium-full in size, with notable freshness that ensures balance. Saucy berry flavors are fully oaked but don't taste woody, while this spreads out comfortably on a lasting finish.

title: Casa do Sol 2017 Froiña 10 Messes Sobre Lías Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Lemony citrus and pine aromas are interesting and go beyond the basics for Rías Baixas Albariño. On the palate, this remains bright and full despite its maturity. Orange and nectarine flavors are steady on a finish that doesn't lose a beat. Drink now.

title: Marques de Tomares 2011 Monteleiva Reserva Colección de Bodega Tradición de Familia  (Rioja)
designation: Monteleiva Reserva Colección de Bodega Tradición de Familia
description: Fully ripe black fruit aromas are slightly raisiny and a touch flat. On the palate, this reserva from a hot year is weighted down by rubbery tannins and ripe berry fruit. Flavors of prune and raisin are at the core of a slightly overripe flavor profile, while this remains full on the finish.

title: Volver 2013 Triga Red (Alicante)
description: Aromas of charred hickory and toasty black fruits are massive. This 15.5% bruiser feels both tannic and hot, while flavors of buttery toasted oak along with fig, raisin and carob follow the nose. Heat is a tolerable issue on the finish. Drink through 2022.

title: Cepa 21 2015  Ribera del Duero
description: Floral violet aromas blend with boysenberry notes on a fruity nose that avoids the heavy oak character that's common to the region. In the mouth, however, this is choppy and tannic. Basic berry flavors are ripe but not complex, while this is strapping on a finish with standard dark-berry flavors. Drink through 2023.

title: Teso La Monja 2015 Romanico  (Toro)
description: Pure berry and black-cherry aromas make for a flush and friendly nose. In the mouth, this is quite dry and drawing, with rough-textured tannins. Lightly salty and savory blackberry and black-plum flavors finish with surface-level depth and a reprise of scratchiness; drink through 2024.

title: Del Celler De L'era 2012 Mim Red (Montsant)
description: Spicy wood grain and minerally aromas of iodine and dried blood sit on top of baked berry fruit scents. This Montsant blend feels chunky and full, with hard tannins that keep everything in line. Charred, roasted berry and plum flavors are overtly oaky, while a full and ripe finish holds on to that woody character. Drink through 2022.

title: Protos 2015 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Ripe, earthy aromas of raisin and baking spices meet a tar note on the nose. Rubbery tannins are ramped up on the palate, while this crianza from a warm, dry vintage delivers flavors of mocha, char and wood grain that linger through the finish. Drink through 2024.

title: La Conreria d'Scala Dei 2010 Iugiter Red (Priorat)
description: Well into its run, this still smells of oak, but also dried, earthy berry fruits and schisty dust. A dense, flush palate remains on the wild side and probably will stay there forever. Ripe mature berry and oak flavors finish with warmth and toughness. Drink through 2024.

title: Bodegas Veganzones 2016 912 de Altitud Clay Soil  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Ripe berry and up-front oak aromas are typical of Ribera del Duero and should draw a smile. A big bullish palate is packed with fruit and tannins, while this tastes of blackberry, dark plum and herbs. A lumbering finish, like the rest of the package, is rough but generous. Drink through 2025.

title: Bodegas Lacort 2012 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Earthy plum and berry aromas are nicely spiced, and overall this reserva smells sound and mature. A tight, slightly choppy palate offers flavors of spiced plum, cherry, cola and cocoa. On the finish, this is steady but low on secondary flavors and complexity. Drink through 2022.

title: Marqués de la Concordia 2013 Viña Alarde Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Earthy, leafy plum and berry aromas are spicy, while this cool-vintage reserva feels dense and grabby. Flavors of tobacco, spiced plum and oak outmuscle the wine's fruit, while this is mouthfilling but plodding on the finish. Drink through 2022.

title: Marqués de la Concordia 2009 Lagunilla Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Classic Rioja aromas of vanilla, tobacco and dried red fruits are on display. In the mouth, this wine has bracing natural acidity that supports ripe flavors of baked berry fruits and brown sugar. Raisiny hints on the finish suggest drinking this sooner rather than later.

title: Bodegas Carchelo 2012 Selecto Red (Jumilla)
description: Dense blackberry and cassis aromas show a hint of leather. This saturated jam-packed blend of Monastrell and several other red grapes tastes of chocolaty oak and baked plum and berries. A chunky finish doesn't show much evolution.

title: Bodegas Muriel 2017 Pazo Cilleiro Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Nectarine and tangerine aromas are bright and clean. On the palate, this is plump yet balanced by a zip of acidity. Orange, nectarine and honey flavors finish with length and a sense of healthy ripeness. Drink now.

title: Conde Bel 2011 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Earthy red berry aromas are a touch jumbled. A pulling palate revolves around rubbing tannins, while this tastes of currant, cherry and red apple skins. Desiccated berry fruit flavors carry the finish on this drink-now reserva from a generous vintage.

title: Alidis 2011 VS  (Ribera del Duero)
description: This Tempranillo's red berry jam and oak aromas lean savory and saucy. On the palate, lip-smacking, tomato-like acidity sends a jolt through plum, currant and oak spice flavors, the oak lingering on the finish. Drink over the next 15 years.

title: Basagoiti 2014 Fuera del Rebaño  (Rioja)
description: Sweet oak, berry fruit and clove aromas lead to a palate centered on racy acidity. Salty plum and red berry flavors conclude with drying tannins, feeling bold and fresh. Drink through 2022.

title: Huguet de Can Feixes 2016 Blanc Selecció White (Penedès)
description: Apple, melon and apricot aromas are pure and come with zero interference from natural funk or oak. A blend of mostly Parellada with Macabeo and other white grapes, it hails from the highest vineyards in the Penedès. Flavors of melon, lime and wet stones reflect gravelly soils, and it's steady on a long finish.

title: Bodegas Aquitania 2017 Bernon Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Entirely fresh aromas of apple and honeydew rank as pure and inviting. On the palate, this is buffed and stony, like a good Rías Baixas Albariño should be. Nectarine and citrus flavors finish well on a long, effortless finish.

title: Bodegas Landaluce 2015 Capricho de Landaluce  (Rioja)
description: Wiry aromas of blackberry and cherry are scratchy and reduced more than smooth and expansive. This Rioja is racy and fresh on the palate, with all sorts of verve. Flavors of plum and black currant are touched up by clove and pepper notes, while this shows dry oak and peppery spice on a firm finish. Drink through 2024.

title: Sierra Cantabria 2014  Rioja
description: Aromas of berry jam, marzipan and animal fur open this full, tannic Garnacha. Flavors of oak and resin vie for top billing with herbal berry notes, while this feels firm and grippy on the finish. An obvious oak character rings on the close.

title: Avancia 2017 Old Vines Godello (Valdeorras)
description: Apple and green herb aromas lead to a chunky palate with pulp and fleshiness cut by blazing acidity and minerality. Flavors of nectarine, green apple, white pepper and wet stone take a while to wrap up due to amplified residual acidity on the finish.

title: Marques de Griñon 2013 Single Vineyard Estate Bottled Petit Verdot (Dominio de Valdepusa)
description: Baked black plum and cassis aromas are dark and rich on the nose. The palate is bold in baked blackberry and plum flavors, with a chocolate and toast note that lingers through the finish. Drink through 2025.

title: Generacion 8 2010 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Chunky black-fruit aromas are on the raisiny side. On the palate, this feels blocky, bumpy and scratchy. Dark black-fruit flavors are earthy and baked, while this finishes slow and steady, with a forward note of coffee grounds. Drink through 2024.

title: Pago de Carraovejas 2014 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Saucy, gritty aromas of molasses, savory plum and road tar are more dark and brooding than fruity. This blend of Tempranillo, Cabernet and Merlot is tight and collected on the palate, with gritty, oaky flavors of blackberry and dark plum. A peppery, spicy finish gets much of its taste from the barrel. Drink through 2023.

title: Carlos Moro 2014 Finca Valdehierro 16 Meses Barrica Tempranillo (Cigales)
description: Heavily oaked and charred aromas of saucy berry fruits and espresso lead to a choppy, astringent palate. Reedy plum and berry flavors are a touch herbal and saucy. It feels tannic and drawing on an oaky finish that sports a clove note. Drink from 2018–2026.

title: Vinos de Arganza 2015 Legado D Farro Viña de Cantaloba Mencía (Bierzo)
designation: Legado D Farro Viña de Cantaloba
description: Floral berry and cassis aromas come with a sweet pastry note and a welcome hint of wild herbs. This Mencía feels tight and firm, with notable tannins and bold acidity. Plum and black currant flavors are touched up by a tropical hint of pineapple, while this feels drawing and tight on a sinewy finish. Drink through 2024.

title: Pradorey 2010 Elite  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Gritty tarry slightly gaseous aromas of jammy black fruits are a bit less than precise. This feels flush but soft around the edges. Blackened berry and black-plum flavors are lightly charred and chocolaty, while this tastes of black pepper and shows some heat on the finish. Drink through 2022.

title: Taron 2012 Cepas Centenarias  (Rioja)
description: Edgy cherry and currant aromas are more crisp than rich, while this old-vines Rioja also shows an aromatic note of dusty earth. High acidity tethered to a medium body creates some midpalate emptiness, while plum, currant and berry flavors are fresh on a pointy finish. Drink through 2024.

title: Uro 2011 Selección  (Toro)
description: Ripe toasty chocolaty aromas of prune and fig turn more volatile and jumpy with air. A tight perky palate with bold tartaric acidity is home to flavors of oak, vanilla, tobacco and spicy plum and berry fruits. Flavors of mocha and chocolate-chip cookie soften up an otherwise intense finish. Drink through 2021.

title: Albet I Noya 2013 Brut Natural Reserva Sparkling (Penedès)
description: Focused crisp aromas of white fruits reflect a cool vintage. This is roughly one-quarter each Macabeo, Parellada, Xarello and Chardonnay, and it feels tight, fresh and focused. Dry stone-fruit flavors include a hint of lime, while this is clean on the finish.

title: Alta Alella 2013 Privat Gran Reserva Brut Nature Sparkling (Cava)
description: Briny cidery aromas are fortunately not that loud or intense. This is wide and generous on the palate, with dry briny stone-fruit and apple flavors. A sense of dryness and pickle brine is amplified on a purposeful finish.

title: Baigorri 2015 Blanco Fermentado en Barrica Viura (Rioja)
description: Waxy lightly toasted aromas of yellow apple are more subtle than popping. This barrel-fermented wine offers good weight and balance along with quiet flavors of spiced apple and vanilla. A sophisticated clean finish is lightly oaked in flavor and smooth in feel.

title: Castellroig 2011 Gran Reserva Brut Nature Sparkling (Cava)
description: On the nose, this smells a touch yeasty and bready, similar to Saltine crackers. The mouthfeel on this sparkling wine is crisp and right on. Slightly bitter white-fruit flavors come with a dusting of white pepper and a lingering lime note on the dry finish.

title: Valdelacierva 2016 Grano a Grano  (Rioja)
description: Candied notes are attached to fruity plum and cassis aromas, while this feels clampy and rubbery, with almost no give to the palate. Foxy berry flavors are a touch buttery, while oak takes over on the finish. There will be many excellent high-end Riojas from the 2016 harvest; this one will blend into the field.

title: Losada 2014 Altos de Losada Mencía (Bierzo)
description: Smooth cool aromas of cedar, lemon peel and cola accent black-fruit scents on this easygoing Mencía. Reedy blackberry flavors come with notes of herbs and spice, while the finish is mild in acidity and hence soft and friendly. Drink now.

title: Freixenet 2007 Casa Sala Gran Reserva Brut Nature Sparkling (Cava)
designation: Casa Sala Gran Reserva Brut Nature
description: Yeasty pear and apple aromas set up a palate of mild citric acidity and leesy weight. Briny citrus flavors feature herbal notes of basil and tarragon, while this mature vintage brut nature is dry and complex on a slightly bitter finish.

title: Vinos de Arganza 2017 Viña Século Godello (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León
description: This wine's stone fruit and green apple aromas are lightly briny and focused. It features a tight, centered palate with vivid orange, lime and green melon flavors. The finish is compact, minerally and driven by energy.

title: Nubori 2012 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Ripe berry aromas suggest prune and raisin. Given the nose, it's no surprise that this is plump, chewy and dense on the palate. Roasted berry flavors are at max ripeness and touched up by spice and clove notes, while on the finish this is chunky, with tannic bite. Drink now.

title: Emina 2015 Fermentado en Barrica Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Aromas of apple and hay are slightly oily but nice. Bright acidity renders this fresh and not too chunky, while flavors of dry oak, melon and salted apple finish steady, with a hint of lemon. If you are interested in barrel-fermented Verdejo, this is a good place to start.

title: Mar de Frades 2016 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: In this vintage, the wine itself is as catchy as Mar de Frades's signature blue bottle. Aromas of green melon, apple and lees are spot on for the variety. Flavors of pineapple and citrus finish with modest complexity carried by the presence of lees.

title: Viña Otano 2010 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Roasted berry aromas include a leafy note and a hint of grilled meat. This is a muscled-up blend of Tempranillo, Graciano and Mazuelo, and the secondary players add punch. Raw berry flavors are helped by a dash of brown sugar, while this feels plush and bullish on the finish. Drink through 2028.

title: Montecillo 2010 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Modest but classy raspberry, plum and oak spice aromas get this gran reserva going in the right direction. A full-bodied palate reveals edgy tannins, while this tastes lightly toasted and blackened, with plum and berry fruit at the foundation of a long, steady finish. Drink now through 2022.

title: Alta Alella 2016 Blanc de Neu Organic White (Alella)
description: Aromas of grilled corn, haystack and dried apricot are far from fruity and peppy, and while this is a bit heavy on the palate, it finds its groove amid honeyed flavors of stone fruit and pineapple. By the time this finishes, mango and pineapple flavors are in full bloom. Drink now.

title: Rioja Vega 2012 Gran Reserva Estate Bottled  (Rioja)
description: Earthy aromas of savory black fruits and black olive lead to a full and tannic palate that's a bit rough. Toasty, slightly burnt berry flavors finish firm but short, with hard tannins and grit. For a 2012 gran reserva, this is on key but doesn't shine.

title: Ramirez de la Piscina 2015 Selección Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Ripe, chunky black fruit aromas reflect a hot year but get a freshness boost from lemony oak. A thick palate is creamy and oaky, with prune, vanilla and chocolate flavors. A fat finish is almost too ripe and heavy, but not quite. This should appeal to fans of ripe red wines.

title: Muga 2018 Flor De Muga Rosé (Rioja)
description: A yeasty note of cured ham is noted on this lightly oaked high-end Rioja rosé. A fresh palate, with a woody texture, offers flavors of oak grain, peach and cantaloupe prior to a steady, fresh finish that reverberates with oak and minerally notes.

title: Valderiz 2014 Valdehermoso Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: A compelling mix of berry, oak, mocha and earthy aromas is true to Ribera del Duero and moderately complex. A tight, tannic palate delivers blackberry and smoked meat flavors prior to a fleshy, meaty tasting finish. Drink through 2021.

title: Castell d'Encus 2014 Thalarn Syrah (Costers del Segre)
description: An unusual opening of cookie dough and black-fruit aromas suggests a ripe wine, and this is definitely on the full side. While the palate is chunky and lacks a distinct focal point, flavors of tomato, herbs and baked plum are complex and meaty. A leathery feel along with herbal plum flavors defines the finish.

title: Sangenís I Vaqué 2004 Coranya Red (Priorat)
description: Earthy plum and berry aromas are lightly herbal, with a note of eucalyptus. In the mouth, this is gritty and grabby, which is surprising given that it's 12 years old. Gritty peppery berry flavors comfortably fade away on a spicy finish. Drink through 2024.

title: Enate 2012 Merlot (Somontano)
description: Ripe, stout and smoky dark-berry aromas are spicy and a bit hot. This lush Merlot from a warm year is voluminous and chubby, with heft and full extraction. Spicy, toasty blackberry and cassis flavors come with chocolaty oak, while this is dense, chewy and mouth coating on the finish. Drink through 2019.

title: Pittacum 2011 Mencía (Bierzo)
description: While the nose on this well-aged Mencía is damp, earthy and almost nutty smelling, the palate is healthy, with biting tannins. Familiar black-fruit flavors are oaky but not overdone. It tastes saucy and slightly herbal on a racy, intense finish.

title: Mar de Frades 2017 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Citrus and mineral aromas are clean and proper for top-level Albariño from Rías Baixas. A lean tangy citric palate is exact and stony in feel. Lemon-lime and green-apple flavors are tight and tart, while this remains lively and tart on an acid-driven finish.

title: Amador Diez 2015 Cuvée Verdejo (Rueda)
description: A gold color and a strong scent of new oak are backed by spiced-apple aromas. A lemony palate is ripping with core acidity, which is the vital offset to this barrel-fermented Verdejo's dominant oak component. Salty lemon and tangerine flavors finish long and with a distant flavor note of oxidized white fruits. Drink through 2020.

title: Viñas del Cenit 2014 Aleo Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León
description: Dark, earthy, herbal berry flavors are full-force on a nose. Plenty of grip and spunk drive a firm palate. Cherry, plum, berry and chocolate flavors make for a rich Tempranillo with lasting toasty darkness to the finish. Drink through 2020.

title: Bodegas Fuentespina 2012 First Label  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Creamy oak aromas shout “vanilla” and “wood resin” in full voice. This is a rough wine with stampeding tannins. Toasty boysenberry flavors are more pounding than elegant, while this tastes of bitter chocolate on an aggressive finish. Give this five years and it may show better but now it's massive and unsettled.

title: Bodegas Ramon Ramos 2011 Monte Toro Crianza  (Toro)
description: Ripe dense aromas of blackberry and cassis border on prune and raisin but pull back. A compact saturated palate is held together by hard, pounding tannins, while grapy black-fruit flavors show a chocolaty note of fudge. A condensed tannic finish is heavy and feels a bit overextracted.

title: Ego Bodegas 2016 Infinito Red (Jumilla)
description: A dense nose is loaded to the hilt with ripe berry, raisin and prune aromas. This Monastrell-led blend is giant on the palate, with rubbing tannins. Forceful oak results in chocolate and vanilla flavors on top of blackberry fruit, while on the finish graphite and herbal-medicinal notes help with complexity.

title: Volver 2016 Triga Red (Alicante)
description: A warm nose is a bit unsettled and strained due to high alcohol and full ripeness of Monastrell and Cabernet Sauvignon fruit. A heavy, almost soupy mouthfeel is almost over the line, while dark plum, blackberry and coffee flavors conclude on a finish that's so ripe and weighty that it's arguably lazy; drink only if rich and ripe reds are your thing.

title: Fillaboa 2017 Selección Finca Monte Alto Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Floral aromas of honeysuckle and cured ham are particular to the vineyard and extended lees aging. This is full in body, with just enough acidity to keep the balance right. Melon and apple flavors are leesy like the nose, while the finish is consistent. For something different and individual, drink this now.

title: 12 Linajes 2013 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Blackberry, cassis, tire rubber and black olive aromas include a note of vanilla. In the mouth, this cool-vintage Crianza is pinching and tannic. Berry and vanilla flavors are solid but not evolved, while this feels tight, tannic and raw on the finish. Given how cool 2013 was, this is fairly generous. Drink through 2022.

title: Valduero 2012 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)
description: A dense nose with cola, lemony oak and vanilla notes sets up a bulky, ripe palate with raisiny weight. Ripe black-fruit flavors are jammy and accented by vanilla, while this remains oaky on a ripe finish. Drink through 2022.

title: Lleiroso 2012 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Initial murky aromas clear up while remaining a bit gritty and stalky. This crianza has a raw, choppy feel. Gritty, earthy flavors of leathery plum and berry fruits finish peppery and spicy. Drink through 2022.

title: Parxet 2014 Brut Reserva Sparkling (Cava)
description: Yeasty, melony aromas come with a note of sourdough bread. This feels round, citric and tight, with lime, orange and bready flavors. A crisp citrusy finish exudes a sense of elegance along with freshness.

title: Monteabellón 2013 14 Meses en Barrica  (Ribera del Duero)
description: A malty earthy woody nose with berry, vanilla and tobacco aromas is complete and generous. This is a bit tough and acidic, but that bodes well for the future. Flavors of marzipan, vanilla, coconut, mocha, black plum and raisin finish with depth and length. Drink through 2023.

title: Suertes del Marqués 2014 La Solana Listán Negro Cordón Trenzado Red (Valle de la Orotava)
designation: La Solana Listán Negro Cordón Trenzado
description: This Tenerife blend holds Listán Negro and Cordón Trenzado. The nose is a bit green and grassy, like cool-climate Cabernet. In the mouth, the wine is pulling and rugged, with rawness. Herbal, peppery red-fruit flavors feature a pyranzine-based taste of red chili, while the finish shows hard tannins and simmering heat. Drink through 2021.

title: Viñas del Vero 2011 Secastilla Garnacha (Somontano)
description: Ripe, slightly sunbaked aromas of berry fruits, plum and raisin include notes of vanilla and oak grain. A medium-bodied palate is agile, fresh and juicy. Oak-aided flavors of coffee, mocha and chocolate accent plum and berry fruit. Despite a drawing, dense finish, this high-elevation Garnacha remains upright in stature. Drink through 2023.

title: Rioja Vega 2014 Reserva Producción Limitada Tempranillo Blanco (Rioja)
description: This barrel-fermented Tempranillo Blanco is low in intensity on the nose. However, in the mouth it is linear and shows strong acidity. Oxidized, old-school flavors of dry white fruits and oak finish long and mellow. Drink this classic white Rioja through 2020.

title: Sierra Cantabria 2016 Organza White (Rioja)
description: Barrel-heavy aromas of raw oak and vanilla dominate the nose on this blend of Viura, Malvasia and Garnacha Blanca. Lively acidity gives life and balance to a full resiny palate, while this tastes much like it smells: oaky and briny, with citrusy undertones. A mild finish that's nutty and salty is lasting.

title: Abadia Retuerta 2014 Selección Especial Red (Sardon de Duero)
description: Ripe berry aromas are matched by hefty oak-based scents of lemon, vanilla and toast. In the mouth, this is chunky and obtuse, with a blocky overall feel. Prune, blackberry and oaky toast flavors are grapy and a bit soft on a chunky finish.

title: Rio Madre 2016  Rioja
description: Jammy smashed-berry aromas include coffee notes and something vaguely saucy. A big and blocky palate is both oaky and tannic, while this tastes of baked berry fruits and cassis. Raw tannins make for a grabby finish.

title: Tionio 2013  Ribera del Duero
description: Racy berry aromas come with a hint of oaky cinnamon. This feels raw, tannic and dense. Flavors of roasted plum, dry oak, savory spices and grilled meat finish firm and taste toasty. Drink through 2022.

title: Rosa Nautica 2017 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Floral aromas are honeyed and pleasant. Strong acidity gives teeth to the palate, while this tastes mostly of tangerine and lemon, with some tropical sweetness. A citrusy finish with golden-apple notes closes this out.

title: Pingón 2014 Torre Pingón Selección  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Earthy berry aromas are loaded with gritty notes of black olive and coffee grounds, meaning the nose is none too bright. A choppy palate is rough and drawing, while this tastes of soy sauce, pepper and dark berry fruits. A tough drying jagged finish lowers the smoothness factor on this hard-pounding RDD. Drink through 2030.

title: Nora 2013 Nora da Neve Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Yellow in color, with subdued aromas of apple and squash, this feels creamy and a touch flat. Baked and buttered apple flavors finish dry and salty. For oak-aged Albariño, this is well done. Drink now.

title: Monterebro 2014 Selección Red (Jumilla)
description: Ripe black-plum and spice aromas are dense and blocky. This is 85% Syrah and 15% Monastrell, with a jammy palate and a touch of heat and flab. Flavors of raisin, blackberry and prune finish earthy, with an echo of prune and moderately scratchy tannins.

title: Muga 2015 Barrel Fermented White (Rioja)
description: Stone-fruit and melon aromas are minerally. This feels linear and tight due to racy acidity. Flavors of white fruits, lime and stones are slightly tart, while this is short but firm on the finish. For barrel-fermented Viura, this is not oaky in any overt way.

title: Dominio de Atauta 2015 Torre de Golbán Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Cheesy oak aromas combine with earthy black fruit scents on a nose that's not in top gear but isn't stalled, either. A huge, tannic palate rates as a wide load, while flavors of blackberry and black cherry are short on depth and complexity. As might be expected, this is hard as rocks on the finish. Drink through 2024.

title: Gotas de Mar 2016 Fermentado En Barrica Godello (Ribeiro)
description: Spiced pumpkin and oily stone fruit aromas are not overtly oaky as they feed into a full palate that's short on acidity and length. Salty, briny melon, peach and banana flavors show some oak character, while this barrel-fermented Godello stays the course on a plump finish that tastes salty.

title: Mas Blanch I Jové 2015 Petit Saó Red (Costers del Segre)
description: Solid berry, cassis and raisin aromas seem right for a warm-vintage blend of Tempranillo, Garnacha and Cabernet Sauvignon. Ripe black cherry, berry and oaky chocolate flavors finish chewy and dense, which is the best way to describe this blend from Costers del Segre in Catalonia.

title: Rioja Vega 2016 Edición Limitada Rosado (Rioja)
description: Raspberry and plum aromas are fresh and inviting. A full, fresh, popping palate is lively, while a cross of cherry, raspberry and citrus flavors is whetting and tasty. A zesty, steady finish confirms the fairly high quality.

title: Quinta de Couselo 2018 Turonia Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Ripe, oily aromas of pineapple, melon and pine open this pulpy, full-bodied Alabriño. Flavors of melon, pineapple and mango are warm and full, while this holds onto its fruit on a big finish with a hint of burn.

title: Tarón 2015 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Cherry and berry aromas include spice and oak notes. For a ripe year, this Crianza is as expected in terms of mouthfeel, meaning it's full but also fresh. Salty plum, red-currant, tomato-leaf and oak-spice flavors finish steady, with a lasting tomato-sauce note.

title: Artadi 2014 Garnacha (Navarra)
description: This wine's earthy cherry and plum aromas come with a hint of milk chocolate. The palate is edged with rubbery tannins, its savory, lightly salted plum flavors growing jammier and more fig-like as it breathes. A textbook fruit-forward Grenache.

title: Torelló 2014 225 Brut Nature Sparkling (Cava)
description: Yeasty, bready aromas are mature and indicate that this is no newbie. Briny acidity is bracing at first but then falls off. Savory, saucy flavors of briny apple and pickle juice steer a mature finish with complexity. By no means is this faultless, but if you like older Cava it's worth a go.

title: Castellroig 2017 Sabaté i Coca Corpinnat Reserva Brut Nature Sparkling (Spain)
designation: Sabaté i Coca Corpinnat Reserva Brut Nature
