description: Lemon-lime aromas are slightly briny and dusty. This brut nature sparkler carries the new Corpinnat designation, meaning it's no longer Cava. On the palate it is clean and medium in body. Orange and citrus-peel flavors are direct but limited in depth and complexity.

title: Marqués de Cáceres 2013 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Plum and cherry aromas are riper than might be expected for a cool-vintage 2013 crianza. Chewy, drawing tannins lend grip to the palate that tastes of black plum, tea and dry spices. A bit of oaky chocolate is present on the finish.

title: Finca Arantei 2016 Single Vineyard Estate Bottled Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Lemon-drop aromas are fresh and show a touch of green apple. This wine is solid, but a bit basic. Lightly salted melon and apricot flavors finish dry and collected.

title: Granbazán 2017 Etiqueta Verde Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Citrus and tropical fruit aromas are punchy and high toned. A lemony palate is softened by leesy notes, while this tastes dry and of lean white fruit and white pepper. A tight finish is focused but not all that fruity or flavorful.

title: La Caña 2017 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: A mineral-driven nose includes oceanic notes of sea brine to go with apple and light oak scents. Sizzling acidity is in the green-apple realm, while this Albariño tastes of Granny Smith apple, gooseberry, oak and lees. A tangy, pinched finish is salty and firm.

title: Vinos de Arganza 2017 Encanto Godello (Bierzo)
description: This offers appealing, straightforward apple and white peach aromas. It's rounder than it is racy, with green melon and slate notes. The finish is clean, elegant and fairly long.

title: Bodegas Leda 2015 Viñas Viejas Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León
description: Dense raisin and blackberry aromas tilt this in the direction of overripe. On the full, beefy palate, grating tannins frame spicy prune and cassis flavors. A heavy, tannic finish confirms the wine's overtly ripe character, with toasty oak influence.

title: Mas de Subirà 2015 Vi De Guarda Red (Priorat)
description: Raisin, prune, spiced berry and vanilla aromas are a touch cooked, which reflects a hot, dry vintage. A smacking palate is intense, tannic and high in acidity, leading to tart plum and cherry flavors that are cut by oaky vanilla and a touch of back-end raisin. In terms of weight, ripeness and oak, this covers the full spectrum; drink through 2022.

title: Besllum 2012 Red (Montsant)
description: Earthy red berry aromas include notes of coffee and fallen leaves. A medium-bodied palate is solid and focused. Dry raspberry, currant and plum flavors are reserved more than effusive, while this blend of Carignan, Garnacha and Syrah offers cocoa and mild red fruit notes on a finish with dry tannins.

title: Inurrieta 2011 Cuatrocientos Crianza Red (Navarra)
description: Dark berry aromas are calm and oaky. This blend of 60% Merlot and 40% Cabernet Sauvignon feels full and blocky, although bold acidity helps. Minty, oaky flavors of plum, cassis and tomato are salty and spicy, while this runs long on a finish that boasts a ripe-fruit base.

title: Victoria Ordóñez 2016 Monticara White (Sierras de Málaga)
description: This wine's gardenia, honeysuckle and tropical fruit aromas are the hallmarks of Moscatel. The palate is narrow yet refined, with lychee and pineapple flavors. The finish is short and marked by bell pepper notes.

title: Emina 2014 Prestigio Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Leathery blackberry, vanilla and tobacco aromas include a gritty burnt note that's not entirely welcome. This feels full and oaky, with good balance. Oak-based flavors of vanilla and mocha sit atop black-fruit notes, while this is balanced yet tannic on the finish, with a lingering flavor of vanilla. Drink from 2018–2023.

title: La Caña 2013 Navia Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: A yellowish color announces this oaked Albariño. Aromas of sunflower seeds and stone fruits are more mellow than loud. Creamy and full bodied, this benefits from bold malic acidity. Flavors of summer corn, dried apple and wood resin finish salty. Drink now with fish, crab or lobster.

title: Carlos Moro 2017 Finca San Cibrao White (Ribeiro)
description: This Ribeiro's focused citrus and peach aromas are clean and nice. Its citrusy palate offers lean tangerine and apple flavors, with round edges and a dry finish marked by salt and distant bitter notes.

title: Contino 2011 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Gritty, herbal berry aromas smell much like asphalt. Following the nose, this is tight and raw in feel. Burnt, herbal, gritty plum flavors finish clipped and drawing, with pinching tannins and dark spice notes.

title: Pazo Pondal 2015 Godello (Bierzo)
description: This Godello feels composed and solid. Dry white-fruit aromas are reticent and oily. Flavors of peach and golden apple finish with stability and a sense of class. Drink now.

title: Pagos de Valcerracin 2013 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Fig and raisin aromas blend with damp earth and animal notes on the nose of this grippy, bumpy crianza lacks focus but is still quite good. Black cherry, herbal plum and toasty oak flavors finish sticky and with lasting oak. Drink through 2025.

title: Valdelana 2014 Agnus Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Spicy, briary berry aromas are subtle and reserved, but sound. This wine is firm and a bit drawing on the palate, with flavors of plum, berry fruits and cocoa. Mild berry flavors on the finish are tasty and not pushy or overdone.

title: Palacios Remondo 2014 Placet Viura (Rioja)
description: Equal parts of peach pit, petrol and oak aromas drive this Viura towards a round, full palate. Nutty flavors of popcorn and dry fruits are modest but elevated, while this tastes similarly of stone fruits, salt and oak on the finish.

title: Perelada 2013 Gran Claustro Reserva But Nature Sparkling (Cava)
description: Waxy white-fruit aromas are a touch austere and harsh. This holds a tight, crisp palate with flavors of yeast, apple and citrus fruits. A short, clean finish ensures that this closes with ease and clarity.

title: Avancia 2017 Cuvée de O Godello (Valdeorras)
description: Aromas of apple and fresh yellow squash are not overly bright. Like its old-vines big brother, this Godello delivers bold acidity and a sense of minerality on the palate. Apple and stone fruit flavors are ripe and steady through the finish.

title: Roque Colás 2012 Viticultura Ecológica Red (Calatayud)
description: Ripe blackberry aromas combat raisin and prune scents in this concentrated four-grape blend. Its black fruit flavors include black tea and savory spice notes, finishing with medium-hard tannins and distinct oak characteristics. Drink through 2019.

title: Remírez de Ganuza 2010 Trasnocho Reserva  (Rioja)
description: This intense Tempranillo burns with alcohol and charred oak on the nose. Its almost-burnt black fruit flavors finish with rough, rugged, drying tannins as well as briary, oaky berry notes. Drink 2019–2035.

title: Terras Gauda 2016 Abadía de San Campio Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Moderately floral aromas of stone fruits and fresh carrot juice feed into a round palate that's balanced and well shaped. Nectarine and peach flavors are nice and easy. This wine is slightly leesy-tasting on a medium-length finish.

title: Teso La Monja 2017 Romanico  (Toro)
description: Blackberry and blueberry aromas are full and spicy like pie. This Toro is big and extracted, with road-grating tannins. Toasty, blackened berry flavors are ripe and rugged, while this is ramming in feel and toasty in flavor on the finish.

title: Alidis 2012 Gran Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)
description: A beefy, brothy nose is stewy and dense, with none of the elegance and comfort that great wines should show. Instead, this is big and saturated on the palate, with raisin, baked berry and stewed flavors. Gummy weight and chocolaty flavors fuel a rich finish.

title: Bodegas Muriel 2015 Finca de la Villa Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Earthy aromas of ripe berry fruits blend well with spicy oak and vanilla notes. A lively palate with bright acidity puts out flavors of spiced plum, tomato, red currant and dried earth. This is a classic Rioja crianza that's honest, fresh and eminently drinkable over the next few years.

title: Bodegas Ondarre 2014 Rivallana Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Earthy berry fruit aromas are more foresty and mulchy than bright and fresh. A tight, drawing palate is tannic and high in acidity. Like the nose, this tastes saucy, earthy and tomatoey, while a steady finish confirms that this is traditional Rioja reserva.

title: Rejadorada 2016 Roble  (Toro)
description: Dark berry aromas are slightly complex and minerally, with a hint of hot stones. This Toro feels big and fleshy, but also slightly choppy. Blackberry, plum and chocolate flavors slowly drift away on a steady, direct finish.

title: Marqués de la Concordia 2006 Federico Paternina Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: First-take aromas of raisin and cotton candy are soft and sweet. Following that lead, this feels chunky but adequately acidic. Herbal, reedy raspberry and plum flavors finish with spice and chocolate notes. Drink now.

title: CVNE 2013 Cune Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Earthy berry aromas are adequate but not the stuff of legend. In the mouth, this off-vintage gran reserva is solid but a bit jagged and choppy. Warm, earthy plum and berry flavors come with a mild chocolate backing prior to a balanced finish. Given the difficulties of 2013, namely extended cold weather, this is commendable. Drink through 2030.

title: Marqués de la Concordia 2014 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Berry and cherry aromas are soapy at first, then deeper and cleaner with airing. This reserva offers a bouncy, saturated palate with lift. Berry fruit and black plum flavors are spiced up on a robust finish.

title: Bodega Andrés Iniesta 2013 Corazón Loco Selección Red (Manchuela)
description: Rubbery black-fruit aromas include notes of black olive and pepper. This blend of Tempranillo, Syrah, Cabernet Sauvignon and Petit Verdot shows a fair amount of pop and energy before softening up and losing steam. Cherry, plum and currant flavors come with chocolaty oak prior to a finish that curls up rather than extending. Drink now.

title: Bodegas Vegalfaro 2015 Caprasia Crianza Anfora Bobal (Utiel-Requena)
description: Warm black-fruit aromas are rubbery, scratchy and undeniably ripe. This Bobal was fermented in clay anfora, and the mouthfeel is screechy, grabby and tartaric. Rustic, gamy blackberry and black-plum flavors are a touch salty and finish chunky and bearish.

title: Viña Otano 2015 Blanco Fermentado en Barrica White (Rioja)
description: This shimmering barrel-fermented blend of 75% Viura and 25% Tempranillo Blanco opens with stable aromas of apple, butter and fresh corn. An elegant fairly light palate delivers a mix of dry oak, nectarine, peach and apple flavors. This is lithe and comfortable on the finish, with modest but noticeable residual oak.

title: Finca Allende 2015 White (Rioja)
description: A yellow color and aromas of spiced pumpkin, baked apple and resiny oak get this blend of 95% Viura and Malvasia going. This is full and resiny in feel, resting between creamy and tight. An upfront oak flavor masks green banana and spiced apple notes prior to a mature finish.

title: Ego Bodegas 2016 Goru Red (Jumilla)
description: Smoky berry aromas ooze toasted oak and campfire, while under that black fruit scents exhibit a touch of green. This varietal Monastrell is saturated and full. Grapy black fruit flavors come with more than enough toasted oak and burnt notes, while the finish is long, lasting, rubbery and tannic.

title: Muga 2016 Rosé (Rioja)
description: Clean aromas of apricot and cantaloupe are fresh, stony and not too pushy. This has a nice mouthfeel driven by zesty acidity. Nectarine and melon flavors are clean as river stones, and long lasting.

title: De Moya 2015 Sophia Bobal (Valencia)
description: This Bobal's smoky berry aromas include a blast of burnt rubber. It's dense and plush, with the variety's typical rubbery tannins. Blackberry and oaky chocolate flavors lead to an equally chocolaty finish.

title: Pazo San Mauro 2016 San Amaro Sobre Lías White (Rías Baixas)
description: Briny white fruit aromas are leesy as the sobre lías (on lees) in the name implies. But given its age, this is not overly fruity on the nose. A pulpy palate is balanced by citric acidity, while this blend of 76% Albariño and 24% Loureiro tastes of orange, lemon and persimmon topped with salt. While this is still in good shape, it won't stay that way forever. Drink now.

title: Atalayas de Golbán 2015 Torre d'Golbán Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Reduced aromas of gritty berry fruits and rubber need all the air they can get. A tannic palate is tight and tough, with flavors of baked plum that run hot and heavy. A scratchy tannic finish brings this hard and tannic Tinto Fino to a close.

title: Castellroig 2012 Sabaté i Coca Corpinnat Josep Coca Brut Nature Sparkling (Spain)
designation: Sabaté i Coca Corpinnat Josep Coca Brut Nature
description: Mild apple aromas are at the front of a subdued nose. In the mouth, this warm-year sparkler is easygoing, with dry melon and mellow stone-fruit flavors. A comported finish includes notes of green banana, citrus and sea brine.

title: Resalte 2015 Vendimia Seleccionada  (Ribera del Duero)
description: This jammy, pulpy wine opens with blackberry and cassis aromas and follows through with a mashup of blackberry and black plum flavors. It finishes on soy sauce and stewed berry notes.

title: Crápula 2016 CR Soul Monastrell (Jumilla)
description: Aromas of Band-Aid, wet cement, cinnamon and black fruits lead to a thick, jammy, pulpy palate that bleeds ripeness. Sappy blackberry and plum flavors finish with savory notes of grilled meat. Overall, this captures the essence of Jumilla Monastrell.

title: Albet I Noya 2016 Efecte Reserva Brut Rosé Sparkling (Penedès)
description: Stone fruit and red apple aromas set up a punchy, fresh and citric palate. This bright Penedès sparkler (don't call it Cava) tastes of pink grapefruit and peach, while the finish is fresh and forward.

title: Creencia 2015 Con Virtud Dry Farmed Monastrell (Jumilla)
description: Typical of fully ripe Monastrell from Jumilla, this is a thick, massive wine from head to toe. Prune, blackberry, cassis and raisin aromas push into Port territory, while this is as expected on the palate: heavy, sappy, saturated and seemingly bolstered by tartaric acid. Baked flavors of dark berry fruits, black currant and chocolate finish with the heat and burn that comes with 15.5% ABV. This is recommended only if you like extracted, full-bodied wines; look elsewhere if you want elegance, lightness and a feathery touch.

title: Vionta 2017 Limited Release Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Aromas of lanolin, orange and green melon are perfectly sound. This has a plump but citrusy mouthfeel and snappy flavors of orange and fresh lettuce. Keep your expectations reasonable and this is more than just good: it's actually very good, especially for the price.

title: Dominio del Soto 2015 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Aromas of stalky berry fruits, herbs and sea shell improve little by little with airing. This is full, chewy and plump on a palate, with modest acidity. Berry, cassis and chocolaty oak flavors thicken up on a dense finish.

title: Bodega Classica 2016 El Pacto  (Rioja)
description: Berry, spice and vanilla aromas are meaty and forceful. An obtuse palate is more tannic than deeply structured, while this tastes of ripe plum and oak, with a charred character coming into play on the finish.

title: Izadi 2013 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Oak and related vanilla aromas are prominent. This is a high-acid Rioja with starchy tannins. Resiny, oaky flavors of berry fruits are topped with pepper, clove and other spice notes. This tastes toasty on the finish, with persistent acidity creating length.

title: Bodegas Franco-Españolas 2012 Excelso Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Dark-plum and baking-spice aromas lead a nose that's warm, murky and a touch unclear. A gritty medium- to full-bodied palate offers spicy plum and raspberry flavors in front of a compact finish with lasting savory notes. Drink through 2020.

title: Bodegas Olarra 2015 Sagasta Reserva  (Rioja)
description: A full and chunky nose includes aromas of herbal berry, tobacco and tar. A plump palate, with weight and grabbiness, deals blueberry, prune, raisin and vanilla flavors. Ripeness is confirmed on a hefty but sturdy finish of medium length.

title: Valenciso 2011 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Leafy aromas are on the stalky, damp and stewed side and not particularly fresh or fruity. In the mouth, this is more bright and bold, with earthy, stalky plum and hard spice flavors. A note of oxidation appears on a finish that tastes toasty on the surface—very good but not great.

title: Larchago 2012 Reserva Edición Fábulas  (Rioja)
description: Ripe berry aromas meander towards desiccated plum and cassis. Staying with that theme, this feels plump and fleshy, with blackberry and barrel-spice flavors that are well integrated. A sappy and pulpy feeling finish tastes of vanilla and chocolate.

title: Familia Bastida 2015 Paraje de Tito Garnacha (La Mancha)
description: Baked, earthy black fruit aromas come with a heavy topping of cola and root beer scents. Old-vine Garnacha in a warm, dry year like 2015 equals weight and aggressive tannins on the palate. Pulpy blackberry, salt and toast flavors finish chocolaty, with clawing dryness.

title: Finca Albret 2013 Reserva Red (Navarra)
description: Raisiny berry aromas are jumpy and foxy as well. In the mouth, this feels dry like desiccated fruits. Black plum, oak and vanilla flavors finish flush and full but also tough and intense. Five years after harvest and this is no easy ride.

title: Príncipe de Viana 2014 1423 Reserva Tempranillo-Garnacha (Navarra)
description: This blend of 80% Tempranillo and 20% Garnacha shows the Garnacha side of the blend via raspberry and raisiny aromas that offset reedy herbal notes. This feels fresh and sappy, while raspberry and red-currant flavors contain candied notes. A snappy finish, with peppery spice flavors, comes across raw and hot.

title: Portal del Priorat 2013 Negre De Negres Red (Priorat)
description: Rubber, Band-Aid and leathery red-fruit aromas open this blend of Garnacha, Carignan and Syrah. In the mouth, this is blocky and collapsed. Roasted plum and berry flavors carry a medicinal note, while this is chewy and tastes lightly herbal on a tannic, weighty finish.

title: Ovidio García 2009 OG De Autor Reserva Tempranillo (Cigales)
description: Raisin, maple and vanilla aromas are derived from borderline overripe raw materials and 24 months in barrel. A hard palate pulls downward with massive tannins. Baked berry and chocolaty oak flavors finish with notes of berry pie and raisin.

title: Viñas del Cenit 2014 Venta Mazzaron Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León
description: A dark, roasted, smoky opening is the greeting on this burly Tempranillo from Zamora. Grabbing tannins pinch like squeaky rubbery, while this tastes of savory, roasted black fruits. A meaty, chewy, tannic finish is confirmation of overall toughness. Drink through 2021.

title: Basagoiti 2013 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Spicy reedy cherry and red-plum aromas open this high-acid sizzler from a cool vintage. Lean as a stick in terms of build, this tastes of raspberry, red plum and dry spices. A short but juicy and tight finish is ripping with acid. Drink through 2025.

title: Bodegas Faustino 2011 Faustino V Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Berry and plum aromas are so ripe that raisin enters the picture. This feels medium to full, with soft acidity. Flavors of chocolate and wood spice share space with ripe berry fruit, while a full, long finish deals mocha and raisin notes.

title: Bodegas Olarra 2010 Cerro Añon Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Gritty cassis aromas are oaky and challenging, which is what you can get when a wine spends more than three years in oak. In the mouth, this is wiry and rubbery. Foxy plum and cherry flavors finish clampy and herbal. Very good but with a few holes and pitfalls.

title: Columna 2017 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Fresh peach in a bowl describes how this nicely made Albariño smells. Its round, full-bodied palate is balanced with acidity. And its fresh peach and apricot flavors lead to a chalky, minerally finish.

title: Torroxal 2018 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Nectarine, green melon and dusty aromas get this off to a good start. A fleshy palate with cutting citric acidity feels right, while this tastes briny on top of stone-fruit and mild citrus flavors. A steady, slightly chalky finish helps this end well.

title: Fernández Gómez 2016 Selección Familia White (Rioja)
description: One sniff announces that this Viura-Malvasia-Garnacha Blanca blend is fully oaked, while good acidity cuts some of the wine's resiny weight. While barrel-based flavors are firmly in charge, this offers apple and stone-fruit notes prior to a finish that tastes slightly buttery.

title: Protos 2018 Verdejo (Rueda)
description: A fruit salad nose includes aromas of green melon, mixed citrus and apple. This is largely lean and linear on the palate, with just enough pulpy body to give it substance. Citrus and mild bell pepper flavors finish with a modest touch of bitterness. Drink immediately.

title: Castaño 2015 Solanera Viñas Viejas Red (Yecla)
description: This wine's berry and black plum aromas are generous and full, with a touch of lemony oak. A blend of Monastrell, Cabernet Sauvignon and Garnacha Tintorera, it's full bodied, with rubbery tannins. Earthy berry and plum flavors are warm and oaky; the finish is stout, with baked plum and berry flavors.

title: Bodegas Tobía 2015 Óscar Tobía Blanco Reserva White (Rioja)
description: Overt oak and waxy apple aromas introduce this barrel-fermented Viura-led blend. A full-bodied palate is resiny due to this having spent 18 months in barrel. Creamy woody flavors of melon and banana finish with minimal kick and acidity, so drink through 2021.

title: Tamaral 2013 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Dusty berry, resin and bell-pepper aromas suggest a marginally ripe wine with plenty of oak. A raw punchy choppy mouth feel and woody spicy plum and berry flavors are good but not very deep or evolved. A finish with hard tannins is par for the course.

title: Bodegas Eidosela 2016 Ethereo Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Apple and leesy aromas are largely fresh and textbook for the variety. A plump, slightly oily palate features just enough acidity, while peachy flavors of nectarine flatten out on the finish. Drink now.

title: Castillo Clavijo 2010 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Light, spicy aromas of mature, leafy berry fruits and herbs lead to a juicy and fresh palate. On the flavor side, this is dry and spicy, with tea, pepper and leafy berry notes that stay peppery and spicy on the finish.

title: Heredad Graula 2014 Reserva Red (Catalunya)
description: Dark berry aromas come with charred notes of burnt wood and clove. A thick, chewy palate is tannic and borders on being too much. Ripe blackberry flavors are candied and wild, while this settles on thick, oaky and chocolaty on the finish.

title: Bodegas Valdemar 2016 Inspiración Alto Cantabria Tempranillo Blanco (Rioja)
description: Ripe, pulpy stone-fruit aromas are slightly floral. This white Tempranillo feels round and plump, with moderate acidity. A full range of white-fruit flavors emphasizes melon, apple and peach, and it's steady and balanced on the finish.

title: Abad Dom Bueno 2017 Esencia Godello (Bierzo)
description: This barrel-fermented Godello doesn't pull any punches with its oak: The nose is woody and dominated by oak grain. A tight, linear palate is agile and fresh, not heavy or resiny. Flavors of lime, green apple and raw wood fade out on a tangy, popping finish. Drink through 2020.

title: Casa de la Ermita 2012 Idílico Monastrell-Petit Verdot (Jumilla)
description: Black-fruit aromas are spicy, with a note of cinnamon sticking out. This blend of Monastrell and Petit Verdot displays high acidity and related scratchiness on the palate. Tartness blends with plum and berry flavors, while this runs quick and tight on the finish.

title: Viña Mayor 2016 Tinto Roble  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Jammy plum and spice aromas show earthy grit upon deeper inspection. A full, fruity palate offers plenty of size and weight, while this tastes of blackberry, coffee and chocolate. Pulpy berry fruit flavors narrow down on the finish.

title: Marqués de Vargas 2012 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Lightly charred aromas of coffee, wood smoke and chocolate outweigh berry and plum scents. A tight palate shows firm tannins and carries roasted berry and plum flavors.

title: Terroir Al Límit 2016 Red (Priorat)
description: Floral red-fruit aromas show a touch of wild animal. The tight and choppy palate holds racy flavors of cherry and plum. A long, fruity finish rolls out little by little, with a lasting feel of grape skins.

title: Finca Allende 2014  Rioja
description: Prune and candied berry aromas are on the ripe side and thus lack liveliness. A saturated palate is full but slightly lazy and gummy, while this tastes of blackberry and plum. Complexity and deviation from the basics are lacking in this ripe Rioja.

title: Dominio Romano 2015 Camino Romano  (Ribera del Duero)
description: This wine's earthy berry and olive aromas are a bit rubbery. On the palate, it's raw and choppy but not too rough or intense. Its salty, lightly herbal berry and plum flavors end on a savory note.

title: Viñadecanes 2014 Tres Racimos Mencía (Bierzo)
description: Grapy berry aromas are oaky and a touch harsh. A fleshy pulpy palate is sturdy and tannic, while this tastes of airy dark fruits that are more fluffy than tough. Toast and blackberry flavors make for a no-nonsense finish.

title: Emilio Moro 2013 Malleolus  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Grassy green underdeveloped aromas are not what Emilio Moro wines are known for, but given that this is a 2013, these scents are not without foundation. The palate follows the nose with raw pulling tannins and green-leaning flavors of basil, plum and boysenberry. A tight scouring finish is consistent with what came before it.

title: Torres 2015 Celeste Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Cool, murky berry aromas are gamy. A blast of fruitiness propels a big palate loaded with spicy chocolaty oak. Bold berry flavors are short-lasting on a tight, intense finish. Crianzas are made to drink young, but this will benefit from more aging; drink through 2028.

title: Viña Mayor 2015 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Jammy berry aromas are forward but inexact. A tight powerful palate is narrow in scope, with peppery red-berry flavors propelled by lively acidity. Finishing notes of oak spice and cocoa are notable through a choppy but bold ending.

title: Bodegas Riojanas 2015 Monte Real de Familia Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Ripe aromas border on raisin and hoison sauce, with savory, baked berry notes. This is decidedly plump and chunky on the palate, with a jammy mouthfeel. Blackberry, chocolate and peppery spice flavors finish oaky in a traditional Rioja way.

title: Bodegas Carsalo 2017 Pazo Castrelo Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Floral melon and apple aromas come with a hint of lees-driven vanilla cookie. A pulpy palate deals tropical fruit and stone fruit flavors, while this Albariño is firm in feel and slightly salty tasting on a lasting finish.

title: Bodegas Leza García 2015 Tinto Familia Crianza  (Rioja)
description: A plush, jammy nose contains berry fruit and exotic spice aromas, all backed by violet and licorice hints. A full palate is fruity and balanced, while this tastes of baked plum and meaty berry fruits. A steady finish doesn't change much, meaning this is full and chunky on the back side.

title: Príncipe de Viana 2018 Edición Rosa Rosé (Navarra)
description: Clean, mild and welcoming aromas of cantaloupe open this pale-colored rosé. There's texture and fullness to the palate, along with dry melon flavors that rank as fresh. A steady finish takes a while to quit.

title: Valenciso 2012  Rioja
description: Earthy, slightly exotic aromas are unusual and suggest blueberry and tea. In the mouth, this is widespread and saturated. Grapey flavors are heavy and include a helping of toast, while this is dry, chewy and tannic on a finish that hints at oxidation.

title: Volver 2017 Quinta del '67 Vino Generacional Garnacha Tintorera (Almansa)
description: A dark color and heavy aromas of mint and oak lead the charge on this fully extracted Garnacha Tintorera. A concentrated, gritty palate is home to spicy woody black-fruit flavors, while peppery wood-spice notes dominate a loaded finish. If you're in search of elegance, pass this by; it's all about extraction, oak and black-fruit character.

title: Conde de Siruela 2014 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: This impresses with bold berry and spice aromas. On the palate, it's wiry in feel, with pounding acidity and hard tannins. Its salty, earthy plum and red berry flavors are fully oaked, with a severely dry and high-acid finish. Drink through 2027.

title: Hacienda del Carche 2013 Cepas Viejas Red (Jumilla)
description: Gamy aromas of wild berry fruits lead to a solid direct palate with good balance, cushion and acidity. Ripe flavors of black cherry and black plum finish firm, healthy and spicy, with touches of chocolate and toasty oak. This is 70% Monastrell and 30% Cabernet Sauvignon.

title: Castaño 2016 Alcaria Red (Yecla)
description: This blend of Monastrell, Syrah and Garnacha Tintorera feels lively, its dark plum and berry aromas laced with chocolate. Smacking tannins create a dry sensation, framing ripe black plum and prune flavors. Complex notes of spice and tomato emerge on the firm finish.

title: Catania 2014 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Ripe berry, black cherry and leather aromas come together nicely in front of a creamy palate with just enough acid-tannin tension. Lightly herbal, spicy blackberry flavors are savory rather than dark and fruity. The wine tastes spicy and peppery on a finish that feels right.

title: Maetierra Dominum 2009 QP Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Earthy berry aromas come with notes of beef stock and dried leaves. A clampy palate with rubbery tannins is the opposite of smooth, while this wine tastes of raw plum, berry fruits and grape skins. It feels pinchy on the finish.

title: Bodegas Palacio 2013 Cosme Palacio Viñedos en Altitud Crianza  (Rioja)
designation: Cosme Palacio Viñedos en Altitud Crianza
description: Floral red-berry and cassis aromas are steady and fresh. In the mouth, this wine turns raw and jagged. Cranberry, currant and red-plum flavors show very little oak before a lean, powerful finish. This cool-vintage wine will last for years but probably not improve.

title: Bodegas Perica 2009 Viña Olagosa Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Baking spice and smoky wood-grain aromas are classy but dominate fruit scents. This wine feels crisp and snappy, with hard tannins. Spicy, woody flavors match the nose and are backed by chocolate and berry fruit notes, carrying through to the spicy, oaky finish.

title: Marqués de Riscal 2012 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Briary berry aromas are spicy but also earthy and a bit stewed. A chewy dense palate is more chunky than structured, while this tastes of charred wood and baked berry fruits. Given that 2012 was a very warm year, this is in good shape. Drink through 2022.

title: Alvides 2015 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Dark oaky aromas of minty black fruits are gritty and concentrated. Following that nose, this is grinding on the palate. Acid-pushed dark-fruit flavors come with an offset of oaky vanilla, while this is clipped and gappy in feel on the finish.

title: Uro 2012 Finca la Rana  (Toro)
description: Cherry and berry aromas come with a darker hint of road tar in this wine, accented by herbal notes. The palate is tight with lemony acidity and bold tannins, featuring dry, spicy red plum and cherry flavors. On the finish, it's dry, peppery and lightly herbal.

title: Vega Montán 2014 Mencía (Bierzo)
description: Slightly rubbery black cherry and blackberry aromas are generic but good. This feels round and easygoing, with soft tannins and modest acidity. Black-plum flavors fly solo, while this is nice but hollow on the finish. Drink now.

title: Old Hands 2017 Roble Monastrell (Yecla)
description: Aromas of warm rocks, black plum, mixed spices and scented bath soap lead to a firm palate with grabby tannins. Sun-rich flavors of berry fruits and cassis are backed by a steady finish, with chocolaty oak. For value-priced Monastrell, this is authentic and in good shape.

title: Abadia de Poblet 2016 White (Conca de Barberà)
description: Melony aromas are dulled by haystack and wheaty scents, while this Catalonian white feels full and generally well balanced. Lightly oxidized, leesy flavors of melon, white grapefruit and pineapple are not a common package, while this feels smooth, honeyed and creamy on the finish.

title: Bodegas Berceo 2013 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Earthy plum aromas are supported by vanilla and tobacco notes on a nose with energy. Energy is a recurring theme on the palate, which is tangy and rings the acidic bell. Plum, raspberry and currant flavors finish dry and composed. This could improve a bit over time; drink through 2026.

title: Portal del Priorat 2013 Gotes del Priorat Carignan-Grenache (Priorat)
description: A dark color and chunky aromas of black plum and animal hide set up a full tannic, rubbery palate. Herbal salty notes accent core plum and berry flavors, while this is long on the finish, with earthy notes and a sauvage hint of garrigue.

title: Bodegas Berceo 2017  Rioja
description: Creamy, mildly toasty plum and berry aromas come with a note of vanilla. This is quite crisp and tight on the palate, with acidity and tannins combining strengths to create grip. Plum, spiced berry and chocolate flavors do their best to spread out on a firm finish.

title: Viña Leizaola 2014 El Sacramento  (Rioja)
description: A full but flat nose includes berry and plum fruit and oaky grit. A big, bulky palate has rubbery tannins, while berry and oak flavors are slightly awkward and baked rather than focused. A plump finish is generous but short on structure and purity.

title: Sancho Barón 2016  Rioja
description: Earthy plum and berry aromas come with a rubbery note of pencil eraser. While this is narrow on the palate, it's lively. Red plum, raspberry, currant and a hint of vanilla form the flavor profile, which is backed by a balanced finish.

title: Vetus 2016 Flor de Vetus Old Vines From Segovia Verdejo (Rueda)
designation: Flor de Vetus Old Vines From Segovia
description: White-fruit aromas and a prickly scent of cactus or nettle opens this tight, citrusy old-vines Verdejo. Matching the aromas, this tastes of pithy citrus, grapefruit and green herbs. A racy finish fades out nicely.

title: Baron De Ley 2014 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Ripe, earthy plum and cassis aromas are slightly smoky, with a graphite note. An oaky palate is spread a bit thin, while flavors of red currant and plum are backed by dry oak that extends onto the finish. Drink now.

title: Belondrade 2015 Belondrade y Lurton Verdejo (Rueda)
description: A gold color and wheaty aromas of straw and haystack are devoid of Verdejo's patented high-toned aromas. A soft palate is low on acidity, while this tastes woody, with hard-to-find white-fruit flavors. A peachy, leesy finish shows residual oak. Enjoy soon.

title: Palacio De Canedo 2017 Godello (Bierzo)
description: Pear and apple aromas lead to a medium-bodied palate with healthy acidity and mineral notes. Stone fruit flavors control the flavor profile, while this is braced by bold acidity and stoniness on the finish.

title: Pago Casa Gran 2017 Falcata Casa Gran Crianza Red (Valencia)
description: Honest berry, plum and chocolate aromas come across as whole. On the palate, this blend of Garnacha Tintorera, Monastrell and Syrah is forward in a rugged way, with grinding tannins. Black-fruit and chocolate flavors are within the norms for the Valencia region, while this remains robust through the finish.

title: Genium Celler 2013 Ecològic Red (Priorat)
description: This wine's jammy, cheesy aromas devolve into raisin and prune. It's syrupy and flat on the palate, with stewed black plum and berry flavors that peter out on the soft, tired finish.

title: Zudugarai 2016 Hondarrabi Zuri (Getariako Txakolina)
description: This wine's dusty, stony peach and nectarine aromas precede a round, lemony palate with no spritz. Its citrus flavors are stony and chalky, with lasting snappy green apple and lemon notes. This was made for acid lovers.

title: Bodegas Faustino 2014 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Plum, cherry and chocolate flavors come with milder notes of vanilla and tobacco. A sound palate shows spunk, while flavors of plum, cherry and wild berry are supported by a hint of smoky oak. Maturity shows up on the finish, which tastes slightly raisiny and oxidized. Drink now.

title: Casa Primicia 2015 Gn  (Rioja)
description: Black-cherry aromas are heavily supported by oud wood and burnt notes. A drawing palate is medicinal and gravelly, while flavors of dark plum, bitter chocolate and coffee finish dry and with a lingering burnt taste. This is a heavy Garnacha, with a lot of oak attached to it.

title: Sierra Cantabria 2015 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Savory berry aromas are spicy, earthy and steady. In the mouth, this Crianza is drawing and tannic, and thus very dry in feel. Savory plum and berry flavors come with spice and chocolate notes in front of a grabby finish with rubbery tannins.

title: Sonsierra 2013 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Cherry Life Savers candy aromas come with cedary oak notes and earthy density. On the palate, this is chippy and raw, with citric acid. Spicy, earthy berry and plum flavors are stretched out across a long finish with sharp, pointy residual acidity. For a difficult year like 2013, this is very good. Drink through 2025.

title: Viña Costeira 2018 Colección 68 Treixadura-Albariño-Godello White (Ribeiro)
description: Powdery aromas of melon and scented candle are about as easy as one could ask for. In the mouth, this blend of Treixadura, Albariño and Godello is full, creamy and tastes of melony white fruits. A fleshy finish shows only moderate acidity, thus this should be enjoyed right away.

title: Pago de Carraovejas 2016  Ribera del Duero
description: Lactic oak combined with very ripe fruit results in aromas of buttermilk, jammy berry, cough drop and campfire. In the mouth, this feels severely tannic and packed to the brim with fruit. Oak-based flavors blanket berry tastes, while this remains woody as a sawmill on the finish.

title: Parxet 2016 Brut Reserva Sparkling (Cava)
description: Chalky, fresh aromas of pear and clover lead to a moderately pulpy palate. Orange flavors are quite nice but monotone. On the finish, this is dry with notes of papaya and stone fruits. Overall, this captures the essence of Cava.

title: Ego Bodegas 2014 Fuerza Red (Jumilla)
description: Chocolaty oak gives this blend of Monastrell and Cabernet Sauvignon a sweet nose. But ripe tannins take away any sense of confected or candied fruit. Oaky notes of marshmallow and chocolate accent its berry fruit, feeling at once smooth and tannic.

title: Arrocal 2014 Selección  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Big aromas of coffee, spice cake and earthy black fruits slip towards raisin and murk. This sports a bulky palate with grating tannins. Stewy black-fruit flavors are accented by oaky clove and nutmeg notes, while this stays woody and spicy on the finish. Drink through 2024.

title: Valduero 2015 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Mild cherry and berry aromas include a dash of baking spices. A crisp racy palate is based on fresh acidity and tight tannins. Earthy plum, cherry and currant flavors are the slightest bit oxidized, while this is steady and sturdy on the finish.

title: Carlos Serres 2012 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: A lightly oaked nose offers aromas of mossy berry fruits, earth notes and chocolate. On the palate, this Reserva from a warm vintage feels pinched. Bold, slightly tart berry flavors are superficial, while underneath touches of prune and raisin precede a finish with helpful latent acidity.

title: Conde Bel 2008 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Subtle cedar and tobacco aromas are smooth and mature. This Gran Reserva from a notoriously tough and cold vintage feels tight, firm and rubbery. Savory, slightly stewed berry and plum flavors are lightly herbal and finish with gritty tension.

title: Alta Alella 2014 Mirgin Exeo Brut Nature Sparkling (Cava)
description: Autolytic aromas announce a mature bubbly with aromas of sourdough bread and spent yeast. This brut nature is fairly smooth in feel save for acidic bite. Toasty, mature flavors of yeasty white fruits and dry spices finish briny and salty.

title: Bodegas Olarra 2014 Summa Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Murky aromas of berry fruits and fallen leaves are less than bright. This Reserva from a marginal vintage feels bulky and grating. Stalky, earthy berry and cherry flavors finish with earthy tobacco undertones. It is good but not at its best.

title: Bodegas Ondarre 2016 Rivallana Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Ripe berry aromas are a bit desiccated, with notes of tobacco, spice and chocolate. A full but choppy palate is tannic and brimming with acidity, while this tastes of savory roasted plum. Not much changes on a robust finish.

title: Bodegas Franco-Españolas 2012 Rioja Bordón Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Spicy rooty aromas of licorice, anise, fennel and dried berry fruits are a bit herbal and raw. As for raw, the palate fits that description, with bumpiness to boot. Berry, oak spice and baking-spice flavors are steady on the finish. Drink through 2023.

title: Bodegas Palacio 2015 Glorioso Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Smooth, spicy berry and black-cherry aromas are spread across a concentrated nose. A tight juicy palate is fresh, while this weighs in as medium-to-full. Lightly roasted berry and plum flavors include a spot of oaky vanilla, while this is mellow and emphasizes freshness and spice notes on the finish.

title: Camino de Cabras 2017 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Apple and peach aromas along with stony minerality render the nose legitimate. This feels lemony and correct. Green apple, stone fruit and a dash of salt are the flavors, while this shows mild to medium acidity throughout.

title: Aspaldi 2011 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Ripe black-fruit aromas are a touch baked and raisiny, which makes sense given the warmth and dryness of the 2011 vintage in Rioja. On the palate, this is dry as a bone, with cheek-pounding tannins. Flavors of roasted plum, red currant, tomato sauce and vanilla finish raw but also clean and true. Drink through 2024.

title: Abad Dom Bueno 2015 San Salvador Gotin del Risc Godello (Bierzo)
description: Apple and stone fruit aromas are mature but holding form. A tight palate displays grip and bold acidity some three years after harvest, which is a good sign. Flavors of nectarine, salt and bitter stone fruit pits peter out on a minerally finish. Drink through 2019.

title: Museum 2012 Reserva Tempranillo (Cigales)
description: Ripe berry aromas are a bit raisiny, with vanilla and balsam wood notes. This Tempranillo feels blocky, saturated and tannic. Flavors of raisin, prune, blackberry and wood spice are full and bullish, while a boundary-pushing finish maintains a palpable raisiny quality. Drink through 2020.

title: Resalte 2014 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: A concentrated and potent nose of dark-berry-fruit aromas mixed with cigar box portends a big wine. Confirmation comes on the palate, which is ripe, rough, choppy, tannic and bolstered by lemony acidity. Flavors of bold berry fruits, plum, raw oak and vanilla finish with chocolate and tobacco notes. If you know Ribera del Duero, this is straight from the textbook.

title: Bodegas Riojanas 2011 Viña Albina Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Cola and blackberry aromas come with cheesy oak notes on a nose that seems awkward. An edgy palate with high acidity lacks the smoothness one might expect from a top gran reserva, while plum and raisin flavors are sappy prior to a raw and screechy-feeling palate.

title: Sonsierra 2016 Fermentado en BarricaTempranillo Blanco Tempranillo Blanco (Rioja)
description: Upfront oak smells buttery and rich, while a full, ripe, round palate avoids being flabby. Baked apple and buttered toast flavors are the result of barrel fermentation, while this tastes a lot like good popcorn on the finish. Low alcohol and high acidity help this Tempranillo Blanco show elegance.

title: Eduardo Garrido García 2012 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: This bodega usually delivers solid, traditional Rioja reds. This one opens with heavy oak, cheese and horse aromas, along with earthy berry fruit. The palate glares with oak and screeching acidity, yielding vanilla, wood and tangy plum flavors. A buttered popcorn note and distant fruit flavors carry into the finish. Drink through 2025.

title: Hilanda 2015 Término de Arriba Monastrell (Jumilla)
description: This Monastrell's grapy berry aromas are brusque but deliver the heft the variety is known for. The palate is saturated with acidity and tannin. Its plum, berry and currant flavors are muscular and stiff, laden with vanilla and oak notes that persist on the finish.

title: Avancia 2016 Old Vines Godello (Valdeorras)
description: A gold color and overtly woody aromas akin to cedar cover more delicate scents of white peach and pear. A plump body with a resiny texture benefits from bright acidity, while this tastes of salty stone fruits and oak. The finish is long and woody in character.

title: Finca Albret 2018 El Alba Chardonnay (Navarra)
description: Grainy oak and vanilla aromas accompany white-fruit scents and a hint of briny ocean breeze. This Chardonnay feels solid and resiny, with acidic cut, while oak-driven wood-spice flavors outweigh banana and papaya notes. If you like an oaky Chardonnay that's not too fat, this fits the bill.

title: Vizcarra 2015 JC Estate Bottled  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Aromas of mashed berries, cheese rind, oak and milk chocolate carry the nose of this wine. The choppy palate is tannic and biting, while this tastes of game and berry fruits prior to a grapy finish.

title: Blanco Nieva 2016 Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Punchy citrus and tropical fruit aromas punctuate a stony, varietally correct nose. This Verdejo is slightly plump in feel, with penetrating acidity. Salty, briny apple and nectarine flavors finish clean and minerally.

title: 12 Linajes 2015 Roble  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Brambly berry aromas are woody and a bit fiery. This roble feels sinewy, with structure and intensity. Black-fruit flavors are toasty but not charred or burnt. The finish is full and dark but short.

title: Conde de Siruela 2012 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Unusual but not unpleasant aromas of cinnamon and coffee cake lead to a saturated palate with rugged tannins. Flavors of fig paste, chocolate and baking spices confirm the wine's ripeness, while blackened flavors and rock-hard tannins drive the finish.

title: Castell d'Encus 2014 Quest Red (Costers del Segre)
description: Hailing from high in the Pyrenees, this wine dances to the beat of its own drummer. Floral red-fruit aromas suggest hot stones and wild brush, accompanying leather and tomato scents on this blend of Bordeaux grapes. A tight, tannic palate is home to herbal plum and tea flavors. The wine is earthy tasting but a bit muddled on the finish.

title: Remelluri 2013 Blanco White (Rioja)
description: A mature nose of cornbread and oxidized fruits suggests a wine older than this. A white blend, it features a multitude of grapes led by Viura. On the palate, acidity is the key ingredient, while a mix of oxidized apple, melon and corn flavors runs long on the finish. Drink through 2022.

title: Bodegas Muriel 2016 Pazo Cilleiro Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Subdued white fruit aromas lead to a stern, minerally palate in this wine. Mixed citrus flavors with integrated acidity carry it through a bright finish. Drink now.

title: La Mejorada 2011 Villalar Oro Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León
description: Earthy slightly rustic aromas suggest compost along with ripe berry fruits. This feels wide and heavy, with an extracted mildly tannic mouthfeel. Prune and blackberry flavors don't see much acidic push, and thus this Tempranillo finishes blocky, ripe and chunky.

title: Vallobera 2016 Finca Vallobera  (Rioja)
description: On the nose, this is quite oaky, while blackberry and cassis aromas are a bit foxy. A saturated, grabby palate is full and somewhat plodding, while baked blackberry flavors are lightly oxidized prior to a flat finish, with rubbing tannins.

title: Naveran 2015 Dama de Barcelona Brut Sparkling (Cava)
description: Stone-fruit aromas are yeasty and show a hint of vanilla. In the mouth, this vintage Cava is plump and round. Flavors of baked apple and bready yeast end with a touch of salt atop apple and pastry flavors. This is 85% Chardonnay and 15% Parellada.

title: Bodegas Faustino 2013 V Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Raisin and prune aromas are out front on the nose, which is backed by a sappy palate. Baked plum, prune and chocolaty oak flavors finish soft and wan. With so many excellent Rioja reservas to consider, this one gets lost in the shuffle.

title: Vinos de Arganza 2015 Flavium Selección Mencía (Bierzo)
description: Cassis, prune and cigar-box aromas announce a ripe wine. Then a plump chunky soft palate confirms that assessment. Big grapey flavors are round and kind of easy, while a short finish has chocolaty notes filling any gaps.

title: Vinsacro 2012  Rioja
description: Stewed black-fruit aromas are earthy and deep, but lacking in freshness. A full-bodied palate delivers all the expected weight and body of a warm vintage like 2012. Savory prune and cassis flavors peter out on a baked-tasting finish. Drink now.

title: Vinessens 2013 Sein Monastrell-Syrah (Alicante)
description: Plum and blueberry aromas display a hint of desert herbs. A full dense palate is jammy in feel, while blackberry and prune flavors come with herbal savory notes. A mix of toasty oak and prune-like flavors on the finish leave a lasting impression of maximum ripeness. Drink through 2021.

title: Naia 2015 Las Brisas White (Rueda)
description: Inviting apple, citrus and stony aromas precede a racy, citrusy palate with bracing acidity. Quick-hitting green melon, nectarine and lime flavors end with a persistent note of green apple. This is the best version of this Verdejo-Viura-Sauvignon Blanc blend in several years. Drink now.

title: Valserrano 2015 Fermentado en Barrica White (Rioja)
description: Toasty melon and peach aromas are oaky but elegant, sort of like nice Burgundy. A round balanced palate definitely suggests quality Chardonnay, but this is 95% Viura and the rest Malvasia. Oak and spice flavors render white-fruit notes secondary, and the finish is more of the same. Drink through 2020.

title: Loxarel 2015 Amaltea Brut Nature Reserva Sparkling (Penedès)
description: Dusty yeasty aromas are natural and dry, fitting for brut nature. A citric palate is cleansing after initially feeling sharp, while this tastes of crisp citrus fruits and green apple. A stony finish is focused and direct.

title: Bodegas Perica 2014 6 cepas 6 Viura-Verdejo Viura-Verdejo (Rioja)
description: This gold-tinted, barrel-fermented Viura-Verdejo blend shows aromas of dry apple, fino Sherry and bready yeast. The palate feels plump and balanced, while baked apple flavors come with a salty note that adds complexity. A firm dry lightly oaked finish keeps this on course.

title: Marqués de Gelida 2014 Brut Reserva Pinot Noir Rosé Sparkling (Cava)
description: This brut rosé is light in color and equally light on the nose, with mild aromas of creamy orange, powdered sugar and red currant. A flyweight palate with citric acidity deals mild tangerine and nectarine flavors prior to a slight finish with crisp acidity.

title: As Laxas 2017 Laxas Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: This wine's dusty lemon and straw aromas lead to a medium-bodied, creamy palate with healthy acidity. Its quick-hitting apple and grass flavors finish fresh but short, without much complexity. Enjoy now with summery fare.

title: Pagos de Valcerracin 2016 Roble  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Orderly berry and black currant aromas come with a hint of oak-based clove. A drawing palate is healthy albeit tight, while this Tempranillo tastes of earthy, roasted berry fruits and oak spice. Complexity pokes its head up on the finish via savory game, olive and meaty notes.

title: Hiruzta 2017 Hondarrabi Zuri (Getariako Txakolina)
description: Briny, grassy aromas of white fruit and sourdough bread are clean and honest for Txakoli. This is citric and offers mild spritz, while flavors of white grapefruit and tangerine quickly dissipate on a tangy finish.

title: Carlos Serres 2011 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Earthy berry, plum, spice and cocoa aromas announce a wine that's ready to drink. Lemony acidity and firm tannins make for a structured palate, with textbook Rioja reserva flavors of plum, cherry and tobacco. Drink through 2022.

title: Valserrano 2013 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: This wine's blackberry, rubber and tea aromas make for a subtle entry. It's firm and acidic, almost raw. Cocoa, tea and coffee notes deepen its spicy plum and berry flavors. It feels warm and solid on a reserved finish.

title: Dominio Dostares 2015 Estay Prieto Picudo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León
description: Earthy plum and berry aromas have plenty of oak in support, but also a rubbery note of latex and Band-Aid. This is Prieto Picudo, a lesser-known variety from Zamora in western Castilla y León. The palate is thick and compact, while this tastes of oak, rubbery black fruits and earth. A dry edgy tannic finish concludes this solid red from an esoteric grape variety.

title: Castellroig 2013 Brut Nature Reserva Sparkling (Cava)
description: Aromas of pear cider are mild yet focused on the nose. Fresh acidity drives the scrubbing palate, while this brut nature tastes of green apple, white corn and mild citrus fruits. An clean, dry finish makes for a nice ending.

title: Llopart 2015 Brut Reserva Rosé Sparkling (Cava)
description: Light strawberry and raspberry aromas are a touch jammy and sweet smelling. This Monastrell-based rosé is slightly aggressive but not coarse on the palate. Peachy, melony flavors are more generic than specific, while this finishes clean and easy.

title: Viña Vilano 2014 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Straightforward berry and cherry aromas control a nose with spice and cocoa notes. A high-toned, tannic palate carries fresh plum and raspberry flavors end, with hard tannins, barrel-based notes and general dryness. Drink through 2021.

title: Bodegas Muriel 2013 Fincas da la Villa Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Earthy plum and cherry aromas offer a touch of wet clay to keep things grounded. This Reserva is medium in body, with good acidity and balance. Earthy berry flavors shows hints of oak and raisin, while plum and prune notes carry over to a finish with dry edgy tannins. Drink this proper Rioja through 2023.

title: Bodegas Riojanas 2014 Viña Albina Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Aromatically speaking, this is gritty and rough. In the mouth, this Reserva from a shaky vintage is soupy but not out of shape. Sappy plum, prune and tomato flavors are classic for Rioja but finish without much punch, so best to drink this soon.

title: Bodegas Bilbainas 2012 Viña Pomal Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Soupy berry and raisin aromas are smoky but lack rigidity. An inward-pulling palate is tight due to fairly severe tannins. Dark-plum flavors are savory and a bit oaky, while this is powerful on a muscular finish with rubbery tannins and lasting savory flavors.

title: Telmo Rodríguez 2015 Basa White (Rueda)
description: Apple, melon and other white-fruit aromas lead to a citrusy pulpy palate with good balance. Flavors of pithy citrus and green apple finish with a racy feel and notes of stone fruits and citrus peel. This is Verdejo with 10% Viura.

title: Alidis 2015 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Olive, berry and prune aromas sit in front of a hard-charging palate with slightly raisiny fruit and a lightly stewed character. Toast, chocolate and coffee flavors on the palate and finish reflect a good amount of oak.

title: Bodegas Vínícola Real 2012 Cueva del Monge  (Rioja)
description: Muddled black-fruit aromas include notes of road tar on a ripe nose that's not entirely fresh. On the palate, this warm-vintage Rioja is drawing and tight. Flavors of currant and plum are raisiny at their base, while this is ripe, meaty and savory tasting on the finish. Drink through 2020.

title: Alto Moncayo 2014 Veraton Garnacha (Campo de Borja)
description: Lactic oak is the dominant aroma on this Garnacha, which results in creamy notes of chocolate atop plum and cassis scents. This is woody and resiny in feel, with ample acidity to maintain balance. Savory, smoky plum and blackberry flavors are baked and woody, while this tastes of beef jerky and other cured meats on the finish. Drink through 2020.

title: Alta Alella 2014 Mirgin Laieta Rosé Gran Reserva Brut Nature Sparkling (Cava)
designation: Mirgin Laieta Rosé Gran Reserva Brut Nature
description: A fresh aroma of orange takes the lead on the nose. In the mouth, this brut nature is tight, carrying flavors of pink grapefruit and red apple skins that last on the finish.

title: Pata Negra 2015 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Chunky berry aromas are spicy and dense, but a touch flat. On the palate, this Crianza is smacking, with lively acidity. Plum and berry flavors are generic but good, while this toes the same flavor line on a solid finish. Drink through 2019.

title: Bodega Classica 2012 Hacienda Lopez de Haro Reserva  (Rioja)
description: This wine's leafy, spicy red fruit aromas grow leathery with airing. The palate is tightly wound, with unyielding tomato-like acidity. Its peppery red plum and tomato flavors show hints of tobacco, earth and oxidation.

title: Bodegas Caudalía 2015 Xi'ipal Las Bajadas Single Vineyard Martín de Unx Garnacha (Navarra)
designation: Xi'ipal Las Bajadas Single Vineyard Martín de Unx
description: This wine's spicy plum and berry aromas are lightly oaked and minty. It's fresh and crisp on the palate but almost raw, with rubbery tannins and plum, currant and vanilla flavors. It's dry and spicy on the finish.

title: Bodegas Tobía 2013 Selección Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Oak dominates the nose of this wine, leading to maple, molasses and mint aromas. It's broad and grippy on the palate, with herbal plum and toasty oak flavors. Its big, tannic finish is bold, but somewhat one-note.

title: Pradorey 2011 Elite  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Gritty, rubbery aromas seem underripe given how warm and generous 2011 was. In the mouth, this is gravelly and like sandpaper. Burnt gritty berry flavors are saucy, while this tastes of herbal berry fruits and oak on the finish.

title: Alta Alella 2015 Blanc de Neu Pansa Blanca (Alella)
description: This gold-colored sweet Xarello is lightly oxidized, with aromas of butterscotch, baked squash and honey. The longer it sits, the better it gets, and that's despite blazing acidity. Flavors of pears in syrup, melon and honey finish long due to intense acidity.

title: Ignacio Marín 2012 Marín Old Vine Garnacha (Cariñena)
description: Ripe raisin, vanilla, tobacco and cassis aromas are more than adequately oaked. This feels grippy and bold, with an oak-based resiny mouthfeel. Toasty blueberry and blackberry flavors finish with a final note of oak and heat.

title: Rectoral do Mar 2016 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Dusty peach and mild citrus aromas set this wine's plump palate up with spritz. Despite the indistinct nature of its pulpy, salty apple and citrus flavors, it's well made overall and on target. Drink now.

title: Pazo San Mauro 2016 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Fresh stony apple and citrus aromas are composed. Following that lead, this feels focused and fresh. Flavors of stone fruits, citrus fruits and white pepper finish crisp but not real long or deep.

title: Alvarez de Toledo 2017 Godello (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León
description: This wine's apple and nectarine aromas are fresh, clean and stony. Its bright palate is acidic and stern, with green apple, white grape and green plum flavors. A minerally finish with a stony feel offers a clean way out.

title: Protos 2015 Verdejo (Rueda)
description: With a yellowish color and round melony aromas that are suggestive of candle wax, this feels oily and a touch viscous, but not fat or out of shape. Dry, slightly salty melon flavors finish strong.

title: Adegas Gran Vinum 2016 Selección Especial Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Melony aromas are leesy and a touch rich and flat. That's also how the palate comes across. Inexact nectarine flavors are plump and turn slightly bitter and yeasty on the finish. It's best to drink this right away.

title: Fillaboa 2014 Selección Finca Monte Alto Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Fleshy tropical aromas are mature and not that lively or kicking. In the mouth, this single-vineyard wine feels tight and acidic but also oily and full in body. Salty citrus and stone-fruit flavors are braced by core acidity, while this offers another helping of salty nectarine flavors on a full, dense finish. Drink now.

title: Bodegas Olarra 2012 Añares Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Dusty aromas of prune, raisin and spice cake are a bit flat and bulky. This is chewy and on the fat side, with oak-led prune and black-plum flavors. A solid but top-heavy finish is full of fruit but not all that deep or layered.

title: Bodega Classica 2014 Hacienda Lopez de Haro Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Savory aromas of medicinal oak combined with spicy, minty berry and cherry scents make for a good opening. A fairly full palate is balanced by healthy acidity, while this wine tastes of plum, berry fruits, vanilla and tobacco. A solid finish with nothing extreme is the final seal.

title: Resalte 2014 Expresion Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Baked, raisiny aromas are unmistakable. Not surprisingly, this is thick and chunky on the palate, with a dammed up flow. Black currant and raisiny flavors push the limits of acceptable ripeness, while this feels thick and tastes lightly oxidized on the finish.

title: Roger Goulart 2014 Gran Reserva Brut Rosé Sparkling (Cava)
description: A reddish color and clean aromas of raspberry and red plum lead to a fresh and alert palate that shows good balance. Red apple, citrus and red berry flavors are direct and firm on a relatively short finish.

title: Avante 2014  Ribera del Duero
description: Hot, minty aromas of burnt oak, graphite and road tar introduce a fiery palate. Burnt-oak flavors turn resiny and towards mocha and blackberry as the wine breathes. Keeping with a theme set from the start, this is fiery on the finish, with toasty, blackened flavors.

title: El Centimo 2018 Real Lot 1988 Tempranillo Blanco (Rioja)
description: Briny, cidery aromas are oaky and nice. This barrel-aged Tempranillo Blanco feels wide and pulpy, and thus fairly full in body. Salty apple and wood spice flavors lose fruit on a chunky finish that shows a leesy oxidative note.

title: Viña Eguía 2015  Rioja
description: Earthy plum and berry aromas are slightly leafy and not without a touch of complexity. A full palate with ripe tannins registers as being right, while ripe plum and cassis flavors maintain brightness on a finish with sappy acidity.

title: Casa Primicia 2012 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Earthy, savory aromas of leathery berry fruits come with an animal note. This warm-vintage Reserva is dense and feels like it's piling on top of itself. Roasted, spicy berry flavors are slightly leafy, while oak spice is lasting on a solid, chunky finish.

title: Nisia 2017 Las Suertes Old Vines Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Peach and nectarine aromas show a hint of barrel influence but not too much. A high-acid palate keeps this oak-aged Verdejo on the citric and tangy side, while flavors of lemon, underripe nectarine, vanilla and wood grain finish full, oily and salty, with leftover zesty acidity.

title: Casa Primicia 2014 Cofradia Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Warm, slightly cooked berry aromas are jammy and accented by vanilla and animal-hide notes. A rock-hard palate is pounding and tannic, while this tastes of heavy berry and plum fruit along with grainy, fatty oak. A hard, rubbing finish is bulky, and overall the harmony on this off-year Rioja is questionable.

title: Casar de Burbia 2013 Hombros Mencía (Bierzo)
description: Aromas of raisin, prune, spice cake, clove and cinnamon are oaky. This selection of the high part of the grape bunch known as the shoulder feels grabby, with clamping tannins. Woodsy, earthy berry flavors are accompanied by licorice and clove notes, while chocolaty oak helps to overcome a light green character on the finish.

title: Val Sotillo 2013 Finca Buenavista  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Oak-based savory spicy aromas start out raw and rustic but find their way in front of a tight palate with hard tannins. Plum and currant flavors get a big boost from the barrel, while this tastes of tomato, plum and hickory on a tannic drying finish.

title: Crápula 2012 Basado en Hechos Reales Monastrell (Jumilla)
description: Overtly smoky woody aromas sit on top of earthy berry scents on this muscular Monastrell. Grabby tannins and outsize acidity create rigidity and roughness, while this tastes of shrill black cherry and blackberry. Oak is always present, with char the final impression.

title: Martín Códax 2016 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Lemon and apple aromas are fresh and zippy on the nose. An alert, agile palate is citrusy but not sharp. Flavors of apple, nectarine and apricot finish with length, clarity and brightness. Drink now.

title: Alta Alella 2015 Privat Bruant Organic Sparkling (Cava)
description: This is not a cookie-cutter Cava. It opens with apple juice aromas along with yeast and white-bread scents. In the mouth, this feels a bit bready and soft. Yeasty flavors of papaya, green banana and melon see a white-bread note return on the finish. This is 100% Xarello (Pansa Blanca).

title: Vilerma 2015 White (Ribeiro)
description: Gold in color, with pineapple, lanolin and air-freshener aromas, this Treixadura-led blend feels round and creamy, with a shot of bracing acidity. Salty tropical fruit and flowery flavors finish plump in feel and briny in flavor.

title: Teso La Monja 2014 Romanico  (Toro)
description: Despite showing reduced black plum and blackberry aromas, this displays grippy tannins and tension on the palate. Its blackberry and boysenberry flavors are lush, and the oak is mild and integrated on the finish.

title: Beronia 2011 Reserva Tempranillo-Graciano-Mazuelo  (Rioja)
description: This is full and dense but not heavy. Its ripe, smoky aromas include balsamic berry, tobacco, vanilla and lemon peel notes. Spicy into the finish, its earthy plum and raspberry flavors are loaded with dry oak. Drink through 2023.

title: Icono 2013 Selección Red (Valencia)
description: Dark berry aromas, chocolate and grit define the nose on this blend of Syrah, Cabernet and Tempranillo. The palate feels ripe and fresh, but the tannins are hard and grabby. Black plum flavors are bold and offer notes of spice, herbs and earthiness. This is composed on the finish despite a reprise of hard smacking tannins.

title: Ossian 2014 Agricultura Ecológica Verdejo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León
description: Mature corny aromas of tortilla chips are particular and require a lot of air and swirling to show their best. This barrel-fermented old-vines Verdejo shows lightly oxidized flavors along with oak and apple. On the finish, this is plump, oaky and a bit bready tasting. Drink now.

title: Abad Dom Bueno 2018 Godello (Bierzo)
description: Aromas of white fruits and apple skins are clean and fresh. A zesty palate is crisp and minerally, with a hint of spritz. Typical Godello flavors of melon and apple are steady on the finish.

title: Pagos de Valcerracin 2015 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Smoky blackberry aromas break down with airing and turn earthier and more gritty. A bullish palate with drawing, abrasive tannins sets up blackberry, cassis and olive flavors, then an unruly finish tastes of savory berry fruits and chocolate.

title: Marqués de la Concordia 2016 Federico Paternina Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Tropical-fruit aromas are slightly oily but on target for Verdejo. This wine displays a full, round palate held together by acidity and white-fruit tannins. Lightly salty grapefruit flavors finish moderately long, with citrus overtones. Drink as soon as possible.

title: Bodegas Palacio 2013 Glorioso Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Berry, cola and chocolate aromas are pretty. In the mouth, this wine is bright and brash, with rough tannins and high acidity. Flavors of plum and wild berry are a touch salty and then comes a hard-pounding finish. Drink through 2026.

title: Marco Abella 2015 Roca Roja Single Vineyard Garnacha (Priorat)
description: This varietal Garnacha from a warm year opens with ripe aromas of black plum and blackberry that are concentrated and jammy. Massive ripeness on the palate is offset by tartaric acidity, while this tastes of blackberry, cassis, vanilla and hard cheese. On the finish, raisiny ripeness and weight are balanced by driving acidity.

title: Losada 2013 Mencía (Bierzo)
description: Meaty leathery blackberry aromas are less dressed up and polished than in past vintages. This Mencía feels jammy, wide and chunky, while flavors of spicy blackberry are limited. A toasty oaky lightly charred finish closes out this full-bodied offering from a tough cool year.

title: Marco Abella 2013 Roca Roja Garnacha (Priorat)
description: Aromas of burnt wood and spice cover rugged gritty berry scents. This is a tight minerally wiry Garnacha that's oaky on the palate. Oak-rich plum flavors finish with strong tannins, residual grit and lasting wood-based notes. Drink through 2022.

title: Montecillo 2011 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Classic Rioja aromas of berry fruits, spice, tobacco and vanilla lead to a grabby palate that's slightly bumpy in feel. Dry spicy plum and berry flavors are lightly herbal, while the finish tastes the same.

title: Fillaboa 2018 Estate Grown Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Floral white fruit aromas are leesy and peachy as they introduce a fleshy palate brightened by core acidity. Salty peach and tropical fruit flavors finish with mild energy and length. Drink now.

title: Bodegas Muriel 2014 Fincas da la Villa Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Aromas of baked berry fruits, cassis, maple, vanilla and tobacco are encouraging. In the mouth, this is smacking and wide, with rubbing tannins. Bold berry, plum and black currant flavors show prune and herbal notes on the finish.

title: Mustiguillo 2015 Finca Terrerazo Vino de Pago Bobal (Spain)
description: Sunbaked aromas of raisin, baked blackberry and warm earth are not exactly fresh and popping. In the mouth, this full-bodied Bobal rambles at maximum weight. Cassis, raisin and licorice flavors finish warm and with the essence of desiccated black plum and supporting oak.

title: Paco & Lola 2018 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Classic Rías Baixas aromas of apple, pineapple and pear are clean and friendly in front of a slightly sharp and citrusy palate. One-dimensional citrus flavors suggest orange and tangerine, while this finishes short, with citrus and stony notes.

title: Adega Cachín 2015 Peza do Rei Mencía (Ribeira Sacra)
description: This wine's floral, lightly jammy red berry aromas smell like nice bath soap. It's tight and raw on the palate, expanding a bit with air. Its mix of red fruit and herbal flavors is linear and lively, although the finish is slightly abrasive.

title: Don Olegario 2018 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Chunky aromas of white fruits and brine set up a tight, lemony palate that's minerally. Apple and lemon flavors are mildly bitter prior to a lasting finish that's firm and stony but holds onto that note of bitterness.

title: Ego Bodegas 2017 Goru 38 Barrels Red (Jumilla)
description: Chocolate, vanilla and clove aromas ride high on an oaky nose, while this Monastrell-Cab-Syrah blend feels resiny, and also scratchy with tannins. Berry fruit is at the base of clove, wood-grain and chocolate flavors, while oak spice is the key driver on a plump, woody and slightly hot finish.

title: Marques de Griñon 2013 AAA Red (Dominio de Valdepusa)
description: Maximum ripeness is conveyed through concentrated berry aromas. On the palate, that same ripeness includes blazing tartaric acidity that creates a scratchy mouthfeel. Blasting raisin, cassis and berry flavors see screechy acidity take over on the finish, with oaky flavor remnants. This is equal parts Cabernet Sauvignon and Petit Verdot

title: Scala Dei 2016 Prior Red (Priorat)
description: Earthy, slightly stewed berry and black-plum aromas are on the quiet side, but not the palate, which is wiry, acidic and crackling with toughness. Plum, currant, cola and spice flavors don't slow down on a finish that's hot and grinding.

title: Luis Cañas 2014 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Smooth, floral berry aromas are easy to like. This crianza feels whole and plump. Lightly herbal tomato flavors blend with richer plum and berry notes in front of a balanced, mostly ripe finish.

title: Senda Verde 2016 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: This juicy Albariño opens like a bowl of fresh fruit, with aromas of apple, pear, peach and melon. Stone-fruit and citrus flavors are slightly pithy and oily in character, while tangy orange and pineapple echo on a brief but clean finish.

title: Pittacum 2015 Petit Pittacum Mencía (Bierzo)
description: Slightly rustic, meaty aromas of berry fruits are savory and include notes of iodine and dried blood. This feels a bit hard, raw and rubbery, but leathery dark-fruit flavors are quite good. On the finish, rubbery tannins return. Drink through 2019.

title: Loxarel 2015 Amaltea Red (Penedès)
description: Minerally berry aromas are bold and come with notes of bramble and leather. A lively palate is aggressive and rough around the edges, while lightly oaked flavors of plum and berry fruits are spicy prior to a firm finish with grating tannins. This is a blend of 60% Cabernet Sauvignon, 30% Merlot and 10% Ull de Llebre (Tempranillo).

title: Vinos de Arganza 2015 Lagar De Robla Producción Limitada Mencía (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León
description: A black color and big oaky aromas of blackberry and bacon tell you what you need to know about this Mencía. A heavily extracted palate is jammy and borderline syrupy in texture. Charred oak has left a smoky imprint on black fruit flavors, while this is peppery and tastes mostly of burnt oak on the finish. Drink through 2024.

title: Ramón Bilbao 2016 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: A clover aromas leads on the nose, with white flower accents in the background. A round, healthy palate is mildly citric, with an orange note running strong. A steady finish helps this conclude well. Drink now.

title: Bodegas Muriel 2006 Fincas de la Villa Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
designation: Fincas de la Villa Gran Reserva
description: Heady aromas of tobacco and raisin struggle to suggest complexity. This is grabby and weighty on the palate, with spicy black plum and herbal flavors. Texturally, this Gran Reserva from a hot year remains chunky, grabby and blocky after many years in bottle. And on the finish, there's a note of oxidation.

title: Bovale 2016 Bobal (Utiel-Requena)
description: Smoky blackberry and dark-plum flavors are robust and convincing, while this Bobal is grapy, meaty and showing rubbery tannins on a full palate. Blackberry and prune flavors come with mild oak and barbecued notes, while this is steady on a fruity, balanced finish.

title: Adegas Tollodouro 2018 Blanquito Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Briny citrus aromas are punchy and strong, while this feels slightly pinched yet mostly round. Salty flavors of sea brine and citrus fruits finish steadily. Overall this doesn't wow but it more than gets the job done.

title: Losada 2016 El Pájaro Rojo Mencía (Bierzo)
description: Roasted berry and plum aromas include notes of ham and bacon. This wine is grabby and tannic on the palate. Meaty plum and currant flavors set up an extracted finish with hard residual tannins. There's a lot of fruit and power here but not much elegance.

title: Telmo Rodríguez 2017 Basa Verdejo-Viura (Rueda)
description: Honeydew and lime aromas show a light note of sea brine and bell pepper on this blend of 90% Verdejo and 10% Viura. Round and healthy in feel, this Rueda has a fresh set of flavors that includes grapefruit, green banana and herb. Basa has had its ups and downs over the years; this vintage is all up. Drink now.

title: Príncipe de Viana 2013 Reserva Tempranillo (Navarra)
description: Spicy cherry and plum aromas are lightly herbal, with a note of olive. This varietal Tempranillo is blasting with acidity and skins-based tannins. Saucy flavors of plum and wild berry fruits include chocolaty oak. It's driven by high-toned acidity on a cranking finish. Drink through 2025.

title: Txomín Etxaníz 2017 Getaria Rosé (Getariako Txakolina)
description: A shiny pink tint and bright aromas of nectarine and citrus fruits announce a round yet citric palate with freshness. Pink grapefruit and mild red-fruit flavors mellow out on a finish that doesn't last long.

title: Losada 2015 El Pájaro Rojo Mencía (Bierzo)
description: Rubbery, leathery berry aromas are edged with woody accents. There's intensity and depth to the palate, which doles out rustic plum and berry flavors. A moderately powerful but ripe finish concludes this likable Mencía from a good year.

title: Valdelacierva 2015 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Ripe and easygoing aromas of plum and berry fruits include a distant note of clove. This is juicy but also plump and balanced. Berry, plum and mild oak flavors are standard but appealing, while this is fresh, lightly oaky, spicy and correct on the finish.

title: Losada 2016 Mencía (Bierzo)
