description: Spicy berry, oak, vanilla and schist aromas introduce a crisp palate with resiny oak. Dark plum and raspberry flavors are bolstered by oaky notes, while this tastes dark and chocolaty on a finish with fresh acidity and scratchy tannins.

title: Marqués de la Concordia 2014 Federico Paternina Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Up-front aromas of cedary oak, vanilla and spice provide framing for riper berry scents. A full palate with piping acidity is cut by creamy oak, while this tastes of red plum, currant, tobacco, savory spices and vanilla. Although a bit ripe and soupy in structure, this is a classic-style Rioja to drink now.

title: Perinet 2015 1194 Red (Priorat)
description: From the opening gun, this is overtly and massively ripe, hence it smells of maple, raisin and prune along with crème de cassis liqueur. A heavyweight from front to back, this tastes of brandied black fruits, chocolate cake, clove and other baking spices. An unctuous finish is the opposite of light and dainty.

title: Vall Llach 2015 Idus Red (Priorat)
description: Berry scented candle and baking-spice aromas comprise an exotic nose. On the palate, this is as soft as a goose-feather mattress, with very little notable acidity or lift. Deeply ripe and baked black-fruit flavors taste of cassis and blueberry on a thick finish. Drink through 2020.

title: Sierra Cantabria 2014 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Aromas of barrel spice, baking spice and earthy plum form an inviting nose. This is chewy and full on the palate, with good balance. Roasted berry, spiced plum, baking spice and clove flavors close up shop on an edgy finish, with popping acidity and residual roasted notes.

title: Marques de Monistrol 2015 Winemakers Select Reserva Brut Nature Sparkling (Cava)
description: Yeasty aromas of vanilla and bread overwhelm mild white-fruit scents on this full-bodied brut nature. Apple, pear, green-melon and vanilla flavors finish smooth and long, with integrated yeasty complexity.

title: Tionio 2016 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: A saturated purple color and jammy plum and berry aromas are dense and slightly reduced, although airing helps this along. A flush, grapy palate is fairly tannic and grabby but not overly rough. Blackberry, cassis and chocolate flavors finish full, pulpy and chunky.

title: Carlos Moro 2015 Finca Valdehierro 16 Meses Barrica Tempranillo (Cigales)
description: Earthy, baked aromas are meaty, minty and herbal but not entirely clean and pure. This wine from little-known Cigales is tight to an extreme, bordering on astringent. High acidity makes woody plum and red berry flavors screechy, while the finish is dry and driven by oak and acidity.

title: Castellroig 2012 Sabaté i Coca Rosado Reserva Familiar Brut Reserva Sparkling (Cava)
designation: Sabaté i Coca Rosado Reserva Familiar Brut Reserva
description: Vanilla and fruity tobacco notes are more particular to this Cava than common. This Garnatxa rosé feels soft but inoffensive. Yeasty vanilla, brown-sugar and generic stone-fruit flavors finish semisweet and without much acidity.

title: Lagar del Rey 2018 Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Lemon and orange peel aromas are direct and crisp, followed by a medium-bodied palate with bracing acidity. Lightly briny citrus and melon aromas are standard for Verdejo, while this is focused and solid on a juicy finish.

title: Montserrat Canals Torres 2014 Eunoia Vintage Reserva Brut Nature Sparkling (Cava)
description: Kiwi and lemon-lime aromas lead to a tight, stony palate. White-fruit flavors are more savory and briny than pure, while this evaporates and finishes with elegance. For a fresh style of cava, this brut nature rings true.

title: Enate 2011 Syrah (Somontano)
description: A tight beam of oak and char runs through prune, blackberry and cassis aromas. This Somontano Syrah feels tight like a fist, with rough tannins and bright acidity. Peppery oak and black-fruit flavors are lightly herbal and spicy on a snappy finish that doesn't lay down. Drink through 2019.

title: Alta Alella 2017 Lanius White (Alella)
description: A golden color and oily aromas of honey, walnut, lightly oxidized citrus and wood grain announce this chunky but sturdy Catalonian white blend. Oak is the lead flavor, backed by butter and roast pumpkin and/or squash. A warm, full finish closes out this barrel-aged number. Drink now.

title: Bodegas Valdemar 2010 Conde de Valdemar Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Briary, oaky, stalky berry aromas lead to a full-bodied palate with tomatoey acidity. Savory plum and berry flavors include notes of oak grain and tomato that lead to a steady finish. Overall, this is a classic Rioja from an excellent vintage. Drink through 2022.

title: Bodegas Riojanas 2016 Monte Real de Familia Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Aromas of cherry and berry fruits show well on the nose. This crianza is medium in body and a touch wiry due to sappy acidity. Flavors of plum, berry and vanilla are straightforward, while this is juicy and easy on the finish.

title: Bodegas Riojanas 2016 Viña Albina Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Traditional Rioja aromas of earthy berry, plum and wood spice set up a lively but jagged palate with drying tannins. Plum and cherry flavors are meaty and moderately spicy, while this boasts clarity and purpose on the finish.

title: Pago Casa Gran 2015 Casa Benasal Elegant Red (Valencia)
description: This blend of Garnacha Tintorera, Syrah and Monastrell offers easygoing plum and blueberry aromas. It's chunky on the palate, with big tannins and damp blackberry and dark plum flavors. The finish includes a tobacco note.

title: Bodegas Landaluce 2015 Fincas de Landaluce Crianza  (Rioja)
description: This crianza's plum and blackberry aromas are fruity and firm, with modest oak. It's lively in feel, with zesty acidity covering slight oxidation on the midpalate. Its cherry, plum and wild berry flavors lead to a chocolate- and baking spice-inflected finish.

title: Salcis 2009 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Gritty earthy aromas come up short on freshness and clarity. This feels raw and pinching, with dry rubbing tannins. Gritty peppery berry flavors are oaky, while this finishes with savory berry, herb and tobacco flavors. Hammering tannins suggest decanting and/or service with hearty foods.

title: Vega Sicilia 2008 Unico  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Name and reputation get you only so far, as this underwhelming offering from a poor vintage proves. Compact stewy aromas of baked berry fruits and asphalt are the appetizer. A main course of chunky jammy stewy berry and prune flavors finishes with a desiccated essence. Unico is known to age for decades, but not this vintage. Drink now for what it's worth.

title: Vilarnau 2013 Brut Nature Vintage Sparkling (Cava)
description: Apple, peach and yeast aromas are welcoming but a little wayward. This brut nature shows roundness on the palate and no coarseness. Briny apple and dried-apricot flavors are calm on the finish.

title: Portal del Montsant 2013 Brunus Red (Montsant)
description: Although this Carignan-Garnacha blend smells gritty and not as ripe as vintages like 2012 and 2011, it is fresh and full in feel, with grippy tannins. Flavors of blackened spice, plum and berry fruits finish full, fleshy and a touch hot. Drink through 2019.

title: Tamaral 2011 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)
description: A big oaky can't-miss blast of clove and wood spice is more dominating than secondary berry aromas. This is resiny and full in body, with ample acidity. Oak plays a lead role on the flavor profile, which includes toast, mint and herbal black plum. A peppery toasty finish benefits from moderate juicy acidity. Drink through 2021.

title: Clos Berenguer del Molar 2015 Clos de Tafall Red (Priorat)
description: Ripe earthy aromas of berry fruits, compost and cheesy oak are disparate but good. A raw, grabby palate is bumpy as it deals flavors of berry fruits, cassis and aged cheese. While the finish lacks total harmony, this wine has enough power and quality of flavors to continue on.

title: Heretat Mastinell 2008 Carpe Diem Reserva Especial Brut Nature Sparkling (Cava)
designation: Carpe Diem Reserva Especial Brut Nature
description: Aromas of applesauce and pear syrup are ripe and friendly. On the palate, this brut nature feels boxed in and lacking in breadth. Flavors of apple and green herbs are lightly oxidized, while this finishes dry and briny on hints of stone fruit and melon.

title: Bouza de Carril 2016 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Briny aromas of cactus and lightly pickled cucumber are more neutral than loud. This is lively on the palate, with citrusy flavors that include a note of orange peel. Mild green-herb flavors and a touch of bitterness on the finish are not uncommon for Albariño.

title: Monterebro 2013 Crianza Monastrell-Syrah (Jumilla)
description: Warm earthy ripe aromas of raisin, baked berry fruits and prune are typical of Jumilla and Monastrell, which is 85% of this blend along with 15% Syrah. Punchy and tannic, but not fierce, this is ripe and tastes of raisin, prune and dried herbs. A lasting finish is raisiny and choppy.

title: Parxet 2011 Gran Reserva M.C. Sparkling (Cava)
description: White-fruit aromas of apple and green melon are slightly yeasty. This feels round, with enough weight and body to absorb amplified acidity. Flavors of melon and apple are dry and salty, while this is clean and secure on the finish.

title: Parxet 2014 Cuvée 21 Made With Organic Grapes Sparkling (Cava)
description: Mellow yeasty apple aromas suggest good things to come. This feels full, easygoing and good. Toasty apple and spice notes control the flavor profile, while this finishes with an overall sense of completeness.

title: Campo Viejo 2014 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Dry, spicy aromas of plum, brick dust and earth are lean but sound. On the palate, this Rioja is plenty satisfying, with smooth tannins. Plum and wild berry flavors finish tight, tannic and peppery, with moderate oak in support.

title: Blanco Nieva 2018 Martúe Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Always a solid choice among Rueda's sea of Verdejos, this hits the right notes up front with pineapple, lime and melon aromas. A plump palate isn't laser-sharp, while pear and green-melon flavors soften up on an easy finish. Drink now.

title: Luis Saenz 2015 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Grapy plum and berry aromas are dense and pulpy but entirely pleasant. In the mouth, this is a touch choppy and hard, with rubbery tannins. Beefy berry and savory plum flavors finish with vanilla and coffee notes along with sturdy tannins. Drink through 2020.

title: Altos De Rioja 2015 Altos R Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Chunky black fruit aromas are inviting and under control. In the mouth, this crianza from a warm, dry vintage feels thick and saturated, with jammy weight. Roasted berry and plum flavors finish big, sappy and a touch jagged due to rugged tannins. Drink through 2020.

title: Alberto Orte 2013 Sierra de la Demanda  (Rioja)
description: This blend of 75% Garnacha, 20% Tempranillo and 5% Viura opens with oaky aromas of cigar box, floral notes and raisin. A snappy, fresh palate reflects high elevation and a north-facing vineyard exposure, while this tastes oaky and of herbal currant and raspberry. A spicy finish of dried red-fruit notes and a saucy snap fits into the traditional mode for Rioja. Drink through 2021.

title: Xavier Flouret 2012 Pavo Real  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Earthy black-fruit aromas include notes of cigar box. This feels tight and acidic, but with plenty of oak. Flavors of woodspice and vanilla are more dominant than plum and berry notes, while this is thick but not entirely thorough on the finish.

title: Bodega Trenza 2010 Rizado Monastrell (Yecla)
description: Raisiny, reduced aromas of baked fruits suggest overripeness. On a weighty palate this is saturated like the nose, but not overdone. Stewed black-fruit flavors are chocolaty, while this is extracted enough to leave a coating of black-fruit residue on your cheeks, tongue and teeth.

title: Lealtanza 2012 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Rubbery black-plum and berry aromas lead to a jammy palate that's full but lacking in edge. Plum, berry and oaky flavors finish with weight and toasty, earthy notes of chocolate and spiced berry fruits.

title: Peza do Rei 2016 Red (Ribeira Sacra)
description: Raspberry, wild herb and schisty aromas are key to the nose on this Mencía. A fresh, acidic palate is banging and racy, not subtle. Berry-fruit flavors are amplified by high acidity, while this is bright, energetic, floral and minerally on the finish.

title: Marqués de la Concordia 2012 MM Reserva de la Familia Brut Nature Sparkling (Cava)
designation: MM Reserva de la Familia Brut Nature
description: Apple and brioche aromas are composed on the nose. A plump, slightly oxidized palate offers mild fruit tones, but shows a welcome shot of citrus on the finish.

title: Bodegas Olarra 2016 Añares Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Berry and plum aromas are standard for good Rioja crianza, which this is. A fleshy, fairly full palate is juicy and textured, while centered flavors of plum, berry fruits, oak spice and vanilla finish with mild milk chocolate notes.

title: CVNE 2014 Viña Real Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Traditional Rioja aromas of dried berry fruit and red currant are rugged. In the mouth, this is dry, pulling and fairly austere due to grinding tannins. Gritty flavors of plum and tomato sauce are spicy and the slightest bit green on the finish. Drink or hold through 2021.

title: Gramona 2011 Imperial Gran Reserva Brut Sparkling (Cava)
description: Yeasty aromas suggest sourdough. With a plump body, this gran reserva tastes a touch bready and nutty, with some oxidation. Mellow, mature white fruit flavors are backed on the finish by autolysis notes and a taste of sautéed mushroom.

title: Clos de Nit 2017 Red (Montsant)
description: Pulpy, grapy berry aromas are moderately concentrated. This blend of Garnacha, Carignan and three other red grapes feels grabby and pulpy, while flavors of blackberry and raspberry are slightly minty and herbal. Crisp tannins keep the finish in line.

title: Bodegas Berceo 2014 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Subtle berry and cassis aromas have earthy undertones. On the palate, this is wide and fleshy but not laser focused. Mild oak, chocolate and plum flavors finish with tomato, spice and light herbal notes.

title: Viña Bujanda 2015 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Cherry, vanilla and oak spice aromas come with a note of citrus. This crianza feels fresh and lively but not that deep or complex. Flavors of spiced plum, currant and red apple skin show a mildly desiccated note of prune on the finish. This is a textbook simple Rioja to enjoy at any time in any setting.

title: Eguren Ugarte 2016 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Lightly spiced plum and berry aromas are touched up by a dash of oak-driven cinnamon. While this crianza is a bit edgy and gravelly in feel, it deals solid dark-fruit flavors backed by spicy oak. A steady finish carries this blend of 90% Tempranillo and 10% Garnacha home.

title: Atalayas de Golbán 2014 Torre de Golbán Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: From Dominio de Atauta, this crianza is slightly murky and earthy up front, with aromas of smoky wood, prune and dark grit. A full, saturated palate is packed with power, while this tastes of blackberry, prune and leather.

title: Resalte 2014 Lecco Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Ripe berry aromas border on raisiny and stewed, while background notes of graphite and smoke are barrel driven. This crianza from a marginal vintage feels resiny and a bit syrupy. Savory black fruit flavors come with vanilla and chocolate shadings, while this remains chocolaty on a steady finish.

title: Jaume Serra 2015 Brut Nature Reserva Método Tradicional Sparkling (Cava)
description: White fruit and pineapple aromas are a touch briny. On the palate, this is round and pulpy without much bubble action or scour. Dry, salty lemon-lime flavors finish well. Known for its value Cristalino label, this is a step up for Jaume Serra.

title: Luna Beberide 2017 Mencía (Bierzo)
description: Spicy blackberry and black plum aromas are true to Mencía and Bierzo. This feels tight and compact, with inward-pulling acidity. Plum and dark berry flavors are clean, while this holds on to its virtues on the finish.

title: Mont Marçal 2017 Brut Rosado Sparkling (Cava)
description: Aromas of cantaloupe, mango sorbet and apricot introduce a clean, smooth palate. Likable but basic flavors of peach and melon are easy to process and enjoy, while this feels clean and direct on the finish.

title: Hiruzta 2016 Rosé Brut Nature Sparkling (Getariako Txakolina)
description: Hailing from the cool Basque country and featuring both red and white Hondarrabi, this smells a touch raw and stalky, with dried peach and melon notes. A quick, punchy palate delivers dry apricot and orange flavors, while this is stony on a finish that's more cleansing than fruity.

title: Aljibes 2016 Viña Aljibes Red (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Meaty blackberry aromas smell of soy sauce and game. A widespread palate comes with grabby tannins. Mint, oak and herbal berry fruit flavors are more sauvage than polished, while this blend of Tempranillo, Cabernet and Petit Verdot is tight on the finish, with rugged residual tannins. Drink through 2022.

title: Artadi 2013 Pasos de San Martín Garnacha (Navarra)
description: This spicy, fiery smelling Garnacha shows bright plum and berry aromas. In the mouth, this is tough and tannic, with raw acidity and a mild burn. Dark, spicy berry flavors are blackened, while this tastes peppery and feels hot on the finish.

title: Rodrigo Méndez 2017 Cies Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: This wine's nectarine and peach aromas are rather standard. Juicy, briny stone fruit flavors make for a bright palate that finishes well but without much complexity.

title: Alta Alella 2015 Mirgin Rosé Reserva Brut Nature Sparkling (Cava)
description: Pale salmon in color, this Brut Nature leads with clean, stony aromas that are more neutral than expressive. It's fresh, crisp and tight on the palate, with light, dry currant and raspberry flavors that feel clean on the finish.

title: Finca Azaya 2016 Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León
description: Sweet-smelling raisin, prune, licorice and chocolate aromas are fully ripe. In the mouth, this is plump but firm, with scratchy tannins. Prune, mocha and chocolate flavors are consistent with the nose, while this holds onto a raisiny sense of ripeness on the finish.

title: Adega Cachín 2015 Peza do Rei White (Ribeira Sacra)
description: Stone-fruit, orange peel and Ribeira Sacra's textbook schist-driven aromas make for a moderately complex and interesting nose. This is tightly wound, with an acidic backbone. Flavors of white peach, pithy citrus and mild bitterness finish with a waxy but firm texture. It's 70% Godello with Treixadura and Albariño.

title: Finca Río Negro 2013 5 Ano Cogolludo Guadalajara Tempranillo-Cabernet Sauvignon (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Untamed cherry and berry aromas are foxy and gamy while packing some heat. This blend of Tempranillo and Cab Sauvignon is tough on the palate, with drying tannins. Rubbery plum and olive flavors finish rugged, with hard spice and game notes.

title: Bodegas Palacio 2014 Cosme Palacio Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Olive, raisin, cassis, clove and wood grain aromas constitute an interesting nose. A full palate with resiny oak and noticeable tannins sets up a flavor profile based mostly on clove, oak and berry fruit. While this remains oaky across the finish, there's enough dark fruit here to make this well worth a go. Drink through 2022.

title: Finca Albret 2017 El Alba Chardonnay (Navarra)
description: Overt oak aromas outweigh generic white fruit notes prior to a plump and creamy palate that's fairly resiny. Wood-based flavors of vanilla and spice work well with salt and melony fruit notes, while this Chardonnay performs a slow fade on a salty tasting but balanced finish.

title: Adegas Gran Vinum 2015 Selección Especial Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Citrus, mineral and honey aromas are good but not all that complex. This feels full and weighty, with nectarine and orange flavors. On the finish, dry citrus flavors are round and lasting but low on elegance. Drink now.

title: Dominio de Tares 2016 Baltos Mencía (Bierzo)
description: This nose is rich, savory in aromas of blackberry, black olive, chocolate and iron. A flush, pulpy palate is tannic and overall a bit broad and clunky, while friendly black plum and cassis flavors darken up on a thick finish. Big fruit and a ripe flavor profile are what this Mencía delivers.

title: Portal del Montsant 2015 Bruberry Carignan-Grenache (Montsant)
description: The modest cherry and raspberry aromas in this Carignan-Garnacha blend set up a buoyant palate with tight, rubbery tannins. It offers generic but sound berry fruit flavors and some oak. Chewy tannins mark the finish.

title: Tosalet 2014 Vinyes Velles Red (Priorat)
description: The fiery cherry and cassis aromas in this snappy wine include a rubbery Band-Aid note. Roasted tomato, plum and currant flavors are framed by lip-smacking tannins and tomato-like acidity, finishing with gritty intensity.

title: Parxet 2015 Cuvée 21 Brut Made With Organic Grapes Sparkling (Cava)
designation: Cuvée 21 Brut Made With Organic Grapes
description: Aromas of wood smoke, baked apple and browned butter are slightly complex and stately. This organic brut feels good but less complex than the nose indicates. Pear, apple and green-melon flavors are a touch oxidized prior to a sound finish.

title: Viñestral 2014 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Cherry, plum and balsam-wood aromas make for a good opening. This wine feels full, with cheek-grabbing tannins. Flavors of woodspice, cherry and plum hold appeal, but this feels a bit hot on the finish, with residual oak.

title: Viña Otano 2017 Rosé (Rioja)
description: A light-salmon color and dusty aromas of citrus fruits lead to a solid palate with just enough acidity to support the wine's grabby texture. Dry flavors of melon and papaya don't scream loudly, while this tastes of citrus peel and feels a bit tight on the finish.

title: Hilanda 2012 Término de Arriba Monastrell (Jumilla)
description: Powerful berry and spice aromas open this jammy slightly heavy Monastell. Desert-herb notes of sage and thyme accent a core blueberry flavor, while this tastes of carob, roasted beet and toast on the finish.

title: Portal del Montsant 2017 Bruberry Blanc White (Montsant)
description: Oily white-fruit aromas are lightly oxidized and soft. This is 80% Garnacha Blanca, with the rest Macabeo, and it feels melony and a touch flat, as if it's entering its final days. Honey, green-banana and melon flavors are, like the rest of the wine, nice but flat.

title: Llopart 2016 Brut Reserva Sparkling (Cava)
description: Yeasty white-fruit aromas are clean and basic, while this brut feels a bit foamy but helped by firm acidity. Apple, green pear and yeasty vanilla flavors wrap up on a finish that holds form. While this vintage Cava isn't a thriller, it's more or less faultless.

title: Paco & Lola 2016 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Light lemony aromas are more blowsy than exact. This feels citric and grabby, with oily weight to the palate. Flavors of ripe white grapefruit, nectarine and orange expand but don't evolve on the finish.

title: Bodegas la Casa de Lúculo 2016 Lúculo Garnacha (Navarra)
description: Smoky fiery aromas of black plum and berry fruits mixed with a hint of vinegar lead to a raw, rugged and grabby palate. Blackberry and blueberry flavors show a fair amount of oak, while heavy spice flavors along with heat and burn dominate the finish.

title: Bodegas Corral 2012 Don Jacobo Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Creamy earthy berry aromas are a touch nutty and raisiny. Flavors of spiced plum and prune are long-lasting, with a touch of heat and a note of pepper. On the finish, this is dry and spicy but doesn't show many elevated qualities.

title: Vega Escal 2014 Grenache-Shiraz-Carignan Red (Priorat)
description: Nominal berry aromas come with a covering of oaky vanilla. This feels full, with only mild acidity creating a somewhat gummy mouthfeel. Plum, currant and raspberry flavors are harmonious, but beyond that this blend of Garnacha, Carignan and Syrah doesn't have more to offer.

title: Torre Oria 2015 Viñedo Antiguo Bobal (Utiel-Requena)
description: Jammy berry aromas are medicinal yet a touch dilute. In the mouth, this is edgy, tannic and resiny. Ripe berry flavors come with more than enough oak backing, while this is toasty tasting, with jammy weight on the finish.

title: Viñas del Vero 2014 La Miranda Secastilla Garnacha (Somontano)
description: Raspberry, plum and rose-petal aromas are dusty, floral and elegant. In the mouth, this wine is fit and spry, with crisp, pulling acidity. Herbal red plum and raspberry flavors finish with spice, mint and unabsorbed oak notes.

title: Nivarius 2016 Solo Blanco Tempranillo Blanco (Rioja)
description: Clean white-fruit aromas are whole, with nothing in particular standing out. A pulpy, fairly full palate comes up a touch soft, while this wine tastes of melon and green banana. Due to shy acidity, this white Tempranillo is a bit flat on the finish.

title: Convento Oreja 2016 Roble  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Damp but stout aromas of concentrated berry fruits are full but not overly expressive, layered or complex. A fleshy, widespread palate follows suit, while this tastes of jammy but generic plum and berry fruits. A full finish spreads out but lacks definition.

title: Pradorey 2014 Finca La Mina Reserva Single Vineyard  (Ribera del Duero)
designation: Finca La Mina Reserva Single Vineyard
description: Foresty berry aromas are oaky, earthy and not overly ripe, with barrel-driven notes of clove and chocolate. This has rough tannins and a scratchy mouthfeel. Herbal plum flavors are woody and spicy, with a strong taste of clove on the finish.

title: Ego Bodegas 2017 Goru Gold Red (Jumilla)
description: Ripe, rubbery berry aromas are warm and oaky, with a chocolaty backing. A thick, grabby palate is par for the course in Jumilla, while this blend of Monastrell, Cabernet Sauvignon and Syrah tastes a lot like it smells: chocolaty and rich, with effusive creamy vanilla. A loaded and pulpy finish is tannnic.

title: Protos 2015 27  (Ribera del Duero)
description: This wine's raisin and prune aromas are accented by marzipan, tobacco and oak notes. Ripe flavors of blackberry and raisin are offset by citrusy acidity, creating rawness on an otherwise concentrated palate. It's extracted, acidic and a bit disjointed on the finish.

title: Gotas de Mar 2015 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: The integrated nose with peach, melon and stony aromas is clean and vital. This weighs in on the full, round and heavy side, while flavors of orange and grapefruit are good but monotone. A briny citrusy finish closes this out. Drink now.

title: Baica 2017 Barricado Red (Jumilla)
description: Sappy berry aromas are lightly herbal and moderately complex. This Monastrell-led blend feels plump, grabby and a bit rugged. Herbal plum and blackberry flavors are savory but a touch green, while the finish is slightly hot and tastes of chocolaty oak.

title: De Moya 2015 Justina Bobal (Valencia)
description: Beefy aromas of blackberry and raisin are a bit horsey. A dense mouthfeel is punched up by tomatoey acidity, while this tastes of salty black plum and prune. A steady finish with oak spice and licorice flavors shows Bobal in a good light.

title: Evaia 2016 Rosé (Rioja)
description: Mild citrus, melon and peach aromas are clean. This wine feels solid and a touch plump, but with agility. Peach and melon flavors are simple, and it's fresh, tasty and fairly elegant on the finish.

title: Proelio 2015 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: An almost-black color and savory, meaty aromas of black fruits and prune announce a saturated Tempranillo with syrupy weight and thickness. Charred flavors of burnt wood and slightly overripe black fruits finish with full tannins.

title: Castro Martin 2015 Family Estate Selection Sobre Lias Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Tropical fruit, melon and fresh carrot aromas lead to a shearing palate with sharp acidity. Quick-hitting, sharp-angled lemony flavors finish tangy, minerally and lasting, with zesty citric acidity creating length. This is lean and pointed at only 12.3% abv.

title: Marqués del Atrio 2011 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: This Rioja's raspberry and currant aromas are mostly ripe, with just a hint of leafiness. It feels gritty and firm yet jammy on the finish, with red berry and vanilla flavors that show a hint of oxidation. Drink now.

title: La Legua 2013 Crianza Tempranillo (Cigales)
description: Leathery berry aromas are comported and spicy. This feels grabby, tannic and tight, but good. Blackberry, toasty oak and integrated spice and herbal notes conclude with a compact tannic grip and a lasting note of oak.

title: Palacio de Fefiñanes 2016 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: This wine's dusty white fruit aromas aren't as focused as expected from Fefiñanes. Its spritzy palate resembles that of a soda, offering ripe sweet melon and lime flavors. A bit of pyrazinic grape skin character is noticeable on the finish.

title: Pazo de Barrantes 2016 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Neutral white-fruit aromas lead the nose of this wine, while it's round on the palate, with just enough acidic cut to keep it from feeling oily. Briny peach and nectarine flavors finish with a mild salty note. Drink now.

title: Lagar de Indra 2018 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: The clean nose is fairly neutral except for hints of apple and stone fruits, while a round and healthy palate shows moderately bright acidity, along with flavors of melon and lime. Concluding the package is a comfortable finish with hints of apple, citrus and stone fruits.

title: Llopart 2013 Imperial Gran Reserva Panoramic Sparkling (Cava)
description: Briny, bready aromas are yeasty but less than complex or stirring. On the palate, this vintage Cava is highly regular, with little depth and soda-pop acidity. Pear, green-melon and green-herb flavors don't elicit much excitement on the finish.

title: Finca la Melonera 2014 La Encina del Inglés Red (Málaga)
description: Aromas of animal hide and latex are savory more than fruity. This feels overdone and soupy on the palate, with sticky tannins. Candied, baked flavors of plum, blackberry and black currant are spicy in flavor but syrupy in feel on the finish.

title: Otazu 2013 Premium Cuvée Red (Navarra)
description: A charred, fiery nose holds aromas of burnt wood and roasted blackberry and plum. A dense, compact palate is piercing and heavy, tasting of roasted black fruits and black olive. A smoked, resiny palate smolders with residual oak.

title: Parxet 2017 Cuvée 21 Brut Made With Organic Grapes Sparkling (Cava)
designation: Cuvée 21 Brut Made With Organic Grapes
description: Nectarine and green-plum aromas lead to a lively palate. This brut delivers pleasant and proper nectarine and papaya flavors in front of a steady finish that maintains its white-fruit character.

title: Palacio del Burgo 2014 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Ripe berry aromas border on raisiny, while overall this reserva smells baked and soft. A chunky palate is bolstered by grabby tannins, while blackberry and black plum flavors hint at mocha and clove on a spicy but drawing finish.

title: Marqués de Vargas 2016 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: A dark color and warm aromas of plum, raisin and prune announce a fuller-bodied wine. In the mouth, this feels sappy and extracted, while black cherry and prune flavors are darker and fatter than what you find in most crianzas. On the finish, dark-fruit notes quickly give way to prune.

title: Condes de Albarei 2016 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: This wine's classic Albariño aromas of white flowers and stone fruit are simple and nice. It feels round and true but a touch flat. Thompson grape, melon and ripe apple flavors hold steady on the finish. Drink now.

title: Castell d'Encus 2015 Ekam White (Costers del Segre)
description: A blast of petrol opens this blend of Riesling and Albariño from the Pyrenees. After the harshness blows off, this displays a citric personality and stony minerality. Ripe white-fruit flavors are offset by a yeasty finish. Drink now.

title: Príncipe de Viana 2018 Edición Blanca White (Navarra)
description: Melony white-fruit aromas are fairly generic but clean, while this blend of Chardonnay and Sauvignon Blanc is full to the point of being creamy. Woody aromas of oak grain and spiced apple finish smooth, simple and steady.

title: Roger Goulart 2011 Gran Reserva Sparkling (Cava)
description: Yeasty apple and vanilla aromas set up a pleasant palate that's more foamy and amorphous than well defined. Mild lime, nectarine and yeasty flavors finish with competence. This is a perfectly good Cava that doesn't stand out.

title: Mas d'en Gil 2014 Coma Alta Garnacha Blanca (Priorat)
description: Years into its existence and this varietal Garnacha Blanca still smells like raw oak and turpentine, although those aromas are more ingrained than superficial. A well-balanced mature palate with lively acidity is helpful, while this tastes of fino Sherry and dried white fruits. A long finish with salt and pepper notes references oak as its final chord.

title: Obalo 2016 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Berry aromas are ripe and restrained as this flush Crianza opens. Fleshy weight and full tannins lend size to wild-blackberry and black-olive flavors. On the finish, this is rambling, rough and gravelly.

title: Altavins 2015 Tempus Crianza Red (Terra Alta)
description: Earthy berry aromas are more subdued than bright. In the mouth, this feels a bit collapsed, syrupy and hot. Hefty cherry and black plum flavors are a touch oxidized and short on kick. This feels jammy and thick while tasting of spiced berry fruits on a finish that's sleepy as it expires. Drink now.

title: Abendus 2016 Red (Somontano)
description: Cherry, plum and raspberry aromas are fiery and show a hint of latex. In the mouth, this blend of Garnacha and an indigenous grape called Moristel feels tight and choppy but fresh. Medicinal berry and plum flavors show a touch of oak, while this ends with dry tannins and peppery spice notes.

title: Forjas del Salnés 2017 Leirana Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: This wine's apple and melon aromas come with notes of wet wool and lanolin. The palate is bolstered by citrusy acidity that tastes solely of orange and orange peel. The finish is tangy and salty.

title: Marqués de la Concordia 2012 Reserva de la Familia Sparkling (Cava)
description: This fits properly into the brut nature category courtesy of neutral aromas and a direct tightly built palate. Mild citrus and melon flavors lose some clarity on a finish that hints at mealy apple and butter.

title: Contino 2015 White (Rioja)
description: Aromas of oak, buttered bread and apple are subdued. In the mouth, this feels ripe more than ripped, with mild acidity and not a lot of spine or structure. Flavors of oak, spice and apple fall quietly away on a simple finish.

title: Luis Saenz 2012 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Aromas of generic berry fruits, vanilla, wood grain and raisin lead to a flush palate that's slightly abrasive and tannic. Woody, spicy plum and berry flavors finish with dry tannins and smoldering oak.

title: Hacienda Urbión 2016 Cuvée  (Rioja)
description: Cool earth and prune aromas make for a jammy nose. On the palate, this is fleshy and grapy but direct. Jammy berry and plum flavors maintain a grapy quality on the finish, while overall this is nice in an uncomplicated way.

title: Torres 2014 Celeste Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: This wine's blackberry, grilled meat and olive aromas are a bit rustic. It's honest on the palate, with stewed fruit, spiced plum and herbal flavors that finish with bold acidity. A no-frills but good Ribera del Duero.

title: Montebaco 2017 Alma de Vino Mar y Montaña White (Ribeiro)
designation: Alma de Vino Mar y Montaña
description: Simple aromas of apple and generic white fruits lead to a chunky palate with just enough vitality and acidity. Fleshy apple and peach flavors are modest in front of a short finish that lacks punch. Drink now.

title: Vins El Cep 2015 Gelida Brut Gran Reserva Sparkling (Cava)
description: Apple and pear aromas are basic, while a simple palate is clean and mellow, with no edge or cut to it. Apple and green-banana flavors are smooth through a standard finish. Overall, this vintage Cava is perfectly good but fails to plow any new ground.

title: Casa de la Ermita 2013 Crianza Red (Jumilla)
description: Floral berry and plum aromas are lightly woody. This feels full and edgy, with fairly hard tannins. Black-fruit flavors are certainly ripe, while this finishes bold and intense, with scratchy tannins. The blend is Monastrell, Tempranillo and Cab Sauvignon.

title: Sierra Cantabria 2015 Otoman White (Rioja)
description: Dry waxy white-fruit aromas are mild but clean. This blend of Viura and other white grapes feels plump but a touch soft, with only modest acidity. Dry bready flavors of melon and papaya finish a touch flat. Drink now.

title: Bodegas Bilbainas 2012 Viña Pomal Alto de la Caseta  (Rioja)
designation: Viña Pomal Alto de la Caseta
description: An opaque black color and charred aromas of mint and menthol are telling: this is a highly saturated and heavily oaked Rioja from a warm vintage. Along with that profile comes clenching tannins and dark flavors of burnt toast and black fruits. This isn't about nuance or elegance; it's a blockbuster.

title: Torres 2011 Grans Muralles Red (Conca de Barberà)
description: A heavy nose is defined by rubbery black-fruit aromas, while this holdover from a hot dry year feels sappy and soft, and ultimately overweight. Baked black-fruit flavors include a note of savory dried beef, while this is decidedly thick and jammy on the finish. The blend includes Garnacha, Carignan, Monastrell and the ancient grapes Garró and Querol—very good in some ways but overall not a great Grans Muralles, one of Familia Torres' signature wines.

title: Lasalde Elkartea 2016 Aitzalde White (Getariako Txakolina)
description: Punchy aromas of citrus and cactus are not outright green but do show pyranize scents. A palate with honest body, grip and lemony acidity tastes of tangy lemon-lime and tangerine, while this is angular but not scouring on the finish.

title: Campillo 2018 El Sueño White (Rioja)
description: The nose on this blend of Viura and Chardonnay is overtly oaky, while the mouthfeel is punched up by lemony acidity. A dominant wood spice flavor rests on top of mute citrus, while on the finish this is bright and juicy, with a lasting oak-based flavor.

title: Bodegas Muriel 2018 Pazo Cilleiro Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Aromas of citrus fruits, green melons, white flowers and sea brine are typical of Albariño. On the palate, this is full and on the creamy side, with adequate citric acidity. A slightly salty flavor profile includes nectarine and melon notes, while this tastes of pineapple and salted peach on a round finish.

title: Cuatro Pasos 2015 Pizarras de Otero Mencía (Bierzo)
description: This fresh Mencía's bright red fruit aromas exude rocky mineral tones. Raw, popping red plum and cherry flavors finish herbal and tomato-like, with a bit of tannic bite. Drink now or any time through 2021.

title: Obalo 2018 Rosado (Rioja)
description: Clean neutral aromas hint at peach pit and wet stones. This Rioja rosado is in good shape and built around tangy citric acidity. Orange and lemon flavors are fresh, and overall this defines what a quaffable, affordable Spanish rosé should be.

title: Rioja Vega 2014 Reserva Estate Bottled  (Rioja)
description: Racy currant, cranberry and lemon-peel aromas are low on depth and darkness, while this feels zesty on the palate, with acidity fueling things. Spicy, oaky red-plum flavors stay fresh on a crisp, acidic finish that's rough and rugged.

title: Naveran 2014 Perles Blanques Cuvée Antonia Sparkling (Cava)
description: Toasty smoky aromas of well-oaked base wine stick out on this vintage Cava. A round, solid palate is balanced and shows proper grip, while this tastes pickled and slightly bitter as opposed to fresh and pure. Briny flavors linger on a smooth finish.

title: Altavins 2017 Ilercavònia Garnacha Blanca (Terra Alta)
description: Pear, apple and peach aromas are light all around. A healthy but basic palate has modest acidic energy, while apple and stone fruit flavors include a hint of green. A lightly briny finish suggests a fresh salad with a mild vinaigrette dressing.

title: Agustí Torelló Mata 2015 Reserva Brut Sparkling (Cava)
description: Apple and lime aromas are mostly good but rudimentary. The same could be said for a fresh but basic palate. Apple and pear flavors are a bit bready, while this loses some steam on a finish that's mostly bready, yeasty and creamy.

title: Vins El Cep 2014 Gelida Brut Gran Reserva Sparkling (Cava)
description: Dusty, yeasty apple aromas get the job done. A plump, chunky palate is lacking in exactness, while this brut tastes briny, savory and salty, with a hint of apple. A smooth finish maintains those flavors.

title: Bodega Classica 2017 Hacienda Lopez de Haro Rosado (Rioja)
description: Aromas of citrus fruit and citrus peel are welcoming but basic. This rosé feels flush yet fresh, with proper balance. Clean but limited flavors of citrus and stone fruits finish steady and avoid the common plague of bitterness.

title: 12 Linajes 2015 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Ultraripe aromas of raisin, prune and blackberry come across as mushy and overdone. A saturated palate is sappy and heavy, with tartaric acidity offering a boost. Flavors of prune, raisin and cassis are almost too ripe, while aforementioned acidity keeps this from collapsing on the finish. The 2015 vintage was a hot one, and this wears it.

title: Luna Beberide 2015 Godello (Bierzo)
description: Mild apple and white-fruit aromas are a bit wheaty like bread. Conversely, the palate is tight, with pulling lemony acidity. Like the nose, this tastes wheaty and like stone fruits, while the finish is distinctly leesy.

title: Adrás 2014 Mencía (Ribeira Sacra)
description: Earthy, savory berry aromas are rubbery, while this feels fleshy and jammy. Young woody flavors outweigh the wine's basic fruit notes, while this tastes toasty on the finish.

title: Hacienda del Carche 2015 Taus Selección Red (Jumilla)
description: Sunbaked plum and currant aromas are a touch spicy. In the mouth, this blend of 50% Monastrell, 25% Syrah and 25% Cabernet Sauvignon is full, tannic and mostly well balanced. Dense spicy plume and black-fruit plum flavors finish with rubbery grabby tannins.

title: Hacienda del Carche 2015 Infiltrado Red (Jumilla)
description: Jammy plum and raspberry aromas feed into a clampy but fresh and lightly oaky palate. Flavors of currant, herbal red berry and oak-based clove end with rustic, grabby tannins that are drying. This is a mix of Syrah, Monastrell and Garnacha Tintorera.

title: Marqués de la Concordia 2012 Federico Paternina Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Initial perfumed aromas break down and turn a bit soapy and like red-apple skins. A juicy palate has volume but lacks structure. Plum, wild berry and saucy flavors finish full and wide but without much definition or shape.

title: Mar de Viñas 2017 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Prickly lemon and pineapple aromas come with modest minerality. This is zesty on the palate, with some body. Stone-fruit flavors of peach and nectarine finish full and healthy. This is a nice but basic Albariño to drink now.

title: Rafael Cambra 2015 El Bon Homme Red (Valencia)
description: Gamy, savory plum and berry aromas recall asphalt, tree bark and wildness. This blend offering Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Monastrell is clampy and tannic. Oaky savory berry flavors finish choppy, with a hint of clove.

title: Scala Dei 2015 Prior Red (Priorat)
description: A saturated, grapy nose with jammy black-fruit aromas is massive but not exact. A blocky, clumsy palate is weighty and a touch stewed. Blackened berry flavors show every bit of this Garnacha-based wine's 15% abv. Notes of fig and chocolate are up front on a heavy finish.

title: Bodega Virgen de la Sierra 2016 OGV Garnacha (Calatayud)
description: Earthy black-fruit aromas of chocolaty plum and berry are the starting course. This wine is a bit high in acidity and pulling, so there's tension on the palate. Plum, tomato and oak flavors are saucy, while the wine tastes earthy and feels grabby on the finish.

title: Gancedo 2013 Mencía (Bierzo)
description: Foresty berry aromas are warm and chunky. This feels plump and full in body, with grabby tannins and edgy acidity. Salty spicy plum and berry flavors come with loud oak notes, while this finishes full and stout, with toast and mint-like residuals.

title: Ovidio García 2012 OG Esencia Crianza Tempranillo (Cigales)
description: Grapy black-fruit aromas are adorned with more than enough oaky vanilla. This is grabby and acidic. Flavors of cherry, wild berry, tobacco and vanilla finish in similar fashion, with brightness fostered by ultra high acidity. This is good and rugged but short on ease and flow.

title: Comando-G 2015 Rozas1er Cru Vino de Paraje Garnacha (Vinos de Madrid)
description: A rosy, almost rusty color and dusty aromas of crushed granite, cinnamon and citrus peel open this high-elevation Garnacha from the Sierra de Gredos, which is south of Madrid. A full, pulling palate features rubbery tannins while light, salty red-berry flavors end with a creamy finish.

title: Muga 2017 White (Rioja)
description: A light color and pleasant but simple floral and white fruit aromas open this tangy Rioja that hums along with high-toned citrus flavors and snappy acidity. Grapefruit, orange and grape skin flavors take their time on a racy finish.

title: Larchago 2017  Rioja
description: Generic berry and plum aromas are clean and standard for everyday Rioja. A medium-bodied palate with modest but notable tannins shows bright plum and red berry flavors in front of a finish that darkens up and is legitimately toasty.

title: Alta Alella 2016 Mirgin Brut Nature Reserva Sparkling (Cava)
description: Grassy white-fruit aromas include a strong note of petrol. A plump, round but foamy palate holds flavors of briny stone fruits that are one part sweet and one part sour. Briny flavors persist on a steady finish.

title: Hacienda Urbión 2014 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Earthy aromas of raisin and baked berry fruits lead to a medium-bodied palate that's more spongy and absorbing than hard. A mix of leafy berry, brown sugar, salt and herbal flavors finishes short and basic, with a touch of root beer and licorice to ponder.

title: Granbazán 2015 Limousin Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: There's no mistaking the main ingredient in this barrel-driven Albariño, and that's Limousin oak, which gives off extreme aromas of wood grain and turpentine. A plump palate is chunky due to barrel aging, while this tastes mostly of wood resin and related bitterness. While well made, this is what it is: a heavily oaked Albariño cut from its own mold.

title: Obalo 2013 Matulán Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Bold earthy black-fruit aromas properly announce a drawing, tannic middleweight with powerful plum, raspberry and tomato flavors. This cool-vintage Rioja is tough and sinewy on a highly tannic finish. Drink through 2022.

title: Balbas 2015 Ardal Tradición  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Oak-derived aromas of maple, charred wood and clove are pronounced on the nose. The full-bodied palate offers grainy tannins and strong charred oak notes that leave a charcoal-infused berry impression. Its flat, slightly stewed finish is bolstered by a shot of lemony acidity.

title: Bodegas Peñafiel 2011 Sierra de Miros Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Unusual exotic-leaning aromas of lavender, violet, cardamom and anise are intriguing. In the mouth, this has textural issues, namely it's abrupt and tannic. Flavors of mild chocolate, carob and blueberry are uncommon for Ribera del Duero.

title: Ossian 2015 Quintaluna Verdejo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León
description: Basic aromas of apple and melon feed into a solid round palate with good acidity. Salty flavors of popcorn and tropical fruits finish flush, balanced and with notes of melon and papaya.

title: Bodegas Aragonesas 2016 Crucillón Red (Campo de Borja)
description: This wine's dusty raspberry and plum aromas are friendly and powdery. A 50-50 blend of Garnacha and Tempranillo, it's lively and tight, with generic black fruit flavors that finish minty and a touch raw.

title: Valdemonxes 2017 Clásico Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Apple and talcum powder aromas are normal for Albariño. A plump palate is balanced by citric acidity, while this tastes of apple and briny citrus prior to a finish that's showing a slight hint of pyrazine-based green.

title: Montecillo 2017 Singladuras Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Plump, leesy aromas of melon and peach are varietally on par. A round palate shows balance and proper acidity, while salty, briny, dusty white fruit flavors are leesy and suggest melon and nectarine on the finish.

title: Viña Eguía 2014 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Spicy, savory oak aromas sit in front of dried cherry and plum notes, while this feels fresh and snappy, with mild acidic burn. Briary plum and spicy berry flavors qualify as oaky, while this tastes of vanilla, mint and mixed spices on a lightweight finish.

title: Sierra Cantabria 2018 Blanco White (Rioja)
description: Apple and pear aromas are clean and fresh, while this blend of Viura, Sauvignon Blanc and Malvasia feels solid and healthy. Mild citrus and basic white-fruit flavors finish short but true.

title: Aranleón 2014 Blés Crianza Organic Wine Red (Valencia)
description: Floral soupy plum aromas come with notes of road tar, violet, lavender and grass. This has a jammy, saturated, chunky mouthfeel to go with plum and spiced-berry flavors. Exotic notes of cardamom and clove are key to a spicy finish. This is a blend of Monastrell, Tempranillo and Cabernet Sauvignon.

title: Ramirez de la Piscina 2013 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: This wine's spiced plum and berry aromas show hints of animal fur and leather. The palate is rough around the edges, offering plum and berry flavors that have veered toward prune. Savory spice and chocolaty oak notes mark the finish.

title: Pazo De Villarei 2017 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Citrus aromas dominate this seasonally friendly white, with a backing of green herb and grass notes. It's lively, with good flow as its mix of pineapple and pine flavors dash lightly into the crisp, juicy finish.

title: Val Sotillo 2009 Gran Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Like many 2009 RDD wines, this is at max ripeness and maybe over the edge. Ripe earthy plum and prune aromas feed into a heavy palate that's not exactly skipping. Prune, blackberry, blueberry and juniper flavors finish dense and settled. This is ready to drink: it is what it is.

title: Marqués de Gelida 2014 Marques de Gelida MIM Natura Brut Reserva Sparkling (Cava)
designation: Marques de Gelida MIM Natura Brut Reserva
description: A blend of bready aromas along with crisp apple and pear scents leads to a citrusy palate of lime and green melon. The lasting finish is a good way for things to conclude.

title: Prada A Tope 2015 Palacio de Canedo Godello (Bierzo)
description: Dusty apple aromas show a good level of pop and freshness. This Godello feels round yet fresh. Yeasty, bready white-fruit flavors are more basic than specific.

title: Palacios Remondo 2012 Propiedad  (Rioja)
description: This Rioja Baja Garnacha is earthy on the nose, with aromas of stewed berry fruits, tomato and raisin. The palate is livelier than the aromas, but this still feels a bit heavy and stewed. Flavors of vanilla, root beer and saucy berry fruits lack pop on a finish that seems to be tiring.

title: Palacio de Primavera 2012 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Raisin aromas could use a bit more lift and freshness. This Rioja feels grabby due to rubbery tannins. Soupy, slightly herbal berry flavors finish on chocolaty notes but also a choppy sense of roughness.

title: Alberto Orte 2012 Elo Monastrell (Yecla)
description: Leathery, scratchy black-fruit aromas are striated and minty, with a note of oak. This Monastrell feels grabby, hefty and on the bold and bulky side. Jammy blackberry flavors come with minty green notes, while this tastes mildly grassy and feels a bit hot on the finish.

title: Gotas de Mar 2016 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Briny white-fruit aromas are lean, with a pyrazinic note of jalapeño. Stone fruit flavors show on the palate, but with a mild bitterness. Nectarine is the lead on a short-run finish. Drink now.

title: Hiruzta 2018 Hondarrabi Zuri-Beltza Rosé (Getariako Txakolina)
description: Crisp, lightly spiced aromas get this Txakoli rosado off to a good start. A consistency of spritzed orange juice backed by citrusy flavors made briny by salty notes make this authentic and good for drinking right away.

title: Marqués de Vargas 2014 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Roasted aromas of tomato and red plum are spicy. This has a chunky, blocky mouthfeel that's searching for its groove. Herbal plum and tomato flavors finish a bit raw in feel and salty in flavor.

title: Marqués de Vargas 2014 Conde de San Cristóbal  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Rooty aromas of licorice and sarsparilla are out front, followed by a big wave of barrel char. This wine feels good but a little abrupt and choppy. Savory flavors of barbecue and meaty berry fruits finish blackened and peppery, with a lasting note of charred wood.

title: Marqués de Cáceres 2018 Excellens Rosé (Rioja)
description: A light but distinct clear pink color along with stony but mild aromas open this fresh rosé. A crisp, tight palate is lean and focused, while this tastes citrusy, with a hint of red plum. Clarity, cleanliness and freshness are top virtues.

title: Abad Dom Bueno 2016 Laderas Del Norte Mencía (Bierzo)
description: Reduced berry and olive aromas require a lot of air, swirling and patience to unwind. An amorphous palate is grabby, fleshy and fat, while this tastes of jammy dark plum and various spices. A round, obtuse finish deals latent oak and coffee notes.

title: Finca Sobreño 2013 Crianza  (Toro)
description: This wine's fiery nose holds oak spice, red fruit, tobacco and chocolate aromas. It's full and grippy on the palate, with hard tannins. Oaky flavors of vanilla and cocoa bolster moderately ripe cassis and plum fruit. A creamy quality persistents on the finish.

title: Castellroig 2016 Sabaté i Coca Vermell Reserva Brut Sparkling (Cava)
designation: Sabaté i Coca Vermell Reserva Brut
description: Bready, toasted aromas play up popcorn and stalky fruit notes in front of a round palate that ranks as basic. Orange, apricot and nectarine flavors fade out on a finish with a notable yeasty character.

title: La Val 2011 La Val Sobre Lías Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Oily, briny, waxy aromas reflect aging and extended time on lees, both of which this wine has been through. Piercing acidity keeps things in balance, while oxidized flavors of corn and salted peach finish strong and slightly bitter. This unique style of Albariño is not for everyone.

title: Vinessens 2017 Beryna Monastrell-Garnacha Red (Alicante)
description: Desiccated black-fruit aromas are baked but not cooked. This blend of Monastrell and Garnacha is saturated and heavy on a pruny palate, while flavors of baked berry fruits finish spicy, oaky and dark, with an aftertaste of prune.

title: Vega Clara 2015 Mario  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Ripe raisiny aromas teeter on the brink of overripe, while this feels heavy, hard and loaded with tannins. Baked berry, raisin and cassis flavors turn more stewed on a heavy finish with a prune-like aftertaste.

title: Alion 2013 Alion  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Some years, even the top wines suffer, and in a cold 2013, Alion is not what it normally is. For starters, this is far more tight, tannic, raw and pulling than its track record. Toasty oak is a big player, creating creamy aromas and toast on the finish. In between are crisp, peppery blackberry flavors. This wine may improve with time. Drink 2018–2028.

title: Castell d'Encus 2014 Acusp Red (Costers del Segre)
description: Like all of Raul Bobet's Castell d'Encus wines from the Pyrenees, this Pinot Noir displays a personality all its own. Raspberry and strawberry aromas are floral and herbal, but feel chunky and a bit obtuse. Tea, herbal plum and Asian spice flavors end with notes of wild flowers and black tea.

title: Marqués de la Concordia 2016 Viña Alarde  (Rioja)
description: Plum and berry aromas are natural and unadulterated by unwelcome oak. This is dry and fresh on the palate, with medicinal cherry, herbal plum and light oak flavors. An easy finish with light cherry notes wraps this up.

title: Fernández de Piérola 2008 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Savory berry aromas are accompanied by spice notes and a hint of latex. This feels wide rather than precisely shaped. Baked, earthy, oaky flavors envelop stewed berry notes, and the wine feels wayward on the finish.

title: Dominio de Punctum 2014 Dulce Venganza Late Harvest Chardonnay (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: This golden dessert Chardonnay opens with soft aromas of papaya, melon, squash and corn. On the palate, this is chunky like pineapple syrup. Flavors of pineapple, melon and mango puree end with a note of carrot on a long viscous finish.

title: La Zorra 2014 Red (Sierra de Salamanca)
description: Plum and berry aromas are tight and focused, with no indication of oak. A blend of Tempranillo and Rufete, this wine is snappy and drawing in feel. Plum and currant flavors finish long and juicy, with ripping acidity.

title: Pazo de Toubes 2018 Modus Vivendi Treixadura-Albariño-Loireira White (Ribeiro)
description: Piercing tropical-fruit aromas are centered on pineapple. This white blend is what the Ribeiro region does best, and this is a full, melony wine made to drink now. Melon, papaya and apple flavors finish short due modest acidity.

title: Vins El Cep 2011 Claror Gran Reserva Brut Nature Sparkling (Cava)
description: Briny apple and nectarine aromas are within the proper framework of brut nature. Citric and stone-fruit acidity makes for a racy palate, while this tastes mostly of peach and nectarine along with some salt and brine. A firm finish is acidic and dry.

title: Traslascuestas 2011 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Saucy herbal lightly grassy aromas surround an interior scent of black cherry. This feels thick and raisiny, and on the ripe side. Flavors of raisin, prune, brandied cherry and spice finish peppery. Drink now.

title: Morgadío 2015 Legado del Conde Albariño Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Citrus and apple aromas are fresh, reserved and on the light side. In the mouth, this pops with lemony acidity and related tang. Flavors of tart green apple and lime are racy almost to the point of being sour, while this ends with a tingle of sharp acidity and a sense of wet stones and minerals.

title: Marqués del Atrio 2015 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: A compact nose smells herbal and slightly green, with spearmint and cherry aromas sticking out. A hard palate is scratchy, while berry and vanilla flavors are slightly weedy. Heat settles in on the finish as the fruit evaporates.

title: Señorío de Sotillo 2014 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Black-fruit aromas with accents of road tar and spice turn more herbal with airing. A tight, crisp mouthfeel is built around smacking acidity, while plum and berry flavors come with peppery spice notes. An herbal character returns on a ripped, juicy finish. Drink through 2021.

title: Ochoa 2010 Reserva Red (Navarra)
description: Earthy, lightly baked berry aromas fresh on the nose. A snappy palate with raw acidity leads to mildly herbal plum and berry flavors. A dry, spicy, nicely oaked finish is a bit choppy in feel but tastes right. Similar to past bottlings, this is 55% Tempranillo, 30% Cab Sauvignon and 15% Merlot.

title: Familia Montaña 2014 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Raspberry and plum aromas fairly introduce a racy and forward palate with punchy acidity and raw tannins. Red berry flavors are jammy, and overall there's a lot of fruit to this bumpy ride of a reserva.

title: Mileto 2009 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Aromas of spicy oak and dried berry fruits lead to a clampy, rubbery palate. Plum and berry flavors are slightly saucy, while the finish, which is still fresh for a 2009, is tannic and pulling.

title: Palma Real 2015 Verdejo-Viura (Rueda)
description: Melon, nectarine and mild citrus aromas are clean and direct. This basic white is firm and balanced, while stone fruit, melon and white-pepper flavors end easy and fresh.

title: Gratavinum 2011 2?R Red (Priorat)
description: Raisiny aromas of prune and desiccated cassis feed into a full pudgy palate. This is rich to the breaking point, with ultraripe flavors of baked plum and berry fruits. Chocolate is the main flavor on an oaky, thick finish.

title: Bodegas Riojanas 2015 Viña Albina Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Ripe berry aromas are leathery and oaky, with a hint of prune. A chunky, plump palate is fairly resiny in feel. Flavors of vanilla along with old-style oak and tobacco interplay with berry-fruit notes that push up against overripe. On the finish, this holds onto its overt oak-influenced character.

title: Bodegas Carballal 2015 Floreano e Punto Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Aromas of orange pulp and peel are hanging in there. This feels both oily and citric, while sour-leaning citrus flavors are a bit salty. On the finish, this feels plump and holds onto its citrusy essence. Drink immediately.

title: Altavins 2015 Ilercavònia Grenache Blanc (Terra Alta)
description: A crisp combination of mineral notes, citrus aromas and citrus peel lead to a juicy medium-bodied palate. Lime and apple flavors are slightly briny, while this is dry, pithy and true to the Garnacha Blanca variety on the finish.

title: Aljibes 2011 VA Red (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Leafy herbal saucy aromas of plum and currant come with hints of tobacco and café mocha. This blend of Petit Verdot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Tempranillo has a Bordeaux-like flavor profile complete with leafy plum and herbal spice notes. On the finish, this holds onto its herbal character.

title: Llopart 2015 Brut Reserva Sparkling (Cava)
description: A light color and simple aromas of applesauce and pear set up a palate with pulpy weight cut by citrusy acidity. Lightly herbal, slightly bitter white fruit flavors show a hint of green on the finish.

title: Legado del Moncayo 2017 Garnacha Rosé (Campo de Borja)
description: Dusty aromas of citrus rinds are a touch prickly but overall rank as good and clean. A plump palate with medium body retains its freshness prior to melon and orange flavors that hold together on the finish.

title: Lagar de Indra 2017 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Light citrus, peach and buttercup aromas are appealing and easygoing. A plump palate with citric acidity is round and healthy, while this tastes of citrus and tropical fruit. This is steady on the finish; drink now.

title: Juvé & Camps 2015 Essential Brut Xarel-lo (Cava)
description: Dusty vanilla aromas are a bit funky and rustic, with a note of wood. A foamy palate with low acidity is round but blocky. Flavors of spiced apple and powdered sugar finish with notes of vanilla and pepper. This is 100% Xarello, one of Cava's go-to white grapes.

title: Casa de la Ermita 2013 Lunático Monastrell (Jumilla)
description: This Monastrell's scratchy, slightly soapy berry and cassis aromas are on the sweet and ripe side. Its baked plum and berry flavors are fleshy and lack focus, finishing with abrasive tannins.

title: Bodegas Valdemar 2017 Conde Valdemar Blanco White (Rioja)
description: Apple and melon aromas are friendly and open. Tangy acidity straightens out an otherwise plump palate, while nectarines and slightly tropical flavors are ripe, round and flow nicely across the finish.

title: El Xamfrà 2013 Brut Nature Sparkling (Cava)
description: Briny, bready aromas of apple cider set up a smooth but slightly soft palate. Flavors of nectarine and green herbs finish short and briny, like an echo of the nose. Drink now.

title: Eguren Ugarte 2013 Cincuenta  (Rioja)
description: Raspberry, strawberry and oaky shoe polish aromas comprise the nose on this pinching rubbery Rioja from a cold vintage. Plum, cherry and raspberry flavors finish fresh and ripped, with tannins that won't quit. Drink through 2020.

title: Trus 2015 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: A dark color and bulky aromas of jumbled black fruits and Christmas spices set up a stacked palate with hard tannins and lots of weight. Blackberry flavors mixed with mocha and spice notes are classic for Ribera del Duero. A warm finish with grating tannins suggests that aging may help; drink through 2026.

title: Martín Berdugo 2016 Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Floral aromas mixed with citrus notes are appealing. This wine feels round but solidified by bright core acidity. Ripe flavors include pineapple, mango and peach. On the finish, lime and tropical notes are good but short.

title: Tionio 2015 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Concentrated black-fruit and oak aromas are gamy. A jammy palate tips the scales towards heavy, while this tastes of ripe, slightly baked black fruits. Notes of toast, spice and game mark the close.

title: Valserrano 2016  Rioja
description: Cherry and cassis aromas are closed down. This Mazuelo, globally known as Carignan, is full of power but also astringency. Unsurprising black-cherry and plum flavors darken up on a hard-pounding finish that doesn't overplay the oak. While not a cellar selection, this will last for decades due to its high acid-and-tannin level.

title: De Bardos 2015 Epica Roble  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Grapy berry aromas are a bit reduced and jammy. In the mouth, this wine is dense and saturated, with solid tannins and a sense of thickness. Savory blackberry and cassis flavors finish earthy and slightly baked, with drying tannins.

title: Altavins 2014 Tempus Red (Terra Alta)
description: Rubbery aromas of grilled meat and medicinal berry fruits lead to a full jammy palate with a nebulous mouthfeel that's slightly stewed and flat. Ripe, raisiny flavors of baked berry and plum finish soft.

title: Altos de Torona 2016 Rosal Caiño Albariño-Loureiro White (Rías Baixas)
description: This blend of three local grapes including Albariño opens with briny core aromas surrounded by white-fruit notes. The palate hits with a piercing shot of acidity but then turns thicker and more syrupy. Flavors of passion fruit and nectarine are slightly briny and finish plump.

title: Valserrano 2014 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Rubbery berry aromas are scattered, with notes of floral soap, bacon and oak. A fresh but choppy palate holds flavors of plum and oak spice. Those same flavors carry onto a dry, tight finish that's more lean than lush.

title: Gómez de Segura 2013 Finca Ratón Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Cottony plum and berry aromas are a touch soapy. This is plodding and on the heavy side. Saturated stewy berry and spice flavors are chocolaty and oaky on the finish, as well as herbal. This offers a lot, but it's coarse, jumpy and suffers a bit under its own weight.

title: Rafael Cambra 2014 Soplo Garnacha (Valencia)
description: Dry spice, bacon, rubber and red fruit aromas comprise the nose on this tight, prodding Garnacha with bright acidity. Red plum and pomegranate flavors finish with a note of salt on a long finish with raspberry shadings.

title: Finca Valpiedra 2015 Cantos de Valpiedra  (Rioja)
description: Woodsy aromas meld with stalky berry and plum scents prior to a pulling, tannic palate with bold acidity. Herbal berry flavors are pumped up by lemon acidity, while this shows fiery spirit along with berry flavors that finish with prune notes.

title: Artadi 2014 Garnacha Blanca (Navarra)
description: Aromas of gasoline and white grapefruit skins lead to tangy palate with good grip and weight. This tastes waxy, bitter and citrusy, with a hint of tropical fruit. Zesty acidity livens up the finish, which runs fairly long.

title: Muga 2016 White (Rioja)
description: Spiced apple and light oak aromas are clean and attractive. This wine feels racy and pure, with good acidic kick. Flavors of nectarine and wood are compatible, while this barrel-fermented Viura (with 10% Malvasia) is solid on the finish.

title: Artadi 2012 Santa Cruz de Artazu Garnacha (Navarra)
description: Pushy oak on the nose results in grainy aromas and cheesy notes. This warm-vintage Garnacha from Navarra feels tight and pulling, with choppy tannins. Oaky flavors of blackberry are raw and bumpy across a hot and scratchy finish.

title: Finca La Mata 2015  Ribera del Duero
description: This wine smells a touch minty and green. It's tight, muscular and tannic on the palate, with oaky, herbal berry fruit and a firm, chalky finish.

title: Cellers Baronia del Montsant 2013 Flor d'Englora Garnacha (Montsant)
description: Although this value red shows mild baked and raisiny aromas, it's not overripe. The palate is blocky but full. Dry oak flavors of clove and spice infuse its tomatoey plum fruit, feeling bold, dry and firm on the finish.

title: Viña Olabarri 2016 Bikandi Crianza Ecological  (Rioja)
description: A demonstrably oaky nose comes with aromas of maple, hickory, wood grain and berry fruits. Following the nose, this feels grabby, with severe wood-based tannins. Buttery berry and oak-based flavors could use another year or two to settle, while this feels grating and warm on the finish.

title: Parxet 2015 Brut Reserva Sparkling (Cava)
description: Fresh pear, apple and seashell aromas form the welcome on this vintage brut. A steady palate is a bit foamy and unrefined. Flavors of vanilla, white tree fruits and yeasty bread are mildly complex in front of an even finish.

title: Emilio Moro 2016 El Zarzal Godello (Bierzo)
description: A gold-meets-tan color and chunky aromas of walnut oil and mature apple are less than overtly fruity and fresh. In the mouth, citric acidity is keeping this braced and balanced. Flavors of lightly salty nectarine and peach pit turn lemony and a touch bitter on a full finish. Drink now.

title: Fillaboa 2017 Estate Grown Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Melon and mild pyrazine-based green aromas create a good but slightly unfocused nose. This feels chunky and pulpy, with melony weight. Flavors of pineapple and nectarine are briny on the back end, while this is short on a finish that's low on acidic verve.

title: Castellroig 2014 Sabaté i Coca Mosset Corpinnat Brut Nature Sparkling (Spain)
designation: Sabaté i Coca Mosset Corpinnat Brut Nature
description: Smoky, stalky aromas of warm haystack are low on fruit. Throughout, this brut nature is dry and salty, with the lightest level of fruit that passes for ripe. Citrus notes on the finish get reduced to pithy grapefruit as this closes.

title: Portal del Priorat 2014 Luno Red (Montsant)
description: Lightly spiced plum aromas are minerally and come with a hint of nutmeg. A flush, bouncy palate is made tougher by rubbery tannins, while spicy plum and blueberry flavors are solid through the back end. The blend offers Grenache, Syrah, Carignan and Cabernet Sauvignon.

title: Pittacum 2014 Val de la Loba Paraje Singular Mencía (Bierzo)
designation: Val de la Loba Paraje Singular
description: A pinched, rubbery nose hints at volatility. In the mouth, this single-vineyard Mencía is wiry, tough and high in tartaric acidity. Savory, saucy plum and berry flavors are salty on a dense finish.

title: Muruve 2014 Elite  (Toro)
description: Earthy, herbal aromas are a bit murky and reflect a marginal Toro vintage in 2014. A grabby, overextracted palate delivers rock-hard tannins along with gummy flavors of blackberry and blueberry. On the finish, creamy oak takes on a clove-like flavor.

title: Gómez de Segura 2013 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Saucy berry aromas include screaming oak notes, while this is smacking, tannic and full on the palate. Plum and berry fruit flavors are fully oaked, while this feels tight and drawing on the finish.

title: Sueño 2014 Tempranillo (Ribera del Júcar)
description: This wine's ripe berry aromas include integrated oak, tar and vanilla notes. Its plum, raspberry, vanilla and cream flavors are appealing, yet it finishes raw, jagged and a bit shrill.

title: Llopart 2012 Leopardi Gran Reserva Brut Nature Sparkling (Cava)
description: Pear and honeydew aromas are sweet, bready and yeasty. This is foamy to the point that it blows up on the palate. Dry, basic apple flavors are nothing special for gran reserva, while this fades out without much of an impression.

title: Altos de Torona 2018 Sobre Lías Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Briny aromas of orange and nectarine are a bit stony and minerally. This Albariño is plump but not real zesty. Melon and stone-fruit flavors finish creamy and fairly long due to lees aging.

title: Bodegas Vegalfaro 2016 Caprasia Red (Utiel-Requena)
description: Malty, earthy, roasted berry aromas become more chocolaty as this wine breathes. An oaky, resiny palate is saturated and shows spicy, peppery black-fruit flavors along with some heat. This Bobal-Merlot blend sizzles on a full-throttle finish that's not shy on oak.

title: Bodegas Palacio 2014 Glorioso Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Aromas of creamy vanilla and mixed berry fruits are a bit jumbled. This has a full, grabby, chunky palate, with spicy plum and peppery flavors that don't show a lot of variation or complexity. On the finish, there's heat and oak to cut through.

title: Vins El Cep 2016 GR5 Senders Xarel-lo (Penedès)
description: Apple and pear aromas are clean as a whistle. This is varietal Xarello, a key grape in Cava production. It is citrusy and minerally in feel, with lemon, tangerine and stony flavors mixed with a touch of yeast. A tight, exact finish is juicy and stony.

title: Finca Constancia 2014 Selección Red (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Floral berry aromas are drowned out by heavy scents of licorice and clove. A jumpy, fresh palate is raw but high in energy. Herbal, minty currant flavors are dry, oaky and toasty on the finish. This blend is made from six grapes, Syrah and Cab Sauvignon among them.

title: Rosa Nautica 2016 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Aromas of lemon curd and citrus blossom come with a hint of pine. This feels lemony and narrow, with a tight body that's showing little to no give. Nectarine, citrus and green-melon flavors are fresh prior to a dry citrusy finish.

title: Nubori 2014 Cata Nobilis Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Spiced-plum, soy sauce and prune aromas settle on soupy as this breathes out. A full palate with sinewy tannins, notable acidity and some creaminess deals flavors of stewed plum, raisin and vanilla. On the finish, it's more of the same, with a stewed final impression.

title: Pazo de Barrantes 2018 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Ripe tropical aromas include scents of lychee, pineapple and peach. On the palate, this is fat to the point that it borders on syrupy. Salty melon flavors are infused with a lees character, while this reverts to chunky on the finish.

title: Llopart 2016 Rosé Brut Reserva Sparkling (Cava)
description: A salmon color and mild aromas of red apple open this rosé Cava. An animated palate is a bit foamy and lacking in finesse, while cantaloupe and orange flavors offer a hint of white pepper on a standard finish.

title: Bodegas Hidalgo 2015 Picos Pardos Grenache (Calatayud)
description: At first, this black-colored Garnacha smells horsey and reduced, but with time it exudes more aromatic harmony and quality. A big tannic palate is rough like sandpaper. Blackberry, pepper and chocolate flavors don't rise to a level of excellence, while a heavy saturated finish closes out this muscular red.

title: Vieira de Plata 2018 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Leesy aromas of melon and cured ham are rich and full, while a pulpy palate shows mild spritz. Peach and nectarine flavors are solid and satisfying before they fall off on a pulpy finish.

title: Protos 2016 12 Meses  (Ribera del Duero)
description: A heavy topping of mocha and clove carries the nose toward an aggressive palate where the acidity sticks out. Oaky flavors of mint and clove crowd raspberry and cherry notes, while this feels and tastes woody on the finish. This spent 12 months in French and American barrels, which is noted.

title: Lasalde Elkartea 2015 Txakoli Aitzalde Hondarrabi Zuri (Getariako Txakolina)
description: Grassy aromas and a whiff of celery lead to a snappy palate with fresh but tart lemon, gooseberry and white-currant flavors. A juicy fresh finish with citrus flavors is typical of well-executed Txakoli.

title: Hiruzta 2015 Txakolina Hondarribia Hondarrabi Zuri (Getariako Txakolina)
description: A note of yeasty vanilla graces apple and citrus aromas. This feels chalky and minerally, with a touch of spritz. Dry lime and green-apple flavors finish clean and long, with no funk to speak of.

title: Bodegas Campante 2015 Viña Reboreda Godello (Ribeiro)
description: A light yeasty quality and a note of mustard stick out on an otherwise generic white-fruit nose. This is fairly full in body and well balanced—flavors of melon and stone fruits fall off on the finish and taste slightly oxidized. Drink now.

title: Celler Bàrbara Forés 2013 Negre Red (Terra Alta)
description: Ripe, slightly oxidized berry, raisin and Band-Aid aromas feed a tannic, grippy palate in this Garnacha, Syrah and Carignan blend. Its earthy berry and plum flavors are full and ripe, with a blocky, slightly medicinal finish.

title: Alta Alella 2016 GX Made With Organic Grapes Garnacha (Catalunya)
description: Jumpy plum and raspberry aromas come in front of a fleshy but bright palate with bold acidity. Lively raspberry and plum flavors darken up on a peppery finish with some heat. For an everyday red wine with energy, this fits the bill.

title: Parxet 2012 Gran Reserva M.C. Sparkling (Cava)
description: Lemon-lime aromas are similar to commercial soda. This vintage Cava is tangy, lemony and crisp on the palate, but nothing beyond normal. Green-apple and lime flavors are a bit tart, while this is clean and lean on the finish.

title: Mont Marçal 2015 Brut Reserva Sparkling (Cava)
