description: Lime, lettuce and cactus aromas lean in the direction of green. On the palate, this brut reserva is aggressive and foamy. Slightly bitter flavors of green herbs are matched by lemon-lime notes, while this is steady on the finish.

title: Luna Beberide 2015 Finca la Cuesta Mencía (Bierzo)
description: Earthy berry aromas are lightly herbal. Tight tannins are crunchy, while this tastes of dark-berry fruits, plum and green herbs. A dry spicy peppery finish is tough but steady on the way out.

title: Bodegas Vínícola Real 2007 200 Monges Selección Especial Reserva Blanco White (Rioja)
description: A gold color and resiny aromas of nutty oak and oxidized white fruits capture the essence of aged white Rioja. A round, oily palate is dominated by oak, tasting of spiced apple, almond skins and woodspice. Flavors of peanut, dried apricot and stone-fruit pits provide for a good finish.

title: Cuatro Rayas 2018 Cuarenta Vendimias Selección Especial Sobre Lias Verdejo (Rueda)
designation: Cuarenta Vendimias Selección Especial Sobre Lias
description: Citrus peel aromas are offset by strong leesy notes that almost give this Verdejo a smoky nose. A crisp palate is like lime juice, while this tastes of lime and citrus peel prior to a fresh but short finish.

title: Bodegas Iranzo 2016 Azul de Bobal (Utiel-Requena)
description: Resiny oak aromas rest atop blackberry, raisin and prune scents on what amounts to a full but lazy nose. This Bobal is fleshy and tannic, with spiked acidity that provides a needed shock. Sappy berry, plum and resiny oak flavors finish jammy, tannic and a bit flat.

title: Beronia 2013 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Earthy plum aromas are a bit damp, mossy and gaseous. An angular palate is high in acidity, and thus feels raw. Flavors of cola, desiccated black fruits and lemony oak finish dry, with plum, cherry and chocolate notes rising up on a tight tomatoey finish.

title: Finca Río Negro 2013 Cogolludo Guadalajara Red (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Raw spicy plum and berry aromas are scratchy as opposed to lush and deep. This blend of Tempranillo, Syrah, Merlot and Cab Sauvignon is medium bodied, with earthy berry and cola flavors that don't have much to say on the finish.

title: Pingón 2015 Torre Pingón Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Aromas of olive, forest floor and damp black fruits are more challenging than outright pure. Hard tannins concentrate flavors of chicken fat, desert brush and gamy berry fruits, while a dry, scrubbing finish could use a buffing.

title: Viñedos de Alfaro 2015 Conde del Real Agrado Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Wide berry and plum aromas are fruity but unrefined. This crianza is mostly Garnacha with Tempranillo, Graciano and Mazuelo. The palate is flush but drills down hard with tannins. Berry and plum flavors reflect a warm year and a warm subzone of Rioja (Alfaro).

title: Chopo 2014 Monastrell-Syrah (Jumilla)
description: Jammy plum and berry aromas come with dessert herb scents. A juicy palate doesn't offer much structure, but this Monastrell-Syrah blend tastes good courtesy of plum, blackberry and toasty flavors. The ripe warm finish is generous.

title: Cuatro Pasos 2016 Pizarras de Otero Mencía (Bierzo)
description: A fruity nose with plum, wild berry and black-cherry aromas is solid and pleasant. A tight palate with grip is healthy, while this tastes slightly green but also fruity and fresh, with mint and spice notes on the finish.

title: Bodegas Ugalde 2014 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Floral aromas of cherry and plum are on the light side, which is not a criticism. A snappy, pulpy palate is a bit rubbery and raw, while this Rioja Crianza tastes of raspberry and salty red plum. A mild finish is an apropos ending to this easy-drinking blend of Tempranillo, Garnacha and Mazuelo (Carignan).

title: Suertes del Marqués 2015 Trenzado White (Valle de la Orotava)
description: Hailing from the volcanic soils of Tenerife in the Canary Islands, this blend of Pedro Ximénez and Listán Blanco opens with aromas of citrus peel and honey. A powerful palate is angular and smacking. Salty citrus flavors reflect an ocean influence, while the wine is strong on the finish.

title: Marqués de Valparaíso 2015 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Generic berry and plum aromas are straightforward and clean. A tight-as-nails palate shows merciless tannins and severe clamp, while pinched red fruit flavors offer a hint of olive. Tannic rawness remains on a clampy finish.

title: Marqués de Cáceres 2016 Generación MC  (Rioja)
description: A black color and dense aromas of blackberry, clove and oak spice lead to a fully saturated palate with rubbing tannins and modest acidity. Heavily spiced and toasted blackberry, cocoa and vanilla flavors are oak-aided, while this settles in bumpy fashion on a tough, tannic finish.

title: Cellers Unió 2016 Perlat Red (Montsant)
description: Earthy aromas of tobacco, modest oak and berry fruits require airing to put their best foot forward. A slightly sticky and resiny palate is as full as it needs to be, while this Garnacha-Carignan-Syrah blend tastes of ripe berry fruits and spicy oak. On the finish, clove and herbal notes enter the picture.

title: Bodega Classica 2014 Hacienda Lopez de Haro Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Spicy earthy cherry and berry aromas are calm like a serene lake. A more crisp and drawing palate is bolstered by fresh acidity, while this tastes of earthy plum and tomato, with spice notes. A fleshy but limited finish is the conclusion; drink now.

title: Picos Pardos 2016 VS Garnacha (Calatayud)
description: Candied red-fruit aromas are soupy and suggest chocolate-covered raisin and cherry cough drop. This is a hard nut, with charged-up tannins. Ripe berry flavors include a jammy note of prune, while this finishes like gravel. One should always strap in when tackling a Calatayud Garnacha.

title: Viña Vilano 2016 Roble Black Edition  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Borderline raisiny aromas are ripe but a touch cooked and soft. This feels flush and full, but also soupy. Blackberry, spice and oaky flavors finish woody and with notes of mint and herbs.

title: Licia 2016 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Punchy citrus, apple and lanolin aromas are a bit dusty and entirely typical of Rías Baixas Albariño. Direct citrus flavors and a note of briny orange peel finish a bit salty, with a hint of green banana.

title: Bodegas Olarra 2016 Sagasta  (Rioja)
description: Spicy oak with a chocolate twist rests comfortably on top of berry fruit aromas. A racy, tough palate is rubbery but lively and balanced, while blackberry, plum and chocolate flavors simmer on a finish with clean but notable oak.

title: Ego Bodegas 2015 Fuerza Red (Jumilla)
description: A heavy coating of charred oak and coffee grounds rests atop blackberry and cassis scents. While this is jammy and thick, core acidity and lemony oak notes foster balance. Cassis and blackberry flavors finish peppery, spicy and oaky, with a lasting note of chocolate. This is 75% Monastrell with 25% Cabernet Sauvignon.

title: Godelia 2016 Pilgram Mencía (Bierzo)
description: Medicinal, minerally plum and black-currant aromas are staunch. A live-wire palate with heavy tannins and tension is far from elegant and smooth. Like the nose, this tastes of medicinal plum and berry fruits, while the finish is bold, tannic and choppy.

title: Marques de Griñon 2012 Single Vineyard Estate Bottled Petit Verdot (Dominio de Valdepusa)
description: Broad, foresty black-fruit aromas are spicy and lush. Although this Petit Verdot is nice on the nose and tastes good, the mouthfeel is off due to shrill tartaric acidity. Savory and sour plum flavors clash, and it feels raw and grating on the finish.

title: Luna Beberide 2016 Mencía (Bierzo)
description: Dark-berry aromas are a touch medicinal. This Mencía feels tight, hard and rubbery, with rocky tannins. Black-fruit flavors show a touch of herbs. It finishes firm and intense, with unresolved tannins and bright acidity.

title: Sonsierra 2015 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Ripeness is conveyed through mild raisin and prune aromas. While this is firm on the palate, there's just enough cushion to provide depth. Earthy berry and raisin flavors reflect a warm year, while this is sappy on a fruity finish with just enough edge to it.

title: Bodegas Olarra 2010 Reciente Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Mature, almost murky aromas of leafy berry fruits are not exactly fresh. High acidity has created an edgy, clipped palate, while currant, pie cherry and raspberry flavors wrap up on a lean and spirited finish. This will last another 10 years, but the fruit is already on the slide.

title: Bodega Classica 2016 Lopez de Haro Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Plum aromas veer toward the dark end of the aromatic spectrum. A racy palate is both plump and bolstered by acidity. Berry and plum flavors are punchy and slightly earthy and leafy in a classic Rioja way.

title: Beronia 2018 Rosé (Rioja)
description: Aromas of stone fruit and chewing gum are mild and easy. This rosé feels fresh but has some weight and grip. Peach, nectarine and apricot flavors show on the palate, while a good texture and mild bitterness add some complexity to the finish.

title: Xucrogas 2014 Her Essential Garnacha (Cariñena)
description: Lightly floral and airy raspberry and red currant aromas are slightly leathery. Typical of Garnacha from Aragón, this feels round and jammy. Candied red fruit flavors are steady on the finish, and overall this shows Garnacha in a fresh and flowery way.

title: Castroviejo 2014 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: A round nose is slightly raisiny and ripe, with vanilla and a woodsy note of hand soap. A fairly full palate isn't short on acidity or tannins. Chocolaty oak accents plum and wild raspberry flavors, while this is jacked up on a powerful but untamed finish.

title: Montecillo 2015 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Rubbery, slightly blackened aromas of berry fruits, beef stew and olive lead to a wide, fleshy palate with solid tannins. Black plum, vanilla and prune flavors are derived from a warm, dry vintage, while this crianza deals a mild chocolaty note on a round finish.

title: Legaris 2009 Calmo Vino de Lágrima Nocturno  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Big grapy aromas of blackberry and cassis are rather heavy and flat. This has a tannic abrasive mouthfeel in which nothing is smooth. Borderline overripe flavors of baked plum and blackberry finish chocolaty and with baking-spice flavors.

title: Portal del Priorat 2014 Negre de Negres Red (Priorat)
description: Latex and medicinal berry aromascome with cinnamon and savory spice notes in this sinewy, full-bodied wine. Its grippy tannins and prodding acidity frame slightly exotic and savory blueberry, oak and graphite flavors, finishing snappy, with a note of cured meat.

title: Marqués de Carrión 2014 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: A mixture of wet clay and baked plum aromas form the nose of this ready to drink crianza. Scratchy tannins and tight acidity give the palate verve, while this tastes mostly of saucy plum. A rubbing, tannic finish wraps it up.

title: Finca Río Negro 2016 992 Cogolludo Guadalajara Single Vineyard Red (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Slightly raw aromas of leathery berry fruits are foxy at first, with a lactic note. This Tempranillo-Syrah blend feels tight and tough, with grippy tannins, while berry flavors are herbal, minty and buttery. On the finish, this feels dry and choppy, with grainy oak.

title: El Coto 2017 875m Fermentado En Barrica Finca Carbonera Chardonnay (Rioja)
description: Can't-miss oak drives the nose on this high-elevation Chardonnay. In the mouth, oak-based weight is cut by hard-driving acidity. Smoky, woody notes push generic white fruit flavors to the fringes, while primed acidity pushes a low-fruit finish to its limits.

title: Don Olegario 2016 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Apple and vanilla-cookie aromas are mild. The slightly chunky mouthfeel suggests grape skins. Skins-driven flavors of lime and grapefruit finish with an oily texture and a taste of citrus peel.

title: Pago de la Jaraba 2014 Red (La Mancha)
description: A cool, minty, rubbery nose revolves around smoky berry aromas. This is mostly Tempranillo, with 20% Cabernet Sauvignon and 10% Merlot, and on the palate it bounces from point to point. A short blast of blackberry and plum flavors finishes with power, acidity and a gamy quality.

title: Palacio de Bornos 2016 Verdejo (Rueda)
description: This Verdejo is pungent and angular on the nose, with pyrazinic aromas of green citrus, sweat and cactus that are common to the variety and Rueda. An oily, grabby palate is cut by firm acidity, while flavors of tangerine, nopal and bell pepper finish short despite lively acidity.

title: Juvé & Camps 2015 Milesimé Brut Reserva Chardonnay (Cava)
description: Dusty, dry apple and pear aromas come with a whiff of talcum powder. This Chardonnay feels plump and soft, with moderate to low acidity. Apple, vanilla and spiced pear flavors are steady on a finish that's more regular than special.

title: Valmiñor 2017 Edición Especial 10 Años Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Tropical-fruit aromas include notes of pineapple and mango. This has an easy-to-like palate with pulpy weight and just enough acidity. Peachy flavors include a note of honeydew melon, while this shows a saline character on the finish.

title: Bodegas Vínícola Real 2009 200 Monges Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Chunky black-fruit aromas are in the overripe zone, with a smoky offset. A raw palate is bolstered by citrusy acidity that creates a screechy mouthfeel. Flavors of plum skins and orange peel are good.

title: Altos de Torona 2016 Sobre Lías Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Banana and pear aromas are lightly briny. A minerally mouthfeel is driven by citric acidity, while tangerine flavors are backed by sea-based briny notes. This offers real value; drink immediately.

title: Txakoli Primo 2017 Zarautz Hondarrabi Zuri (Getariako Txakolina)
description: This wine's punchy, minerally citrus and stone fruit aromas set up a spritzy and lemony palate with sharp acidity. Its tart, tangy citrus and pineapple flavors finish long, with intense tartness. This is Txakoli in all its lean, acidic glory.

title: Vicente Gandia 2018 Nebla Verdejo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León
description: On the nose, this Verdejo blends generic citrus aromas with pyrazines in front of a healthy palate with medium weight and punchy acidity. Green apple, grass and green bell pepper flavors finish short but fresh. Drink now.

title: Señorío de Sotillo 2015 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: A black color and jammy blackberry aromas (bordering on cooked) reflect a hot vintage. A smacking, condensed sense of saturation defines a ripe palate with coconut and dark-chocolate flavors. On the finish, coconut and other oaky flavors dominate.

title: Raiza 2017 Altos de Raiza  (Rioja)
description: Herbal berry aromas are a touch jammy and superficial. On the palate, this feels full, round and blocky but not heavy. Dried plum and savory flavors of gamy berry fruits finish pulpy and pudgy. For everyday Rioja, this is just right.

title: Picos Pardos 2016 Red (Calatayud)
description: This unwieldy Garnacha opens with candied berry aromas that border on reduced and medicinal, with raisiny notes. A sappy grabby palate tastes of fig, blackberry, prune and cherry cough drop, while a tannic finish collapses down.

title: El Coto 2018 Blanco Viura (Rioja)
description: Citrus and tropical fruit aromas are fit and normal for this variety, which isn't common to Rioja. A pulpy body with acidic balance offers salty flavors of green melon and salad. On the finish, this tastes briny like a cactus pad. Drink right away.

title: García Figuero 2016 Viña Viejas  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Forceful oak-based aromas of clove and cinnamon are less than natural, while this is powerful, raw, gritty and pinched on the palate. Wood-based flavors of clove and cinnamon sit on top of blackberry fruit, while this tastes of black plum and blackberry on a sappy, oaky finish.

title: Victoria Ordóñez 2016 La Ola Del Melillero White (Sierras de Málaga)
description: This floral- and tropical fruit-scented wine is 70% Pedro Ximénez and 30% Moscatel. It's round and oily in texture, with simple orange, lychee and green melon flavors and a nice, steady, citrus-laced finish.

title: Manuel Manzaneque Suárez 2015 Mil Cepas Vino de Parcela Cencibel (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: This Tempranillo's ripe berry aromas devolve into leathery, raisiny notes as they unwind. It's dense and chewy on the palate, with herbal raspberry and plum flavors and a hard finish marked by raisiny notes and hint of oxidation.

title: Marqués de la Concordia 2016 MM Reserva de la Familia Brut Rosé Sparkling (Cava)
designation: MM Reserva de la Familia Brut Rosé
description: Vague aromas of orange and nectarine are inexact. The same could be said for the mouthfeel on this rosé Cava: It is round and friendly but not very active. Peppery flavor notes infiltrate mild citrus fruit flavors, while this is solid in feel but short on complexity on the finish.

title: Bodegas Landaluce 2016 Fincas de Landaluce Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Slightly murky and earthy black plum aromas are a bit jumbled but not problematic. This varietal Tempranillo crianza feels full and tannic, while plum and berry flavors transition to fresh prune on the finish. At 14.5% alcohol, this is pretty big for a crianza, but in a good year like 2016 it makes the grade.

title: Sierra Cantabria 2015 Organza White (Rioja)
description: Oak and spice notes are out front on the nose but not overpowering. This blend of Viura, Malvasia and Garnacha Blanca is medium in body, with a shot of bracing acidity. Wood-dominant flavors of spiced apple and resin carry the finish.

title: Pago Casa Gran 2017 Casa Benasal Elegant Red (Valencia)
description: Warm aromas of cherry and menthol settle on blackberry and wood spice, while this feels linear, choppy and tannic. Dark-plum, blackberry and cassis flavors add up, while this feels fiery on a finish that never loses its good flavor profile. Syrah, Monastrell and Garnacha Tintorera is the blend.

title: Pago Casa Gran 2017 Casa Benasal Crux Red (Valencia)
description: Reduced aromas of bluegrass, cherry and sugar beet lead to a clamping palate driven by hard-biting tannins. Just like the palate is raw, so are flavors of plum, beet and spicy oak. By the time this Monastrell, with 10% Garnacha Tintorera, finishes with hard rubbery tannins you're waving the white flag.

title: Coto de Hayas 2016 Garnacha-Syrah (Campo de Borja)
description: This Garnacha-Syrah blend is crisp and lively. Its generic berry and plum aromas are fresh and clean, with a hint of rubber. Blackberry, plum and grape skin flavors end in snappy fashion.

title: Serra da Estrela 2015 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Lemon and apple aromas are inviting, with a note of sweet grass. A chiseled, acidic yet round palate delivers flavors of tangerine, lime, lees and mild bitterness. This is fresh throughout, but short on the finish.

title: Tineta 2015  Ribera del Duero
description: Initially, this smells horsey, minty and not entirely clean or clear. A full chunky but clumsy palate is home to dark toasty flavors of clove and spice, while fruit notes are secondary. Barrel-driven mint, spice and clove flavors dominate the finish.

title: Marco Abella 2013 Loidana Red (Priorat)
description: Fresh cherry and plum aromas are basic and easy, with a medicinal side note. This Garnacha-Carignan-Cabernet blend is grabby and pulling. Plum, raspberry and tomato flavors finish with a reprise of rubbery tannins.

title: Alta Alella 2017 Bruant Organic Natural Brut Nature Sparkling (Cava)
description: Green apple, pear and mineral aromas comprise a nose with nothing overt. On the palate, this is light on bubbles and high in malic acidity, which is typical for the brut nature style. Lime, green apple and Bartlett pear flavors are clean and lean on the finish.

title: Alta Alella 2016 Mirgin Laietà Rosé Gran Reserva Brut Nature Sparkling (Cava)
designation: Mirgin Laietà Rosé Gran Reserva Brut Nature
description: Yeasty, oxidized aromas are bready while not pumping out much fruit. Raw acidity lends a tangy element to the palate, while this rosé tastes briny and like red currant, tart nectarine and citrus. Elegance is hard to find on a full but balanced finish.

title: Ego Bodegas 2016 Goru 18M Red (Jumilla)
description: Gritty aromas suggest dirty motor oil, coffee grounds and almost nutty black fruits. This Monastrell blend feels choppy, pulling and hard. Blackberry, cassis and berry syrup flavors are grinding on a finish that's so massive and tannic that this ranks as clumsy.

title: Emina 2016 Verdejo-Viura (Rueda)
description: This blend of Verdejo and Viura opens with citrusy aromas that include tropical notes and a hint of minerality. A juicy citric palate holds orange and lemon-lime flavors, while this tastes citrusy on the finish.

title: Artadi 2014  Rioja
description: This wine's ripe berry aromas include a hint of iodine. Its chunky palate lacks precision, tasting of coffee and nondescript berry fruit flavors. The finish is dense and round but lacks focus.

title: Protos 2014 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: This crianza is intense, its ripe blackberry and cassis aromas tinged with oak. Loud flavors of black plum, coffee and spice are pushed by lemony acidity into the toasty, strong-boned but narrow finish. Drink through 2026.

title: Finca Antigua 2016 Crianza Garnacha (La Mancha)
description: Spearmint and rubbery berry fruit aromas include a note of sandalwood on what amounts to an exotic nose. A full and fleshy palate deals flavors of black plum, blackberry and currant, while this Garnacha tastes dry and desiccated on a finish with tomatoey acidity.

title: Bodegas Martinez Corta 2016 Cepas Antiguas Selección Privada  (Rioja)
description: This bright and lively Tempranillo offers concentrated berry and plum aromas with a touch of oak. Grippy and a touch abrasive, it tastes of blackberry and subtle oak, finishing salty and savory, with mild heat.

title: Pradorey 2010 PR3 Barricas Verdejo (Rueda)
description: This resiny, oaky Verdejo opens with a bright gold luster and spiced pumpkin and honeyed white fruit aromas. Its mature, lightly oxidized stone fruit flavors are backed by lingering toastiness. A full, textured finish closes it out.

title: Gaintza 2017 White (Getariako Txakolina)
description: This wine's apple and citrus aromas are lean and dusty. Like most Txakoli wines, it's sharp and tangy on the palate, with spritz. Its briny gooseberry and lime flavors are salty, which again is typical for this style of Basque white wine.

title: Bodegas Aragonesas 2016 Viña Temprana Old Vines Tempranillo (Campo de Borja)
description: This everyday Tempranillo offers chocolaty berry aromas. Tightly built, its dark, spicy raspberry and plum flavors finish bright and firm. A very good basic red.

title: Castaño 2016 Hécula Monastrell (Yecla)
description: Woody berry and clove aromas introduce this chewy, extracted Monsatrell. Solid tannins drive its herbal plum and berry flavors, with ample woodspice and a peppery, clove-like finish.

title: Bodegas Olarra 2015 Reciente Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Berry and cherry aromas are jumbled at first, but better with airing. On the palate, this is kicking with acidity and choppy tannins. Plum and cherry flavors are bold on a tannic finish with a touch of heat. While tasty and intense, this reserva is brusque.

title: Bodegas Berceo 2014 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Calm berry aromas open this crianza that's packed with fruit. Big and bold flavors of grape skins, plum and berry fruits turn drier and spicier on a finish that's lively and fairly long.

title: Vicente Gandia 2016 El Miracle Art by Cari Roig Red (Alicante)
designation: El Miracle Art by Cari Roig
description: Plum and berry aromas are just ripe enough to draw you in. A medium-to-full palate is a touch choppy, while savory berry and plum flavors benefit from integrated oak. This Alicante blend is steady on the finish and easy to drink.

title: Rafael Cambra 2016 El Bon Homme Red (Valencia)
description: Wild berry aromas include notes of smoke and rose petals, all of which amounts to a good whole. A wiry, punchy palate lives off acidity, while this blend of Cabernet Sauvignon and Monastrell tastes of red plum, cherry and tobacco. Plum and cherry flavors carry over to a screechy finish.

title: Marqués de Murrieta 2014 Finca Ygay Reserva  (Rioja)
description: This reserva from a not-so-good vintage smells floral, much like red roses. A pulpy palate is fleshy and short on focus, while this tastes of candied plum, raisin and cherry tomato. A slightly metallic flavor is up front on the finish.

title: Navas 1212 2016 Roble  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Blackberry and cassis aromas are clean and fruity, but only moderately intense. A pulpy, fruit-filled palate is on the grabby side, while this tastes of leathery berry and black plum. Notes of chocolate and oak spice are apparent on the finish.

title: Pagos del Galir 2017 Godello (Valdeorras)
description: Mild stone fruit and peach pit aromas come in front of a medium-bodied palate. Apple, green melon and stalky bitterness are the main flavors that end with a solid, cleansing finish. This is standard Godello done well.

title: Losada 2017 El Pájaro Rojo Mencía (Bierzo)
description: Earthy berry and raisin aromas are not what you'd call exact, and are instead wide and fleshy. Matching the nose, this feels bulky and saturated. Baked blackberry and cassis flavors finish with soupy weight and rubbery tannins.

title: Castellroig 2011 Sabaté i Coca Reserva Familiar Brut Nature Sparkling (Cava)
designation: Sabaté i Coca Reserva Familiar Brut Nature
description: Sourdough bread aromas are calmly citric. A clean and direct palate doesn't go beyond the basics, while this tastes of green melon, herbs and grass. On the finish, this is solid but doesn't expand or become more interesting.

title: Vinos de Arganza 2016 Encanto Mencía (Bierzo)
description: Ripe blackberry and cassis aromas are lusty and bring a note of oaky clove as this opens. A bold bright palate is juicy and rugged. Grapy black-fruit flavors are toasty, while the barrel influence is strongest on the finish, which tastes of clove, chocolate and oak spice.

title: Portia 2018 Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Initial citrus and green aromas are pointy and sweaty and come with pyrazine notes common to Verdejo. On the palate, this is round and not too sharp. Green flavors of lime, kiwi and green melon finish with clarity.

title: Portia 2014 Triennia  (Ribera del Duero)
description: A highly saturated nose smells outright raisiny. On the palate, this is dense as mud and tannic. A mix of overripe berry and tomato flavors amounts to a saucy whole, while this feels warm and sappy on a finish that's massive but shy on elegance and character.

title: Emilio Moro 2016 La Revelía Godello (Bierzo)
description: Briny citrus and apple aromas come with a leesy note of lanolin. Sharp acidity bolsters the spine and structure of this Godello, while apple and bitter walnut flavors become even more tight, skins driven and bitter on the finish.

title: Energo 2014  Ribera del Duero
description: Initial ripe, baked black fruit aromas transition to raisiny. A heavy, smacking palate steps with heavy feet, while this tastes of roasted black plum and stewed berry fruits. A chewy, dense, saturated finish is par for the course.

title: Launa 2014 Selección Familiar Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Hard and charred on the nose at first, this sheds its tire-like aromas for cleaner berry-fruit notes with airing. A full grabby palate is a bit rough and awkward, while roasted berry, plum and oak flavors finish minty and resiny.

title: Volver 2015 Tarima Hill Estate Bottled Old Vines Monastrell (Alicante)
designation: Tarima Hill Estate Bottled Old Vines
description: Minty aromas of herbal berry fruits set up a tight, linear palate with acidity that registers as tartaric and jacked up. Dark plum and spiced blackberry flavors are toasty and a touch hot on the finish.

title: Convento Oreja 2014 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Earthy berry and raw oak aromas are more powerful than elegant. A saturated palate with palpable thickness is hard to cut through. Deep but compact cassis and blackberry flavors are hard around the edges, while this fades quickly on the finish for something so big and dark.

title: Bodegas Aragonesas 2015 Castillo de Fuendejalon Crianza Garnacha-Tempranillo (Campo de Borja)
description: Strawberry, raspberry and plum aromas don't overpower, and that's something rare for an Aragón red. The mouthfeel is a bit tough and astringent, with raw tannins. Spicy, savory plum flavors are mildly herbal, while this Garnacha-Tempranillo blend offers a flavor note of pizza on the finish.

title: Vicente Gandia 2016 Finca del Mar Monastrell-Petit Verdot (Valencia)
description: Plum and berry aromas are full but restrained. On the palate, this blend of Monastrell and Petit Verdot is fleshy and pulpy. Oaky plum and cassis flavors fade away slowly on the finish before getting replaced by more overt oak notes.

title: Convento Oreja 2014 Memoria Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Overripeness is spread all over this RDD, starting with aromas of raisin, prune and vanilla and then moving on to a jammy palate with distinct raisin and prune flavors. This is friendly and welcoming as a whole, but decidedly raisiny at all checkpoints.

title: Tamaral 2015 Roble  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Black cherry and cassis aromas are spicy, with a sense of freshness. This Tempranillo feels tight and racy, with tension to the palate. Woody, spicy black-fruit flavors are medium in depth and a touch cooked, while this is full on the finish, with a pronounced oak flavor sticking out.

title: Dominio del Soto 2014 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Smoky berry aromas are rustic and scratchy as this crianza comes at you with force. A saturated palate is bullish and grabby, while this tastes of ripe blackberry, burnt toast and chocolate. Oak-driven spice and dark-fruit flavors settle with warmth on the finish.

title: Marqués de la Concordia 2013 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Dried berry fruit, leather and oak spice aromas comprise a traditional Rioja nose. In the mouth, this is lean and choppy, with lemony acidity creating tightness. Snappy, saucy plum and savory oak flavors finish dry, with rubbing tannins.

title: Vinessens 2016 La Encina Centenaria Monastrell (Alicante)
description: Baked black fruit aromas are ripe, hot and pushy. On the palate, this Monastrell feels fiery and aggressive, with hard-driving acidity. Bold plum and currant flavors finish with power but also tongue-burning acidity that makes the ending choppy.

title: José Pariente 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Rueda)
description: Sauvingon Blanc is the second grape in Rueda to Verdejo, but here's a good one for casual situations. A no-nonsense nose with white fruit scents and cactus notes leads to crispness on the tongue and flavors of stone fruits and passion fruit. A note of scallion spices up a citrusy finish.

title: Hiruzta 2018 Hondarrabi Zuri (Getariako Txakolina)
description: A neutral nose opens this clean Txakoli, while a chalky palate has a lemon-lime character. Tart apple and citrus flavors are good but common, while this is steady on a finish that neither evolves nor devolves.

title: Peñalba Herraiz 2015 Aptus 6 Meses en Barrica  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Cherry and dark plum aromas are solid on the nose. A raw, energetic palate is paced by bright acidity, while this tastes of blackened spice and blackberry. On a bold finish, peppery fruit flavors blend with lightly charred oak.

title: Baron De Ley 2018 Rosado (Rioja)
description: Melon and nectarine aromas are open and easygoing. On the palate, this is more lean and simple than pulpy. Mild stone fruit flavors are steady and cleansing and don't make noise; made entirely from Garnacha grapes.

title: Sonsierra 2017 Tempranillo Blanco (Rioja)
description: Clarity is what this Tempranillo Blanco stresses. The color is light and lucid, while the nose is lean and pure, showing orange notes along with a touch of brine. The palate is straightforward in flavors of melon and green banana.

title: Saline 2017 Hondarrabi Zuri (Getariako Txakolina)
description: Pear and melon aromas are clean but basic for Txakoli. A lightly spritzed palate is citrusy and proper in feel, while snappy flavors of grapefruit and gooseberry finish with freshness, some body and peppy acidity. Drink now.

title: Hiruzta 2016 Berezia Hondarrabi Zuri (Getariako Txakolina)
description: Sea brine, citrus and cider are the main aromas on this still Txakoli that's both round and smooth on the palate. Grapefruit and apple flavors are propelled by modest malic acidity on this fast-maturing Basque white. Drink now.

title: Juan de Juanes 2013 Vendimia Oro Red (Valencia)
description: Black-fruit aromas include overripe prune along with herbal hints. In the mouth, this Syrah-Merlot-Cabernet blend is pulling and tannic. Toasty oak, blackberry and barrel-based spice flavors finish dry as a bone, with roughness. Drink through 2020.

title: Carramimbre 2013 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Gamy berry aromas are earthy and smell like black olives in brine. A firm palate becomes drier and more raw with airing, making for spicy plum and rubbery flavors. Fruit is hard to find on a tough finish where the coolness of 2013 shows through.

title: Bodegas Lozano 2014 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Wood spice and earthy aromas of forest floor and mint outweigh popping fruit on the nose of this fleshy, filled-out crianza. Spiced raspberry and dried plum aromas lead to a steady finish with crisp latent acidity that fosters length.

title: Alta Alella 2017 GX Organic Garnatxa (Catalunya)
description: Foxy berry aromas are jammy and fleshy, while this Grenache shows rubbing tannins and bold acidity. Tomato, plum and oaky flavors have an herbal element, while this deals an additional hit of oak on a finish with scratchy residual tannins.

title: Sierra Cantabria 2013 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: This wine's earthy berry aromas include notes of cheese and compost. It's plump and awkward on the palate, with oxidized plum and berry flavors and a finish marked by rubbery tannins.

title: Senda Verde 2016 Mencía (Bierzo)
description: Punchy berry and black-currant aromas are lively but wiry. This wine is flush on the palate, with pulling tannins. Medicinal black-plum and berry flavors finish with even harder, more abrasive and scratchy tannins than what came before.

title: Arínzano 2010 La Casona Tempranillo (Pago de Arínzano)
description: Gamy, roasted aromas of berry fruits and black olive are less than stellar for a great year like 2010. A stewed, tomatoey palate is drawing in feel, while this Tempranillo from a single estate in Navarra tastes of olive and herbal black fruits. A severely tannic finish is rough and drying.

title: Vall Llach 2015 Embruix Red (Priorat)
description: Ripe blackberry, raisin and cassis aromas border on syrupy. This extracted wine is soupy in feel, with hard tannins. Toasty black-fruit flavors end with burnt oak notes on a saturated finish.

title: Vinos de Arganza 2017 Legado de Farro Finca de Andrade Godello (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
designation: Legado de Farro Finca de Andrade
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León
description: This Godello is fresh and a bit fleshy, with lime, stone fruit and mineral aromas and mild citrus and honeydew melon flavors. The finish is steady but simple.

title: Viña Otano 2012 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: This wine's earthy berry aromas include a touch of mint and chocolate. It has a crisp mouthfeel, with plum and citrus fruit. It's potently woody on the finish.

title: Carlos Moro 2016 Finca las Marcas Fermentado en Barrica Verdejo (Rueda)
designation: Finca las Marcas Fermentado en Barrica
description: Oily apple and lanolin aromas are subdued and reflect this Verdejo's time in barrel. A chunky but solid palate is braced by malic acidity, while short, dry white fruit flavors taste woody and then slightly bitter like a peach pit on the finish.

title: Camino de Cabras 2015 Mencía (Valdeorras)
description: Plum, currant, wood grain, vanilla and baking spice aromas are fitting for a medium-bodied Mencía like this. On the palate, things run lean and pulling, with tight rubbery tannins. Minerally red fruit flavors are juicy, while this is firm and drawing on the finish.

title: Bodegas Corellanas 2013 Viña Rubican Crianza Red (Navarra)
description: Earthy plum and prune aromas straddle the line between ripe and baked. This wine is tight and firm on the palate, with good flow. Dark, toasty oak is matched to berry and black-plum flavors. It's long on the finish due to ripping acidity.

title: Viña Somoza 2015 Sobre Lias Godello (Valdeorras)
description: Slightly briny and pickled on the nose, this Godello could benefit from being more fruity up front. Lemony acidity and a stony sensation define the mouthfeel, while this tastes lemony, briny and a touch bready from lees stirring.

title: Viña Bujanda 2011 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Slightly herbal aromas veer off in the direction of grassy and rooty. This feels jagged and a bit choppy, with gritty roasted berry flavors. On the finish, that same gritty character persists and is joined by a tarry note.

title: Portal del Priorat 2013 Gotes del Montsant Carignan-Grenache (Montsant)
description: Aromas of wet cement, plum, blueberry and cherry come with moderate oak. This feels wide and grabby, with no definitive focal point. Spicy earthy slightly exotic berry and plum flavors finish with grabby tannins and juicy acidity.

title: Fillaboa 2015 Estate Grown/Viñedo Propio Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Fleshy oily aromas of orange peel and white flowers lead to a chunky, citric palate that's more full and blocky than elegant. Briny orange and tart nectarine flavors finish plump.

title: Vicente Gandia 2016 BO Único Bobal (Utiel-Requena)
description: Earthy plum and berry aromas rise up amid notes of gaseous reduction. In the mouth, this Bobal is jammy, plump and pulpy, but short on core acidity. Baked berry flavors are friendly but flat, while this remains thick and mild on the finish.

title: Viñas del Vero 2016 La Miranda Secastilla Garnacha (Somontano)
description: Ripe berry and plum aromas are forward and earthy. A full, fleshy palate is fairly tannic and rugged, while plum and berry flavors are bright and intense. A tight finish with rubbery tannins concludes this strong-boned Garnacha from a high plateau in Somontano.

title: Damalisco 2014 Roble  (Toro)
description: Spicy oak aromas accent foxy red berry scents in this pinchy, wayward wine. Its chocolatey black fruit and peppery spice flavors finish jammy, with a lot of unresolved oak.

title: Bodegas Verum 2012 Red (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Mild cherry and plum aromas lead to a tight palate with moderate depth and good overall texture. Black plum flavors are spicy and show some dry oak, while this blend of Merlot, Tempranillo and Cabernet Sauvignon holds on to an oaky, spicy profile on the finish.

title: Izadi 2014 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: A ripe, fully oaked nose includes charred aromas along with herbal plum and currant scents. This wine has so much pep on the palate that it feels a touch raw, with a resiny oak offset. Woody plum and raspberry flavors finish with a final blast of oak.

title: Finca La Estacada 2012 Reserva Varietales Red (Uclés)
description: Aromas of ripe black fruits, graphite, dry herbs and licorice root are solid and encouraging. This Tempranillo blend from La Mancha feels choppy and tight, while screechy red-plum and cherry flavors finish a bit raw and hollow.

title: Finca La Emperatriz 2010 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Spicy generic berry aromas come with an herbal component and a note of licorice root. This feels tight and compact, but not overly ripe. Berry fruit flavors are herbal and the slightest bit green, with a black-pepper note in front of a rubbery finish with clamping tannins.

title: Pazo de Barrantes 2013 La Comtesse Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Aromas of green melon and pear are calm like a lake with no breeze. This feels mildly creamy, while leesy briny melon and peach flavors turn somewhat bitter prior to a soft easy finish that doesn't sing but doesn't fall off.

title: Nubori 2014 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Aromas of spice and cinnamon accent gummy berry and plum scents. On the palate, this Reserva is smacking at first, then more pulpy. Grapy berry flavors show some oak, while this hollows out on a racy, snappy finish.

title: Cellers Unió 2015 Roureda Llicorella Gran Selecció Vitis 60 Red (Priorat)
description: Ripe, soupy berry aromas are earthy and heavy, with a preponderance of clove. In the mouth, this is full and oaky, with chunky weight cut by spiky acidity. Toasty, creamy flavors of clove, burnt wood and black pepper dominate in front of a barrel-driven finish that plays up clove and chocolate.

title: Bodegas Tobía 2016 Viña Tobía Viura (Rioja)
description: Floral and tropical aromas include a note of lemon blossom. This wine feels friendly, with enough acidity to create raciness. Slightly oily tropical fruit flavors hold steady on the finish. Drink now.

title: Vallobera 2015 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Savory oak aromas and related spice notes blend with earthy berry scents. This wine has a racy mouthfeel tempered by creamy oak. Woody, spicy, earthy flavors of berry fruits and tomato conclude with a note of vanilla on a traditional Rioja-style finish.

title: Pagos de Araiz 2014 Crianza Red (Navarra)
description: Black cherry and black currant aromas are dense but not blatantly overripe. A flush palate is a bit nebulous in structure, while this four-grape blend tastes of baked berry fruit and chocolate in front of a soft, slightly cooked finish. This is Merlot, Syrah, Tempranillo and Cabernet Sauvignon.

title: Vins El Cep 2015 Gelida Pinot Noir Rosé Brut Reserva Sparkling (Cava)
designation: Gelida Pinot Noir Rosé Brut Reserva
description: A tan color and aromas of peach and crushed vitamin tablets lead to a dry but foamy palate with bold acidity. Orange and cantaloupe flavors are lean and dry, while this is clean but short on the finish.

title: As Laxas 2017 Vieira de Plata Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: With a tan color and apple juice aromas, this is not pinpoint sharp up front. A palate with adequate acidity and weight holds chunky flavors of nectarine and orange. Mild bitterness and briny notes rise up on the finish.

title: Viña Ludy 2017 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: A jumpy, high-toned nose deals a mix of fresh white fruit scents, floral notes and a whiff of citrus oil. The palate is popping with acidity but holds on to some roundness. Dry, peachy flavors are a bit salty, while this tastes melony on a short finish.

title: Protos 2016 Verdejo (Rueda)
description: This wine's citrus, cactus and dusty yeast aromas make for a solid entry. Its light, slightly dilute palate delivers lime, orange peel and green herb flavors into a steady, lasting finish.

title: Casa Primicia 2015 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Meaty black fruit aromas are endearing but simple. In the mouth, this plays up the fresher, crisper side of Rioja. Plum and spice notes make for a snappy flavor profile, while this retains its crispness on a fresh finish.

title: Bodegas Olarra 2014 Añares Crianza  (Rioja)
description: The baked berry, raisin and vanilla aromas in this Tempranillo and Garnacha blend are a touch soupy. It's tannic and firm on the palate, with tomato, berry and mildly oxidized flavors.

title: Aljibes 2014 Selectus Red (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Ripe aromas of blackberry, prune, vanilla and cola are a high point on this muscular blend from Albacete in warm central Spain. A soupy palate could be dismissed as too heavy and woody. Flavors of clove, chocolate and thick berries are minty, chocolaty and a bit hot on the finish. Lovers of massive reds will be happier than fans of leaner, more traditional Old World wines.

title: Condes de Albarei 2017 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: This wine's ripe aromas suggest mango and stone fruit. It's full and plump on the palate, with standard Albariño acidity providing energy. Nectarine and melon flavors linger on the finish.

title: Alta Alella 2017 Capsigrany Organic Natural Brut Nature Sparkling (Cava)
description: A tan “skin contact” color is fitting because this smells of grape skins and mild oxidation. A dry palate is a bit foamy, so this isn't exactly smooth. Flavors of underripe peach and nectarine remain dry and reticent on the finish.

title: Lelia 2016 Garnacha-Syrah (Cariñena)
description: Cherry, plum and pencil shavings are the prime aromas on this juicy, fast-pumping blend of Garnacha and Syrah. Plum, spicy berry and freshness are on full display through a dry finish with residual tannic rawness.

title: Bodegas Olarra 2014 Cerro Añon Crianza  (Rioja)
description: This wine's ripe, raisiny aromas include vanilla and a hint of animal hide. Its dense, oaky palate is generally in balance, with plum, tomato, spice and vanilla flavors typical of Rioja. It flattens out on the finish, tasting slightly baked.

title: Naia 2018 S-Naia Sauvignon Blanc (Rueda)
description: Spicy green-fruit aromas are followed by a slightly oily-feeling palate braced by green-apple acidity. Stone fruit and passion fruit flavors are true to Sauvignon Blanc, while this is quick and spicy on the finish.

title: Viña Eguía 2014  Rioja
description: Plum, raspberry and floral aromas create an appealing nose. This everyday Rioja feels tight and pulling, with scratchy tannins. A flavor profile dominated by red berries feels tannic and rubbery on the finish.

title: Terras Gauda 2014 La Mar White (Rías Baixas)
description: This chunky, funky blend is led by the local Caiño Blanco grape, with Loureiro and Albariño in the mix. Lanolin is a more prominent aroma than any particular fruit, and this wine feels round but mature. Peach and dried melon flavors finish with little drive. Drink immediately.

title: Terras Gauda 2015 O Rosal Black Label White (Rías Baixas)
description: Mature, oily aromas of melon and sweet potato lack vivacity. This blend of Albariño, Caiño Blanco and Loureiro feels mature, with lightly oxidized stone-fruit flavors. A plump, dry-tasting finish indicates that it should be drunk right away.

title: Sierra Cantabria 2014 Reserva Unica  (Rioja)
description: There's a chemical note to the nose of this oaky-smelling Rioja. A thick palate is chewy and tannic, while this tastes of clove, licorice gumdrop and baked berry fruit. Oaky clove is the dominant flavor on a dense but standard finish.

title: Marqués de Toro 2015 Marqués de Toro Finca la Moura Mencía (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
designation: Marqués de Toro Finca la Moura
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León
description: There seems to be some volatility on the nose of this Mencía, and overall this old vines offering lacks cohesion and purity up front. A crisp, almost citric palate features high acidity and choppy tannins, while short berry flavors evaporate in no time on a finish that leaves mostly ringing acidity.

title: Evolet 2015 Tempranillo (Vino de Calidad de Valtiendas)
description: Briny, leathery berry and black olive aromas require plenty of air to unwind. A wide but unfocused palate deals grating tannins, while this tastes of ripe black fruits. A blocky finish is rocky, as is this entire offering from just outside the Ribera del Duero DO.

title: Altos de Torona 2018 Albanta Sobre Lias Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Citrus and sea-brine aromas are not uncommon for Albariño from Rías Baixax. On the palate, this is less than precise but fruity. Pineapple and other tropical-fruit flavors turn to white grapefruit and citrus pith on the finish.

title: Guerra 2016 Roble Mencía (Bierzo)
description: Raw red fruit aromas of currant and cranberry include a hint of damp earth. On the palate, this Mencía is smacking and tight, with cutting acidity and firm tannins. Cherry, plum and chocolate flavors remain bright and energetic on a fresh, fruity finish.

title: Naveran 2015 Brut Sparkling (Cava)
description: Solid apple cider and lime aromas are slightly briny on the nose. This brut shows freshness and tension on the palate, while citrusy flavors include green-herb notes. A slight bitterness rises up on a firm finish.

title: Naveran 2014 Dama Brut Sparkling (Cava)
description: A gold luster and a constant flow of beaded bubbles are encouraging signs. This Chardonnay-heavy brut shows apple and light brioche aromas, followed by a round palate. Salty melon and papaya flavors end with little fruit and a note of sourdough bread.

title: Morgadío 2016 Legado del Conde Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Stone fruit and floral aromas are friendly on the nose but not complex. This second-label bottling from Morgadío is round and nicely textured, while nectarine flavors lead to a healthy finish that stays the course.

title: Avancia 2016 Cuveé de O Godello (Valdeorras)
description: Mild but focused aromas of apple and lime are fresh and slightly minerally. This is round and easy on the palate, with controlled citric acidity. A simple flavor of orange finishes favorably but without complexity.

title: Nessa 2017 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Prickly citrus aromas show a softer yeasty edge. On the palate, this is round and balanced, with good body and fresh acidity. Pithy orange and sea-salt flavors finish briny in flavor but correct and not edgy or acidic in feel.

title: Hiruzta 2017 Rosé (Getariako Txakolina)
description: A shiny pink color and citric aromas open this tangy, crisp and spritzy Basque Country rosé. Grapefruit and orange flavors are zesty, and overall this is a live wire to drink now.

title: Hermanos Hernáiz 2016 El Pedal Tempranillo  (Rioja)
description: Plump berry aromas are solid and sound, but not elevated or special. A tight palate is firm and offers just enough body and richness. Lightly baked berry flavors finish steady, with a touch of licorice.

title: Casa Primicia 2016 Viña Diezmo CR Crianza  (Rioja)
description: A slightly murky and earthy nose requires airing to show its best. In the mouth, this crianza is full, chunky and obtuse, with raw tannins. Herbal berry flavors are slightly minty, while this is short and tastes of plum and berry fruit on the finish.

title: Marqués de la Concordia 2011 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: This wine's dried cherry and plum aromas are dusty and earthy, with hints of latex and rubber. Its grippy, tough palate offers briny, savory flavors of earthy berry fruits and oak. Salty and drying on the finish, those fruit notes taste roasted, with little to no brightness.

title: Finca Allende 2011  Rioja
description: This wine's rooty berry, spice and herb aromas are intriguing and particular. The palate is rough, with pulpy plum and spicy currant flavors and a briary herbal undercurrent.

title: Nora 2018 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Punchy tropical fruit aromas are slightly briny and backed by a tangy, fresh palate. Standard Albariño flavors of apple, honeydew and citrus are nice in a normal way, while this finishes steady and clean. Drink right away.

title: Bodegas Eidosela 2017 Ethereo Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Oily aromas of citrus peel and vanilla cookie are a touch green and herbal. This Albariño feels chunky and round, with flavors of lemon and green herb. On the finish, green notes of oregano and thyme are as prominent if not more so than fruit.

title: Mar de Viñas 2016 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Tropical fruit and apple aromas are ripe and nice. This wine is fruity but imprecise on the tongue, with bold orange and apple flavors that are juicy, bright and fairly potent. Drink now.

title: Marqués de la Concordia 2016 HZ Abascal Vineyard Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Spicy berry and plum aromas come with some oak, and overall the nose on this crianza is in order. A crisp, wiry palate is braced by popping acidity, while this tastes of currant, plum and cherry. As the fruit fades on the finish, what remains are hard tannins and the residue of citric acid.

title: Torres 2013 Celeste Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Gritty herbal aromas of olive, asphalt and compost announce a cool-vintage wine. This feels raw and massively tannic. Roasted barely ripe plum and berry flavors finish bone dry and pulling.

title: Cellers Unió 2016 Clos Dalian Crianza Garnacha (Terra Alta)
description: Aromas of leather, cherry and berry aromas come with additional notes of dried herbs, grainy oak and animal hide. The medium-bodied palate is straightforward and lifted by bright acidity. Flavors of cherry tomato, red plum, raspberry and vanilla finish with springiness and punch. Drink now.

title: Victoria Ordóñez 2018 La Pasajera Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Passion fruit and citrus aromas are clean and typical of Verdejo, while this feels crisp and racy, with citric acidity. Lime and orange-peel flavors lead the way, backed by a stony finish.

title: Ochoa 2014 Crianza Tempranillo (Navarra)
description: Rubbery dark-fruit aromas are sound but limited, while this Tempranillo feels rugged, tough and tannic. Spicy berry flavors come with savory undertones of salt and dried fruits, while the finish reverts to tannic and edgy.

title: Pagos del Galir 2018 Godello (Valdeorras)
description: Simple melon aromas lead to a round palate with medium intensity and mild acidity. Pear and other white fruit flavors rate as standard but good, while this is solid on a short finish that loses steam fairly quickly.

title: Real De Aragón 2016 Garnacha (Calatayud)
description: Citrus peel and briary berry aromas are proprietary rather than common to most Garnacha wines from Calatayud. A flush palate offers both vibrant acidity and hard tannins. Plum, raspberry and exotic spice flavors wind down on a racy, aggressive finish.

title: Cuatro Rayas 2018 Nave Sur Verdejo (Rueda)
description: As spring and summer take form, this deserves a spot in the patio lineup. The nose of this Verdejo is citrusy and round, but with snap. A fresh palate with firm acidity delivers a mix of melon and nectarine flavors. Finally, a tangy finish keeps this going in the right direction.

title: Portia 2016 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: On the nose, this crianza is full and dense, although airing helps it along. A bright, juicy palate is emboldened by acidity and grating tannins, while this tastes of cassis, black plum, berry fruits and vanilla. A steady finish continues with that theme.

title: Bodegas Alejandro Fernandez 2015 Alejairén Airen (La Mancha)
description: The color, the nose, and finally the mouthfeel and flavors set this artisan Airén on its own course. Sherry influences are noted on the oxidized nutty nose. In the mouth, this amber-colored wine is unctuous and fat, with dry tannins. Flavors of dried apricot and aged fino Sherry are rather aimless on a short finish.

title: Monterebro 2014 Barrica Monastrell-Syrah (Jumilla)
description: Slightly rustic earthy aromas of animal, blackberry, plum and cola feed into a jammy palate with just enough acidic pop. Chocolaty blackberry flavors are touched up by resiny oak, while this blend of 85% Monastrell and 15% Syrah tastes similar on a persistent finish.

title: Bodegas Campante 2016 Viña Reboreda Godello (Ribeiro)
description: Fresh mineral and white-fruit aromas are clean as a whistle. This Godello from Galicia is crisp in feel, with dry, melony flavors and a hint of green.

title: Blanco Nieva 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Rueda)
description: Lime and lemon aromas are clean and direct on the nose. This well-cut Sauvignon Blanc is crisp and light weight, with salty green-apple and citrus flavors that linger on the finish.

title: Bodegas Aquitania 2016 Bernon Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Flowery white-fruit aromas are mellow. A round melony palate is a touch soft but holding on. Melon and peach flavors are basic but perfectly good, while this is just vital enough on the finish. Drink up!

title: Viña Mayor 2012 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Full, round aromas of berry fruits are oaky and appealing. In the mouth, this wine is ultradry, tannic and raw. Flavors of blackberry, plum and coffee finish hard and abrasive due to scraping tannins.

title: Marqués de Riscal 2015 Finca Torrea  (Rioja)
description: Ripe berry and raisin aromas are desiccated and jammy. An edgy tannic palate deals flavors of raisin, prune, toast and black pepper, while a short but dense finish confirms that this is a ripe modern-style Tempranillo.

title: Castroviejo 2008 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Raisiny aromas of prune juice and vanilla lead to a chunky, weighty palate that's almost syrupy. Blackberry, prune and raisin flavors are a touch soupy on a finish with low acidity. Drink now.

title: Ardales 2011 Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Ripe raisiny aromas are soft, maybe to a fault. This feels wide, grabby and modest in structure. Jammy raspberry and raisin flavors finish plump and easy, with low acidity. Drink now.

title: Viña Mayor 2015 Tinto Roble  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Ripe aromas of baked berry and plum offer a window into this slightly jumpy, acidic Tempranillo. Roasted, blackened berry flavors show the “roble,” meaning this is a bit oaky. On the finish, this is short but solid and fruity.

title: La Caña 2016 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Light apple and pear aromas are clean and basic. This wine feels refined and elegant, with apple, peach and leesy flavors suggestive of mild oak. A friendly but standard finish concludes this easy-drinking Albariño.

title: Burgo Viejo 2011 Licenciado Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Soupy heavy aromas suggest that the sun-baked conditions of 2011 got the better of this wine. In the mouth, this feels jammy and thick, with a shortage of balance and elegance. This tastes stewy, with meaty berry flavors and licorice notes. A heavy finish confirms a sense of overripeness.

title: Cellers Baronia del Montsant 2012 Flor d'Englora Roure Red (Montsant)
description: The nose is carried by black fruit, iodine, and iron. On the palate, this Garnacha and Carignan blend is sinewy and tough, with tomato-like acidity. Warm flavors of baked earth, tobacco and roasted berry fruits finish meaty, savory and with notes of chocolate and prune.

title: Cuna de Reyes 2014 Crianza Vendimia Seleccionada  (Rioja)
description: A lightly maderized color and aromas of earthy berry, raisin and prune indicate moderate overripeness. That assumption is confirmed on a plump, chunky palate with rubbery tannins. Ripe berry and raisin flavors finish with the slightest hint of early onset oxidation; drink now.

title: Marqués de la Concordia 2017 Lagunilla Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Baked berry, raisin and tobacco aromas set up a palate, with ripping acidity and bright flavors of plum, cassis and vanilla from modest oak. This tastes authentic for Rioja, meaning it's lightly fruity and lightly woody.

title: Montserrat Canals Torres 2014 Brut Sparkling (Cava)
description: A fresh nose with a whiff of briny apple sets up a palate of green pear and crushed stone. Lime and apple flavors are lasting and pure across the crisp finish.

title: Marqués de Valparaíso 2014 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Aromas of rose petals and raisins carry to a compact palate that is chewy and tannic. Blocky plum and berry flavors are slightly flat on a finish with scraping tannins. Drink through 2021.

title: Heras Cordon 2015 Hacienda José Luis  (Rioja)
description: Berry, tomato and herbal aromas are spicy and earthy more than bold and fruity. This Rioja from a touted but warm year feels tight, with good body and balance. Spicy leafy flavors of lightly stewed berry fruits and chocolate finish short in length and complexity.

title: Pago de Tharsys 2016 Tharsys City Tinto Bobal (Utiel-Requena)
description: Tire-rubber, blackberry and black-cherry aromas lead to a medium-to-full palate with rubbery tannins that are common to Bobal. Blackberry and plum flavors are authentic but lack complexity, while this flattens out on the finish.

title: Bosque De Matasnos 2016  Ribera del Duero
description: Woody black-fruit aromas are loud but not elegant. Following that opening, this feels saturated and sappy, with a sense of thickness. Charred, chocolaty flavors sit atop black fruit, while this tastes of campfire and chocolate on a blackened finish.

title: Bodegas Tobía 2016 Selección de Autor  (Rioja)
description: Off the bat, this smells like milk chocolate, clove and forced oak as opposed to natural fruit with integrated spice and wood notes. A grabby palate ranks as tough and drying, while this fully oaked Rioja tastes of resin, dry spices and modest plum.

title: Bodegas Aragonesas 2016 Don Ramón Red (Campo de Borja)
description: A pinched nose holds rubbery berry aromas, while this Garnacha (with 25% Temprnillo) feels round and meaty but a touch flat on the palate. Black-plum, cassis and raisin flavors see ripeness confirmed on a finish with a note of prune.

title: Feixa Negra 2016 Red (Priorat)
description: Red fruit aromas are topped with oaky, spicy scents of vanilla and clove. A fresh, high-tension palate features dry tannins and roughness, while plum, wild berry and oak flavors conclude on a smacking, zesty finish.

title: Ramon Roqueta 2017 Tina 21 Garnacha Blanca (Catalunya)
description: Mild but clean and correct citrus aromas lead to a crisp, lip-smacking palate with decent body. Quick-hitting flavors of green fruit and white peach finish with zesty acidity and hints of orange peel and green herb. This is a white Grenache for simple sipping.

title: Torres 2016 Milmanda Chardonnay (Conca de Barberà)
description: Baked apple, wood spice and oak-related butter aromas are integrated, while this Chardonnay from the Penedès feels full and chunky but cut by healthy acidity. Melon, peach and apple flavors are oily and mildly oaky, while this abruptly quits on an otherwise clean finish.

title: Sara Rivera 2018 Verdejo (Rueda)
description: A round nose smells a touch cheesy and full, not lean and direct. In the mouth, this is tangy and citric as Verdejo should be. Orange and citrus flavors are full and tangy, then lightly oxidized as this fades away.

title: Viña Herminia 2014 Herminia  (Rioja)
description: Aromas of raw oak, vanilla and cherry settle with airing, but this Rioja feels a bit wiry and choppy. Plum, berry and oak flavors finish well, with bright acidity paving the way.

title: Naveran 2015 Brut Nature Sparkling (Cava)
description: Briny, bready aromas suggest sourdough on the nose. In the mouth, this is solid but shows mild complexity. Orange and nectarine flavors include a spot of yeast, leading to a clean, dry finish.

title: Quintana de Cue 2015 Roble  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Ripe aromas of prune and blackberry come with a hint of green. A dense, tannic palate holds rich flavors of prune and plum. A toasty, oaky finish is spicy but short.

title: Marqués de la Concordia 2015 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Earthy berry aromas are matched by spicy oak and vanilla notes. In the mouth, this warm-vintage crianza feels snappy, sappy and sinewy. Oaky red plum and currant flavors finish spicy but basic. Overall, this is a good but standard Rioja, nothing more.

title: Marqués de la Concordia 2014  Rioja
description: Plum and berry aromas are made more savory and spicy by overt wood notes. This wine feels fresh, crisp and edgy, with acidic snap. Raspberry, plum, currant and oak flavors finish dry and slightly abrasive.

title: Larchago 2016 Rosé (Rioja)
description: Aromas of grapefruit, orange peel and chewing gum feed into a wide palate with slightly flat acidity. Melon and papaya flavors finish a bit soft, with a note of stone-fruit pit.

title: Josep Grau Viticultor 2014 Vespres Red (Montsant)
description: Cherry cough drop and cassis aromas are red in nature. Dense and compact on the palate, with plum and currant flavors, this finishes with residual tannic rub and increasingly intense berry fruit. Elegance and charm are fleeting.

title: Pazo San Mauro 2017 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: This offers basic stone fruit aromas and a shrill, linear palate. It tastes of barely ripe apricot and nectarine, with sharp, tangy acidity and a lightly salty finish.

title: Guerra 2017 Mencía (Bierzo)
description: Raspberry, plum and black currant aromas are bright and fruity. This everyday Bierzo feels fresh and lively, with flavors of cassis and raspberry buoyed by rubbery tannins.

title: Cueto 2013 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Oak is at full voice on this crianza, with aromas of vanilla and baking spices out front and loud. Rubbery tannins create a clamping mouthfeel and bring a sense of dryness to plum and peppery flavors.

title: Dominio de Punctum 2016 Rosado (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Aromas of nectarine and plum skins are clean and easy to like. This has intensity and grip on the palate, with pithy orange-based flavors. A salty element adds complexity to the finish on this nice rosé.

title: Matarromera 2013 Granza Made From Organic Grapes  (Toro)
description: Prune and raisin aromas suggest overripeness in this wine. In the mouth, it's extracted and harsh, with raisin, baked plum and blackberry flavors and heavy tannins.

title: Bodegas Aquitania 2015 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Aromas of lanolin, wet wool and squash indicate that this wine has lost much of its fruit. That's confirmed on the palate, which feels tired and thin, with fading stone-fruit flavors. The wine is nearing the end of its drinking enjoyment.

title: Bodegas Aragonesas 2016 Aragus Made with Organic Grapes Red (Campo de Borja)
description: This chewy Garnacha has grapy berry and cherry aromas that seem the slightest bit chemical. It's medium in body, with blackberry and cassis flavors and a prune-like, rubbery finish.

title: Cellers Unió 2015 Perlat Garnacha (Montsant)
description: Berry and spice aromas that suggest clove open this medium-bodied Garnacha. Spiced berry flavors hint at cinnamon, while chocolate notes are welcome on a plump finish.

title: Raventós I Blanc 2016 Conca del Riu Anonia Blanc de Blanc Sparkling (Penedès)
designation: Conca del Riu Anonia Blanc de Blanc
description: Some funk on the nose blends with aromas of scrambled eggs and arugula. A tangy palate is in accordance with blanc de blancs norms, while this tastes grassy and like lime in front of a finish that tastes like fresh lettuce.

title: Perelada 2015 Stars Reserva Brut Nature Sparkling (Cava)
description: A pale color and clean but mellow lemon-lime aromas feed into a palate that's foamy. Slightly bitter and raw lime flavors finish coarse and with distant charm. Even for brut nature, this is less than generous.

title: Fillaboa 2016 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Aromas of white flowers and oily melon set up an agile palate with racy citric acidity. Pithy citrus and green-herb flavors are a touch salty. The wine is fresh with an herbal flavor on the finish.

title: Bodegas Faustino 2016 VII Tempranillo Rosé (Rioja)
description: Fresh, fruity aromas center around red apple and cherry. This pink-colored rosé is fairly full in body, with ample acidity. Slightly salty but fruity plum flavors end steady and level.

title: Ego Bodegas 2014 Infinitio Red (Jumilla)
description: This combination of Monastrell and Cabernet Sauvignon is so heavily oaked that it smells almost entirely of clove. A grabby palate delivers flavors of blueberry, blackberry and clove in front of a finish that's woody and tannic. Time will tell if the oak will subside; at this moment it's dominant.

title: Alta Alella 2016 Merla Organic Mataro (Alella)
description: Alta Alella's entry into the natural wine world comes via this Mataro (Mourvèdre) from Catalonia. Reduced, raisiny aromas push the nose to the outer limits of acceptable ripeness, while this feels saturated. Prune and grapy fruit flavors simmer on the finish.

title: Altos de Cristimil 2016 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: A peach aroma mixes with notes of lees and crushed stone on the nose. The palate is citric and streamlined, with lean tangerine flavors that turn a touch oily and fleshy on the midpalate, but ultimately racy on the finish.

title: Edetària 2015 Selecció Old Vines Garnacha Blanca (Terra Alta)
description: A heavy coating of oak dominates over mild fruit tones on the nose. This old-vine Garnacha Blanca is textured, with briny white-fruit and resiny oak flavors.

title: Bodegas Bilbainas 2015 Viña Zaco Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Apple and citrus aromas are starting to show some age-based corn and wheat notes on the nose. A solid palate is compact and narrow, while apple and stone-fruit flavors exhibit mild bitterness. The finish is tangy, with a modest burn. Drink now.

title: Bodegas Fos 2016 Maceración Carbonica  (Rioja)
description: This wine's light, herbal berry aromas include a touch of olive. A solid though basic Tempranillo, it offers fresh black plum flavors and feels unrefined and a touch aggressive on the finish.

title: Baron De Ley 2017 Varietales  (Rioja)
description: Damp earth, leather and dark-plum aromas feed into a flush palate. Red-berry, plum and tobacco flavors are standard and pretty much as expected, while this finishes well but without much fanfare.

title: Avancia 2018 Cuvée de O Rosé (Spain)
description: Common rosé aromas of orange, nectarine and wet stones announce a plump but shallow palate. Based on the Mencía grape, this tastes of melon and apple juice in front of a medium-length finish, with average depth.

title: Nessa 2016 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Pear and melon aromas are good but basic. Citric acidity is grabbing, while citrus and peach flavors show a hint of green pepper on the backside. On the finish, the fruit character doesn't last long. Drink immediately.

title: Nebla 2016 Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Dusty, yeasty, waxy apple aromas open this Verdejo, which feels wet and juicy, with scouring acidity. Lemony flavors include a note of orange peel, and the wine finishes tangy and tart.

title: Portal del Priorat 2015 Negre de Negres Red (Priorat)
description: Medicinal, rubbery aromas suggest earthy berry, compost and latex. This Grenache-Carignan-Syrah blend feels baked and chunky but not fully defined. Roasted dark-berry flavors finish heavy and without finesse.

title: Mont Marçal 2016 Brut Rosado Sparkling (Cava)
description: Cantaloupe and stone-fruit aromas of this Trepat-based Cava are clean but basic. That also describes the palate, which is good but a bit soft and low on acidity, with some dry orange flavors.

title: Carlos Serres 2014 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: On first take, this smells oaky, with notes of animal fur and earthy berry fruits. A tight palate shows tomatoey acidity, while a narrow field of flavors includes plum and herbs. Drawing tannins and a minty flavor drive the finish on this basic but positive Rioja.

title: Volver 2016 Tarima Rosado (Alicante)
description: This light-colored, alert wine with melon and nectarine aromas is confident up front. Cleansing acidity is the driver of a juicy, tangy and lean palate. Crisp flavors of pie cherry, currant and rose water finish fresh.

title: Castillo Clavijo 2013 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Familiar Rioja aromas of cigar box, baking spices and dried cherry introduce a dense, sinewy palate. Flavors of cherry, plum and chocolate include peppery spice notes, which are balanced on the way out.

title: Bodegas Aragonesas 2015 Viña Temprana Old Vines Garnacha (Campo de Borja)
description: Earthy black cherry and plum flavors are solid and steady, as is the palate on this honest yet basic Garnacha. Flavors of black plum, blackberry and dry spices finish well. Overall, this value wine gets it right without forcing anything.

title: Cyan 2014 Valdefinjas Crianza  (Toro)
description: Murky, gamy aromas indicate that 2014's wet, humid conditions affected this wine. In the mouth, this is heavy and tough, with grating tannins. Black-fruit flavors combined with lemony oak are chunky, massive and acidic on the finish. This wine is good but has balance issues.

title: Palacio del Burgo 2017 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Cool blueberry aromas are touched up by exotic notes of cardamom and lavender. On the palate, this is fully extracted and tannic. Spicy berry and plum flavors are dry, with sappy weight playing out on a heavy finish.

title: Gramona 2013 La Cuvée Gran Reserva Brut Sparkling (Cava)
description: Briny apple aromas are a touch skunky before transitioning to scrambled eggs. A sodalike palate is slightly coarse, with highly active bubbles, while briny stone fruit flavors fade out on a somewhat hollow finish. This is one of Gramona's most basic Cavas, and basic is how it smells and tastes.

title: Juvé & Camps 2015 Gran Reserva Reserva de la Familia Brut Nature Sparkling (Cava)
designation: Gran Reserva Reserva de la Familia Brut Nature
description: Wayward aromas of white fruits and wildflowers are suggestive of apple juice. A foamy but thin palate deals lean flavors of celery, lettuce and green apple. On the finish, this is light and mild, nothing more.

title: Guerra 2016 Tradición Mencía (Bierzo)
description: Earthy red fruit aromas lead to a modest palate with an apple-skins texture and not a lot of stuffing or structure. Berry flavors are backed by mild chocolaty notes, while on the finish this Mencía stays in the steady middle lane.

title: Rioja Vega 2014 Crianza Estate Bottled  (Rioja)
description: Floral aromas of violet grapy blueberry and minimal oak amount to a nose without much tension or intensity. A pulpy fruity palate avoids hard tannins, while this tastes of herbal raspberry and plum with some spice. Scratchiness comes up on a full finish.

title: Ànima Negra 2017 Quíbia Falanis White (Vi de la Terra Mallorca)
description: Citrus peel and saline-driven aromas of sea water and seashells lead to a plump but basic palate that weighs in on the soft side. Papaya and dull melon flavors turn slightly bitter on the finish. This is made from Callet (a red variety), Premsal and 10% other Mallorcan grapes.

title: Sierra Norte 2016 Porta Regia Colección Privada 5 Meses Monastrell (Jumilla)
description: Solid plum and berry aromas lead to a fruity palate that's bouncy but not deep or layered. Candied berry flavors are satisfactory, but kind of basic. A flush finish closes out this varietal Monastrell.

title: Vega Sauco 2016 La Sonrisa del Nómada  (Toro)
description: Woody berry aromas are hot but also creamy and show vanilla notes. A bold, grabby palate delivers oaky flavors of prune, spice and chocolate. Some heat and aggressiveness must be dealt with on a firm finish.

title: Enate 2012 Crianza Tempranillo-Cabernet Sauvignon (Somontano)
description: Earthy red-berry aromas include a note of forest floor. A medium-bodied palate is centered on tight racy acidity, while this blend of Tempranillo and Cabernet Sauvignon tastes of red plum, mixed spices and cocoa powder. An edgy finish with spiced cherry and plum flavors is juicy and primed by raw acidity.

title: Castro Martin 2015 A2O Sobre Lias Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Melon and a green note of pole beans and lettuce set up a high-acid citric palate. Grassy notes of clover and lettuce infiltrate core citrus flavors, while this shows lemony punch and an herbal note on a juicy tangy finish.

title: Ochoa 2009 Reserva Red (Navarra)
description: Reflecting a hot and dry vintage, this blend smells a bit raisiny and overripe. In the mouth, hard tannins make for a rough and rugged palate, while flavors of tomato, green herbs, prune and spice finish similarly baked, herbal and tomatoey. This is a blend of 55% Tempranillo, 30% Cabernet Sauvignon and 15% Merlot.

title: Otazu 2014 Pago de Otazu con Crianza Chardonnay (Pago de Otazu)
description: This barrel-fermented Navarran Chardonnay is gold in color, with a matte finish and a resiny mouthfeel. Woody, spicy flavors gleaned from copious oak dominate a flavor profile of creamy melon notes. Lasting oak carries the finish.

title: Conde de Siruela 2016 Roble  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Charred oak and slightly overripe aromas make for a bullish nose. On the palate, this delivers a jolt of acidity along with oversize tannins, while ripe plum and cassis flavors.

title: Bodegas Luzón 2013 Luzón Roble Monastrell (Jumilla)
description: This Monastrell's cherry and cassis aromas show a rough, oaky burn. It's grippy and a touch raw on the palate, with roasted berry and plum flavors that linger into the finish.

title: Finca Villacreces 2014 Pruno  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Earthy but basic berry and plum flavors introduce this bumpy, rugged Tempranillo. Its tight mouthfeel is governed by rough tannins and tomato-like acidity, its lightly herbal, salty plum and berry flavors finishing choppy, rugged and abrasive.

title: Beronia 2016 Verdejo (Rueda)
description: This standard Verdejo is light on acidity, which is reflective of a hot year. Its citrus and green herb notes are fresh and prickly while its melon and thyme flavors lose intensity on the slightly bitter finish.

title: Dominio de la Abadesa 2011 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)
description: This wine's grapy, jammy raspberry aromas are not the stuff of great Ribera del Duero. It lacks direction on the palate, tasting of herbal, medicinal plums and currants with a scratchy finish.

title: Crápula 2014 Basado En Hechos Reales Monastrell (Jumilla)
description: Ripe, grapy, floral aromas introduce this plump, chunky Monastrell. Soft tannins make the palate amorphous. Its baked plum and berry flavors are a touch raisiny, and the finish is heavy.

title: Viña Otano 2014 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Earthy aromas of wet clay share space on the nose with strawberry and cotton-candy sweetness. A lively palate is high in tartaric acidity, while this tastes of roasted plum, savory red-berry fruits and spice. On the finish, this shows a mild note of prune.

title: Avancia 2017 Cuvée de O Mencía (Valdeorras)
description: Heavy aromas of wood spice, schisty berry and seashell are loud but short on harmony. This Mencía feels plump and round, but low on acidity. Oaky, herbal berry flavors are roasted and minty, while this feels tannic and sticky on the finish.

title: Bodegas Riojanas 2013 Viña Albina Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Gritty earthy aromas of raisiny fruit and asphalt are indicative of a drawing and gritty palate. Leafy notes of tomato vie with baked-fruit flavors, while this is clampy and lacks smoothness on the finish. Seems like 2013's cold conditions affected this wine.
