title: Bodegas Veganzones 2015 912 de Altitud Limestone Soil Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Oak-based spice, chocolate and vanilla aromas fit the bill for Ribera del Duero. In the mouth, this is hard as rocks, with fierce tannins that bump and grind. Jammy berry flavors collapse on a heavy, tannic finish.

title: Ramirez de la Piscina 2014 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Muddled aromas of gritty berry fruits and tomato leaf suggest low ripeness. On the palate, raw acidity is the key player. Fiery red-berry flavors are fairly well oaked, while this simmers but doesn't evolve on the finish.

title: Marqués de Riscal 2007 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: A fresh berry aroma is overpowered by an earthy overtone in this wine. This is holding up on the palate, while flavors of roasted berry fruits are just not that ripe, a lasting reflection of a cold vintage.

title: Protos 2017 Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Snappy aromas of citrus fruits and cactus are racy and crisp. A healthy-feeling palate is smooth but cut by citric acidity. Briny citrus flavors include notes of jalapeño pepper and salt, while this is steady across the finish.

title: Sierra Norte 2015 Temperamento Bobal (Utiel-Requena)
description: Earthy, funky aromas of animal, oak and stewed dark fruits open this Bobal. A plump palate with creamy weight offset by cutting acidity delivers oak-based flavors of slightly overripe plum and blackberry. On the finish, it's mostly oak that sticks out.

title: Pago de la Jaraba 2014 Azagador Crianza Viñedos Propios Red (La Mancha)
description: Choppy berry aromas are earthy and contain notes of olive and dried leaves. This Tempranillo-led blend is free-flowing and solid on the palate. Cherry, plum and dry spice flavors are steady on a finish with some flesh to it.

title: Bodegas Lacort 2008 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: A light red color and earthy aromas of dried cherry and cinnamon oversell a linear palate that's acidic and pushes hard to the middle. Tomato, red-plum and herbal flavors finish long and narrow on a wood spice note.

title: Marqués de Cáceres 2016 Deusa Nai Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Oily citrus aromas are offset by dusty scents and yeasty notes. A citrusy palate has pulpy weight and acidic tang. Briny, slightly pickled flavors of cucumber and citrus fruits finish salty, with a note of lime. Drink now.

title: Heras Cordon 2013 Hacienda José Luis Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Musky earthy berry aromas come with a note of graphite. In the mouth, this is raw and lacks totality. Flavors of plum skins and grape skins are slightly oxidized and finish with herbal raspberry and currant notes.

title: Príncipe de Viana 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon Rosé (Navarra)
description: This orange-red tinted Cabernet opens with spice notes and the scent of apple skins. A wide yet balanced palate is ultimately basic, while this tastes of briny red fruits, earthy spices and tomato sauce. On the finish, this holds onto its saucy character, making it a food-friendly rosé.

title: Marqués de la Concordia 2006 Santiago Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Spicy dry aromas of plum and cherry are classy and traditional. A tight and crisp palate feels lemony due to high acidity, while this tastes of dry salty plum and currant. Oak spice, clove and cocoa flavors settle in on a woody finish.

title: Bocopa 2015 Laudum Barrica Especial Monastrell (Alicante)
description: Herbal aromas of tobacco and grass are light and spicy, reminiscent of Cabernet Sauvignon. A rubbery pinchy palate improves with airing, while this tastes of roasted black fruits and tomato. Herbal peppery chocolaty flavors are nice on the finish.

title: Enate 2013 Crianza Tempranillo-Cabernet Sauvignon (Somontano)
description: Tomato and plum aromas are savory and spicy, with raw oak notes that don't shy away. This blend of Cabernet and Tempranillo feels crisp, dry, exact and tight. Flavors of foresty berry fruits are herbal and spicy, while this feels firm across the finish.

title: Casal Novo 2016 Godello (Valdeorras)
description: Briny apple aromas are standard. This Godello is full in body and a bit flat, with little acidic edge to the palate. Fairly modest melon and green-banana flavors are understated on a simple finish.

title: Castaño 2016 Made With Organic Grapes Monastrell (Yecla)
description: Woody aromas combine with plum and berry scents in this organic Monsatrell. Roasted plum and berry flavors come with an oaky note of clove and sinewy tannins. It's bright, juicy and lively yet hot on the finish.

title: Pata Negra 2017 Verdejo (Rueda)
description: This wine's snappy tangerine and orange peel aromas include a green note of cactus. It's a simple but well-made Verdejo with a tight, peachy palate and a citrusy kick of acidity. It closes with unripe stone fruit flavors.

title: Finca Jakue 2017 Hondarrabi Zuri (Getariako Txakolina)
description: This wine's aroma includes pine cone and rubber glove notes but not much fruit. The palate is tight and pinched, with tart citrus flavors and a lightly spritzy, bitter finish.

title: Marqués de la Concordia 2016 Vega de la Reina Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Light apple and peach aromas are good and solid before turning a bit wooly and oily with airing. The tight, citric palate is typical of Verdejo, with a snappy, cleansing finish.

title: Terroir Al Límit 2015 Terra de Cuques White (Priorat)
description: Dusty, peachy aromas are mellow, while overall not a lot is happening on the nose. A somewhat collapsed, fallen palate is ultimately a bit flat. Mild apple and spice flavors last on a finish that's slightly bitter and tastes of almond.

title: Abad Dom Bueno 2016 Godello (Bierzo)
description: Yeasty white-fruit aromas carry the nose. In the mouth, this basic Godello is fleshy and pulpy. A mix of citrus and nectarine flavors holds steady on a fresh but simple finish.

title: Arínzano 2015 Hacienda de Arínzano Chardonnay (Pago de Arínzano)
description: Aromas of creamy oak and corn stalk are oily, rich on the nose. In the mouth, this Chardonnay from Navarra is broad but with ample acidity. Woody, creamy pineapple and orange flavors finish steady and oaky.

title: Larchago 2014 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Aromas of cinnamon, barrel spice and raisiny fruit are a touch murky. This feels full, wide and tannic. Flavors of plum and raspberry are matched by coconut and oak notes, while woody coconut flavors stand out on the finish.

title: Marqués de la Concordia 2012 Santiago Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Leafy, spicy red fruit aromas lead to lean, tomatoey cranberry and red plum flavors in this wine. It finishes spicy and reedy, with prominent acidity.

title: Ramirez de la Piscina 2013 Selección Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Warm, leathery aromas of baked berries, molasses, animal fur and tobacco announce a heavily oaked style of Rioja. Despite all the oak, it's lean and astringent on the palate, a reflection of 2013's cool, rainy conditions. Its dried berry flavors are overcrowded by toasty, resiny oak straight through the finish.

title: Ovidio García 2014 Esencia Crianza Tempranillo (Cigales)
description: This wine delivers a frontal blast of chocolaty oak and char. Its severely tannic palate overloads its generic black fruit with barrel notes. It finishes hot, with briary touches.

title: Oxer Basteguieta 2014 Suzzane  (Rioja)
description: Raisiny aromas are accompanied by a chocolate note on the nose. This Garnacha is rough and punchy on the palate, with tart currant and plum flavors that run counter to the nose. Prior to an abrasive but energetic finish, this tastes herbal and oaky.

title: Vinessens 2017 Peligrés Garnacha (Alicante)
description: Earthy plum and black-cherry aromas are gritty and a touch soupy, while this Alicante Garnacha is big and hot but short on structure and elegance. Oaky black-fruit flavors are less than nuanced, while this is hot and grapey on a finish that's oozing lactic oak character.

title: Vins El Cep 2016 Gelida Brut Reserva Rosé Garnatxa Sparkling (Cava)
description: A bready nose is light on fruit, while this rosé Cava feels plump, soft and foamy. Chunky cantaloupe and nectarine flavors are mild and smooth on a friendly but inexact finish.

title: Blanco Nieva 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Rueda)
description: Citrus and stone-fruit aromas are mostly fresh and round. This shows a grape-skin-based mouthfeel and oily grapefruit flavors that turn dry and lightly pickled and briny on the finish.

title: Bodegas Ontañón 2014 Vetiver Viura (Rioja)
description: Dry waxy aromas are more oaky than fruity. In the mouth, racy acidity combines with barrel tannins to create zest and some texture. Oaky leesy citrus flavors finish fresh and firm, with a touch of oak-based bitterness.

title: Abad Dom Bueno 2013 Mencía (Bierzo)
description: Rubbery earthy aromas include black-fruit scents and a touch of prune. This Mencía feels raw, drawing and pinched. Overt oak notes share the flavor profile with tart plum and currant, while the finish is abrupt.

title: García Figuero 2016 4 Roble  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Jammy berry aromas are more gritty than smooth. This feels chunky and on the heavy side, with power but little finesse. Extracted blackberry and cassis flavors finish with overt oak, related chocolate notes and rough tannins.

title: Bodegas Tobía 2015 Viña Tobía Viura (Rioja)
description: Dusty orange aromas and a tight lime-driven palate set up lime and arugula flavors that show mild bitterness on the back side. A tangy finish with a note of white pepper is an appropriate ending.

title: Grandes Vinos y Viñedos 2015 Corona de Aragón Garnacha Blanca (Cariñena)
description: Fleshy melony aromas are devoid of any sharpness. This feels chunky but balanced, with peach-pit flavors and citric undertones. A clean short finish seems right for this basic white.

title: Bodegas Ondalan 2014 100 Abades  (Rioja)
description: Compact cherry, plum and cassis aromas are nice. In the mouth, this is ruled by snappy edgy acidity. Flavors that match the nose finish raw, with blazing residual acidity. There's probably no limit to how long this Graciano will last; drink through 2030.

title: Bodegas Valdemar 2015 Inspiración Alto Cantabria Tempranillo Blanco (Rioja)
description: Peach, mango and crushed-stone aromas lead to a cidery, streamlined palate. Salty stone-fruit flavors lead in this barrel-aged Tempranillo Blanco, a fairly rare wine even for Rioja. On the finish, this is plump but lacking in structure. Drink now.

title: Bodegas Valdemar 2015 Finca Alto Cantabria Macabeo (Rioja)
description: A yellowish tint and woody aromas include a note of baked apple. A somewhat full-bodied palate is endowed with a resiny texture, while this tastes of woody dried apple and papaya. Round and persistently oaky on the finish.

title: Gorrebusto 2016  Rioja
description: This wine's grapy berry aromas bring good vinegar to mind. Its raw, fresh palate is firm and far from fat and cushy, with briny plum and berry flavors. It has a hard grape skin-like texture on the finish.

title: Martin Freixa 2014 Old Vines Carignan (Montsant)
description: There's a definite cooked, stewy element on the nose of this Carignan. The palate is also baked in style but has with a shot of angular, tomatoey acidity. Earthy plum and spice flavors finish with meaty notes and a final burst of acidity.

title: Enate 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot (Somontano)
description: Gritty tomatoey aromas suggest rustic but underripe fruit. On the palate, this delivers a mix of freshness combined with a medium-full body. A mix of herbal berries and wood-based spice notes finish grabby and warm.

title: Mont Rubí 2015 HMR White Xarel-lo (Penedès)
description: Clean direct melon and tropical-fruit aromas are simple but nice. This feels light and fresh, without much weight or body. Melon and white-fruit flavors are a touch bready, while this is dry, fresh and not that fruity on the finish.

title: Pazo Pondal 2015 Leira Pondal Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Peach, orange and seafoam aromas are clear and uncomplicated. This offers good flow on a healthy palate, while salty citrus and stone-fruit flavors are steady on the finish. Drink now.

title: Pago Casa Gran 2014 Falcata Crianza Red (Valencia)
description: Heavy oak, asphalt, chocolate and slightly weedy berry aromas open this blend of Garnacha Tintorera, Monastrell and Syrah. In the mouth, rubbery tannins create astringency. Fully oaked, spicy berry flavors include vanilla and clove notes, while an oak-dominated finish tastes creamy and herbal.

title: Abad Dom Bueno 2016 Mencía (Bierzo)
description: Straightforward berry and plum aromas are a bit smoky. A grapy palate is saturated and full of fruit, but also grabby, tannic and hard. Cherry and plum flavors are bold and lightly toasted, while this Mencía is racy and aggressive on the finish.

title: Alidis 2014 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Chunky obtuse aromas of berry fruits are a bit damp and volatile. This is heavy and severely tannic, while blackened berry and prune flavors come across a bit stewed. A drawing tannic finish brings this to a close.

title: Vicente Gandia 2017 Nebla Verdejo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León
description: A punchy nose includes aromas of green herbs, scallion, bell pepper and stone fruits. This Verdejo has an oily texture cut by lemony acidity. Salty flavors of orange peel and citrus fruits hollow out in front of a plump finish with lasting citric acidity.

title: Mocén 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Rueda)
description: Varietally familiar aromas of snappy citrus fruits are feline in nature. This is light in body, refreshing and citric. Flavors of lime and tangerine are stony and show a hint of green herbs, while this is lasting on a fresh finish.

title: Cuatro Rayas 2017 Cuarenta Vendimias Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Prickly aromas of lime, tropical fruits and cactus suggest a good Margarita. A tight crisp palate offers clarity and freshness, while this tastes of grapefruit, white pepper and green herbs.

title: Sonsierra 2017 Selección Viura (Rioja)
description: Mild apple scents are about all you'll find on a clean but neutral nose. This Viura is simple and fresh on the palate. Snappy citrus flavors are a touch briny, while this is consistent and just bold enough on the finish.

title: Valserrano 2017 Blanco White (Rioja)
description: Aromas of seashell and lime blend with notes of almond skins and overt oak. Following the nose, this barrel-fermented Viura feels resiny from lengthy exposure to oak. Apple, vanilla and wood resin make up the flavors on this balanced but lean Rioja with stand-out oak character throughout.

title: Perelada 2016 Només Garnacha Blanca (Empordà)
description: Aromas of orange peel, melon and vanilla come together fairly well. This feels plump but solid, with modest acidity. Melony flavors turn yeasty on a lightly oxidized finish that lacks length and kick. Drink now.

title: Castillo Clavijo 2008 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Rusty in color and lacking fruit aromas on the nose, this is just good enough for a gran reserva. Leathery, roasted-plum flavors taste more like black olive than bright fruit. It's tannic and a bit dull on the finish.

title: Luna Beberide 2016 Godello (Bierzo)
description: Mild white-fruit aromas suggest peach juice. This Godello is both plump and citrusy in feel. Generic citrus flavors are closest to orange. This is a touch bitter and slightly oxidized on the finish, so drink now.

title: Rento 2014  Ribera del Duero
description: Baked, raisiny aromas are dull and soft. Following that lead, this wine is jammy and lacking in verve. Flavors of prune, raisin and spice cake finish smooth and easy, with almost no acidity.

title: Valserrano 2017 Rosado (Rioja)
description: A dark color and aromas of cherry and red-apple skins play up the “red” side of rosé. This Rioja is full in body, with a rubbing texture. Sleepy red-fruit flavors finish chubby, confirming this rosado's fuller-bodied status.

title: Litore 2016 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Citrus aromas are forceful and show a hint of green bell pepper. A plump melony palate is healthy and easygoing. Briny green-melon flavors are modest on a finish that indicates that it's time to drink this.

title: Mas d'en Gil 2013 Coma Blanca White (Priorat)
description: Oxidized aromas of waxy white fruits lack freshness and suggest murk and age. While this blend of Garnacha Blanca and Macabeo is holding onto its solid mouthfeel, it tastes mostly of old wood and spiced melon. On the finish, notes of raw wood and buttered popcorn are out front.

title: Ramirez de la Piscina 2014 Selección Crianza  (Rioja)
description: A severely charred and woody nose means this blocky Crianza has strong scents of mint, clove and barrel spices. Expect a battle from start to finish; the palate is resiny and grabby, while oak-infused berry flavors taste a lot like clove. The same can be said for a big-time woody finish.

title: Tinedo 2015 Cala N.2 Red (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Blackberry, raisin and baking-spice aromas generate a sense of power more than finesse and elegance. On the palate, this blend of Tempranillo, Graciano and Cabernet Sauvignon is beyond intense. Flavors of savory berry, oak and caramel finish bold and syrupy.

title: Prada A Tope 2015 Palacio de Canedo Mencía (Bierzo)
description: Plum and raspberry aromas are jammy and not too intense or demanding. A grabby tannic palate feels a bit stemmy, while plum and raspberry flavors are grabby on a finish with gravelly tannins.

title: Marqués de la Concordia 2012 Viña Alarde Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Aromas of raspberry, plum, tobacco and cedar are a touch reedy and raw. A somewhat dilute and lean palate deals tart cherry and red-plum flavors that hint at sourness. Tangy zesty acidity pumps up finishing salad-dressing-like flavors of vinegar, salt and herbs.

title: Marqués de Reinosa 2012 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Crisp red-fruit aromas and dusty spice notes convene on a fiery nose. This is hard, smacking and jagged on the palate, with flavors of tomato, red plum and dry oak. On the finish, this returns to the same grating tannic intensity that defines the palate.

title: Pradorey 2015 Crianza Finca Valdelayegua Single Vineyard  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Spicy black-cherry aromas are earthy and herbal, with a note of olive. A deep but tightly drawn palate brings flavors of berry, plum and raspberry. This Crianza is tight as nails on a raw finish. Time could help this along; drink through 2028.

title: Vinos de Arganza 2014 Flavium Premium Mencía (Bierzo)
description: Initally, this Bierzo Mencía is funky smelling, with gamy aromas of berry fruits, iodine and rubber. A flush, heavy palate is more thick and flat than lively, while herbal green notes infiltrate berry and spice flavors. Green peppercorn flavors stand out on a chunky finish.

title: Montebuena 2017 Cuvée KPF  (Rioja)
description: Plum and berry aromas are good in a standard and familiar way. A full-fruit palate is a bit grinding, while berry, black plum, cassis and prune flavors finish steady but with clamping tannins.

title: Pazos del Rey 2016 Pazo de Monterrey Godello (Monterrei)
description: Mellow peach and apricot aromas indicate a mature but clean Godello. A round palate comes with a grape-skins texture, while bold natural acidity is keeping this lively. Briny orange flavors are a touch sour, while this is short on flavor but healthy feeling across the finish.

title: Adega dos Eidos 2016 Eidos de Padriñán Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Aromas of lime and dried mango are quiet on the nose. This Albariño has the feel of pulpy citrus fruits, while a mix of briny tropical fruit flavors turns a bit green and peppery on the finish.

title: Naveran 2015 Brut Rosé Sparkling (Cava)
description: Aromas of orange and vanilla turn more burnt and smoky as this Pinot Noir-Parellada brut rosé opens up. The highly foamy mouthfeel carries rustic, spicy citrus flavors.

title: Pablo Claro 2016 Biodynamic Sauvignon Blanc (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Mild white-fruit aromas carry the nose of this Biodynamic Sauvignon Blanc. Angular, tangy flavors of gooseberry and green plum carry the flavors and finish crisp and clean.

title: Volver 2015 Tarima Made With Organic Grapes Monastrell (Alicante)
description: Peppery spice and asphalt aromas are more prominent than secondary berry scents. A hard, tannic but generous palate and woody spicy flavors are the keys to this full-force Monastrell. If you know Tarima, then this wine's oaky aggressive character will be familiar.

title: Pradorey 2009 Gran Reserva Finca Real Sitio de Ventosilla Single Vineyard  (Ribera del Duero)
designation: Gran Reserva Finca Real Sitio de Ventosilla Single Vineyard
description: No two ways about it, this hot-vintage Gran Reserva is a plush wine. It starts with baked cooked stewed aromas that render the nose asleep. A soupy stewy palate tastes of baked berry fruits, prune and chocolate. Consistent with the rest of the wine, this finishes soft. Drink now.

title: Pazo Pondal 2015 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Flowery aromas suggest air freshener. This feels plump, round and oily. Salty orange flavors are just ripe enough to be good, while this pushes the limits of brininess on a finish that offers a taste of the ocean.

title: Baron De Ley 2015 White (Rioja)
description: Fleshy apple and peach aromas lead to a medium-bodied palate. Standard flavors of stone fruits are nice but simple, while this blend of Viura and Malvasia finishes with light notes of apple and nectarine.

title: Bodegas Veganzones 2015 Viejo Mundo Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Soapy red-fruit aromas are questionable. In the mouth, this is tough and pulling, with no holds barred. Candied berry and sugar beet flavors finish with intensity but also a green residual note.

title: Cillar de Silos 2015 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: This crianza's rustic grilled meat and baking spice aromas are unfocused. It's jammy and soupy on the palate, with a soft structure, mild tannins and charred prune and berry flavors.

title: Victoria Ordóñez 2017 La Pasajera Verdejo (Rueda)
description: This wine's mild citrus and green herb aromas are typical of good but basic Verdejo. It's lean, lemony and light in body, with briny citrus flavors and a salty finish.

title: Volver 2015 Single Vineyard Tempranillo (La Mancha)
description: This wine's floral, grapy aromas are woody and a touch volatile. It's jammy and mouthfilling, with wiry acidity and soft tannins. Its jammy berry and black plum flavors finish flush, without much structure.

title: Con un Par 2016 Monastrell-Petit Verdot (Valencia)
description: Plum and cherry aromas carry a lemony oak note. This is fresh but rubbery, as you might expect from a young Monastrell-Petit Verdot blend. Plenty of black currant and plum fruit is supported by mild toasty bitterness on the finish.

title: Pingao 2014  Rioja
description: Compact, rubbery aromas of plum and berry come with notes of cheesy oak and cowhide. A tight, fresh palate is balanced, tasting of plum, berry fruits and oaky spice. A straightforward finish echoes the palate.

title: Emina 2016 Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Snappy slightly prickly aromas of citrus, bell pepper and green herbs lead to a fresh, citric palate of moderate weight. Green-leaning flavors of grapefruit and nectarine finish firm but mild, with a briny note.

title: Marqués del Atrio 2013 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Mild, controlled aromas of spiced cherry, road tar and earthy coffee form the nose of this wine. The palate is restrained, with integrated spiced berry and dried leaf flavors. For an everyday Rioja of quality, look no further.

title: Señorío de Sotillo 2015 Roble  (Ribera del Duero)
description: This leads with tire rubber, asphalt and beef jerky aromas, seeming smoky, savory and oaky. Grippy tannins frame its slightly stewed berry flavors. It finishes on notes of licorice, smoked meat and baked blackberry.

title: Baron De Ley 2015 Varietales  (Rioja)
description: Leathery, oaky berry aromas are baked and include a note of cinnamon. A stout, firm palate is framed by rough, edgy tannins. Spicy, herbal plum flavors feature more than enough oak, while this is drying and tannic on the finish.

title: Nivarius 2016 White (Rioja)
description: Apple and pear aromas are clean and easy, with a hint of white corn. This is Tempranillo Blanco blended with Viura and Maturana Blanca; it feels generic but fresh, with simple lime and orange flavors. A steady finish shows little change from the palate.

title: Castaño 2016 Monastrell (Yecla)
description: This Monastrell's raisiny, candied aromas are ripe but a touch flat. In the mouth, it's raw and rough, with slightly abrasive tannins. Herbal red plum flavors accent its dry, scratchy finish.

title: Telmo Rodríguez 2016 Al-muvedre Monastrell (Alicante)
description: There's some funk to this Monsatrell, starting with earthy, rubbery aromas that suggest animal fur, leather and volatility. Its full, bold palate delivers spicy, slightly roasted berry and plum flavors prior to a raw finish. It's more rustic than polished.

title: Ego Bodegas 2014 Gorú Red (Jumilla)
description: Glaring oak on the nose results in notes of clove, chocolate and spice to go with generic but ripe black-fruit scents. This blend of Monastrell, Syrah and Petit Verdot feels heavy and syrupy, while flavors of maple, toasted oak, chocolate and clove finish ripe, but also sweet and candied.

title: Capçanes 2015 Mas Picosa de Flor en Flor Red (Montsant)
designation: Mas Picosa de Flor en Flor
description: Rubbery red berry aromas are more than satisfactory for this type of Garnacha blend. Its linear, light-bodied palate is fresh and punchy, with salty plum and berry flavors. While not very extracted, it lasts on the finish.

title: Breca 2016 De Fuego Old Vines Rosé Garnacha (Calatayud)
description: While there's barely any color to this Garnacha rosé, it's a good, albeit pedestrian, wine. Light and clean on the nose, it tastes of lightly sugared red fruits and nectarine. The finish is just racy and cleansing enough.

title: Bodegas Bilbainas 2014 Viña Zaco  (Rioja)
description: This wine's heavy oak aromas are toasty but not overdone, while bacon and tobacco notes lurk in the background. Its raw, supremely tannic palate delivers woody, spicy berry flavors.

title: Vecordia 2011 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Mixed berry, Christmas spice and herbal aromas have their limits. This is ringing and hard on the palate, with an unsettled combo of fierce tannins and bold acidity. Raspberry and plum flavors are on the tart side, while this runs low on cushion and depth on the finish.

title: Pagos del Moncayo 2015 Prados Privé Red (Campo de Borja)
description: Jammy berry and gaseous aromas require a lot of patience to sift through. This heavyweight Syrah-Garnacha blend feels wide, grabby and tannic. Blasting oak, chocolate and extracted berry flavors are expansive on a hot finish that reflects 15% abv.

title: CVNE 2016 Monopole Viura (Rioja)
description: Clean white-fruit aromas are simple but pleasant. This Viura has a round, plump body that's a touch flat. Salty citrus flavors come with notes of lime and green banana. A lasting finish is mild and tasty. Drink immediately.

title: La Caña 2018 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: This partially barrel-fermented Albariño shows its upbringing through oaky aromas of wood grain and spice, while fruit scents are mild. A lean, malic palate is racy in feel, while this tastes woody on top of melon and peach notes.

title: Marqués de la Concordia 2017 Federico Paternina Banda Azul Brut Sparkling (Cava)
description: Dusty apple and bready aromas are good but not that expressive. This Cava from Rioja is a bit foamy and wide on the palate, while flavors of dried apple and white pepper finish with yeasty oxidative notes.

title: Edetària 2016 Viaterra Garnacha Blanca (Terra Alta)
description: Aromas of orange peel and tarragon are spunky and a little green on the nose. This fresh, lean Garnacha Blanca shows moderate acidity and short flavors of green melon and almond skins. A bit of saltiness is present on a dry finish.

title: Salcis 2013 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Aromatically, this doesn't offer much. And while the palate is a bit raw, rugged and clumsy, this tastes of cherry, plum and chocolate in way that's convincing. On the finish, this is spicy with lingering cocoa notes.

title: De Bardos 2014 Rómantica Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Floral aromas recalling violet petal and raisin introduce this crianza from a tough year. It's at once extracted and narrow, with a heavy blast of oak that lends toast and chocolate flavors, while the finish tastes burnt.

title: Pazo Pondal 2018 Lenda Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Floral aromas suggest tropical fruits like melon and pineapple, while this is sound in feel. Salty peach and melon flavors are short on depth but varietally correct, while this is steady on a finish with lingering tropical notes.

title: Tarón 2017 4M  (Rioja)
description: Raisin and baking-spice aromas form a basic opening, while this feels blocky and tannic, with a shock of acidity. Cherry, plum, berry and spice flavors are standard individually and as a group, while this offers a light dusting of baking spice on a finish with residual berry notes.

title: La Purísima 2018 Syrah (Yecla)
description: Grapey berry aromas are oaky, and while the nose on this Syrah is far from complex it settles into something good. The same can be said for the palate: it's grapey but also juicy and appealing. Flavors of wild berry, spicy oak and cardamom remain bright across the finish.

title: Baron De Ley 2018 White (Rioja)
description: A punchy citric nose offers a hint of green, while this Viura-Malvasia blend is as expected on the palate, meaning fresh and light. White-grapefruit and apple flavors end with a reprise of mild green notes.

title: Bodegas Ondarre 2016 Valdebarón  (Rioja)
description: Mild berry aromas are welcoming and not pushy. On the palate, however, this is more fierce, with raw tannins. Lightly herbal plum and berry flavors offer tasty subtleties on a tough-textured finish.

title: Cellers Unió 2016 Perlat Garnatxa (Montsant)
description: Ripe berry and plum aromas are thick and a bit strained. On the palate, this Grenache is tannic and rubbery in feel. Baked berry and raisin flavors show a chocolaty richness on the finish. Overall, this is mostly good but a little lacking in top-to-bottom balance.

title: Crápula 2016 Gold 5 Monastrell-Syrah (Jumilla)
description: Blackberry, licorice and burnt-wood aromas comprise the nose on this blend of Monastrell and Syrah. A flush palate features rubbing tannins, while a charred oak flavor covers up berry and plum notes. On the finish, this remains oaky and chocolaty, but dry in feel.

title: Covila 2014 II Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Raspberry, olive and oak aromas are pinched. This crianza from a marginal year feels chunky and broad, with scratchy tannins. Cool, herbal berry and plum flavors are minty and oaky on a finish that hints at complexity.

title: Pradorey 2017 Verdejo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León
description: Apple, stone-fruit and buttercup aromas are good but basic. This Verdejo is honest and fresh on the palate, but far from complex. Salty apple flavors are reserved, while this tastes of briny apple and melon on the finish.

title: Bodegas Paniza 2016 Garnacha (Cariñena)
description: Red-berry aromas are basic but fresh, with minimal concentration. A plump juicy palate ranks as healthy, while raspberry and red-plum flavors are not too serious or intense. A fresh steady finish wraps up this pulpy Garnacha.

title: Ressò 2016 Old Vines Garnacha Blanca (Catalunya)
description: Tan in color, with uncomplicated but friendly melon and apple aromas, this feels electric on the palate due to high acidity. The mix of citrus and stone-fruit flavors is lean, tight and lasting on the finish.

title: Dominio de la Abadesa 2014 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Mature, slightly oxidized berry aromas lead to a palate that has the clamp and tension of rubber bands. Black-fruit and plum flavors are good but basic, while this feels rocky hard and rubbery on a tannic finish.

title: Aspaldi 2015 Cosecha  (Rioja)
description: Gritty berry and spice notes indicate a wine that's just ripe enough. A palate with rubbery tannins and grip features saucy, herbal plum and tomato flavors. On the finish, this is steady, fresh and tightly wound.

title: 12 Linajes 2016 Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Clean, fresh, basic white-fruit aromas are stony. This is lemony, lean and crisp in feel. Flavors of briny citrus turn salty on a finish that tastes of fresh green herbs and scallion.

title: Portal del Montsant 2011 Santbru White (Montsant)
description: Fully mature, oxidized aromas include a heavy note of popcorn and oak along with aged pear and apple. This wine is ripping with acidity, while flavors lean towards salty, lightly baked apple. A finish based mostly on acid means this should stay vital for years to come.

title: Martinsancho 2016 Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Grapefruit and grit show on the nose. A narrow palate with a hint of spritz delivers short green melon flavors that turn slightly bitter prior to a peppery-tasting finish.

title: Mar de Envero 2016 Troupe Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Briny citrus aromas announce a palate with citric acidity. Similar briny citrus flavors are one-dimensional, while notes of hay and green herbs pop up on a racy finish.

title: Marqués de la Concordia 2016 Lagunilla Viura (Rioja)
description: Fresh but basic apple and pear aromas lead to a direct palate with citric acidity. Dry, simple peach and nectarine flavors are replaced by a mild briny character on the finish.

title: Matsu 2017 El Picaro  (Toro)
description: Ripe berry and cassis aromas show some oak prior to a raw, rough and rubbing palate. Baked black plum and berry flavors are true to Toro, while a dry, tannic finish deals leftover flavors of black plum and spice. Drink when ready; this is not for aging.

title: Fillaboa 2015 Seleccion Finca Monte Alto Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Yeasty aromas of Animal Cracker cookies and vanilla mask fruit tones on the nose. This vineyard-designated Albariño shows flavors of briny apple and stone fruits, with a slightly bitter, monotone finish.

title: Cellers Unió 2015 Clos Dalian Garnacha Blanca (Terra Alta)
description: Light peach and grape-skin aromas lead to a zesty citrusy palate that's slightly oily in feel. Flavors of orange, tangerine and stone-fruit pits finish firm, steady and a touch salty.

title: Sierra Norte 2014 Pasión de Bobal (Utiel-Requena)
description: Roasted smoky plum and berry aromas are slightly oaky. This feels flush, with grabby tannins. Plum and mixed-berry flavors grow more appealing with air, while this tastes roasted and savory on a rugged and tannic finish.

title: Finca Albret 2017 Rocío Rosado (Navarra)
description: A rusty orange color is a prime indicator that this isn't your average dry rosé. Based on free-run Garnacha juice and fermented in barrel, this is a dry, textured wine with orange peel and red apple flavors. A chalky finish is where oak character speaks loudest.

title: Carlos Serres 2018 Tempranillo-Garnacha Rosé (Rioja)
description: Aromas of grape skins are mild and minimal, while this is zesty despite showing some pulpiness on the palate. Slightly tart tangerine is mostly what this simple rosé tastes like, while the finish is chalky feeling and clean. Not that it matters much, but this is 80% Garnacha and the rest Tempranillo.

title: CVNE 2014 Viña Real Barrel Fermented Viura (Rioja)
description: Candle wax, a touch of yeast and early oxidized aromas control the nose on this barrel-fermented Viura. Quick apple flavors turn lightly bitter, buttery and yeasty in front of a lasting, dry finish.

title: Rioja Vega 2016 Reserva Producción Limitada Fermentado en Barrica Tempranillo Blanco (Rioja)
designation: Reserva Producción Limitada Fermentado en Barrica
description: This fully oaked Tempranillo Blanco smells outright grainy, while the play between briny core fruit and oak creates a mustard scent. Briny, woody citrus flavors are intense but fail to show secondary notes of complexity.

title: Marqués de Carrión 2013 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Oaky berry aromas are backed by milk chocolate and vanilla notes on a candied nose. A smacking palate centers on severely dry tannins, while this reserva tastes of saucy, savory plum and currant. A clipped, abrupt finish is apropos for this Rioja from a cold year.

title: Marqués de la Concordia 2014 Viña Alarde Crianza  (Rioja)
description: While this smells a touch tired, with a hint of oxidation to go with tobacco, raisin and damp aromas, sappy tomato-like acidity provides proof of life. Flavors of tomato, raspberry, currant and vanilla finish dry and saucy in an old-style Rioja way. Drink now.

title: Viña Otano 2015 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Leathery berry and raisin aromas are ever so slightly oxidized. This crianza feels zesty and lively, with plum and red berry flavors. A tight, racy finish is a bit raw but honest, and overall this is a nice Rioja if red fruit flavors and acidic snappiness hold appeal.

title: Atalayas de Golbán 2015 Torre de Golbán Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Bold berry fruit and spun-sugar aromas scream ripeness and oak. On the palate, this strikes as being tough, aggressive and forward in nature; nothing is reserved or subtle. Crackling plum and cherry flavors wrap up on a rough finish. More time in bottle could help this, but Crianzas shouldn't require a lot of patience. Drink through 2030.

title: La Gitana 2014 Cuerno Expresion  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Raisiny aromas suggest overripeness on the nose, leading to a saturated palate that is thick and jammy. While this tastes stewed at its core, there's enough edge to the finish to allow woody notes to help out prune and raisin flavors. If full ripeness is your thing, then proceed with gusto.

title: Cuatro Pasos 2015 Mencía (Bierzo)
description: Spicy plum and cassis aromas come with a sweet note of cinnamon-infused jam. A gritty but fun palate loses energy and bounce as this airs out, while flavors of chocolate and plum finish creamy before falling off. For a simple but good taste of Mencía, give this a go.

title: Bodegas Heredad Aduna 2014 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Plum and berry aromas come with notes of tobacco ash and green herbs. On the palate, this is a bit closed and clipped. Savory, spicy berry and plum flavors finish with length and notes of vanilla and mixed spices.

title: Bodegas Valdemar 2014 Fincas Valdemacuco Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: An obtuse nose with chunky berry aromas gets sketchier under the microscope, which unveils aromas of green bean and mulch. A flat rubbery tough palate is fiercely tannic, while this tastes a bit stewed and heavy. A rubbery finish tastes of dark-berry fruit.

title: Vionta 2015 Limited Release Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: As this enters its second year in bottle, the nose is still clean and punchy, much like fruit salad. A plump solid mouthfeel holds flavors of salty peach. Beyond that, there's not a lot to say about this standard Albariño. Drink immediately.

title: Palacios Remondo 2015 La Vendimia  (Rioja)
description: This Garnacha-Tempranillo blend opens with candied plum and berry aromas. On the palate, this feels sticky, jammy and a touch gummy. Plum and candied-berry flavors are ripe and fun, but rudimentary. A mild finish confirms that this is good but basic stuff.

title: Bodegas Hnos. Pérez Pascuas 2012 Viña Pedrosa La Navilla  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Call this traditional, a throwback, or whatever you want, because it's a less-polished wine with a strong sense of buttery oak and animal. It's also challenging and strained, with herbal tart plum flavors and a strong note of cheesy oak to the finish.

title: Rioja Vega 2015 Edición Limitada  (Rioja)
description: This Tempranillo looks and smells ripe, and it's loaded with toasty minty oak aromas. In the mouth, this woody number is pushy and tannic. Barrel-driven flavors of smoky charred black plum are one-dimensional. This finishes tannic and with pounding oak.

title: Obalo 2015 Rosado (Rioja)
description: Aromas of peach pit and dry melon are firm and clean but nothing special. This feels fresh and correct, nothing more. Pithy briny stone-fruit flavors are steady on the finish, which shows good weight and balance. Drink now.

title: Urbina 2016 Rosado (Rioja)
description: A salmon color and aromas of cantaloupe, peach and grape skins lead to a tight but pulpy palate. Fleshy peach and papaya flavors, like the nose, come with a sense of skins. A round, chewy finish is bold and fairly serious.

title: Castellroig 2014 Terroja de Sabaté i Coca Xarel-lo (Penedès)
description: Briny citrus-peel aromas show a pyrazinic green side and a touch of corn tortilla. A somewhat dilute palate is bolstered by a shock of citric acidity, tasting of stone fruits and citrus. On the finish, early nectarine notes are replaced by briny flavors.

title: Finca Valpiedra 2011 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Aromas of burnt leaf, peanut butter, desiccated black fruits and olive are jumbled, strange and get tougher to process the longer this sits. A racy sharp palate is high in acid, while this tastes of tart plum and pie cherry, with tobacco and vanilla in the backdrop. On the finish, this is tangy at first then fizzles, leaving acidic burn. For a pricey Reserva from a strong vintage, this is not compelling.

title: Valduero 2017 Yunquera Albillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León
description: Made from Albillo, a variety not known for its expressiveness, this offers dull white fruit aromas. The chunky palate deals flowery flavors of orange and persimmon that give way to a minerally finish.

title: Vallobera 2014 Finca Vallobera  (Rioja)
description: Grassy scents accent this wine's prune and raisin aromas. It's chunky but also high in acid, so the mouthfeel has balance issues. Its raisiny berry flavors are slightly oxidized and spicy on the finish.

title: Viñedos Balmoral 2017 Maravides Chardonnay (Spain)
description: This low-alcohol Chardonnay grown at 3,200 feet elevation offers mild white fruit aromas. It's neither ultra-ripe nor fruity, with pulsing acidity that offsets some creaminess on the palate. It finishes salty and citrusy, with a touch of melon.

title: Beronia 2014 Coleción Beronia Tempranillo  (Rioja)
description: This wine's smoky black fruit aromas come with a licorice note. It's full in body, with spicy plum and currant flavors and an oaky, salty finish.

title: Bodegas Ugalde 2015 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Red-plum aromas are fiery and punchy, with a backing of light spice, oak and herbal notes. In the mouth, this is lean and cutting, with sharp acidity. Red-currant, graphite and green-herb flavors are smacking and tomatoey on a finish that hints at astringency. For a warm year like 2015, this is stripped back.

title: Albet I Noya 2017 El Fanio Xarel-lo (Penedès)
description: Oily, lightly oxidized aromas are full and round but not exactly popping with clarity. This Xarel-lo feels chunky and yeasty, while mildly oxidized flavors fail to suggest any particular fruit. On the finish, this is waxy in feel and tastes vaguely of apple.

title: Alta Alella 2017 Mirgin Reserva Brut Nature Sparkling (Cava)
description: Briny citrus aromas are lean and come with a whiff of white vinegar. A dry, fresh palate lacks complexity while dealing minerally lime flavors. Lastly, a crisp finish is bone-dry but short on flavor and character.

title: Albet I Noya 2016 XA Xarel-lo (Penedès)
description: Simple green-apple aromas are innocuous. This is fresh, easy and light on the palate. Flavors of apple and sweet greens finish mild and clean. Overall this wins by keeping things basic and fresh.

title: Bodegas Aragonesas 2017 Viña Temprana Old Vines Tempranillo (Campo de Borja)
description: Dry, punchy currant and cherry aromas are snappy and fresh. In the mouth, this everyday Tempranillo feels smacking and fit, with high acidity. Short but fresh plum and berry flavors stay bright and lively across an otherwise vacuous finish.

title: Luna Beberide 2017 Godello (Bierzo)
description: Apple and corn aromas are smooth but short on freshness. Following the nose, this feels plump and pulpy, with moderate acidity putting this in the drink-now category. Leesy, sightly bitter apple and melon flavors lose some snap on the finish.

title: Marqués de Vargas 2015 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Welcoming berry aromas are fresh and include notes of cinnamon and baking spices. On the palate, this is rubbing due to grating tannins. Flavors of leathery plum, raspberry and oak finish with notable wood spice and friction.

title: Con un Par 2016 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: This quiet Albariño comes from the Vicente Gandia family of wines. It opens with short, peppery aromas backed by a medium-bodied palate. Peppery, slightly bitter flavors echo the nose, with a hint of stone fruit to help it along. Drink now.

title: Vins El Cep 2017 Kila Brut Sparkling (Cava)
description: A mild nose doesn't have a lot of fruit, but there's a good amount of vanilla, pastry and powdered sugar on the bouquet. A cidery palate is a touch flat, while this tastes of apple and melon in front of an easy finish.

title: Hiruzta 2016 Basque Brut Nature Hondarribia Sparkling (Getariako Txakolina)
description: Neutrality defines the nose on the Basque brut nature made from the same white grape that fuels Txakoli. This feels foamy and tastes pithy and oddly saucy, with stone-fruit notes. A mildly bitter finish has a skins-driven feel.

title: Valdelacierva 2014 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Savory, spicy, herbal berry aromas lead to a sinewy palate that's full of acidity and chop. Oaky plum flavors are woody and a bit muddled, while this wine tastes of oaky red fruits on a fiery finish.

title: Monterebro 2015 Blanco Sauvignon Blanc (Jumilla)
description: Jumilla is a red-wine region, but this Sauvignon Blanc is a citrusy example of a tastyquaffable white from the area. Aromas of citrus peel are mildly pyrazinic, while this feels plump and balanced, but with spritz. Core citrus flavors come with a sprinkle of salt.

title: Montespina 2016 Sauvignon (Rueda)
description: White-flower aromas are a touch yeasty, like animal crackers. This feels plump but maintains a sense of freshness. Citrus and nectarine flavors are generic but good, while this is lasting on the finish, with notes of grape-skin extract and pyrazines.

title: Baronet 2011 Familia Reyes Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Dusty earthy cherry and plum aromas are a bit spicy, while this feels blocky, with rubbery tannins. Spicy herbal plum and raspberry flavors show a mild green note on the finish.

title: Dominio Basconcillos 2015 Viña Magna 6 Meses en Barrica  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Jumpy berry aromas are offset by notes of clove and wet dog. This feels thick, chewy and creamy, while foxy berry and plum flavors are bolstered by heavy oak. On a creamy feeling finish, a chocolatey note rises up along with herbal hints.

title: Castelo do Papa 2017 Godello (Valdeorras)
description: This wine's light lemon blossom and lime aromas are nice but highly basic. Its simple, free-flowing palate deals candied white fruit flavors, ending with white table grape and sugar cookie notes.

title: Albet I Noya 2015 El Fanio Xarel-lo (Penedès)
description: Neutral, slightly briny aromas are fresh but low on fruit. This has a slightly plump feel but not a lot of length or depth. Short basic white-fruit flavors match the nose, while this Xarello finishes dry in feel and mildly briny in flavor.

title: Abad Dom Bueno 2014 Mencía (Bierzo)
description: Oaky, rubbery aromas are stewy and include notes of clove and cinnamon. A raw, pulling palate is defined by rubbery tannins, while this wine is toasty on top of tart plum and black-currant flavors. A firm, tough finish holds leftover clove, toast and licorice flavors.

title: Acentor 2016 Garnacha (Calatayud)
description: Berry and tomato aromas are basic. Typical of Garnacha, this is grabby and chewy on the palate. Flavors of grape skins, black plum and herbal berry fruits are peppery and show a hint of oak-based clove on the finish.

title: Cofrade 2018 Viura-Sauvignon Blanc (Rioja)
description: This yellow-tinted blend of Viura and Sauvignon Blanc opens with apple and pear aromas that come across as ripe. A pulpy palate has the texture of grape skins, while this tastes of melon and peach prior to a finish that offers an apricot note before falling off.

title: Torres 2013 Milmanda Chardonnay (Conca de Barberà)
description: On the nose, this aging Chardonnay brings corn to mind. Its palate is neither exciting nor flawed, with melon and stone fruit flavors that are yeasty and short, finishing on a bready and slightly oxidized note. Not a great value for its price.

title: Jardín de Lúculo 2015 Los Bohemios Garnacha (Navarra)
description: This wine's suntan lotion aromas and mild volatility are a bit disconcerting. On the palate, it's full and dark, with abrasive, rubbery tannins and jammy currant and black cherry flavors that finish strong.

title: Ego Bodegas 2018 Goru Verde Made with Organic Grapes Monastrell (Jumilla)
designation: Goru Verde Made with Organic Grapes
description: Massive blackberry aromas include smoke and char. A tough palate collapses a bit under its own extraction level, while this tastes of spicy black fruits and chocolaty oak. The finish veers towards that all-too-familiar clove and chocolate zone, but overall this holds the line on being too much.

title: Altovinum 2016 Evodia Garnacha (Spain)
description: Gritty red-berry aromas announce a Garnacha that's not overly ripe and definitely not heavy or jammy. A lean palate is slightly acidic and tannic, while this tastes of red currant and plum. Hard tannins circle back on a finish with mild heat.

title: Barahonda 2016 Carro Red (Yecla)
description: Minty black fruit aromas are fiery and jacked up. On the palate, this Monastrell-led blend feels grabby and hard, with rough tannins. Roasted berry and Barbecued flavors are spicy, meaty and charred, while this feels full and lively on the finish.

title: Ramirez de la Piscina 2015 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Berry and plum aromas show some barnyard amid overall ripeness. This feels bulky and grating, with rubbing tannins. Chunky berry flavors are more basic and undefined than specific, while this crianza is punchy and a bit rough on the finish.

title: Viñedos y Bodegas Pablo 2015 Gran Viu Red (Cariñena)
description: Aromas of maple, mocha, creamy oak and tree bark speak louder than fruit on this tight, rubbery feeling blend of Garnacha, Carignan and Tempranillo. Red plum, currant and spice flavors are touched up by chocolaty oak, while this reverts to choppy and extremely tannic on the finish.

title: Bohigas 2015 X Xarel-lo (Catalunya)
description: Light aromas of mango, melon and lime are quiet but clean. This is a simple but fresh white with a crisp stony mouthfeel. Easygoing flavors of melon and apple finish with a note of lime as well as a hint of wheaty yeast.

title: Rejadorada 2016 Reja  (Toro)
description: Generic red-fruit aromas are basic but clean. A chewy, plump palate is solid and not too heavy, which helps standard plum and berry flavors. While this joven-style Toro is far from concentrated and intense, the finish is slightly grapy, chunky and jammy.

title: Familia Montaña 2017 Blanco White (Rioja)
description: Whether this is leesy, mildly oxidized or both, a waxy nose is not bad if you're prepared for it. A melony feel and flavors of papaya go flat on a dry finish; an interesting blend of Garnacha Blanca and Viura.

title: Alonso López 2016 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Charred oak devolves into clove and mint aromas on this crianza. A strict palate is hard and pulling, built by firm acidity. Flavors of burnt oak and berry fruits finish dry and toasty.

title: CVNE 2016 Viña Real Crianza  (Rioja)
description: A tight nose with clamp and aromas of field greens and alfalfa could use more fruit, while this crianza feels grabby and tannic. Berry flavors are spicy but lean toward green, while this tastes minty and feels scratchy on the finish.

title: Burgo Viejo 2016  Rioja
description: Jammy blackberry aromas deal savory side notes of soy and hoison sauces. Clampy tannins create a smacking palate that struggles for but achieves balance. Blackberry flavors are minty in the middle, while this is chocolaty and a touch sticky on the finish.

title: Pazo de Barrantes 2017 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Yeasty melon, hand soap and geranium petal aromas lead to a chunky palate that's a bit soft and overweight. Flavors of briny citrus, green herb and peach pit do their best to hold up on the finish. Drink now.

title: De Moya 2015 Maria Bobal (Valencia)
description: Floral and dusty berry aromas lead the nose of this Bobal, which was aged 12 months in oak and includes trace amounts of Merlot. It's tight and racy on the palate, with forward plum and cherry flavors. The finish is fresh but breaks up quickly.

title: Emilio Moro 2015  Ribera del Duero
description: Forced oak aromas of milk chocolate and vanilla blend with blackberry and dark plum scents in this wine. It's abrasively tannic and rubbery on the palate, with stewed berry flavors and more oak notes. The finish is scratchy.

title: Heras Cordon 2012 Hacienda José Luis Reserva  (Rioja)
description: This wine's heavy black fruit aromas lack freshness. The palate is similar: it's both stewy and tannic. Its raisiny black fruit flavors are buried in oak, tasting much like a cup of black coffee on the hot, heavy finish. It's too overripe and bulky, even for the warm year.

title: Finca Nueva 2018 Fermentado Barrica.18 White (Rioja)
description: A neutral nose is low on fruit and devoid of anything specific. Citric acid cuts an oily palate, while this Viura tastes good but once again nonspecific. A lasting, healthy finish wraps up this largely standard white Rioja.

title: Izadi 2013 El Regalo  (Rioja)
description: Smoky oak on a dark-berry base gives a sense of richness and plushness. But that never comes, as this is rough and tannic, with an unyielding mouthfeel. Cherry, plum and chocolate flavors finish with rock-hard butts. Drink through 2022.

title: Ego Bodegas 2016 Fuerza Red (Jumilla)
description: Huge smoky aromas are based on grainy oak but include notes of cola and warm earth. A saturated palate tips the scales toward hot and heavy, while this blend of Monastrell, Cabernet Sauvignon and Syrah tastes of toasty oak, clove and generic black fruits. A thick, oaky finish closes this out.

title: Vicente Gandia 2015 Hoya de Cadenas Night Harvest White (Valencia)
description: Stone-fruit aromas of peach and nectarine include a hint of gardenia and bath soap, which is likely attributable to the 40% Muscat that leads Viura, Chardonnay and Verdejo. With a grabby oily texture and flavors of green melon and lychee, this is pleasant and easy to sip.

title: Matarromera 2016 Granza Made From Organic Grapes Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Tropical mango, melon, citrus and peach-pit aromas are typical for Verdejo. Flavors of citrus peel and stone-fruit pits follow the nose, while this organic-grape offering is mildly green on a light fresh finish.

title: Egeo 2017 Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Simple peach and melon aromas are chunky. Strong acidity cuts through an otherwise plump and melony palate. Short, basic green melon and white pepper flavors lose fruit but not their appeal on the finish.

title: Viña Cerrada 2015 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Aromas of green tobacco and berry fruits lead to a fresh and upright palate. Spice and oak flavors are wrapped around plum and prune notes, while this shows a raisiny hint at its core, as if the warmth of the 2015 vintage got in the way of full and total ripeness.

title: Sonsierra 2015 Barrel Fermented Viura (Rioja)
description: While this smells almost entirely like a barrel, the palate avoids being resiny and instead comes across as fresh and balanced. Oaky flavors are unavoidable, while melony fruit notes on the finish are dosed up with wood spice and a shot of freshening acidity.

title: Bodegas Bilbainas 2014 Viña Pomal Selección 500 Edición Especial Crianza  (Rioja)
designation: Viña Pomal Selección 500 Edición Especial Crianza
description: Cherry aromas are mildly medicinal, like a cough drop. This is a bold Rioja that rumbles on its way toward jammy berry flavors and hints of chocolate and spice. Despite being obtuse and a bit candied, this doesn't come up short on fruit.

title: Bodegas Luzón 2015 Luzón Colección Crianza Red (Jumilla)
description: Tarry dark-berry aromas are oaky, a touch smoky and chocolaty. This Monastrell-Garnacha Tintorera displays the extracted, lush tendencies of Luzón. Blackberry, smoky oak and coffee flavors finish full and chocolaty.

title: As Laxas 2017 Laxas Sensum Albariño Sparkling (Rías Baixas)
description: Floral, dusty aromas are yeasty and green, and immediately this Albariño distinguishes itself as different from the sizable pack of Cavas and other Spanish sparkling wines. Oily, flowery flavors of clover and melon are distinct, while this shows notes of grass and scallion on the finish.

title: Príncipe de Viana 2015 Roble Garnacha (Navarra)
description: This standard Garnacha feels jammy but a bit shapeless. Its raspberry and cassis aromas are ripe and candied, with a floral note while its raspberry and plum flavors finish with modest spice.

title: Parxet 2011 Titiana Brut Pansa Blanca Sparkling (Cava)
description: This brut Cava is made entirely from the Xarello grape. It's bready, leesy and yeasty on the nose, with touches of apple and nectarine. A low-verve palate tastes briny, with a hint of lime. On the finish, this tastes like the dust of vitamins.

title: Pago Casa Gran 2016 Casa Benasal Elegant Red (Valencia)
description: Floral red berry aromas are furry like a just-washed pet. This blend of Garnacha Tintorera, Syrah and Monastrell is tightly wound on the palate, which is packed with fruit but also punishing. Pinched plum and cherry flavors are compact and unyielding, while this darkens up on the finish.

title: Bodegas Verum 2013 Roble Red (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: A browning color indicates age, while this blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Tempranillo and Merlot smells dry and spicy, with mild oak and chocolate notes blending with plum scents. A medium-bodied palate offers black plum and herbal flavors in front of a finish that suggests black tea.

title: Valdelana 2015 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Generic plum and cherry aromas come with a vanilla note, while this everyday crianza feels compact, with pressing acidity. Plum, tomato, vanilla and coconut flavors reflect an oaky Rioja that tastes a bit dried out on the finish.

title: Bodegas Aquitania 2017 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Common Albariño aromas of green apple and sea brine come with a hint of waxy lanolin. Round and basic on the palate, this tastes of salty white fruits prior to a finish that is briny, with nectarine and citrus notes.

title: Bodegas Valdemar 2017 Inspiración Tempranillo Blanco Tempranillo Blanco (Rioja)
description: Apple, melon and spice aromas are honest and pleasant. In the mouth, this pulpy white Tempranillo is simple, with stone fruit-like acidity and matching flavors of nectarine that show a salty side. On the finish, this spreads out and becomes more dilute.

title: Lealtanza 2016 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: A soft nose with rubber, vanilla and floral berry aromas sets up a wide, bulky palate that's satisfying but not exactly precise. Black plum, cassis, wood spice and mint flavors finish steady but with a grapy feel.

title: Castillo de Maluenda 2015 Punto y Coma Garnacha (Calatayud)
description: Initial aromas of chlorine and raw plum settle and become more fruity and attractive with airing. This shows a forward fresh sassy palate with clipped rugged tannins. Ample oak and salty berry flavors veer towards clove and cinnamon prior to a scraping tough finish.

title: Bodega Otto Bestué 2016 Chardonnay (Somontano)
description: Briny stone fruit aromas lead to a pulpy palate in this medium-bodied wine. Its ripe white fruit flavors show no signs of oak, tasting melony and finishing short. Drink as soon as possible for best results.

title: Bodegas San Valero 2013 Particular Old Vine Garnacha (Cariñena)
description: Oak-heavy wood spice, plum and leather aromas open this Garnacha. On the palate, it's syrupy and heavy, with sweet cassis and blackberry flavors blanketed with oak, finishing jammy and resiny.

title: Esperanza 2017 Estate Grown & Bottled Verdejo (Rueda)
description: This wine's spunky green herb and lime aromas lead to a lively but creamy palate. Its salty lime flavors hold steady on the linear finish.

title: Castillo de Monjardin 2015 La Cantera Garnacha (Navarra)
description: This Garnacha's leathery, slightly underripe aromas are more savory than bold and fruity. On the palate, it's dry, with tomato-like acidity, fresh and zesty roasted plum flavors and a medicinal note that lingers on the finish.

title: Pradorey 2015 Selección Especial Verdejo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León
description: Right away this smells big and waxy, with lightly oxidized, pulpy melon aromas and a hint of seawater. A high-acid medium-bodied palate deals salty flavors of corn and melon, while the finish is fresh, full and a touch pithy in flavor.

title: Altavins 2016 Almondí Petit Red (Terra Alta)
description: Black-fruit aromas are spicy and earthy, with a hint of mushroom. This is full but basic on the palate. Black cherry, plum and dark-berry flavors are largely generic, while this Garnacha-led blend is plump and savory tasting on the finish.

title: Bodegas Palacio 2013 Cosme Palacio Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Berry fruit aromas are slightly gamy, with a hint of vanilla. On the palate, this is choppy and tough. Gamy, herbal plum and raspberry flavors transition to oaky and chocolaty on a severely dry, tannic finish that pushes up against sandpaper.

title: Conde Bel 2014 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Gritty, slightly cooked aromas make for a nose that's not bad but not that refined or elegant either. A soupy palate brings a sticky mouthfeel, while this tastes of oak and herbal red fruits. On the finish, this is more or less the same. Tempranillo and Garnacha is the blend.

title: Bodegas Aragonesas 2017 Crucillón Garnacha-Tempranillo (Campo de Borja)
description: Berry and plum aromas include modest hints of minerals and seashells. A fleshy palate is regular in feel, but balanced and not faulty. Plum and raspberry flavors are backed by light dashes of cocoa and pepper in this easy-to-like red.

title: Nisia 2018 Old Vines Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Simple apple and melon flavors are mild, while this is snappy feeling on the palate. Apple-cider flavors lose some freshness and clarity on a finish that's tasting yeasty on its way to oxidized.

title: Lagar de Indra 2016 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Fresh white-fruit aromas are pure in their set up of a citric, racy palate. Salty orange leads to a briny finish with salty apple and citrus flavors.

title: Olivier Rivière 2016 La Bastid White (Rioja)
description: Dusty, minerally white-fruit aromas are generic but appealing. This blend of Viura, Malvasia and Garnacha Blanca has a chunky palate with modest acidity. Green-melon flavors are round but flatten out and turn slightly bitter in front of a basic finish.

title: Bodega Classica 2017 Lopez de Haro  (Rioja)
description: Earthy plum aromas are slightly gamy. On the palate, this basic Rioja is fair and solid, albeit slightly sticky. Flavors of generic berry fruits and mild oak don't change much on an honest finish.

title: Bodegas Faustino 2012 V Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Dried plum, cherry and root beer aromas are traditional for Rioja. Malic acidity creates the drive on a narrow palate with leafy flavors of dried cherry and plum. A tart but not outright sour finish has a touch of spice to help it out.

title: Viña Costeira 2018 White (Ribeiro)
description: This wine is flowery on the nose. A wide palate is lacking in acidic cut, while this tastes of melon and apple prior to a mild finish.

title: Siglo 2015 Crianza Edición Oro  (Rioja)
description: This warm-vintage crianza is a bit unfocused and leafy on the nose. On the palate, however, it shows better, with fullness and grab. Baked berry flavors struggle to show total clarity, while this offers raisiny notes on a warm, chunky finish.

title: Arriezu 2018 Cantos Blancos Made With Organic Grapes Verdejo (Rueda)
designation: Cantos Blancos Made With Organic Grapes
description: Oily citric aromas suggest orange peel, with a stony offset. This Verdejo is satisfyingly light, mild and fresh in feel, while flavors of scallion and citrus fruits turn slightly bitter prior to a lean finish controlled by green-herb flavors.

title: Bela 2017 Estate Grown  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Bela is the new Ribera del Duero property from CVNE in Rioja. This is a different type of RDD, one with exotic blueberry and spice aromas that settle on gamy and sauvage. But on the palate, it's hard and tannic, with the pinch of astringency. Herbal plum and currant flavors have a tea and grass-like quality, while this is spicy and suggestive of nutmeg and green herbs on a hard and grabby finish.

title: Bodegas Tobía 2014 Óscar Tobía Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Berry, raisin, vanilla and spice aromas are common, while this is thick and heavy on the palate, with grating tannins. Berry, mocha and chocolate flavors wrap up on a grabby finish that tastes baked and slightly overripe.

title: Launa 2014 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Dry, hot, scratchy berry -fruit aromas are earthy as well. A solid but abrasive palate shows hard, rubbery tannins. Flavors of plum, berry fruits and prune finish a bit stewed.

title: Alegra 2014 Roble  (Ribera del Duero)
description: The earthy berry and plum aromas in this full-bodied wine include cinnamon and spice notes. Its ripe black fruit comes with a tea-like note and a rubbery mouthfeel, finishing rugged with meaty black fruit and spice flavors.

title: Manuel Manzaneque Suárez 2014 Ea! Tempranillo (La Mancha)
description: This Tempranillo's oaky berry aromas are solid but standard. It shows moderate buttery oak and plum flavors, tasting mostly of creamy oak on a finish propped up by acidity.

title: Dominio de la Vega 2012 Paraje Tornel Bobal (Utiel-Requena)
description: Plump soft aromas of berry fruits, raisin and prune hint at ripeness. This feels dense and chewy, with integrated tannins. Saucy savory berry and plum flavors suggest tomato sauce, while this tastes lightly oaky and minty on the finish.

title: CVNE 2014 Viña Real Crianza  (Rioja)
description: A somewhat flat baked jammy nose offers up a helping dose of oak spice. This feels chunky but largely healthy, while oaky minty flavors of berry fruits and plum show a tomato-like quality on a blocky finish.

title: Juvé y Camps 2011 Brut Nature Gran Reserva Reserva de la Familia Sparkling (Cava)
designation: Brut Nature Gran Reserva Reserva de la Familia
description: Inoffensive aromas of crushed vitamins and stone fruits are good enough. This feels plump and medium in body, while flavors of papaya and green melon are dry and a touch briny. A solid finish is fine but doesn't push things forward.

title: Cuatro Pasos 2013 Mencía (Bierzo)
description: Gritty leathery plum aromas are intense but also low on ripeness and charm. Par for 2013, which was quite cool and rainy, this wine feels racy, with abrasive tannins. Short standard black plum and berry flavors finish with controlled toasty oak notes.

title: Egeo 2015 Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Mild, clean white-fruit aromas are generic but good. This feels round, with medium-level acidity. Pithy melon and citrus flavors are more bland than vivid on the finish. Drink now.

title: Rioja Vega 2018 Colección Tempranillos Rosé (Rioja)
description: Punch bowl aromas of stone fruits are a bit sharp and burning, with a hint of smelling salts. There's body to this rosé of Tempranillo along with stand-up acidity. Briny flavors of citrus fruits are fairly basic, while this is fresh and racy on the finish.

title: Vega Sauco 2015 Piedras & Princesas  (Toro)
description: There are more piedras (rocks) to this than princesas (princesses). The nose is ripe but a bit chemical, while the palate throbs with aggressive tannins and grinding acidity. Berry and chocolate flavors are fiery, and overall this is more high octane than anything else.

title: Morgadío 2018 Legado del Conde Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Leesy yeasty flavors of flowery white fruits, white bread and vanilla lead to a plump and round palate with a melony mouthfeel. Melon and mild green-herb flavors finish steady but not steely or tight.

title: Parxet 2013 Titiana Brut Pansa Blanca Sparkling (Cava)
description: A mixture of yeast, apple cider, pear and tropical-fruit aromas opens this varietal Xarello, known in parts of Catalonia as Pansa Blanca. A round but regular mouthfeel houses melon and citrus flavors. On the finish, this is standard, with some bitterness.

title: Nora 2016 Nora da Neve Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: A bold gold color and even bolder aromas of raw wood, oak resin and woody spice dominate the opening of this barrel-aged Albariño. A full but healthy palate feels grabby and resiny, while this tastes mostly of oak and wood spice. Add a point if you love barrel-heavy white wines; subtract a point or two if you don't.

title: Otazu 2018 Chardonnay (Navarra)
description: Tight, crisp apple aromas are lean and limited but fresh and crystal clear. A tight citric palate lacks weight and body, while this delivers short white fruit flavors backed by salty green notes. A mild melony flavor is found on the finish.

title: Rioja Vega 2016 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Ripe berry, raisin and oak aromas lead to an edgy palate with rubbery tannins. Plum and berry flavors are a touch raw and sappy, while this loses some steam on the finish, which tastes raisiny and mildly oxidized.

title: Marqués de Gelida 2013 Gran Reserva Brut Sparkling (Cava)
description: Powdery white-fruit aromas are simple and suggestive of scented soap. This is round, but with pinching acidity. Orange and nectarine flavors finish with citric snap and then smooth length.

title: Pagos del Moncayo 2016 Prados Fusión Garnacha-Syrah (Campo de Borja)
description: Honest berry-fruit aromas are a touch fiery and abrasive. On the palate, this Garnacha-Syrah blend is more calm than lively. Chunky berry flavors peter out slowly on a plump finish.

title: Livius 2009  Rioja
description: Lazy raisiny aromas reflect a very warm vintage. In the mouth, this Graciano is fat, with dense, plodding tannins. Raisin and prune flavors are chewy and exceedingly ripe, while this is obtuse on the finish.

title: Chan de Rosas 2016 Gran Cuvée Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: A reticent nose offers mature peach and stone fruit notes but nothing too bright or exciting. A chunky palate is living off latent acidity, while this tastes vaguely of apple juice and peach. Albariño is not known for its aging ability, and this is showing its age. Drink immediately.

title: Alidis 2012 Expresión Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)
description: A charred, chocolaty nose is doused with oak and related coffee and mocha aromas. On the palate, this is resiny and sappy in feel, with excess weight. Wood and more wood flavor has seeped into core berry fruit, while this feels dry and tannic on the finish, with a marshmallow flavor.

title: Aljibes 2016 VA Viña Aljibes Garnacha Tintorera (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Jammy berry aromas include a savory note and a touch of green. A huge, jammy palate is sappy and borders on being too big and heavy. Saucy blackberry flavors finish short on a plump finish.

title: Bodegas Caudalía 2014 Xi'ipal Parcela La Celada Single Vineyard Martín de Unx Syrah (Navarra)
designation: Xi'ipal Parcela La Celada Single Vineyard Martín de Unx
description: Baked, earthy berry aromas include notes of green herbs and spent coffee grounds. This Navarra Syrah is smacking and austere in feel, with citrusy acidity. A mix of sappy red fruit and toasted flavors finishes herbal, spicy and oaky.

title: Cellers Unió 2016 Convey Grenache-Carignan (Priorat)
description: Savory berry aromas include hints of spice, rubber and latex. This 50–50 blend of Garnacha and Carignan is tight and pulling, with little to no excess weight. A mix of oak and red fruit flavors hums toward a raw, choppy finish with a woody note of clove.

title: Finca Valpiedra 2014 Cantos de Valpiedra  (Rioja)
description: Classic Rioja aromas of lemony oak, vanilla and red fruit feed into a lean, fresh palate without much depth. Dry, spicy notes of mild oak blend into core tomato, red plum and currant flavors, while this crianza finishes with barrel spice and clove accents along with lingering cranberry and currant flavors.

title: Cepa 21 2016 Hito  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Oak-based lactic aromas include graphite and pencil eraser notes along with heavy black fruit scents. This is big and a bit jumbled on the palate. Blackberry and black currant flavors are accompanied by pasty oak notes. On the finish, this is grabby but with cutting acidity.

title: Bodegas Berceo 2016 Más de Berceo Tempranillo (Navarra)
description: Berry and plum aromas are a touch soapy and candied. A fresh, racy palate is high in acidity but modest in terms of stuffing and weight. Plum and berry flavors are light and simple but fattened up by a note of buttery oak prior to an honest finish.

title: Bodegas Lozano 2015 Montes De Leza Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Aromas of root beer, earthy plum and minty herbs lead to a saturated palate with tight tannins. Oak and spice flavors share the palate with red plum, currant and savory notes. On the finish, this is full and tannic.

title: Abad Dom Bueno 2017 Godello (Bierzo)
description: Buttercup, pear and lees aromas open this zesty Godello that feeds off citric acidity. Flavors of white grapefruit and citrus peel end crisp, lean and minerally, but also sharp and angular.

title: Beronia 2017 Rosé (Rioja)
description: Aromas of citrus peel, orange juice and nectarine are solid and clean. This quaffable rosé is citric yet a bit dilute and watery in feel, but still fresh. Tangerine and currant flavors finish light and easy.

title: Serra da Estrela 2017 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: This wine's briny aromas are citrusy but also green. It's tightly wound, with zesty, peppery lime, lemon and green herb flavors and a short finish.

title: Vara 2017  Rioja
description: Cherry and black currant aromas are forward and grapy, while this feels a bit loose and pulpy. Black-plum flavors are nice but hollow, while this sees plum notes stick around on a soft finish.

title: Bodegas Palacio 2015 La Poda  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Aromas of plastic and latex are hard to miss on a reduced nose that includes raspberry and red-plum notes. This is an extracted, full-bodied Tempranillo with bulky tannins. Grapy berry fruit flavors finish grabby and rubbery.

title: Mont Marçal 2016 Brut Reserva Sparkling (Cava)
description: Stalky, briny aromas are low on fruit, while this brut has a soda-like palate with foamy carbonation. Lightly green and grassy lemon-lime flavors land on green herbs and chive on the finish.

title: Palacio De Canedo 2017 Maceración Ecológico Mencía (Bierzo)
description: Dusty berry, black plum and pasty aromas include a note of clove. On the palate, this is sappy and fleshy, while uncomplicated black cherry and raspberry flavors finish plump and with mild spice notes.

title: Bodega Otto Bestué 2013 Finca Santa Sabina Tempranillo-Cabernet Sauvignon (Somontano)
description: Rooty aromas of licorice mix with raw slightly grassy red-fruit scents in front of a juicy lively high-acid palate. This blend of Cabernet Sauvignon and Tempranillo from a cool year shows spicy plum and red-berry flavors, while a peppery lightly herbal finish is tangy and fresh.

title: Resalte 2016 Vendimia Seleccionada  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Dark aromas of asphalt, blackberry and charred wood are low on elegance. On the palate, this feels wide and resiny, but short of character and focus. Woody flavors of jammy berry and clove finish with a heavy dose of wood spice that seems forced and slightly artificial.

title: Bodega Otto Bestué 2014 Finca Rableros Crianza Tempranillo-Cabernet Sauvignon (Somontano)
description: Edgy raw cherry and plum aromas are spicy, setting up a bracing palate with firm tannins and high acidity. This is dry, spicy and like red plum and currant. Scouring acidity makes for a moderately abrasive finish.

title: Cuna de Reyes 2011 Reserva Vendimia Seleccionada  (Rioja)
description: This leads with oaky berry aromas and a whiff of menthol. The palate deals salty plum and berry flavors, a burnt note of char and citrusy acidity. It's clipped and short.

title: Vicente Gandia 2015 El Miracle by Mariscal Garnacha Tintorera (Valencia)
description: Aromas of rose hips and generic red fruits are restrained. A compact palate is fresh enough, while this tastes of reedy red fruits with touches of mint and oak. On the finish, any remaining fruit fades fast leaving mild oak notes and heat.

title: Bodegas Riojanas 2014 Monte Real Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Candied berry and raisin aromas are just fresh and focused enough. A jammy, tannic palate is rather flat, while this tastes of pasty, oaky red berry fruits. A touch of heat and medicinality are noted on the finish.

title: Enate 2012 Cabernet-Cabernet Cabernet Sauvignon (Somontano)
description: Ripe black fruit aromas are clouded by oak-based scents of graphite, milk chocolate and resiny spice. On the palate, this warm-vintage Cabernet Sauvignon is flush and pulpy, but inexact. Plum, cassis and spice flavors are slightly raisiny prior to a short finish with heat and overt oak character.

title: Matarromera 2016 Fermentado en Barrica Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Dusty stone fruit aromas are reserved and a bit chunky. On the palate, this barrel-fermented Verdejo is lemony but also resiny in feel. Woody stone fruit and peach pit flavors finish steady but with nothing extra.

title: Niño Jesús 2016 Tinto Figaro Garnacha (Calatayud)
description: Spicy plum and berry aromas are earthy prior to a snappy, slightly shearing palate. Tomato and red fruit flavors hold their energy on a smacking, gritty finish with pop. This Garnacha delivers value and quality. Drink now.

title: Albet I Noya 2012 Reserva Martí Red (Penedès)
