description: Raw oak, pencil eraser, berry and cassis aromas open this blend of 60% Syrah and 40% Cabernet Sauvignon. A flush but tannic palate is rough, while this tastes of herbal berry fruits, spice and oak. A fiery finish with dry tannins is the conclusion.

title: Celler Piñol 2016 Portal White (Terra Alta)
description: Waxy aromas of honeyed apples, petrol and lanolin introduce this blend of Garnacha Blanca, Sauvignon Blanc and Viognier. Its fleshy palate is cut by acidity, recalling tart apple and pineapple.

title: Oro de Castilla 2017 Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Grassy aromas and citrus notes dominate the nose of this Verdejo. It has an oily texture and a plump palate, with salty, lightly green citrus and stone fruit flavors that finish with residual saltiness.

title: Nisia 2017 Old Vines Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Apple and other white fruit aromas are good but generic. This Verdejo is fresh and healthy in feel, with pulpy weight. Leesy flavors of apple and persimmon finish slightly briny.

title: Pallas 2014 Reserve Old Vines Garnacha (Spain)
description: Leather and spiced berry aromas are capped and jammy. In the mouth, this high-alcohol Garnacha feels soft and somewhat flat, not a surprise given its 16.5% declared weight. Chocolaty blackberry flavors also taste of clove and bacon on a syrupy finish.

title: Bodegas Franco-Españolas 2014 RB Rioja Bordón Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Snappy red berry aromas come with notes of tomato, mint and dry spice. A round palate with moderate depth and dry tannins lacks stuffing, while this tastes of herbal red plum, currant, oak spice and tomato prior to a finish that's fresh but raw and grating.

title: El Coto 2013 Coto de Imaz Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Unintegrated oak, gritty road tar and earthy berry aromas form the opening of this problematic reserva. Its acidity is almost off the charts, creating scratchiness and tension on the palate. It's tart and tomatoey in flavor, with a coating of oak and vanilla.

title: Bodegas Palacio 2017 La Poda Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: This delivers orange-scented hand soap aromas. On the palate, its slightly green orange and lime flavors are mildly briny, with punchy yet controlled citric acidity and a light, fresh finish.

title: Campos Reales 2015 Selección Tempranillo (La Mancha)
description: This uncomplicated wine features ripe, jammy black fruit aromas. It's full bodied and fleshy on the palate, with blackberry and black plum flavors and a springy finish filled with chocolate notes.

title: Ego Bodegas 2017 Goru El Blanco White (Jumilla)
description: Floral aromas include whiffs of jasmine and peach blossom, scents you can attribute to the Moscatel in this blend that also includes Chardonnay. In the mouth, this is a touch oily in feel but also acidic. Flowery, tropical flavors of lychee and pineapple finish full and healthy.

title: Larchago 2018  Rioja
description: Dark aromas of plum and berry are boosted by spicy oak. In the mouth, this is tight and pulling, with no cushion to the palate. Dry, woody berry flavors are good but limited, while this tastes spicy, resiny and oaky on a tight, tannic finish.

title: Vicente Gandia 2016 Nebla Old Vine Garnacha (Valencia)
description: Rustic black-fruit and leathery aromas hold it together and don't run roughshod. This Garnacha is a bit choppy and tartaric, but black-fruit aromas are solid and convincing. While this is quick and choppy on the finish, it's also juicy and fresh.

title: Mano A Mano 2015 Vanta La Ossa Syrah (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Berry and cassis aromas are chocolaty and ripe. A saturated palate with rubbery tannins offers roasted plum and black tea flavors that are gamy and spicy. On the finish, this tastes cool and earthy, and overall this grows more wild as you work with it.

title: Montecillo 2018 Rosé (Rioja)
description: Basic aromas of melon, peach and chewing gum set up a straightforward palate. Standard stone fruit and cantaloupe flavors are a touch bitter in front of a short but crisp finish. If you're looking for a fresh and easy wine for simple quaffing, this is it.

title: Abadia Retuerta 2013 Pago Valdebellón Cabernet Sauvignon (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León
description: Heavily herbal spicy leafy aromas are green like cool-climate Cab Franc, and then a massive bolt of oaky char takes over. This Cabernet Sauvignon is hard, drying and tough on the palate. Herbal roasted black-fruit flavors are smothered in burnt oak, while this is blackened but green tasting on the finish. Ripeness of fruit was clearly an issue in this cool vintage.

title: Bodegas Peñafiel 2015 Baron de Filar Roble  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Aromas of jammy berry fruits, licorice gum drop and warm earth are scattershot and precede a palate that's chunky but flat in feel. Buttery oaky berry and raisin flavors are solid but not direct or focused on the finish.

title: Bodegas San Isidro 2015 Rumor Monastrell-Syrah (Jumilla)
description: Spiced plum aromas come with a note of iodine and Band-Aid, nothing that's strange for the Monastrell-Syrah blends of Jumilla. An aggressive palate with fiery potency tastes of salty plum and currant. On the finish, this is high in energy, juicy and bold.

title: Borsao 2015 Macabeo-Chardonnay (Campo de Borja)
description: For a basic Spanish white, this rises above the norm. Lightly candied white-fruit aromas and a medium-bodied palate help this Macabeo (Viura) and Chardonnay blend get going. Flavors of green banana and pithy lime end with tropical overtones and controlled pyrazine-based pepper notes.

title: Palma Real 2015 Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Crisp aromas of celery and lime set up a fresh citrusy palate that's light to medium in both body and weight. Flavors of green-grape skins and lemon-lime finish a bit salty, but with proper acidity and balance.

title: Sierra Cantabria 2018 Rosado (Rioja)
description: Peachy aromas are about all that sticks out on an otherwise clean and neutral nose. A standard palate is chunky, while this tastes peachy and a bit yeasty. A harmless finish is good but bland.

title: Raimat 2013 Castell de Raimat Tempranillo (Costers del Segre)
description: Floral black-fruit aromas share space on the nose with olive and rubber notes. This Tempranillo feels rubbery and a touch collapsed, however its baked plum and jammy berry flavors are pleasing. Drink this easygoing wine now.

title: Bodegas Perica 2015 Olsgosa Viura (Rioja)
description: Warm dusty oaky aromas come prior to a citric palate that's high in acidity and thus austere. Salty citrus flavors are monotone and fail to alter path on a salty woody finish.

title: Viña Palaciega 2013 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Leafy, earthy aromas of mild berry fruits and smoked meat lead to a crisp palate with drawing tannins. Following suit, stalky red-berry flavors dry up quickly on a tough finish. The 2013 Rioja vintage was notoriously cool and difficult, and this Reserva reflects that.

title: Latitud 42 2017 Viura (Rioja)
description: A tan tint and aromas of spiced apple and oak announce a barrel-aged Viura that's simple on the palate. Tangerine, mandarin and mild oak flavors are lifted by citric acidity on the finish. Drink immediately; this isn't built for the long run.

title: Bodegas Alejandro Fernandez 2008 Tinto Pesquera Millenium Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)
description: This aged Reserva from one of Ribera's seminal names is reflective of the vintage, which was cold, rainy and difficult. This smells of mulchy blackberry, coffee and wood smoke. The palate feels clipped and impermeable, while barely ripe flavors of blackened berry fruits are aided by chocolaty oak and tea notes. While this is full in body and dark in flavors, a lot is missing for something of this price.

title: Carlos Serres 2018 White (Rioja)
description: Generic white-fruit aromas are clean in front of a citrusy palate, with some body to it. Briny citrus and stone-fruit flavors are, as you might expect, mild, short and fresh on the finish. This is 85% Viura and 15% Tempranillo Blanco.

title: Spartico 2016 Organic Tempranillo-Cabernet Sauvignon (Utiel-Requena)
description: Granulated berry and plum aromas are slightly reduced and come with an animal note on this Tempranillo and Cabernet Sauvignon blend. A flush, weighty palate is well balanced, while flavors of dark plum and cassis finish tannic and a bit rubbery.

title: Viña Cerrada 2016 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Early aromas of intrigue include cinnamon, lavender, wet cement and clay, which give way to spiced cherry once this crianza airs out. A racy palate with bright acidity offers basic berry, plum and spice flavors. On the finish, this is drying and steady.

title: Kirkland Signature 2014 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Cherry and spice aromas are calm and clean on the nose. Next in line is a smacking, lean palate that plays up a steady plum flavor. As value-priced Rioja goes, this is quite good.

title: Casar de Burbia 2016 Casar Fermentado en Barrica Godello (Bierzo)
description: A tan color and woody aromas of vanilla and oak grain open this lightly oxidized barrel-fermented Godello that's fleshy, plump and resiny in feel. Oaky, oxidized flavors of vanilla and peach persist on a full and grabby finish.

title: Chan de Rosas 2017 Clásico Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Mild aromas of dusty apple are steady but not expressive. On the palate, this mature Albariño feels round and cidery. Briny stone fruit flavors hold firm on the finish. This is at (or slightly past) its peak in terms of freshness.

title: Bodegas Nekeas 2018 Vega Sindoa Chardonnay (Navarra)
description: Briny white fruit aromas are coated in obvious oak, while a creamy palate with tropical overtones offers oaky melon and papaya flavors backed by vanilla, resin and heat on the finish.

title: Obalo 2014 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Grapy aromas of plum and berry are round but inexact. On the palate, this is full-out jagged and rubbing, with rock-hard tannins driving the mouthfeel. Generic berry and spice flavors are good, but this lacks finesse on the finish.

title: Altos de Torona 2018 Torre de Ermelo Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Yeasty, slightly grassy aromas include citrus scents that are high in pyrazines. A fleshy yet citric palate offers uncommon (for Rías Baixas) passion fruit and nectarine flavors that lean towards tropical on the finish.

title: Carlos Serres 2015 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Rubbery berry aromas are earthy and on the lean side. In the mouth, this crianza is firm, with almost no give. Cherry flavors show a hint of raisiny overripeness, while this is solid on a basic finish.

title: Altos De Rioja 2016 Altos R Pigeage Blanco Viura (Rioja)
description: Oak is the sole standout aroma on this barrel-fermented Viura. A plump, resiny palate shows the weight of oak aging, while this tastes woody more than fruity. A healthy-feeling finish with mild acidic pop tastes mostly of oak.

title: Nexus 2014  Ribera del Duero
description: Earthy notes of iron and brick dust blend with horsey, leathery berry notes in front of a smacking medium-bodied palate that's choppy and drawing. Flavors of salt and chicken fat are oak based, while this also offers basic berry fruit notes. On the finish, this is comfortable but doesn't offer much textural complexity, body or length.

title: Valderiz 2016 Valdehermoso Joven  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Berry fruit, road tar and a touch of chocolate are the aromas that get this young Ribera Tempranillo going in a good direction. Slightly raw tannins roughen the palate, while this tastes of savory and saucy black plum. Notes of soy sauce and black-olive tapenade lend credibility to the finish.

title: Dominio de Punctum 2017 Lobetia Organic Vineyards Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Candied plum and berry aromas are friendly and inviting. A round, pulpy palate is in balance, while this Tempranillo tastes of plum and raspberry, with a distant hint of dark berry fruit.

title: Luis Cañas 2017 White (Rioja)
description: This is a barrel-fermented Viura and thus the nose smells distinctly woody and resiny. Cleansing acidity lends clarity to an otherwise resiny palate, while this tastes of raw oak grain, white pepper and white peach prior to an oaky finish.

title: Don Olegario 2017 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: White fruit aromas come across fine but basic and generic. A mouthfeel dictated by stone fruit and citric acid yields limited nectarine flavors. That same monotone nectarine flavor carries over to the finish.

title: Pazo De Villarei 2018 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Mild citrus and melon aromas come with a note of lees-based vanilla. A plump pulpy palate is a bit low on acidity and energy, while this tastes melony and peachy prior to a chunky finish.

title: Marqués de Cáceres 2018 Excellens Viura (Rioja)
description: A translucent color is backed by simple but clean aromas of wet stones and lime. In the mouth, this Viura is citrusy and fresh. Flavors of tangerine, scallion and green herbs fade on a light easy finish.

title: Fernández Gómez 2014 Garnacha  (Rioja)
description: Medicinal aromas of berry fruits and latex are woody and floral. Flavors of plum and currant are more raw than lush, while this tastes of tomato and feels crisp on the finish.

title: Grandes Vinos y Viñedos 2014 Monasterio de las Viñas Reserva Red (Cariñena)
description: Gently spiced plum and currant aromas come with a sprinkle of dusty earth. This blend of Garnacha, Tempranillo and Carignan feels tight and juicy, with acidity driving the palate. Lightly salty flavors of red plum and currant are fiery and come with an accent of oregano prior to a lean finish.

title: Duquesa de la Victoria 2017  Rioja
description: Plum, cherry and berry aromas are standard but clean and fresh. Following the nose, this everyday Tempranillo from the Valdelana family feels spunky and bouncy, with rubbery tannins. Generic plum and berry flavors finish snappy and bright.

title: Las Colinas Del Ebro 2015 Syrah-Grenache (Terra Alta)
description: This blend of Syrah and Garnacha feels blocky and rubbery. Floral raspberry and blueberry aromas come with baking spice notes, particularly cinnamon. Ripe raspberry flavors finish with a dash of chocolate and a touch of salt.

title: Montebuena 2016 Cuvée KPF Estate Bottled  (Rioja)
description: Earthy plum, cherry and raspberry aromas comprise a level nose with a hint of green. On the palate, this is smacking but full, with wiry acidity. Plum and berry flavors finish well but short, without much follow-through.

title: Beronia 2015 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Raspberry and cherry aromas are common for Rioja crianza. A choppy palate with lemony acidity is shy on body, while this tastes of red plum, currant and a touch of buttery oak. Hollowness is a factor on a finish with mild heat and grape skin tannins.

title: Marqués de Cáceres 2018 Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Apple and hays aromas show decent concentration. This Verdejo is plump on the palate and tastes of salty tropical and citrus fruits. Briny notes infiltrate a healthy finish. Drink now.

title: Marqués del Atrio 2016 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Candied milk chocolate aromas ride high on the nose of this jammy but friendly Rioja. A chocolaty palate is full and creamy, while soft, slightly gummy berry flavors finish ripe and fruity.

title: Proelio 2016 Vintage  (Rioja)
description: Oaky aromas of clove and wood spice are forceful. A full loud tartaric palate is the opposite of shy, while this tastes largely of clove and spices, with berry fruit as the canvas. This is hard, rubbery and demanding on the finish, but also generous with its power and flavors.

title: Finca Albret 2015 El Balcón Crianza Red (Navarra)
description: Off the bat this strikes with minty aromas and side notes of green herbs. This is a blend of Tempranillo, Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon, and it's drawing, tannic and tight on the palate. Cool herbal notes of juniper and mint are branded into berry fruit flavors prior to a tough finish.

title: Finca Nueva 2018 Rosado.18 Rosado (Rioja)
description: A lightly fruity nose smells a touch cheesy, while this blend of Tempranillo and Garnacha feels puckery at first, then more hollow. Mellow stone fruit flavors blend with mild citrus notes to comprise a basic but satisfying rosé.

title: Viña Bujanda 2014 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Raspberry, toast, spice and herbal aromas are pure Rioja. This is crisp and tight as a drum. Raisiny fruit flavors are offset by hard acidity, while this is spicy across a bumpy finish.

title: Egeo 2018 Verdejo (Rueda)
description: The nose leads with green aromas of grass and herbs. This feels solid, with an acidic rip providing zest and energy. White-peach, passion fruit, green-banana and arugula flavors dissipate on a basic finish.

title: Quasar 2014 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: This Crianza has leathery aromas, a tannic mouthfeel and roasted, spicy red berry flavors. It's dry, oaky and not particularly ripe.

title: Gancedo 2009 Xestal Mencía (Bierzo)
description: The 2009 vintage was a hot one, so this wine's stewy, overripe aromas and deep, advanced color aren't shocking. In the mouth, it's generous with raisiny, ripe berry fruit, feeling undeniably heavy.

title: Vinessens 2018 Tragolargo Monastrell (Alicante)
description: Bold berry aromas are reduced and show notes of olive and latex. On the palate, this is full and tannic, with rubbery tension. Dark-plum flavors dominate this fruity, one-dimensional Monastrell.

title: Nisia 2015 Las Suertas Old Vines Verdejo (Rueda)
description: This oak-aged Verdejo is yellow in color, with aromas of mustard and apple cider. In the mouth, this is weighty and a bit candied despite offering acidic cut. Outright sweet flavors of peach and melon finish mustardy like the nose, with oaky, resiny notes.

title: Sancho Barón 2014  Rioja
description: This wine's gritty black fruit aromas bring road tar to mind. Its full mouthfeel is cut by acidity, keeping it from feeling soupy. Its tart, spicy plum and currant flavors finish with overt oak, punchy acidity and heat.

title: Emilio Moro 2016 La Felisa  (Ribera del Duero)
description: A black color and clubbing aromas of charred oak, reduction and milk chocolate are jumbled and require a lot of airing to fall in line. A thick and sticky palate feels gooey, while this tastes of creamy lactic oak and chocolate. There's nothing elegant or finessed about this heavily oaked Tinto Fino.

title: Palma Real 2018 Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Fresh minerally aromas of white fruits and green cactus open this crisp light-bodied Verdejo. Lime and tropical-fruit flavors are simple but good, while this is steady and clean on the finish.

title: Perinet 2015 Red (Priorat)
description: Reduced raisiny aromas announce a big wine that stresses ripeness over freshness. An expected, the heavy palate is tannic and on the brink of collapse, while this tastes as it smells: raisin, prune, mocha, etc.

title: Proelio 2016 Tenue Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Roasted berry aromas are muted and smothered by heavy, savory oak and clove scents. A sappy, grabby palate is big boned and roughened by acidity and raw tannins. Black-fruit flavors are charred, while this tastes savory and herbaceous on the finish.

title: Bodegas Leza García 2015 LG  (Rioja)
description: Warm, almost furry berry aromas set up a narrow palate with plum-like acidity. Berry flavors are desiccated but pushed by bold acidity, while this holds form on a finish made more aggressive by aforementioned high acidity.

title: Bodegas Landaluce 2015 Fincas de Landaluce Reserve  (Rioja)
description: Earthy plum and berry aromas smell a bit damp as well as like asphalt. A bumpy, edgy palate is dried out by rubbery tannins, while blackberry, cassis and grapy flavors are generic through the finish.

title: Hiruzta 2017 Berezia Hondarrabi Zuri (Getariako Txakolina)
description: Briny citrus and cactus aromas speak loudly in front of a still palate with no spritz. This is table wine Txakoli, not the zesty effervescent stuff; and it's a bit stalky in flavor, with mild citrus notes. On the finish, skins-driven bitterness holds this back.

title: El Coto 2016 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Plum and berry aromas are a bit rubbery in front of a smacking palate that's tight and racy. Red plum, currant and tomato flavors finish tight, with nothing loose or gangly. This crianza plays up the fresh, no-frills side of Riojano Tempranillo.

title: Faustino Rivero Ulecia 2018 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Apple, melon and sea brine aromas are typical of Albariño from Galicia. A plump palate is a bit low on kick and acidity. Dry melon and white fruit flavors are simple, while this tastes a bit yeasty on an easygoing finish. Drink now.

title: Marqués de la Concordia 2013 MM Reserva de la Familia Brut Nature Sparkling (Cava)
designation: MM Reserva de la Familia Brut Nature
description: Dusty apple aromas are yeasty and come with a notable vanilla scent. Flatness is an issue on the palate, which is low on fizz and kick. Bready white-fruit flavors finish yeasty and dry, with a hint of white pepper.

title: Mas Igneus 2017 Renéixer White (Priorat)
description: A slight pink color comes from the fact that while this is mostly Garnacha Blanca, there is Merlot and Garnacha Tinta in the blend. Aromas of peach pit and melon lead to a full palate that hits with acidity before turning creamy. Grape-skin contact during fermentation not only lends color but has given this textural grab and mild bitterness on the finish.

title: Altos de Valdoso 2017 Roble  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Dark-berry aromas are extracted and grapey but easy to process. On the palate, this feels fully extracted, with rough tannins and a hint of vinegar. Grapey blackberry and dark-plum flavors are short in front of a tannic finish.

title: Castellroig 2017 Finca Sabaté i Coca Corpinnat Reserva Brut Sparkling (Spain)
designation: Finca Sabaté i Coca Corpinnat Reserva Brut
description: Slightly stalky aromas include a note of papaya. Moderate acidity controls a standard palate, while this tastes of lime and green banana. A texturally sound finish is the final act of this common brut sparkling wine.

title: Alidis 2017 Tinto 6 Meses en Barrica  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Slightly volatile berry and plum aromas settle without too much salad dressing character. A dense, jammy palate is on the fat side, while this tastes of black fruits, chocolate and herbs prior to a grating finish with some heat.

title: Emina 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Rueda)
description: Round, chunky aromas of grapefruit and passion fruit settle on friendly and varietally correct. This is snappy and solid in feel, with lime, orange and nectarine flavors. An acid-driven finish holds the line and doesn't taste bitter or green.

title: Altavins 2015 Almodí Petit White (Terra Alta)
description: Stony fresh aromas of lime and grapefruit are light and clean. This blend of Garnacha Blanca, Chardonnay and Sauvignon Blanc is steady on the palate. Flavors of dry lime and wet stones are slightly pithy, while this finishes firm and dry.

title: Beronia 2018 Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Peach and tropical fruit aromas set up a round palate that's in balance. Apple, fennel and cilantro flavors wrap up quickly and cleanly on a simple but solid finish.

title: Loriñon 2014 White (Rioja)
description: Initial briny citrus aromas give way to white grapefruit scents. Like the nose, this feels bracing and citric. Tangy flavors of lime and tangerine finish short but with tingling acidity.

title: Marqués de la Concordia 2016 Lagunilla Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Floral berry aromas are candied and leafy, with a sweetness akin to apple juice. A stretched palate is raw, rubbery and tough, while classic Rioja flavors of red fruits, tomatoes, herbs and oak finish with a reprise of raw tannins.

title: Muga 2017 Flor De Muga Rosé (Rioja)
description: Aromas of citrus, peach and chlorine are only moderately inspiring. An intense palate is kind of blocky and lacking in the smooth flow and balance rosé requires to be at the top level, while snappy citrus flavors give way to light oxidation on the finish.

title: Naia 2018 Las Brisas White (Rueda)
description: Fresh stone fruit and citrus aromas set up a plump, fleshy palate with spritzy flash. Tropical fruit, melon and mango flavors finish with pulpy weight and good length.

title: Obalo 2018  Rioja
description: Generic plum and berry aromas are spicy and tight. Similarly, the palate on this Tempranillo feels tight, hard and snappy. Flavors of black fruits, rubber and oak spice conclude on a dry, edgy finish.

title: Príncipe de Viana 2014 Reserva Tempranillo (Navarra)
description: A wiry nose is herbal and raises questions about ripeness. In the mouth, this is tight and choppy, with aggressive tannins. Herbal plum and wild berry flavors finish spicy and tannic, with a final hint of green. In the end, this isn't underripe, but it certainly shows the typicity of Navarra, which can lean toward green.

title: Viñas del Vero 2017 La Miranda Secastilla Garnacha Blanca (Somontano)
description: A dry, lightly spiced nose with vanilla, dust and waxy white fruit notes leads to a full palate with citrusy acidity. Short, basic flavors of white grapefruit and citrus hang in for a while on the finish. A good pairing with seafood.

title: Raimat 2015 Castell de Raimat Albariño (Costers del Segre)
description: A yellow color and yeasty aromas announce a mature wine that's still holding onto a flowery essence. A plump body is balanced by citric acidity, while this tastes of tangerine and sea brine. A citric finish is lively, but this wine needs to be drunk soon.

title: El Coto 2018 875m Finca Carbonera Fermentado en Barrica Chardonnay (Rioja)
description: Aromas of white fruits and grainy oak come with a briny note of sea shell. This Chardonnay is light in body and tastes of oak and briny stone fruits. A steady finish of medium length is the conclusion.

title: José Pariente 2017 Fermentado En Barrica Verdejo (Rueda)
description: A flat nose offers oak and subdued green-fruit aromas. In the mouth, this barrel-fermented Verdejo is full and resiny. Overt oak flavors are matched by green-fruit notes, while this is steady and lightly green tasting on the finish.

title: Legado del Moncayo 2016 Vendimia Seleccionada Montaña Garnacha (Campo de Borja)
description: Foxy berry aromas suggest cassis along with animal notes. This Garnacha feels full but a bit lazy and flat. Blueberry and herbal notes are roasted and taste of barbecue smoke, while this is short on complexity on the finish.

title: Marqués de Riscal 2015 Próximo  (Rioja)
description: Flat aromas of raisin and prune are dense but lack intensity. Matching the nose, this warm-vintage wine feels thick and a touch soupy. Plum, raisin and cassis flavors finish with hints of spice and cooked cherry and berry fruits.

title: El Regajal 2016 Las Retamas Red (Vinos de Madrid)
description: Plum and minty green notes lead to a full palate made jagged and rugged by hard, grinding tannins. This Tempranillo blend from the Madrid region tastes of blackberry, dark plum and oak-related spices and chocolate. A smacking, edgy finish is generous but rough.

title: Vicente Gandia 2016 El Miracle by Mariscal Garnacha Tintorera (Valencia)
description: Honest plum and berry aromas include a note of spicy oak. A fresh palate with tomatoey acidity frames savory berry flavors that are slightly raisiny, while a finish with vanilla and raisin flavors battles to show conviction and purity.

title: Bodegas Murviedro 2013 Cepas Viejas Bobal (Utiel-Requena)
description: Berry and earth aromas open with a touch of horseradish that blows off with time. This Bobal is drawing and dry on the palate, with fresh acidity. Savory berry and tomato flavors finish with scratchy tannins.

title: Parés Baltà 2014 Electio Xarel-lo (Penedès)
description: This wine's yellow color is offputting. It smells more of haystack, compost and rubber than fruit and tastes like butter and dried apricots. It seems oxidized on the finish.

title: Maior de Mendoza 2017 Fulget Cuvée Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: This wine's melony aromas come with a dried cheese note. It's soft in texture, with citrus and nectarine flavors that finish melony and sweet, with low intensity and little focus.

title: Vins El Cep 2016 Kila Sparkling (Cava)
description: Yeasty, bready aromas include a not-shy note of scrambled eggs. A pulpy palate is balanced but doesn't stir much interest. Stone fruit and mild citrus flavors are highly basic.

title: Guerra 2014 De Pura Cepa Roble Mencía (Bierzo)
description: Generic cherry, berry and spice aromas make for a solid nose. This Mencía is fleshy but lacking in depth and intensity. Plum, currant and cherry flavors are diluted on the finish.

title: Brumita 2017 Monastrell (Jumilla)
description: Gamy berry and wild brush aromas include a hint of cowhide and animal. On the palate, this Monastrell is chewy, with gummy tannins. Ripe black cherry flavors are sweet and chocolaty, while this is full, pulpy and minty tasting on the finish.

title: El Coto 2018 Blanco Verdejo (Rioja)
description: Aromas of citrus, tropical fruits and pyrazines set up a basic palate with freshness but little to no depth. Grassy lemon-lime flavors are limited but finish clean.

title: Viñedos de Alfaro 2018 Real Agrado Viura (Rioja)
description: A light color and stony aromas of minerals and green citrus foretell a light, fresh and balanced palate. Briny green melon and underripe peach flavors finish clean and minerally, but that's as far as this standard Viura goes.

title: Finca el Lince 2016 Monastrell (Jumilla)
description: Grainy wood aromas dominate the nose on this Monastrell. On the palate, this feels resiny and tannic. A flavor profile based mostly on oak offers nonspecific black fruit at the base, while this continues to push a woody character on a drying finish. Tasted twice with varied results; this note attempts to meld those two tastings.

title: Bodegas Eguren 2015 Condado de Eguren Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: This wine's berry aromas carry a faint hint of animal hide. The palate is raw with acidity yet saturated with roasted berry flavors and minty, oaky notes. Those wood suggestions linger on the edgy finish.

title: Beronia 2014 Tempranillo  (Rioja)
description: This wine's earthy plum and vanilla aromas are cheesy and rough. It's round on the palate, with spiced plum, herb and oak-based vanilla flavors that flatten out on the finish, showing mild oxidation.

title: Beronia 2013 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: This wine's tea and spiced plum aromas come with a hint of orange peel. It tastes of reedy raspberries and currants on the narrow palate. Moderate oak spice is detectable on the lean finish.

title: Aragus 2015 Old Vines Garnacha (Campo de Borja)
description: This wine's cherry candy and rubber aromas lead to a palate that's bouyant and lively but unsettled. Its plum and currant flavors are lean and edgy, framed by rubbery grape skin tannins and slight oxidation.

title: Finca El Encinal 2014 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: This wine's berry and cherry cola aromas seem candied and medicinal. On the palate, it's tight with rugged tannins. Its spiced plum and tobacco flavors have a burnt character while the finish is marked by tannic dryness.

title: Coto de Hayas 2018 Garnacha Rosado (Campo de Borja)
description: Inoffensive aromas of red apple skin and chewing gum are low on fruit but clean. A juicy palate is also clean and presentable, while this value-priced Garnacha rosé tastes of generic stone fruit and citrus prior to a finish with a tiny bit of early-onset oxidation.

title: Naveran 2015 Perles d'Or Brut Xarel-lo (Cava)
description: Made entirely from the Xarello grape, this brut smells is mildly funky on the nose. A solid palate holds briny peach and bready flavors, while this is steady on the moderately complex finish.

title: Inurrieta 2010 Altos de Inurrieta Reserva Merlot-Cabernet Sauvignon (Navarra)
description: This blend of Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon has a resiny aroma ont the nose. The palate boasts lemony acidity, with vanilla, tobacco and currant flavors, while the finish is choppy and tangy.

title: Marqués de Valparaíso 2016 Roble  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Green, grassy aromas announce a wine with ripeness issues. In the mouth, this feels raw and tannic, with hard-pumping acidity. Oaky, chocolaty flavors accent plum and berry fruit, while this feels and tastes riper on the finish than it does early on.

title: Enate 2016 234 Chardonnay (Somontano)
description: This mild, plump and basic Chardonnay leads with peach blossom, yeast and cured ham scents. Its melon, peach and apricot flavors hollow out on a mild, yeasty tasting finish.

title: Finca Allende 2014 White (Rioja)
description: With a tan color and murky aromas of rubber and stale fruits, this aging Viura (with 5% Malvasia) appears past its prime. High citric acidity lends zest to a palate that's losing clarity. Sour briny woody flavors are mostly salty and low on fruit. On the finish, this displays a pickled note of sauerkraut along with dry almond skins.

title: Xiloca 2016 Garnacha (Calatayud)
description: Furry plum and berry aromas are good but fragmented. Racy acidity creates tension and some rawness on the palate, while this wine tastes of tart black plum and black currant. Latent acidity on the finish results in strained freshness.

title: Viña Otano 2016 Blanco Fermentado en Barrica White (Rioja)
description: Dusty aromas of white fruits are equaled by barrel-based vanilla scents. A round, easy palate gives off a powdery sense, while this barrel-fermented Viura-Tempranillo blend tastes yeasty and of green banana. Latent acidity on the finish creates mild sourness.

title: Clos Pons 2015 Jan Petit Red (Costers del Segre)
description: Cherry and raspberry aromas are also stalky and gamy, a likely reflection of the 75% Syrah in this blend with Garnacha. A hard, grabby palate holds flavors of herbal plum and grape skins, while an obtuse finish tastes a little green.

title: José Pariente 2018 Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Prickly, spicy aromas of cactus and pyrazines share space on the nose with melon and citrus notes. This feels round and a bit chunky, with little for the midpalate. Grass and grapefruit flavors flatten out on the finish of this good but inconsequential Rueda white.

title: Borsao 2016 Garnacha (Campo de Borja)
description: Both on the nose and palate, this Garnacha is mildly angular and pinching, with a sense of rawness brought on by hard tannins. Its foxy plum flavors are jumpy and nervy, finishing peppery and jagged.

title: Siglo 2009 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: A stalky smoky nose with brambly currant, burnt wood and sea-shell aromas signals that this isn't all aces. A gravelly palate holds baked berry, bacon and smoked flavors prior to a dry, spicy finish with heat. This offers a good lesson in the disparity of quality among Rioja Gran Reservas.

title: El Coto 2015 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Leafy red-plum and currant aromas are jammy and racy, as is a saucy palate that's rough and bumpy. Bold cherry and plum flavors are wild and gamy, while this feels flush and drying on a full-fruit finish.

title: Sierra Cantabria 2016 Selección  (Rioja)
description: Punchy red-fruit aromas are lightly concentrated and floral. In the mouth, this is smacking and superficially hard. Generic berry and cherry flavors finish rough and tough, with jagged edges.

title: Marqués de Cáceres 2016 Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Oily aromas of orange peel are lively but imprecise. This Verdejo ranks as fruity but simple, with plumpness and citric acidity. Briny citrus flavors give off a sense of grape skins that extend onto the finish.

title: Loriñon 2013 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Earthy berry aromas are a bit stalky and flat. This crianza is firm and choppy, but also stewed on the palate. Spicy plum and olive flavors are ordinary if not a touch underripe.

title: Filón 2015 Garnacha (Calatayud)
description: Berry aromas come with a modest green note. This feels grabby, rubbery and tannic. Baked black-fruit flavors are herbal and minty, while an oak-driven flavor of bacon provides a smoky meaty cover. This feels blocky and a touch hot on the finish.

title: Príncipe de Viana 2016 Roble Graciano (Navarra)
description: Raw reedy red-fruit aromas are scratchy and herbal. Given that, it's not a surprise that this Graciano is clampy on the palate. A mix of sweet and savory flavors includes red currant, pomegranate and tomato, while this is linear and doesn't generate much excitement on the finish.

title: Pere Ventura 2012 Gran Reserva Brut Sparkling (Cava)
description: Apple-juice and pear aromas lead to a mostly flat palate that's plump but shapeless. Stale apple and stone-fruit flavors lack vitality and taste sweet, while this brut finishes wheaty and oxidized.

title: Castillo de Monséran 2016 Garnacha (Cariñena)
description: Raw choppy aromas of berry fruits are lean and rough-edged. This Garnacha feels racy and fresh, but light on structure. Plum and berry flavors are short and lack stuffing, while this is juicy and popping on the finish.

title: Casa del Valle 2014 Orquestal Reserva Tempranillo (La Mancha)
description: Fiery aromas are herbal and suggestive of lavender. A pinched narrow palate holds briary flavors of herbal raspberry and blueberry. Tannic rub creates friction on a finish with herbal green notes.

title: Alta Alella 2016 Privat Bruant Organic Brut Nature Sparkling (Cava)
description: Bready yeasty lightly oxidized aromas are surprising for brut nature, normally the most crisp style of Cava out there. For what should be a leaner-style wine, this is foamy and obtuse. Nutty flavors of almond skins and yeasty stone fruits finish with additional oxidized notes on top of white-fruit flavors. This is varietal Xarel-lo.

title: Godelia 2016 Pilgram Godello (Bierzo)
description: Stalky aromas lack freshness and lean towards briny. A tight citrusy palate is more positive, while this offers slightly stale flavors of dried apricot and mango in front of a chalky finish.

title: Bodegas Eidosela 2018 Ethereo Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Briny white-fruit aromas suggest wheat and straw more than bright clean fruit. A chunky palate is low on lift but not outright flat, while this tastes yeasty, with apple and green-banana notes. A hint of bitterness appears on the finish.

title: Mas de Subirà 2016 Vi de Guarda Red (Priorat)
description: A shortage of fruit and an excess of oaky clove aromas don't make the nose on this all that convincing. A heavy, grating palate deals flavors of raspberry, mint and clove. Unabsorbed oak and dry tannins create a blocky finish with no finesse.

title: Viña Mocen 2016 Fermentado en Barrica Verdejo (Rueda)
description: A golden color and creamy aromas of vanilla and wood grain are what you'd expect from a barrel-fermented Verdejo. A citric palate is not too thick or resiny, while this tastes of orange, tangerine and oak. A juicy finish benefits from cutting acidity.

title: Eduardo Garrido García 2014 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: A jammy nose falls a bit flat and stewed. In the mouth, this is not just dry but it's drying due to starching tannins. Prune and plum skin flavors finish very dry, much like the palate feel.

title: Otazu 2016 Pago de Otazu Chardonnay con Crianza Chardonnay (Pago de Otazu)
designation: Pago de Otazu Chardonnay con Crianza
description: Buttery oak aromas ride heavily atop baked apple scents on a fat, lush nose. This barrel-aged Chardonnay from Navarra is plump, round and resiny in feel, with just enough acidity to provide balance. Creamy, buttery white fruit flavors pour on the oak, making this “woody” through and through.

title: Naia 2018 Verdejo (Rueda)
description: While this plays up pyrazines more than bright fruit on the nose, it isn't feline or overly green smelling. A full, slightly heavy palate holds ripe but inexact flavors of pineapple and peach. Fleshy on the finish. Drink now.

title: Bodegas Riojanas 2015 Puerta Vieja Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Up-front creamy oak leads to aromas of root beer along with dusty berry fruits. This Crianza has a heavy pounding palate with protruding tannins. Herbal blueberry and plum flavors are fully oaked and thus taste forced, pushy and candied through the finish.

title: Protos 2016 P Verdejo (Rueda)
description: A mix of yeasty lemon- and orange-peel aromas are just inviting enough. This Verdejo has a plump but basic mouthfeel along with slightly bitter flavors of citrus skins and salt. A briny green-leaning finish suggests a wine that's beginning to fade.

title: Príncipe de Viana 2017 Edición Rosa Rosé (Navarra)
description: Punchy aromas of citrus, spice and tomato paste are fresh, leading to a tight palate with bold acidity. Despite that, there's a lightly oxidized component to salty flavors of tomato sauce and apple skins.

title: Palacio De Canedo 2016 Made With Organic Grapes Godello (Bierzo)
description: Apple, peach and butterscotch aromas are not distinct. A palate comprised mostly of acid has a skins-like texture, while this tastes slightly pickled, with citrus and pineapple notes. On the finish, this Godello is briny and cidery, with a touch of bitterness.

title: Campo Viejo 2016  Rioja
description: Dry, spicy plum and cherry aromas are typical of good basic Rioja. This is medium in body, with somewhat rough tannins and spanking acidity. Plum and berry flavors are common, and it's racy on the finish.

title: Aljibes 2015 Red (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: A nose that's top-heavy with oak and menthol aromas includes hefty black-fruit scents and a touch of green. This is Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Cabernet Franc, and it's densely centered and heavy on the palate, with no elegance to speak of. Compact oaky flavors of blackberry and cola finish with grinding tannins and residual grit.

title: Estefania 2014 Tilenus Mencía (Bierzo)
description: Roasted, rubbery blueberry and mint aromas are herbal and lightly green. This feels clampy, with hard tannins. Highly herbal and gamy flavors of berry fruits are minty at the core, while this is soupy with sucking residual tannins on the finish.

title: Chopo 2016 Monastrell-Syrah (Jumilla)
description: Ripe berry and cassis aromas feature more than enough charred wood and licorice scents. A palate with raw tannins is tough to penetrate. Flavors of burnt oak, clove, chocolate and stewed berry fruits finish similarly but drier. This is 70% Monastrell and 30% Syrah.

title: Viñedos de Alfaro 2018 Real Agrado Garnacha Rosé (Rioja)
description: Hints of plum and raspberry are found on a nose that smells like candy or chewing gum. This rosé is solid but basic in feel. Mild fruit flavors are generic but friendly, while this is clean yet vapid on the finish.

title: Faustino Rivero Ulecia 2011 Reserva Tempranillo-Garnacha  (Rioja)
description: Rusty and translucent in the glass, this has roasted, underripe berry and road tar aromas and a raw palate. Its burnt plum flavors are underdeveloped, finishing peppery and low on fruit.

title: Cofama 2018 Ressò Garnacha Blanca (Catalunya)
description: Tropical fruit and apple aromas come with a whiff of lanolin. On the palate, this is plump and a touch flat, but not too soft. Melon and papaya flavors are fairly standard, as is a mild finish.

title: Casa Primicia 2017 Rosado (Rioja)
description: Pinched, slightly sharp citrus and stone fruit aromas carry the nose. Pithy flavors of nectarine and orange fade away with mild bitterness and hints of oxidation on the finish.

title: Raimat 2017 Saira Albariño (Costers del Segre)
description: Aromas of yeasty citrus, fresh corn and lanolin announce a softer, warmer-climate Albariño than what most fans of the grape are used to. A solid but bland palate lacks lift and snap but isn't flabby. Peachy yeasty flavors are limited through the finish but never problematic.

title: Otazu 2010 Señorío de Otazu Cabernet Sauvignon (Pago de Otazu)
description: Berry and plum aromas are herbal and include cheesy oak notes. On the palate, this Cabernet Sauvignon from Navarra is high in acidity and choppy in feel. Modest flavors of berry fruits are lessened by dry tannins and fiery heat on the finish.

title: Manzanos 2018 Siglo  (Rioja)
description: Sharp aromas of pine and red fruits lead the palate with fresh acidity as well as oxidative notes. Cherry and berry flavors rank as standard, while crisp and smacking acidity offsets mild oxidation on the finish.

title: Esperanza 2016 Estate Grown and Bottled White (Rueda)
description: Lemon and tangerine aromas are slightly dusty. In the mouth, this Viura-Verdejo combo is lively and bouncy. Pithy citrus, almond-skin and apple flavors finish juicy.

title: Vicente Gandia 2014 Bo Bobal Único Bobal (Utiel-Requena)
description: Plump earthy berry and plum aromas are fruity and generally good. This Bobal has a grapy reduced mouthfeel that revolves around rubbery tannins. Black-fruit flavors come with chocolaty notes, while this is fleshy and tannic on the finish.

title: Really Awesome Wine 2018 Raw Organic & Vegan Villanueva de Alcardete Verdejo-Airén-Sauvignon Blanc White (Spain)
designation: Raw Organic & Vegan Villanueva de Alcardete Verdejo-Airén-Sauvignon Blanc
description: Lime and mild pear aromas are limited but direct and clean. This blend of three acid-driven white grapes feels citric and sort of raw. Lime, green melon and citrus flavors finish fresh and lean.

title: Príncipe de Viana 2018 Fermentado en Barrica Chardonnay (Navarra)
description: Lime and tangerine aromas are zesty and pointy. Matching the nose, this feels citrusy and medium in body. Quick-hitting but clean flavors of citrus fruits and nectarine finish mellow and mild. This may have been fermented in barrel, but there's no oak character to speak of.

title: Vicente Gandia 2018 Hoya de Cadenas Single Estate Bobal Rosé (Utiel-Requena)
designation: Hoya de Cadenas Single Estate Bobal
description: A dark salmon color and earthy aromas of red apple and red currant open this rosé made in a warm area of Spain from the Bobal grape. Plum and nectarine flavors are yeasty and briny more than crisp and fresh, while a short finish is plump but low on flavor.

title: Arínzano 2016 Gran Vino Chardonnay (Pago de Arínzano)
description: A brownish-gold color and oxidized aromas suggest a wine that's both tired but also potentially complex and unusual. A plump palate is unfortunately mostly dull in feel, while this Chardonnay tastes of oak, dried white fruits and oxidation.

title: La Purísima 2018 Monastrell (Yecla)
description: Raspberry aromas are yeasty and almost tropical at first, then more authentic after airing. A high-acid palate has a skins-like feel and hard tannins, while the flavors are centered on plum and red-berry fruit. Mild spice notes help out the finish on this value-level Monastrell.

title: Finca Jakue 2017 Rosé (Getariako Txakolina)
description: Mild dusty aromas lack kick. This has a lemony mouthfeel and flavors of orange peel and lemon. This Txakoli airs out and quickly loses its fruit character and intensity on a pithy-tasting finish.

title: Familia Bastida 2016 Vuela  (Rioja)
description: Berry and plum-skin aromas lead to a direct palate with energy but also a sense of rawness. Rough rooty berry flavors are lasting on a tough grabby finish.

title: As Laxas 2016 Laxas Sensum Albariño Sparkling (Rías Baixas)
description: This sparkling Albariño holds its own, and given how little sparkling Albariño exists, that's a back-handed compliment. Aromas of apple and smoky flint set up floral flavors of citrus fruits backed by a cured-meat note of Iberico ham. On the finish, this turns green and bitter, with citrus-skin notes taking charge.

title: Castillo de Monjardin 2016 El Cerezo Unoaked Chardonnay (Navarra)
description: This Chardonnay's rubbery aromas are tight and closed. It's tangy and acidic, with no oak to soften it up. Its apple, citrus and grassy flavors finish bright and easy.

title: Vinedos Singulares 2016 El Veïnat Garnatxa (Montsant)
description: Stalky red berry aromas are low on fruit, while this Catalonian Garnatxa feels grabby but short on depth. Oaky, pasty flavors outweigh modest fruit notes, while this feels grainy, gummy and slightly hot.

title: Bodegas Leza García 2017 Nube Teampranillo Blanco Tempranillo Blanco (Rioja)
description: A yellow color and aromas of peach and citrus blossom are mild but nice. A plump, lightly citric palate deals flavors of Golden Delicious apple and orange in front of a steady finish. If this has a notable fault, it's that it's soft and won't likely age well. Drink now.

title: Tamaral 2014 Vendimia Seleccionada Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: A jammy, reduced nose is dominated by cooked berry aromas. The dense palate tastes largely of wood grain and stewed berry fruit. A minty oak flavor marks the short finish.

title: Bodega Classica 2017 Lopez de Haro Viura (Rioja)
description: Leesy aromas of pear, apple and vanilla open this simple Viura. A lean palate is fresh but unsubstantial, while this tastes of apple, tropical fruits and green grapes. A modest finish is neither here nor there.

title: Burgo Viejo 2016 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: An abundance of raw-oak aromas gives this crianza a sense of saw mill and clove. High-acidity creates choppiness, but that's offset by lactic oaky notes. Tart plum and currant flavors are tomatoey and woody, with some vanilla softness. On the finish, this remains tomatoey and punchy.

title: Duquesa de la Victoria 2013 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Palpable aromas of vanilla-rich oak result in aromas of pencil eraser, campfire and milk chocolate. In the mouth, this feels soupy and thick, with moderate acidity. Flavors of pasty vanilla, chocolate and berry syrup taste oaky and candied on the finish.

title: Don Aurelio 2015 La Elegancia Crianza Tempranillo (Valdepeñas)
description: Floral red berry aromas include notes of nutmeg and dried herb. A fleshy palate is anchored by hard, scratchy tannins, while spicy plum and currant flavors are dry and peppery, characteristics that carry over to the finish.

title: Coto de Hayas 2017 Garnacha Rosado (Campo de Borja)
description: Aromas of rose petals and punchy but generic citrus fruits lead to a chunky palate with good acidity. Flavors of citrus skin and lime show a slight herbal green side, while this is plump but balanced on the finish.

title: Arrumaco 2017 Garnacha Rosé (Spain)
description: Common aromas of grape skins, cantaloupe and papaya are mostly clean and legit. The palate, while showing some acidic tang, is a bit grabby and short on substance, while this Garnacha Rosado tastes of nectarine but little more. A soft finish that turns bready indicates a wine in decline, so drink immediately.

title: Inazio Urruzola 2018 White (Getariako Txakolina)
description: A gritty nose is low on fruit, but that's Txakoli. In the mouth, this is tangy and citric, with lemon and tangerine flavors. Sharp natural acidity keeps this pumping across the finish, which remains tart until the end.

title: Bodegas Olarra 2014 Cerro Añon Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Olarra turns out a lot of wines across many labels and at some point they become one in the same. For what it's worth, this reserva opens with smoky, oaky aromas and fruit notes that suggests hand lotion. A rubbery and full palate offers red fruit tannins backed by darker fruit flavors. This is tight and tannic on the finish.

title: Bodegas Faustino 2018 VII Viura (Rioja)
description: Generic white fruit aromas suggest green melon and apple, while this feels fresh and citrusy. Simple white fruit flavors finish short, with a lingering note of citrus. Consistent with prior years, this varietal Viura is par for the course.

title: A Fuga 2017 Mencía (Ribeira Sacra)
description: Baked, jammy berry aromas are spiced up with clove and nutmeg notes. A fleshy but unfocused palate is home to raspberry and plum flavors that are accented by wayward spice notes. A jammy finish is short on tightness and depth.

title: Enate 2018 234 Chardonnay (Somontano)
description: Oily citrus and stone fruit aromas smell a bit like household cleanser, while this Chardonnay feels healthy. Melon, apple and vanilla flavors finish with acidic kick, and while this tastes of vanilla and is suggestive of oak, this sees no wood and thus it's the lees that provide said character.

title: Alonso López 2018 Tempranillo Rosé (Rioja)
description: A nonspecific nose with little to no fruit is innocuous, which is a good descriptor for this Rioja rosado. A plump palate is slightly chunky, while this delivers short, quick-hitting citrus and stone fruit flavors that barely register.

title: Príncipe de Viana 2016 Roble Garnacha (Navarra)
description: High-toned cherry and plum aromas are aggressive, as is a lean palate. Plum and cranberry flavors are firmly in the red, while this Garnacha offers side notes of peppery spice. This is juicy and spunky more than dark and heavy.

title: Nubori 2016 Cata Nobilis  (Rioja)
description: Lean rubbery berry aromas are raw and pinched, with a hint of vinegar. This Rioja from an average vintage smacks hard with juicy acidity. Standard berry flavors are short and basic, while this is wiry on the finish.

title: Naveran 2016 Brut Sparkling (Cava)
description: Right away this is funky on the nose, with briny aromas and a sense of resiny wood. A briny palate is texturally thick, while this tastes of brined citrus and savory notes.

title: Bodegas Bilbainas 2016 Viña Pomal White (Rioja)
description: Dusty yeasty aromas are more out front than any particular fruit scent. This Viura-Malvasia blend is linear feeling as it toes a single line. Narrow stony flavors of white pineapple and lime don't do much on a limited finish.

title: Bodegas Fos 2014 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Scratchy aromas of spicy red fruits and tree bark hold up to scrutiny, as do the oaky notes that create a vanilla essence to go with gamy berry flavors. A chewy, meaty finish belies this Crianza's low price tag.

title: El Coto 2017 Blanco Viura (Rioja)
description: Punchy citric aromas are fairly sweaty and green, like Sauvignon Blanc or a Verdejo from Rueda. A racy citric palate is tangy and zesty. Lightly salted orange and lime flavors include a hint of green cactus, while this basic Viura holds firm on a minerally finish.

title: Otazu 2017 Tempranillo Rosé (Navarra)
description: This rosé of Tempranillo opens with a popular pink Provence color and not too serious aromas of citrus fruits and cheese. The palate, despite the wine's light color, is chunky and a bit sticky. Chewing gum flavors flatten out on a finish that's showing the first stages of oxidation.

title: Bodegas Faustino 2015 VII Viura (Rioja)
description: Fresh, crisp and more neutral and competent than exciting is how to best describe this racy but lightweight Viura. A citric palate issues short, tangy lime flavors, while the finish is juicy, lean and tight.

title: Baron De Ley 2014 Varietales  (Rioja)
description: Forced oak and modest red-fruit aromas are good enough to draw you in. This feels snappy, with cheek-puckering acidity. Tart red-fruit flavors of plum and currant are woody but honest, while the wine's initial forced oak character settles down on the finish.

title: Martinsancho 2017 Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Briny citrus aromas are oily and gritty prior to a chunky palate that's thick and a bit flabby for Verdejo from Rueda. Vague stone-fruit and citrus flavors finish plump but short, with salty notes.

title: Clos Pons 2012 Alges Red (Costers del Segre)
description: Stalky, herbal berry and plum aromas are gamy as well. This blend of Tempranillo, Syrah and Garnacha feels clipped, with tomato-like acidity. Herbal plum flavors come with a note of oregano and a dash of salt.

title: Bodegas Paniza 2015 Sleever Viura-Chardonnay (Cariñena)
description: Aromas of apple and dried melon are basic and clean. This Viura-Chardonnay has juicy outsized acidity to go with a chunky body. Generic slightly sweet apple flavors finish fresh, with a hint of lime.

title: Finca Valpiedra 2010 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Given the lauded conditions of 2010 in Rioja, this wine's herbal minty grassy nose and raw tart pulling palate are surprising. Savory herbal tomatoey red-plum flavors finish minty, with lasting fresh acidity.

title: Finca Manzanos 2014 Joven  (Rioja)
description: Despite being a bit rough on the nose, this Tempranillo-Garnacha blend offers solid berry, plum and cherry aromas. A bright juicy palate delivers plum, currant and raspberry flavors along with a touch of dry spice. For everyday red, one shouldn't complain about this.

title: Portal del Montsant 2015 Bruberry Blanc White (Montsant)
description: Dry apple and pine-needle aromas are punchy on this blend of 80% Grenache Blanc and 20% Macabeo. An uneventful palate is fresh but simple. This wine tastes mostly of bitter grape skins and almond skins. Modest apple and grapefruit notes show on the finish.

title: Xabec 2012 Red (Montsant)
description: Dry, spicy, saucy aromas are low on fruit. This blend of Carignan and Garnacha feels tight, lean and pulling, with little weight or volume to the palate. Leafy plum and beef bouillon flavors are a bit stewy on the finish.

title: Rioja Vega 2013 9 Barricas  (Rioja)
description: Toast, chocolate, tobacco and rooty aromas precede a racy linear palate that's so streamlined it's sharp. Tart plum and raspberry flavors are soured by lemony acidity, while this is raw and nervy on an intense finish.

title: Marco Abella 2016 Loidana Red (Priorat)
description: Gamy, rubbery berry aromas are short on purity and fruit. An obtuse, chunky palate includes hard grabby tannins, while this tastes of soupy plum, tomato sauce and vanilla. Scraping tannins and chunky weight block this from ending with any elegance.

title: Domeco de Jarauta 2017 Sancho Barón  (Rioja)
description: Heavy oak on the nose announces an extracted Tempranillo, with hints of cow hide and barnyard. This feels fleshy and snappy, with rubbery tannins. Flavors of currant and plum finish choppy and tannic, with forceful notes of oak-based clove and toast.

title: Pazo Baión 2017 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: White fruit aromas of melon, peach and papaya are controlled, not effusive or boldly fruity. A solid palate is held together by citric acidity, while this tastes salty and generically citric before mild oxidation appears on the finish.

title: Marqués de la Concordia 2017 MM Selección Especial Brut Rosé Sparkling (Cava)
description: A rusty orange color and mild aromas of cantaloupe and watermelon open this Cava. On the palate, this feels saucy and foamy. Wood-tinged flavors of red bell pepper and clover finish short and spicy. Overall, this is good but unusual for rosé Cava.

title: Príncipe de Viana 2015 Edición Limitada Crianza Red (Navarra)
description: Herbal berry aromas lean towards green, while mint and spice notes are also part of the opening. A sappy, jumbled palate is hard as rocks, while this tastes of stewed saucy blackberry. By the time this blend of Tempranillo, Merlot and Cabernet concludes, the flavors are mostly settled.

title: Marqués de la Concordia 2018 Vega~Reina Singe Vineyard Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Green fruit, carrot juice and grassy aromas open this plump and fruity Verdejo. Grassy flavors include lime and grapefruit, while a hint of bitterness is noted on a standard finish. Drink now.

title: Finca del Marquesado 2009 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Reserved aromas of plum, raisin and oak lead to a pinched palate that pulls to the center like a magnet. Peppery blackberry and cassis flavors are raw and without volume prior to a collapsed finish.

title: Gotas de Mar 2017 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Pumpkin, matchstick and vague stalky aromas announce a round palate that's soft and shapeless at the edges. This fading Albariño tastes of stalky white fruits and briny apple, while modest acidity is noted on a peachy finish.

title: Vicente Gandia 2018 El Miracle 120 Aniversario Chardonnay-Sauvignon Blanc (Valencia)
description: Tropical-fruit aromas include notes of orange blossom and mango. This blend of Chardonnay and Sauvignon Blanc feels fresh and citrusy. Lime and lychee flavors finish with snappy tightness.

title: Mont Marçal 2014 Extremarium Brut Reserva Sparkling (Cava)
description: Honeyed apple aromas are basic and superficial, while this feels foamy and standard on the palate. Flavorwise, this is generic and offers nothing beyond the basics, while a return to foam returns on the finish.

title: Sierra Cantabria 2017 Selección  (Rioja)
description: Plum and berry aromas are earthy, with a hint of compost in the mix. A heavy palate is flat, with rubbery tannins. Herbal berry flavors carry a note of mint, while this is grinding and tannic on the finish.

title: Burgo Viejo 2017 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Grainy oak, blueberry and kirsch aromas come in front of an impermeable palate that's hard, closed and smacking. Oaky dark-fruit flavors include a note of prune, while this is plump and severe on the finish.

title: Casar de Burbia 2016 Casar Mencía (Bierzo)
description: A black color and ultraripe aromas of raisin and oaky vanilla open this jammy, full-bodied version of Mencía. Vanilla and baked berry and plum flavors end with chocolaty richness and an unmistakable raisin character.

title: Carlos Serres 2018 Old Vines  (Rioja)
description: Foxy plum and cherry aromas come with a hint of minty green. On the palate, this standard Tempranillo feels choppy and edgy, without much middle ground. Plum and herbal flavors finish dry, with freshness and a note of latent oak.

title: Carlos Serres 2017 Rosé (Rioja)
description: This salmon-colored blend of 80% Tempranillo and 20% Garnacha smells more rubbery and dense than fruity and lifted. A lemony palate is endowed with more than enough acidity, while this tastes strictly of tart citrus fruits.

title: Bodegas Vegalfaro 2016 Rebel.lia Red (Utiel-Requena)
description: Foxy, floral berry and plum aromas include notes of green herbs. A palate with big, rubbery tannins and herbal flavors of spiced berry fruits and cinnamon finishes with abrasive, drying tannins. This blend holds Garnacha Tintorera, Bobal and Tempranillo.

title: Roque Colás 2013 Viticultura Ecológica Red (Calatayud)
description: A dark, dense and spicy nose is saturated and oaky, but appropriate for this thick gummy style of Garnacha-Tempranillo-Cabernet Sauvignon. Blackened berry and chocolate flavors taste of fudge on a sticky finish. Overall, this has its good and bad points.

title: Ramón Bilbao 2015 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: A heavy nose is oaked to the point that this Crianza smells mostly of charred wood and shoe polish. Oak-dominant flavors of herbal berry fruits and plum mixed with baking spices conclude with a resiny aftertaste.

title: Quirus 2014 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Odd aromas of lemony oak and scented soap are dominant and block out this Crianza's fruit scents. A pinched high-acid palate holds soupy tomatoey flavors of savory red plum and currant. On the finish, this is tart, with rubbing tannins.

title: Dominio de Atauta 2013 Parada de Atauta  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Cheesy oak aromas and murky fruit scents are less than what Atauta usually offers. Chalk it up to the rough conditions of chilly 2013. In the mouth, this is choppy. Roasted berry and earthy notes precede a tannic, rubbery finish.

title: Aragus 2016 Rosado Garnacha (Campo de Borja)
description: Fleshy stone-fruit aromas announce a fuller-bodied wine made from Garnacha. Straightforward citrus and nectarine flavors are fresh and clean, continuing to a pithy, slightly briny-tasting finish.

title: Bodegas Cristo de la Vega 2016 Camina Rosé Tempranillo (La Mancha)
description: Light red-fruit aromas include a note of chewing gum. This wine is medium in body and solid in feel. Currant and nectarine flavors are basic and snappy, persisting on the finish.

title: Ego Bodegas 2017 Acuma Red (Jumilla)
description: Bearish from the beginning, this Monastrell-Syrah-Petit Verdot shows mossy berry and charred aromas in front of a hard choppy palate, with gravelly tannins. Burnt oak, savory spice and woody black-fruit flavors give way to nothing but overpowering char and oak grain on the finish.

title: Bodegas Alejandro Fernandez 2009 Tinto Pesquera Millenium Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Baked aromas of raisin and prune announce a hot-vintage wine that's over the edge. A stewy ,syrupy palate is tannic but lacking in textural balance. Toasty raisiny black-fruit flavors stick to prune and raisin on an overripe finish.

title: Marqués de Murrieta 2012 Capellanía Viura (Rioja)
description: This Viura smells oxidized and soft, with barrel-based aromas in charge. A soft, watery palate is resiny, tasting bready and yeasty more than fruity. If you dig around, there's some complexity and quality, but this is not the best vintage for Capellanía.

title: Cuatro Rayas 2015 Cuarenta Vendimias  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Campfire and grilled meat aromas lead the way to a pulling palate that's taught as stretched elastic. Black-plum and berry flavors are saucy, savory, woody and stewy. Residual roasted berry flavors and drying tannins make the finish tight and short.

title: Pagos del Rey 2016 Sentero  (Toro)
description: After cheesy barnyard aromas blow off, this simple Toro offers up baked, lightly medicinal flavors of berry fruits and raspberry. A short, lightly herbal finish tastes minty and shows gummy tannins.

title: Marqués de Valparaíso 2017 Roble  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Baked, raisiny berry aromas come with a mild green tobacco note. An edgy, chunky palate shows hard but bracing tannins, while this drought-year Tempranillo has raisiny overtones atop berry and oak flavors. Woody campfire flavors drive a gritty finish with a kiss of oaky clove.

title: Atalayas de Golbán 2016 Virdiana Roble  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Jammy berry and cotton candy aromas are a bit hot and weedy. This feels sappy but upright on the palate. Flavors of plum, currant and green herbs finish with grip and spice notes.

title: Arrocal 2016 Ocho Meses En Barrica  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Aromas of cherry Kool-Aid and candied berry fruits are circumspect. On the palate, this young Tempranillo is chunky, pulpy and lacking in definition. Oaky flavors of chocolate, chicken fat and spice stand out more than fruit, while this lacks intensity on a plump finish.

title: Rios de Tinta 2016  Ribera del Duero
description: Black-fruit aromas include notes of rubber and mixed spices. On the palate, this is loose in structure but shows ample acidity. Moderately ripe berry and black-plum flavors are savory and taste of stewed meat on the finish.

title: Viña Mocen 2016 Selección Especial Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Flower blossom and honey aromas lead to a tangy palate that's quite basic. Lime and tropical fruit flavors are zesty but limited, while this is punchy and healthy on the finish before mild bitterness takes over.

title: Cyan 2015  Toro
description: Gamy rubbery berry-fruit aromas include oak and iodine notes. A choppy hard palate tastes of roasted berry fruits and green herbs, while a full tannic finish is chunky and soupy.

title: Viña Vilano 2015 Roble Black Edition  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Staunch aromas of burnt coffee and gritty black fruits are jumbled and tough. This feels fat and a bit out of shape, while heavily oaked flavors of roasted berry fruits finish blackened and woody.

title: Jean León 2015 3055 Chardonnay (Penedès)
description: This wine's melon and mango aromas come with an oily note of lanolin. It feels lazy on the palate, with just enough acidity to maintain freshness. Mild tropical fruit flavors turn yeasty on its hollow finish. Drink immediately.

title: Sonsierra 2015 Selección Viura (Rioja)
description: Apple and melon aromas are easy to decipher. For a basic white wine, this feels good, fresh and mostly right. Modest generic white-fruit flavors are followed by a bready note of spent lees on the finish.

title: Finca Albret 2015 Lastra Reserva Tempranillo-Merlot (Navarra)
description: Out of the gate this Tempranillo-Merlot blend is strange smelling, with a tropical note of pineapple sticking out. Tannic astringency makes for a hard palate, while this tastes of herbal plum. Rough tannins create a rubbery, grating sensation on the finish.

title: Bodegas Luzón 2014 Luzón Red (Jumilla)
description: Cherry and blackberry aromas come with spice and cool note of cola in this Monatrell-Syrah blend. It's narrow and tannic, with black fruit and desert herb flavors that finish dry and rubbery.

title: Bodegas Valdemar 2013 Conde Valdemar Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Raisin and prune aromas announce a chunky palate that's solid but not agile or elegant. Flavors of prune and cassis come with a sense of grape skins. It finishes well.

title: Abad Dom Bueno 2015 Fermentado Barrica Godello (Bierzo)
description: Resiny oak is the dominant aroma on this barrel-fermented Godello. That heavy oak character carries straight to the palate, which tastes severely resiny. Oak and hidden white-fruit flavors are about all that's present on the finish.

title: Alleme 2016 Hondarrabi Zuri (Getariako Txakolina)
description: Fresh pear and apple aromas are light, simple and clean. Like almost all Txakoli, this is acidic and highly citric in feel, with flavors of lemon and underripe pineapple.

title: Manzanos 2018 Siglo Tinto  (Rioja)
description: Medicinal plum and raspberry aromas are earthy and candied. A prodding palate is thin in the middle, while this offers short shots of plum and berry flavors prior to a lightly herbal finish. This blend of Tempranillo and 20% Garnacha is good in a commercial way.

title: Ego Bodegas 2016 Goru 38 Barrels Red (Jumilla)
description: A thick, heavily oaked nose smells of char, wood grain and clove more than anything fresh or natural. A sappy, extracted palate feels resiny, while oaky, jammy flavors of spiced gumdrop and blackberry finish with hard, drying tannins. This is Monastrell, Syrah and Petit Verdot from a hot part of Spain.

title: Chan de Rosas 2017 Cuvée Especial Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Bready, yeasty aromas are low on freshness and hint at early oxidation. A plump palate is melony and weighty, with moderate acidity. Melon and peach flavors lose steam on the finish. Drink now.

title: Casa Primicia 2014 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Reedy cherry and berry aromas are gritty, while a fairly full palate deals earthy plum and spice flavors that are peppery. This tastes roasted on a firm, tough finish. Charm and high notes are fleeting on this Crianza.

title: Bodegas Palacio 2014 Glorioso Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Earthy berry aromas show lemony oak and wood resin. This feels tannic, grabby and hollow in the middle. Herbal berry flavors lean in the direction of green, while this tastes minty and low on fruit on the finish.

title: Matanegra 2011 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Dense, charred aromas control a soupy nose with reduction and not much fruit. In the mouth, this is heavy, syrupy and in need of a lift. Flavors of black tea, cured beef and stewed plum finish hot.

title: Legón 2016 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: A strong blast of oak is front and center on the nose of this crianza, which carries a distinct aroma of barbecued meat. Fierce tannins are at the heart of a concentrated palate, while toasty oak and minty dark-fruit flavors finish with spice and resin notes.

title: Cermeño 2017 Vendimia Seleccionada  (Toro)
description: Jumpy berry and black fruit aromas are clean but unsophisticated. A smacking palate with pounding acidity holds flavors of plum and berry fruits that don't deliver the ripeness and richness that Toro is known for. On the finish, this is grating and superficial.

title: Viña Bujanda 2011 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: A rusty color and earthy, almost nutty aromas of mulched berry and forest floor lead to a tannic, sappy palate. Leafy, spicy berry flavors are more murky than fresh, while this tastes leafy, herbal and of green tobacco on the finish.

title: Palacios Remondo 2013 Plácet Viura (Rioja)
description: Cheesy oak and dull white-fruit aromas are not a big draw. A chunky plodding palate feels a bit heavy, while dry oaky flavors suggest pear and green apple. Hailing from a cold, wet vintage, this seems as though it's losing clarity.

title: Can Petit 2016 Brut Single Estate Sparkling (Cava)
description: Stalky, briny aromas are not overly funky, while this feels fresh and slightly foamy. A mix of apple and leafy green flavors precedes a finish with mild bitterness and a touch of oxidation.

title: Arráez 2017 Vivir Sin Dormir Monastrell (Jumilla)
description: Briary berry aromas collapse toward the center of the nose on this extracted Monastrell. A cratering, smacking palate tastes of baked berry fruits, prune, oak grain and clove, while a fleshy finish is chocolaty and thick.

title: Bodegas Aragonesas 2013 Castillo de Fuendejalon Crianza Red (Campo de Borja)
description: Earthy raisin and prune aromas are good in an overripe way. Following the nose, this Garnacha-Tempranillo blend feels dense, thick and chewy. Spicy stewy berry flavors taste chocolaty on a gummy finish.

title: Volver 2015 Tarima Monastrell (Alicante)
description: Toast and leather aromas support modest berry scents. This is full, loud and banging on the palate. Roasted blackened flavors of blackberry and plum carry a meaty note, while this remains dark and toasty on an aggressive finish.

title: Pagos del Rey 2015 Bajoz  (Toro)
description: Medicinal, grapy berry aromas come with a hint of latex and Band-Aid. This flush, fruity Toro feels grabby and tannic. Uncomplicated, bold flavors of plum, blackberry and cherry are brash on the finish.

title: El Coto 2014 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Leafy, earthy plum and berry aromas don't suggest much ripeness. On the palate, this is fresh but wiry, with zesty red fruit acidity offset by mild creamy oak. Short berry flavors finish with tangy latent acidity and notes of tomato and herb.

title: Campellares 2016  Rioja
description: Skinned plum and cherry aromas are narrow and slightly toasty. A tannic palate is grabby and lacking in finesse, while this tastes of dark plum and cherry. On the finish, this is rough, rugged and grabby, with jagged residual tannins.

title: Alidis 2012 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Raisiny aromas are earthy but lack freshness, clarity and purity. A gritty, grinding palate is tannic and rough, while this warm-vintage reserva tastes of mint, prune and gamy berry fruits. On the back end, a minty green flavor infiltrates a hard-pounding, severely tannic finish.

title: Campo Viejo 2017  Rioja
description: Earthy red fruit aromas are light and airy more than dense and concentrated. On the palate, this Garnacha is jumpy and a bit scratchy. Plum and berry flavors are brash, while there's some heat to the finish of this lighter-bodied Rioja.

title: Borsao 2018 White (Campo de Borja)
description: Floral, yeasty aromas include a sweet note of cured ham. This blend of Chardonnay and Macabeo (Viura) is full and chunky, with honeyed white-fruit flavors. On the finish, waxy floral notes return and are backed by mild bitterness.

title: Portia 2017 Roble  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Forced oak and resiny aromas give this a chemical note of tire rubber on the nose. The palate is sizable but unruly, with oaky weight and a resiny feel to go with flavors of coconut, vanilla, mocha and woody berry fruits. Roughness and oak are outsized on this Ribera Tempranillo.

title: Matanegra 2012 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Gritty berry aromas come in front of a clampy palate that's acidic then tannic and ultimately empty. Chunky berry and vanilla flavors struggle to stay steady on a finish that doesn't improve or devolve.

title: Castaño 2017 Monastrell Monastrell (Yecla)
description: This salmon-colored rosé of Monastrell smells vaguely of cantaloupe and citrus. A plump citrusy palate features good acidity, while this tastes a little like orange. Accept this as highly basic and enjoy it for what it is.

title: Bovale 2017 Rosé (Utiel-Requena)
description: A direct set of stone-fruit and citrus aromas feeds into a round balanced palate with firm acidity. Minerally citrus and red-plum flavors are salty, while the finish is lasting but doesn't taste like much.

title: Senda Verde 2015 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Aromas of dusty lees, grapefruit and pine needles set up a snappy citric palate. This tastes of pithy lime, lemon and orange, while a quick-fading finish mixes citrus-peel notes with a hint of grapes skins and pyrazines.

title: Príncipe de Viana 2018 Garnacha Rosado (Navarra)
description: A reddish color is normal for this type of Navarran Garnacha, while a fruity nose hints at peach and flower blossoms. A medium to full palate is on the lumbering side, while one-dimensional citrus flavors finish with controlled heat and burn.

title: Bodegas Paniza 2018 Viura (Cariñena)
description: Mild apple and white-fruit aromas are fresh except for a hint of yeastiness. This Viura feels mostly crisp and lean. Lime, apple and melon flavors are basic but good, while this is short on the finish.

title: Sierra Cantabria 2014 Selección  (Rioja)
description: Earthy chocolaty slightly raisiny and murky aromas are not as fresh and popping as they could be. This high-acidity Tempranillo feels full and chewy, while herbal chocolaty red-fruit flavors are fiery on the finish.

title: Spyro 2014 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Bland, mature aromas of white fruits are on the weak side for Albariño. This feels round and oily, while briny leesy flavors lack pop and precision. A grabby aged finish is short on the free flow that this grape and region are known for. Drink immediately or wait for a newer vintage.

title: Bodegas Berceo 2016 Tempranillo  (Rioja)
description: Modest oak aromas accent this wine's blueberry and plum scents. It's lean in feel, with popping acidity. Diffused berry and cherry flavors finish with energy on the wiry finish.

title: Cathar 2014 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: This is yet another very hard 2014 Ribera del Duero, devoid of elegance Its cherry, berry and herbal aromas lack focus, and its black fruit and toast flavors finish with scraping tannins.

title: Campo Viejo 2013 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: This wine's herbal plum and berry aromas are dry and subtly green. It's tight and racy, with raw tannins, currant and red plum flavors and a dry, herbal finish marked by lemony acidity.

title: Naveran 2013 Perles Blanques Cuvée Antonia Sparkling (Cava)
description: Heavy bubbles and aromas of apple and pickle juice are intense. Round in mouthfeel, flavors of tart citrus are offset by mealy notes. This tastes mostly of briny, salty orange on the sizable finish.

title: Martín Berdugo 2016 Joven  (Ribera del Duero)
