description: Jumpy aromas of blackberry Kool-Aid are common for a joven. In the mouth, this feels chunky and grabby, with punchy acidity. Salty berry and plum flavors come with abrasive tannins and an aftertaste of oak.

title: Dominio de Eguren 2017 Protocolo White (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: This delivers fresh but generic apple, pear and stone fruit aromas. It's soft on the palate, with saline-rich flavors of apple and lettuce that finish steady.

title: Dominio de Eguren 2017 Protocolo Made With Organic Grapes White (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Yeasty pear and citrus peel aromas introduce this crisp, quaffable white. Its saline and stone fruit flavors hold steady through the finish.

title: Vega Sauco 2015 el Beybi  (Toro)
description: Raisiny aromas are obvious but not over the top. This basic Toro is expansive but a touch heavy in fell. Raisin and black plum flavors are more baked than fresh, while this is compact on the finish.

title: Cruz de Piedra 2017 Macabeo (Calatayud)
description: This wine's chunky apple aromas hold onto their freshness. Its plump palate shows citrusy acidity and briny white grapefruit flavors. A touch of green lettuce and scallion emerges on the finish.

title: Txomín Etxaníz 2015 Getaria White (Getariako Txakolina)
description: Dusty apple aromas are plain and simple. This has a heavy disposition on the palate despite spritz. Flavors of mango, nectarine and green herbs come with a touch of bell pepper prior to a bulky finish with apple notes.

title: Mas d'en Gil 2012 Coma Alta Grenache Blanc (Priorat)
description: A strong whiff of gasoline and/or diesel is pure petrol. Tight and oily in feel, this mature white tastes pithy, yeasty, waxy and low on fruit character. A dry finish with flavors of papaya and white pepper is short on freshness.

title: Paso a Paso 2015 Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Earthy, oaky and ripe on the nose, this Tempranillo feels taut and drying due to heavy pulling tannins. Flavors of wood grain, raisin and toasty black fruits finish with a lasting sense of forced oak.

title: Fillaboa 2016 Selección Finca Monte Alto Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: A gold color and chunky aromas of citrus and sea foam display more depth than clarity or freshness. This mature Albariño feels chunky and borderline flabby. Heavy citrus and melon flavors show pyrazinic brininess on the finish.

title: Eduardo Garrido García 2015 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Jumpy berry aromas suggest wet dog fur. While this is fresh in feel, it's also a bit clipped and thin on the palate. Cherry and plum flavors come with prune and raisin notes, while this hangs in there on a choppy finish with acidic snap.

title: Bodegas la Casa de Lúculo 2017 Cátulo Garnacha (Navarra)
description: Herbal red plum aromas come with an animal note. A tight, pulling palate features rough tannins, while this tastes of sappy plum and raspberry. A hollow but fresh finish leaves behind scrubbing tannins.

title: Jardín de Lúculo 2015 Old Vines Garnacha (Navarra)
description: This Garnacha's jammy aromas of prune and raisin suggest overripeness. It's full bodied but short on acidity. And it tastes like it smells: raisiny, with cassis notes.

title: Pagos del Moncayo 2015 Prados Colección Garnacha (Campo de Borja)
description: This wine's heavy oak aromas bring a smoldering campfire to mind. It's dense and soupy, with low acidity and soft tannins. Its baking spice and black fruit flavors finish hot, with a roasted character. It was tasted twice with consistent findings.

title: Bodegas Aragonesas 2018 Viña Temprana Garnacha (Campo de Borja)
description: A bright pink color and dry plum aromas open this competent rosé that's fairly full and grabby on the palate. Generic flavors of stone fruits don't move the dial, while this fades quickly on a modest finish with a touch of oxidation.

title: Godelia 2017 Godello (Bierzo)
description: Briny aromas of generic white fruits and haystacks are undistinguished. A fiery palate is grabby and citric, while this tastes melony but also stalky and slightly bitter on a modest finish. This is 80% Godello and 20% Doña Blanca.

title: Emina 2016 Pasión  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Gritty aromas of baked berry fruits and road tar lead to a clampy, pinched palate that's rugged and pulling. Raisin, blackberry and charred burnt oak flavors revert to prune and raisin on a warm, baked finish.

title: Borsao 2015 Monte Oton Garnacha (Campo de Borja)
description: Candied berry fruits are earthy but come with a note of sweet plastic. This feels grabby and firm, with palpable acidity. Salty plum and berry flavors finish warm and long due to lively acidity.

title: El Coto 2018 Rosado (Rioja)
description: A salmon color and dusty but nonspecific citrus and stone fruit aromas lead to a chunky palate that's low on pop and zest. Fleshy melon and stone fruit flavors are yeasty and finish with a skins-like essence and mild bitterness.

title: Tressals 2014 Red (Priorat)
description: Gritty leather and cherry aromas pass quickly across the nose of this wine. It's chunky and meaty, with plum, berry and herbal flavors. A grippy, straightforward finish confirms it's well made but has limits.

title: Yemanueva 2014 La Tercia Bodega Tempranillo (La Mancha)
description: This blocky Tempranillo smells dense and damp, with curry and earthy berry notes. Its chunky palate deals in heavy berry flavors that are low on elegance and high on tannin, and its finish is earthy and flat.

title: Chozas Carrascal 2015 Las 2ces Bobal (Utiel-Requena)
description: This Bobal's dark, earthy berry and leather aromas are closed but presentable. On the palate, herbal plum, tomato and lightly baked berry flavors finish with the scrub of rustic tannins.

title: Arroyo 2014 Roble  (Ribera del Duero)
description: A dark purple color and reduced, funky stewed fruit and leather aromas open this tannic, hard-bodied Tempranillo. Its mix of tea and stewed berry flavors finishes rough, with a meaty note.

title: Godelia 2013 Selección Godello (Bierzo)
description: To date, Godelia has done better with its Mencía than Godello. This wine smells like pine, wheat and match stick, all aromas related to underripe fruit. A stalky, corny flavor profile lacks ripeness, a theme that's replayed on the finish.

title: Vins El Cep 2015 Gelida Mim Natura Brut Reserva Sparkling (Cava)
description: Shy aromas of peach and dust are reserved. A cidery palate has just enough acidity to avoid flatness, but this is not exactly bursting with tension and energy. Mild spiced-apple flavors finish slightly foamy and bitter.

title: Telmo Rodríguez 2015 Dehesa Gago  (Toro)
description: Herbal blackberry and jammy black-plum aromas are forceful and brutish. This Toro has a hard, collapsed, jammy palate and overripe berry fruit flavors. A dense, chewy, baked finish is solid but lacks elegance.

title: Matarromera 2017 Fermentado en Barrica Verdejo (Rueda)
description: A gold color and aromas of spiced pumpkin and wood grain confirm this Verdejo's barrel-fermented roots. A full and resiny palate is cut by acidity, which helps this avoid feeling blowsy. Wood grain, citrus and passion fruit flavors turn slightly bitter prior to the finish, which remains woody in character.

title: Ramón Raventós 2014 Brut Nature Sparkling (Cava)
description: Vanilla and pear aromas are about as basic as you will find from good Cava. A flat palate tastes of briny white fruits and sea-foam, while this is soft on the finish. Overall this brut nature is highly regular, with nothing special about it.

title: Palma Real 2017 Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Fresh but prickly aromas of citrus fruits include a green note of cactus. This doesn't have much stuffing, but it's round on the palate. Briny flavors of lime and green salad with vinaigrette are common to a basic Rueda Verdejo like this.

title: Volver 2017 Single Vineyard Tempranillo (La Mancha)
description: Heavy oak attached to fully ripe fruit results in aromas of coconut, wood smoke and creamy blackberry. A sappy, resiny palate is fully extracted and weighs plenty, while this tastes largely of oak, with charred, chocolaty accents.

title: Hiruzta 2016 Rosé (Getariako Txakolina)
description: Simple aromas of Juicy Fruit gum lead to a fresh palate with light rubbery tannins. The flavor of pink grapefruit is singular, with mild bitterness setting in on a citric finish. This is lively but not an enamel peeler.

title: La Bodega de Pinoso 2015 Cepa 50 Viñas Viejas Monastrell (Alicante)
description: Cherry and plum aromas are a touch grassy on this compact but extracted Monastrell. Cherry and black-plum flavors rumble away on a grabby rubbery tannic finish. This is a big loud warm-climate wine where elegance and finesse are not factors.

title: Marqués de Vizhoja 2016 Torre la Moreira Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Dusty white-fruit aromas come with notes of green herbs and pyrazines. This feels solid and simple, with some plumpness. Generic papaya and dry melon flavors end with a flavor note of green banana.

title: Monterebro 2015 Joven Monastrell-Syrah (Jumilla)
description: Bold cherry and berry aromas come with a syrupy hint of cough drop. In terms of shape, this is grapy and wide bodied, with plum, blackberry and prune flavors. A medicinal quality to the finish neither helps nor hurts. This is 85% Monastrell and 15% Syrah.

title: Viñas del Vero 2012 Crianza Cabernet Sauvignon-Tempranillo (Somontano)
description: Raw herbal crisp aromas of currant and red cherry are a touch green. This blend of Cabernet Sauvignon and Tempranillo is dry on the palate, with clamping tannins. Rooty spicy flavors of tomato and clove finish rough and with mild heat.

title: Viña Herminia 2014 Excelsus  (Rioja)
description: Rubbery, generic berry and red-fruit aromas are decent, nothing more. This Garnacha-Tempranillo blend feels fresh, lean and wiry, with raw flavors of plum and red-berry fruits. A high-toned racy finish is the opposite of plush.

title: Lar de Sotomayor 2013  Rioja
description: Tarry and gritty smelling up front, this offers herbal black-plum notes on second and third takes. This is a wide load on the palate, with huge, pounding tannins. Peppery berry flavors finish dry and abrasive.

title: Ramirez de la Piscina 2017 White (Rioja)
description: Oily aromas of citrus peel and apple are basic, as is a round palate with modest acidity. Mild citrus and stone fruit flavors roll onto a short finish before disappearing. This is 85% Viura and 15% Malvasia.

title: Marco Abella 2015 Loidana Red (Priorat)
description: Earthy, soupy berry aromas are touched up by forced oak. This wine is tannic, screechy and acidic on the palate, with a swath of creamy oak. Herbal, saucy plum and berry flavors finish raw, pulling and tannic, with an excess of oak flavor.

title: Cellers Unió 2015 Perlat Syrah (Montsant)
description: Raisiny aromas indicate that this Syrah is a bit overripe and lazy. Its big, bulky palate is weighty but unfocused, with a jammy berry flavor profile backed by a plump finish.

title: Altavins 2016 Ilercavònia Garnacha Blanca (Terra Alta)
description: Snappy aromas of tangerine lead to a chunky palate with thickness as well as cutting acidity. This tastes of dried melon and bitterness, while on the finish it's chunky, with distant flavors of green melon.

title: Ramon Roqueta 2016 Garnacha (Catalunya)
description: A transparent red color and aromas of cherry and plum set up a wiry, clipped palate with juicy acidity. Spunky plum flavors turn more roasted on a finish with barbecued notes.

title: La Zorra 2014 La Moza Suelo de Pizarra Rufete (Sierra de Salamanca)
description: Aromas of herbal red-berry fruits, tomato, leather and grass lead to a snappy, tight, drawn palate. Red-currant and plum-skin flavors are racy, while this Rufete, a variety rarely seen, is grabby and fairly astringent on the finish.

title: La Zorra 2014 La Moza Calabrés Garnacha (Sierra de Salamanca)
description: Earthy cherry aromas are downright raw, with a touch of green grass woven in. An acidic, choppy palate follows the nose, while this Garnacha from the Sierra de Salamanca region tastes of tart red currant and cranberry. A crisp finish is fresh but abrupt.

title: Marqués de la Concordia 2013 MM Reserva de la Familia Brut Rosé Sparkling (Cava)
designation: MM Reserva de la Familia Brut Rosé
description: Yeasty aromas of vanilla and cotton candy include hints of sweat and funk. This vintage brut rosé feels narrow and citric, but fair and fresh. Bitter orange and grapefruit flavors finish dry and a touch flat.

title: Batán de Salas 2015 Syrah (Somontano)
description: Aromas of dry brush, wiry cherry and road tar open this Syrah. In the mouth, high acidity creates sheer angularity. Plum and tart black-currant flavors are staunch and rubbery on a mildly abrasive finish.

title: Bodegas Peñafiel 2015 Alba de Sierra Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Apple and citrus aromas are a touch briny. This feels pulpy, with standard weight and balance. Dry bready yeasty melon and white-fruit flavors finish with a salty side note.

title: Naia 2015 S-Naia Sauvignon Blanc (Rueda)
description: Spunky passion fruit and citric aromas are far from dull. This feels racy due to strong citric acidity. Lime and passion fruit flavors follow the nose, while this is quick and simple on the finish.

title: Maior de Mendoza 2017 Fulget Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: This wine's generic white fruit aromas are innocuous. Its tangy, citrusy palate deals salty flavors of orange and lemon. It feels fresh on the finish but never rises above basic, good Albariño.

title: Vicente Gandia 2017 Hoya de Cadenas 130 Anniversary White (Valencia)
description: This blend of 60% Merseguera, 20% Sauvignon Blanc and 20% Verdejo features pleasant floral aromas and a racy palate with some inherent creaminess. Its briny citrus, lime and salt flavors don't waver on the finish.

title: Val de Los Frailes 2014 Roble Tempranillo (Cigales)
description: This wine's gamy blackberry and raisin aromas struggle to hold up. The palate is astringently acidic, with coconut- and vanilla-laden plum and berry flavors. Those oak accents preside on the finish.

title: Tempranillo Road 2017 Tempranillo (Navarra)
description: Clean cherry and plum aromas are just stout enough to draw you in. A lean palate without much body or weight holds salty plum and currant flavors, while a steady finish with juicy acidity confirms this Tempranillo's everyday status.

title: Luis Saenz 2017  Rioja
description: Cherry, plum and coconut aromas along with a hint of vinegar make up the nose on this fresh but edgy Tempranillo. Flavors of red plum, olive and vinaigrette finish dry and woody in a highly basic but competent way.

title: Enate 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot (Somontano)
description: Dry spicy aromas of tree bark accent basic red-fruit scents. In the mouth, this blend of Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot is tight as a drum and racy. Narrow tangy flavors of plum finish peppery, lean and scrubbing.

title: La Legua 2013 Capr icho Tempranillo (Cigales)
description: Baked black-fruit aromas feature a ton of oak and related char and spice. In the mouth, this is pulling, blocky, tannic and wiry. A mixed bag of oak, spice, clove and blackberry flavors finishes like a campfire, with choppy, hard tannins that make for a rock-hard closing mouthfeel.

title: Reina de Castilla 2014 Barrel Fermented Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Briny aromas are less than fruity. This feels oily and round, with flavors of tropical fruits such as pineapple and mango set against nectarine and stone-fruit notes. Plump on the finish, with a slightly bitter aftertaste.

title: Circe 2016 Verdejo (Rueda)
description: After opening with white fruit and mineral aromas, this shows a sticky palate made fatter by low acidity. Candied sugary mango, banana and melon flavors are distinctly sweet, which could be a plus or minus depending on your tolerance for residual sugar in a white wine.

title: Bodegas Paniza 2018 Fábula de Paniza Garnacha Rosé (Cariñena)
description: A clean but mostly neutral nose offers a note of nectarine prior to a solid but basic palate that has the texture of citrus peel. A mildly citric flavor profile ends with a slight note of oxidation. Drink now.

title: Rafael Cambra 2016 Mateo Cambra  (Rioja)
description: Medicinal, rubbery berry aromas require airing to settle. In the mouth, this Rioja Garnacha is plump and round but with only medium-level concentration. A rubbery flavor is attached to plum and berry notes, while this is standard on the finish.

title: Bodegas Franco-Españolas 2017 Bordón Viura (Rioja)
description: A light, lucid color and aromas of apple and peach open this quaffable white Rioja. A light spritz shows on the palate, with flavors of apple and melon.

title: Larchago 2016 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Ripe berry and plum aromas are flush and warm, but also a bit fuzzy and furry. Grapey sappiness defines the palate on this black-fruit-driven Crianza that's chocolaty tasting on a bold finish.

title: Ochoa 2016 Calendas Garnacha Rosado (Navarra)
description: Clean nectarine and red plum aromas open this quaffable Garnacha rosé. Lightly salty stone-fruit flavors are pushed by bright acidity, which is about all that remains on a racy but mostly tasteless finish.

title: Borsao 2015 Garnacha (Campo de Borja)
description: Bright fruity plum and raspberry aromas are typical of this wine. The palate is a bit rough and abrasive, while flavors of salty plum and chocolate are punchy prior to a solid but basic finish.

title: Bodega Otto Bestué 2015 Joven Syrah-Grenache (Somontano)
description: Savory, gritty raspberry and currant aromas are earthy, with a suggestion of Band-Aid. This Syrah-Garnacha blend feels rubbery and tannic, with a downward pull. Roasted red-berry and plum flavors finish with a note of grilled meat.

title: Coto de Hayas 2018 Verdejo (Campo de Borja)
description: A clean, pleasant nose offers mild aromas of melon and citrus. On the palate, this is competent and actually impressive for Campo de Borja Verdejo. Melony flavors are slightly salty, while this tastes yeasty on the finish. Drink now.

title: Bodegas Morgante 2017 Primera Luna Tempranillo-Garnacha (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Clean, presentable berry aromas are generic, while this Tempranillo-Garnacha blend feels rubbery. Herbal plum and spice flavors are of good but regular quality, while this finishes with grabby tannic grip.

title: Bodegas Vínícola Real 2014 Cueva del Monge Fermentado en Barrica White (Rioja)
designation: Cueva del Monge Fermentado en Barrica
description: Mild fruit aromas are crowded by peanut and burnt-wood notes. This Viura-led blend is full and round on the palate, with forceful flavors of nutty stone fruits, sea brine and wood resin. A lean, acidic palate is better in feel than weak flavors.

title: Senda Verde 2016 Godello (Bierzo)
description: Melon and kiwi aromas are a touch green. This wine feels tangy but also plump, while lemon-lime flavors give way to skins-driven bitterness. A bland finish with residual tang is direct in feel.

title: Pagos del Rey 2013 Castillo de Albai Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Subtle aromas of cherry cola are basic. This Rioja is medium in body, with slightly scratchy tannins and acidity. Earthy plum and berry flavors finish with a hint of toasty oak and a sense of dryness.

title: Palacio de Bornos 2017 Verdejo (Rueda)
description: There's nothing wrong with this Verdejo except that it's starting to age and lose clarity. Aromas of orange peel are limited and slightly grassy, while salty citrus flavors fall off quickly on a finish that was probably more lively a year ago.

title: Virgen de las Viñas 2015 Tomillar Crianza Tempranillo (La Mancha)
description: Spicy oak aromas include notes of blackberry, mocha, fig and raisin. This Tempranillo feels saturated and dense, with tough tannins. Blackberry, cassis, chocolate and peppery spice flavors finish dark, toasty and long.

title: Las Colinas Del Ebro 2015 Garnacha Blanca (Terra Alta)
description: On the surface, this smells of green apple and citrus, although deeper digging reveals pickled briny scents. A pinched citric palate and dry bitter flavors of green fruits and almond skins finish mild and slightly bitter.

title: Delia 2017 Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Basic aromas of currant, red plum and milk chocolate set up a tight, firm palate with red cherry and plum flavors. A smacking finish is fresh and taught, and overall this is a good everyday Tempranillo.

title: De Bardos 2013 Mítica Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Bacon and smoked berry aromas are gamy and rough. No two ways about it: This is fiery and centered on acidity. Wild berry flavors get overrun by dry woodiness, while hard tannins make this raw on the finish. This may require decades to soften up.

title: Viñedos y Bodegas Pablo 2017 Menguante Tempranillo (Cariñena)
description: Despite a foxy, medicinal smelling opening, this Tempranillo from Cariñena comes around. Scrubbing tannins lend roughness to a palate with limited structure, while herbal spicy plum and berry flavors include a green note prior to a cheek-rubbing finish.

title: Ipsum 2017 Estate Bottled Verdejo (Rueda)
description: This wine's citrus and mango aromas come with a shot of green bell pepper—all atypical notes for Rueda. Its plump but watery palate holds bell pepper, green banana and lime flavors. A capsicum-tasting burn dominates the finish.

title: Shaya 2018 Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Lean, grassy citrus and minerally aromas set up a palate that's pulpy and creamy, with just enough acidity to provide needed energy and cut. Leesy green melon flavors come with a slightly bitter aftertaste, while this is short on the finish.

title: Marques de Tomares 2017 Monteleiva Colección de Bodega Tradición de Familia  (Rioja)
designation: Monteleiva Colección de Bodega Tradición de Familia
description: Damp earth and plum aromas include a slight hint of olive. On the palate, this is big and mouthfilling, with rubbery tannins. Roasted berry flavors are short on depth and finish with rubbery tannins.

title: Navardia 2018 Organic Wine White (Rioja)
description: Melon and lemon-lime aromas are clean and regular, while this feels lemony but with enough texture to support that racy style. Lime and persimmon flavors are steady on a balanced but basic finish.

title: Navardia 2017 Organic Wine  (Rioja)
description: Herbal, slightly soupy plum aromas clean up with airing. This organic but highly basic Tempranillo offers a mild grab on an otherwise easygoing palate. Herbal plum flavors are slightly green, while this hollows out on the finish.

title: Casa de la Ermita 2016 Blanco Macabeo (Jumilla)
description: Grapefruit, peach and flowery aromas amount to a pleasant wine. This varietal Macabeo feels oily but it also has citric snap. Pineapple, grapefruit and salty flavors finish lemony fresh.

title: Viñas del Vero 2016 Chardonnay (Somontano)
description: Light, pleasant apple aromas are about all this neutral Chardonnay is giving. Its mild palate with just enough acidity carries clean and easy melon flavors. A slightly briny note closes out the lean finish.

title: El Coto 2016 Rosado (Rioja)
description: Aromas of peach pit, apricot and melon are basic but a little mealy. A chunky palate seems soft due to waning acidity. Flavors of melon and papaya finish slightly flat and bitter. Drink immediately.

title: Pazo de Barrantes 2014 La Comtesse Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: This is a wide-bodied, fully mature Albariño with an oily nose that lacks sizzle and is coming up on mealy. Flavors of grape skins and melon are dry, earthy and a touch bitter. A peachy, flat-feeling finish indicates that its drinking life is nearly over.

title: La Bodega de Pinoso 2016 Vergel Rosado (Alicante)
description: Fresh, composed aromas suggest a stick of fruit-flavored chewing gum. This wine has a pulpy palate and a hint of spritz that makes it tastes soda-like, with red-apple flavors and a touch of peppery bitterness.

title: Mocén 2016 Selección Especial Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Clean but standard citrus and apple aromas set up a mild, citrusy palate. This wine offers green banana, melon and citrus flavors in front of a similar-tasting finish.

title: Vicente Gandia 2018 El Miracle 120 Aniversario Shiraz-Garnacha Rosé (Valencia)
description: A red color and spiced apple aromas lead to a full but juicy palate. Pomegranate and watermelon flavors are on the sweet side, while this has a red-wine feel from start to finish.

title: Peñalba Herraiz 2016 Aptus 6 Meses Barrica  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Sappy blackberry aromas are dense. In the mouth, this is heavy and a bit overweight for a joven-style wine. Plum and herbal flavors end with flabby weight.

title: Pradorey 2011 PR3 Barricas Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Bold yellow-gold in color, this aged, barrel-fermented Verdejo has predictably heavy aromas of wood spice and resin, joined by hints of carrot juice and apricot. It has solid palate with adequate acidity, showing oaky stone fruit flavors that finish with a heavy dose of barrel spice.

title: Vicente Gandia 2015 Hoya de Cadenas 130 Anniversary White (Valencia)
description: This blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Verdejo opens with aromas of bath soap and apple juice. Plump and standard in feel, this tastes of stone fruits and salt. On the finish, which is steady but basic, this tastes bready and leesy.

title: Finca Bacara 2015 Crazy Grapes Monastrell (Jumilla)
description: A heavy coating of resiny oak sits on top of reedy berry fruit aromas. Reduction and jamminess offset each other on a tight palate, while there's a prickly, slightly herbal quality to the plum and berry flavors in this Monastrell.

title: Raventós de Alella 2015 Tina 9 Pansa Blanca (Alella)
description: This wine's nectarine, mango and citrus aromas are mild. It has a solid mouthfeel that suggests proper balance. Apple, green banana and tropical fruit flavors finish short and low on acid.

title: Vins El Cep 2015 Kila Sparkling (Cava)
description: This brut is sound on the palate, but low acidity results in a flat sensation. White-fruit and green melon flavors are lightly oxidized on a yeasty finish.

title: Bodegas Faustino 2013 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Prune and cassis aromas are timid and earthy. This crianza from a cool, rainy year feels choppy, but has substance. Spicy, peppery red-fruit flavors are dry and finish with acidic freshness.

title: Finca Río Negro 2017 992 Cogolludo- Guadalajara Single Vineyard Red (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Red-fruit aromas are a bit cheesy from oak, while this Tempranillo blend feels tight, snappy and ultimately a bit hard. Limited plum, berry and chocolate flavors wind up on a grating finish.

title: Portal del Priorat 2014 Gotes Grenache-Carignan (Montsant)
description: Medicinal berry and plum aromas result in a latex scent. High acidity creates pinching and narrowness on a palate with plum and berry flavors that are more racy and red than dark and ripe. Edgy tannins resurface on a raw finish.

title: Bota Real 2011 Gran Reserva Garnacha-Syrah (Terra Alta)
description: A jumbled nose includes aromas of sweet plastic, soap, creamy oak and candied red fruit. On the palate, this Garnacha-Syrah blend feels grabby and a bit gummy. Foxy berry flavors include a phenolic hint of green, while this is short and choppy on the finish.

title: Bodegas Aragonesas 2014 Solo Selección Viñas Viejas Garnacha Garnacha (Campo de Borja)
description: Mealy berry aromas are stewy and topped with a heavy load of oak-based carob and cocoa. In the mouth, this Garnacha feels sticky and dense. Dried dark-fruit flavors finish woody and medicinal, with heat and excess weight.

title: Borsao 2016 Monte Oton Garnacha (Campo de Borja)
description: This everyday Garnacha is racy and energetic, with spicy, leathery raspberry, strawberry and plum aromas. It's brighter on the palate, offering juicy plum and raspberry flavors that linger on the lively finish.

title: Amaren 2016 Barrel Fermented White (Rioja)
description: Oily, nutty aromas are low on fruit. This barrel-fermented white Rioja is full and chunky on the palate, while the flavor profile includes stalky but generic white fruits, raw oak and some bitterness. A plump finish is based mostly on barrel tannins.

title: Bodegas Paniza 2018 Garnacha Rosé (Cariñena)
description: Orange-peel and pink-grapefruit aromas are mild and yeasty in front of a pulpy palate with citric pop. Basic flavors of orange and tangerine linger on a clean, simple finish, with a hint of yeastiness. Drink now.

title: Jorge Ordóñez & Co. 2016 Nisia Old Vines Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Mineral-driven on the nose, the palate of this Verdejo is citrusy in feel, with a grippy texture. Flavors of nectarine and peach are mild on a fresh finish.

title: Inurrieta 2016 Orchidea Sauvignon Blanc (Navarra)
description: White-fruit and citrus aromas are mild but clean on the nose. This has a light-bodied palate and tart flavors of orange and lime. A juicy finish hangs around for a few moments then dissipates.

title: Quirus 2017 Tempranillo Blanco (Rioja)
description: This Tempranillo Blanco offers candied melon and lime aromas. On the palate, it has the consistency of apple juice and tastes of Bartlett pear with a hint of salt. Ultimately, it's a good but average wine little character and a dilute finish.

title: Peculiar Wines 2017 Ostras Pedrin Alto Turia Verdosilla (Valencia)
description: This wine's light tint and equally light tropical fruit, lychee and gardenia aromas suggest Moscatel, but it's 100% Verdosilla, a white grape native to Valencia. The palate is lean but fresh, with briny citrus and salty melon flavors that don't break down on the finish.

title: Sedosa 2015 Rosé (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Clean, stony aromas are more neutral than fruity. This feels good and standard, with fresh acidity. Mild flavors of citrus, stone fruits and yeast fade quickly on the finish.

title: Pazo De Villarei 2017 Abadia do Seixo Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: This offers the fresh apple and pineapple aromas typical of Albariño. Its high acidity creates tart, lemony flavors that lack body. A sharp finish confirms the wine's pointy profile.

title: Livius 2008 Garnacha  (Rioja)
description: A nose with oxidized baked-fruit aromas confirms that this 2008 is on the back side of its run. A jammy, reduced palate houses squeaky tannins and leads to a flavor profile ruled by raisiny, stewed berry fruits. Prune and baking-spice flavors control a soft, mature finish.

title: Pagos del Rey 2015 Arnegui  (Rioja)
description: Plum and raspberry aromas are clean and fresh. This feels solid and tastes of bright yet medicinal plum and cherry. A balanced finish with bolstering acidity and reasonably good berry flavors makes this worth a go.

title: Compañia de Vinos del Atlántico 2013 Sierra de la Demanda Viura-Garnacha Blanca White (Rioja)
designation: Sierra de la Demanda Viura-Garnacha Blanca
description: Briny, funky aromas of cured ham, stone fruits and salt water are unique for the area. This blend of Viura and Garnacha Blanca is linear and acidic, with lightly oxidized, barrel-driven flavors of boiled ham and dried apricot.

title: Ramón Bilbao 2014  Rioja
description: A heavily charred nose smells downright burnt. This Garnacha is tannic and oaky, with charred flavors of clove, black plum, toast and wood resin.

title: Mas d'en Gil 2014 Bellmunt Red (Priorat)
description: Raspberry aromas are mild on the nose. This hails from Bellmunt, a warm, lower-lying section of the Priorat. In the mouth, it's rough and gritty, with narrow plum and cherry flavors.

title: Castellroig 2014 Vermell Brut Xarel-lo (Cava)
description: Bitter peach pit and burnt orange aromas open this tan-colored Cava. A soft, lightly citric mouthfeel could use more acid, while this tastes of grape skins and stale grapefruit. A short finish introduces green-herb notes.

title: Coto de Hayas 2013 Crianza Red (Campo de Borja)
description: Spice, leather and oak aromas rest on top of an earthy base that doesn't suggest any particular fruit. This Garnacha-Tempranillo blend feels narrow and choppy. Flavors of savory oak, baked berries and chocolate finish dry and drawing.

title: Taron 2012 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Lazy berry and mild raisin aromas sit heavily in the glass. This crianza is rubbery and grabby in feel, but also pretty big. Stewed berry and prune flavors finish with some excess weight.

title: Gaba do Xil 2017 Godello (Valdeorras)
description: Prickly citrus and generic green aromas are a bit pyrazinic. A plump, pulpy palate is a touch flat, while this tastes of lettuce, bell pepper and lime. Mild bitterness is notable on a finish where green herb flavors are lasting.

title: Príncipe de Viana 2016 Edición Rosa Rosado (Navarra)
description: This pink Garnacha feels good and plump yet lacks the concentration of a great rosé. It has cherry Lifesaver, vitamin and cheese-like aromas and yeasty citrus flavors that are mild through the finish.

title: Altavins 2015 Almodí Grenache (Terra Alta)
description: This scattershot red is made from the Garnacha Peluda grape. It's airy on the nose, with cherry and citrus peel aromas that are also slightly foxy. There's not a lot to the palate, aside from medicinal red berry, salt and rubberband notes. It's light in body yet fiery and aggressive on the finish.

title: Beronia 2016 Tempranillo Rosado (Rioja)
description: Neutral aromas and a light pink color suggest this will be an easy ride. Its shy palate is light on acidity, with generic, mild flavors and a mildly briny finish.

title: Barinas 2014 Selección Monastrell (Jumilla)
description: This opens with bold but faintly chemical berry aromas. Its chunky palate features hard tannins, tasting of roasted berries, oak and cured meat. On the finish, it feels rubbery and a touch flat.

title: R+ 2014  Ribera del Duero
description: This everyday Tempranillo opens with spicy aromas and herbal black plum and prune notes. Its palate is ruled by rubbery tannins, tasting of berries, plums and mild oak spice. A roasted flavor closes the finish.

title: Bodegas Riojanas 2014 Puerta Vieja Crianza Selección  (Rioja)
description: This wine's creamy, woody maple and tobacco aromas are within Rioja norms. On the palate, it's blocky and thick, with vanilla and marshmallow flavors that taste sweet, finishing with little structure.

title: Bodegas Cristo de la Vega 2016 Colorea Verdejo (La Mancha)
description: This is a solid Verdejo, with citrusy acidity and pulp to the palate. It shows modest melon and apple aromas and citrus and green herb flavors that finish with no major changes.

title: Marqués de Cáceres 2016 Rosé (Rioja)
description: This everyday rosé's shiny pink color indicates it's still lively and fresh. Its cherry candy and chewing gum flavors are powdery and yeasty. Flavors of grapefruit and orange peel pervade the palate, feeling spunky on the finish.

title: Cruz de Alba 2014 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: This has intense smoky, minty and herbal aromas, without much fruit. It's lemony and wiry on the palate, with sour plum and currant flavors that taste woody, spicy and minty on the finish. A lean and sharp rendition of Tempranillo.

title: Simué 2017 Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Snappy, pungent aromas of citrus carry the aroma. This feels round, oily and fairly full on the palate. Salty citrus flavors include green notes, while this hints at bell pepper and briny white fruits on the finish.

title: Viñas del Vero 2015 Garnacha-Syrah (Somontano)
description: A lean but lucid nose shows piquant floral scents. The palate on this Garnacha-Syrah is choppy and abrupt, with high acidity and rubbery tannins. Medicinal red plum and red-currant flavors finish with a rubbery grip.

title: Tarantas 2016 Organic Tempranillo (Utiel-Requena)
description: Spicy berry fruit aromas are straightforward and pretty good. This wine feels firm and centered, with plum, berry and cherry flavors. A reasonably deep finish offers residual berry notes and peppery spice.

title: Legado del Moncayo 2016 Garnacha Blanca (Campo de Borja)
description: Aromas of clover and yeasty vanilla lack concentration. This feels a bit oily, while nonspecific citrus flavors finish with a note of grape skins and brine. It's acidic and medium to light in body.

title: Ossian 2015 Viticultura Ecológica Verdejo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León
description: Briny citrus aromas are a bit stale and vie with oak scents. This barrel-aided Verdejo is oily and resiny in feel. Salty apple and corn flavors are a touch oxidized, and on the finish that oxidized character is more amplified, with hints of popcorn and butter.

title: Marco Abella 2015 Òlbia White (Priorat)
description: Oxidized stone-fruit aromas blend with vanilla and rubbery notes on this blend of mostly Garnacha Blanca and Viognier. In the mouth, this feels resiny and creamy, and ultimately rather monotone. Vanilla and wood-resin flavors are prominent prior to an oaky finish that's low on fruit.

title: Izadi 2017 Larrosa Rosé (Rioja)
description: Earthy aromas of cantaloupe are slightly mealy and stale. A chunky palate shows the tannic grab of grape skins. Salty melon and peach flavors are not that bright, but lively acidity keeps this on a proper keel in terms of balance.

title: Rio Madre 2017 Garnacha Rosé (Rioja)
description: A hot-pink color and punchy aromas of citrus and red fruits make for a bright opening. In its current youthful state, this feels healthy and medium in body. Primary citrus flavors come with a spicy note of cactus prior to a foxy, lightly green finish.

title: Quintana de Cue 2014 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Heavy berry fruit and oak aromas are low on depth and complexity. This thick Tempranillo is choppy and impermeable. Saucy flavors of herbal plum and tomato finish equally herbal and with saltiness, much like a meat sauce for pasta.

title: Bodega Classica 2015 Hacienda Lopez de Haro  (Rioja)
description: Roasted, leathery and rubbery berry aromas are gritty and short on brightness. This feels rugged but good. Jammy cassis and cherry flavors show notes of cocoa and herbs.

title: Beronia 2016 Viura (Rioja)
description: Yeasty aromas are simple and low on both fruit and acidity. Flavors of almond skins and lightly salted stone fruits finish mellow, without much snap.

title: Borsao 2016 Rosé (Campo de Borja)
description: Melon, Animal Cracker and tropical fruit aromas lead to a plump but solidly fresh palate. A mix of stone-fruit and pink-grapefruit flavors is chiseled, and tastes a touch peppery on the finish.

title: Bodegas Riojanas 2014 Monte Real de Familia Crianza  (Rioja)
description: A dark color and stewy aromas of earthy berry fruits lead to a lush, lazy palate that tastes of toasty oak and roasted berries. A hot, minty and charred finish feels heavy.

title: Magister Bibendi 2014 Navarrsotillo Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Baked, earthy berry aromas are cooked and nutty, not fresh. A palate with heft is awkward and a bit out of balance, while this Garnacha tastes of roasted berry fruits and burnt wood. Lingering oak spice is the most notable flavor on a heavy finish.

title: Chopo 2016 Red (Jumilla)
description: Heavy berry aromas give way to scented soap and cola notes. This blend of 80% Monastrell and 20% Cabernet Sauvignon is quite heavy, with a syrupy mouthfeel cut by rough acidity. Black-fruit flavors lack flow on a flush but stunted finish.

title: Parxet 2013 Titiana Brut Rose  (Cava)
description: Creamy peach and orange aromas are a bit like a Creamsicle. In the mouth, this is chunky and citrusy, but far from elevated or elegant. Salty briny citrus and nectarine flavors finish flat, yeasty and oxidized.

title: Viña Bujanda 2012 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Stalky berry aromas are low on fruit and smell like a brush fire. A choppy mouthfeel and roasted flavors of plum and currant are not overly ripe, while this tastes somewhat stale on a rough finish.

title: Bodegas Grupo Yllera 2017 Boada Campo de Bueyes Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Snappy green jalapeño and cactus aromas set up this wine's tight, acidic palate. Its briny, salty melon and lime flavors stay crisp and firm on the punchy finish.

title: El Coto 2017 Rosado (Rioja)
description: Pinched, slightly astringent aromas are generic and barely fruity, but not off. A plump palate deals the minimum in bracing acidity, while light generic flavors of red fruits finish watery.

title: Gómez de Segura 2016 Selección  (Rioja)
description: A nose built almost entirely around raw oak is warm and earthy more than fresh and fruity. In the mouth, this is severely tannic and resiny. Hot woody berry flavors are demanding, while this is dry and dominated by the barrel on the finish.

title: Viña Palaciega 2015 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: A light nose with pale berry aromas barely registers as ripe. In the mouth, this crianza is dry and just makes the weight for medium-bodied. Leafy, slightly bitter plum flavors finish dry, shallow and slightly green.

title: Navardia 2016 Made With Organic Grapes  (Rioja)
description: Raspberry and red-berry aromas are clean and fresh, but nothing more. A rubbing tannic palate is scratchy, while this organic-grape Rioja provides generic berry flavors that finish with astringency.

title: Naveran 2016 Brut Nature Sparkling (Cava)
description: Lavender-scented soap and talcum-powder aromas are light and airy. This brut nature feels austere and citric. Sour orange and melon flavors are a bit stale, while this tastes of underripe cantaloupe on the finish.

title: Naveran 2016 Brut Rosé Sparkling (Cava)
description: Hand soap, murky melon and red-fruit aromas precede a plump foamy palate. Red-berry flavors are good but average, while this tastes savory and salty on a briny finish.

title: K5 Argiñano 2016 K Pilota Hondarrabi Zuri (Getariako Txakolina)
description: White-fruit aromas are quiet on the nose. Despite a shearing mouthfeel that's typical for Txakoli, the palate leans sour and citric in feel.

title: Bodegas Alanís 2015 Las Híades White (Ribeiro)
description: Aromas of stone fruit, apple and pumpkin announce a palate that's dilute but holding onto some punch. Briny citrus flavors suggest orange peel, while this blend of Palomino and Torrontés tastes slightly bitter on the finish.

title: Edetària 2016 Via Edetana White (Terra Alta)
description: This blend of Garhacha Blanca and Viognier is round in feel. Briny nectarine and citrus flavors are sharp on the palate and turn green on the finish.

title: Montebro 2013 Vilamar Reserva Reerva Merlot-Cabernet Sauvignon (Terra Alta)
description: Candied, oaky aromas of clove outmuscle foxy berry scents. This blend of 60% Merlot and 40% Cab Sauvignon is heavy, tannic and ultimately a bit overweight and flabby. Clove, wood spice and cooked berry flavors finish with baking spice and woody notes.

title: Volver 2014 Single Vineyard Tempranillo (La Mancha)
description: This wine's charred nose suggests over-the-top oak. The palate is a rough road of hard grape skin tannins. Char and clove flavors blanket its savory, meaty berry fruit, finishing woody and redolent of clove.

title: Clos de Nit 2015 Red (Montsant)
description: The tomato and plum aromas in this Garnacha blend are a bit soupy. Its chunky palate is heavy with generic berry fruit and a touch of oxidation. A solid, middle-of-the-road pour.

title: Santo Cristo 2015 Flor de Cayus Garnacha (Campo de Borja)
description: This Garnarcha features roasted berry and horseradish aromas. It's choppy on the palate, with top-heavy acidity and jammy blackberry and cassis flavors. Tobacco notes emerge on the finish.

title: Campos Reales 2016 Canforrales Clásico Tempranillo (La Mancha)
description: Foxy plum and violet aromas introduce this basic Tempranillo. It's broad on the palate, with herbal plum and berry flavors, modest acidity and little structure or intensity.

title: Bodegas Aragonesas 2018 Coto de Hayas Chardonnay (Campo de Borja)
description: Aromas of apple juice and powdered sugar are pleasant and lead to a lean, acidic palate, with little body. Short, slightly salty flavors of lemon, peach and melon are even shorter on the finish, which is mildly oxidized.

title: Breca 2018 Rosé (Spain)
description: This is light in color, with hints of peach and mango that don't qualify as strong or intense. A mild palate is timid, while this tastes vaguely of peach and cantaloupe prior to a shy finish.

title: Bodegas Paniza 2016 Viura-Chardonnay (Cariñena)
description: There's almost no color to this blend of Viura and Chardonnay, nor does it smell like much. On the palate, it is plump but lacking in acidic kick. Creamy flavors of banana and melon turn slightly bitter on the finish.

title: Ramón Raventós 2015 Brut Inicial Sparkling (Cava)
description: Briny, pickled aromas are challenging. On the palate, this is initially foamy and then dull. Apple, green herb and vanilla flavors carry over to the finish. As a whole, this brut is just good enough but has faults.

title: Bodega Classica 2015 el Pacto  (Rioja)
description: Volatility is an issue on an otherwise flat, jammy nose. Hard tannins and full extraction create roughness on the palate. Flavors of clove and cinnamon come straight from the barrel, and it's jagged on a pounding finish.

title: Finca Montepedroso 2017 Sobre Lías Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Punchy lemony aromas suggest air freshener and household cleanser. A mildly austere and tangy palate shows a yeasty side, while this tastes of pineapple, commercial yeast and melon prior to a somewhat hollow finish.

title: Gooseneck 2017 Grenache Rosé (Navarra)
description: Prickly aromas of citrus and pyrazines turn more powdery and soapy with airing. A straightforward palate evokes no reaction, while this tan-colored rosé tastes of generic melon, apple and stone fruits prior to a briny finish that fades with nary a peep.

title: Vicente Gandia 2017 El Miracle 120 Aniversario Tempranillo-Shiraz (Valencia)
description: Briny plum and berry aromas set up a soft palate that's more jammy than structured. Plum and berry flavors are generic, while this blend of Tempranillo and Shiraz finishes short, with lightly oxidized notes.

title: Cellers Unió 2015 Clos Dalian Crianza Grenache (Terra Alta)
description: This is tight and rubbery in feel, without much depth or give to the palate. Herbal tea aromas accent generic red fruit scents. Raspberry, red plum and salty flavors finish choppy but clean.

title: Chapter Capítulo 8 2016 Sauvignon Blanc-Verdejo (Castilla La Mancha)
description: This Sauvignon Blanc-Verdejo blend has mild, prickly cactus and citrus aromas and a mix of tropical and green flavors with a slightly bitter finish. It's an everyday white with low acidity.

title: Raventós de Alella 2015 Tina 20 Pansa Blanca (Alella)
description: This varietal Xarello feels more flat than vivid. It has fleshy yet generic white fruit aromas, ripe melon flavors and a tired finish.

title: Casa L'Angel 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Valencia)
description: A dark purple color and aromas of blackberry, creamy oak and pencil lead to a raw, pulling palate that's thick but also high in tartaric acidity. Grainy oak and mocha flavors make a louder statement than does the fruit.

title: Finca Albret 2018 Rocío Rosado (Navarra)
description: A rusty color and aromas of plum and apricot open this barrel-fermented rosé that isn't oaky in the least. A grabby palate has the feel of grape skins, while this is short on flavor and yeasty tasting, with a soft finish.

title: Clos de Nit 2014 Crianza Red (Montsant)
description: Stalky aromas of earthy plum and burnt leaves are not fully ripe. A choppy, gritty palate holds saucy flavors of salted plum, tomato and herbs. A short finish with herbal notes is appropriate. The blend holds Garnacha, Carignan and Syrah.

title: Viore 2017 Verdejo (Rueda)
description: This wine's punchy citrus, pineapple and pyrazine aromas lead to a steady but shy palate with adequate acidity. Its mix of tropical fruit and green citrus flavors finishes slightly bitter.

title: Viore 2017 Verdejo (Toro)
description: This wine's oily citrus aromas are not what you'd call refined. Its white grapefruit and bitter orange flavors are braced by modest acidity. On the finish, it resolves itself with a citrus peel-like note.

title: Dios Ares 2014 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Berry aromas are fiery and scratchy at first, then break down and become suggestive of olive. High acidity and not much body create crispness but also tart plum and cranberry flavors. Loud acidity is maintained on a raw finish.

title: Urbina 1999 Selección  (Rioja)
description: A roasted gritty nose suggests both age and underripeness. A rubbery palate is more jagged than smooth, while this tastes of salty berry fruits and plum. A dry finish goes quickly, leaving an aftertaste of tart red fruits and tomato leaf.

title: Bodegas Aletta 2016 Veraz Garnacha (Campo de Borja)
description: Cherry and berry aromas are generic. On the palate, this everyday Garnacha is braced by smacking acidity. Oaky flavors of clove and black fruits finish grabby due to rubbing tannins. For a fruit-forward red wine, this is competent.

title: La Val 2012 Fermentado en Barrica Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Flowery, yeasty aromas are also soapy and buttery, which makes sense given that this is overly mature and was brought up in oak barrels. Moderate acidity means balance is fleeting, and the wine tastes of stale stone fruits and yeast.

title: Telmo Rodríguez 2015 Al-muvedre Monastrell (Alicante)
description: Leafy minty blueberry aromas announce this jammy Monastrell. There's no oak on this, nor much give to a linear flat palate. Blueberry flavors hold onto the nose's grassy herbal essence, while the finish tastes peppery and vaguely green.

title: Angosto 2017 Parcelas De Familia White (Valencia)
description: This is one quarter each Sauvignon Blanc, Muscat, Verdejo and Chardonnay—a blend you're not likely to find elsewhere. Its mix of tropical and floral aromas comes with a cheesy-smelling overlay. In the mouth, it's highly acidic, with sour and salty flavors.

title: Capçanes 2017 Mas Donis Rosato (Montsant)
description: This wine smells like pizza—all yeasty, bready aromas with tomato and herb notes. It lacks structure on the palate, tasting salty, with nonspecific citrus flavors and a bitter finish.

title: Monterebro 2016 Barrica Red (Jumilla)
description: Raw, herbal, oaky aromas include notes of Navajo sage stick and oak-driven clove. This wine is 85% Monastrell with Syrah, and it feels grabby, tannic and oaky. Creamy oak flavors are soupy, while this wine is plump, chewy and tastes of forced oak on the finish.

title: Jardín de Lúculo 2015 Origen Garnacha (Navarra)
description: This wine's damp earth and raisiny aromas don't suggest a high level of quality. It's jagged on the midpalate but creamy along the edges, with candied and raisinated berry flavors that fall flat on the finish, lacking complexity.

title: Agronavarra 2017 Ventana Roble Tempranillo (Navarra)
description: Jumpy, prickly cherry and plum aromas are lean and spicy. The palate on this Tempranillo follows suit: It's tight, juicy and high in acidity. Flavors of red plum and currant taste of oaky clove, while a forced woody clove flavor persists on a bright, tight finish.

title: Balbas 2017 Ardal Tradición  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Oak is the dominant character on this Tempranillo, and it smells mostly of clove and leathery berry fruits. A smacking and bumpy palate is quite tannic and rough, while this tastes of oak grain, clove and tart plum. A tough finish is minty and slightly green.

title: Finca Constancia 2016 Altozano Verdejo-Sauvignon Blanc (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Mango, grass and dusty aromas lead to a fresh mild simple palate. This tastes of pithy citrus fruits and stone-fruit pit, while the finish blends slight bitter notes with slightly tropical ones. It's 70% Verdejo and 30% Sauvignon Blanc.

title: Bodegas Aragonesas 2015 Aragus Made with Organic Grapes Garnacha (Campo de Borja)
description: Medicinal red-fruit aromas are mildly baked and sweet. This feels a bit heavy, with cheek-scrubbing tannins. Medicinal cherry and berry flavors extend onto the finish of this everyday Garnacha.

title: Cantaburros 2015 Roble  (Ribera del Duero)
description: This is raisiny and jammy on the nose. That's followed by a scratchy palate with rough tannins. Roasted grapy flavors are just pleasant enough, while a gravelly finish is ruled by residual hard tannins.

title: Enate 2011 Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Somontano)
description: Mulchy aromas lack fruit and freshness. In the mouth, this shrieks of high acidity and hard tannins. Oaky flavors of vanilla and cream blend with spicy herbal green-leaning berry notes, while this shows an earthy essence on a muddled finish.

title: Taron 2014 4M  (Rioja)
description: A spicy oaky nose is low on fruit, scattered and chocolaty. In the mouth, creamy oak and high acidity clash, while a lead flavor of chocolaty oak struggles to blend with tart saucy red-fruit notes. A milk chocolate flavor is most prominent on a hollow finish.

title: Coto de Hayas 2016 Chardonnay (Campo de Borja)
description: Light aromas of white fruit greet the nose in this Chardonnay from red-wine country. The plump palate is simple and low on acid, while this tastes of lightly oaked melon and apple.

title: Burgo Viejo 2009 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Soupy raisin and prune aromas are earthy and sleepy. This feels a lot like prune juice, but with tannins. Prune is also the sole flavor on this overripe but still decent gran reserva from a hot vintage.

title: Dolmo 2016 Roble  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Savory, meaty aromas are strained, roasted, oaky and low on fruit. This young Ribera del Duero from the Vicente Gandia family of wines is raw and underdeveloped on the palate. Roasted berry flavors are short on ripeness and taste gritty in front of a hollow finish.

title: Bodegas Lacort 2015 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Mild aromas of clove and cinnamon blend with red fruit scents. A snappy, tight palate is lean and crisp, while spicy cherry and raspberry flavors are dry and display no secondary levels of depth or complexity.

title: Llenca Plana 2016 Carignan-Grenache (Montsant)
description: A gaseous berry-fruit nose could use better purity and concentration. This blend of Carignan and Garnacha is grapy and plump. Smoked blackberry flavors take on a clove note, while this remains bulky and hard to navigate on the finish.

title: Valle de Orón 2015  Ribera del Duero
description: Raisiny berry aromas smell baked and dried out. This warm-vintage Ribera del Duero feels thick, saturated and drying. Jammy, lightly oxidized berry flavors return to raisin, prune and other desiccated fruits on a chewy finish.

title: Viña Jaraba 2015 Selección Especial Red (La Mancha)
description: Reduced berry and plum aromas smell gassy and like latex and plastic. On the palate, this Tempranillo-led blend feels sappy. Greenish flavors of raspberry and currant finish with grabby tannins.

title: Viore 2018 Verdejo (Toro)
description: Apple and melon aromas lead to a round and easy palate with moderate to low acidity for Verdejo, so this is a wine to drink right away. Look for melony flavors of lime and green plum and a short finish.

title: Cellers Unió 2016 Roureda Llicorella Poboleda Vi de Vila Red (Priorat)
designation: Roureda Llicorella Poboleda Vi de Vila
description: Blackberry and raspberry aromas are both bright and jammy, while this is decidedly wiry, hard and acidic on the palate. Tart plum and currant flavors finish raw, with acidic burn. Freshness is fine but this is lacking in fruit, body and charm.

title: Duquesa de la Victoria 2017 Malvasia (Rioja)
description: Buttercup and white-fruit aromas barely make a statement in front of a palate that's a touch oxidized and losing steam. Grassy flavors of green melon hang around on a lasting but empty finish.

title: Esperanza 2018 Estate Grown and Bottled Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Lime and passion fruit aromas are the best part of an otherwise green and dusty nose. Mild spritz and green-leaning flavors of cactus and pulpy citrus fruits bring this Verdejo home. Drink now.

title: Familia Bastida 2016 Vuela  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Stalky berry aromas along with woody notes comprise the nose on this savory wine that's lacking in ripeness. Heavy oak on the palate fails to mask the fact that this is briary and tastes of leafy fruit and oaky clove.

title: Bodegas Faustino 2017 VII Viura (Rioja)
description: Basic aromas of apple and lime are yeasty. This everyday Viura feels angular and lean, with tangy acidity. Simple flavors of green apple and citrus are a touch salty prior to a tart and zesty finish.

title: Val do Sosego 2015 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Tropical fruit, banana and citrus aromas are flat and not fully convincing. This is narrow in feel, with bland stone-fruit flavors. The finish follows the palate, meaning it's good enough but unremarkable.

title: Vallobera 2013 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Grainy oak and earthy red-fruit aromas lead to a hard, tannic palate. Basic plum and cherry flavors finish rough and highly tannic, with savory notes.

title: Palma Real 2017 MontePalma Sauvignon Blanc (Rueda)
description: Piquant aromas of green fruits are feline in nature. This SB from Rueda feels chunky, with soft edges to the palate. Briny, lightly vegetal flavors of citrus fruit and bell pepper finish with just enough acid to make this worthwhile.

title: Legado del Moncayo 2015 Garnacha Blanca (Campo de Borja)
description: Floral and tropical aromas are wan. This feels O.K., while slightly bitter flavors of green melon rapidly disappear on a mild finish. Everything about this amounts to basic.

title: Sierra Cantabria 2015 Selección  (Rioja)
description: Roasted berry, compost and earthy aromas are jumbled and not entirely fresh. This is narrow and resiny in feel, with oaky flavors of clove, milk chocolate and resiny berry fruits. Overall, there's not a lot to this other than oaky makeup.

title: Emina 2017 Verdejo (Rueda)
description: A briny smelling nose includes aromas of pickled fruit, pineapple and pine tree. A phenolic skins-driven palate tastes briny like this smells. A quick, salty finish fades out without much fruit.

title: Marqués de Riscal 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Rueda)
description: Prickly aromas of pine, green herbs and seashell are low on fruit. This Sauvignon Blanc is plump and basic in feel, with apricot and peach flavors that turn peppery and bitter on a simple finish.

title: Portal del Priorat 2016 Gotes Grenache-Carignan (Priorat)
description: Dry, peppery cassis and blackberry aromas are a high point on this Garnacha-Carignan blend because the palate is highly tartaric and angular. Tart plum and wiry currant flavors are narrow, pinching and severely dry on the finish.

title: Bodegas Ondarre 2016 Rivallana  (Rioja)
description: Mulchy, earthy berry aromas are leafy and not that ripe. On the palate, this is tight and high in acidity, while gritty, savory plum flavors are herbal on the finish.

title: Lagar del Rey 2016 Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Obtuse, unfocused aromas of squash, carrot and citrus are not as zesty and direct as Verdejo should be. This feels wide, with spritz to the palate. No single fruit flavor stands out in front of a soft finish with mild apple and stone-fruit notes.

title: Ochoa 2017 Calendas Garnacha Rosé (Navarra)
description: Weighty aromas of slightly stale citrus and stone fruits are a harbinger of what's coming, namely a palate that's stuck in stop-motion and melony flavors that are nonspecific and ordinary. A flat finish with yeasty notes doesn't bode well for this lasting past 2018.

title: Cruz de Piedra 2016 Garnacha (Calatayud)
description: Foxy berry aromas are fruity and jumpy. This wine is grapy on the palate, and more flat than lively. Jammy black-fruit flavors are herbal, while mint and peppery notes drive the finish.

title: Gil Luna 2016 Sin Complejos  (Toro)
description: Rubbery dark-fruit aromas come with cheesy oak scents. This basic Toro has a sticky, saucy mouthfeel bolstered by tartaric acidity. Short, oaky berry flavors are chocolaty, while the finish offers mostly residual oak notes.

title: Aragus 2016 Blanco Viura (Campo de Borja)
description: A largely neutral nose hints at papaya and melon. This Viura is lean in feel, with lemony acidity. Generic nectarine and melon flavors flatten out on a finish that's showing early-onset oxidation. Drink right away for best results.

title: Casar de Burbia 2014 Casar Mencía (Bierzo)
description: A dark color and damp aromas of raisin lack freshness. Overall, this wine is stewed and oaky, with a heavy palate that's showing salty oak-driven berry and prune flavors. It's missing in balance and finishes with persistent saltiness.

title: Portal del Priorat 2016 Gotes del Blanques Grenache Blanc (Priorat)
description: This almost-colorless Grenache Blanc smells of generic white fruits. The palate is lean, shearing and shares much in common with lime juice. Flavors of lime, tart apple and scallion are tangy on a clattering finish.

title: El Coto 2012 Coto Real  (Rioja)
description: On first impression, this smells like a pot of freshly brewed coffee, which is fine at breakfast but not at dinner. Hard tannins are dry as bones and dust, while this tastes of black fruits, blackened spice and black coffee. Toasty oak can be a nice addition to a fine wine, but here it's overwhelming.

title: Bodegas Paniza 2018 Agostón Garnacha-Cabernet Sauvignon Rosé (Cariñena)
description: Peach-pit and wooly aromas drive a dusty, dry nose, while this blend of Garnacha and Cabernet Sauvignon feels melony and a bit soft, with mild acidity. Melony flavors are front loaded on a quiet finish. Drink now.

title: Palma Real 2017 Verdejo-Viura (Rueda)
description: Fruit salad aromas of green melon, citrus and kiwi lead to a plump, chunky palate that's lacking in spine. Green, lightly vegetal flavors of melon and bell pepper are plodding through a slightly bitter finish.

title: Campos Reales 2016 Sauvignon Blanc-Airen White (La Mancha)
description: Aromas of fresh pumpkin and dusty peach are clean but bland on the nose. This blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Airen shows briny melon flavors, with notes of spent yeast and wheat on a low-acid finish.

title: Bodegas Corral 2015 Don Jacobo Vino Ecológico  (Rioja)
description: Spicy cinnamon and berry aromas are warm and cheesy. A jammy mouthfeel is lacking in structure, despite hard tannins. Flavors of raspberry jam include green notes of herbs and grass, while this feels flush on the finish, with clamping tannins.

title: Ressò 2016 Old Vines Garnacha (Catalunya)
description: Grapy wild-berry aromas show notes of raisin and wet clay. This feels full and blocky due to low acidity. A mix of candied plum, berry and green herb flavors are short on the finish.

title: Bodegas Valdemar 2015 Inspiración Selección Estate Bottled  (Rioja)
description: A thick soupy palate smells of black fruits and stale peanuts. The sappy palate is borderline overdone, with cooked flavors of baked berry fruits and grilled steak. Those same stewed characteristics don't dissipate on a heavy finish. Tasted twice with similar findings.

title: Abadia Retuerta 2014 Pago Valdebellón Cabernet Sauvignon (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León
description: Damp, mossy, earthy berry aromas are murky as a whole. This Cabernet is massive and pounding on the palate, with tannins as hard as nails. A green-leaning flavor profile with coffee, mint and blackberry notes finishes with heavy oak, burnt toast and green spice flavors.

title: Marqués de la Concordia 2013 HZ Abascal Vineyard Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Earthy aromas of oak and tobacco meet brandied cherry and plum about halfway. On the palate, this is screaming with acidity, making for a shrill mouthfeel. Flavors of oaky vanilla and sour cherry finish with sizzle and sour red-currant notes. The most notable problem is unresolved pesky acidity.

title: Bodegas Aresan 2017 Syrah (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Beefy black fruit aromas are thick and gamy. More of the same is found on the palate of this blocky, chunky Syrah. Limited but saturated black fruit flavors finish with chewiness and rubbing tannins.

title: Vicente Gandia 2014 Finca Del Mar Crianza Cabernet Sauvignon (Valencia)
description: Generic black plum and berry aromas are not well defined or elevated. A flush, sappy palate is saucy in feel, while this tastes of herbal black fruits, oak spice and pepper. A dry finish is low on fruit.

title: Carlos Serres 2017 Old Vines  (Rioja)
description: Uncomplicated cherry and raspberry aromas come with a latex note. A crisp, dry, tight palate doesn't have much weight or body behind it, while this tastes of spice, green tea, mild oak and simple red fruits.

title: Dominio de Eguren 2016 Protocolo Made With Organic Grapes Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Rubbery, cheesy berry aromas are earthy and come with a touch of spice. High acidity makes for a tight, drawing palate, while this tastes of tangy plum and currant prior to its scratchy finish.

title: De Muller 2014 Legitim Criança Red (Priorat)
description: Leafy aromas are damp, nutty and not fully clicking. This blend of Garnacha, Merlot and Syrah is hard and tannic, with little to no cushion to the palate. Much like the nose, this is green and earthy tasting, with minty flavors and heat to the finish.

title: Argami 2016 Old Vines Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Yeasty but generic white-fruit aromas come with a hint of vanilla cookie. This feels angular and acidic, not full and complete. Citrus flavors are both briny and sour, while this tastes salty on the finish.

title: Bodegas Fariña 2012 Dama de Toro Crianza  (Toro)
description: Heavy oak results in aromas of maple, clove and wood resin. On the palate, this is sticky and chewy, with rough tannins. Much like this smells, it tastes of wood, clove and milk chocolate more than clean fruit. A spicy clove-driven finish is dense and cheesy.

title: Dominio de Punctum 2016 Lobetia Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Grapy aromas of black cherry are young and fruity but unsophisticated. This everyday Tempranillo is more superficial than deep in build. Sweet as well as peppery black-fruit flavors finish mild.

title: Delia 2016 Tempranillo (Spain)
description: Gritty rubber and latex aromas mix with less than pure berry scents in this wine. Its loud, briny plum and currant flavors finish tart, with wiry acidity.

title: Marques de Griñon 2012 Single Vineyard Estate Bottled Graciano (Dominio de Valdepusa)
description: There are pluses and minuses to this Graciano, and they're glaring. For starters, this is definitively stewed on the nose, such that this smells quite a bit like prune juice. The palate is sappy and massive, not unexpected after a sniff or two. Deep, late-harvest prune and chocolate flavors feed a stocky finish that runs on for a long time.

title: Bodegas Ontañón 2015 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Oaky notes of vanilla and tree bark lead a woody nose toward a punchy palate with sharp acidity. Lean cranberry and sour plum flavors are shearing, while this tastes both gamy and tart on a lean finish with low body weight.

title: Rioja Vega 2018  Rioja
description: Aromas of Band-Aid and foresty berry fruits come with a hint of herbal green. A tangy, zesty palate leans toward angular, while flavors of plum and pie cherry finish crisp, zesty and clean. If ever there was a blueprint middle-of-the-road Tempranillo, this would be it.

title: Monasterio de las Viñas 2016 Special Selection Old Vine Garnacha (Cariñena)
description: Raisiny plum and strawberry aromas are candied and jumpy. Next, a lush palate is both jammy and sappy in feel, while this tastes of raisin and cherry smothered in oak. A warm finish sticks to the candied script.

title: Pagos del Galir 2016 Mencía (Valdeorras)
description: Stalky berry aromas don't pop with much freshness, while this is strapping but heavy on the palate. Stalky berry flavors are roasted and rustic, while this Mencía from Valdeorras tightens up on an edgy finish with muted berry flavors.

title: Legado del Moncayo 2017 Garnacha (Campo de Borja)
description: Red fruit flavors of pomegranate and raspberry are candied, while this Garnacha feels bumpy and rough, without much structure or stuffing. Fresh but candied cherry and raspberry flavors suggest hard candy, while this is entirely basic on the finish.

title: Portal del Montsant 2014 Bruberry Red (Montsant)
description: Cherry cough drop and minerally, almost chlorine aromas lead to an edgy high-acid hard palate. This blend of Carignan, Garnacha and Syrah tastes medicinal and like creamy but fiery red plum. A screechy-feeling, chocolaty-tasting finish leaves an impression.

title: Ego Bodegas 2013 Fuerza Red (Jumilla)
description: A heavy blast of oaky char is the dominant force on the nose. This blend of Monastrell and Cabernet Sauvignon feels cloying. Candied berry and cherry flavors are sugary, baked and oaky, while this finishes with sticky flavors of raisin and sweet milk chocolate.

title: Finca La Estacada 2015 Ocho y Media Tinto Velasco (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: A fruit-forward nose with earthy plum and berry aromas leads to a sharp, lively palate with high acidity. Plum and berry flavors are rendered angular by said acidity, while mild salty notes rise up on the finish.

title: Estefania 2016 Tilenus Godello (Bierzo)
description: Cornbread and murky white fruit aromas barely register as fresh. A standard palate is chunky and a bit flabby, while this tastes of papaya and stale apple prior to a soft finish with some bitterness.

title: Borsao 2017 Macabeo-Chardonnay (Campo de Borja)
description: Tropical fruit and melon aromas are straightforward in this blend of Macabeo and Chardonnay. The palate feels plump, with modest acidity and flavors of white fruits and grape skins.

title: Evaia 2018 Rosé (Rioja)
description: A light and cloudy tint combined with quiet stone-fruit aromas set up a tight, slightly watery palate. Generic flavors of red apple and nectarine finish steady and clean but low on thrills. This is 75% white Viura and 25% Garnacha, which helps explain the light color.

title: Pago de Tharsys 2016 Acedemia de los Nocturnos Bobal (Utiel-Requena)
description: Earthy plum and berry aromas lack concentration and depth. In the mouth, this Bobal is snappy, acidic and slightly raw in feel. Plum and wild berry flavors finish short, with a hint of oxidation.

title: Lágrimas de Maria 2015 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Damp, herbal berry aromas lead to a full palate with rubbery tannins. Soft, stewed berry and spice flavors are low on kick and freshness but don't fold. On the finish, this flattens out and tastes baked and slightly cooked.

title: Las Colinas Del Ebro 2017 Garnatxa Blanca (Terra Alta)
description: Briny citrus and bell pepper aromas amount to a lightly pickled nose. This Garnacha Blanca is solid in feel but common. Short pear and apple flavors are lightly green and vegetal, while a low-acid finish doesn't have much to offer.

title: Valcantara 2015 Old Vine Garnacha (Cariñena)
description: Berry and raisin aromas announce a slightly overripe wine. That's confirmed on the palate, which feels a bit syrupy. Oaky black-fruit flavors are candied, and this Garnacha finishes steady but chunky.

title: Adrás 2016 Mencía (Ribeira Sacra)
description: A heavily oaked nose smells more of milk chocolate and vanilla than natural fruit. On the palate, this is sticky and heavy. Flavors of cocoa and plum are more oak-based than authentic, and it doesn't let go of that dominant oak character on the finish.

title: Bodegas Valdemar 2015 La Gargantilla Garnacha  (Rioja)
description: Raspberry aromas are jammy, reedy and leafy, while on the palate this is hard and sappy, with weight. Jamminess is a recurring theme on this high-priced Garnacha. Flavors of cherry and rhubarb wrap up on an edgy, scrubbing finish.

title: Can Sumoi 2018 Serra de L'Home Xarel-lo (Penedès)
description: This Xarel-lo smells funky, with notes of compost. A fleshy palate is balanced by malic acidity, while this tastes of bitter nectarine and grape skins. A watery tasting finish feels grabby, tight and dry

title: Arrumaco 2018 Garnacha Rosé (Spain)
description: A light mix of peach pit and stalky fruit aromas form the opening on this standard summer sipper. This Garnacha rosé feels grabby, while briny melon flavors hint at cantaloupe prior to a basic finish.

title: Adegas Tollodouro 2018 Pontellón Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Briny, green aromas suggest low ripeness. On the palate, this feels chunky but also spritzy, like fermenting canned fruit. Salty nectarine and bland pineapple flavors are limited on a finish that's neither lively nor complex.

title: Marqués de Cáceres 2017 Made With Organic Grapes  (Rioja)
description: A chunky nose includes aromas of tomato sauce, meat and Band-Aid, meaning this is challenging from the opening gun. A blocky palate is unfocused, with a grape-skins texture, while herbal saucy oaky flavors dominate lightly green-berry-fruit notes.

title: Alta Alella 2016 Mirgin Reserva Brut Nature Rosé Sparkling (Cava)
description: Pink grapefruit and citrus-scented soap aromas form the opening. On the palate, this is fairly chunky, raw and rough. Orange and grapefruit flavors are average prior to a citric finish with pulpy weight.

title: Palacio del Burgo 2014 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Open-grained oak aromas dominate a toasty nose with heat. This feels lean and tomatoey. Flavors of tart plum and pie cherry are almost sour and feel edgy due to severe wood tannins.

title: Bodegas Riojanas 2014 Viña Albina Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Heavy aromas of raisin, oak and chocolate are copied on the palate that tastes of oak, vanilla and raisiny fruit. It has a woody finish.

title: El Prado 2015 Tempranillo-Cabernet Sauvignon (Valencia)
description: Shy plum, berry and milk chocolate aromas come in front of a palate with little more than scratchy tannins. Baked plum flavors are flat, and the finish is mild.

title: Vicente Gandia 2018 Hoya de Cadenas Single Estate Chardonnay (Utiel-Requena)
description: Basic white-fruit aromas are lean and light, while this warm-climate Chardonnay feels citric and lemony, as if the grapes were picked on the early side. Tangy lemon-lime flavors finish clean but short.

title: Navardia 2018 Organic Wine Rosé (Rioja)
description: Yeasty aromas are generally fresh but nonspecific. Shocking acidity makes for a hard-pounding citric palate, while this tastes of blood orange before turning slightly bitter and briny on the finish.

title: Botas de Barro 2016 Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Mild stone-fruit aromas are quiet on the nose. This feels plump on the palate, with dry citrus flavors that are a touch green and bitter.

title: Matsu 2015 El Picaro  (Toro)
description: Plum, berry and spice aromas are a touch volatile. A hard, flush palate is loaded with rubbery tannins. Baked berry, cassis and prune flavors fall off on a finish that tastes slightly cooked.

title: Burgo Viejo 2016 Blanco Viura (Rioja)
description: Flat aromas of lacquer and cured ham are not all that fruity, and the palate on this Viura is not deep or serious. Mildly oxidized flavors of white fruits and ham are more savory than bright. Drink immediately.

title: Bodegas Copaboca 2016 Finca Feroes Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Apple and apricot aromas lead to a simple but healthy palate. Stone fruit and citrus flavors are ample but flatten out on a low-acid finish.

title: Monterebro 2016 Rosado (Jumilla)
description: A reddish color and lean aromas of cherry skins and plum lead to a pinchy, high-acid mouthfeel. Tart flavors of red plum and citrus fruits are a touch foxy and broken, and seem punchy on the finish.

title: Cellers Unió 2016 Clos Dalian Garnacha Blanca (Terra Alta)
description: Mild fruit tones hide behind yeasty aromas. Plump in feel yet not overly intense, the palate deals briny flavors of almond skin, peach pit and melon. On the finish, this lingers with a hint of salt.

title: Mar de Envero 2015 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Apricot and carrot aromas show on the nose. This aging Albariño is pulpy and round in feel, with prickly flavors of melon, bell pepper and bitter pyrazines.

title: Urbina 2017 Viura (Rioja)
description: Waxy yellow apple aromas are less than vital, while this basic Viura feels round and a touch citrusy. Generic citrus flavors get the job done, but that's about it. A finish with a citrus-skins feel and mild oxidized notes says drink this now.

title: Las Valles 2015 Viura-Chardonnay (Cariñena)
description: Yeasty white-fruit aromas lead to a light-bodied affable palate. This blend of Viura and Chardonnay tastes as expected, meaning simple lemon-lime. A mild lees character surfaces on a standard finish.

title: Olivier Rivière 2015 Mirando al Sur Viura (Rioja)
description: Heavy oak gives off sawmill aromas, with only touches of apple and stone-fruit scents lurking below the surface. This feels creamy, heavy and striving for balance. With a ton of oak flavor leading the charge, it tastes woody, candied and spicy, but also jumbled and unfamiliar.

title: Viñas del Vero 2015 La Miranda Secastilla Garnacha Blanca (Somontano)
description: Waxy pear and apple aromas lead to a lean, acidic palate. This Garnacha Blanca from the highest vineyards in Somontano tastes of briny citrus and tart apple. A slightly green finish with pickled notes closes it out.

title: CVNE 2014 Cune Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Murky aromas of leafy plum and compost announce a challenging wine from a difficult vintage. In the mouth, this reserva is outright thin. Tangy, tart plum and red cherry flavors are zesty as well as lightly green and herbal on the finish.

title: Marqués de Frías 2017 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: A gold color and slightly mealy aromas of melon and apple suggest an Albariño that's beginning to break down. Blazing acidity injects needed intensity, while flavors of salty apple finish with a heavy shot of brininess.

title: Sierra Cantabria 2016 Rosé (Rioja)
description: A yeasty nose smells all right but somewhat artificial and not that fruity. A low-acid palate has flavors of melon and grape skins, but the total package seems a touch nutty and prematurely stale. A flat finish is consistent with what came before.

title: Carlos Serres 2016 Viura-Tempranillo Blanco White (Rioja)
