description: Apple and stone-fruit aromas are basic. This wine feels lean and stringy. Tart nectarine, citrus and salty flavors finish light and simple in this Viura with 15% Tempranillo blanco.

title: Filón 2017 Garnacha (Calatayud)
description: Earthy, slightly stalky red fruit aromas are lighter than the palate, which is plump, sticky and resiny. Forced oak is a big part of the flavor profile, which includes clove and berry fruit. A woody, choppy finish with heat is how this Garnacha ends.

title: Angosto 2016 Parcelas De Familia Red (Valencia)
description: Earthy aromas of rubber and olive blend with muddled fruit scents on a hot nose. A choppy, almost cutting palate blazes with acidity, while this blend of Garnacha, Monastrell and Syrah tastes of needly pie cherries and green herbs prior to a rugged finish.

title: Bodegas Soledad 2015 Solmayor Crianza Tempranillo (Uclés)
description: Robust cherry aromas start out earthy and smoky but turn more raisiny the longer this sits. Cutting tartaric acidity is a bracing element that boosts wild berry, spice and chocolate flavors. A rough finish elicits no suggestion of elegance.

title: Coto de Hayas 2017 Garnacha-Syrah (Campo de Borja)
description: Candied berry aromas are convincing enough as they suggest black cherry Kool-Aid. A clampy palate shows rubbery tannins along with modest but solid black fruit flavors. On the finish, this Garnacha-Syrah blend has tannic rub and a grapy aftertaste.

title: Sierra de Viento 2017 Garnacha (Cariñena)
description: Initial gaseous aromas of sulfur, latex and rubber blow off and get replaced by generic berry scents. This standard Garnacha feels pulpy but soft. Candied cherry flavors are on the sweet side and play out on a plump finish.

title: Burgo Viejo 2018  Rioja
description: Reduced berry and black plum aromas include notes of rubber glove and latex. This everyday Rioja feels big and full, but also kind of clumsy. Slightly soupy flavors of plum and rubber remain on the finish.

title: Alberto Orte 2013 La Antigua Clásico White (Rioja)
description: Chemical resiny aromas stand out more than fruit. This Viura-led blend feels tight, tangy and acidic. Salty flavors of persimmon lack fruitiness. This 12% ABV wine from a cold vintage tastes salty on a finish that's living off acidity.

title: Urbina 2016 Viura (Rioja)
description: A light-gold color and mild white-fruit aromas set up a palate with lightly oxidized apple flavors. This Viura seems to be losing steam given that the finish is more bready and cidery in flavor than fresh.

title: Bodegas Lozano 2017 Essence Méditerranéenne Rosé (Spain)
description: Peach and cantaloupe aromas are mostly fresh in front of a pulpy palate with citric acidity. A monotone grapefruit flavor carries over to a finish that's juicy early on, then static.

title: Hilanda 2014 Monastrell (Jumilla)
description: A tidal wave of oak-derived aromas, mostly maple and milk chocolate, engulfs the nose of this Monastrell. On the palate, it's creamy yet wiry, its oaky mint and vanilla flavors blending with acidic tastes of currant and red plum before settling into an oaky, scouring finish.

title: Camina 2016 Verdejo Verdejo (La Mancha)
description: Light, clean apple aromas lead to a basic palate with skin-driven texture. Airy green fruit and citrus peel flavors finish mild and fresh. At 11.5% abv, this is about as light as good wine gets.

title: Bodegas Riojanas 2016 Pregón Verdejo Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Green herb aromas are up front on this wine's slightly stale nose. Its plump melon flavors are short on zing, tasting dry and yeasty with a low-acid finish.

title: Emina 2016 Fermentado en Barrica Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Blaring oak and woodspice aromas rest heavily on this barrel-fermented Verdejo's citrus scents. It's resiny on the palate, with woodspice flavors and mild oxidation.

title: Pago de la Jaraba 2017 Viñedos Propios Sauvignon Blanc (La Mancha)
description: Prickly pyrazine aromas come with notes of pineapple and banana. This is medium in body, with a beam of ringing acidity that forms the baseline of this La Mancha SB. Flavors of grapefruit and green herbs are steady on a dry citric finish.

title: Zinio 2016  Rioja
description: Gamy herbal red-berry aromas come with a whiff of wild field. This Garnacha feels rubbery and tannic. Red-plum and currant flavors are backed by prune notes, while this is jammy and raisiny tasting on the finish.

title: Pepe Raventós 2017 Vinya del Noguer Xarel-lo (Spain)
description: This cloudy unfiltered Xarel-lo smells vaguely of citrus on a lightly oxidized nose. The palate is kept tight by citric acidity, while this tastes of salt water, sour apple and tart nectarine. High acidity lends length to a funky grape skins-driven finish.

title: Quinta Promesa 2017 Mencía (Bierzo)
description: A hot, oaky and resiny nose offers candied berry scents. On the palate, this feels clampy and raw, with tomatoey acidity. Woody flavors of campfire and barbecue smoke finish with clove and spicy wood grain notes.

title: Larchago 2018 Viura (Rioja)
description: Sharp, prickly aromas are driven by pyrazines, while this feels like it smells: tangy and citric, with zip. Pointed tangerine and grapefruit flavors finish juicy and green. Overall, this is much like Verdejo or Sauvignon Blanc.

title: Bodegas Aragonesas 2016 Viña Temprana Old Vines Garnacha (Campo de Borja)
description: This wine's bright raspberry and plum aromas are typical of basic Garnacha. Its fresh, racy palate isn't heavily structured, offering a simple mix of plum, oak and chocolate flavors.

title: Bodegas Copaboca 2015 Finca Feroes Roble  (Ribera del Duero)
description: This wine's raisiny aromas include smoked meat and chocolate notes. It's intensely tannic on the palate, tasting mostly of chocolaty oak and vanilla. That oak dominates the finish, leaving a carob flavor.

title: Bodegas El Cidacos 2011 Conde Otiñano Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Heavy oak dominates the nose of this wine, creating milky notes of vanilla and carob. The palate is choppy with tannins and herbal red plum and currant flavors. It ends with mint and green notes.

title: Can Petit 2016 Single Estate Rosado Sparkling (Cava)
description: Rustic, funky aromas are low on ripeness and suggest pickled red cabbage. A high-acid palate offers stalky red fruit flavors prior to a short finish that's shy in body and complexity.

title: Castillo de Monjardin 2017 La Cantera Garnacha (Navarra)
description: Gummy berry and cherry aromas are on the sweet side, while this feels wiry, with red plum acidity. Plum and grapy berry flavors are short and hollow, while this is lightly abrasive on an acidic finish.

title: Scala Dei 2016 Garnatxa (Priorat)
description: Rubbery aromas of latex and sulfur give way to jumpy red-berry and animal notes. A jammy sappy palate requires airing to show its best, while this varietal Garnatxa tastes of herbal raspberry and red plum. A rubbery grating finish fits the overall package.

title: Cellers Unió 2017 Clos Dalian Garnacha Blanca (Terra Alta)
description: This Garnacha Blanca's lime and dusty apple aromas lead to a plump, simple palate with little direction. Its lightly briny white fruit flavors are generic and a bit flat.

title: Príncipe de Viana 2017 Edición Blanca Chardonnay-Sauvignon Blanc (Navarra)
description: This wine's generic white fruit aromas are indicative of neither the Sauvignon Blanc nor the Chardonnay in this blend. It's chunky on the palate, with cactus, tarragon and green citrus notes. A texturally solid finish ensures that this leaves a mostly positive final impression.

title: Pingao 2015  Rioja
description: This Rioja's gritty berry aromas include hints of pepper, asphalt and animal fur. It's clipped and raw, with oak-laden herbal plum and berry flavors. A burnt oak character rests heavily on the finish.

title: Pregón 2017 Verdejo (Rueda)
description: This wine's punchy citrus and nectarine aromas signal a basic Verdejo. It's fresh but light, with moderate acidity, dry melony flavors and a steady, briny-tasting finish.

title: Bodegas Cerrosol 2015 Monte Palma Sauvignon Blanc (Rueda)
description: Although this smells a bit oily, gritty and pyrazinic—an indication that it's living on borrowed time—at the moment this SB is still in fairly good shape. Pithy grapefruit flavors finish plump and citrusy. Drink immediately.

title: La Legua 2013 Roble Tempranillo (Cigales)
description: Abrasive aromas of cherry and red plum are medicinal and rudimentary. This feels clamped and severely tannic. Foxy berry and buttery oak flavors finish choppy, with prodding acidity.

title: Tossals 2014 Junior Red (Montsant)
description: Grassy raspberry and cherry aromas are a bit leathery. This Carignan-Garnacha-Syrah blend feels saturated but not entirely comfortable. Jammy ripe mixed-berry flavors are chunky, candied and finish hot, with chocolaty oak.

title: Bodegas Bleda 2017 Castillo de Jumilla Monastrell (Jumilla)
description: Scratchy, oaky aromas of pencil eraser, wood grain, vanilla and raspberry lead to a dense thick chewy palate. Herbal, salty plum and berry flavors finish tannic, grabby and sticky.

title: Valdelana 2017  Rioja
description: Initial aromas of bubble gum and hand soap turn more fruity and legit with airing. A wiry palate pinches down, while this tastes of plum, berry fruits and the dust that comes with baseball-card gum. A wide grabby finish is more clumsy than exact.

title: Borsao 2016 Tres Picos Garnacha (Campo de Borja)
description: A ton of oak is the greeting on this Garnacha, and with that come palpable notes of clove and chocolate. A fully extracted palate feels thick and saturated, while this tastes of clove, barbecued meat and wood resin. Over the years, this wine has become more woody, charred and manipulated.

title: Casa de la Ermita 2015 Joven Monastrell-Syrah (Jumilla)
description: Ripe roasted black-plum and berry aromas are wild and a touch hot. This is jumpy, angular and pumped to the brim with acidity. Foxy currant and red-plum flavors show a baking-spice element, while this is racy and rugged on the finish. Best for burgers and pizza.

title: Palma Real 2018 Verdejo-Viura (Rueda)
description: Briny citrus aromas are a bit sweaty and pyrazinic. This 50–50 blend of Verdejo and Viura is plump, with modest citrusy zest to the palate. Green melon and carrot flavors finish without much drive or pop.

title: Burgo Viejo 2015 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Damp berry aromas come with a covering of chemical oak. A smacking palate is tannic and aggressive, while this tastes of berry fruits giving way to prune and raisin. A tough finish is fitting.

title: Alta Alella 2016 Lanius Organic White (Alella)
description: A heavy coating of oak aromas gives this midlevel white blend a resiny outlook. In the mouth, this is medium in body but flabby due to low acidity. A flavor profile based mostly on oak includes notes of popcorn and butter, while this is woody and less than precise on the finish.

title: San Antonio Abad 2017 Delicioso Tempranillo (La Mancha)
description: Scalped raspberry and plum aromas are limited. This feels round but awkward, while candied plum flavors lead to a rubbery-feeling finish with the same flavors that came before.

title: Trencalòs 2017 Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Candied red fruit aromas are youthful and punchy. A light-to-medium palate is basic in composition, while this Tempranillo tastes of plum, raspberry, tomato and peppery spice. A juicy but simple finish brings this to a close.

title: Bodegas Aragonesas 2017 Aragus Made with Organic Grapes Garnacha (Campo de Borja)
description: Aromas of clove and red fruits are pushed by boisterous oaky tones. Clove and baking spice notes on top of easy berry fruit flavors are smoky and forced, while clove, campfire and barbecue flavors are more than a Garnacha of this quality can handle.

title: Montefiel 2014 Reserva Serie Limitada Red (Terra Alta)
description: Wayward, slightly strange aromas of cinnamon and earthy funk cloud the fruit on this blend of Merlot, Garnacha and Tempranillo. The palate is beefy and thick, while berry flavors are a bit soupy and strained, with a suggestion of vinegar.

title: Cellers Unió 2018 Clos Dalian Garnacha Blanca (Terra Alta)
description: Year to year, this quaffable Garnacha Blanca rates about the same. This new vintage opens with woolly aromas of apple and pear. A low-voltage palate is light in weight and depth, while this tastes of underripe honeydew melon, celery and lettuce.

title: Lusco 2016 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Golden in color and heavy on the apricot and peach aromas, this seems just past its prime. Citrusy acidity keeps the palate jumpy, while apple and spiced pear flavors lose steam on the unsculpted finish.

title: Beronia 2016 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Punchy red-fruit aromas of plum and raspberry are lightly oaked. This everyday Rioja is fiery on the palate, with red-alert acidity. That means the flavors are sharp and hard driving—good for pizza and carne asada tacos.

title: Bodegas Martinez Corta 2017 Cepas Antiguas Selección Privada  (Rioja)
description: Roasted plum, berry and clove aromas set up a tough, saucy palate with pronounced tannins. Tomato, spiced plum and cinnamon flavors are a bit raw, as is a lean finish.

title: Arrocal 2014 Passión  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Minty black fruit and grilled meat aromas lend this wine a green, herbaceous tone. Its tannic palate tastes of weedy berries and burnt wood. Herbal, green notes and raw tannins overpower the finish, feeling underripe at every point.

title: La Purísima 2018 White (Yecla)
description: Lemon-lime aromas are slightly green, while this feels round but flat along its edges. Citrusy flavors are more round than sharp, while this holds onto its fullness through the finish.

title: Paco & Lola 2018 Nº 12 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Apple and melon aromas are generic and include a touch of mustard, while this feels soft and short on cut. Candied white-fruit flavors come across as sugary, while this tastes sweet and feels a bit bland on the finish.

title: Vivanco 2011 Colección Vivanco Dulce de Invierno Late Harvest Red (Rioja)
designation: Colección Vivanco Dulce de Invierno Late Harvest
description: An aromatic opening of compost and vinegar might suggest casting this aside. But flavors of strawberry and chocolate, along with an admitted weedy note, amount to something decent. Finishing notes of brown sugar and berry syrup are chocolaty and ensure that this finishes better than it begins.

title: Dolmo 2017 Roble  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Jumbled aromas include bits of red-flower petal, reedy red fruits, sugar beet, green herbs and wood. A shearing palate, with piercing acidity, calls for food, airing and patience; this tastes of herbal cherry and red plum, while the finish narrows down to an essence of red fruits and acidity.

title: Príncipe de Viana 2017 Garnacha Rosé (Navarra)
description: Mild pyrazine-based aromas of bell pepper and hard spices blend with red-apple-skin scents on a midlevel nose. A narrow mouthfeel lacks elasticity, while this tastes of salt and savory tomato sauce. Savory more than fruity, this isn't bad.

title: Mas d'en Gil 2016 Bellmunt Vi de Vila White (Priorat)
description: A light color and simple aromas of apple juice are less than serious. A minimal palate doesn't have much to say, while this tastes of apple and green pyrazines. As a whole, this blend of Garnacha Blanca and Viognier is reasonably good but bland.

title: Finca Constancia 2015 Parcela 52 Verdejo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Distinct yet unusual aromas of vanilla extract and butterscotch announce and confirm that this was barrel fermented. Low vibrancy and bounce on the palate create a sense of flat heaviness. Salty peach and melon flavors are buried in wood spice, while this tastes dry, pithy and resiny on a mild finish.

title: Vara 2018 Garnacha Rosado (Spain)
description: Flat aromas are cheesy, with notes of papaya and cantaloupe. On the palate, this rosé of Garnacha feels citric and grabby, while salty flavors of melon turn yeasty and slightly oxidized on the finish.

title: Bodegas Bilbainas 2018 Viña Pomal Rosé (Rioja)
description: Chewing gum aromas are simple and mild, while this blend of Garnacha and Viura feels lean and punchy. Yeasty flavors offer only a touch of fruit, while this is fresh and healthy but bland on the finish.

title: Bodegas Paniza 2016 Viura (Cariñena)
description: Apple and citrus aromas are spunky but briny and stalky. This basic Viura has good body, with bright acidity. Sweet lime and citrus-peel flavors hold steady on the finish.

title: Alta Alella 2015 Capsigrany Organic Sparkling (Cava)
description: This tan-colored brut nature opens with yeasty aromas of brioche and oxidized apple. A foamy palate lacks clarity and smoothness, while this tastes like it smells: briny, yeasty and mildly oxidized. A fruitless finish is simply dry and bready.

title: Zumaya 2016  Ribera del Duero
description: Jammy black currant aromas are rooty and medicinal. This young Tempranillo is hard and smacking on the palate. A forced-oak flavor of clove is dominant, while this is drying and raw on the finish.

title: Bodegas Corral 2016 Don Jacobo Viura (Rioja)
description: This wine is citrus-driven on the nose, leading to a streamlined palate of apple, green melon and almond skin flavors.

title: Cantaburros 2015  Ribera del Duero
description: Berry and plum scents suggest powdered drink mix. A narrow palate feels austere, while this tastes of tart black plum with mineral tones. On the finish, this dries out quickly as it leaves grating residual tannins.

title: Bodegas Escudero 2015 Solar de Becquer  (Rioja)
description: Punchy raspberry and red-plum aromas are light and airy. That also describes the palate, which is dilute and lacks stuffing. Flavors of raspberry Kool-Aid and mild oak are fresh and floral on the finish. This may do best as a chilled simple sipper.

title: Bodegas Paniza 2015 Agostón Viura-Chardonnay (Cariñena)
description: White-fruit aromas are generic but satisfactory. This mix of Viura and Chardonnay is plump to the point of being slightly cloying. Candied melon and lime flavors finish short, with residual sweetness.

title: Val de Los Frailes 2010 Crianza Tempranillo (Cigales)
description: Gritty, tarry aromas are front and center on a hard bouquet. This Crianza feels brutally tannic. Gritty flavors of burnt berry and road tar reflect the nose, while this tastes like blackened creosote on a rough finish.

title: El Coto 2015 White (Rioja)
description: This is so light in color it almost looks like water. Oily aromas suggest tropical fruits, while this feels lean and somewhat dilute. Pithy citrus is the key flavor, while an acidic finish shows a note of papaya.

title: Carlos Serres 2015 White (Rioja)
description: Aromas of stone-fruit pit and citrus peel are punchy. This blend of Viura and Tempranillo Blanco feels solid. Pithy grapefruit and salty flavors carry over to the finish of this everyday white.

title: Bovale 2015 Bobal (Utiel-Requena)
description: A nose comprised of bubble gum, floral plum, berry fruit and oak aromas is simple and sweet. This exudes hard rubbery tannins, while flavors of milk chocolate, cherry and marshmallow end with a hint of vanilla along with a reprise of hard tannins.

title: Bodega Virgen de la Sierra 2015 Albada Viña Viejas Macabeo (Calatayud)
description: Generic mild citrus aromas come with a note of compost. This Macabeo feels round but basic. Dry limited flavors of papaya and citrus fruits finish slightly briny.

title: Finca Montepedroso 2015 Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Peachy aromas are pulpy and lack sizzle. This feels loose and wide, with modest acidity. Dry, peppery flavors are low on fruit, while this feels fleshy on the finish, with mildly bitter citrus notes.

title: Agustí Torelló Mata 2015 Reserva Brut Rosé Trepat (Cava)
description: Yeasty aromas include notes of compost and damp leaves. On the palate, this is crisp but also tomatoey in feel. Flavors of cherry tomato, citrus and green herb settle on a tart, dry, limited finish. This is 100% Trepat.

title: Condes de Albarei 2018 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: This wine offers a mild intensity of melon and nectarine flavors that finish with notes of grape skins and salt. This is straightforward yet fresh, lending easy-drinking appeal.

title: Otazu 2009 Altar Cabernet Sauvignon (Pago de Otazu)
description: Spicy aromas of berry fruits and green herbs are typical of just-ripe to not-so-ripe Cabernet. A tight and tannic palate is not expansive, while much like the nose, this tastes of herbal black fruits and bell pepper. Very dry tannins make for a scratchy finish.

title: La Zorra 2014 Teso de la Media Fanega Rufete (Sierra de Salamanca)
description: Earthy aromas of roasted red plum blend with scents of latex and cured meat on a jumbled nose. Like any Rufete, this feels drawing and rubbery, with choppy tannins. Flavors of tomato, currant and red plum are tart and narrow on a drawing finish.

title: Vicente Gandia 2015 Hoya de Cadenas Crianza Shiraz (Utiel-Requena)
description: Condensed aromas of herbal berry fruits do not unfurl, while this feels tight and sticky on the palate, with rubbery tannins. Flavors of red plum, currant and tomato are savory on a finish with pasty oak notes.

title: Protos 2015  Ribera del Duero
description: A heavily oaked nose of berry fruits quickly gets taken over by creamy milk chocolate and clove scents. An overextracted tannic palate holds flavors of burnt wood and blackened spices. On the finish, this wine is so charred and woody that it tastes bitter.

title: Castell d'Encus 2014 Taleia White (Costers del Segre)
description: A severe sense of funk and sweat is the aromatic greeting on this Sauvignon Blanc-Semillón blend. A crisp, citric palate tastes green, like lime and tarragon. On the finish, this is tight and stony, with overt citric acidity.

title: Familia Bastida 2016 Paraje de Titos Garnacha (La Mancha)
description: A bulky nose is oaked up, creamy and a bit green. Next, a full palate collapses inward and feels sticky and resiny, while this Garnacha tastes of plum and blackberry along with graphite and oak. Chocolate is the lead flavor on a rubbing, heavy finish.

title: Tossals 2015 Junior Red (Montsant)
description: A vibrant purple color and foxy berry aromas announce the jammy palate and punchy acidity of this wine. It tastes of herbal plums and berries and doesn't hold up on the oaky, pulpy finish.

title: Príncipe de Viana 2015 Garnacha Rosado (Navarra)
description: This everyday wine feels chunky due to low acidity. Its dusty aromas are generic and not very fruity or expressive, and its meandering cherry and plum flavors precede a simple finish.

title: Borsao 2015 Tocado Garnacha (Campo de Borja)
description: Horsey blackberry and cherry aromas come with a note of latex. In the mouth, this is choppy and abrupt. Raw berry flavors finish with a mild sensation of heat.

title: Lamin 2010 Viñas Viejas Garnacha (Calatayud)
description: Heavy oak is a front-row theme throughout this tannic, extracted, black-tinted Garnacha. Hot fudge sundae and sawmill aromas lead to a palate that's as tannic as sandpaper. Its charred, heavily oaked flavors finish chocolaty, with a lasting and overbearing taste of clove, lacking balance and clarity of fruit.

title: Pluvium 2016 Merseguera-Sauvignon Blanc (Valencia)
description: This sound, basic white blend is made from Merseguera and Sauvignon Blanc grapes. Its apple and melon flavors are tasty but simple, the fruit falling off quickly on the finish. Drink now.

title: Pradorey 2014 Adaro  (Ribera del Duero)
description: This Ribera del Duero smells more forced than natural, dominated by oak and clove scents. Its tough, woody palate matches the nose, with resiny berry and plum flavors. On the finish, a strong clove flavor is backed by modest berry fruit.

title: Finca Albret 2015 Garnacha (Navarra)
description: Flat, earthy raisin and prune aromas in this Garnacha indicate very ripe, almost desiccated fruit. The palate is much like the nose: flat and low on vitality. Jammy blueberry and herbal flavors finish chunky, without lift or nuance.

title: Manuel Manzaneque Suárez 2015 Fatum Red (La Mancha)
description: Reedy, slightly green red berry aromas come with oaky milk chocolate notes in this blend of 80% Tempranillo and 20% Bobal. Its woody, lean flavors are shy on fruit, tasting mostly of oak on the scratchy finish.

title: Viña Bujanda 2016 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Resiny green oak aromas give this a damp, foresty outlook. On the palate, this is compact almost to the point that it caves in. Cherry and red berry flavors come in front of a minty finish that struggles to hold up.

title: Pago de la Jaraba 2015 Azagador Cosecha Viñedos Propios Red (La Mancha)
description: Although its oaky plum and berry aromas smell a bit like sweet plastic, this is largely harmonious on the palate. Bright acidity pumps up its blackberry, plum and milk chocolate flavors, remaining racy on the finish.

title: Legado de Orniz 2017 Cindus  (Toro)
description: An opaque purple color is ominous and backed by a raisiny nose that's sun-baked and sleepy. An oversize palate is tannic, while flavors of milk chocolate and bourbon barrel give this an oaky, forced character. A shallow finish confirms that this is a size-over-substance RDD.

title: Vicente Gandia 2017 Hoya de Cadenas Bobal Single Estate Rosé (Utiel-Requena)
designation: Hoya de Cadenas Bobal Single Estate
description: Powdery, slightly soapy aromas lack fruit and freshness. In the mouth, this rosé of Bobal is round and in decent shape, but with only mild acidity. Nonspecific orange and nectarine flavors finish short, without cleansing power.

title: Carlos Serres 2016 Old Vines  (Rioja)
description: Generic berry and plum flavors lead to a pulling palate with clamping tannins and high acidity. Plum, black-fruit and olive flavors are choppy prior to a tight-as-nails finish.

title: Sonsierra 2016  Rioja
description: Aromas of road tar, blackberry and rubber are a touch chemical but not bad. A raw palate with rubbery tannins is home to generic plum and berry flavors. A dry rubbery-feeling finish is appropriate for this everyday Tempranillo.

title: Telmo Rodríguez 2016 Basa Blanco Verdejo-Viura (Rueda)
description: Light dusty aromas are mildly sweaty and green. This Verdejo-Viura blend is crisp and stony, without much body weight. Dry lime and citrus pith flavors are briny, while nopal and grapefruit flavors come into play on a bracing finish.

title: Eguren 2015 Viura (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Dry lime and citrus peel aromas are round and solid, nothing more. That more or less describes the palate, which tastes a little bit wheaty and dull, with a note of bitter melon on the finish. Drink now.

title: Aldonia 2017 Vendimia  (Rioja)
description: A reduced nose smells of iodine, latex and olive more than bright fruit. A big, extracted palate is clumsy and scraping, while plum and wild berry flavors transition to chocolate and coffee before finishing rough and edgy, with residual medicinal notes.

title: Tres Ojos 2016 Old Vines Garnacha (Calatayud)
description: Hot asphalt and stalky red berry aromas are at the heart of a nose that's shy on ripeness and charm. On the palate, this is hard like a box of nails. Herbal, gritty plum flavors finish with loud oak and edgy, scratchy residual tannins.

title: Vicente Gandia 2016 El Miracle 120 Aniversario Shiraz-Garnacha Rosé (Valencia)
description: This blend of Shiraz and Garnacha is simple on the palate, with modest acidity. Powdery berry and stone-fruit aromas are basic.

title: Covila 2015 Adivino Tinto Joven  (Rioja)
description: Fiery cherry cough-drop aromas are basic at best, crude at worst. Bright and wiry in feel, this tastes of medicinal red fruits.

title: Naia 2018 K-Naia Verdejo-Sauvignon Blanc (Rueda)
description: Soft aromas of Bartlett pear and applesauce are ripe in this blend of Verdejo and Sauvignon Blanc. In the mouth, this is oily and pulpy, with only modest acidic cut. Peachy flavors fade out on a plump finish.

title: Coto de Hayas 2015 Garnacha-Syrah (Campo de Borja)
description: Although this opens with foxy aromas that suggest moderate to sketchy ripeness, this Garnacha-Syrah blend feels pretty good. Mild oak, plum and berry flavors are racy on an acidic finish.

title: Batán de Salas 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Somontano)
description: Oaky resiny spicy aromas are an indicator of what's to come. This has a scratchy mouthfeel and resiny notes akin to licking a plank of wood. A heavily oaked flavor profile tastes mostly of dry wood and clove. On the finish, wood-spice flavors and drying tannins are in control and don't let go.

title: Grandes Vinos y Viñedos 2016 El Circo Acróbata Garnacha (Cariñena)
description: Scratchy plum and berry aromas are a bit gummy. A jammy palate with strawberry and raspberry flavors shows off the fruity red side of Garnacha, while a raspberry flavor lingers on a finish with mild heat and burn.

title: Aspaldi 2014 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Earthy plum, cherry, spice and tobacco aromas are familiar to Rioja. A high-acid medium-bodied palate is austere and hard as nails. Tart red-fruit flavors finish racy and fiery, with excess gas in the tank.

title: Hiruzta 2016 Hondarrabi Zuri (Getariako Txakolina)
description: Light aromas of green melon and white fruits lead to a plump, slightly flat palate. Pithy citrus and bitter herb flavors are prominent, while this no-spritz Txakoli reverberates with citrus and tangy green-apple notes on the finish.

title: Verdeal 2018 Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Punchy tangerine and lemongrass aromas show some force, while this Verdejo feels pulpy and citric in a common way. Spicy green-herb and citrus flavors fall off on a short finish.

title: Bodegas Luzón 2018 Luzón Verde Made with Organic Grapes Monastrell (Jumilla)
designation: Luzón Verde Made with Organic Grapes
description: Soapy red-berry aromas lack ease and seem a touch artificial, while this is bright and smacking on the palate. Plum and currant flavors are direct and basic through a lively finish.

title: Trus 2016 Roble  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Band-Aid and latex aromas are big parts of a jumbled nose. In the mouth, this is basic, with sappy acidity and chewy thickness. Meaty plum and cherry flavors are oaky and a touch green, while this is generic on the finish.

title: Vallobera 2015 Familia San Pedro Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Oak-blanketed plum aromas are barely up to the heavy clove and rubber notes that are out front. A choppy, tannic palate qualifies as rough, while this tastes more of oak, clove and spice than vivid fruit.

title: Campellares 2017  Rioja
description: Foxy berry aromas are accompanied by forceful notes of raisin and wet dog fur. On the palate, this is full but edgy and grinding. Generic berry and raisin flavors finish with hints of prune and cocoa powder.

title: Mocén 2016 Eco Made From Organic Grapes Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Light in color, with basic apple and green-melon aromas, this is a mild Verdejo with a fairly plump mouthfeel. A cross of melon and citrus flavors falls off on the finish before turning bitter.

title: Bodegas San Valero 2018 Particular Fermentado en Barrica Chardonnay (Cariñena)
description: Soft pear and oak aromas lead to plump palate with citrus peel notes. Savory, oaky nectarine flavors are saucy, while this turns more briny on a basic but solid finish.

title: Antaño 2014 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Stemmy, musky aromas of clove and men's cologne announce a big and overwrought palate that could use more lift and elegance. Toasty, peppery berry flavors transition to tomatoey and herbal prior to a finish that simmers with toasty oak but not much fruit.

title: Hacienda Urbión 2016 Cuvée White (Rioja)
description: Aromas of fruit salad are simplistic. On the palate, this feels citrusy and grabby. Short flavors of green melon and yeast turn mildly bitter and suggest grape skins on a plump finish.

title: Bodegas Luzón 2014 Luzón Blanco Macabeo (Jumilla)
description: Briny citrus and petrol aromas are unusual for Macabeo. This basic white tastes like lemon-infused water. Yeasty, leesy white-fruit flavors are low on steam. Drink Now.

title: Avancia 2018 Cuvée de O Godello (Valdeorras)
description: Grassy aromas include a hint of clover, while this Godello is medium in body. Simple pear and melon flavors lack clarity and precision, while the finish doesn't offer much due to low acidity. While good, this vintage seems a click to two below what the wine normally offers.

title: Viña Palaciega 2014 Joven  (Rioja)
description: Floral aromas of rose hips and scents of plum and spiced tomato comprise the nose of this light-bodied Rioja. Floral raspberry and exotic spice flavors finish airy juicy and light. Drink this easygoer with a light chill.

title: Ochoa 2013 Crianza Tempranillo (Navarra)
description: Rubbery black cherry and olive aromas are gritty and not that ripe. Similarly, the palate on this Tempranillo is hard, narrow and tannic. Short red plum and berry flavors shrink up on a finish with the texture of apple skins.

title: Borsao 2017 Garnacha (Campo de Borja)
description: Murky berry and milk chocolate aromas are not bad, while this feels lively, with perky acidity and rubbing tannins. Grapy flavors of plum and currant finish with berry and spice notes as well as some heat.

title: Raventós de Alella 2017 Pansa Blanca (Alella)
description: Yeasty apple aromas are a bit harsh and muddled, while this varietal Xarel-lo feels plump, pulpy and chunky. Earthy, murky apple flavors finish flat and with a grape skins flavor.

title: Really Awesome Wine 2018 Raw Organic & Vegan Villanueva de Alcardete Rosé (Spain)
designation: Raw Organic & Vegan Villanueva de Alcardete
description: A hot pink color and dusty, candied aromas that smell like no known fruit lead to a dilute palate with little acidity or core intensity. Rhubarb and melon flavors are mild prior to an inoffensive finish. This rosé of Tempranillo comes from Toledo in central Spain.

title: Latúe 2017 Made with Organic Grapes Tempranillo (La Mancha)
description: Cooked berry and plum aromas qualify as rustic. On the palate, this Tempranillo is grabby and scrubbing. Herbal plum and tomato sauce flavors are raw on the finish.

title: Las Margas 2017 Garnacha (Cariñena)
description: Murky cherry and plum aromas set up a rubbery, abrasive palate with tartaric burn. Sharp plum flavors come with a hint of vinegar, while this Garnacha tastes of hard spice and tart plum on the finish.

title: Borsao 2017 Rosé (Campo de Borja)
description: Aromas of terpenes and grape skins make this simple rosé a bit rough upfront. In the mouth, this is more grabby than easy flowing, while short pops of apricot and peach flavors flatten out on a mildly bitter finish.

title: Conde de Altava 2015 Joven Viura (Rioja)
description: Briny pickled aromas are just clean enough to pass muster. This simple Viura is lemony and tangy on the palate, with saline-influenced flavors of citrus fruits and bell pepper. On a snappy finish, a briny flavor leads the way.

title: Alvides 2016 Roble  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Aromas of olive and rubber share the nose with leathery berry scents. A meaty, fleshy palate is cut by sharp acidity, while this tastes of lightweight plum, berry and ginger. Lastly, a briny note seeps onto a grabby finish.

title: Venta Morales 2015 Made With Organic Grapes Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Heavy oak aromas sit atop wiry plum and spice scents. This feels tannic and tough, with up-front oak and herbal berry flavors. A dry tannic, spicy finish features palpable oak that tastes forced and like plastic.

title: Lo Nuevo 2015 Covello Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Lemon and apple aromas precede a high-acid citric palate without much elegance or finesse. This pedestrian Albariño deals pithy orange flavors that come with a note of grape skins. On the finish, this seems like orange juice.

title: Dominio de Eguren 2016 Protocolo Red (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Slightly soupy plum and berry aromas open this generic red blend. A fleshy, tannic palate is mildly abrasive, while blueberry, cassis and herbal flavors are a touch green before hinting at chocolate and plum on a grabby finish.

title: Luzia de Ripa 2015  Txakoli de Álava
description: Cidery aromas are, at best, sturdy. This has shearing acidity along with an oily round mouthfeel. Sour stone-fruit and citrus flavors finish with lasting notes of tart green apple. This is a still Txakoli: don't expect spritz or bubbles.

title: Campos de Risca 2013 Estate Wine Organic Monastrell-Syrah (Jumilla)
description: Dusty aromas of desert brush, oak, blueberry, animal hide and green herbs are strained. This feels raw and choppy, while reedy herbal red-fruit flavors finish with a note of raisin. This Monastrell (with 10% Syrah) is okay but all over the map.

title: Bodegas Isidro Milagro 2015 SPÑ Red (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Prickly berry aromas include notes of both candied raspberry and cinnamon. This feels a bit clunky and sticky, with sugary berry flavors and a slightly cloying finish.

title: Dominio de Eguren 2015 Protocolo Rosé (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Dusty aromas of chewing gum are a little strange, while this is chunky, creamy and a bit oily on the palate. Dry melon and papaya flavors are mild and finish with little to no oomph. Drink now or wait for the 2016 to appear in the spring.

title: Viñedos Balmoral 2014 Edoné Gran Cuvée Rosé Sparkling (Spain)
description: Lightly floral aromas lead to a foamy palate with grapefruit-like acidity. Flavors follow suit, namely pink grapefruit in a freshly squeezed style. A grape-skins texture makes for a raw, citric finish.

title: Txakoli Primo 2018 Zarautz Hondarrabi Zuri (Getariako Txakolina)
description: Almost no color and lightly tropical aromas of melon and lime are underwhelming. This lean Txakoli owns a soda-like disposition, with flavors of lemon-lime soda that finish dry and stony.

title: La Candelaria 2014 Senda 66 Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Punchy, herbal red fruit aromas come with vanilla and clove notes as well as some greenness. A scratchy-feeling palate sees a dominant woody clove flavor snuff out this Tempranillo's fruit character, while a spicy finish remains woody and noticeably green.

title: Manuel Manzaneque Suárez 2016 Fatum Tempranillo-Bobal Red (La Mancha)
description: Stalky aromas border on weedy, and overall this blend of Tempranillo and Bobal lacks clarity and ripeness on the nose. In the mouth, this is compact but fails to spread its wings. Mulchy berry flavors come with green notes in front of a similar tasting finish helped out by good feel.

title: Vicente Gandia 2015 Finca Del Mar Crianza Tempranillo (Valencia)
description: Cherry and red currant aromas are compact, with notes of wet earth and damp animal fur. A reduced palate is drawing, while this shows narrow black fruit and peppery flavors in front of a sappy finish that hollows out little by little.

title: Bodegas Ondarre 2015 Rivallana Crianza  (Rioja)
description: A nose heavy with aromas of compost and mulched leaves offers only minimal fruit. On the palate, this is decidedly raw and angular. Zesty but sharp currant and cranberry flavors finish scratchy and lightly abrasive.

title: Navas 1212 2016 Joven  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Candied red fruit aromas are rudimentary while suggesting sugar beets. A fleshy, widespread palate delivers herbal plum flavors, while this is short on the finish.

title: Avancia 2016 Cuvée de O Mencía (Valdeorras)
description: Furry, fluffy aromas of cotton candy and berry jam announce a wiry wine with hard tannins. Grapy plum and sour berry flavors are gamy as a whole. This Mencía remains challenging, hard-edged and not fully satisfying through the finish.

title: Bodegas Lacort 2014 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Cherry and hand-soap aromas barely make the grade. This feels raw and lean. Cranberry and plum-skin flavors finish herbal, spicy and not really ripe. This is a highly snappy Crianza without much flare.

title: Viña San Juan 2015 White (La Mancha)
description: This blend of Chardonnay, Viura and Verdejo is light in body, with stalky haystack aromas and dilute nectarine and melon flavors. Its yeasty finish is somewhat bland.

title: Albet I Noya 2018 Curiós Xarel-lo (Penedès)
description: This Xarel-lo opens with murky aromas that are not entirely clean. A round but shapeless palate tastes of lightly oxidized apple and melon, while this is texturally grabby and thick on the finish. Drink as soon as possible.

title: Viña Pérez 2018 Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Sweaty, gritty citrus aromas run heavy on pyrazines. A tight, crisp palate holds grassy flavors of green herbs and citrus fruits, while this Verdejo veers toward green vegetable flavors on the finish.

title: Viñedos de Alfaro 2016 VA! Carbonic Maceration  (Rioja)
description: This carbonic-macerated wine smells grapy, with no breadth to the nose. Following suit, this feels jammy and a bit gummy. Candied, medicinal berry and plum flavors are compacted on a short finish.

title: Viñedos y Bodegas Pablo 2016 Menguante Selección Garnacha (Cariñena)
description: Stewy aromas of raisin and prune include a warm note of leather. This Garnacha feels tannic and jammy. Flavors of raisin, blackberry and loud oak finish soft and jammy, with little to no structure.

title: Enanzo 2017 Garnacha Rosé (Navarra)
description: A dark color translates to chunky aromas of stone fruits and grape skins. This full-bodied Garnacha rosé delivers odd peachy flavors that break down and show mild bitterness. A wayward unfocused finish is not a surprise.

title: Bodegas Luzón 2018 Luzó Coleccion Blanco White (Jumilla)
description: Uncomplicated melon and yeasty vanilla aromas precede a ripe and lively palate, with punchy citrus, melon and tropical-fruit flavors. Tangy acidity pushes this basic white blend from Spain's southeast.

title: Bodegas Aragonesas 2014 Don Ramón Red (Campo de Borja)
description: Off the bat, this smells a bit like fruit punch, although with time it stiffens. A chunky heavy somewhat flat palate tastes of clove, chocolate and berry and plum.

title: Luis Saenz 2017 Viura (Rioja)
description: Peach and nectarine aromas are simple and yeasty. Standard melony flavors rank as quiet, while on the finish this basic Viura is vapid and showing signs of fading.

title: Marqués de Cáceres 2017 Deusa Nai Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: A light color and stalky aromas of briny white fruits precede a chunky palate with a cidery mouthfeel. Briny stone-fruit and stale pineapple flavors don't have much to say on a plump finish.

title: Marqués del Turia 2018 Viura-Sauvignon Blanc (Valencia)
description: Tropical-fruit aromas lead this light-bodied blend of Viura and Sauvignon Blanc. It is lean in feel, with lime-like acidity. Tropical-fruit flavors finish mild and easy.

title: Ego Bodegas 2017 Marionette Monastrell-Syrah (Jumilla)
description: This dark Monastrell-Syrah blend hits with a wall of milk chocolate on the nose, and, with time, things smell only more oaky and forced. A big palate is both sticky and acidic. Soupy black fruit, tomato and creamy flavors finish with another round of chocolate. This is generous but unconvincing as a serious wine.

title: Marqués de Riscal 2017 Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Oily, slightly sweaty aromas of phenolic green fruits and peanuts raise some questions regarding quality. A creamy palate is low in acid, while this tastes largely of bell pepper and melon prior to a wan finish.

title: Rioja Vega 2016  Rioja
description: Leafy berry aromas are a touch green and herbaceous. Like the nose, this wine feels choppy and raw, with rough tannins. Spicy red-fruit flavors finish with scratchy tannins and dry oak notes.

title: Tamaral 2016 Roble  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Overly ripe aromas suggest raisin and pencil eraser. On the palate, this is choppy and lacks flow. Baked flavors of raisin and prune are desiccated, while this tastes jammy and feels hot on the finish.

title: Raiza 2014 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Rubbery aromas suggest tree bark, plum fruit and hand soap. A lean and crisp palate plays up tartaric acidity, while shearing cherry and raspberry flavors take a while to dissipate on a linear but raw finish.

title: Marqués de Vizhoja 2016 White (Spain)
description: This wine's cidery nose and watery, spritzy palate announce a generic white wine with sea brine and lemon water flavors. It has a short but tangy finish.

title: Bodegas El Cidacos 2012 Conde Otiñano Crianza  (Rioja)
description: This smells of spices, barrel char and milk chocolate. Its raw, tannic palate shows highly evident oak, tasting of reedy plum and wood. The finish is tough.

title: Cara Nord 2017 Trepat Rosé (Conca de Barberà)
description: This wine's strawberry aromas fall somewhere between jammy and sharp. It's citrusy and lean on the palate, with plum skin, cranberry and salt flavors that lead to a tangy, sour finish.

title: Santo Cristo 2016 Flor de Añon Roble Red (Campo de Borja)
description: This slightly raisiny Garnacha-Syrah blend leads with prune and soft raspberry aromas. It has a rubbery texture and generic plum and wood spice flavors that spread out across the finish.

title: Vinedos Singulares 2015 Corral del Obispo Mencía (Bierzo)
description: Initial aromas of olive, iodine and foresty black fruits turn more mulchy and malty as this breathes. Grating tannins make for a rough palate, while cherry, plum and brown sugar flavors are burnt and slightly candied, with almost no finish.

title: Raventós de Alella 2015 Santa Maria Pansa Blanca (Alella)
description: This linear wine's neutral aromas vaguely resemble peach and peach pit. Its yeasty, leesy, oxidized white fruit and white bread flavors finish on a melony note but with little intensity.

title: Licenciado 2014 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Grapy, reduced aromas suggest apple skins. This off-vintage Rioja feels sappy and displays ringing acidity and a textural sensation of grape skins. Shocked plum and berry flavors are high toned and quick on a skinned finish.

title: Aljibes 2016 Red (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Odd aromas of lemony oak, raisin, prune and turned earth are all over the map and fail to project a clear image of what this Bordeaux blend will taste like. On the palate, this is thick and dense, with no lift. Heavy flavors of chocolate, oak and black fruit finish minty and tannic.

title: Duquesa de la Victoria 2015 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Aromas of road tar and black licorice burn and simmer in front of a sticky palate. Burnt oak along with dark chocolate flavors are pressed onto berry fruit, while this is dry on the finish. Valdelana is the maker of this label.

title: Emilio Moro 2017 Finca Resalso  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Funky, foxy aromas of iodine and leathery berry fruits lead to a raw, choppy and tannic palate, while minty plum and currant flavors finish with a reprise of desertlike dryness and grating tannins.

title: Genium Celler 2012 Ecològic Red (Priorat)
description: Can't-miss raisiny aromas signal freshness and balance issues. This Priorat blend from a hot year feels thick and sappy, while baked flavors of raisin and prune are overripe. Prune and chocolate flavors steer a cooked finish to its final resting place.

title: La Zorra 2014 Teso Blanco White (Sierra de Salamanca)
description: Bready, oxidized aromas are imprecise and lacking in fruit. This is a blend of Palomino, Rufete Blanca and Moscatel from Salamanca, which is off the beaten path. A plump but flat palate of yeasty white-fruit flavors lacks zest on a fading finish. Drink now.

title: Pinord 2011 M Marrugat Gran Reserva Brut Nature Millésime Sparkling (Cava)
designation: M Marrugat Gran Reserva Brut Nature Millésime
description: Funky aromas are sweaty, foxy and feline in nature. This doesn't have a lot of feel or texture, while the flavors on this brut nature are a bit weedy and grassy. The fruit character is quite short on the finish.

title: Bodegas Luzón 2018 Colección Monastrell Rosado (Jumilla)
description: Dry citrus aromas are lightly briny and slightly bitter. This Monastrell rosé feels plump but kind of stale. Flavors of melon and dull peach terminate quickly on a short finish.

title: Borsao 2017 Tres Picos Garnacha (Campo de Borja)
description: Once upon a time, Tres Picos was one of the best value wines from Campo de Borja, but in recent years it has become nothing more than oaked-up commercial juice. Aromas of mint and clove dominate, while the mouthfeel is cloying and resiny. Clove and raw wood flavors carry over to the finish.

title: Pinuaga 2016 Nature Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: While this Tempranillo opens with mulchy, cheesy aromas that suggest less than ideal raw materials, flavors of tomato, creamy oak and herbal plum gain some momentum before finishing short and green. As for feel and structure, this is plump and grabby.

title: Dominio de Punctum 2017 20,000 Leguas Amber Wine Skin Contact White (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Dark-tinted skin-contact wines are all the rage, but this gold-brown number is just O.K. Subdued peach and apricot aromas precede a palate with textural grip. Savory, salty flavors of dried stone fruits lose steam on a finish without much follow through or complexity.

title: Prieto Pariente 2016 Viñedos de La Provincia Tempranillo-Garnacha (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León
description: Jumpy berry aromas are candied and veer off towards raw oak and wet dog. A gummy, sticky palate is full and weighty, while this blend of Tempranillo and Garnacha tastes of raisin and jammy berry fruits prior to a finish that leaves a gummy residue.

title: Bodegas Aragonesas 2016 Mósen Cleto Crianza Red (Campo de Borja)
description: Spicy, scratchy berry aromas lead to a gummy, sticky palate with berry, plum and woody flavors that don't exactly sing in harmony. A thick finish, with excess weight, is fitting.

title: Ostras Pedrin 2016 Verdosilla (Valencia)
description: In this Verdosilla, an obscure white variety from the Valencia region, yeasty, bready aromas are mild and slightly floral. Its palate is watery and not very crisp, with dry apricot flavors that have no zing.

title: Marques de Toledo 2015 Verdejo (La Mancha)
description: This wine's neutral nose includes mild citrus scents. It's tired and bland on the palate, with yeasty flavors, finishing with papaya and commercial white bread notes.

title: Cellers Unió 2015 Perlat Red (Montsant)
description: This Garnacha-Carignan blend contains some Syrah as well and smells almost exclusively of clove and spice. On the palate, it's resiny and sticky, with overwrought clove and barrel spice flavors that dominate the finish.

title: Bouza de Carril 2018 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Basic apple and white fruit aromas are not that effusive. On the tongue, this feels chunky and a touch flat. White nectarine and peach flavors turn mildly bitter before showing lees notes and oxidation on the finish.

title: Enate 2012 Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Somontano)
description: Stalky berry aromas include an oaky note of vanilla. On the palate, this Cabernet feels tannic and sticky. Peppery plum and raisiny flavors are herbal, candied and mildly oxidized on the finish.

title: Protos 2017 12 Meses  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Hot berry aromas are loaded with chocolaty oak and wet cement scents. A warm resiny palate sees oaky chocolate flavors take over before this moves on to burnt marshmallow and clove on the finish. This is about as far from natural as you can get.

title: Portal del Montsant 2015 Brunus Rosé (Montsant)
description: This flat, watery wine has yeasty, generic stone fruit flavors and salty, bitter grape skin flavors. It's round in mouthfeel but inexact on the finish.

title: Vicente Gandia 2016 Finca del Mar Chardonnay Chardonnay (Valencia)
description: A tan color and dusty, tired aromas put this Chardonnay on short notice. Its plump palate delivers a mix of stone fruit and bitter, skin-based flavors, with a static finish.

title: Beso de Vino 2016 Old Vine Garnacha (Cariñena)
description: Gamy briny berry aromas are undistinguished. This basic Garnacha feels pointy and tannic. Flavors of currant and prickly red plum show a green note on an herbal finish that's flimsy in structure.

title: Príncipe de Viana 2015 Vendimia Seleccionada Crianza Red (Navarra)
description: Minty, grassy aromas are more dominant than fruit scents, while the palate is hard, wiry and grabby. Grassy flavors of plum and berry are mildly green, while on the finish this echoes the nose with mint and grassy notes. This is Tempranillo, Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon.

title: Pingao 2016  Rioja
description: Gritty, crusty aromas of road tar and burnt coffee lead to a creamy, oaky palate that's cloying. Medicinal black-fruit flavors are hot with pushy oak, while overall this comes across as being worked and manipulated.

title: Siglo 2017  Rioja
description: Saucy gamy berry aromas are sketchy and not fully convincing. This Tempranillo feels grabby and raw, while stalky berry flavors are less than fresh and finish herbal and dried out.

title: Viña Palaciega 2017 Joven  (Rioja)
description: Stalky aromas of compost and mulchy berry fruits lead to a pulpy palate. Stalky, slightly green berry and plum flavors finish short with notes of raisin and desiccation.

title: Arínzano 2014 Hacienda de Arínzano Red (Pago de Arínzano)
description: Initial volatile aromas of vinegar, coffee and strained berry fruits are all over the map. A thick blocky palate is anchored by hard tannins, while this Tempranillo blend tastes of blackened oak, campfire and green, sappy fruits. Coffee and toast are prime flavors on a dry tannic finish.

title: Casa de la Ermita 2014 Dulce Blanco Macabeo (Jumilla)
description: Aromas of buttered noodles and honey fail to hold up in the glass. This sweet Macabeo feels a bit watery, with no complexity to the palate structure. Flavors of honey and vanilla are slightly bitter.

title: Las Colinas Del Ebro 2016 Red (Terra Alta)
description: Murky aromas of compost, raspberry and pineapple are less than clean. A chunky palate is more flat than lively, while this tastes largely of raisin and stewed dark-berry fruits. A flat finish with low acidity is adequate but dull.

title: Pata Negra 2016 Roble  (Ribera del Duero)
description: An outright woody nose smells of sawdust and mint. On the palate, this young Tempranillo shows holes in the middle. Oak-heavy flavors of clove smother what fruit this has.

title: Bodegas Grupo Yllera 2016 Boada Campo de Bueyes Roble  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Wayward berry aromas are heavily oaked, resulting in clove scents. This feels fleshy and awkward, with mild tannins and a questionable structure. Woody, sappy purple-fruit flavors include a strong blast of clove, while this retains an oaky character on a finish that's both savory and baked in flavor.

title: Finca Río Negro 2016 Cogolludo-Guadalajara Gewürztraminer (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Highly aromatic on the nose, notes of flowers and soap carry the lead. In the mouth, this is oily in feel yet with a strong vein of acidity. A quick blast of lychee flavor finishes short and bitter.

title: Hilanda 2016 Monastrell (Jumilla)
description: Top-heavy oak creates aromas of campfire, clove and maple. That same thick, oaky character is noted on a creamy palate. Flavors of clove and barrel spice dominate. In general, this oak bomb just repeats itself over and over again.

title: Carramimbre 2015 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Oaky, resiny aromas of wood grain and spice render fruit a secondary item. This is tight, raw and tough on the palate. Gamy black-fruit flavors are heavily oaked and spicy, with a strong accent of clove.

title: Enate 2016 Fermentado en Barrica Chardonnay (Somontano)
description: A heavy blast of forceful oak dominates this Chardonnay's basic white-fruit aromas. This is chunky and resiny in feel, with just enough cutting acidity. Woody flavors are straight from the barrel, while this offers yeasty vanilla notes on a melony finish.

title: Gooseneck 2016 Chardonnay (Navarra)
description: A mix of mild oak, pineapple, melon and vanilla aromas is common for basic Chardonnay. A medium-bodied palate holds yeasty melon flavors that come and go quickly. A lightly oxidized finish tastes mostly of vanilla.

title: Irelia 2016 Ecològico Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Prickly, punchy aromas of sweat and pyrazines start off this Verdejo. In the mouth, this is oddly syrupy but also acidic. Flavors of canned pineapple and green herbs end with a lasting note of pink grapefruit.

title: Bodegas Faustino 2015 VII  (Rioja)
description: Earthy aromas of baked fruits and leather struggle to convey a sense of full ripeness. A tight acidic palate is hard and drawing, while this tastes of oxidized plum in front of a snappy finish.

title: Bodegas San Isidro 2015 Gémina Monastrell (Jumilla)
description: Aromas of Band-Aid, oak spice and clove smother basic berry scents. A rough, hard and pulling palate shows rubbery flavors of plum and oaky clove. Heavy oak, high acidity and a sense of rawness define the finish on this Monastrell.

title: Casa de la Ermita 2015 Joven Organic Monastrell (Jumilla)
description: Earthy leathery berry aromas come with notes of burnt rubber and plastic. This straightforward Monastrell feels lean and raw, but fresh. Flavors of red plum, currant and grape skins finish peppery and lean, with pointy acidity.

title: Finca el Lince 2015 Monastrell (Jumilla)
description: Blackberry and prune aromas come with a heavy blanket of oaky clove and earth notes. In the mouth, this Monastrell has a tartaric edge to it, and overall it feels saucy. Savory, saucy plum and berry flavors are roasted and salty, while this is short on fruit and heavy on residual oak across the finish.

title: Rios de Tinta 2015  Ribera del Duero
description: This rustic, herbal Tinto Fino has tarry blackberry and cassis aromas that turn horsey, minty and herbal on a nose that struggles to hold up. After hinting at savory berries, flavors turn green, bitter and underripe. It finishes with rough tannins and heat.

title: Aljibes 2016 Garnacha Tintorera (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Foxy berry and plum aromas are telling. In the mouth, this is lean and tight, with barely any depth or give. Herbal plum and raspberry flavors are lightly green, while this is drying and tannic on the finish.

title: Volver 2015 Paso a Paso Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Medicinal berry and chocolaty oak flavors come in front of a high-acid, tartaric palate. This everyday Tempranillo tastes of oak, chocolate and slightly weedy plum. Overall, it's good enough to warrant a glass or two.

title: Dominio de Punctum 2016 Chardonnay (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Lemon-lime and bathroom cleanser aromas are tropical but a bit false. This feels medium to full but lacks character on the palate. Orange and persimmon flavors finish salty but not overly so.

title: Pluvium 2015 Premium Selection Bobal-Cabernet Sauvignon (Valencia)
description: Mild, dusty cherry aromas set up a pulling, dry palate. Flavors of tea and spiced tomato lack fruit, and this wine is dry and somewhat abrasive on the finish. The blend is 80% Bobal with Cabernet Sauvignon.

title: Rejadorada 2014 Reja  (Toro)
description: Underripe berry aromas are leathery and briny. This wine is bulky and chewy in feel, with herbal berry and rubbery flavors. A rustic finish with good mouthfeel delivers animal-like flavor notes.

title: Old Hands 2018 Joven Monastrell (Yecla)
description: Aromas of fruit punch and Sangria include sweet hints of honey blossom and red-licorice candy. On the other side of the spectrum, this Monastrell feels acidic and raw. Back to Hawaiian Punch for flavors, while the finish is edgy.

title: Dominio de Eguren 2018 Protocolo White (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Dusty orange-peel aromas lead to a palate that's mildly citric in feel but mostly just blunt. Citrus and dry melon flavors deliver the basics, making this right for easy quaffing.

title: Figaro 2015 Tinto Niño Jesús Garnacha (Calatayud)
description: Wiry berry aromas come with a touch of sweet plastic. This feels hard and tannic as well as fleshy. Herbal, lightly weedy and salty plum and berry flavors finish with lively acidity and foxy, jammy berry notes.

title: Latitud 42 2016 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Forced oak on the nose creates an early whiff of menthol and mint. A live-wire palate is charged up and resiny, while oaky flavors of black fruits and pepper end with a final hit of barrel spice.

title: Pradorey 2016 Vendimia Nocturna Verdejo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León
description: Punchy pyrazine and citrus aromas suggest austere Sauvignon Blanc. This feels tight and lean, while boxed-in flavors of grapefruit and bitter citrus pith finish short but with vitality.

title: Dominio de Punctum 2017 Viento Aliseo Biodynamic Viognier (La Mancha)
description: This wine's tan color and soapy pear and red apple aromas make for a confounding start. Its soapy, yeasty pink grapefruit and grape skin flavors finish with tropical notes. While not bad, it's odd and disjointed.

title: Tres Buhis 2016 Tempranillo (Yecla)
description: Damp, rubbery berry aromas suggest compost. This basic Tempranillo feels grabby but also flabby. Jammy berry flavors are nondescript, while the finish on this standard wine is lazy, slightly tannic and stewy.

title: Vega Escal 2015 Crianza Red (Priorat)
description: Aromas of lactic oak, clove and muddled berry fruits precede a lugubrious palate that's sticky and tannic. Prune and clove flavors rise to the top of a flavor profile backed by heat and oak character.

title: Viore 2016 5 Meses en Barrica  (Toro)
description: Right off the bat you can tell that this is all about the oak. Aromas of coconut and lactic berry fruits smell of wood grain. A resiny palate is sticky, while flavors of raw oak, wood spice, clove and distant plum fruit are what they are.

title: Antaño 2015 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Berry and cinnamon aromas lack clarity and focus. A tight, juicy palate is drawing and mildly astringent. Sappy black plum and raspberry flavors dry up quickly on the finish.

title: Antaño 2017 Tempranillo  (Rioja)
description: Cherry, tea and cookie aromas are O.K. but not elevated or suggestive of anything beyond what's basic. A lean palate with high acidity and pulling tannins offers light raspberry flavors prior to a mildly abrasive finish.

title: Inurrieta 2017 Orchidea Sauvignon Blanc (Navarra)
description: Citrus- and pyrazine-based aromas of lime and bell pepper introduce this Navarran Sauvignon Blanc. It's simple and fresh, with bitter pepper and lime flavors.

title: Coto de Hayas 2017 Chardonnay (Campo de Borja)
description: A light color and equally light aromas of lime and little more introduce a linear palate that's oily feeling and acidic and pulls inward. Briny, tart nectarine flavors do a quick fade on a finish that rings with acidity.

title: Bodegas Soledad 2017 Solmayor Tempranillo (Uclés)
description: Simple, spunky aromas of cherry and raspberry candy are not that serious. This Tempranillo feels full and jumpy, but with little focus. Like the nose, this tastes of cherry candy, while the finish disappears in no time.

title: Enate 2017 Fermentado en Barrica Chardonnay (Somontano)
description: Heavy oak on the nose makes this Somontano Chardonnay smell like a sawmill. In the mouth, this is creamy and ultimately rather soft. An oak-dominated flavor profile is low on zest and fruit, while this tastes of burnt popcorn on a resiny finish.

title: Bodegas Tobía 2017 Daimon  (Rioja)
description: Earthy red plum and raspberry aromas are leafy but also heavily oaked. On the palate, this Garnacha-led blend is sappy, resiny and fiery. Forced oak flavors of clove and nutmeg sit on top of berry fruit, with juicy acidity keeping things moving.

title: Nora 2018 Peitan Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Nonspecific, uncommitted aromas are more like scented soap or candle than fruity. This Albariño feels plump with no center point. Apple and nectarine flavors don't have much to say.

title: Vicente Gandia 2017 El Miracle 120 Aniversario Shiraz-Garnacha Rosé (Valencia)
description: Grassy stone-fruit aromas are not fully crisp and veer into the green zone. This blend of Garnacha and Shiraz feels round and globular, without much core acidity. Mild but nonspecific fruit flavors are difficult to define.

title: Albet I Noya 2016 Efecte Reserva Brut Sparkling (Penedès)
description: Funky, sweaty aromas of brined fruits and chicken fat are not the best way to get started. This feels citric and pulpy at the same time. Salty citrus and briny stone-fruit flavors are maintained on the finish.

title: Viñedos y Bodegas Pablo 2017 Menguante Garnacha (Cariñena)
description: Rubbery, medicinal berry aromas open this basic Garnacha that's narrow on the palate. Berry flavors come with hints of vinegar and butter, while this feels a bit sticky and hot on the finish.

title: Sonsierra 2017 Selección Tempranillo Rosé (Rioja)
description: A watermelon-red color and green-leaning aromas of beets and lettuce lead to a heavy palate. Briny red-fruit flavors hint at vinegar, while this maintains a salad-dressing quality on the finish.

title: Viña Fuerte 2015 Crianza Tempranillo (La Mancha)
description: Berry aromas are fortified by smoke, char and tobacco scents that don't seem fully natural. There's flesh to the palate, but also tannins that are hard as nails. Herbal black fruit flavors come with a vanilla note, while a brambly finish tastes and feels slightly raisiny.

title: Agronavarra 2017 Ventana Garnacha (Navarra)
description: Rubbery berry and cranberry aromas come with grassy field notes. This Garnacha has a clampy, raw, tannic mouthfeel and pointy flavors of plum and berry fruits. A lean, grabby, rubbing finish gets the job done, but barely.

title: Bodegas Tobía 2016 Viña Tobía  (Rioja)
description: Medicinal, rubbery berry aromas are grapy and suggest latex. While big and round in feel, the palate lacks focus in its berry and plum flavors.

title: Bodegas San Valero 2016 Particular Chardonnay (Cariñena)
description: Melon and citrus-peel aromas are basic. This wine is plump on the palate, with modest acidity. Pithy grapefruit and orange flavors are lasting on a finish with citrus-peel notes.

title: Viore 2017 5 Meses en Barrica  (Toro)
description: Grainy oak dominates a nose that's thin on fruit and backbone. In the mouth, this is jagged and rubbing, while grapy berry flavors are mildly oxidized. On the finish, this tastes more like wood than fruit.

title: Palacio del Burgo 2015 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: A compacted nose smells raisiny. Next in line is a fleshy, jammy palate that's unfocused. Raspberry, plum and prune flavors finish with a low pulse, and overall this is unexciting.

title: Beramendi 2016 Lurbira Garnacha (Navarra)
description: A reduced and grapy nose smells of herbal berry fruits and olive. Saucy dark-berry flavors are mildly green, while oak and spice notes control a grapy finish that's low on structure.

title: Montebuena 2015 Cuvée KPF  (Rioja)
description: Punchy cherry and berry aromas are wiry. This wine is acidic and raw in feel, with tart flavors of pie cherry and plum. An angular finish is driven mostly by sharp acidity.

title: Paco & Lola 2010 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Albariño is not known for its aging potential, and this fairly stale offering from 2010 is proof that the textbook is correct. Aromas of white fruits, corn and hay set up a chunky palate with flavors of melon and mango that are yeasty and slightly oxidized.

title: Valdelana 2016 Agnus  (Rioja)
description: Earthy berry fruits come with a slathering of oak-based milk chocolate. This wine feels chunky and heavy, while a mix of leafy berry flavors with oxidized raisin notes finishes jammy.

title: Burgo Viejo 2015  Rioja
description: Cool rooty grassy aromas are up front. This feels wiry and tannic. Herbal green-leaning plum and currant flavors finish with a distinct flavor of minty green along with rough tannins.

title: Martín Berdugo 2016 Rosado (Ribera del Duero)
description: This wine's basic red fruit aromas are clean but flat. That flatness carries over to the palate, which feels rubbery and lacks acidity. Its bland plum and cherry flavors are slightly bitter, concluding with a low-energy finish.

title: Raventós de Alella 2015 Pansa Blanca (Alella)
description: Dusty applesauce aromas lead to a pulpy, medium-bodied palate in this pure Xarello. It tastes of bitter grape skins , papaya and green melon, its tropical notes offset by grassy and briny hints on the finish.

title: Conde de Altava 2014 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: This Rioja's rubbery aromas are so strong they suggest industrial tires. It has grippy tannins and a blackened flavor profile that includes bacon fat. Drying tannins make for a rough finish.

title: Príncipe de Viana 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon Rosado (Navarra)
description: This is almost red in color, with spicy bell pepper aromas resulting from early harvested Cabernet Sauvignon. Its full, chunky palate shows yeasty, lightly green and peppery flavors that linger on the finish.

title: Bodegas Riojanas 2015 Canchales Vino Joven  (Rioja)
description: Rubbery raspberry and plum aromas are decent. This feels crisp and abrasive on the surface, but sort of empty in the middle. Lean snappy plum and raspberry flavors end with scratchy tannins and a medicinal aftertaste.

title: Gorrebusto 2015  Rioja
description: Candied berry aromas lack crispness. This feels hard, with little give and depth to the palate. Burnt toasted berry flavors are hot and fall off on a clumsy finish.

title: Sonsierra 2015 Selección Tempranillo Rosé (Rioja)
description: This pink wine smells of red-apple skins. The palate is low on acidity but not entirely dull. Dry briny lightly bitter flavors don't show a lot of fruit, while this is pulpy on the finish.

title: Covila 2018 II Tinto  (Rioja)
description: Leathery raspberry and cherry aromas are fairly flat, while this basic Tempranillo feels clipped at the edges and hollow in the center. Foxy plum and red berry flavors lack depth, while this feels rubbery and squeaky on the finish.

title: Castro Martin 2016 Family Estate Sobre Lias Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: This offers mild buttercup and melon aromas. In the mouth, it's all about acidity, with any lasting fruit notes tapering off. It's lean and citrusy on the finish.

title: Palacios Remondo 2014 Las Montesa  (Rioja)
description: This wine's earthy, green aromas lead to a choppy palate with wiry acidity. The flavors are saucy, recalling mint, plums, berries and tomatoes. It finishes with herb and blaring oak notes, as well as a hint of scrambled egg and cheese.

title: Finca Montepedroso 2018 Sobre Lías Verdejo (Rueda)
description: A yellow color and oily aromas of stone fruits and melon open this Verdejo that's spritzy on first take, then chunkier and flatter. Bland apple and melon flavors are short and slightly bitter, while the finish deals more of the same.

title: Vallobera 2016 Familia San Pedro Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Berry aromas are peppery but beyond that nondescript, with cool oak that suggests wet cement. A clampy palate is drying and tannic, while this tastes mostly of creamy oak and milk chocolate. A dry finish evaporates, leaving heat.

title: Señorío de Peñalba 2015 Señorío de Peñalba Premium Mencía (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León
description: Among this bodega's strong lineup of 2015 Mencías, this is the weak link. The nose is overtly raisiny and overripe. A tannic, wide-bodied palate seems cooked and lacks a center point, while raisiny berry flavors are jammy on a sticky finish.

title: Milcampos 2015 Viñas Viejas  (Ribera del Duero)
description: This wine's jumbled aromas of coffee grounds, burnt oak and berries lead to a tight, pulling palate with hard tannins. Its heavy oak and soupy berry flavors are accented by carob and green notes. On the finish, it's overtly tannic.

title: Bodegas Cristo de la Vega 2017 Colores Verdejo (La Mancha)
description: Mild white fruit aromas lead the nose of this La Mancha Verdejo. It feels round and plump, with moderate acidity and a standard mix of stone fruit and citrus flavors that grow increasingly bitter on the finish.

title: Castillo de Monjardin 2017 El Cerezo Chardonnay (Navarra)
description: This wine's leesy, lightly oxidized nose leaves an impression of oak, although none was used. Its powdery, yeasty melon flavors land softly on the rather lifeless finish.

title: Torre Oria 2015 80 Years Old Vines Red (Valencia)
description: This wine's aromas and flavors are outright raisiny. Prune, fig and other overripe flavors feature prominently. And yet, it still has some quality and character despite being out of balance.

title: Dominio de la Abadesa 2018 Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Heavy pyrazines on the nose result in green aromas of cactus along with sulfur and matchstick. This feels plump and pulpy, with no spine or structure. Core melon and tropical fruit flavors are yeasty prior to a finish that's oddly creamy.

title: Elias Mora 2017  Toro
description: Gummy plum aromas control a reduced nose. On the palate, this is pushy, raw and almost unfriendly in how tannic it is. Sappy, fiery plum and berry flavors have an herbal undertone, while this mercifully lightens up on the finish. This is Toro in tough, unwieldy form.

title: Portal del Priorat 2015 Ediciones I Limitadas Luno Red (Montsant)
description: Earthy berry and animal aromas are challenging, while this Garnacha-led blend feels flat and obtuse, with little lift of layering. Reduced, jammy plum and blueberry flavors finish with rubbing tannins and heat that builds.

title: Bodegas Fariña 2016 Dama de Toro  (Toro)
description: This Tinta de Toro smells like a cherry Lifesaver. In the mouth, there's not much body or substance. Candied blackberry and cassis flavors are medicinal and jammy on the finish.

title: Bodegas Leda 2015 Mas de Leda Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León
description: This second label wine from Leda smells flat, raisiny and overripe. A soupy, heavy palate follows the nose, delivering stewed berry and raisin flavors. Stewed fruit and cinnamon notes mark the close.

title: Aranleón 2017 Sólo Organic White (Utiel-Requena)
description: This blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Macabeo offers yeasty nectarine and vanilla cookie aromas. It has high acidity but low overall quality., with lightly oxidized, salty citrus flavors.

title: Castillo de Monjardin 2015 Crianza Origen Coupage Selección Red (Navarra)
description: A dark purple color and overripe raisin, berry and clove aromas introduce this Navarran blend. The palate is cloying and overweight, with wood resin and clove flavors. It finishes with that clove note, confirming its one-dimensional character.

title: Príncipe de Viana 2017 Fermentado en Barrica Chardonnay (Navarra)
description: This Chardonnay's floral aromas are inoffensive but not very wine-like. The palate is round but hollow in the middle, with briny citrus flavors and mustard- and green herb-inflected finish.

title: Dominio de la Abadesa 2016 Verdejo (Rueda)
description: A dull gold tint and steamrolling barrel aromas announce an oak-heavy wine that's tight, resiny and high in acid. Woody flavors of salted apricot echo on the finish.

title: Sierra Norte 2016 Porta Regia Colección Privada Old Vines Monastrell (Jumilla)
designation: Porta Regia Colección Privada Old Vines
description: Rough, rubbery aromas suggest road tar. This Monastrell feels clumsy and hollow. Raw, slightly weedy berry flavors are green and minty on a chewy finish.

title: Felix Solis 2016 Flirty Bird Sauvignon Blanc (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: This Sauvignon Blanc has little to no varietal character. The nose is quiet, with just a hint of peach. A round palate shows almost no acidity, while this tastes peachy and yeasty prior to a pulpy finish.

title: Marqués de Montañana 2016 Selección Especial Garnacha (Calatayud)
description: Pushy oak and heavy clove aromas seem excessive for this level of Garnacha. A rough, grating palate leads to oak-heavy flavors of clove and blackberry, while a persistent flavor of oak-driven clove controls the finish.

title: Paso a Paso 2016 Verdejo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Prickly citrus aromas include notes of white flowers. Yeasty grapefruit and lime flavors are bland and short, while this ends flat, yeasty and lightly oxidized.

title: Monterebro 2016 Joven Red (Jumilla)
description: Jammy, baked aromas are raisiny and slightly volatile. This blend of 85% Monastrell and Syrah is heavy and soupy, with dull edges. Herbal prune and raisin flavors are raw and green on the finish.

title: Bodegas Fariña 2015 Spanish Sons Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León
description: This wine's furry berry aromas bring a wet dog to mind. It's at once creamy and acidic on the palate, with chocolaty oak and gamy, herbal berry flavors. It finishes with a lasting note of carob.

title: Arrumaco 2015 Tempranillo (Spain)
description: This Tempranillo smells a bit chemical as well as jammy. A tannic palate is slightly astringent but softens with airing. Medicinal plum and berry flavors stick out on a rough finish.

title: Pluvium 2016 Bobal-Grenache Rosado (Valencia)
description: Yeasty, briary aromas are low on fruit. This blend of Bobal and Garnacha feels citrusy, with a moderate level of pulp to the palate. Flavors of yeasty citrus fruits turn bready on the finish.

title: Casado Morales 2016 Rosé (Rioja)
description: This simple rosé has lightly floral but generic aromas. It's tight on the palate, with a decent body and dried apricot flavors that finish slightly salty.

title: Viña Mayor 2016 Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Prickly, sharp aromas of citrus, matchstick and haystack are low on fruit. This Verdejo has a sharp acidic feel and pyrazinic flavors of cactus and bell pepper along with standard citrus.
