title: Bodegas Martinez Corta 2015 Cepas Antiguas Selección Privada  (Rioja)
description: Cassis and raisin aromas lead to a rubbery, grabby and pinching palate. This wine tastes of herbal, leafy berry and plum, while the savory finish lingers.

title: Arrumaco 2016 Garnacha Rosé (Spain)
description: Mostly neutral aromas include hints of strawberry and chewing gum. This wine feels dilute, with tangy, tart flavors of pink grapefruit. Pointy, sharp acidity allows the finish to hang around.

title: CVNE 2014 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Aromas of tire rubber, beet root, earthy plum and compost are not the stuff of legend. This feels soupy, then hollow. Flavors of tomato sauce are less than stirring, while this is edgy in feel and tastes tomatoey across the finish.

title: Bocopa 2015 Conde de Alicante Selección Monastrell (Alicante)
description: Slightly grassy raspberry and plum aromas suggest oyster shell. This is drawing and a bit abrasive, with lightly herbal and generic red-fruit flavors. It's dry in feel and lightly bitter in flavor on the finish.

title: Cyatho 2015 Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Creamy, almost buttery melon aromas are soft and not snappy. A plump but citrusy mouthfeel is bolstered by fading acidity, while this tastes of dry citrus fruits and salt brine. Bitter grapefruit notes take over on the finish.

title: Marqués de la Concordia 2017  Rioja
description: Sketchy aromas of pencil eraser, asphalt, medicinal cherry and oak-based clove are not the stuff of legend. In the mouth, this basic Rioja Tempranillo feels tight and acidic, without much body. Punchy plum flavors are backed by another round of oaky clove, while this feels raw on the finish.

title: Bodega Classica 2013 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Stalky cherry and berry aromas announce a lean, tart palate with a texture influenced by grape skins. Plum and currant flavors are thin, and this is earthy, tangy and low on ripeness on the finish.

title: Cuatro Rayas 2016 Cuarenta Vendimias Verdejo (Rueda)
description: A nose with mild citrus and banana aromas is indicative of the fleshy but basic wine that follows. Dry flavors of peach pit are slightly bitter, and it's dull on the finish. This wine marks Cuatro Rayas's 40th year.

title: Egeo 2016 Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Nectarine and orange aromas are basic and yeasty. A peachy, pulpy palate with flavors of orange and bitter grape skins loses fruit rapidly on the finish.

title: Belondrade 2016 Quinta Apolonia Verdejo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León
description: Briny, wayward aromas of grape skins and yeast are funky and unfocused. This Verdejo has a pulpy, soft mouthfeel and flat white-fruit flavors that turn bitter on the finish.

title: Albada 2014 Viñas Viejas Garnacha (Calatayud)
description: Raisiny, saucy aromas are slightly volatile. A wide, saturated palate comes up short on focus and acidity, while a mix of raisin and green-herb flavors lands on a heavy finish.

title: Torres 2014 Milmanda Chardonnay (Conca de Barberà)
description: The nose of this wine is melony and chunky, with a touch of oak. The palate feels solid enough but still a bit mushy, while dry, creamy flavors of tropical fruits are diffuse in front of a finish that's low in verve.

title: Arrumaco 2016 Verdejo (Spain)
description: Pleasant white-fruit aromas are simple. This has a fresh but highly basic mouthfeel. Melony flavors come with green pyrazine notes, while this is dilute on the finish.

title: Bodegas Alejandro Fernandez 2014 Alejairén Airen (La Mancha)
description: This golden oak-aged Airén smells almost entirely of wood grain and vanilla. On the palate, it's resiny to an extreme. Flavors of raw wood and coconut are devoid of fruit, while this tastes like liquid oak on the finish.

title: De Moya 2016 Tibó Meseguera (Valencia)
description: Tropical fruit and sucking-candy aromas are inoffensive and lively. This varietal Merseguera is texturally pulpy but also zippy due to high acidity and only 12% abv. Lime and lychee flavors finish quickly.

title: Jorge Ordóñez & Co. 2016 Triton Old Vines  (Toro)
description: Heavily charred aromas suggest a steak or hamburger left on the grill for too long. In the mouth, this is compact and boxed in by rock-hard tannins. Like the nose, this young Toro tastes burnt and grilled. Flavors of black coffee and clove dominate an oak-driven finish.

title: Los Navales de Martúe 2017 Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Green aromas of lettuce and bell pepper announce a wine with little fruit. Its chunky palate is barely in shape, with vegetal notes of arugula and spinach on the back end.

title: Latitud 42 2015 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Minty raw-oak flavors are raspy. Following suit, this feels raw and choppy as nails. Generic black-fruit flavors are covered up by resiny oak, and that same woody character stands out on a scratchy finish.

title: Bodegas Illana 2016 Crianza Red (La Mancha)
description: Gritty aromas of black top, black fruits and green herbs are the opening. This multigrape blend is grabby and stomping, with herbal flavors of tea infused into black fruit. A tannic finish is hard to rally around.

title: Bodegas Olarra 2010 Añares Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Given how good 2010 was in Rioja, this Gran Reserva is disappointing and lacking but still reasonably decent. Stale, gritty aromas are burnt and foresty, while this feels sharp, lemony and tannic. Leafy flavors of tomato and plum suggest compost, while this is tough and gritty on the finish.

title: Trillón 2018 Vendimia Seleccionada White (Rioja)
description: Aromas of hay, burnt grass and gritty white fruits are not great, while this feels chunky and oily on the palate. Salty melon and citrus flavors are basic and bland, while this feels yeasty and full on the finish.

title: Grandes Vinos y Viñedos 2013 Anayón Garnacha (Cariñena)
description: Aromas of raisin and lactic oak announce a baked-out Garnacha. A thick chunky palate is not a surprise given the nose, while this is quite oaky, with gamy black-fruit flavors. A stewed character and lemony oak control a heavy finish.

title: Viña Otano 2016 Viura (Rioja)
description: A yeasty, floral aroma leads the nose. This dilute Viura has little substance on the palate, while bland flavors of white fruits finish yeasty and slightly briny on a hint of melon.

title: Lelia 2015 Garnacha-Syrah (Cariñena)
description: Reedy red fruit aromas are candied and slightly raisiny. This blend of Garnacha and Syrah feels fleshy, unfocused and tannic. Jammy strawberry and raspberry flavors are green and chocolaty, while this tastes minty and herbal on an overly tannic finish.

title: Bodega Classica 2016 Hacienda Lopez de Haro Viura (Rioja)
description: Slightly pyrazinic aromas are green and gruff. The palate is simple and streamlined, with flavors of melon and peach. A briny tasting finish closes out this standard Viura.

title: Bodegas Cristo de la Vega 2016 Camina Sauvignon Blanc (La Mancha)
description: Aromas of lanolin and citrus peel lead on the nose. The medium-bodied palate holds a bitter flavor of stone-fruit pit that leads to a clean, short finish.

title: Crápula 2013 Soul Red (Jumilla)
description: This wine shows an extracted palate with flavors of raisin and toast, while tartaric acidity creates a fiery finish with a grapy aftertaste.

title: Dominio de Tares 2016 La Sonrisa de Tares Godello (Bierzo)
description: Creamy aromas of apple and candy corn show on the nose. Flavors of citrus fruit carry the streamlined palate.

title: Bodegas Tobía 2015 Daimon  (Rioja)
description: Bold berry aromas suggest full ripeness and a certain level of ease. In the mouth, however, this feels heavy. Grapy flavors of blackened berry fruits finish chunky and with little energy.

title: Bodegas Alanís 2015 Elara Treixadura-Godello White (Ribeiro)
description: A neutral nose shows a briny streak, while this feels acidic on the palate. This blend of Treixadura and Godello shows white-fruit flavors, with a wheaty tasting finish.

title: Vega Sindoa 2016 Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Navarra)
description: Aromas of white fruits, oak and grape skins are mild on the nose. A resiny, sticky palate leads to ripe white-fruit flavors that are oak-covered. Low acidity and heavy oak on the finish make for a cloying end.

title: El Coto 2016 Viura (Rioja)
description: Prickly, fairly green aromas suggest cactus and citrus. A punchy, citric mouthfeel is lean, while this Viura tastes of lime and thyme.

title: Volver 2016 Tarima Blanco White (Alicante)
description: Pungent aromas of cactus and sweaty citrus suggest Sauvignon Blanc or Verdejo, but this is mostly Merseguera with Macabeo and Moscatel thrown in. A pulpy palate is marginally focused, while this tastes of tropical fruits, namely grapefruit and passion fruit.

title: Inazio Urruzola 2016 Ernio White (Getariako Txakolina)
description: This wine feels alive due to typical Txakoli acidity, but there isn't much body or structure to it. Tart green-apple flavors are waxy and inexact.

title: Altolandon 2013 Rayuelo Bobal (Manchuela)
description: This Bobal's roasted berry and funky animal aromas hardly lay down the red carpet. Its dry spice and oak flavors smother berry and plum fruit, tasting herbal and minty on a heavy, grippy finish.

title: Breca 2016 Garnacha De Fuego Garnacha (Calatayud)
description: Flat berry aromas are pretty heavy, while this Garnacha is so full in body that it's a bit over the top for what it is. Ripe, candied flavors of baked black fruits and chocolate finish with bulk.

title: Mureda 2015 Made With Organic Grapes Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Berry, spice and raspberry Kool-Aid aromas set up an edgy feeling palate with hard tannins and a hollow middle. This is fruity but rough, with a finish that's raw, rubbery and tannic.

title: Bodegas Ontañón 2015 Maceración Carbonica  (Rioja)
description: Wiry slightly harsh and medicinal aromas of plum and berry are typical of a carbonic wine. Rubbery, chunky and grabby on the palate, this tastes of savory medicinal plum and raspberry. A limited finish ends abruptly.

title: Bodega Andrés Iniesta 2016 Corazón Loco Red (Manchuela)
description: Foxy, candied raspberry and red-currant aromas smell leathery and damp. This blend of Syrah and Tempranillo is jumpy and chippy on the palate. Flavors of herbal red fruits are slightly green, while this feels gummy and grabby on a tannic finish.

title: Bodega Luzdivina Amigo 2016 María Abril Godello (Bierzo)
description: A yellow color and mild aromas of apple and butterscotch don't amount to much. This is plump but mellow in feel. Simple flavors of apple, corn and butter are dull on a soft finish.

title: Dominio de Tares 2017 Fermentado En Barrica Godello (Bierzo)
description: Aromas of corn and spiced white fruits are mild on the nose. This barrel-fermented Godello feels resiny on the surface but dilute in the middle. Uncommon flavors of hay, corn and stone fruits conclude without much character.

title: Viña Arnáiz 2010 Gran Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)
description: While this isn't terrible, for a gran reserva from a vaunted vintage it leaves much to be desired. A stalky nose is briary at best and mulchy at worst. A tannic, raw and rubbing palate deals herbal berry and oak flavors, while the finish is woody and not fruity.

title: Bodegas Aletta 2017 Aletta Garnacha (Campo de Borja)
description: Harmless aromas of generic berry fruits lead to a plump but flat palate. Gummy berry flavors are equally flat, while this is bland on the finish.

title: Dominio de Eguren 2018 Protocolo Made with Organic Grapes Rosé (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: A light-orange color and dry, dusty aromas of orange peel open this fleshy but bland rosé made from organic grapes. Monotone flavors of orange skins fade on a finish that's healthy in feel but devoid of character.

title: Finca Antigua 2016 Crianza Tempranillo (La Mancha)
description: Aromas of raisin and dark plum are gritty and candied, while this Tempranillo feels fleshy but also highly acidic, sort of like aged vinegar. Short, basic plum and berry flavors finish lively and smacking.

title: Dominio de Eguren 2018 Protocolo Made with Organic Grapes Macabeo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Melon and mild citrus aromas are simple and steady, while this organic Macabeo feels lean and pithy. Grapefruit is the lead flavor, followed by controlled bitterness that extends onto a tight and narrow finish.

title: Bodegas Faustino 2018 VII Rosado (Rioja)
description: A nice pink color and mostly clean aromas of peach, orange and watermelon precede a high-pitched palate with citric flavors that lean toward sour. High acidity and not much flavor through the end make this a challenge to relax with.

title: Cepa 21 2017 Hito Tempranillo Rosé (Ribera del Duero)
description: Barely ripe, stalky aromas settle on papaya. This aging rosé feels full and rubbery, not elegant or alert. Nutty notes precede flavors of dried apricot and orange, while this falls off even more on the finish. Drinkable but not for much longer.

title: Casado Morales 2015 Nobleza Dimidium Alavesa  (Rioja)
description: Harsh initial aromas of black shoe polish and burnt oak are not appropriate for a wine like this, which also smells of beets and horseradish. Blocky scratchy tannins frame flavors of forced oak, butter and generic bitterness. A hot, agitated finish is tough and tannic.

title: Inazio Urruzola 2015 Hondarrabi Zuri (Getariako Txakolina)
description: Despite being the newest vintage, this smells oxidized and like briny apple. A lean palate ranks as bland, while flavors of sour apple and lemon peel finish tart and citric, with a lasting but discordant yeast-like flavor.

title: Bodegas Paniza 2016 Garnacha Rosé (Cariñena)
description: This wine's oily citrus and petrol aromas recall certain Rieslings. It's round palate on the palate, with citrusy acidity but little edge. Its modest grapefruit flavors are short and slightly oxidized and bitter.

title: Bodegas Paniza 2016 Joven Garnacha Rosé (Cariñena)
description: There's little difference between this and Paniza's regular Garnacha rosé. They both smell like stone fruit, gasoline and Riesling. Its yeasty papaya and grapefruit flavors are mildly oxidized and flat on the finish.

title: Bodegas Tempore 2016 Esenzia Old Vine Garnacha (Bajo Aragon)
description: Candied aromas of berry fruits and raisin are not fresh or focused. This wine has a stewy feel along with gummy flavors of blackened berry fruits. Touches of clove, licorice and mint register on the finish.

title: Bodegas Bleda 2017 Pinodoncel Black Red (Jumilla)
description: Leafy green aromas blend with heavy oak, mint and clove scents. This blend of Monastrell, Syrah and Petit Verdot feels creamy, grabby and not real fresh or natural. Soupy overripe berry flavors are oaky and loaded with clove in front of a green finish that's thick and minty in flavor.

title: Hidalgo 2016 Tradición H Viura (Rioja)
description: A cloudy burnished-gold color and oxidized aromas of briny but stale white fruits get this Viura off to a shaky start. Bold malic acidity lends kick to an otherwise flat palate. This tastes lightly oxidized and briny to an extreme, while the finish is cidery.

title: Ochoa 2017 Calendas White (Navarra)
description: This wine's odd, yeasty aromas are the result of a mismatched blend of Chardonnay, Viura and Moscatel. The palate is flabby, with cured ham flavors. A grape skin-like bitterness takes over on the finish.

title: Finca Constancia 2015 Parcela 23 Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Considering that 2015 was a good, albeit hot, vintage, this is surprisingly edgy, with pronounced acidity. Its tart currant and plum flavors are lean and sour, lacking ripeness and richness.

title: Casa Berger 2017 Sorbet Garnatxa Negra Rosé (Catalunya)
description: This wine's orange blossom and yeasty aromas seem confected. It's spritzy but shapeless, with low acidity and candied citrus and creamsicle flavors.

title: Agustín Cubero 2015 Unus Old Vine Garnacha (Calatayud)
description: This wine's medicinal, roasted black fruit aromas include animal and Band-Aid notes. It's a syrupy Garnacha with overripe plum and blackberry flavors that's at once sticky and acidic on the finish.

title: Sinfonía 2015 Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Herbal, jammy berry flavors lead the nose of this blocky-feeling Tempranillo. Its stewed plum and berry flavors finish peppery, gritty and herbal, with little structure.

title: Nivarius 2016 Edición Especial Limitada Maturana Blanca (Rioja)
description: Funky compost announce an unusual wine, which Maturana Blanca is. The palate is round and lacks structure; its briny, white fruit flavors finish salty and stalky.

title: Vallobera 2017 Famillia San Pedro White (Rioja)
description: This wine's generic melon and white fruit aromas are backed by a green note of pyrazine. It's equally basic on the palate, with stalky, oxidized white fruit flavors.

title: Coto de Hayas 2016 Centenaria Garnacha (Campo de Borja)
description: This $15 Garnacha is heavily oaked and smells singularly of clove. The palate is sticky and cloying, with artificial clove and allspice flavors. Way too much oak has been thrown at totally average fruit here, and the result is forced and fake-tasting.

title: Enate 2017 Gewürztraminer (Somontano)
description: This is a thick, oily and highly aromatic Gewürztraminer with bath oil, flower extract and Central Park hot dog scents. Its fat, fleshy palate deals lime, lychee, fennel, lemon peel and soap flavors.

title: Mureda 2016 Mureda Organic Merlot (Tierra de Castilla)
description: Foxy plum and other jumpy aromas set up a raw, choppy palate. This Merlot tastes of salty, herbal plum and cherry, while the finish is lasting, which might not be a benefit.

title: Finca la Melonera 2015 La Encina del Inglés White (Málaga)
description: Honeyed aromas of orange marmalade lead to a flat palate. Bitter flavors of melon and almond skins confirm that this oddball blend of Moscatel, Doradilla and PX from the mountains outside Málaga is lackluster.

title: Zerran 2014 Red (Montsant)
description: Charred, malty, foxy, herbal aromas sound the alarm. This Garnacha-Carignan blend is rough as sandpaper, with heavily oaked flavors of herbaceous black fruits. A rough and rugged finish is abrasive.

title: Bodegas Tobía 2015 Tobía Garnacha Rosado (Rioja)
description: Except for a hint of sulfur and match stick, this doesn't smell like much, be it good or bad. Like the nose, this is a cypher on the palate, with little more than a light, salty flavor profile.

title: Xucrogas 2016 Her Soul Garnacha (Cariñena)
description: Peppy red plum and currant aromas are anything but serious. This Garnacha feels sticky and fairly flat. Candied cherry and raspberry flavors finish heavy and a bit cloying.

title: Gaba do Xil 2015 Mencía (Valdeorras)
description: Jammy, floral berry and mint aromas turn more green and herbal the longer this sits. A flat jammy palate lacks lift and cohesion, while this tastes green and a bit weedy without any notable changes to the finish.

title: Enate 2017 234 Chardonnay (Somontano)
description: This wine's creamy, yeasty lychee and banana aromas are more suggestive of Viognier than Chardonnay. It's heavy and clumsy on the palate, with creamy, oak-drenched pear and banana flavors.

title: La Antigua 2014 Clásico Blanco White (Rioja)
description: This yellow-colored wine has oaky, chemical aromas that lend an impression of tire rubber. Its wayward palate has oxidized apple and butter flavors that finish with notes of popcorn and brined kumquat.

title: Larchago 2016 Viura (Rioja)
description: Dilute melony aromas are slightly spoiled. This feels bland and unfocused. Modest white-fruit flavors are short and mildly bitter, while almond skin is the key flavor on a struggling finish.

title: Astrales 2011 Godello (Valdeorras)
description: Stalky aromas of citrus peel are stale and mostly fruitless. A full, flat palate indicates a wine that has lost its youthful freshness, offering bitter apricot flavors and a finish that's low on acidity.

title: Ignacio Marín 2015 Wine Wings Moscatel-Garnacha White (Cariñena)
description: Tropical aromas of lychee are about all that stand out on the nose of this unusual Moscatel-Garnacha Blanca blend. Neither dry nor sweet, this seems caught in no man's land. A dilute mouthfeel and bitter pyrazine notes on the finish don't help this along.

title: Rodriguez Sanzo 2014 Give Me Five by Javier Rodriguez  (Rioja)
designation: Give Me Five by Javier Rodriguez
description: Charred chocolaty aromas are forceful but not convincing. This feels choppy and raw on one hand, but sticky and chocolaty on the other. Herbal stewy currant and raw-wood flavors are challenging, while this tastes herbal and woody on the finish.

title: Eguren 2015 Selección Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Slightly volatile plum and currant aromas are pointy and suggest vinegar. This feels acidic, raw and bumpy, while herbal plum and salty currant flavors finish with tartaric sizzle and residual saltiness.

title: Matarromera 2015 Granza Made From Organic Grapes Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Sharp, punchy aromas of citrus, green herbs and celery lead to a tight drawing palate. This tastes feline, bitter and a bit like passion fruit. Pyrazine-based green flavors of thyme and scallion drive the finish.

title: Dominio de Eguren 2015 Mercedes Eguren Cabernet Sauvignon (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Cool, earthy berry aromas are foresty and highly herbal. A wide tartaric palate is gritty and tough to maneuver through. Citrusy, briny plum and berry flavors are oaky prior to a brutally tannic finish with stand-out minty oak.

title: Pagos del Moncayo 2016 Prados Colección Garnacha (Campo de Borja)
description: Aromas of peanut butter, stale almonds, murky earth and burnt fruits amount to a messy whole. On the palate, this is chunky and short on balance. Flavors of burnt wood, barbecued pork and black fruits finish with clove and campfire notes.

title: Arrocal 2015 Passión Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Gamy, herbaceous aromas are foxy and raise questions about the quality of this Crianza. A hard tannic palate that tastes of green oak, clove and herbal berry fruits is less than stellar, while this is highly herbal on the finish.

title: Inazio Urruzola 2015 Rosé (Getariako Txakolina)
description: An orange color and cantaloupe aromas open this fading rosé. A soda-water palate feels old, while this is salty tasting and low on fruit. A punch of acidity is the life behind a tart finish.

title: Bodegas Olarra 2014 Clásico Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Flat doughy aromas smell cooked and stewy. In the mouth, this shows pointy acidity and overripe fruit flavors. Raisiny flavors are stewy on the finish.

title: Emina 2016 Tinto Fino Roble  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Wild berry aromas are foxy and smell a bit like vinegar. This dark young Tempranillo is severely tannic and hard as rocks. Blackberry and boysenberry flavors finish salty and with rugged leftover tannins.

title: Martín Berdugo 2015 Barrica  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Heavily oaked aromas are dominated by forceful notes of clove and spice. This has a dry raw mouthfeel and flavors that are far more woody and like a campfire than fruity. It's ultradry and pulling on the finish.

title: Txakoli Primo 2016 Zarautz Hondarrabi Zuri (Spain)
description: Tropical fruit and honey aromas set up a shy palate that's lightly spritzy. An odd mix of flowery honeyed flavors turns in the direction of pink grapefruit on a lean spritzy finish.

title: Las Capas 2015 Red (Calatayud)
description: Cheesy aromas and a whiff of wet cement are more pronounced than basic plum scents. This tastes of candied fruits and chocolate prior to a simple sweet, sugary finish.

title: Txakoli Primo 2016 Zarautz  (Txakoli de Álava)
description: A crisp nose is trimmed with light citrus and chewing gum notes. Hollow on the palate, this deals dilute citrus and nectarine flavors in front of a quickly fading finish.

title: Viñadecanes 2016 Canes Mencía (Bierzo)
description: A cloudy purple color and gaseous aromas of latex and olive signal reduction and sketchy health. This Mencía feels austere and heavy. A burnt essence is bored into gamy black-fruit flavors, while burnt coffee and heat control a finish that's not worth lingering over.

title: Finca La Mata 2016  Ribera del Duero
description: Grapy, soupy aromas lack clarity and suggest hot pavement. This is lacking in structure and constitution, and that means overall balance is sketchy. Woody, soapy berry flavors are a bit weedy on the finish.

title: Breca 2017 Zabrin White (Spain)
description: Oily white fruit flavors are generic and not all that fresh. A chunky palate with no snap to it offers mealy white fruit flavors that barely register. A finish with the texture of white grape skins is flavorless and low on acidity.

title: Mureda 2015 Made With Organic Grapes Cabernet Sauvignon (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Murky grassy berry aromas and a whiff of cinnamon make for a sketchy nose. This feels choppy, while quick-hitting flavors of forced oak, baking spice and murky berry fruits finish hollow.

title: Santo Cristo 2016 Flor de Añon Verdejo (Campo de Borja)
description: This offers light aromas of yeasty white flowers and lemon-lime. The palate is weak, while generic white-fruit flavors fall off quickly and taste oxidized on a bready finish.

title: Chopo 2016 Monastrell (Jumilla)
description: Blatant aromas of milk chocolate and candied-berry fruits amount to a soupy, heavy, jammy nose. This Monastrell feels choppy and broken. Saucy berry flavors are loaded with oak and clove notes, while this wine tastes like chocolate and feels hot on the finish.

title: Santa Cruz de Alpera 2016 Verdejo (Almansa)
description: Melony aromas are neutral at best. A pulpy, citric palate holds briny orange flavors that don't show a lot of depth or quality. It falls apart on the finish.

title: Enate 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon Rosado (Somontano)
description: Controlled volatility on the nose sets the state for a blocky clumsy palate with no finesse. Lightly vegetal flavors of red bell pepper lack fruit and overall this is mediocre at best.

title: Bodegas Valdemar 2016 Conde Valdemar Rosé (Rioja)
description: Fruit-salad aromas include a note of chewing gum. This feels basic, with tart vapid tomato flavors. A saucy-tasting finish is bland as a board.

title: Marqués de Montañana 2015 Selección Especial Garnacha (Calatayud)
description: Jumpy foxy berry aromas get this Garnacha going. Raw hard tannins smack down with ferocity, while this tastes of candied plum, salt, chocolate and something oddly artificial. Dry scratchy tannins make for a rough finish.

title: Gregoriano 2013 Gran Gregoriano Garnacha (Campo de Borja)
description: A rusty color and stewy aromas of murky berry fruits and cardamom set this off on its own course. Choppy and chunky in feel, this Garnacha tastes stewed, savory and baked, with almost no fruit to speak of. On the finish, this seems roasted.

title: Bodegas Berceo 2015 Más de Berceo Viura (Navarra)
description: Chunky oak rests heavily atop aromas of stale white fruits and nuts. This is obtuse in feel, with stalky, oaky flavors that are largely devoid of fresh fruit.

title: Batán de Salas 2016 Chardonnay (Somontano)
description: Strange, yeasty aromas suggest boiled ham and buttercup. This feels full and fleshy, with low acidity. It tastes like it smells: yeasty and much like ham, with little fruit.

title: Vicente Gandia 2016 Hoya de Cadenas Single Estate Chardonnay (Utiel-Requena)
description: Tropical fruit aromas are soft and syrupy. This is chunky and low in acidity, with oily stone-fruit flavors. The finish feels a bit warm and cloying.

title: Ochoa 2016 Calendas White (Navarra)
description: A light color and yeasty aromas of sourdough and dusty white fruits are the greeting on this modest white made from Chardonnay, Viura and Moscatel. Flavors of lime are yeasty and finish bitter.

title: Muruve 2016 Joven  (Toro)
description: Rubbery, medicinal berry aromas smell like Pepto-Bismol. A chunky palate is big and blocky, with no elegance or charm. Candied, grapy flavors finish hard and scratchy.

title: Ochoa 2017 Calendas Tempranillo-Garnacha (Navarra)
description: Herbaceous aromas hint at thistle, grass and reedy raw plum. While this feels fairly full, it's all superficial; there's almost no structure to this Tempranillo-Garnacha blend. Minty spicy oaky flavors sit atop herbal plum and berry fruit prior to a choppy finish.

title: Bodegas Bleda 2016 Pinodoncel Vintage Red (Jumilla)
description: Not much to see here. The nose on this blend of Monastrell, Syrah and Merlot is green and minty. A tough, scrubbing palate is the definition of rough, while this tastes of graphite and green-berry fruits.

title: Loteta 2014 Red (Campo de Borja)
description: Herbal tomato and red-berry aromas are jumbled and fail to state much of a case for this multigrape blend. Herbal spicy tea and raspberry flavors finish jagged, with mild heat.

title: Bodegas Aragonesas 2014 Viña Temprana Old Vines Garnacha (Campo de Borja)
description: Light plum and raspberry aromas include notes of animal and latex. This lightweight Garnacha has a monotone mouthfeel, while hollow simple berry flavors finish with acidic tang.

title: Bodegas Valdemar 2016 Conde Valdemar Viura-Verdejo White (Rioja)
description: Oxidized aromas dull down papaya and pumpkin notes. This Viura-Verdejo blend shows mostly acid on the palate, and it both smells and tastes oxidized. The finish is bland.

title: Bodegas Paniza 2016 Agostón White (Cariñena)
description: This colorless blend of Viura and Chardonnay smells tropical and sweet, like lychee fruit. A palate lacking in acidic edge is round but flat. Sugary papaya flavors precede a soft finish.

title: Burgo Viejo 2016 Tinto  (Rioja)
description: Reduced berry and plum aromas suggest rubber gloves. An acidic, saucy palate struggles for balance. Tart plum and currant flavors recall tomato sauce, while this wine is dry and grating on the finish.

title: Bodegas Morgante 2018 Baila Verdejo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Light citrus aromas are low on fruit and smell stalky. This Verdejo has a watery feel and underdeveloped white fruit flavors that put it on the cusp of decent and avoidable.

title: Borsao 2017 Viña Borgia Garnacha (Campo de Borja)
description: Medicinal aromas of latex and Band-Aid include notes of leather and berry fruits. A plump, bouncy palate fails to register, while this Garnacha tastes rubbery and like berry cough drop. A note of green on the finish isn't of help.

title: Terramagna 2016 CT En Clave de DO Garnacha (Almansa)
description: A heavily candied nose smells like grape bubblegum, while this Garnacha feels overdone and gummy. Candied, minty, oaky black fruit flavors lack authenticity and freshness, while this is sticky on the finish.

title: Senda Verde 2018 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: An empty nose followed by a palate suggestive of fruit pulp cut by saline water gets this started. Jumbled flavors of passion fruit and overripe stone fruits culminate on a flabby finish. This is worth one glass, maybe two.

title: Legado del Moncayo 2017 Garnacha Blanca (Campo de Borja)
description: A vague white fruit nose and a citric palate put this Garnacha Blanca on shaky footing. Tart flavors of grapefruit, tangerine and lime fall off toward bitter on the finish.

title: Lágrimas de Maria 2017 Viura-Tempranillo Blanco White (Rioja)
description: This blend of Viura and Tempranillo Blanco offers a simple aroma of apple juice. The palate is low on acidity, with a flat tree-fruit flavor.

title: Trus 2014 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Prune and raisin aromas and flavors are so dominant that this is exposed as an overripe wine with cooked characteristics. While not awful, there's no balance, acidity or life to this.

title: Viñestral 2015 Tinto Joven  (Rioja)
description: Earthy, underripe berry aromas are raw, stalky and roasted. This feels edgy, not smooth or elegant. Saucy flavors of red plum and currant are lean and snappy on the finish.

title: El Coto 2017 Blanco Verdejo (Rioja)
description: An almost watery color is telling. This Verdejo is not common to the Rioja region, and it's not showing much. A flimsy palate holds bland, lightly vegetal white fruit flavors that don't hold up for long on a slightly bitter finish.

title: Nacido del Quórum 2015 NDQ 3 Mesas en Barrica Monastrell (Jumilla)
description: This patchy Monastrell deals grassy aromas mixed with vinegar and wild-berry notes. The palate, much like the nose, is jumpy and hard to get into. Savory plum flavors are green and raw, while this is untamed on a finish with heat.

title: Alta Alella 2017 Parvus Chardonnay (Alella)
description: Punchy aromas of citrus and tropical fruits are loaded with sweaty-smelling pyrazines. A pulling, lean palate has the texture of grape skins. Salty orange and pineapple flavors move fast and finish briny and tart.

title: Bodegas Valdemar 2017 Conde Valdemar Rosé (Rioja)
description: With hints of currant and pomegranate, this smells light and distant. In the mouth, this is lean and low on body. Grapefruit flavors are about all that rise up on this tangy but generic rosé.

title: Vicente Gandia 2017 Finca Del Mar Chardonnay (Valencia)
description: Light citrus aromas are yeasty and suggest air freshener. A light bouncy palate offers almost no substance or weight, while this tastes of simple melon, apple and citrus fruits. A vapid finish with almost nothing on offer isn't a surprise.

title: Valdelana 2017 Agnus Malvasia (Rioja)
description: Butterscotch sweetness without much fruit controls the nose on this barrel-aged Malvasia that's flat, creamy and low on acidity. Vanilla and yeasty flavors are barely upright on a soft finish with can't-miss vanilla notes.

title: Can Sumoi 2017 Serra De L'Home Xarel-lo (Penedès)
description: This new Xarello from Pepe Raventós and Francesc Escala arrives in a stout bottle that's a nice touch. A nose of crushed vitamins lacks pop and freshness. The cidery palate is low on balance, while it finishes nutty and salty, like peanut butter or peanut brittle.

title: Pata Negra 2016 Roble  (Toro)
description: Furry, mossy plum and berry aromas are jumbled and suggest iodine. A thin, pinched palate shows vinegar-like acidity along with light, leafy flavors of currant and tomato.

title: Cuna de Reyes 2015  Rioja
description: Animal fur and grapy berry scents carry the nose. In the mouth, this feels fleshy and rubbing. Light, leafy berry flavors struggle to hold interest on an unstructured finish.

title: Castillo de Monjardin 2017 Clásico Tempranillo (Navarra)
description: Rubbery, reduced aromas of road tar, cardamom and black fruits are about as far from elegant as things get. A bulky, tannic palate matches this Tempranillo's black color, while soupy flavors of black plum, oak resin and bitterness culminate on a finish that tastes burnt and feels scratchy.

title: Bodegas Olarra 2014 Clasico Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Leafy, mulchy aromas are damp, while this struggling reserva is hard and rubbery in feel. Tomato and burnt savory notes finish saucy and a touch green.

title: Pradorey 2016 Selección Especial Verdejo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León
description: Jumbled yeasty aromas are inexact and a bit strange. A hollow palate is neither here nor there. Weedy, salty and sour citrus and stone-fruit flavors show no follow through on a lightly oxidized finish.

title: Pago de la Jaraba 2017 Viña Jaraba Cosecha Viñedos Propios Unfiltered Red (La Mancha)
designation: Viña Jaraba Cosecha Viñedos Propios Unfiltered
description: Baked aromas include raisin and marshmallow. A collapsed palate follows the nose, while this tastes mostly of raisin and prune. A soft finish confirms that this is alarmingly low on both freshness and structure.

title: Pazo De Villarei 2018 Abadia do Seixo Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Briny, wheaty aromas lack pop and freshness, and that's a recurring theme for this Albariño. A flat, oily palate is soft, while this tastes briny and leesy but not all that clean or fruity.

title: Finca Río Negro 2015 992 Single Vineyard Cogolludo-Guadalajara Red (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: This blend of 80% Tempranillo and 20% Syrah features rubbery berry aromas suggestive of forced oak. The palate is grippy and mealy-feeling, with slightly oxidized berry flavors and a bland, rubbery finish.

title: Espelt 2017 Coralí Rosé (Empordà)
description: Sweaty, yeasty aromas lead the nose of this wine. It has a grape skin-like texture and salty, bitter orange peel flavors. On the finish, it's oxidized and cheesy, with almost no fruit.

title: Vega Sindoa 2015 El Chaparral Old Vines Garnacha (Navarra)
description: Clove, mint and chocolate aromas and flavors dominate this wine, suggesting forced oak. In between all that wood is a cloying mouthfeel marked by weedy sweetness. This might rank as one of the most manipulated and artificial-tasting wines from Spain.

title: Tierra Aranda 2014  Ribera del Duero
description: After a couple of good vintages, this wine was clearly affected by 2014's marginal harvest conditions. The nose is gamy and full of olive and damp earth notes. The palate is tannic beyond belief, leading to a scratchy finish. In between, there are dark berry and coffee flavors.

title: Bodegas Campos Realos 2015 Real de Aragón Garnacha (Calatayud)
description: This offers thick, inky road tar, wood grain and graphite aromas. It's heavily oaked and resiny, with cloying, oaky blackberry and mint flavors. It finishes with even more oak and a hint of carob.

title: Bodega Andrés Iniesta 2017 Corazón Loco White (Manchuela)
description: A mild nose marked by tropical and citrus aromas is a high point for this Sauvignon Blanc and Verdejo blend. The palate feels oily and pinched; its mix of tropical fruit and vegetal flavors leads to a briny finish with green notes.

title: Príncipe de Viana 2017 Garnacha Blanca (Navarra)
description: This wine's tropical fruit, lemon blossom and yeast aromas are underwhelming. It's shapeless on the palate, with yeasty, oxidized flavors and a powdery finish.

title: Picador 2015 Cuvée E.M.H. Garnacha (Campo de Borja)
description: This leads with brett-derived scents and alcoholic heat. It's soft and gummy on the palate, without much structure. Heavy oak has resulted in roasted berry and clove flavors, and it's even more artificial and oaky-tasting on the finish.

title: Berberana 2014 Dragon Reserva White (Catalunya)
description: This leads with sweaty hay and bath oil aromas. The palate is heavy, lacking vivacity. Its salty melon flavors are short and a touch sour.

title: Irelia 2016 Verdejo (Rueda)
description: This wine's gold color, briny citrus and lanolin aromas and flabby mouthfeel suggest it's fading quickly. Its stone fruit flavors are stale and bitter, even on the finish.

title: Marqués de Cáceres 2016 Satinela Semi Dulce White (Rioja)
description: This wine's waxy, petrol-like aromas are more suggestive of Riesling than Rioja. With only modest acidity and a high level of residual sugar, it's cloying on the palate. Its sweet mango and melon flavors finish flat and slightly bitter.

title: Bodegas Valdemar 2015 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Baked, raisiny aromas announce an overripe wine. The thick, jammy palate matches the nose, delivering prune and baked plum flavors prior to a stewy finish.

title: Arráez 2017 Callabuig Tempranillo (Valencia)
description: Lean cherry and currant aromas are not all that ripe or convincing. A smacking palate holds flavors of candied red fruits, while a hot and fiery finish closes out this wine.

title: Vicente Gandia 2015 Hoya de Cadenas Single Estate Crianza Cabernet Sauvignon (Utiel-Requena)
designation: Hoya de Cadenas Single Estate Crianza
description: Aromas of tree bark, spice and fiery red fruits lead to a raw, cheeky palate with tomatoey acidity. Oddly, cherry and plum flavors carry a burnt overtone, while this reverts to tomatoey and smacking on the finish.

title: El Cortijillo 2016 Tempranillo (La Mancha)
description: This Tempranillo's cranberry and currant aromas are lean and raw. It feels capped and rough on the palate, with acidic scratchiness and choppy plum and currant flavors.

title: Camina 2017 Tempranillo (La Mancha)
description: Jumbled aromas of gummy red fruits and green herbs set up a chunky but flat palate. Soft, inexact red fruit flavors are wan, while this tastes herbal on a jammy finish.

title: Trencalòs 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Spicy white-fruit and citrus aromas are pointy and lightly green, as are the flavors on this jumpy Sauvignon Blanc that rises to the level of easily drinkable.

title: Larchago 2017 Blanco Edición Fábulas Viura (Rioja)
description: Aromas of pyrazines and citrus peel are low on fruit. This basic Viura is on its last legs as evidenced by a lightly oxidized and bland palate. Generic white-fruit flavors turn slightly bitter and green on the finish.

title: Marqués de la Concordia 2017 Tempranillo Blanco Tempranillo Blanco (Rioja)
description: Dusty, briny aromas suggest peach pit. A wide, wet palate is shy on focus, while this tastes briny and like white grapefruit. Not much besides lingering citrus and salt show up on a dilute finish.

title: Innatum 2015 Natural Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Stewed and raisiny are the two words to keep in mind when approaching this desiccated Garnacha. Fig, raisin and other overripe flavors don't change on a soft finish.

title: Granbazán 2014 Don Álvaro de Bazán Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: This old Albariño stresses age over beauty; the nose is stalky and fruitless, while the palate feels full and fueled by citric acid. Dull, yeasty, oxidized flavors are shy on fruit and freshness.

title: Juvé & Camps 2017 Gregal D'Espiells White (Penedès)
description: This blend of Gewürztraminer, Malvasia and Muscat is highly aromatic but not at ease, meaning the nose is soapy and smells unnatural. A flat palate with no edge holds dull flavors of lychee and little else. On the finish, this turns bitter and oily.

title: Marqués de la Concordia 2016 Federico Paternina Banda Azul Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Aromas of compost, stale peanut and berry fruit carry the nose. In the mouth, this is raw and grabby, with tomato-like acidity. Green, earthy flavors of tomato and herbs are low on fruit and finish with a note of compost.

title: La Gitana 2014 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Earthy, murky aromas of compost are also herbaceous. A beefy palate with hard tannins holds herbal berry flavors that are green and not entirely clean. A finish lacking in clarity is the final blow to this barely adequate but underperforming RDD.

title: Coto de Hayas 2015 Crianza Garnacha-Tempranillo (Campo de Borja)
description: Creamy, artificial aromas of milk chocolate, vanilla, marshmallow and berry fruits seem fake and forced. In the mouth, this feels sappy and sticky. Flavors match the nose, meaning they're lactic and chocolaty, while this reverts to creamy and candied on a finish that lacks authenticity.

title: Embocadero 2015  Ribera del Duero
description: Overripe berry aromas are smothered in oaky clove on a murky mulchy nose. This Tempranillo from a warm vintage feels flabby and grabby, with shaky balance. Clove and chocolate flavors are oak-based, while this tastes a bit weedy and feels heavy on a fat finish.

title: La Bodega de Pinoso 2017 Vergel White (Alicante)
description: Mildly briny aromas of apple-carrot juice and pyrazines open this blend of 90% Airén and 10% Sauvignon Blanc. The palate is melony and plump at first, then flat. Bland papaya and melon flavors finish without much length or zest.

title: Santo Cristo 2017 50+ Garnacha (Campo de Borja)
description: Cherry and berry aromas are basic and hollow, much like Kool-Aid. On the palate, this feels jammy and tastes artificial and grapey. Candied fruit and fatty notes rise up on a hot finish.

title: Eguren 2015 Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Generic plum and berry aromas are borderline volatile and include a forced note of chocolaty oak. This Tempranillo is abrupt and choppy on the palate, with flavors of candied plum and milk chocolate. A chocolaty oak character remains on a blocky finish.

title: Barahonda 2015 Barrica Monastrell-Syrah (Yecla)
description: A roasted, rubbery nose deals a proprietary mix of savory blueberry, tea and grassy hints. In the mouth, this red blend is raw and pulls inward. Minty, herbal berry flavors are green at heart, while any fruit this has is short-lived on an herbal finish.

title: Pagos del Rey 2015 Blume Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Briny orange, grapefruit and grape-skin aromas announce an oily adequate palate. This has a gritty salty bitter-citrus flavor profile and a finish that's oddly nutty.

title: Raimat 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon-Tempranillo Rosada (Costers del Segre)
description: A burnt-orange color and a chunky nose, with mealy fruit aromas, set up a full palate that grabs at the cheeks. Bitter-orange and orange-skin-driven flavors finish short. This low-on-fruit rosé is made from Cabernet Sauvignon and Tempranillo.

title: Pazo Pondal 2018 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: A gaseous, funky nose is not fully fresh or clean, while this feels wide in body and shapeless. Mealy orange flavors lack the purity that Albariño is best known for, while this tastes yeasty and lightly oxidized on the finish.

title: Nubori 2018 Rosado (Rioja)
description: Waxy apple aromas give way to oxidative scents on this rosé. A high-acid palate is pinching, while dry melon and oxidized apple flavors are wan on the finish. It's a blend of 70% Garnacha and 30% Viura.

title: Latitud 42 2017 Made with Organic Grapes  (Rioja)
description: Milk chocolate and slightly weedy berry aromas set this off on shaky footing, while a tannic palate doesn't bring it around. Slightly green and minty berry flavors revert to forced oak and chocolate on the finish.

title: Ego Bodegas 2018 Marionette Monastrell-Syrah (Jumilla)
description: A saturated purple color and dense, reduced aromas of baked black fruits and barbecue smoke are ominous. A sappy, syrupy palate confirms that this Monastrell-Syrah blend is over the line. Flavors of burnt oak, caramel and Bourbon barrel are just too much.

title: Dominio de Eguren 2017 Protocolo Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Basic raspberry and cherry aromas are about as good as this gets. The palate feels acidic and gritty, and slightly punishing. Cherry-punch and pineapple flavors are high toned prior to a rough finish. Even for everyday Tempranillo this is lacking.

title: Bodegas Aragonesas 2018 Viña Temprana Old Vines Tempranillo (Campo de Borja)
description: Candied red fruit aromas are medicinal and hard to take seriously. This Tempranillo feels rubbery and scratchy, while plum and raspberry flavors are both fiery and slightly artificial. A dry, tannic finish tastes herbal and comes across hot.

title: Viñedos y Bodegas Pablo 2017 Menguante Garnacha Blanca (Cariñena)
description: Early aromas of honeyed melon are as good as this Garnacha Blanca gets. A pulpy palate with no back end houses orange-like flavors that turn bitter on the finish.

title: Alta Alella 2016 Capsigrany Organic Sparkling (Cava)
description: A tan color along with severely oxidized aromas make one guarded as sweaty notes of apple juice and cider roll out. A foamy amorphous palate is not a plus, while this organic varietal Xarello tastes of dried peach and apricot in front of a finish with can't-miss notes of nuts and popcorn. For a Cava leader such as Alta Alella, this overpriced organic bottling is weak.

title: Ochoa 2016 Calendas Tempranillo-Garnacha (Navarra)
description: Grassy berry aromas and oaky clove scents are unconvincing. This blend of Tempranillo and Garnacha feels wiry and a bit like vinegar. Blatant oak and tart plum flavors finish with a distinctly strong note of clove.

title: Marques de Monistrol 2013 Premium Cuvée Reserva Sparkling (Cava)
description: Bready lightly oxidized aromas and a gold color are not overly encouraging. A mostly lifeless palate is pickled and tastes of brined citrus fruits, while a dry hollow finish is the ending.

title: Inazio Urruzola 2016 Ernio Rosé (Getariako Txakolina)
description: Oxidized aromas announce a wine on its last legs. Dry low-intensity peach and cantaloupe flavors finish slightly bitter and without much vitality. Txakoli wines should be consumed during the year after harvest, thus this is past its sell-by date.

title: Burgáns 2017 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: This wine is quiet on the nose, with notes of matchstick and underripe fruit. Bitterness and a lack of fruit carry over to a finish that's lacking in precision.

title: Bodegas Aresan 2017 Verdejo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Grapefruit and green pyrazine aromas set up a lean palate that's mostly acid and not much fruit or pulp. Monotone pink grapefruit flavors finish briny, salty and a touch bitter, with a hint of leftover grapefruit.

title: 12 Linajes 2017 Roble  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Aromas of cherry and plum are medicinal in nature on the nose. This feels choppy and tannic, with an excess of skins-based extract. Gamy, foxy berry and oak flavors are bone dry on a scratchy finish.

title: Pradorey 2015 Oak Fermented Rosado (Ribera del Duero)
description: A cloudy rusted color and soupy aromas render this less than fresh. A chunky, melony palate is low on elegance and acidity, tasting heavily of grape skins.

title: Alta Alella 2016 Privat PB Organic Pansa Blanca (Alella)
description: This Xarello feels juicy and acidic but ultimately lean and simple. Its grassy aromas include a whiff of hay and a touch of mango while its generic citrus and tropical flavors finish with acidic pop.

title: Vega Tolosa 2015 11 Pinos Old Vines Bobal (Manchuela)
description: This Bobal's burnt rubber, black cherry, pencil eraser and soap aromas are ominous. It feels blocky and syrupy, with little flow to the palate other than pasty, candied berry and cassis flavors.

title: Hello World 2015 Petit Verdot (Tierra de Castilla)
description: Reduced prune and green herb aromas tell you all you need to know about this jammy, overextracted Petit Verdot. Its roasted black fruit flavors come with hints of spice and chocolate, but drilling tannins and overbearing weight hinder the finish.

title: Venta Morales 2016 Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: While this Tempranillo smells rustic and horsey, it performs better on the palate, which is thick but flat in feel. Rustic, leathery black-fruit flavors finish hot.

title: Loriñon 2012 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Although 2012 was a ripe, warm year, this wine is tomatoey and herbal. Stalky, salty flavors are barely acceptable.

title: Bodegas Sierra Salinas 2018 Mo Monastrell (Alicante)
description: Jumpy, candied berry aromas are rudimentary and backed by a grapey, extracted palate that doesn't tread easily. Black-fruit flavors are unfocused and gamy.

title: Larchago 2018 Rosado (Rioja)
description: Barely ripe aromas of peach and nectarine come with pyrazines. This Rioja rosado is medium in body, with acidic snap. Briny stone-fruit flavors are burning on the finish. Overall, this is O.K. but struggles to impress.

title: Coto de Hayas 2015 Centenaria Garnacha (Campo de Borja)
description: This heavily oaked Garnacha smells like clove and horsehide. A drawing, scratchy, resiny palate offers clove and barrel-spice flavors. The wine feels tannic and rubbing on a finish that tastes exclusively of oak-based clove.

title: Conde de Altava 2015  Rioja
description: Jumpy raspberry and candied plum aromas are akin to Kool-Aid. A rubbery, grabby palate and foxy, medicinal flavors of latex and berry fruits culminate on a strained finish.

title: Finca Jakue 2016 Txakolina Hondarrabi Zuri (Getariako Txakolina)
description: Mild, melony aromas are friendly, but in the mouth, this wine is sharp and hard-edged, with sizzling acidity. Flavors of tart, underripe peach finish with over-the-top citric acidity.

title: Aranleón 2016 Blés Tinto Organic Wine Red (Valencia)
description: This magenta-colored blend is mostly Bobal, and it smells reduced, with raw raspberry and plum scents. A racy, rubbery and pinching palate holds tart plum and currant flavors. This wine is constrained as a whole, but juicy.

title: Earth Wise 2015 Made With Organically Grown Grapes Red (Spain)
description: Jumpy, punchy berry aromas are high-toned. This blend feels creamy, candied and syrupy. Sweet flavors of baked fruits and Boston baked beans finish with hints of berry syrup.

title: Campos Reales 2016 Rosé (La Mancha)
description: Chewing-gum aromas struggle to stay clean and fresh. This rosé feels rubbery and raw. Herbal flavors include juniper berry and finish with almost no fruit.

title: Camina 2016 Tempranillo (La Mancha)
description: Aromas of wet cement, spicy oak and generic berry fruits make for a rubbery, earthy whole. This wine is jammy and flabby in feel, with peppery berry and oak spice flavors. It lacks character.

title: Marqués de Cáceres 2018 Satinela Medium Sweet White (Rioja)
description: Mild apple and peach aromas are neither bad nor good, just simple and giving off a hint of pyrazines. A full, oily palate is almost viscous, while this tastes of melon and sugary stone fruits.

title: Latúe 2018 Made with Organic Grapes Airen (La Mancha)
description: A clear, almost colorless tint and stalky aromas open this varietal Airén that's more flaccid than lively. A mix of green-fruit and lightly bitter flavors finishes short and without much power or purpose.

title: Vega del Castillo 2016 Señorío de Aldaz Garnacha (Navarra)
description: Cheesy aromas dominate the nose on this flat rubbery-feeling Garnacha. Gritty berry-fruit flavors are a bit weedy, while this is lifeless on the finish.

title: Bodegas Bilbainas 2016 Viña Pomal Rosé (Rioja)
description: A harsh nose smells more of gasoline than fruit. This is rubbery and astringent in feel. Yeasty flavors of papaya are tired, while this tastes of white bread on a finish without much snap.

title: Txomín Etxaníz 2016 Getaria Rosé (Getariako Txakolina)
description: This low-alcohol Basque rosé starts off funky. Pickled, peppery, herbaceous aromas lead to a tart, acidic palate that's not unusual for this style of wine. Sour, herbal, peppery flavors repeat in lighter form on the finish.

title: Mocén 2014 Fermentado en Barrica Verdejo (Rueda)
description: This gold-colorerd wine has fruitless, oaky aromas of squash and pumpkin. It feels flabby, with a resiny oak component to the mouthfeel. Flavors faded if not slightly spoiled white fruits finish with a loud echo of oak.

title: Pago Casa Gran 2014 Elegant Casa Benasal Red (Valencia)
description: Massively oaky aromas of spice and clove dominate the nose on this blend of Monastrell, Syrah and Garnacha. It's tannic and burnt on the palate, with little but creosote and clove for flavors. An all-oak finish brings bitterness.

title: Finca Albret 2017 La Loma Garnacha (Navarra)
description: Plum and currant aromas come with a shot of latex and rubber. On the palate, this feels raw and citric, and that's compounded by hard tannins. Currant and plum flavors include a green herb note, while this tastes lightly green and feels gravelly on the finish.

title: Otazu 2018 Merlot Rosado (Navarra)
description: Light cherry and raspberry aromas are fruity, while this Merlot rosé from Navarra feels round but shows little in the middle. Flavors of bitter red fruits and rhubarb are leafy prior to a shallow finish.

title: Emilio Moro 2016 Finca Resalo  (Ribera del Duero)
description: This entry-level wine has green aromas on the nose, while the palate is pinched and tannic. Jammy berry fruit flavors blended with green-herb notes and rough tannins.

title: Baskoli 2016 Hondarrabi Zuri (Getariako Txakolina)
description: This is a simplistic wine driven by citrus and green, stalky flavors. The palate lacks precision and finishes on a slightly bitter note.

title: Valduero 2016 Yunquera Albillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León
description: Dusty aromas of tropical fruits and melon are ample on the nose. This varietal Albillo, a grape that's rarely seen, feels round but amorphous. Salty, bitter flavors of pineapple and pyrazines leave nothing but mild bitterness on the finish.

title: Vecrima 2015 Godello (Monterrei)
description: A nose of yeast, salami and overripe white fruits leads to a round palate with little vitality or energy. Yeasty stone-fruit flavors become shaky on a low-acid finish.

title: Gooseneck 2014 Chardonnay (Spain)
description: A yellow color with luster announces maturity in this Chardonnay, while flat aromas of spiced pumpkin and melon are mellow. Mature, lightly oxidized flavors of salted corn, apple and squash are preserved on the finish by moderate acidity.

title: Los Navales de Martúe 2015 Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Yeasty aromas of corn and saline water lead to a briny palate of white-fruit flavors. This is low in intensity and wobbly in stature. Drink now.

title: Bodegas Ontañón 2017 Edición Limitada Tempranillo Blanco (Rioja)
description: Oddball aromas dominated by resiny oak are at the front of this woody Tempranillo Blanco. Flavors of white fruits, brine and unabsorbed oak lead to a finish with a white mushroom note.

title: Adivino 2018 Tinto Joven  (Rioja)
description: Raw, medicinal berry aromas are earthy at best, stalky at worst. A tight, snappy palate is light in body but feels rubbery and tannic, while stalky plum flavors finish with a hint of mushroom.

title: Enate 2015 Crianza Tempranillo-Cabernet Sauvignon (Somontano)
description: Balsamic aromas are funky at first and then more confounding and less fresh the longer this sits. A blocky palate is lacking in finesse and structure, while gritty flavors of berry fruits and dark plum don't hold much sway prior to a narrow finish that's drawing and burns.

title: Bodegas Paniza 2018 Fábula de Paniza Chardonnay (Cariñena)
description: Standard apple aromas are clean and simple, while this Chardonnay is fleshy but cut by citric acidity. Short, basic flavors of nectarine and orange offer the minimum on an inoffensive finish.

title: Val de Los Frailes 2016 Rosado (Cigales)
description: This blend of Tempranillo and Verdejo feels chunky. It shows jumbled vinegar and rubber aromas and briny citrus flavors that add a bit of character to the finish.

title: Aljibes 2015 Petit Verdot (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Aromas of herbs, lemon and blueberry show a bramble and green character on the nose. This is a minty Petit Verdot that's been padded with a lot of oak. The end result is a mix of woody flavors that are bitter and finish like mint-infused coffee.

title: Raventós de Alella 2015 Pansa Rosada Rosé (Alella)
description: An orange peel note infiltrates this fading rosé's squash and pumpkin aromas, feeling at once shrill and oxidized. Aside from mushroom and clam shell flavors, it offers little on the finish.

title: Protos 2016 P Rosé (Ribera del Duero)
description: A Day-Glo pink color and presentable but dull red fruit aromas lead into a rubbery palate. Briny, sour pickled citrus flavors finish with no charm.

title: Finca Enguera 2015 Verdil (Valencia)
description: This is Verdil from Valencia, and it amounts to funk in a glass. Its yellow color and lightly oxidized apple and haystack aromas set the stage for a flat palate that lacks structure and acidity. Its apple and peach flavors finish honeyed. Drink now.

title: Alta Alella 2016 Parvus Rosé (Alella)
description: This wine's aromas recall yeast, sea shells and crab meat more than fruit. On the palate, it's oily and thick, with bready stone fruit flavors that lack freshness and finish bitter.

title: Hello World 2015 Cabernet Franc (Tierra de Castilla)
description: Green, minty aromas dominate this Cabernet Franc. It's grippy and tannic on the palate, its herbal, weedy black fruit flavors leading to a sweet note of blueberry. Green accents mark the chewy, thick finish.

title: Palacio del Burgo 2016 Tinto  (Rioja)
description: Jammy berry aromas are a bit volatile, with latex and bramble notes in the background. Scattershot and acidic on the palate, this wine tastes of high-toned saucy berry and plum. It has a pulling finish with tart plum notes.

title: Bodegas Fos 2016 Viura (Rioja)
description: Aromas of lees and chemicals are mild on the nose. This Viura has an oily feel and a salty flavor profile that shows mild fruit tones.

title: Pallas 2015 Old Vines Garnacha (Spain)
description: This Garnacha smells like a smoldering campfire. A tannic, heavy, overoaked palate tastes mostly of burnt wood and hamburger, while a hint of bacon arises on an all-wood finish. This is not a well-balanced wine; it's too oaky, too heavy and just not good.

title: El Escocés Volante 2013 Es Lo Que Hay Viñas Viejas Garnacha (Spain)
designation: Es Lo Que Hay Viñas Viejas
description: Stewed, mealy berry fruit aromas are lacking in clarity and quality. This Garnacha from a cool year feels lean and raw, while berry flavors are sour, weedy and devoid of ripeness. A scratchy, earthy tasting finish is not of help.

title: Bodegas Valdemar 2016 Finca Alto Cantabria Macabeo (Rioja)
description: This wine shows lively acidity and the sensation of resiny oak, while flavors of salt, barrel spice and baked apple show on the finish.

title: Bodegas Grupo Yllera 2014 Boada Campo de Bueyes Crainza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Aromas of game and sauced berries starts off this high-toned wine. The tannic palate offers flavors of medicinal plum and wood.

title: Aranleón 2014 Sólo Tinto Organic Wine Red (Utiel-Requena)
description: This stewy blend of 80% Bobal with Tempranillo and Syrah leads with foxy, murky aromas. Its weedy berry flavors are overoaked, seeming messy and unbalanced.

title: Monterebro 2016 Blanco Sauvignon Blanc (Jumilla)
description: A nose driven by punchy pyrazine-based aromas is sweaty and not encouraging. Other than spunky acidity, the palate on this Sauvignon Blanc is dilute. Briny flavors are raw and green, while the finish is hollow and tangy.

title: Pata Negra 2014 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Aromas of compost and peanut say what needs to be said about this mulchy-tasting crianza. Rawness on the palate and finish do nothing to boost this along.

title: Vega del Castillo 2013 Finca el Espartal Merlot Roble Merlot (Navarra)
description: Cheesy tomato-based aromas are rubbery and fiery. This feels lean and monotone. Stewed, salty flavors of earthy berry fruits are off base and dirty, while this is cheesy tasting on the finish.

title: Bodegas Aragonesas 2018 Coto de Hayas Garnacha-Syrah (Campo de Borja)
description: Raspberry and cherry aromas are punchy and candied like Kool-Aid. A chunky palate grabs along its edges, while this tastes yeasty and like red fruit candy. On the finish, an unnatural oak character rises up.

title: Castillo de Monjardin 2018 La Cantera Garnacha (Navarra)
description: Wiry cherry and raspberry aromas include a shot of lemon juice, while a smacking palate is high in acidity and low on balance. Hollow red fruit flavors are candied, and ultimately this Garnacha is rough and edgy on the finish.

title: Pícaro del Águila 2016 Viñas Viejas Clarete Rosado (Ribera del Duero)
description: This smells yeasty, bready and devoid of fruit. A woody resiny palate deals oaky flavors that are not fruity or fresh, while this aging Ribera blend of red and white wines finishes with sharp bright acidity.

title: Inazio Urruzola 2018 Rosé (Getariako Txakolina)
description: A pink color is backed by aromas of citrus skins and pyrazines, while this rosé Txakoli feels lean and dilute. Pink-grapefruit flavors include a weedy note, while this returns to pyrazines and grapefruit peel on the finish.

title: Jardín de Lúculo 2016 Cátulo Organic Garnacha Rosado (Navarra)
description: Candied, grassy aromas set up a dilute palate with green, almost weedy red-fruit flavors. The finish tastes like grape skins, with an animal-like side note.

title: Marques Escriba 2013 Monastrell-Tempranillo Red (Jumilla)
description: Wiry and volatile aromas of vinegar and saucy berry fruits fail to impress. This Monastrell-Tempranillo blend is hard and tannic, with murky berry flavors that are also a bit weedy. Heat and a lack of ripeness mar the finish.

title: Altos de Cristimil 2015 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Chunky pithy stone-fruit and citrus aromas are sketchy, while the palate is tangy and none too pleasant. Flavors of mealy citrus fruits and a finish with the consistency of orange juice do nothing to help this along.

title: Beramendi 2018 Lurbira Blanco Garnacha Blanca (Navarra)
description: This is young, rudimentary Garnacha Blanca with freshness issues despite its youth. Muddled melon and white fruit flavors lack in lift and vitality.

title: Bodegas Sierra Salinas 2015 Mo Monastrell (Alicante)
description: Berry and plum aromas precede a high-acid palate that's coarse and rubbery. Electric plum and berry flavors have the jets turned on, with only acidity and astringency backing things up.

title: Gracida 2016 Chardonnay (Spain)
description: Waxy aromas of apple skins don't qualify as fresh and lively. A full palate offers salty but vague apple and peach flavors that turn distinctly oxidized on the finish.

title: Lelia 2016 Garnacha (Cariñena)
description: Cooked aromas of raisin open this flabby Garnacha. Stewed berry flavors along with clove and nutmeg notes don't amount to anything serious, while this tastes like spongy spice cake and exhibits almost no tannic grip on the finish.

title: Gil Luna 2015 Sin Complejos  (Toro)
description: Stewy, raisiny and baked on the nose, this wine feels rough and tannic. Soupy, stewed black-fruit flavors finish raisiny.

title: Bodegas Cristo de la Vega 2016 Colorea Red (La Mancha)
description: Heavy oak aromas of vanilla, marshmallow and milk chocolate dominate the nose, flavor profile and finish on this candied, sticky blend.

title: Bodegas Paniza 2017 Campil Blanco Viura-Chardonnay (Cariñena)
description: Terpenes and petrol control the nose on this gritty smelling Viura-led blend. A flat linear palate and yeasty white-fruit flavors are oxidized on a flatlining finish.

title: Pradorey 2015 El Cuentista Tempranillo Blanco (Ribera del Duero)
description: This wine's mealy, oxidized peach pit and stale white fruit aromas are unappealing. The palate is chunky, with blazing acidity and resiny, woody, oxidized flavors.

title: Altos de Torona 2017 Torre de Ermelo Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: This wine's stale, underripe haystack aromas offer zero fruit and hardly any encouragement to keep sipping. It has a solid mouthfeel and wheaty, bitter flavors that extend into the finish.

title: Breca 2015 Old Vines Garnacha (Calatayud)
description: This wine's prune, raisin and cassis aromas lead to a flabby, misdirected palate. Its black fruit flavors are candied and severely overripe. It's so viscous and syrupy that it's hard to drink.

title: Herència Altés 2017 Garnatxa Negra Rosé (Terra Alta)
description: This opens with stale, charmless aromas and a rough, raw texture. Its flavors are bland and disjointed, marked by lasting bitterness.

title: Bodegas Palacio 2017 La Poda Sauvignon Blanc (Rueda)
description: Bell pepper and sweat aromas introduce this lean, high-acid Sauvignon Blanc with sour citrus flavors and vegetal notes. The finish is tangy, sharp and slightly bitter.

title: Montecillo 2017 Rosé (Rioja)
description: Aromas of chewing gum are about all this lacking rosé has to offer. A flat, chunky palate announces a wine that's quickly fading, while this tastes bitter and fruitless on the finish.

title: Terroir Al Límit 2016 White (Priorat)
description: A fruitless nose smells of mealy grape skins, spoiled apple and peach pit. Unfocused white-fruit flavors are mealy and funky on the finish.

title: Mureda 2015 Made With Organic Grapes Merlot (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Light in color and just as light in body, this Merlot smells like cherry, plum and chewing gum. A lean linear palate generates tart generic red-fruit flavors prior to a sour finish.

title: Sensible 2015 Tudela de Duero Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León
description: This features incongruous stewed berry, graphite and tea aromas. The palate is soupy, with burnt oak, mint and grass flavors.

title: La Val 2016 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Briny aromas include too much mussel shell, sea water and compost. This wine is spritzy and coarse-feeling, with briny, pickled flavors of sauerkraut, scallion and sea shell. A briny finish leaves offputting lasting flavors.

title: Borsao 2015 Rosé (Campo de Borja)
description: Chemical-leaning aromas jump out on a last-legs nose. This feels dull and low on pulse, with only a hint of acidity. Mealy bitter apricot flavors finish pithy.

title: Urbina 2009 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Stale, stewy aromas lack vitality and suggest compost. This wine is edgy as well as creamy in feel, while flavors of cottage cheese and broken-down berry fruits finish with rooty, tomatoey notes. This is now eight years old and fading.

title: Terramagna 2015 Lance Cabernet Sauvignon (Spain)
description: Fiery red fruit aromas are green, while this rubs the cheeks with astringency. Herbal red fruit flavors suggest currant and thyme, while this undistinguished Cabernet tastes green and spicy on the finish.

title: Familia Bastida 2016 Vuela Tempranillo (La Mancha)
description: Dark berry aromas come with tire rubber harshness. On the palate, this is thick and soupy. Flavors of forced oak and red berry fruits finish green and minty.

title: Viña Arnáiz 2016 Roble  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Baked berry and clove aromas are disjointed on the nose. A heavily oaked palate is gummy in feel, while this tastes mostly of wood and clove.

title: Paal 2014 01 Syrah (Navarra)
description: Out of the chute, this Syrah is downright weird, with roasted, funky aromas of red fruit, citrus and green herb. A fleshy, sticky, thick mouthfeel is lacking in balance, while this tastes of burnt, nutty berry fruits that finish green and herbal.

title: Mureda 2017 Made with Organic Grapes Chardonnay (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: A heavy yellow color signals a chunky, flat nose. This organic-grape Chardonnay is soft on the palate, with short apple-based flavors that are slightly oxidized. A bready, wheaty finish is plump but heavy and bland.

title: El Prado 2017 Tempranillo-Cabernet Sauvignon (Valencia)
description: Dusty cherry aromas smell like a powdered drink mix. This Tempranillo-Cabernet blend is choppy and hard, with pounding acidity. Herbal black cherry flavors finish hard, edgy and with zero finesse.

title: Torre Castillo 2015 Alegre Monastrell (Jumilla)
description: Jumpy aromas suggest wet animal, with milk chocolate in the background. This feels plump but also choppy, rough and grating. Green notes infiltrate jammy berry and milk chocolate flavors, while this is bitter, weedy tasting and disjointed on the finish.

title: Venta Morales 2015 Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Foxy candied plum and raspberry aromas come with a strong whiff of wet dog. Choppy in feel on the palate, with weedy foxy berry flavors, this fails to show much of an upside.

title: Naia 2014 Naiades Verdejo (Rueda)
description: A flat nose with fully oxidized aromas announces a stale wine that's past its best days. A wide, flabby palate is low on clarity and freshness, while this barrel-fermented Verdejo with five years of bottle age, tastes oxidized and fruitless, with mealy notes of squash on the finish.

title: Delia 2015 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Lean raspberry and orange peel aromas are low on fruit, while this feels pasty, sticky and grabby. Resiny oak creates vanilla-like lead flavors, with jammy berry fruit lurking in the background. A grabby-feeling, green finish tastes tart and feels scratchy.

title: Alvides 2012 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Raisiny aromas include a note of fig, and overall this struggles mightily to show any elegance up front. On the palate, this is poorly balanced: The acidity is tartaric and citric, while there's no body to support that much acidity. Raisin and citrus peel flavors don't mesh well on the finish.

title: Gooseneck 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Valencia)
description: Gritty aromas of road tar, black olive and rubber don't smell much like Cabernet or any particular variety for that matter. A clampy, pulling palate is high in acidity and low in charm. Flavors of plum, tomato sauce and green herb run out on a choppy, high-acid finish.

title: Coto de Hayas 2017 Roble Tempranillo-Cabernet Sauvignon (Campo de Borja)
description: Stemmy aromas are herbaceous and covered by forced clove scents. A chunky but hollow palate is neither here nor there, while this tastes strangely of wood smoke and clove but barely any fruit. A minty finish with more clove-driven oak character fails to help out this blend of 85% Tempranillo with Cabernet Sauvignon.

title: Camina 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (La Mancha)
description: Light aromas of raspberry and cherry turn more herbal and sassy the longer this sits. A bouncy palate is lean and linear, with no texture or depth. Green-leaning berry and cherry flavors fail to stir interest on an insipid finish.

title: Mureda 2017 Made with Organic Grapes Merlot (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: A jammy nose indicates reduction while hinting at green fruit. A fleshy, tannic palate is rubbing, while this Merlot tastes of chocolate and herbal berry fruit.

title: Bodegas Faustino 2017 VII  (Rioja)
description: Stalky aromas play towards rhubarb, while this is hard and tannic on the palate. Grassy, stalky plum flavors lack ripeness and concentration.

title: Pazo de Barrantes 2015 La Comtesse Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Strange leesy aromas of tropical fruits and scented candle lead to a sticky lifeless palate. Oxidized pasty flavors come with soapy notes and a weird hint of lychee on the finish. Aged Albariño is always sketchy; and this is sketchy to the max.

title: Bodegas Monte La Reina 2017 Claudia Moreno Frizzante Verdejo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León
description: Aromas of scented soap and/or candle don't smell much like wine. A lightly spritzy palate is akin to Moscato d'Asti in feel, while sugary flavors of lychee and honey turn cloying on the finish before green bitterness appears.

title: Eguren Ugarte 2011 Cédula Real Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Black fruit and spice aromas are medicinal and show a grassy green note in the center. A raw, sappy palate is rough, while flavors of sour plum take this astringent underperformer only so far.

title: Valmiñor 2017 Minius Godello (Monterrei)
description: Unfocused aromas of corn and hay include strong notes of pyrazines. This Godello feels narrow and pinching, while bitter white-fruit flavors suggest haystack and weeds.

title: Rubus 2016 Wine Selections Proprietary Reserve Red (Calatayud)
description: Aromas of animal, underripe berry fruit and Band-Aid rubber lead to a full and rugged palate. Weedy berry and plum flavors become less appealing the longer this sits.

title: Gran Pasas 2016 November Harvest Monastrell (Yecla)
description: This warm-climate, late-harvest Monastrell smells dense, inky and rubbery, like an eraser or a hot tire. A low-acid and exceedingly ripe palate lacks energy, while this tastes of candied black fruits and burnt brown sugar. On the finish, this struggles for balance.

title: Casa La Rad 2016 Solarce White (Rioja)
description: Stale walnut and mealy white fruit scents lack freshness. This Chardonnay-led blend is rounded in feel, with flavors of salty and citrus that end bitter on the finish.

title: Matarromera 2017 Granza Made From Organic Grapes Verdejo (Rueda)
description: A yellow color and stale aromas of citrus, nectarine and passion fruit make for a jumbled start to this organic-grape Verdejo. A plump palate with almost nothing in the middle tastes peachy at best, while a yeasty oxidized character takes over on a dull finish.

title: Grupo Tierra Secreta 2017 Teso Monastrell (Yecla)
description: Aggressive notes of clove emerge from a mishmash of weedy fruit and raw oak aromas. A bumpy rugged palate is hard and rough, while this tastes of bacon grease, chicken fat and herbaceous black fruits. On the finish, severe rawness and a weird barbecue flavor are in control.

title: Borsao 2015 Berola Red (Campo de Borja)
description: Stalky, burnt aromas are fruitless and less than friendly. In the mouth, this blend of Garnacha, Syrah and Cabernet is grabby and rough. Burnt, gritty flavors are underripe and oaky, while vanilla and chocolate notes on the finish can't hide the fact that this is deficient.

title: Tussock Jumper 2018 Moscato Rosé (Valencia)
description: The nose on this spritzy pink wine is entirely that of Moscato, meaning this smells sweet and like lychee. A foam explosion on the palate makes this tough to swallow, while candied lychee and green-herb flavors are rudimentary.

title: Marqués de Cáceres 2018 Deusa Nai Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Aromas of pine resin and pyrazines give this Albariño a nose akin to stripped-down Verdejo or Sauvignon Blanc. The palate is lean and dilute, while flavors of lemongrass and green fruits don't offer much pleasure.

title: Baigorri 2017 Blanco Fermentado En Barrica Viura (Rioja)
description: Chemical aromas of paint and paint thinner lead this barrel-fermented Viura. An oily, grabby palate holds leesy, oxidized flavors that are quite low on fruit. On the finish, this tastes oxidized and beyond mature for a 2017.

title: Marqués de Cáceres 2015 Organic Wine  (Rioja)
description: Funky horsey murky aromas suggest compost and sweaty animal. A blocky grabby palate and disjointed woody and weedy flavors finish with foxy notes. Nothing about this organic wine impresses.

title: Bodegas Ugalde 2018  Rioja
