description: Aromas of raw berry fruits and pushy oak lead to a grabby palate with sticky, drying tannins. This everyday Rioja tastes mostly of forced oak and clove, while the finish tastes almost entirely of clove. Overall, this comes across as manipulated.

title: Cellers Grifoll Declara 2015 Predicat Red (Priorat)
description: Severely raisiny aromas announce a baked, overripe wine based mostly on Garnacha. A heavy, grabby palate is overdone and saturated, with zero lift and low acidity. Raisiny flavors fade to prune on the finish.

title: Godelia 2018 Godello (Bierzo)
description: Musky, briny white fruit aromas are lacking in purity, ripeness and freshness. Briny flavors are green and herbaceous, with a skunky note. Finishing hints of passion fruit and pineapple seem out of place for Godello.

title: Loteta 2015 Garnacha-Tempranillo-Cabernet Sauvignon-Syrah Red (Campo de Borja)
description: Reduced jammy black-fruit aromas announce a scratchy palate with spritz. This multigrape blend tastes saucy and stewed, while hard tannins and a note of burnt coffee control the finish.

title: Bodegas San Valero 2018 Particular White (Cariñena)
description: Strangely unfocused aromas of white fruits with vegetal notes introduce a flat, cidery palate. This uncommon blend of Chardonnay and Moscatel de Alexandria tastes of dull, slightly bitter tropical fruits before showing almost nothing on the finish.

title: Bodegas Paniza 2018 Viñas de Paniza Oak Aged Chardonnay (Cariñena)
description: Resiny oak aromas come with a chemical overtone, while this is dilute and wayward on the palate. Vanilla and bland white fruit flavors are strange and oaky on the finish.

title: Marqués de Vizhoja 2015 Señor da Folla Verde White (Rías Baixas)
description: Gold in color then flat and oxidized on the nose, this chunky soft blend of Albariño, Treixadura and Loureira is over the hill. Oxidized stale yeasty flavors are fruitless on the finish.

title: Aidura 2015 White (Getariako Txakolina)
description: Color doesn't always mean a lot, but in this case a burnished gold-meets-tan color indicates that this is tired and fading. Aromas of commercial apple juice are sweet but bland. This feels a bit citric but without bounce. The mix of spent lees and cidery flavors finish bready.

title: Matarromera 2016 Granza Made From Organic Grapes  (Ribera del Duero)
description: The electric-purple color and foxy aromas of syrupy berry fruits and yeast should put you on red alert. In the mouth, this is heavy, overly acidic and rock-hard in terms of tannins. Grapy sour stunted flavors match the color, aromas and mouthfeel.

title: CVNE 2016 Cune Rosado (Rioja)
description: Strained aromas are slightly volatile and vinegary. This feels chunky and lacking in shape. Bitter flavors are fruitless and a touch spoiled. The finish is not convincing.

title: Glárima 2013 de Sommos Red (Somontano)
description: This blend is so oaky and sticky on the nose that it smells like a Hershey's Kiss. The palate is out of balance, with chunky weight and unintegrated acidity. Like the nose, this tastes like a drugstore chocolate bar, while the finish is hot.

title: Marqués de Vargas 2013 Conde de San Cristóbal  (Ribera del Duero)
description: The 2013 vintage may not have been good in Spain, but this is really struggling. Green aromas are sharp and suggest vinegar. This feels hard as a pile of rocks, with herbal flavors of green tomato and rustic plum. An herbal-tasting astringent finish will win no new friends.

title: Finca La Estacada 2015 Ocho y Media Malbec (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Exotic cardamom and mint notes turn green the longer this rough wine breathes. Its narrow palate recalls alfalfa, mint and boysenberry, helping explain why Malbec is almost nonexistent in Spain.

title: Altavins 2011 Almodí Petit Red (Terra Alta)
description: This blend of Garnacha, Syrah, Merlot and Samsó (Carignan) smells like a burning field. A tight, pulling palate holds underripe, herbal red fruit and turnip flavors. It's both hot and herbal-tasting on the finish.

title: Loriñon 2008 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Many years in bottle haven't done much for this briary wine with weedy aromas of field greens and spice. A choppy palate with uncontrolled acidity is less than comfortable, while the finish offers nothing but rawness and tannins.

title: El Cortijillo 2016 Verdejo (La Mancha)
description: Scents of pumpkin, pyrazines and general murkiness lead to a dilute palate. Fruitless flavors of onion and lime finish bitter and with notes of green peppercorn.

title: Finca La Estacada 2015 Ocho y Media Chardonnay (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Broken-down aromas of haystack and sulfur are sketchy. This feels pinched, citric and rubbery, while salty sour flavors fail to suggest any particular fruit. As a whole, not much good is going on with this Chardonnay.

title: Pazo Pondal 2015 Lenda Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: A briny-smelling nose is lacking in ripe appealing fruit. This feels pithy and oily, while bitter briny flavors come up short on fruit and friendliness. Pyrazines and bitterness control the finish.

title: Bodegas Faustino 2015 VII Tempranillo Rosado (Rioja)
description: Aromas of rhubarb and red-apple skins lead to a flat, fading palate. This tastes saucy, with no vibrancy or fruit character prior to a dying yeasty finish.

title: Marques Escriba 2018 Monastrell (Jumilla)
description: Marshmallow, milk-chocolate and grassy berry aromas feed into a sappy palate that's sticky and confected. Clove and milk-chocolate flavors dominate, while this feels quite heavy on the finish.

title: Viejo Mundo 2017 Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Mild citrus and pyrazine-based green aromas lead to a round palate with little core punch. Bland, lightly weedy papaya and nectarine flavors fade away in no time on a vapid finish.

title: François Lurton 2016 Campo Alegre Verdejo (Rueda)
description: At first, the palate on this Verdejo is spritzy, but then it goes flat. Chunky but dull white-fruit flavors give way to bitterness on the finish.

title: Serra da Estrela 2016 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: This wine's pine and pyrazine aromas are loud and clear. Its plump palate has a fruit juice quality, recalling stale pineapple with hints of bitterness. A pithy tasting finish makes for a subpar ending.

title: Carlos Serres 2017 White (Rioja)
description: Corn and apple aromas together smell like wheat in this uninteresting blend of Viura and Tempranillo Blanco. Its underripe citrus flavors are tart and slightly bitter, with a lightly oxidized finish.

title: Bodegas Alejandro Fernandez 2015 Condado de Haza Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: This wine is earthy, nutty and vegetal on the nose. A tannic, grainy palate is lacking in elegance, while burnt-out plum flavors finish weedy and oaky.

title: Casal Novo 2016 Mencía (Valdeorras)
description: This bottling helps explain why Casal Novo isn't known for Mencía and instead emphasizes Godello. This smells earthy and damp. A shearing, highly tannic palate deals narrow gamy flavors of grape skins and plum skins. A raw fiery finish with underripe flavors is another negative.

title: Ego Bodegas 2017 El Goru Red (Jumilla)
description: Prune and raisin aromas include notes of milk chocolate, barrel spice and resin. This blend of Monastrell, Syrah and Petit Verdot is thick in feel. Woody, minty flavors of sweet berry fruits and oak finish heavy and flat.

title: Marqués de Riscal 2014 Próximo  (Rioja)
description: Closed on the nose, the palate of this wine is carried by an undefined berry flavor. This is simplistic in feel, with a clipped finish.

title: Alberto Orte 2015 Sierra de la Demanda White (Rioja)
description: This gold-tinted blend of Viura and Garnacha Blanca smells cold and distant, with little fruit and a whiff of something spoiled. The palate is harshly acidic, with curry and oxidized white fruit flavors that wind down on the charmless finish.

title: Covila 2016 Adivino Malvasia (Rioja)
description: This Malvasia shows a narrow palate of salty, oxidized flavors. On the finish, this is bone-dry in feel.

title: Mont Rubí 2015 Gaintus One Night's Rosé (Penedès)
description: This pulpy and highly acidic rosé is made from the obscure Sumoll grape. Its flavors are at once bready and tart, feeling hollow and oxidized on the finish.

title: Bodegas Morgante 2017 Baila Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Stalky aromas of damp berry fruits and green herbs lead to a clampy palate. This tastes underdone and a touch weedy, while the same stalky character found on the nose returns on the finish.

title: Bodegas San Valero 2018 Particular Garnacha Rosado (Cariñena)
description: Flat aromas are dull and earthy, with a hint of mushroom that suggests TCA. A thin palate is tight and pinching, while this Garnacha rosé tastes dry and fruitless. Two samples tasted with similar results.

title: Panarroz 2017 Red (Jumilla)
description: Soupy berry aromas and a snapping palate announce this rugged, reedy Monsatrell blend. Grassy notes, tomato leaf and currant flavors finish tough. This is unoaked but the raw materials need help.

title: Finca Bacara 2018 Time Waits For No One Monastrell (Jumilla)
description: Reduced aromas of olive brine and herbal black fruits are difficult, while this feels sappy, saturated and highly tannic. Flavors of herbal dark plum and salted beef finish, with merciless tannins and dryness. Elegance is nowhere to be found.

title: Trencalòs 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Light in color, sketchy on the nose and dilute on the palate, all of which means this has discernible issues. Bland flavors suggest grape skins, while this is flat, wheaty and yeasty tasting on the finish.

title: Coto de Hayas 2014 Tempranillo-Cabernet Sauvignon (Campo de Borja)
description: Clove and beef jerky aromas are odd and forceful. A globular palate lacks form and balance, while this tastes oddly and singularly of clove.

title: Josep Grau Viticultor 2015 L'Efecte Volador Red (Montsant)
description: Hot rubbery untamed aromas need help. This Syrah-led blend feels clampy and rough. Salty murky black-fruit flavors are herbal and wild, and there's no help coming on the finish, which is grabby.

title: Altos de Torona 2013 Barrica Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Oxidized apricot aromas comprise the bulk of the nose on this weird oak-aged Albariño. Flavors of apricot, peach pit and quince quickly turn bitter, while the finish is flabby. Overall this is sketchy, with few attributes.

title: Oro de Castilla 2018 Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Funky aromas of green fruits, yeast and compost carry to the soft, flabby palate. It is green and vegetal in flavor.

title: Coto de Hayas 2013 Fagus Selección Especial Garnacha (Campo de Borja)
description: Right from the start, this is all about oak and not about quality fruit, balance or subtlety. Aromas of wood resin, milk chocolate and char lead to a rugged rough palate. Flavors of burnt wood and stewed fruit finish resiny. Year after year, Fagus smells and tastes like this: it's time for a reboot.

title: Bodegas Paniza 2018 Fábula de Paniza Garnacha (Cariñena)
description: Red fruit aromas are simple like a piece of sucking candy, while a gummy palate is where this Garnacha starts its slide. Weedy, sugary red fruit flavors seem artificial and the finish is cloying.

title: Otazu 2018 Rosé (Navarra)
description: Stalky aromas of compost and funk carry this rosé of Tempranillo. Flavors of bitter stone fruits lead to an unfocused finish.

title: Alta Alella 2018 Tallarol Pansa Blanca (Alella)
description: A waxy nose is heavily oxidized, a clear warning of what's waiting. And that would be a dull palate that's backed by salty, yeasty flavors and blaring oxidative notes.

title: Tarón 2018 Rosado (Rioja)
description: Aromas of apple juice and hard candy are backed by short, salty flavors of underripe cantaloupe and papaya along with a touch of orange peel.

title: Coto de Hayas 2017 Centenaria Garnacha (Campo de Borja)
description: Strange aromas of clove and beach grass are abnormal. On the palate, this Garnacha is sticky but enlivened by wiry acidity. Heavy oak flavors result in nothing but clove and cream, while this is cloying on a resiny palate that tastes of forced oak and clove.

title: Protos 2018 Aire de Protos Rosado (Ribera del Duero)
description: Gritty, stalky aromas of pyrazines, underripe fruit and sulfur are a turn off, while this feels chunky and stale. Pyrazinic flavors control the palate in front of finish that feels just O.K.

title: Trencalòs 2015 Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Jammy, foxy, volatile aromas do little to draw one into this subpar Tempranillo. Its underripe, underwhelming roasted berry flavors finish dull and hollow.

title: Mureda 2016 Made with Organic Grapes Chardonnay (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Aromas suggest pine oil, pineapple and mango syrup. This wine is shapeless, tasting oddly of rose water and flavored tea. The finish is deficient.

title: Mano A Mano 2017 Manon Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Mint and clove aromas dominate an unnatural nose. On the palate, this is hard and smacking, with almost no depth or cushion. Grassy, green-leaning red-fruit flavors are oxidized on the finish.

title: Dominio de Punctum 2017 Lobetia Organic Vineyard Chardonnay (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Flat aromas of caramel and a hot radiator carry the nose. A palate without much clarity or structure fails to help this along, while briny flavors of citrus turn mushy like yellow squash on a short finish.

title: Virgen de las Viñas 2017 Tomillar Chardonnay (La Mancha)
description: Sharp feline and pineapple aromas are inexact and are not typical of the variety. A full palate is propped up by tangy acidity, while this tastes of celery, green herb and apple cider.

title: Santa Cruz de Alpera 2016 Rosé (Almansa)
description: This Almansa rosé sends out warning signals in the form of foxy plum skin aromas. Its strained flavors are green and reminiscent of vinegar, and the finish is weak.

title: Las Colinas Del Ebro 2016 Garnatxa Blanca (Terra Alta)
description: Funky grapefruit and passion fruit aromas are uncommon and not appealing. This white Grenache is wide but spread thin, with no focal point to the palate. Bitter, weedy citrus flavors don't improve on a finish with a dominant green character.

title: Enate 2017 Tempranillo (Somontano)
description: Gaseous aromas of mulchy berry fruit, iodine, rubber and sulfur get this Tempranillo going in the wrong direction. Green, gummy flavors match the nose, while on the finish this is herbal tasting and medicinal, with weedy notes.

title: Pradorey 2013 El Cuentista Tempranillo Blanco (Vino de Mesa)
description: The light tan color and strained, stalky aromas lack appeal. This aged Tempranillo Blanco feels grabby, while the taste profile is nutty and stale.

title: Evaia 2017 Rosé (Rioja)
description: A dull and oxidized nose smells like little more than chewing gum. And that's really about as good as this gets. The rest of the package is stale, oxidized and going nowhere.

title: Hiruzta 2014 Parcela No3 Hondarrabi Zuri (Getariako Txakolina)
description: An ominous, heavy gold color and an overripe quince aroma announce an over-the-hill wine. Like the nose, this feels flat as a board. Oxidized peach and quince flavors come with little kick or vitality.

title: Ossian 2016 Quintaluna Verdejo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León
description: Unclean, fruitless aromas are dirty and gritty. In the mouth, this feels chunky and flat. Oxidized bitter flavors don't amount to much, while this is low on pulse come the finish.

title: Pagos de Valcerracin 2014 Roble  (Ribera del Duero)
description: This clipped, sharp wine leads with berry and plum scents. In the mouth, it's all acid and no fruit, tasting extremely sour.

title: Lasalde Elkartea 2016 Aitzalde Rosé (Getariako Txakolina)
description: A tan-meets-orange color and vegetal aromas are neither clean nor fresh. This is dilute on the palate, with flavors of tomato leaf, oregano and murky fruit. An oxidized finish is yeasty and bready, a clarion signal that this is past its prime.

title: Bodegas Alejandro Fernandez 2014 Condado de Haza Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Aromas of mulch and green beans are flat-out underripe. A raw tannic palate and green-berry and plum flavors finish weedy.

title: Mayoral 2017 Rosado (Jumilla)
description: Jumbled aromas of yeasty red fruits, cinnamon and funk are off the mark. A flabby chunky palate lacks directness, while this tastes weird and artificial, with a flat finish that goes nowhere.

title: Love 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Scattershot aromas of generic berry and cinnamon smell forced and fake. This has a tannic scrubbing mouthfeel and artificial flavors of chocolate and cheap oak. A green note and burn on the finish do nothing to help this along.

title: Viñedos y Bodegas Pablo 2015 Garnacha Blanca (Cariñena)
description: This fruitless Garnacha Blanca smells a bit too much like rotting compost. A plump palate holds bitter flavors in front of a pithy finish. Overall, there's very little that's good about this.

title: Ochoa 2018 Calendas White (Navarra)
description: A tan color and stale, briny aromas get this Chardonnay-Viura blend off to a fruitless start. Stalky flavors of hay and bitterness only get less appealing as this finishes.

title: Bodegas Tobía 2018 Alma Tobía Rosé (Rioja)
description: A red color and uncommon aromas of wood resin combined with leafy plum. On the palate, this is full-bodied and resiny, while the flavor of an oak barrel dominates.

title: Ego Bodegas 2017 Goru Verde Made with Organic Grapes Monastrell (Jumilla)
designation: Goru Verde Made with Organic Grapes
description: Bulky overripe berry aromas are sweet, soupy and oaky. In the mouth, this is soupy and gooey, with no lift, elegance or acidity. Syrupy berry and barrel-spice flavors finish thick and sticky. Overall, there's no flow, balance or elegance to this Monastrell.

title: Lealtanza 2011 Club Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Raw rooty aromas are herbal and tough to embrace. A rumbling palate is nailed down by hard tannins. Rough, peppery berry flavors come with cooked brown-sugar sweetness prior to a hard finish. Overall, this is low on fruit and not rewarding.

title: Con un Par 2017 Monastrell-Petit Verdot (Valencia)
description: This smells stalky and underripe, with hardly anything fruity or appealing about the nose. A hard-as-rocks palate delivers drilling tannins and roasted plum flavors that barely make it to a scraping finish.

title: Coto de Hayas 2016 Crianza Red (Campo de Borja)
description: Right away this Garnacha seems forced, overworked and unnatural. The nose is nothing but clove, while the palate is like liquid campfire. An oversmoked flavor profile ends with barely any fruit but a truckload of clove and wood character.

title: Mureda 2017 Made With Organic Grapes Sauvignon Blanc (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Herbaceous lime aromas devolve to smell like Mr. Clean cleanser. A wide body with nothing in the center and green flavors of banana and bell pepper fail to click at a level above acceptable.

title: Urbina 2006 Reserva Especial  (Rioja)
description: Stale, leafy, weedy aromas and flavors are accompanied by mild structure or elegance. Time in bottle has not helped this at all.

title: Bodegas San Valero 2014 Particular Viñas Centenarias Garnacha (Cariñena)
description: The fiery burn of oak is the aromatic greeting on this sticky, syrupy Garnacha that's flat as Kansas across the palate. Baked stewy black-fruit flavors remain soft and saturated on the finish. This is the epitome of an overdone wine with glaring balance problems.

title: Mureda 2017 Made with Organic Grapes Syrah (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Jumpy berry aromas mixed with green alfalfa notes don't amount to much. A drawing, slightly vinegar-like palate tastes of green herbs and weedy berry fruits. On the finish, green tea and green bean flavors are fitting.

title: Finca Bacara 2015 Time Waits For No One Monastrell (Jumilla)
description: If time waits for no one, don't wait for this. A blocky, jumbled nose of charred and baked black fruits is rustic and off-base. Clove, all-spice and other savory flavors dominate a heavy, unbalanced finish.

title: Mureda 2017 Made with Organic Grapes Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Cherry with a side of dill pickle describes the nose on this leafy, unfresh Tempranillo. Flavors throughout are murky, soupy and weedy.

title: Coto de Hayas 2016 Fagus Selección Especial Garnacha (Campo de Borja)
description: This wine is dominated by notes of oak and clove. The palate is heavy, extracted and smothered in oak.

title: Breca 2016 Zabrin Garnacha (Spain)
description: Cooked, raisiny aromas signal a wine of low quality. A heavy, plodding palate seconds that motion. Matching the nose, this boxed Garnacha tastes much like prune juice.

title: Arrumaco 2016 Tempranillo (Spain)
description: Jabbing red-berry aromas are a bit dusty and yeasty. This wine feels rubbery and astringent. Raw flavors of tomato and herbs finish hard.

title: Veiga Naúm 2017 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: From the minute this hits the glass, it begins devolving. Its gritty, lanolin-like aromas are atypical of Albariño. Flat, oxidized white fruit flavors lend bitterness to the finish.

title: Finca Constancia 2015 Altozano Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Scattershot aromas of green herbs, mint and blueberries introduce this hard, flat wine. Its plum flavors are raw and minty, and the finish is harsh with green notes.

title: Bodegas Fariña 2015 Mascaradas Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León
description: This wine's savory berry aromas include a strong blast of mustard and leafy, minty notes. The palate is choppy, acidic and raw, with clove-laced sour berry flavors. It's thin and out of balance on the finish.

title: Bodega Virgen de la Sierra 2015 Albada Viña Viejas Garnacha (Calatayud)
description: This wine's wooly fruit aromas show a volatile whiff of vinegar. It's jammy and out of shape, with soupy raspberry and plum flavors.

title: Finca Antigua 2017 Sobre Lías Viura (La Mancha)
description: This Viura, aged five months on the lees, has wayward, blowsy vanilla and spun sugar aromas and no focal point on the palate. Its yeasty white fruit flavors are strange, unfamiliar and shapeless.

title: Vega Sauco 2017 La Sonrisa del Nomada  (Toro)
description: Raisin, blueberry and bubblegum aromas announce a sketchy, faulty wine. In the mouth, this is syrupy, heavy and tannic. Pasty, lactic flavors of oak blanket gooey fruit notes, while on the finish this is creamy in feel and green in flavor.

title: Pagos de Valcerracin 2015  Ribera del Duero
description: Overt can't-miss aromas of mustard and sauerkraut would be fine if this were a hot dog, but it's not. In the mouth, this feels strained and wiry. Sour pickled flavors of cabbage and plum finish raw. This is loaded with challenges and flaws.

title: Pata Negra 2016 Tempranillo-Cabernet Sauvignon (Valdepeñas)
description: Seriously green aromas of pole bean and bell pepper are downright vegetal. Following the nose, this feels raw and hard. Plum and green bean flavors wrap up on a rubbing, scratchy finish.

title: Bodegas Berceo 2016 Más de Berceo Viura (Navarra)
description: Generic white fruit and citrus aromas show a green note of pyrazine in this wine. It's extremely citric, acidic and dilute, with tart, underripe citrus flavors. An oxidized, yeasty note that emerges on the finish.

title: Blanco Nieva 2018 Martúe Sauvignon Blanc (Rueda)
description: The nose of this wine smells of canned fruit and soap, while the palate is dilute, with watered down flavors of apple and pear.

title: Zudugarai 2015 Hondarrabi Zuri (Getariako Txakolina)
description: Funky, heavily pickled aromas lack clarity, charm and cleanliness. This feels flat as a board, with bitter sour nutty flavors of spoiled citrus fruits. A sour, murky finish fails to help it along.

title: Portal del Priorat 2015 Gotes del Montsant Grenache-Carignan (Montsant)
description: A reduced nose smells foul, like a Dumpster. This blend of Garnacha and Carignan from a hot year is out of whack and out of balance, and thus barely passable. Rubbery berry flavors are flat and hard to process.

title: Bodegas Isidro Milagro 2018 SPÑ Verdejo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Neutral aromas include a hint of vanilla cookie. This is watery and dilute, with stalky fruitless flavors. Bland bitterness controls the finish on this unfulfilling Verdejo.

title: Terramagna 2015 Ciro Cabernet Sauvignon (Spain)
description: Raw, grassy aromas include candied fruit and mint notes. The palate is high in acidity and low in charm. Herbal raspberry and plum flavors are sugary on the finish.

title: Bodegas Illana 2017 El Pico Tempranillo (La Mancha)
description: Stewy, soupy aromas are hardly inviting, while this feels raw and tomatoey. Salty, underripe red fruit flavors are green and weedy on the finish.

title: El Cortijillo 2017 Joven Tempranillo (La Mancha)
description: Stalky aromas are burnt and raw, as is the palate. This tastes weedy and salty, and the mouthfeel is grabby.

title: Bodegas Paniza 2018 Agostón Garnacha-Tempranillo (Cariñena)
description: Yeasty red fruit aromas include a whiff of banana. This weak Garnacha-Syrah blend is cloying and just no good on the palate, while sugary strawberry flavors tastes false and processed in front of a cloying finish.

title: Sierra Norte 2011 Cerro Bercial Madurado en Barrica Red (Utiel-Requena)
description: Reduced, malted, raisiny aromas in this blend of 65% Tempranillo and 35% Bobal suggest overripeness or premature evolution. It's tannic on the palate and tastes as stewy as prune juice.

title: Mano A Mano 2016 Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Stewy, green aromas are better suited to tomato sauce than Tempranillo. On the palate, this is tannic and sappy. Stewed berry flavors are herbal, weedy and overloaded with forced, unintegrated oak that results in a difficult finish.

title: Bodegas Soledad 2017 Solmayor Roble Tempranillo (Uclés)
description: Murky aromas of red fruits and cheap oak don't amount to anything inviting. This Tempranillo tastes tart and like chicken fat, while similar greasy, weird flavors carry over to a sour finish. This barely passes for acceptable.

title: Bodegas Morgante 2017 Tinto Lena Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Lean, briny, herbaceous aromas of leafy red fruits lead to a linear palate, with no weight, body or depth. This Tempranillo tastes grassy and tart.

title: Albada 2015 Viñas Viejas Macabeo (Calatayud)
description: Briny aromas lead the nose. This feels tight on the palate, boasting a streamlined texture. Nutty, salty flavors are devoid of fruit, while this Macabeo (Viura) is briny and tastes like almond skins on the finish.

title: Alta Alella 2016 Tallarol Organic Pansa Blanca (Alella)
description: This no-sulfur wine from a hot vintage is prematurely oxidized, with corn and cornbread aromas. Its dilute palate holds bland flavors that are both bready and bitter, and it finishes short.

title: Bodegas Valdemar 2015 Fincas Valdemacuco Roble  (Ribera del Duero)
description: This wine's salad dressing and mustard aromas signal some volatility. It's jammy and shapeless on the palate, with saucy berry and mustard flavors. It was tasted twice with slightly varying results.

title: Marqués de Riscal 2016 Rosé (Rioja)
description: Up front, there's no fruit to this and instead aromas of rot and chemicals. A bitter flavor profile dominated by grape skin and petrol culminates in a flat and tasteless finish.

title: Manuel Manzaneque Suárez 2016 Fatum White (La Mancha)
description: A yellow color and astringent aromas of grape skins, petrol and pyrazines set this blend of Airen, Macabeo and Sauvignon Blanc off on the wrong foot. Its stale fruit and yeast flavors seem oxidized.

title: Love 2015 Merlot (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Muddled candied aromas smell uniquely unnatural and forced. This is choppy and jagged in the mouth, while a strange set of fake-oak and murky berry flavors are prominently on display.

title: Bodegas Y Viñedos Martuela 2016 Dauco Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Root beer, tree bark and stewed fruit aromas aren't encouraging, nor is the color, which lacks luster. A tubular palate is oddly narrow, while flavors of plum, licorice and burnt brown sugar are shocked by tartaric acid.

title: Sinfonía 2016 Vintage Collection Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Raisin, cassis, beef soup and damp mop are notable aromas on the nose. A flush, fleshy palate includes severely dry tannins, while this tastes wild and herbal in front of a weedy finish.

title: Naveran 2016 Perles d'Or Sparkling (Cava)
description: Sorry folks, but this smells like vegetables in the garbage can, meaning earthy and rotten. A foamy clumsy mouthfeel is unhelpful, while this tastes of pickled citrus fruits and cole slaw. All in all, this is barely palatable.

title: Ochoa 2018 Calendas Garnacha Rosé (Navarra)
description: This Navarran Garnacha rosé is red for the most part, and the nose is not fresh but is instead funky, cheesy and stalky. A chunky palate doesn't shine, while this tastes oddly greasy and shy on fruit. Unfortunately, this is consistent with recent vintages.

title: Pradorey 2016 Tempranillo-Merlot Fermentado en Barrica Rosado (Ribera del Duero)
description: This red-colored barrel-fermented rosé of Tempranillo and Merlot smells funky and gummy. Flat on the palate, this tastes of pickled red cabbage: charmless and difficult to get through.

title: La Val 2016 Más Que 2 White (Rías Baixas)
description: Pinched austere aromas of cat pee and oily sweat are extreme and unusual for a Rías Baixas wine. A citric and raw palate tastes like this smells. Fresh acidity is about all this underripe, sour and bitter blend of Albariño, Treixadura and Loureira has going for it.

title: T 2015  Toro
description: Aromas suggest compost, murky grit and olive. In the mouth, this wine is heavy and flat. Roasted, underripe berry-fruit flavors finish hot and gritty.

title: Familia Montaña 2015 Montaña Tinto  (Rioja)
description: An undeniable raisiny nose leads to a soupy, flat, raisiny wine that's flawed and barely drinkable.

title: Love 2015 Chardonnay (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: This yeasty funky Chardonnay is on its last legs. The mouthfeel is mealy and the flavors are dull, yeasty, generic and lightly oxidized on the finish.

title: Viñedos Balmoral 2013 Edoné Gran Cuvée Extra Brut Sparkling (Spain)
description: Highly volatile and pickled aromas are unpleasant and uninviting. This is flat on the palate. Sour flavors of brine and green herbs are the final nails in the coffin of this barely acceptable Cava.

title: Roke Eizaguirre 2018 Txakoli (Getariako Txakolina)
description: This wine shows bruised apple and muddled citrus tones lifted by bright acidity. It is light in profile and simplistic.

title: Love 2015 Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: There isn't much to love about this weedy abrasive high-acid Tempranillo. Green and grassy in flavor, with a minty acidic finish, this is barely cutting it as a whole.
